Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation Review”
Reviews.Author: maddya
Reviews.Content: We are used to staying at all inclusives at great hotels...compared to that, this resort was pretty good. We had called 3 months ahead to reserve a refrigerator. Upon check in they told us that they are first come first served and that we would be put on a list to receive one when available. We did receive it that day but had to wait a bit. What's the sense of reserving it ahead of time? Our room was not ready by check in time either. A minor inconvenience but after traveling with 3 kids we needed the downtime. The cabanas by the pool were a great feature...we loved using it. The daily aqua aerobics was fun for all of us...even the kids enjoyed it! They also had daily iguana feeding which the kids loved and jet skis to rent on the beach...($80 per half hour for 2 people $60/one person). Although the food was expensive, it was excellent food. The italian restaurant and Steak restaurant were amazing! The view of the rainforest was beautiful as well. The pool was not the cleanest pool, but there were a lot of people there during spring break. The beach was really nice, but don't expect the turquoise blue water of the caribbean. If you have a rental car (recommended), definitely go to La Familia Bakery 2. It's about a 5-10 minute drive and is absolutely delicious. The donuts are awesome, the sweet bread is delicious and the breakfast sandwiches were amazing. We fed 15 people breakfast for $40. Overall, we had a fun vacation and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Rio Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was a great. Bring your own drinks to the pool as they are expensive on the property. Also Breakfast buffet was $27 each person and it was so so.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Robin L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November on company trip, so while price was not an issue, we did notice that everything was quite expensive. Rooms were comfortable and clean, beautiful views. Wonderful pool with entertainment and great food and drinks. Iguanas added some interest but were not everywhere as some of our party feared. You pretty much have to go looking for them, so don't fear. Beach was amazingly beautiful. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: WolfPackMom25
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a great time in late February. The weather was great; one little sprinkle over five days. The hotel was very nice and the food for the most part was very good. Our favorite thing to drink were the great mojitos at the ocean/pool bar. They were a bit pricey at $10.50 each. The best restaurant is the one on the golf course. Terrific South American steak with wonderful fluffy popovers with chimichurri sauce. Great service. Flan was a bit heavy for my taste. The rainforest is a great tour to go on; we highly recommend it. We had a great tour guide! One suggestion I had for the hotel is adding some more night life. The pool bar closes too early and the beautiful indoor bar has great tvs but I would have love some dancing opportunities including Zumba exercide classes. My only complaint I wish it was closer to San Juan airport; a bit of a drive.The transfers to and from the airport were great! Air conditioned buses or vans; water bottles; big signs on arrival at baggage claim.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Chief1961
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. After a bad experience in the past at an all-inclusive this stay was very nice. I felt like the restaurants try harder to please the patrons since your paying for your meal. The Italian restaurant is excellent and we should have gone there twice. The steak restaurant was very good but a step down from excellent, Asian was very good. We didn't eat in the buffet restaurant but from what we heard it was very good. The outside pool restaurant was very good too and the pool service and bar were very good. Yes they are are on the pricey side and if I had more then one or two children I'd be more negative. The property is very nice and clean. With two pools, one for adults and one for kids made it comfortable for both. We had perfect weather which makes the experience nice of course. The golf courses are very nice but bring extra balls if your not a 9 handicap or less. Out of bounds is unforgiving, ie; steep dropoffs into water harzards and the dry fallen leaves make it hard to find your wayward balls. The casino was good. The only negative point I had was the coffee shop counter. Too expensive and the lines in the morning are uncalled for. 3 dollars for a can of Coke is outragous. If yoru a cheap guy like me bring your own liquor to supplement your daytime drinks and splurge occasionally for drinks at dinner. Yes they have convienent ice machines on the floors and the elevators move you quickly. Air conditioning was very good and they had comfortable beds. They could have had more hot water for our showers but it wasn't freezing. You have to request a refrigerator, Free Wifi only in the lobby currently but they said they are working on signals in the rooms. We booked this through CheapCaribean for a very low price combined with the airfare and we were pleasently surprised by the entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: JoeOsageBeach_MO
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a 7 night stay at the Rio Mar and I gotta say that it was a great experience. The rooms were clean and kept clean. The grounds were beautiful and it was just a wonderful experience. We flew into San Juan and rented a jeep for the week. We brought along our GPS and it safely got us all over the place. We also took advantage of the valet parking. At $5 more fo parking, it was worth it. The people at the desk were very helpful with booking tours and activities. Do NOT use DragonFly tours for anything. Way over priced and very poor service. We tried them once and they SOOOO screwed up our tour. So much so that we cancelled it an did everything ourselves. On our 3rd day, we took the ferry to the island of Culebra. The ferry sucked but we had a great time on the island. We rented a golf cart and tooled all over the place and went to spent the day at Flemenco Beach. AWESOME BEACH!! We enjoyed Culebra so much that we went again on the 5th day. However, this time, we flew on Flemenco Air. The ferry took 1:45 minutes with lots of seasick people, the puddle jumper took 15 minutes. This time, we rented a jeep for the day ($50) and went snorkling at some beaches that only the jeep could get you to. The next day, we took a catamaran tour back to Culebra for more snorkling. The tour was with a great group called East Wind. I would highly recommend at least one trip to Culebra. Flemenco Beach is one of the best beaches in the world. GO!!!! We also did a bio bay tour at night. Great sight to see. Don't take the kayak tour, lots of work and can be scarey for kids. Take the trip with the electric boat. much more enjoyable and informative. If you set up your own trips and tours you will save lots of money and will pay for your jeep rental. Every activity is no more than a 30 minute drive. I would also recommend eating out as much as possible. Great food available. At the stoplight of route 3 and the road to the hotel is a great little hole in the wall called Mi Puerto. Cheap and super good. Also, the Kiosks are less than 15 minutes away. They have every kind of food you would want. In closing, Great trip, wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, the people are very friendly to people who don't have an attitude. We will be back. ENJOY!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rdm70
Reviews.Content: just returned from this Resort and it was a great experience for a family vacation...activities by the pool kept us entertained as the poolside bingo and water aerobics...one thing to be aware of is parking is full (covered parking)most of the time and is an extra $ 16 daily. I think it should be included as part of the room rate. The rstaurant Sea Breeze by the pool is an afordable alternative ...we went out for breakfast to familia bakery wich is a great place and not far away fro the resort and visited the kiosks of luquillo ...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Vacation”
Reviews.Author: maggie972
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Rio Mar after spending six nights, and can't say enough good things about the place. We found the staff to be incredibly helpful and friendly. While drinks were somewhat on the expensive side, food prices seemed reasonable enough given it is a major beach resort (and similar to prices we pay in surburban Boston). Luquillo kiosks provide an economical alternative, and gave us a sense of local flavor. Having rented a car ($200 for the week), we were easily able to visit Old San Juan and the El Yunque rain forest, both of which I would recommend. The beach was beautiful, and the pools very relaxing. People did go down early to the adult pool to save chairs, and while seating there was a little limited as a result, there were always seats at the activity pool and beach. We thoroughly enjoyed the vacation and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property , very good service”
Reviews.Author: Global2011
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was skeptical about what to expect at Wyndham ...Some of the reviews I read we're concerning .... But I was in for a pleasant surprise. The property is well maintained , service is very good ,the staff at concierge specially worth acknowledging ... Wilson and Maria ... Extremely helpful , Gave us good recommendations for restaurants ...the spa is good but little pricy .the only damper was that this area was very windy and water was not warm enough either in the pool or at the ocean . I didn't enjoy that part at all as I like to get into the water to really get my fill ....and I couldn't do that enough .....but my kids had a great time .....slides in the kids pool specially is awesome .....

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs help with cleanliness and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Luvsfood2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rio Mar Beach Resort and Spa. Decided to stay here for our spring vacation this year after a wonderful experience at this resort three years ago. What a difference 3 years made! The resort facilities have deteriorated dramatically. It seems that the corporate owners are simply sucking money out and not properly upkeeping the facilities nor poperly training staff. We rented a car after landing in San Juan airport and drove to the resort. We waited in line at the front desk for 45 minutes to check in. Our bell boy gave up waiting and left our luggage unattended in the hall. We had to find another bell boy (after we finnally were checked in) to get our luggage up to our room. I knew somehting was wrong with the room as soon as the door opened. It smelled like sweatty feet! I figured that this may be due to being an ocean front room so we paid the bell boy and immediately opened the sliders to air out the room. The beds appeared made but the room looked dirty. The walls were filthy with dirt smudged on them, the shades on the lamps were encrusted with filth, the desk had white smudges of goo on them, the floors looked like they had not been washed for days. Uneasy with all this, I decided to undo the beds and check the sheets. Good thing I did....they had NOT been changed since there was sand and dirt on them! The beds were simply made over using the dirty sheets from the pervious guests! GIVE ME A BREAK! How discusting! I immediately called down to the front desk and they finnally gave us another room on a lower floor which I demanded to pre-inspect before accepting. While the second room was a little better in cleanliness, the overall poor conditions still existed like dirty walls and floors, filthy lamp shades and chipped bathtub which did not drain properly! I also noted that the cleaning staff did NOT change our sheets at all for the length of our stay! We always left a tip so that was not the reason. Even other lower priced hotels at least give you the option to either not have the sheets change or changed daily. NOTE TO WYNDHAM: CUTTING BACK ON CLEANLINESS IS NOT A GOOD WAY TO SAVE MONEY!!! The only good thing about this resort is the the pool area and easy access to the great surf beach. The pool area was clean and the landscaping in this area is nice. I did get a dirty towel from the "clean" towel cabana one day but again, I was not supprised since the help seems so blase regarding the cleanliness issue. Some of the chairs need to be trashed since the webbing is broken and getting poked by it is not fun. The resorts' pool activity staff were quite nice and held a few games of pool bingo and a fun session of water aerobics. However, there were no pool side waiters to be found. In order to get a drink, people had to go to the over-crouded tiki bar where the busy bartenders were mixing drinks non stop. How could they be friendly under those conditions? We had breakfast at the Marbella restaurant where the breakfast buffet was very good however quite pricy ($120 for 4 of us). We also ate at the Shimas restaurant where the food and service were very good. Glad we were finally able to get decent service somewhere on this resort! I was glad to have the rental car (resort charges 20/day to keep the car there) since we left the resort many times to visit Old San Juan and hike El Yunca rain forest both of which I highly recommend to do. On the days we left the resort, we ate breakfast at La Familia 2 bakery just off rt. 3 (awesome breakfast sandwiches)! Old San juan has great restaurants one should not miss. Just remember to park in the parking garage which is centrally located in old san Juan then walk to your destination, quite inexpensive and safe. If you chose to park on the street...make sure to tip the street bandits who will approach you or suffer the consequences of car damage. As for the Rio Mar Beach resort, I do not think I will ever bo back there nor could I ever recommend any of my family and friends to go there. So sad since it could be and used to be quite nice....Definitely needs a major interior and exterior facility rehab including re-educating management and staff on cleaning and customer service procedures!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sun, Fun & Golf”
Reviews.Author: rcmobergann
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 6 night stay at the Wyhdham Rio Mar resort along with 11 others. I booked a golf trip for a group of friends from Florida who like to travel & golf along the way. The front desk manager, Senior Joel Rojas could not have been nicer in helping me put together this group & be sure everything went smoothly. Two couples booked suites & most had ocean view rooms. The resort is older, but don't take that to mean not worthy of a visit. The furniture in the rooms could be updated, but the beds were to die for! So clean, white & comfortable. The group slept well the entire time. I think since the building is older, it's built to last! My room was on the 6th floor with great views of the pools & ocean. We looked down to the pool volley ball which was quite active in the evenings (lots of laughing & enjoying an evening game). All we had to do is close the sliding door, & you did not hear a thing from the pool! Housekeeping is a little lagging. The rooms are clean enough, but on arrival we had no towels, once no coffee cups & no herbal tea was replaced, another time not enough towels. But one call & these itmes were taken care of. So just check ahead of retiring, to be sure you have what you will need for your comfort. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Check daily at the pool towel hut for a list of daily activities such as bingo, pool aerobics, aguana feeding. A lovely beach awaits you with staff to bring you chairs, dig a hole & place your large umbrella, & be sure you have what you need to spend the day. Plenty of restaurants to choose froom & nice people to deal with! What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: theresaje
Reviews.Content: We do not spend much time in our room when on vacation and as long as the hotel meets a few criteria we are happy. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was hot. I read reviews before we went so we followed the following advice and it made a huge difference. We rented a car (a must!), we purchased a cooler and kept drinks & food in our room (Hotel drinks & food are very expensive). The beach we nice until we got some rain; it is close to the river and the water had a lot of debris in it after that. My 13 yr old did not want to leave PR so that is a good vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very good vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Indiannaj01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. We had a very good time. The staff is very friendly. Our room was big and nice, we had a nice view of the pools and the ocean. The hotel upgraded our room to an ocean suite.The pools are big and nice. There is an adult pool and a family pool. The jaccuzy is hot .The beach is huge. Drinks are expensive ( 7.50 dollars for a beer), I suggest that you buy drinks at the supermarket. (but you must have a car) Valet parking is expensive too. (20 dollars + 1.40 tax). Don't forget, If you don't have a car, the shuttle is expensive to go to the airport. , food is expensive at the hotel. You can't visit El yunkee (the rainforest). Except if you take an excursion from the hotel. (and it is not free). For me, the best restaurant at the hotel is The Iguana pub but you must take a shuttle because It is at the country club. (It is free to take the shuttle). Furthemore, I recommand to go to Barbakoa restaurant ( Mojitos are awesome, La Familia Bakery 2 to have a lunch and the Tropical close the road (The chicken is delicious and I paid 20 dollars for 2 and my baby). I will come back to the riomar.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at a decent resort”
Reviews.Author: road_trip037
Reviews.Content: The resort is about a 45 min drive from SJU. We rented a car and paid $15/day to park it in the garage at the resort. The facility and grounds are huge and well kept for the most part. The hotel lobby, pool, beach, spa, and restaurants were nice. Get up early to get a seat at the pool and be prepared to share the space with iguanas. They are everywhere. On the beach, chairs and umbrellas are pleantiful and free of charge. The service was good across the board. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly. The room was average. The bed was comfortable. We lost hot water in the showers at times. About one out of every three ice machines works. The staff knew about it but they didn't seem to be in a hurry to fix those that were broken. Food wasn't cheap but every dinner we had was good. We ate dnners at Shimas, La Estancia, and Palio. We enjoyed Palio the most. Drinking at the resort is expensive. On the way to the resort from SJU we stopped at Ralph's supermarket on Rte 3. It's on the way, about 6 miles from (before) the resort. Just an FYI, Ralph's is a nice store but the staff ia about as warm and fuzzy as den of rattlesnakes. Medalla Light (the local beer) is $16.99 per case at Ralph's. We asked for a mini fridge ($10/day) for our room and kept our supermarket-bought beer/Bacardi there. We brought our drinks down to the pool/beach in the plastic bags from the supermarket filled with ice. It may have been tacky but it saved us hundreds of $. We did the ATV excursion promoted at the concierge desk. It was a good time. Overall I'd say I am glad I went but probably won't go back. It was a nice place to visit once.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive meals and drinks”
Reviews.Author: Katherine J
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a week at the Rio Mar Beach Resort. The pools and beach were very nice as was our room. I had read a review that said to try and get one of the top floors. We were on the 7th floor and our view of the rainforest was spectacular. If I were to go back to this particular hotel, I would rent a car. The meals and poolside drinks were very pricey, and we met quite a few people who felt the same. We did not have a car and to take a taxi just a few miles was ridiculously expensive(at least $50 to go just a mile or two), so we ended up eating all our meals at the resort restaurants. The lobby bar has a nightly drink special and all the bartenders were friendly, so we ended up going there every night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip!”
Reviews.Author: funtimes36
Reviews.Content: The Kids had an amazing time. The pool was wonderful, beach was nice. Room was dated. Food was good but expensive. Easy access to the Amigo grocery store and walgreens and not too far from walmart. Over all a really nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Candice1625
Reviews.Content: So my husband and two children stayed here for a week:: the pluses the pool and the beach are literally rite next to each other and the staff was very friendly and always offering help....the down side to this hotel is nothin works..the tv in our room went out for an entire day,the elevators stopped working so we were forced to take the stairs there was no parking in the lot so we were forced to valet park for 25$ dollars a day and the ice machine was broken so we had to purchase drinks at the beach instead of just bringing what we hAd...deff wouldn't recommend this hotel to stay for your vaca...drinks are expensive as well as food rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Beach Resort April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Megan E
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from PR and stayed at the Wyndham. It had good and bad points. The overall hotel is nice and it seemed to have a lot of activities for people who did not rent a car or want to see other parts of the island. (or for people with children). The pools are beautiful and the beach is nice to lay out on. I always enjoy the sound of waves crashing onto shore. But, as for swimming, their beach is not ideal. You can actually go 20 minutes away off of 3 on 187 and find great little coves where the water is placid and spectacular and not at all crowded. The room was alright but definitely needed upgrading. The bathtub was chipping and on the last night it did not drain at all. We were told we had a rainforest view, but we really just overlooked the roof (not too much a problem for us because we did not spend a lot of time in the room). We ordered room service on night and the food was wonderful. The concierge desk was also friendly and gave mostly good tips. The only problem with them was that they sometimes directed us to more touristy restaurants, which was not what we were looking for. What I loved the most was the location. To appreciate the location of the resort, you have to rent a car. We were only 40 minutes from Old San Juan, but so close to the bio bay and the rainforest. I adored the rainforest. We hiked it two different days and both were a lot of fun. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. There are also some great restaurants near the resort that are delicious! The major problem is that they do charge for EVERYTHING. The most annoying charge was for guest parking. It was only $15 a day, but I believe that as a paying guest we should not have to pay for parking as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice start to visit to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: PghPerson
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar Resort was very nice & great way to start visit to PR. Took the shuttle from San Juan airport to hotel, and then saw Enterprise Car Rental office at hotel! Saved me an extra trip back to San Juan. It may pay to rent a car since cabs and tours can be more expensive. The hotel is on the beach; you hear crashing waves all the time, and at night the coquis (small tree frogs) serenaded me. Rio Mar has two big swimming pools and a kiddie pool, plus two golf courses and a casino (gambling is legal in PR and most large hotels have casinos). We booked tour to biolumenescent bay in Fajardo, but it can be VERY expensive and unless you have a car, there is no place to store items while you are out kayaking...we were lucky that other hotel guests gave us a ride in their rental car and we all locked our stuff in the trunk. Food and drinks are EXPENSIVE; that is the same at all hotels. You may want to pay for in room refrigerator and get drinks and food at local groceries. There are kioskos, local food stands, along the road, but only the brave should try these. We drove into El Yunque park and it was great being so close. Room and hotel were very clean, and the staff nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: Eric V
Reviews.Content: We spent last week at the resort. It was a wonderful time! We have a 6 year old and a 3 year old. They had a blast with the pool and beach. We discovered that last week was also Spring Break for Puerto Rico, therefore there was an obvious increase in police patrol, making sure only the hotel guests were at the resort. It was great. I must say we were pretty laid back, left out cameras, ipads, etc in plain site in our room. We never had an issue with anything being taken. The staff was always very friendly. Our room as most people have stated was nice. Nothing too fancy, but honestly we didn't go there for the room. It was clean, the beds were comfortable. As for the restaurants, we had read before we went that they were pricey so we planned on eating off site. However after eating at a few off site restaurants and still spending $100 for dinner, the resort prices really didn't seem that bad. They other thing I was really happy with was everything I ate at the resort was really fresh. I am a vegetarian and noticed that when I would get a veggie sandwich the veggies were crisp and grilled. The kids meals were always really big and better quality than you find at most places. We did discover a restaurant about 5 miles down on 3. It is called Lolita's. It was a Mexican restaurant. It was so good we went twice!!! Plus with appetizers, desserts, kids meals, drinks, etc, we were still under $100 which you will find is a nice welcome. Another place we discovered was a local bakery called La Famiglia. They had the best pastries and fresh breads. We all got donuts and drinks for under $10! We were not as impressed with the kiosks that many had raved about. I found them to appear a bit shady and dirty. Like I said I am a vegetarian which also does limit my options a bit, but even my meat eating husband was not impressed with the kiosks. Overall we loved our time at the resort. I would recommend it to anyone. They were awesome with kids, but even if you don't have kids, the adult pool seemed very relaxing...I would look at it from afar! lol Oh also we noticed that never once did we observe anyone drunk or out of control. It was a great place to take families.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Fjkell39
Reviews.Content: Great Amenities.....great location. Service is the slowest I've ever endured. Called twice for front desk service and no one picked up after 30 minutes each time. No joke. People are nice when you get them. Definitely rent a car, stop at the store on the way and grab a cooler and your beverages. I would come back after management public ally addresses their staffing issues.

Reviews.Title: “Service was horrible, not even the manager cares!!”
Reviews.Author: Drshemet
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in a very remote, poor area. So the staff, ( which lives in close proximity) is very uneducated in the department of etiquette. When you are paying good money to stay In a resort, and the staff members are rude, and one even has the gaul to tell you even after you have tipped them that " SAYING THANK YOU IS OPTIONAL!" I know that there are plenty of nicer places that the staff treats you like family and would be smart enough and nice enough to not be rude.. My famliy and I chose this resort because it is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect get away”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell13
Reviews.Content: I have never been to PR before. I took my 14 yo nephew over his spring break and we had a great time. He loved the pool. I loved the beach. The room was clean and quiet even during spring break. The room was a mountain view, but had a bonus. It over looked a small pond. We watched the turtles, fish and many iguanas from our balcony. I had rented a car and we did quite a bit of sight seeing. We ate all of our meals at local restaurants except one. The food at the resort was fine, but I prefer 'local' food. There were many local places within a 10-15 minute ride. valet parking is $25 a day, but we used it 3-4 times a day. I would recommend this hotel because is it near the rain forest and only a 25 min ride from the marina from which the snorkeling trips sail out of. Of course you can get a shuttle to any adventure, but driving around PR is an adventure in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Whichwaytothebeach40
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort, beautiful beach, great pool with fun slide. Kids ages 8 and 10 loved the place, spent most time at the pool. El Yunque is very closeby. Highly suggest renting a car. Even the $15/day cost to park, it was worth it. Restauants nearby make for a much more reasonable trip. The restaurants at the hotel are RIDICULOUSLY overpriced. Buffet dinner at Marbellas was well over $100 (without alcohol), and my kids didn't like anything on the buffet. After that, we ate for $40-60/ night off site. $12 for a cocktail? Bought some rum at the liquor store after that. I know it's vacation, and things cost a little more, but this was just silly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: OneTravelJunky
Reviews.Content: Missind items from guest room, filthy bathrooms at pool area, less than adequate housekeeping and unresponsive management

Reviews.Title: “Nice... if you like big”
Reviews.Author: bgwsnc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to my wife and me by family members who liked it enough to return there this spring after enjoying their vacation there last year. We liked the hotel but... don't go there expecting a small intimate experience. The hotel is huge; it has a large conference center, two golf courses, two pools including one that is HUGE, about five restaurants, a casino... you get the picture. If you like big, you will enjoy the experience. The lobby and rooms are beautiful; we had a small suite on the 6th floor with great views of the ocean at a very reasonable price; I spent a lot of time at the nearby El Yunque rain forest, and we enjoyed eating many of our dinners in nearby Luquillo; a rental car is a good thing if you are thinking about getting out to explore. The pool bar is fun (a little loud at happy hour) and two for one rum punches at happy hour a big draw (made with Bacardi 151).

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Beach Resort & Spa, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: User98
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights of spring break there. Was pretty busy because of the holiday. Our accomodations were very nice, probably due to my husband's business upgrade - had a suite with king bed and queen couch. All were clean and tidy. Was impressed with the security to control the number of public beach goers off the hotel grounds. Beach attendants were very adequate at bring chaises and umbrellas. Would give 4 stars if the 4 restaurants on premises had better food at better value. We were not impressed with the Asian fusion (Shima's), Italian (Palios), Argentinian (golf club restaurant) or the fusion buffet (Marbella). Most enjoyed meal was breakfast buffet at Marbella, but it was still pricy at $25 pp. We only were given one bar of bath soap the entire 5 night stay - a slight negative, but made do as there the sink soap bars.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our time here and in PR”
Reviews.Author: LeaH1109
Reviews.Content: We came here on our honeymoon and had a great time, except for some things that had nothing to do with the hotel... more on that later. The resort is beautiful and the grounds are VERY well-maintained. We had an ocean view room, but it was on the first floor; so while we couldn't see the ocean very well, the view of the resort was very nice. Plush, green, and just plain beautiful. We spent a lot of time on our balcony with drinks, just talking and relaxing. The rooms aren't overly luxurious, but were clean and very comfortable. We slept great every night we were there and had no problems with the room. The food was excellent, albeit expensive. We were prepared to spend a good portion of our money on food and drinks. But, it was all REALLY good. The drinks were strong and the restaurants were wonderful. We especially liked the Italian restaurant (went there twice!), and we were really excited to see that the Asian restaurant had a half-price sushi and saki special while we were there. The outside restaurants were fun and laid-back; I just wish that they would stay open a little bit later. We rented a car for a couple of days to go into old San Juan, El Yunque, and some other excursions. Make sure you rent a car for at least a day or two - you can do this at the resort. While you're out, be sure to stop at a grocery store to get some stuff for making drinks. We liked Ralph's on Hwy 3 (in PR, you can buy beer, wine, and liquor in grocery stores). This saved us TONS of money and made it easy to drink on the balcony. The casino was pretty small, but we had fun in there. My husband was disappointed that there weren't any poker tables (at least not while we were in there), but the slots were fun and we won on the roulette several times! (Free drinks at the casino was nice too!) The only bad part of the trip is that I was getting sick as we landed in PR. By our second day, I needed a doctor. The hotel was fantastic with helping us with this - they called a doctor in town to make me an appointment and helped us arrange a taxi to get there and back. So while it was a bummer to be sick on your honeymoon, the hotel really took care of us. If we ever return to PR, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good and working to improve”
Reviews.Author: bcav2468
Reviews.Content: lots of reviews about this place have it about right; great location, wonderful grounds, nice public amenities but a bit broken down and in need of improvements. But our stay was excellent, helpful staff, and we were impressively upgraded from lowest price, poor "mountain view" room to wonderful ocean suite with 55 foot long balcony overlooking pool and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for kids and a great beach”
Reviews.Author: ninad99
Reviews.Content: The resort is so nice and tropical. I wouldnt say it is a 5 star thats because of the rooms which need an upgrade as well as the bathroom. And the balcony could use a good cleaning. The pool was awesome my kids loved the water slide and we rented a cabana on the beach and that was the best thing to do. The service is great. I had requested a refridgerator and they were all out of them so my husband went to the manager explaining to them we have a baby and need to store her food and formula and they actually took the fridge from the executive officers office to put in our room. Paleo is amazing the food is so good. We only ate at Marbella once for the breakfast buffett I wouldnt recommend that it is expensive and wasnt too good. Room service food is great and so isnt the Seabreeze restaurant next to the pools. The drinks were great especially the mojitos, we actually ate at the Lobby Bar twice they had OK food too. All in all it was a great week. I dont know why there are so many negative reviews. It isnt the Ritz Carlton but you get what you pay for and it was good enough for our family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Visit Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: Spring break for 4 good friends at the Rio Mar Beach Resort was great. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful with all our request. The property is beautiful..... beach view and mountain view all at the same place. Food at the main restaurants was outstanding. Lobby bar was fun with a special drink daily and good bar food. Liked the quiet and peaceful adult pool. I would definitely recommend this for a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful... from the outside.”
Reviews.Author: Chicagojo
Reviews.Content: The resort property is gigantic and beautiful. The landscaping is well kept and the beach and pool area is lovely. The interior is absolutely average. And the service is horrendous! How horrendous? Let me count the ways... Our room was dirty upon check in. Puddles of water on the bedroom floor. Chunks of dirt on the bathroom floor. Reservations are required at the overpriced, mediocre hotel restaurants. I called and was transferred several times before someone told me there was no availability until 8PM. I called back and was told there was an opening at 6:30PM. When we got there at 6:30PM, the place was empty. My companion called to reserve an airport transfer and was put on hold for 30+ minutes only to be told she had to go to the front desk to make a reservation. We got to be friends with the hotel maintenance man. He was in our room fixing something almost every night whether it was the safe, key cards that frequently demagnetize, broken lights, etc. He was prompt to fix things, but we shouldn't have had to call him at all. The number of towels in the room constantly varied. It's like they took the dirty ones and never replaced them with clean ones. The sheets weren't changed during our entire stay even thought we requested a change. Service at the Tiki Bar was awful, as well. Expect to wait half an hour just to order food and even longer to get your food. Having your own car is a must if you do stay here. I'm so glad we did because this allowed us to book our own day trips- which saved us more than half of what the hotel was charging for the same trip. The property is huge and there is nowhere to walk to form there. Otherwise, you're stuck eating overpriced, bland food during your stay. There is no mimi fridge in the room. That's an extra charge, of course. And, there is NO nightlife at the hotel. The Tiki Bar closes at ngiht, which is insane in my opinion, and the lobby bar is deserted. The casino is tiny and uninspiring. Consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the preparation!”
Reviews.Author: babynae
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing steal of a vacation, quite frankly the best part of my vacation was had at this hotel! First, my friend did some research and learned that the hotel was a little farther out than most. This prompted us to rent a car which was one of the best decisions of the trip. Renting a car allowed us to frequent the local grocery store and stock up on breakfast items and other amenities that were needed on the trip. The hotel food is overpriced and just not that great so this was a big savings to us! The rooms were average but clean! we asked for the Rainforrest view which was spectacular. it's also important to ask for a room on the higher level floors facing the ocean or Rainforrest for the best views otherwise you could be stuck looking at a parking lot! The resort itself was beautiful, you can definitely tell there is alot of pride in the hotel. The resort pools were nice but by far the best thing about this hotel is the vicinity to the public beach! The water was blue and the beach was clean. The resort also provides chairs and umbrellas which was wonderful, although the service to have those items brought to you is slow.There was only one man responsible to bring you both the chairs and the umbrellas which can be a daunting task when you have 25 people waiting. I liked that this hotel had great resturant recommendations the best of all which was la hacienda aka the best resturant in puerto rico! The Gocart skirt steak and the mofongo were amazing!! We also tried the food stalls which while the area is cool to walk down provided little in the way of variety serving mostly deep fried foods. The service was also slow and non existent. Although we did not end up eating at the food stall recommended by the hotel! This hotel is also close to attractions such as El Yunque, and vieques and biobay. I really enjoyed this hotel and if you take a few step to prepare you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Average resort”
Reviews.Author: wolverines95
Reviews.Content: Traveled on business to the Wyndham Rio Mar resort in March of 2012. Walking into the lobby there is a beautiful view of the ocean. Check-in was fast and efficient. Over slept the first night, late for a meeting, rushed into the shower, no soap!! After doing the best I could with shampoo and leaving for the day, I returned after the room was made up and no soap. I called guest services and they quickly brought me soap but the maid service never did for the remaining 3 days I was there. Strange. Anyway, the food at the main restaurants was top notch although a little expensive. Food at the Tiki bar and lobby bar was below par. Beer is $7.50 for a bottle but mixed drinks were more resonable. There was no drink service at the pool and the service at the beach was spotty at best. If you go here, be prepared to go to the bar every time you want a drink. Not likely I will return as there are many choices throughout the Carribbean and Mexico that I enjoyed more. Plus, it takes about 45 minutes from the airport to arrive at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: conman20
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Sunday evening edger to check into our ocean view room. Our room was on the first floor facing the main courtyard area. Even though it was dark out there was no way we were going to see ocean without standing on the patio chairs. After speaking to the front desk we were upgraded to a 5th floor ocean front room, which was more to our liking. The room was decent, not 5 star by any means, and after a couple day it did become very musty and damp, not sure if that was the humidity alone or the hotel, but after a couple days everything in our room felt cold (from the a/c) and damp. Our problems with the housekeeping started on our second day. We went to the gym and returned, the room had not been made up. We went to the pool for several hours and returned and our room had not been made up. We called the front desk and requested our room be cleaned and them left for massages. When we returned our room had not been made up. We called again and left to hang out in the lobby (the first of many hours spent waiting there) for our room to be cleaned. We even checked with the front desk after 45 minutes and they said housekeeping was headed there. We waited another 45 minutes and returned to find the room had not been cleaned. We called for a third time and asked that they come after 8pm since we were preparing to head out for dinner. At 7:20pm housekeeping knocks at the door and I have to send them away. I called and let them know for the fifth time that we asked for them to come after 8 and that I was forced to send them away because they didn't listen. When we returned from dinner at about 10:30pm, the room still had yet to be cleaned. We called and waited another hour in the lobby before it was finally done. The next day we left at 9am to go to the gym and put the do not disturb sign out since there was no need to clean a clean room. We returned to the room to find the sign gone and the room made up. We called, asked for a new privacy sign and requested the room be made up and then we left for the day. When we returned about 9pm that evening, there was a new sign on the door, but the room had not been cleaned. I assume you're starting to see a pattern here. We returned to the lobby, requested our room be cleaned at the front desk and waited another hour for the room to finally be cleaned. The next day we ordered room service, and to make a long story short they screwed up the order and we had to have the come back twice to fix it. Both time earned us a rude response from the lady answering the phone and a lecture from the delivery man that we should not have started eating our omelet to learn it was made incorrectly, but we should have cut into it first to check that it was correct before consuming.. I wasnt aware of this rule apparently. We finally spoke face to face with a housekeeping manager who apologized for our troubles and gave us a $100 credit. Having spent a good amount of time planning our relaxation around housekeeping I leave it to you the reader to decide if this is adequate compensation. As an aside all the food and drinks are overpriced and not that good. Our dinner at their pricey steakhouse resulted in a steak being sent back after my wife found a hair in her food. I probably should mention that this was the week of sorinbreak so the hotel was booked solid and had lots of families. On the nice side, the pools and grounds are nice and well minted and the beach is very nice and steps away.

Reviews.Title: “bring your wallet and raincoat”
Reviews.Author: sarah l
Reviews.Content: This hotel resort is far from airport,you travel a good 25 min through very poverty stricken area to finnaly reach the resort.write away it was clear we would not be leaving this resort..we arrived and we checked into our room,this was our 25 anniversary trip,they put us on the lobby floor 1rst room! i knew right away this was not going to work, the noise of the lobby was going to be a problem and then i looked at the view it was of the parking lot.. no way, so i went to the desk and said this room was not going to work, well they said if you want to upgrade to a better room with a view it would cost us 75$ more a night. really? so bing our special 25th we did the upgrade,felt like a scam. the resort is right next to the rainforest. so rained all the time got a few hours here and there of sunshine, we actully said the hell with the sunscreen lets try to get some color, beach is not your whie sand beach its brown sand and not so great, they have a sign saying "please dont takeoutr sea shells off the beach" are you serious? isnt that the fun of walking the beach? we did our walk and once you past the resort line it was bad, tires washed up on shore,old car seats from some automobile washed up, real ugly and sad to see.not what you expect to see on a trip to a resort in the caribean. back to the hotel, very expensive and feeling like a prisoner,not feeling comfortable to leave the resort.we were stuck and had to pay drink and food price, 10:50 a drink and around 150.00 for dinner. we knew we had to find a better eating situation. come to find out the lobby bar has great sandwiches for 12$ and happy hour most nights on rum drinks. so we lived at that bar. did love john the bartender there.this is who the 1 star is for.. the room is basic, no refrig as noted you have to pay extra for this. nothing in this resort is free or cheap, water $6 bottle. coffee$4 cup. breakfast 2 people 2 eggs and bacon toast coffee juice tip. $50 ..never felt safe, met a women her room was broken into. another night there was a flurry of cops around for some asult of some kind. there also is a covention center attached to theis resort, so in comes atleast 4oo business travlers time warner i believe it was took over the entire place. guests got shoved aside to cater to these people felt like no one else mattered. never again would i ever go back to this place or puerto rico. my camera was stolen from my carry on at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Vacationed February 17-22”
Reviews.Author: rmzirman
Reviews.Content: Everyone in my family loved the resort it was right on the beach. The beach was clean and every day someone was waiting for you to arrive to set up beach chairs and umbrellas (for free). There are 2 pools one for families and the other is an adult pool. Which was perfect we enjoyed the adult pool and actually did laps, the water was so warm. The location was great we rented a car and went to the Rain forest, San Juan, Barcardi Plant, Bio Bay tour. The Concerige was very helpfully with suggesting restaurants outside the hotel. Of course the restaurants at the hotel are a bit pricey so we ate lunch at the resort didn't want leave during the day and in the evening we went out. The hotel does look a bit tired in spots like the bathroom by the pool but that was okay. We had a wonderful time , relaxed, swam and have recommended this resort to other people and we are planning to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rafquez
Reviews.Content: I am midway through my trip so could be more to come. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to help and service you. Meals on the expensive side but i guess that comes with this being a resort. The rooms need some refurbishing but everything is very clean and the property has a lot to offer. Family oriented place and they do try to give adults their own space eg. Adult pool area. In this day in age of technology wifi is a must and they are lacking. In the room the only way to get internet is by connecting the Ethernet cable no hotspot, and you have to pay ten dollars a day. If you are looking for free hotspot have to go to the lobby area. Place has a lot of potential and now that is under new ownership maybe they will get better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: WhoaNellyNell
Reviews.Content: We were initially a little disappointed that we did not get an ocean view room, especially since we were Wyndham owners. We had every intention of upgrading and adding a new location to our account but after they didnâ€™t even bother to give us the ocean view room, I figured it was not worth our time to begin with. It rained a few days and they didnâ€™t give you much of an option to do things with the children. We had a really good time but it was not in part because we stayed in here â€“ it was because we rented a car and ventured out. Here are our tips: 1.Get a rental car â€“ the restaurants are overpriced and the food is not good. Its quite safe outside the resort so you can venture off to other eateries. 2.Valet your car â€“ they will charge you for it in error anyway (itâ€™s a huge convenience) 3.The bellboys will give you good recommendations on places to eat breakfast and dinner 4.Donâ€™t take the excursions â€“ unless you hate to driveâ€¦.. you can go to the beach, El Yuque, Old San Juan, and the bio bay tours on your own. The companies will discount you the charges if you pay in cash 5.Buy a cooler at the AMIGO supermarket a couple miles down the road and buy some fruit and drinks (will save you tons ) 6.Go to the kiosks to eat and drink â€“ we had two very good drinks for $7 (yes, $3.50 each) â€“its very safe there to go and the folks are very friendly. 7.My final recommendation is take the ferry over to Vieques â€“ the beaches were AMAZING thereâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: kndunleavy
Reviews.Content: This resort is top notch! Beautiful rooms, great food and service beyond your wildest imagination! Everyone is so nice - from the bartenders at the Tiki bar poolside to the front desk and bellmen. There is real personal attention here, better than I'ver ever had anywhere maybe but the really expensive Disney properties. And the location is fabulous - great beach, 5 minutes to the Rain Forest, horseback riding, zip lining. If you want to day trip to San Juan or drive yourself to rain forest or Biobay - rent a car, although the resort taxis are really top notch too.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Gee557
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week from March 10-17th. Loved it. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The adult pool has a salt filter so I swam length everyday and didn't ruin my skin or bathing suit! Yes the bathrooms in the rooms need refurbishing. I spent most of my time outside!! If you want 5 stars--pay for it and stay in a 5 star resort. It seems Wyndham is sprucing up the place but it is large and it will take time.We were very pleased. All the staff was very helpful. The restaurants are expensive as you would expect in a resort but overall good quality with one exception--the coffee was horrible. We struggled to find a good cup in the morning--it was not found at Rio Mar. We also recommend the Luquillo Kiosks. We ate at La parilla. It was very good but also very expensive. We preferred "La Estacion" which is down the street from the El Conquistador Hotel. A 10 minute drive. Bring a GPS! The food was fab and the prices very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DDarboD
Reviews.Content: IWe loved visiting Puerto Rico for several reasons: 1.Everyone we came in contact with, other vacationers & Islanders could not have been nicer. 2.The location was convenient to SanJuan, 45 minutes use 66 express highway, Shopping , rainforest. restaurants and Bio Bay 3. The food was very good at the Hotel Restaurants but pricey. Mixed Drinks at the Tikki hut were $10.50 and beer was $8.00. Our solution was eating out at some local places for some of our meals and we bought a cooler, beer for hubby and "Gasoline" for me. Gasoline is found at Walmart, comes in a box and they are sippy drinks for adults! I drank the "Tu Madras" all week. Yummy, only $9.99 for a box of ten. Watch for coolers are not allowed around the pools but are fine for the beach. 4. Rent a car you will save in the long run. You can forego the tour of the rainforest, drive yourself, bring from home those $1 pocket raincoats you can buy at Dunhams, stop at the Conservation center and get a map. 5. You can do the Kayak bio bay trip in Fajerdo for $45 per person, drive yourself and make reservations with them directly. Have fun and bring your camera flowers are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Summer 2011 vacation”
Reviews.Author: DeeTee818
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about a day or so after hurricane Irene. The hotel was not fully operational but the staff was fabulous! We were there for about 8 nights and did nit have a single complaint. The staff goes above and beyond for their guests and being right on the beach was amazing! The beach was clean and there were plenty of umbrellas, lounge chairs and space on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Large Resort, Not Central, Ok Food, Nice Beach, Not Swimmable”
Reviews.Author: momwithteenagers
Reviews.Content: This is a large all inclusive resort. The staff is very nice, the hotel is very nice, the room is very nice. I ate only in the resort and was not impressed and wished I could eat elsewhere but the resort is far away from everywhere else so that is not an option. I have been to Puerto Rico twice before and Puerto Rican food is awesome. The ocean is very rough and not swimmable because the beach is on the Atlantic side of the island. Because I like good food and I like to play in the water, I prefer a different hotel. Also by the way, when I checked in, I drove up to the front entrance and asked the valet if there was self-parking for hotel guests. I told him I just needed to check in. He said there was self-parking but that self-parking was $15/day and $20/day for valet. I was surprised but went ahead and self-parked. It turned out to be free for hotel guests. That valet should be fired.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - should have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Jpeacott
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was unfailingly polite - we got a room upgrade without asking! We had an ocean view with 2 queen beds. We had a day bed brought in - it was surprisingly comfortable. The bathroom was a good size, but the shower could have used a refurbishment. We used air balcony all the time - lovely to sit with morning coffee. The pool was nice and the water slide was a bonus for the kids. The beach was much nicer than in San Juan- at night the leatherback turtles come in to nest! The food was crazy expensive, and there weren't any kid friendly alternatives off the resort except for fast food. We had room service one night - prompt, friendly and the food was piping hot. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Prices for 2 Star Rooms - Room quality not much better than their sister hotels - Super 8”
Reviews.Author: blackfox135
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in January based on their website and an ad we saw on a travel site. We booked an ocean front room for three nights. On arrival we had the option of two rooms only. Neither had an ocean front - they both overlooked the swimming pool and the ocean front was peekaboo. The rooms were very run down. There was mold in our room on the ceiling and on the drapes. The furniture was chipped. There was rust on the bed lamps. The room temperature was set at 62F and could not be changed. The only way to make the room warmer was to turn off the AC, open the windows, and enjoy the screaming of kids in the pool in front of our window. There was no minibar fridge - $10 extra per night. The TV reception was not consistent. The icemaker on our floor was broken, as was the one on the floor above us. I noted to a staff person that I thought our floor was a non smoking floor and people were smoking on the balconies - he just shrugged his shoulders. When I went down to front desk the first evening to discuss changes - I was told that all of the rooms were in the same condition. I then went to the men's bathroom to find that out of one toilet and one urinal, the urinal was bagged and marked out of order. We used the adults only pool that was being used as a family pool as well. The beach although gorgeous, unfortunately was littered with cigarette butts, from clients using the sand as an ashtray. I don't understand why we as people have to litter and make something beautiful, another sand dump. We only stayed the first night of our three night stay and found another hotel in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Im coming back again”
Reviews.Author: Dan F
Reviews.Content: Great place, staff, facility. The beach is fantastic. The food, although outstanding, is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham,PR - EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: lamont m
Reviews.Content: They were so accommodating that when we missed our flight they allowed us to check back in for FREE until my next flight. Perfect for Couples and relaxing. Go to the San Juan Hotel if you're single. We left the balcony door open all night every night and we were on the side with the swamp water, whcih was very nice, and we didn't get bit by any bugs or mositques. The staff was filled with so many cute PR woman. The arcade was also fun. There was an outlet mall about 15 minutes away but you'll pass it before you get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING staff (had death in immediate family during visit and they were awesome)”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: My grandpa had won a trip through his business for he and I to go on vacation here together in November 2011. My grandpa came down the Wednesday before my aunt (my grandpa's daughter-in-law/co-worker), uncle (grandpa's son), great-uncle (grandpa's brother/co-worker), and other staff members came that Saturday. My grandpa was playing golf on the resort with his son and brother when he started having chest pains. The staff rushed him back to the resort entrance and immediately called an ambulance. Sadly, my grandpa passed away of a major heart-attack while in the ambulance. My grandpa is our rock and experiencing this close of a death for all of us was definitely the worst experience I, and I'm sure any of them, had ever gone through. The staff told us many times that if there was ANYTHING we needed to let them know. The manager there was with my grandpa in his last moments and told me his last words. She constantly checked on my family to see how we were doing. When we left the resort, she personally hugged each and every one of us and said that we have a special place in her heart. She is such a sweet woman. About a week later, we had my grandpa's viewing/funeral. The manager and staff at this resort sent a beautiful spray of flowers to the funeral home. My entire family was so deeply touched and we will never forget how well they treated us. We could not have asked for a better staff during such a difficult time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away”
Reviews.Author: BJ-69-UT
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a vacation. It is right on the beach, has two great pools, and has a lot of entertainment for the kids. It is within easy driving distance from the airport and Old San Juan. It has numerous tennis courts and two championship golf courses. It is gated and very safe. The rooms are very nice. They offer tours for reasonable prices. We ziplined through the rain forest and enjoyed it immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and understaffed”
Reviews.Author: TonyG1974
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week vacation from Rio Mar! To say the least it was an average hotel. I signed up for wynndham by request got my membership card in mail only to be told by front desk that it was only good if i booked through hotel! Strike one! Staff members do not go out of their way to either greet, aknowledge or offer any input about your stay and seem to rather keep to themsleves unless "you" approach them. Strike two! Night time activities involved sitting around a fire pit in darkness as the tiki hut were closed by 8pm! no music outside, no weekend beach party to enjoy, the sovenier glass we bought became useless unless you planned on sleeping after 8pm! There was apparant drug use and drug selling on property! Strike three! Our third day involved a hotel staff member being murdered which was kept on the down low! after knowing all of this was going on ,any normal person would have left the resort and asked for a immediate refund! right! Well when your their with 40-50 family members for a reunion you just try to suck it up and try to enjoy your stay as best as you can. which we did. The Saturday of our stay there was supposed to be a beach party blowout. Well after getting ready and walking out to beach there was NO beach party ,tiki hut was closed again ! We took flyer to front desk and he informed us a member of band had passed away, party was cancelled and there were no other alternatives other then driving to San Juan. Bummer! All in all the resort is beautiful but its the little things made this resort sub par. example the basket ball court had one bent rim and the other had no net! come on! How much does it cost to get a new net? The basketballs themselves were beat up an were terrible to play with, the parking garage spaces were so tight that if you rented a car you were always worried it might get dinged up! they charge you to use the cabanas outside even if you have 40+ family members staying at resort. You cant bring your own drinks poolside, rather you have to lug around a cooler from beach to room everytime you wanted have a few! Plus there were no ice machines outside to refill your drinks. Rooms werent cleaned in a timely manner. I mean after 3pm you would think room service would be done considering we left room around 10:00am , We ended up waiting half an hour soaking wet in hotel lobby. The management never returned our messages until the day after we checked out. I mean we had family fly from all over the united states to attend a reunion and not once did management try to accomodate us in any way, no private room, no special celebration, no nothing! I mean we spent alot of money to stay there ,the least they could have done was set up a celebration room. The casino was understaffed as we had over 7 people wanting to play roulette only to be told that they do not have enough dealers! The best part of resort was checking out! All though i love my island its people culture and all its beauty this was one black eye i wont forget!

Reviews.Title: “"Wanted to go home as soon as I arrived at the Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: al l
Reviews.Content: 'Get me out of here" is what I said to my wife when we arrived in Puerto Rico. The Hotel blows. When we left the airport which cost $67.50 for a taxi to the hotel. We checked in at the front desk to a not so friendly and accomodating clerk. We wondered and asked for a ocean room in which she replied " there are none". So we entered our room located on the ground floor, overlooking the busses parked on the side of the hotel, the balcony was small and never mind being to small for 2 chairs and a table, it was too small for 2 people as well. I was going to throw the table off the balcony to make room. We walked in our room and then right out and asked a different friendlier and more accomodating clerk if we could change our room for an ocean view room which ended up costing $75.00 more per night. Opening our bureau draws to store our clothes , the draws smelt musty and we left our clothes in our luggage instead. The shower ran hot then cold , hot then cold. We left the "do not clean our room" tag on the outside of our room the whole stay. Did not want the maid in the room. We cleaned and took care of the room ourselves, asked for clean towels and toilet paper, emptied our own trash which was fine by me. With no uniformed security presence to identify with we deadbolted the door while we we're in our rooms. The police had to be called to the hotel for a domestic disturbance at the pool around 4 pm one day. To me, the first thing that I noticed is that the hotel let's the locals come to the hotel and use the pool everyday. That's why when you ask for a towel for the pool they ask you for your room number , and wrap a color band around your wrist so they can identify you as a guest and not a local because apparently it is an issue down there, they welcome the locals or they can't keep them out... Horrible...The food sucks and is way overpriced, every thing is rum, they push for you to drink rum. There is no night life. Breakfast between the 2 of us, 2 eggs, bacon, juice and coffee with tip $50.00..No thanks. After the first day we learned our lesson and decided to come home with some money and spent less and less each day. I don't mind spending at all as long as I get what I pay for..Not here, everything is doubled...I'm not stupid. The pool was nice if you don't mind sitting out in the rain every other day...The rain forest?.....Your in it.... Didn't go on any of the overpriced excursions...no thanks. The beach was nice if you like the scenery of a washed up car seat and a couple of automobile tires on the sand that no one would take the initiative to remove. I could go on and on. As we we're leaving on our last day Time Warner Cable had reserved for 600 of their employees to stay at the Wyndham Rio Mar. They we're coming in by the busses taking over the hotel. Before you book a vaction anywhere for that matter you should call ahead and ask if the hotel has a convention center and if they expect any corporate functions ..or your screwed. As we we're finally leaving the hotel waiting for a taxi to take us out of there and back to the airport ( which never showed by the way, had to take the shuttle instead) A woman we became friendly with by the pool throughout our stay ran into us and said her medication was stolen from her locked room, a controlled substance as well and had to file a report with the hotel. Glad to be back home again, won't ever go back. Food for thought,my wife had her $350.00 camera stolen from her luggage at the San Juan airport upon arrival, nothing to do with the hotel. but someone who worked at the airport rummaged through her luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel but food could use overhauling in quality & price.”
Reviews.Author: RidleyNY
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because friends of ours were going. The package was reasonable but we practically paid as much in food as we did for our trip. Granted we did have lunch poolside, didnâ€™t venture off the property to dine except for 1 night and picked up the bill at a dinner for 7 but the food is way over priced. For example, there is a â€˜coffee shopâ€™ in the lobby. I went one morning to get 2 regular coffees. It was almost $8 bucks! Coffee at the breakfast buffet (adults $24 / kids $14) was $2.55. Another breakfast note, we the adults would order a la carte ($14 for 2 eggs, a meat, potatoes & toast) and supplement (on the sly) with the buffet under the kidsâ€™ price. To venture off property, you could get a cab but for 7 of us it was $60 each way so any money you save eating off property, you spend in transportation. There are several restaurants on property but only 3 (buffet, Asian & Italian) in the main building. There is also 1 by the pool and a steak house accessible via internal shuttle. The pool area was nice and had plenty of lounge chairs. The property also had a beach with lounge chairs & umbrellas. Having the beach helped keep the pool from getting too crowded. Our room was on the ground floor with a view of the courtyard. We could hear the toilet flush and the shower run in the room above us. The A/C wasnâ€™t too great. The room would get rather warm at night before the A/C kicked on and cooled it down but then the room would get too cold.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Enjoyable Resort”
Reviews.Author: DickandJudy67
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in February at the Rio Mar and thoroughly enjoyed it. We're a couple in our mid-60's so have a fair amount of travel experience and are a little picky. The Rio Mar is a large resort which is nicely maintained and is in a wonderful location with a very nice beach. We have never been anywhere where the staff is so consistently friendly and well trained. We paid a little more for an ocean view room and were glad we did...although the rooms on the "back" side are probably okay. We rented a car at the airport (30-40 minute fairly easy drive) and are glad we did as we like to explore and find "local" places. The resort is somewhat isolated so without a car restaurant choices would be limited to the resort choices. We bought wonderful pastries each night from the little walk up cafe by the casino entrance and had those for breakfast. When we were at the resort at lunch time we got inexpensive wraps and pizza from the same cafe. We explored at night for dinner and found 2 great spots: About 2-3 miles east of the resort along the highway that connects San Juan to the eastern end of the island we found a new take on "food court"- there is a string of connected small restaurants on the north side of the highway adjacent to the shore.....seemed to be mostly locals as opposed to tourists...what fun...we especially enjoyed "The Ceviche Hut..Authentic Peruvian Cuisine" and greatly recommend it. We also loved The Cafe Berlin in Old San Juan...we're vegetarian and the Berlin has really good veggie choices. One of the nicest parts of the Rio Mar is the beach. Attendants drag chairs/lounges and a beach umbrella to your chosen spot (no fee...give them a tip, though). A short walk to the east on the beach takes you to the river (it flows through the neaby El Yunque Rain Forest---another DON'T MISS) where you can wade and explore. To the west the beach seems to go forever...lots of low key condo resorts but very quiet and no crowds. If you love to run on the beach (I do) you can go a long way (far enough for my old legs). Also great for long walks. Nice waves...mostly gentle but big enough for fun. All in all, a GREAT resort in a great place. And, Puerto Rico is also fun , friendly and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view, not much else”
Reviews.Author: cd b
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wyndham Del Mar in March 2012 for 1 week, on a business trip at a conference. Also extended the trip to take advantage of the opportunity to visit Puerto Rico. We had been to PR the year before and stayed at El Conquistador, a Waldorf property which was far superior in quality of service and room conditions. The Wyndham has an impressive view and the beach is lovely with turquoise waters and nice sand. We golfed and the course was nice as well. However, we found the service very poor. You often could not reach anyone on the phone and even calling the operator would result in a recording. The food service at several of the bars took forever as well as in the restaurants. We ate poolside and in Japanese restaurant as well as at the golf course, all were extremely slow. The sushi at the Japanese place was fantastic, but the meal I ordered was over salted and inedible. The rooms were dated and not overly clean. There was sand on the floor upon arrival and the old tile in the shower area was showing the wear and tear. Overall, for the $$ and service, this place was way over priced. Lastly, as we took a taxi from airport, we had no car to go off site and were stuck buying every meal and drink from the resort. $3 for a can of coke and $8 ham sandwiches got old real fast. The deli outside the casino was always busy with long lines and overworked staff. Also, if you haven't been to one of these resorts lately, don't bother tipping the belman and housekeeping. They're going to charge you for it when you check out anyway - $14 for belman and $2.50/day for housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: horrible2
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service are not worth the Almos 400 dollar night stay! Forget about room service it took almost two hours ... Keep looking ... I wish I had

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for first visit to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Mark1206
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the location is great. Hard for me to judge room value as I was comp'd as part of the conference organizer group. On the down side, the service and cleanliness seemed kinda mediocre. Overall though, if you want to see the real Puerto Rico, don't stay here or at another fancy resort. The only taste of seeing what things are really like on the island was my trip back and forth to the airport. Otherwise, I could have been staying in south Florida, for all I could tell.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rashida A
Reviews.Content: This resort is perfect. Great restaurants, friendly staff, picture perfect. By far the nicest resort I have ever stayed at. Amazing memories with my true love.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, great locale, super service, and good food!”
Reviews.Author: Aleta R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio Mar for a week on a girls getaway trip. It was absolutely perfect for it! The pool and beach are amazing- try and stay on the ocean side if you can. Even though it was the Atlantic side- still beautifiul and blue! I was impressed with all of the food on the property- one usually has low expectations for places like this, but I was pleasantly surprised. Be prepared to spend some money. It's a very large property and they have to pay for it somehow! This is very close to the fain forest park which can warrant several trips to if you rent a car. You are also not so far from San Juan and Old San Juan for a change of scenery. If you can get a designated driver, renting a car is the way to go. Get the insurance- they are crazy drivers and worse parkers. I would add that the rooms need to be updated and there is some sort of equipment on the roof that when it was running, we could barely hear each other talk. Most nights were lovely with the sound of the ocean and the tree frogs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for the adventurous traveler”
Reviews.Author: Vbyellow2
Reviews.Content: Great location for daily activities- loquillo beaches/kiosks, el yunque rainforest and fajardo for beaches and the biobay kayak tours. Night life is a little weak, but If you rent a car it's an easy drive to San Juan or old San Juan for nightlife. Overall a great stay with friendly staff. Maria (at the concierge and towel bar) is a GREAT resource and good for a great laugh. She is what customer service is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: teknoturtl
Reviews.Content: First, check in took a long time. After waiting in line, we were informed that our room was not yet ready and we would be called when it was. After one hour of waiting, we still were not called. We got back in the check in line and were told that we could go ahead and check in a "nicer" room that was ready right now. It was on the first floor. The view was to the common area where people walked to and from the beach/pools. (left me wondering what kind of view the other room had??) The ceilings were SO high. The floor was tile, but it seemed clean to me. Our shower did not drain either. Overall, I found the room to be clean, the balcony was nice. The beds were comfortable. It was relatively quiet in the room. There was nothing "special" about the room, extremely standard, but the bathroom was a bit nicer than the average hotel bathroom. The resort had several places to eat. The Tapas bar appeared to be open only on Saturday night. There was noone there on Sunday or Monday nights. Marbella seemed like a pretty good value to me as it was a buffet w/ dessert included. We also ate at Paulio and Seabreeze. I would say all the food was very good, but on the salty side. The menus were not very extensive. I found the prices to be comparable to other restaurants, I would not say it was outrageously priced at all. The drinks were high priced, and the spa treatments were also very high priced. (we didn't go to the spa). On Saturday night, the TIKI bar was open with a DJ and dance music. There was a crowd of people having fun, drinking, dancing, etc, but the bar and DJ closed shop at 10 pm!!! It was not open any other night. We were disappointed in the lack of things to do at night. The lobby bar was open and so was the casino, but that was it. No place to dance or watch live music, etc etc etc. I wish there had been more night life!! We did not have a car, so we stayed at the resort the whole time. The beach was nice, lounge chairs and umbrellas were complementary. The pool area was nice, but crowded. The resort had a few shops and kiosks to buy souveniers or snacks/HBA. There was a shuttle that is available to go from airport to resort and back. The cost for round trip was $75 per person. The trip took about 1 hour!! Also, we were wrongly charged for someone elses drinks at check out, but after the staff looked into the drinks in question, they realized the drinks were actually purchased by someone who had a similar room to ours. The front desk staff was friendly... but every time we went to the front desk it seemed to take longer than it should have, and involved quite a bit of them clicking and typing with their computers... Not sure what that was all about!! Also, there is an internet room, except you have to pay to use the computers. Overall, I found it well maintained, comfortable, and convenient. I just wish there was more night life and a more streamlined process for check in and settling of bill, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Grounds, Great Service, Rooms need refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Zeus S
Reviews.Content: The Title really sums up how my family and I felt about this destination. It's a huge property and very well maintained. The grounds are truly gorgeous! Their beach area is postcard beautiful! It's a pretty a place as I have seen and very inviting. We arrived very late, due to a prior commitment. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful or friendly. It was a nice way to start our time there. The courtesy continued throughout our time here. Everyone was friendly and always helpful. The lobby area is very attractive and inviting. Plenty of places to stop and have a drink or sit down and take in the stream of guests strolling by. The rooms are a bit tired and in need of refreshing.
