It's visible that the proximity to the beach and having guest come in out with salty, sandy clothing has had an impact on the carpeting and furniture. So yes, the rooms were not up to the rest of the resort. But the view from the room was special with good sound proofing. Didn't hear our neighbors or folks by the pool. Food as expected was more costly than I would have liked. Frankly, overpriced. I did anticipate that as that seems to be the norm in these type of large resort destinations. There is a coffee, snack bar off the main floor that's a bit more reasonable. But down the hill and a few short miles down the main road is Luquillo Beach with rows of place to eat that offer great local fare and more reasonable prices. So worth getting into the car and making the 10 minute drive. My family and I enjoyed our time here. The location is good, close proximity to the MUST-DO EL Yunque Rainforest and other good destinations close to San Juan. So if you choose to book here, go in knowing the rooms are not great but the beach and pool area are and service is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, majority of staff is rude and helpless.”
Reviews.Author: Happygolucky727
Reviews.Content: I came here 2 enjoy the culture. I had no idea for my first visit to this island that I would NEVER want to come back. The only members of the staff that were caring were the bellhops. Other than that you had to call to get fresh towels and make up your own bed. THIS WAS A TOTAL NIGHTMARE!!! Save your money and go to any other bordering island. You'll have more fun. I'm sitting here waiting in the lobby for my pick-up to the airport. This is not a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene was not the hotel's fault”
Reviews.Author: firerose37
Reviews.Content: My twin brother and I (22 years old at the time) took our first vacation with just the two of us and decided to see what Puerto Rico had to offer. Unfortunately the day before we arrived Hurricane Irene had hit PR. When we arrived we caught the van to the hotel, that I paid extra money for and reserved ahead of time, and the driver was very nice. There were a few other travelers along too. The weather was terrible and the roads were flooded but the ride was fine. When we got to the hotel it looked great. We did not have a rental car so we didn't have to worry about parking. We checked in smoothly. The room was nice but that first night the water and toilets were repeatedly affected by the power outage. I asked the concierge for water and they sent up two one-liter bottles of water. We had to use those for a few more days for teeth brushing due to the hurricane power outages. When I asked the front desk about the issues they informed me that the building was running off of generators. The hotel gave us a small discount on food the first night due to the issues. I won't say more about the food except that the theme night with the dancers was fun and worth it, but everything else was average quality and overpriced. Since my brother and I did not have any mode of transportation we had to use their restaurants and it cost us quite a bit more than we anticipated. Another issue is that because of Hurricane Irene the excursions company "Dragonfly Adventures" had to cancel many of their normal activities. Pros: they were very easy to deal with and very easily accessible (desk located in lobby, had staff member available 90% of the time). Every one was friendly. Cons: I had wanted to see a few key sites like the El Yunque rainforest and the bio-bay dinner trip and both were cancelled due to the storm. We did, however, get to go horseback riding and do the Old San Juan and Bacardi Factory tours, which were all very nice. The beach was a mess and pretty much not usable. The pools were average. We took advantage of the water aerobics class one day and that was fun. I won't even mention the hassle we had to go to leave PR due to Hurricane Irene. We had to spend two extra unplanned nights at the hotel and the staff was very kind and helpful but the airlines were just completely uncooperative. Puerto RIco was a great place to visit but I wish I had planned for the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping rooms”
Reviews.Author: Holly H
Reviews.Content: The common areas of this property would lead you to expect quality sleeping rooms. However this is NOT at all the case. The floors are tile and it was sticky. I refused to walk on them without shoes on. The room is large, but very tired. The toilet didn't flush properly, the TV didn't work. The shower didn't drain. The carpet in the guest room hallways was so stained and dirty that is looked like movie theater carpeting. My room was in the East tower and I understand from other people I talked to that the rooms in the West wing are in better shape and have been renovated more recently. Nothing stays open past 10 pm regardless of the night or how busy it may be. The best food I had was at the italian restaurant although it was definitely over priced. The place is freezing and musty. The pool and beach are undoubtedly the best features although I really appreciated the free wifi in the lobby also. I don't recommend this hotel. The only positive aspects can easily be found at other hotels that care about service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ocean front room”
Reviews.Author: Mainefama
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the ocean front room and the sound of the waves at night. Room was clean except for the floor, hence dirty feet. Yuk! Beach was nice but adult pool chairs were being "saved" with towels, etc. but few people. A car here is a must to avoid the overpriced food and drink. Do like to try the local restaurants but a good breakfast place alluded us so we ended up at Burger King twice. It was a good base for us the visit the rain forest, the Bio-bay and a day trip to Ponce, but in general we didn't really care for such a large resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Superb.... Cannot Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: 1st class resort. Beautiful hotel, friendly staff. The pool and grounds are pristine, clean, and so relaxing. The pool area is beautiful, The food was excellent and the beach and location were outstanding. Approximately a five minute drive to Luqillio or just walk... Rio Mar is just a mile down the beach from Luquillo. Approx. five minutes to the Luquillo Kiosks... excellent food, quirky, fun atmosphere. El Yunque is across the street and then a 10 minute drive. Fajardo for Bio Bay is 10-15 minutes away. You cannot get a better resort and location than the Rio Mar. Room was beautiful. No complaints... great time.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: storage
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor reviews, I was concerned about staying at this hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed in this area because it is centrally located and convenient to the El Yunque Rain-Forest, scuba diving and hiking. Our friend was given a renovated room and we were given an unrenovated one, but it was truly fine. The housekeeping staff was excellent. The fitness center and health spa is gorgeous and is fully equiped with new machines, weights and facilities and the guestrooms and bathrooms are spacious and comfortable. It is an older hotel, but my husband and I found the beds and linens extremely comfortable. The casino was small and did not have any poker machines and the breakfast buffet was mediocre and expensive. The pool and beach area was wonderful with lots of comfortable lounge chairs and umbrellas. Considering the very reasonable price for the room, we feel that we got a great deal at a very nice hotel. We often pay a lot more money for a hotel that provides a lot less amenities and less comfort. I recommend this hotel highly. I should mention that there was not a mini bar in the room which was an inconvenience....

Reviews.Title: “Mildew , Mold , Expensive and Indifference”
Reviews.Author: MangoMiami
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from my room at this hotel and I had to review it while things were fresh in my mind. The Good: The beach is nice, the grounds are fairly well kept but some areas are in need of repair. We enjoyed the pool area and the beach quite a bit. The beach staff are A+ and some of the nicest folks we met in the resort. The folks at the tennis shop are also nice and their facilities are well maintained. The Bad: They nickel and dime you on everything. $10 / day to get WIRED internet in the room. $15 a day to park , $16 breakfast for two eggs for breakfast, $3.50 for a banana or apple. The min-fridge that seems to have been in the room at one point was removed from it's enclosure in all the rooms in our group so you have to buy from them instead of getting your own ahead and saving $. It struck me as dishonest and greedy. The concierge staff lie to you with a smile on their face. They do there very best to push you toward their over priced excursions through "dragonfly adventures" their partner in the tour and shuttle service. We inquired as to renting a sail boat which we saw on the beach and the concierge said it was privately owned and not something we could use but instead he suggested a $150 per person boat trip from their service. The truth was that the sailboat can be rented but it's by another vendor who is on the beach and it's much cheaper. They are obviously more concerned about their bottom line than the customer experience. All excursions seemed over priced and under delivered. We went on two Dragonfly adventure tours and were disappointed with them both. The El Yunke rainforest tour was led by a short woman who could not walk very well and we found out later she took us on a very short trip instead of the one to the waterfall because she had mobility issues. There were also questions of her integrity as we later found out she told two different people she graduated form two different colleges. The Dragonfly tour to Old San Juan and Bacardi was horrible. There was so much traffic we didn't have enough time to do both so we ended up going to Old San Juan for an hour and a half. 3 hours of driving for a 1.5 hour run around the city on our own. The tour guide for this trip, who was another over weight individual, made no less than a half dozen references to getting dunk which were followed by tales of his own personal life instead of the surrounding area and information. AVOID DRAGONFLY ADVENTURES. The staff @ concierge and the hotel based restaurants were indifferent 80% of the time. For some reason there is an air of indifference with a slight hint of despise from some of the staff here. I do not know why smiles are greeted with scowls and it's very unprofessional and does not lend itself to an enjoyable area. CHECK YOUR BILL. As others had stated they tried to slip several charges on our bill which we had to dispute. They removed them but the fact that they would tack on a $15 a day parking charge for us when we didn't even have a car shows the level of dishonesty, incompetence, or both, at this resort. WET ROOMS! The rooms were damp and musky and the A/C was always blasting on low. This wasn't isolated as all of the other folks in our group said the same thing. one had to have a dehumidifier in their room since the first morning they woke up there was so much moisture their bed and floor were both soaked with water. Leaving a piece of paper out over night would result it it being soggy in the morning. I'm a bit afraid of what it may have done to my laptop over the 6 days we were here. FREEZING AIR CONDITIONING EVERYWHERE Bring a sweater and long pants for when you are indoors. We didn't expect to need to be warmed up in the Caribbean but every hotel room, meeting room, restaurant and area in the hotel is freezing cold. We believe it is to keep the air circulating so the mold and mildew doesn't set in. In any event shorts alone won't be enough for most. LAST THOUGHTS: The bottom line with this place is I would not return and I would not recommend it. We loved the pool and beach ares but the overall experience, prices and attitude of the people in this resort left us disappointed . This could be a five star review and resort but it sadly falls drastically short of being exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but that's about all”
Reviews.Author: Lunros
Reviews.Content: While the resort is very nice, the food is very pricey, limited in selection and not good at all. you probably would not mind the price if it is excellent but unfortunately not. Fortunately, they don't charge for the air you breath since they charge for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great room..great beach”
Reviews.Author: mjrdnx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio Mar for 6 nights, March 7th through the 12th. We were met at the airport by the hotel shuttle and the cost was included in the price of the vacation. The rep was easy to spot and the service was great. The driver gave us great information about the hotel and the culture. Check in was easy and because it was our anniversary we were given a complementary upgrade to an ocean front room. The room was clean and smelled great and we have nothing but good things to say about the room and the service. The pools were clean and well kept but I will advise future guests to get towels early and stake your spot as it fills up quickly both at the pool and on the beach. Yes the concierge asked if we were interested in some freebies for the Wyndham timeshare information and we declined and were not bothered again. We took a great tour of Old San Juan from Dragon Fly Tours at the concierge desk and Frankie our driver was one of the highlights of the trip, funny, informative and ready to answer any questions and stopped to give the tour a taste of authentic Puerto Rican food on a beautiful beach near Luiza. As my husband and I are from the cold north (not this year) we wanted to be outdoors as much as possible. My only small disappointment was that the Tiki Bar and other outdoor restaurant closed early between 5 and 6pm. The restaurants in the building were open. One was a buffet and the other 2 were a more formal dining experience than we were looking for. So to make up for this there is a small terrace outside the lobby bar that serves small plates, nachos and other happy hour foods. There is also the option to go to ERL outside the casino and order a pizza to go, stop by the lobby bar for a beverage and take it all outdoors to an ocean front table on the deck of the tiki bar. I have read about the cost of food and yes this is a resort and you have to expect it to be pricey, but a large pizza at ERL is $20.00, 2 beers are about $15.00 and the empty table oceanfront in the closed tiki bar is priceless. Thank you Wyndham Rio Mar for the best vacation we have had in years and we look forward to returning over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but with issues”
Reviews.Author: egreer19
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with a crescent beach. The common areas and landscaping are very well maintained. However, the rooms are beat up. Chipped furniture and broken tiles in the bathrooms and bathroom fixtures need updating. We stayed here 12 years ago when it was a Westin property, and we thought it was spectacular. Now needs renovating. The restaurants and bars are expensive, but on par with other similar resorts. The service overall is not good. In the restaurants, service was very slow - no such thing as a quick meal. A few of the employees were friendly but the majority are indifferent. Housekeeping appears to be understaffed. There were never enough towels in the room and sometimes none at all; had to call to get some. Rooms are cleaned once a day and not spruced up in the evenings as in similar resorts. No mini bar in the rooms. Water pressure in the showers is terrible and water runs hot/cold. We had booked a beachfront room with king bed per arrangement with conference we were attending. When we checked in, we were given room with 2 queens overlooking El Yunque - but really the parking ramp. Iguana pit was below, aka Natural Area. We were told the hotel was full and we could move the next day - which we did but was disruptive to our day. The food was good at every meal, and the Executive Chef was charming. We had a yoga class outside in area overlooking the ocean - beautiful! However, was infested with fire ants, and several of us (including me) got multiple bites. Ouch! Area should not be used or sprayed for ants. This would be a very expensive family vacation due to cost of meals, and I'm not sure I'd recommend it to anyone. For the same price, you can stay at an updated resort with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in PR”
Reviews.Author: antiquerStaunton_VA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 2nights in this elegant resort. The beach was beautiful. After spending 5 nights in smaller boutique hotels in PR, we found this resort impersonal and very expensive. The restaurants were over priced for the service and the quality of food was lacking. It was clean and the guys out front were very helpful. The valet service was fast. Next time PR we want to experience the culture so we won't be staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously over-priced”
Reviews.Author: iplaythecowbell
Reviews.Content: To get here from the airport you can either take a taxi which was 63 dollars, or use the hotel shuttle for 37 dollars (you need to reserve it 24 hours in advance btw). The buses don't take you to the hotel. Our room was average-not worth the price we paid for it. Our floor's ice machine didn't work the whole time we were there. The pool was nice and so was the beach. There was hardly any live entertainment. The restaurant staff was really slow and not very friendly. This was our second time visiting Puerto Rico and both times we had poor service. I think its a Puerto Rican thing. The resort is very large and very pretty. If you want to venture out into the local city you'd have to rent a car, which we didn't do, so everyday we'd have to eat at the restaurants they had. We were shocked the first night when we ate at their buffet and were charged 30 dollars per person! Yikes! Unfortunately it wasn't even close to being worth that much money. They had a more low-key restaurant outside which served less expensive food, but still expensive. The average alcoholic shot was 10 dollars, I found out when paying the bill. We started buying bottles of liquor from the gift shop instead, to save money. A lot of families were here with their children, so, beware of the loud noises. lol. They had a slide, kiddie pool, and a playground on one side and an adults only pool on the other. This was a gorgeous resort, but we'll never come here again. It was ridiculously over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach but no nightlife, bar”
Reviews.Author: dawnsternaz
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the resort this week. Very nice, clean, beach is wonderful. They even have an area with iguanas and turtles that they feed each morning at 11am, great for kids! Only downside is the place shuts down at 6pm. We went to the beachbar Sunday night for a drink and although there were people there, they shut it down! We were in Ponce and their bar stayed upon til midnite, it's high season afterall! They do keep the lobby and hotel freezing, so we didn't want to drink in the lobby bar. Overall nice place though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach and Friendly Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: muks321
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/6/12 - 3/12/12. Private Beach was clean with plenty of chairs and umbrellas. Staff was friendly and helpful. Resort needs some updating but is clean and maintained. Needs more entertainment in the evenings. Overall we loved our stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: Dona26
Reviews.Content: We were six ladies from New York that needed to relax and get away from the city life. We stayed for 5 days. We had a great time by the pool. We just wanted to get away and to relax on the beach or pool. When we arrived not all of our rooms were ready but the staff was wonderful and sent us to the bar to have a drink by the beach. We rented a car at the airport and drove all over the area without any problems â€“ we went to the Kiosks almost every night, we also had good steak at the Haciendas (two people order the fish but did not like it), we also went to El Yunque, the rain forest. We forgot to bring water but we did have throwaway raincoats that came in handy. We also drove to Fajardo and then the ferry to Vieques - Sun Bay, we also so made many tips to the local grocery store â€“ Amigo (they have everything fruits, crackers, soda, rum, wine, water, dairy products, and etc.). We went to Dunkinâ€™ Donuts for coffee and a small cafÃ© down the road from the resort. On our last day we drove to Old San Juan and then off to the airport. We used the valet parking ($20 per day) with no issues - we called ahead and by the time we arrived downstairs the car was there. All of our rooms were on the Rain-forest side on the 6th floor. The view was beautiful and the sounds of the frogs were nice. Some of the rooms needed some minor painting and patching. All public areas seemed well-kept and everything was clean. Downside of the resort â€“ Food too expensive, nothing to do at night, very little water pressure in the showers, music by the pool can get very loud, too many guests hogged the beach chairs (the nice wood beach chairs with royal blue cushionsâ€™) but did not use them until two to three hours later â€“ staff does nothing to discourage this practice. We never got a chance to sit in the adult quiet side even though we were at the pool by 9 â€“ 10 am every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: christy49F
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort in Februray 2012 with some family and friends. Upon arriving, the entrance and view was beautiful. We were happy as we had booked this online and had not seen the resort before. I have so many positive things to say about it. The beach was beautiful with surf and sand. Overlooking the beach and poolside was a lively outdoor bar. It was often the hub of acitivity. The only think missing was live music but there was always piped music playing.Drink prices were high but they had a two for one special every day. We all liked the fact that the beach was just a few steps from the pool and bar area so if some of our group wanted to be on the beach and some at the pool, it was easy to get back and forth. The rooms were nice and very clean. The bathroom sparkled. We had a patio with a view of the beautiful grounds, the ocean and the pool. At night, the lights were so pretty. We ate in local restaurants as we wanted to eat Puerto Rican cuisine but the restaurants looked nice although somewhat pricey. All in all, we loved the resort and would highly recommend it. On a side note, if you have not been to Puerto Rico for many years, you should visit. Old San Juan is amazing as it has been restored and included historic buildings, wonderful restaurants, cobblestone streets and little shops. It's a wonderful day or night excursion. We did rent a car as we wanted to see as much as we could.

Reviews.Title: “Laid-back vacation spot for laid-back travelers”
Reviews.Author: Janet R
Reviews.Content: I booked through Cheap Caribbean for a Mon-Fri stay, early March. Probably because I got such a great deal through CC, they put me and my friend in a room with absolutely no view but we didn't mind. The room and bathroom were a good size and very clean and the beds and especially the pillows were so comfortable. They told us the resort was at 80% capacity but it seemed like only 50%. We never had trouble getting two lounge chairs by the adult-only pool or the beach. There is supposed to be waiter service by the pool but we only saw a waiter on one day. For food, there are two places by the pool - the Tiki Bar and the Sea Breeze restaurant - neither spectacular. Frozen drinks were great though. Boleros Lounge, in the hotel, was awesome. I was so impressed by their tapas. And some nights they have a pianist playing. The restaurant next to it, Palio, is also amazing. Worth splurging on a meal there. Overall, I had a really relaxing vacation at Wyndham Rio Mar. I found what I had read about the place to be true - about the service being slow and the prices a little high - but knowing that going in, I never felt really inconvenienced. I'm glad that my friend and I thought to bring a plethora of snacks to cut back on food costs. And the weather was great and the ocean warm. I would definitely recommend vacationing here if you are looking for an accommodating and relaxing beach getaway and you don't sweat the small stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: nerocat611
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 3/5 to 3/9. Really nice hotel grounds. Beautiful golf courses. Nice views! Service was pretty good! Staff seemed friendly and attentive. Adult pool in disrepair! You can see chipping of pool floor and walls. Almost thought it was patern of pool until I looked closely. Plenty of towels and chairs. Restaurants are quite expensive. For 2 adults you'll average US$100 a day without any alcohol. Casino was nice but small compared to other properties on Island. Beach was kinda OK if you just want to lay out on beach. Plenty of chairs. Not one of better beaches compared to some other resorts in Caribean. Unless you plan on spending a lot of time just walking around the property at night or spending most of your evening in the casino, you'd be well advised to rent a car. Word of caution!!!! Watch out for hidden costs to rent a car!! Find out what all the charges are before renting. Ask them what the final cost would be at the end of your rental period. If you don't, you'll be unpleasantly surprised. But still, renting a car is the better way to go. Go up to EL Yunque rain forest. Really a neat experience. You will see it from hotel! Have fun and relax!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golferbren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a three-night golf package March 5-8, 2012. While the public areas are well-kept, the rooms are quite dated and in need of renovation. The most up-to-date thing in the room was the flat-screen TV. While everything was clean, the bathroom fixtures were very dated. The carpet in the hallway was dirty. The ice machine broke the first night of our stay and was not fixed three days later. We ate at Palio twice enjoying the food and service the first night, but felt completely rushed the second time we ate there. Our other dinner at Estancia was good, but not exceptional. Service in the restaurants (other then our second meal at Palio) was excellent. The golf courses were as advertised in Golf Digest's "Best Places to Play." The River Course was an interesting 4-star course; the Ocean Course was 3 1/2 stars and rather unremarkable. There is only one hole where you see the ocean. Be prepared for long lines at the San Juan Airport when checking in for your return flight. The TSA does not have enough personnel on staff during the late afternoon, and we were glad we had been warned to allow extra time. We enjoyed our stay at the resort; however, would not have been comfortable renting a car or venturing out on our own. Based on what one of the shuttle drivers told us, the crime rate is very high. It is a beautiful place, but has many social problems which is very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Larie J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Years. We had a great stay. We went to relax on the beach and get away from it all.... When we arrived the tiolet in our room was leaking, it was fixed by time we returned to room from having drinks by the pool. The beach was nice, the hotel staff was excellent, very attentive. The room was spacious and comfortable. We rented a car, because it is quite a drive from the airport, not sure if I would do that again, once we got to the hotel, we pretty much stayed there. We are actually already planning our next trip here.

Reviews.Title: “This property screams for updates!”
Reviews.Author: DrSuz
Reviews.Content: This property was a Westin property taken over by Wyndham fairly recently. It operates as both hotel and time share. As a hotel, it is not terribly expensive. As a time share, it is way out of line in terms of number of points required vs what you get. The public areas are reasonably well-kept and seem to be refreshed recently. The units, however, require some monitoring. Our unit on the premium 6th floor level was actually fairly shabby. (Shabby seems to be the norm in PR, however.) The balcony chairs sported badly chipped paint, and the bathtub! Well! The porcelain was totally worn off in a dozen or more places--mostly where one had to stand--and the tub looked filthy. I think it was actually clean, but you know . . . I don't mind standing on my own dirt, but if there's a chance it's someone else's, that's not acceptable. Replacing a bathtub is not a big deal. It is not even costly. It only means the room would be out of commission for a day. As with many resorts in desirable locations, the Rio Mar charged extra for just about everything. The price for food seemed extremely expensive, but frankly, the nearby restaurants were nearly as costly, even the kiosks. Drinks were expensive unless you got the day's special. The breakfast buffet was $24/person for a fairly basic buffet. (I guess I'm used to Las Vegas.) The staff, however, was extremely helpful and accommodating. They tried to "make it right" when we complained about the tub by giving us a free tour of Old San Juan which would have cost us $60 each. (The tour was really good, by the way. Try to get Frankie!) We learned to eat at the lobby bar instead of the buffet or the premium restaurants. Or to go down the hill to Antonjito's (a reliable B quality restaurant--but not all that cheap) or head over to the kiosks (La Parilla is very good but pretty pricey). Stay away from the restaurants recommended by the concierge, though. The Hacienda Caribali was HORRIBLE! I didn't find the concierges very helpful. Parking is $15/day for self parking if you can find a spot in the garage. Valet is $20. You really do need a car unless you plan never to leave the resort--not a good idea IMHO. If you want to go to Vieques, take the ferry from Fajardo. It's cheap--$1 each way for seniors, a bit more for you youngsters. Your parking will cost $5 for the day. Isabella Secunda is a charming town, easy to walk around, but if you have time, rent a car and go around the island. Be sure to take your umbrella! PR is quite wet.

Reviews.Title: “This long review for first-timers!”
Reviews.Author: Larry V
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a quick 3 night stay at Rio Mar Beach Resort. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. Go prepared for a few things, however. Transportation: Unless your money is unlimited and/or you love the convenience of staying at this beautiful property the entire time, rent a car! (Word of advice: stay clear of EZ/Allied Car Rental. They put a $500 hold on your credit card--even after you purchase the $9.95/day fee for liability insurance. I think we were conned.) With a car you have the freedom to leave the resort atmosphere and experience some of the "real" Puerto Rico. The ride from the airport in San Juan was interesting. Drivers are very assertive, for lack of a better word. Definitely be ready for defensive driving--always scanning! Also, it is not a "beautiful" ride. San Juan is in rough shape in some parts. Sad, really. Traffic in the late afternoon to the resort was surprisingly light. We made it in about 45 minutes and it was about 4:30 in the afternoon. HOWEVER, morning rush hour traffic from Rio Grande into San Juan (the airport) was ridiculously heavy and we missed our morning flight. Give yourself at least 2 hours to get back to the airport if it's during morning rush hour--especially if you have a rental car return. Also, TSA at the San Juan airport is VERY slow. It was pretty frustrating standing there looking at two agents with only one of them checking IDs and the other just taking up space. We missed our flight by 5 minutes due to traffic and lack of efficiency through security. Parking at the resort is not free!! It's $15.00/day and $20 for valet. The parking is underground and crowded in the evening. We sometimes got the last spot! The elevator from the parking garage only worked sporadically. It was quite a chore trying to figure out where the stairs are and finding your way back to the lobby. Food: We were tired from our first day of travel so we decided to splurge and eat at one of the resort restaurants. We were disappointed that the Tiki Hut (outdoor) had closed at 6:00. The beach and outdoors were so inviting, that it was disappointing that we couldn't eat close to the ocean that first night. To me, that was far too early to close. Anyway, we ended up eating at Marbella. It was a very pleasant restaurant with excellent, attentive staff. Only disappointment was that there was no regular menu--only an Italian buffet--that evening. The food was really good, but we were expecting to have choices. It was about $100 for the four of us to have dinner with only water to drink. We weren't surprised at the price from other reviews. The Asian restaurant was open as well; however Palio was closed at that time. In fact, I never saw Palio was open during the time we spent there. Maybe we just missed it. That was the only time we ate at the resort. If you have a car, definitely take the time to drive the <10 minute ride to the kiosks in Luquillo. It is not a resort atmosphere, so expect that. It seems to be a hang out for a lot of the locals as well. We really enjoyed being there. Watch out for broken glass, however! Seems to be some partying going on there later on in the night. We enjoyed a fabulous lunch at La Parilla and dinner at El Jefe Burger. Both meals were good with a fun atmosphere. Check out all the kiosks. Lots of deep fried food, drinks of all sorts and friendly faces. There are a couple of mediocre gift shops there as well. We had no idea what to expect at these kiosks, but we're sure glad we went. Not all the kiosks are open during daylight hours, however. PS--coco frio is NOT cold pieces of coconut!! It's cold coconut water served in the coconut itself. Interesting! Also, mofongo (a local dish) isn't the greatest--but you should try it anyway! We also had breakfast one day at Antojitos at the bottom of the road leading to the resort. I would not recommend it for breakfast. The omelets were watery and luke warm. Maybe lunch and dinner would have been different. Cute place, though. El Yunque: We took 1/2 day to explore the rainforest. We had mixed feelings. We all thought it was beautiful. We did a challenging hike to Mina Falls. Getting to the falls was easy, going back was all uphill. So plan your hikes accordingly. I probably wouldn't bother stopping at the visitor center. Just get a map from the concierge at the hotel (he has recommendations) and keep on driving up the mountain road. It's twisty/turny so drive with care. There are snack places with bathrooms in several places up to the trail head to Mina Falls. There appears to be two separate trail heads for this particular hike to the falls. We bypassed the first one as there was no parking and drove onto the next one. Would we do the rainforest again? Probably not. It's just not our thing. But we're happy to have visited at least once. If you're a naturalist, however, plan on spending the day hiking, etc. This is the place for you! Not many people even realize that our US National Park system has a rainforest! FINALLY! The property: BEAUTIFUL!!! We're from Minnesota, so just the idea of being near the ocean was exciting. This property has amazing grounds which seem to be very well-kept. Our ocean front room was just that--just expect that your view of the ocean may be hindered by palm trees. We couldn't complain. You are just a short walk from the ocean through the grounds, and you hear the waves constantly. It was very windy there during our stay. I think that might be quite common. Our room itself was fine. We're not big complainers, however. Other people may have been bothered by dust in the corners, sand in the tub, etc. It wasn't a big deal to us. Our only complaint about housekeeping was that we didn't get enough towels when we finally did leave them on the floor for fresh ones. Even that wasn't a huge deal. The pools were lovely with plenty of seating, and that was later in the afternoon when we wanted to get out of the ocean wind. There is music playing most of the time, so sit away from the speakers if that's not your thing. Nice perk is that the resort provides beach towels and chairs and umbrellas for the beach. Tip the guy who puts the umbrella in for you!!! I wish I could remember the first guy's name that helped us (Miguel??), but he was so informative about the beach and swimming in the ocean. Very sweet guy. We were very happy with the size of the beach. It was very easy to find a spot all your own and right on the water. Check in was very smooth for us. Staff was friendly and quick. Use your phone to check out when you leave. It's quick and easy and will save you a stop at the front desk which can sometimes be busy. The walls of the rooms seemed somewhat thin. When our neighbor slammed the door (which happens when you leave your balcony door open) our bed shook. We heard people talking quite a bit in the hallways and somewhat next door, but that could just be rude people! One thing we should mention is that once you get on the grounds of the resort it's slow going. There are speed bumps slowing you down constantly. I get that, but it got a little annoying at times. The drive to the resort itself is long and windy. Just enjoy the scenery of this beautiful place. Overall, we were very pleased with the resort itself. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Problems with cleanliness and upkeep.”
Reviews.Author: HippoNC
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one night. The hotel had a nice location but we were disappointed at the cleanliness of our room. After checking in we were greated by large hair balls in the bathroom. Also hairs on the floor. I called and they sent someone to reclean the room. After they were done there was still a hairball in the bathroom. Also the safe and tv were not working properly. If I had not gotten a great rate of about $100 a night on hot wire I would have given a lower rating. The beach and pools were great the hotel has two pools and two hot tubs that were also very nice. Bottom line. Not happy with the room. But nice grounds, location and facilities. Also of you're staying here and looking for a good and reasonably priced place to eat try the brass cactus, about 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: fvaracch
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get a good deal on a hotel in Puerto Rico but we wanted to stay in a decent hotel. Found one at the Wyndham Rio Mar. Went 1st week in March and paid $287 incl taxes a night hotel was right on beach. We got an oceanview roomm it was a little dated but it was clean. They have 2 pools one for just adults, tennis and golf on the proprerty. We ate at Mirabellas for breakfast was good and we went to dinner at Shimau was delicious. Golf courses were in pretty good shape but the service at the club was terrible. No one came to take bags off cart, clean shoes etc also had to wait 1 1/2 hrs past tee time cause they ran out of carts. Nice hotel for price

Reviews.Title: “Almost 1st Class”
Reviews.Author: WestchesterMike
Reviews.Content: The location, building and grounds are great. The beach is just minutes from your room. The El Yunque national rain forest is 5 minutes by car. Old San Juan is about 45 minutes away. The resort has two pools, a hot tub, the beach, several restaurants, a spa, tennis courts and golf. The restaurants are pretentious, serving expensive, mediocre food. However, if you're adventurous, there are many kiosks nearby. Some of them serve great food, but it's local fare. The ambiance is not for those with who need pampering. The downside; Our room was near the casino. It was VERY NOISY at night. We could not sleep! The air conditioner was broken. It took two service calls to repair it. The in-room safe was inoperative. It only took one service call to repair it. The wireless internet service was very poor. It was very difficult to connect and cost $9.99 per day! Soap and towels were in short supply. We had to call housekeeping more than once. The staff was very nice and responsive. We may give the Rio Mar another chance, but in a different room. I'm hopeful that (next time)v,I can say it is 1st class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Vineyarder
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, older parents with two middle schoolers. We are nondrinkers, and pretty forgiving when it comes to service having spent years and years in the service industry. We just returned from a week long stay at the Rio Mar. This is a lovely property, beautifully manicured and maintained. The grounds are lovely with views from almost every vantage point. The beach is "golden sand" not white...the water was rough when we were there, but loads of fun body surfing. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas for all. The family pool was busy with lots of families and young people; didn't visit the adults only pool, but looked comfy and quiet. The views from the ocean view rooms were gorgeous; we had a rainforest view, also spectacular. Entire staff was friendly and courteous, accommodating. Mostl days, we got coffee at the little cafe by the casino. We made a run to Walgreens and picked up snacks and cereal, juice, milk, etc. We live in a resort area and expect restaurant prices to be higher, however, we ate breakfast one day at Marbella which set us back $80 bucks...should have ordered off the menu...we weren't impressed with our value on this one. We ate lunch at SeaBreeze by the pool one day and had a terrific pork quesadilla...price in line with what we expected ($60). Also ate at the Tiki Bar one day during lunch; price also in line here in our view. For dinners, we went off site. Don't be afraid, try the kiosks in Luquillo! We ate at El Jefe Burger, Tapas 13, La Parilla, and Ay Bonito and were never disappointed. Each night we spent about $100 and enjoyed every meal. We rented a car for about $150 for the week and took day trips to El Yunque, Seven Seas Beach, Luquillo Beach, and Old San Juan. This suited us perfectly; we're not much for organized tours, but this let us get out and about on our own time. Valet park at the resort; its only $5 more per day and totally worth it. We chose this resort because it was away from the city, but do think you need a car unless you are looking to simply enjoy your resort while on vacation. However, it didn't seem like there was alot going on at night. For us, that's okay. We also did the go carts at Hacienda Caraboli...good inexpensive fun! The beds were super comfortable, housekeeping timely and efficient, although she forgot towels a few times...this was quickly and easily rectified with a phone call to the front desk. I thought the room was a little small, and weirdly set up; we were constantly bumping into each other. But we spend so little time in the room that we didn't really care. The bathroom was big; good water pressure most of the time and lots of hot water. We really enjoyed our stay and felt we got our money's worth. Thanks Rio Mar!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but not for the budget conscious foodie”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict629
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I along with a group of friends just returned from Rio Mar on february 28th. It was a beautiful resort but as many others have said, the food can be very pricey. That along with the fact that the resort is very secluded, it is almost impossible to find good food at an affordable price without renting a car or taking a cab to the nearby restaurants and kiosks. A cab ride to the nearby kiosks costs will run you about $15 each way and you will find about 15 to 20 small shops, restaurants, and bars selling everything from empanadas (patties that can be filled with everything from cheese to shrimp), sancocho (soup usually served with rice), along with fruit "batidas" (shake or smoothie in spanish) and popular cocktails. Aside from having to leave the resort for affordable meal options, it is a pretty good resort. The staff is very accommodating. (We did receive a complimentary upgrade on arrival as did our friends) The grounds are clean. The rooms were nice and spacious. And if your spanish is a little rusty don't fret. Mostly everyone on the resort as well as much of the island speaks english.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded property”
Reviews.Author: LBNY78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5-day, 4-night stay. I was a bit unsure if we'd have a good stay after reading some of these reviews. But we had a great time. While I understand some (but only some) of the criticism, the pros outweigh the cons. Pros - If you're looking for a secluded retreat away from the city, this is perfect. It's about 35-45 minutes from San Juan airport, depending on traffic. The property itself is secluded. When you first turn into the property, there is a security gate. The person there has a record of your reservation. Once you get through, you drive a winding, pretty road for less than 5 minutes (passing the golf courses, country club, tennis courts, and time share villas) to the entrance to the resort. We arrived about 4pm on a Wednesday. The valets were immediately at our car to help with luggage and get us to the front desk for check-in. The parking was a bit confusing at first (you have a choice of valet vs. self-parking), but it worked out once we understood what our options were. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful, with a gorgeous view right away of the ocean. There is ample seating all throughout. The front desk clerk was very welcoming. In fact, this was a common trait of every employee we encountered at Wyndham. We were always greeted warmly, whether it was while walking through the lobby, at the pool, or in the elevator. We had booked a mountain-view suite, but they gave us an ocean-view suite when we arrived since the mountain-view suite was not yet ready for us. That was fine by us! And they kept the same price. We spent our trip mainly playing tennis (there is a shuttle that will take you there - but we just drove ourselves every morning) and relaxing by the pool. We stayed in the adult pool area. There is a family and activity pool as well, but that tended to be much louder. The adult pool was quiet and relaxing. You have the option of renting a cabana, which I highly recommend. Yes, it's pricey, but totally worth it if you can swing it. Keeps you out of the sun and rain (and it rained at least twice every day we were there). And you won't have to worry about getting a spot at the pool. We ate dinner at the resort every night except one (when we went to Condado). The food and wine at the restaurants are surprisingly good. And the waitstaff is very helpful. For instance, we had ordered a particular bottle of wine, but was then told they did not have any. bottles left So they brought us a similar bottle from the menu, which was more expensive, but charged us the less expensive price. The grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. The beach doesn't stretch on for miles and miles, but is definitely sufficient. Cons - The restaurants are probably more expensive than they should be, but the food is better than expected. And if you're from a big city, the prices are completely in line with most restaurants. Another con is that the adult pool never seemed to have enough room for everyone. We didn't have a problem because we rented the cabanas. But there were people every day after 11am looking for lounge chairs. The rooms and furnishings could definitely be updated, but considering we didn't spend much time inside, they were fine for what they were. The same for the tennis center - the courts need some repair. All in all, a perfectly nice resort with friendly and attentive service. If you're looking for rest and relaxation, this is a good place to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful... but food very pricey”
Reviews.Author: kristanf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week vacation (a gift to us from a friend) at the Rio Mar Beach Resort & Spa in PR. The resort is beautiful; big windows and places to sit and enjoy the view from every vantage point, adult & separate kid/family pool were very beautiful but the bottom of adult pool floor needs to be repainted - looks old. Customer service great w/ plenty of staff to help with all needs. We stayed in a junior suite on 7th floor overlooking the rain forest w/ private balcony w/ table/chairs. Both room and bathroom were very spacious, bed was really comfortable - we enjoyed sleeping in! The water pressure in the shower was excellent, but the tub was a standard sized shower/bath combo. This was disappointing. For a suite, we expected a larger Jacuzzi-type tub. Three "minor" complaints were the extremely overpriced food, the lousy "business center" and the daily parking fees. Food at resorts is always more expensive, but this was outrageous - lots of added taxes and fees at all the restaurants in the resort - watch out. There are several restaurants in Rio Grande that are affordable and tasty. Check out Antojitos Puertorriquenos down the hill from the resort - the food/service is excellent and the prices are minimal compared to the resort restaurant prices. Quickly, in case you need to take care of any business while at the resort, printing in the tiny business center is $1 per page and faxing is the same - $1 per page. No Kinkos-FedEx in town either. The parking is $15/day. Adds up so be prepared. Overall - we'd go back. Had a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort in PR.”
Reviews.Author: BrianFFXVA
Reviews.Content: 2nd time at this resort. We went with another couple and met 3 friends there for 5 nights. As expected, the hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and it was exactly what we expected. We didn't spring for the ocean view room which we regret as we were on the 1st floor on the side of the resort. Good clean room however so no real complaints. Ask about renting a mini fridge ($10 per day but they forgot to charge us) so you can run out to the grocery stores and pick up Medalla lights ($6 each on the resort) and food for breakfast and lunches. Only resort restaurants we ate at were the beachside grill (burgers, sandwiches, kind of expensive but you are eating on the beach what do you expect?). We didn't eat at any of the fancier restaurants for any of the meals because we know they are expensive and we prefer to explore the island and try new things. You can walk (about 2 miles) on the beach to the kiosks of Luquillo or catch a cheap cab and there are plenty of restaurants there to eat at that are great. La Parilla (best restaurant my wife and I have ever ate at), El Jefe Burgers, and others. Staff at the resort was cool. Casino was small but had blackjack, roulette, slots and other card games. Don't expect to much but its fun. Each day we just ate breakfast in the room with supplies from the grocery store, made lunches and packed beers/drinks and headed down to the beach. Plenty of chairs and tons of space so no issues. You can get an umbrella (they are free) but the staff will put it in for you so give them $5 and you will be fine. No problems from anyone with drinking/eating on the beach so that's the way to go. Even drank our own supplies at the pool and nobody cares. My wife and I are in our late 20s as was the rest of our group and there were other people our age. There were also families and older couples. There is enough space that nobody gets in each others way. There is a family pool, adults only pool, and all the beach. This was our 2nd time at the resort and if we found a good deal we would probably go again. My wife and I walked for miles in both directions on different days with no issues. Locals are friendly. We also did the El Yunque rain forest (we didn't do the tour, just hopped in the car our friends rented, grabbed a map, and walked the trails we wanted to). Also did the Bio Bay which was awesome. You kayak through the mangroves at night (our group had at least 15 other couples with glow sticks so you see where they are but can still see the glowing water and stars). Try this for sure. Definitively going to Puerto Rico again, just may try a different resort to switch it up as we have been here twice.

Reviews.Title: “bring a fat wallet”
Reviews.Author: tlc2459
Reviews.Content: While I would agree with many of the other reviews, the views of the beach and pool are very good, the over all value for the prices they charge is not very good. If you do not rent a car you are trapped into dining at the resort only, unless you're willing to spend 20 - 40 dollars fro a cab ride to restaurants only 5 - 10 minutes away. We tried to dine at Palio our last night there, but were informed that shorts for male diners are not welcome, guess they saved me 150 dollars...we saw many people that had obviously been there before going out to the local grocery stores stocking up on beer, wine, snacks so they would not have to pay their exorbitant prices for those items...live and learn. We would go back, but do many things differently.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach & Pool Combo”
Reviews.Author: Meiguoren1
Reviews.Content: My wife & i stayed on the 7th floor of the Wyndham Rio Mar at the end of February (Tues-Wed). This resort has a gorgeous setting... with a wide swath of soft brown sand and nicely laid out pool areas among plentiful palm trees. The Good: â€¢ very friendly service from all of the staff we encountered (i.e. front desk, concierge, bartenders, and wait staff) â€¢ grounds and common areas are very well maintained â€¢ huge beach w/great ocean swimming, lounge chairs & towel service â€¢ nice Tiki Bar on the beachfront â€¢ clean and comfortable King bed room w/oceanfront view â€¢ awesome happy hour mojitos and great service from Gabriel at the Lobby Bar The Bad: â€¢ self-parking structure didn't have any working elevators, so we had to carry our luggage up several flights of stairs (while trying to follow poor signage) and a fair distance to the front desk â€¢ La Estancia restaurant was closed â€¢ key card for our room didn't work on two occasions (which meant two trips to the front desk for reprogramming) â€¢ food was pricey, just be careful what you order My wife & i are returning to the Wyndham Rio Mar for the last night (Saturday) of our trip, so i'll report on any new experiences after that stay. BTW: i booked our stay though Priceline for $100/night plus taxes, resort fees, and parking. The total was just under $150/night. Rental Car Tip: make sure to get the Tollway sticker for the rental car at the San Juan airport rental car center so you can avoid stopping at the cash toll lines on the highways. It will be a big time saver. I didn't do this and regretted it, especially when we got stuck waiting in a cash toll lane for one hour on the PR66 Carolina tollway. The system there was corrupt... they had 3 toll workers walking along the stopped cars offering drivers to go through an "exclusive" lane for $20... what a scam!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: crf55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited the rio mar on a business related function. It was a nice room, nothing really fancy but was clean and the staff was very helpful. The grounds are very nice, but the restaurants and bars were expensive. We rented a car in San Juan and used it to get around to the rain forest, restaurants in town and at the kiosks. Also for a snorkeling trip to Fajardo. We had a wonderful time and loved everything about Puerto Rico. We were pleasantly surprised as there were quite a few not so favorable reviews on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “beach”
Reviews.Author: rockteam
Reviews.Content: the rio mar was spotless. it has a terriffic beach and was not crowded. swimming pool area is quite large and very clean. water was on cold side. very sunny days is february. nice stay. just bring plenty of $$ but you wont be disappointed. cost 25/day$ to park. cliff

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: audrey11
Reviews.Content: so my boyfriend and i just spent 4 days at the rio mar hotel in puerto rico. if you're looking for a beautiful beach property away from san juan, this is the place for you! the room we stayed in was nothing fancy, but had all the amenities we needed, was very clean, and had a small balcony overlooking the lagoon. the staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. and it's a 10 minute drive to the rain forest.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: asclaf
Reviews.Content: We loved our February stay at Rio Mar. We travel often and thought the staff was terrific, friendly and attentive, although the front desk should have been staffed with at least one more person to speed things up. Our room was quite nice and the ocean view was beautiful. One regret is that all the beach umbrellas were taken by 11:00am and as a result, we both got sunburned. As far as time share come-ons, only one staff member spoke to us and was very polite when we declined. We enjoyed breakfast at the resort but asked to be seated on the patio outside the dining room. The weather was perfect and it was the perfect setting, uncrowded and quiet. The food at the resort is pricey so we decided to visit restaurants off site for dinner. There are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants around, especially at the Kiosks in Luquillo. Personally, I enjoy taking my time at dinner so waiting for the food to be prepared wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “"Not as bad as I thought it would Be, but pricey"”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson76
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rio Mar during the week of Feb 20-24th, 2012. Before, I had left I read a lot of reviews. I would say, many reviews were spot on about the food, service etc. I didn't set my expectations high. The person I traveled with had been there 2 years ago and assured me it was good. So, here is what I thought. Check-in: Check in went fairly smooth. Since I read a lot of reviews about views, I asked for a high floor. Jose, at front desk said," I will see what I can do, but we are running a full house this week"..After typing in on the computer, He told us there was a room on 5 but it wasn't ready and we could wait like 30 minutes and he would call us on our cell. So, we explored around the lobby and outside. We got our call and picked up our key. Well, we ended up on the first floor. In the end, our room wasn't too bad. I actually liked that it was the first room in the hallway and it was right next to the spa, close to the door to go outside to the pool,and near all the restaurants. It was also by the stairs by the lobby so we could easily get drinks at the lobby bar and head to the cafe for a quick snack. We would get drinks and bring them to the room and sit on our balcony. I didn't hear a lot of noise by elevators, but I did hear the people coming in the doors a lot, late night and early morning, but nothing too bad. Food: It was very expensive. I went to Marbella's for the Mexican Buffet. It was 24.95, but you eat as you wanted. I would have liked more selection at the buffet. I was looking for tacos, burritos, but it was quesadillas, rice, beans, etc. It was ok, but wanted more variety. I also did Shimas the Japanese restaurant and that bill was 113.00 for 2 people. I got the coconut chicken, I hardly tasted coconut. It was not worth the price. The server was bad. He didn't come back to ask us how our food was or anything. I got a drink and it was 10.50 and not very good. I think it was called Red Lotus. I was their with a friend, we are just 2 female friends and Melvin our waiter called me her partner, my friend was like, what, you mean my friend. Just because we are 2 ladies, don't assume anything. We also ate at Palio's. It was the better of the 3 restaurants, again, very pricey. I had the tortellini and I got 7 of them and sauce for 21.00. I can buy a whole package for like 4-5 dollars. I also got a salad and that was another 11.00, and I got a glass of wine. Again, when all said and done, your looking at a bill close to 50 or more for 1 person, depending on how many drinks you get etc. There was no such thing as cheap meals here. The second night, I got Penne Forno, it was ok, and 24.00, plus salad and drinks. Service was good and I spoke Spanish to the waiter the entire time. It was fun! Cafe/ Bakery: I got a bagel and juice here. The bagel was not sliced and you put the cream cheese on yourself. I didn't realize this until I got to the room. The next day I got a chocolate muffin, it was good. Juce and a bagel/ muffin, 7.50. Marbella's- Breakfast Buffet: 24. 95.. the usually breakfast stuff. You can order a la carte, it is cheaper. I didn't eat 24. 95 worth of food the day I went. Tiki Bar: Slow, I had to go to the bar twice to let them know I existed and wanted to order. Chicken sandwich, fries, and a drink, about 35.00. I got the Babaloo, it was just ok. The mojito was good. There were no cheap meals here at this hotel, allow yourself a food budget and drinks. I hear there are cheap restaurants down the road in Luiquillo Beach, I suggest exploring that option, unless you don't care about high prices. Lobby Bar: Ask for drink specials, Barcardi drinks were 5.00. I had a lot of Barcardi Limon with Sprike, or one night, was daquiri specials for 5.00. I guess it depends on what you like to drink. Towels by the pool: I just wanted a towel, I don't need to be hit up for time shares each time. Pools: I used the adult pool, get there early for a chair especially on crowded weeks. This area can also be a little shady, as the sun moved behind the hotel. The cabanas take up space. Look for the iguanas, they like to come out in bask in the sun and might even walk under your chair. I really enjoyed the pool, big and roomy. There was a main family pool for kids with a water slide. They had basketball courts, volleyball courts, tennis,and an arcade, which I didn't personally use, but it was there. Beach: I found it to be typical and fairly clean. There were chairs for hotel guests. There is no lifeguard, but the flags were up. We had 2 days of red flags. The waves were high and rough, but we still went in and took some dips. Take a walk down the beach, it goes on for a while. It looks like people were cleaning the beach up from a storm that happened by in January or December. The beach was private and only hotel guest seemed to be using it. The water was typical Atlantic Ocean water, sandy which seaweed type of things floating, but least it was not rocky. It was warm and it was not home! Tours: We did the El Yunque tour and Old San Juan Historical. El Yunque was great. It was a lot of walking and you should be in good shape to do the trail, as it It can be very steep. I went to the tour desk and must of had that look on my face that I wanted info. The one girl who helped me first was nice and told me about the tours, she then offered me 2 free tickets to the tours, and then I realized she was trying to sell me a time share. Watch out for time share people, so then she directed me to the other tour person at the desk and I booked my 2 trips from Dragonfly. If you go on the Historical Tour, it does not to go EL Morro, just drives by it, you go to the other fort: San Cristobol. Tours left promptly from the hotel and returned you promptly. I did not have any problems with tours and if you talk to the right people first it is fine, least for me it was. Juan Lopez was our guide and he was great. Rooms: Typical, clean for the most part, title floor, flat screen TV, etc. I found the beds comfortable. I sort of had a pillowtop feel. The only problem, it took 2 days for them to put the blanket on the bed. We just had sheets. It was ok, since it is Puerto Rico and warm, but I was a little chilly. The room was not to bad, just a few little paint peels, but who stays in the room all day anyways? It was fine for the price. I had a nice view of the courtyard and the entrance doors. If I looked over the balcony I could see the ocean. We were not really facing the ocean. I was in room 1103. Location: The hotel is exactly 1 hour from Old San Juan, and about 45 minutes from the airport. We did our tours and stayed at the resort. We didn't want to do the rental car thing, but if you want to find cheaper places to eat, maybe a car would be good, or a taxi. The area near the hotel looked poor and dumpy, but you see that on many islands. You do see El Yunque from the hotel, which is also nice. The rainforest is about 3 miles from the resort, but at least 20-30 minutes driving. It is overcast a lot because of the rainforest, but we see had plenty of sun! Nightlife, well, there is a casino.. but it is small. We usually just went swimming at night and used the hot tub. We basically had the pool all to ourselves. We also just walked on the path. It was nice. They should have more activities at night, perhaps, a dance club, or some shows. Overall, I had a great relaxing vacation. I saw a lot of great things, El Yunque and Old San Juan. I had been to Old San Juan before from cruising, but it was nice to be able to go back and visit things I did not have time for on the cruise. The hotel is not that bad. I would go back, but I would try to eat other places off the resort. It is not a 5 star hotel, but it worked for me for my budget. Sure, it could use some upgrades, but it is not the worst place I stayed at. Beware of timeshares, unless you want that. Service can be slow, but their was a lot of people, since it was school break time. I do think the food was over priced, but I sucked it up and ate there, next time maybe not. Drinks were pricey, but didn't seem watered down. It is far away from San Juan, renting a car may be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, I can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: TJCBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: Our Family just returned from 8 Great days at the Rio Mar Beach resort. The Pools, The Hot Tubs, The Beach Chairs and Umbrellas. Everything was perfect. The kids pool has fun activies all day. The Tiki Hut provides all the drinks and food. There are also servers walking around the pool area. Bacon cheeseburger with Fries runs 12$ plus tax and tip. Beer is $7 and drinks start at $10. Rooms were niceand have Tile floors which were mopped by staff everyday. Very Humid which is too be expected being an island so the room smells a little. There was a lot of maintenance being performed daily. Cutting tree's down, painting, tileing. This is a large faculity and needs a ton of up keep. They do there best to stay out of everyone's way. The parking garage needs work ! We had a great time. A few downers. resort fee 14% daily. self parking is $16.05 daily. I wish the room fee was the room fee. Casino is not big. It is not staffed for large crowds. It was very busy while i was there and there were not enough dealers to have all the tables open. Many guests could not play black jack or roulette. This casino is just a service for its guests not a big one to make money. This resort is perfect for older couples and Familes not 18 -25 year olds looking to party.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back tomorrow if I could...”
Reviews.Author: marediker87
Reviews.Content: We were in a room with a rainforest view, and I found I preferred it OVER the ocean view. The rainforest is just beautiful! The bed was amazing. I did find it difficult to sleep some nights, though, because we were in the main hallway not far from the elevator. Drunk people turning in late at night have a universal volume, that being set to "obnoxious." Luckily, it got quiet quick. There was a separate pool & hot tub for adults (YAY!) but we were able to invade the kid's territory and use the water slide. Plenty of family-friendly activities ~ feeding iguanas, lawn games, water aerobics, dancing lessons. A (gas - no smoke! yay) fire pit at night and a "drive-in" movie projected poolside. There was an arcade, too, but I'm not sure it got much use, the pools and the beach were so wonderful! Fell in love with the sounds of the Coqui frog. We were able to purchase yards of adult beverages and got cheaper refills. We LOVED Palio. My sister has Celiac and the chef went over the entire menu with her, and there was very little she could NOT have. And what we did was AMAZING. We ate at Marbella one night, and local young people came in and danced in traditional costume. They put on a great, fun show! If you want a less expensive breakfast, there is a nice cafe outside the casino where you can get coffee, baked goods, cereal cups, yogurt, fruit... make a picnic breakfast for the beach! I also saw folks with kids walking around there with pizza boxes at snack/dinner times. Inexpensive way to appease finicky kids?? The waitstaff at the restaurants and the cafe were incredibly friendly and helpful. The bartenders at the poolside Tiki Bar were a little grumpy, but perhaps that was due to the screaming, foul-mouthed, drunk guest they had to deal with? We both had mahi mahi salad two days in a row! It was great! We took a Dragonfly excursion to the Bacardi Distillery & Old San Juan that was great! Having a designated driver ~ excellent idea!!! Another day we rented a car and climbed to the top of El Yunque, and the Mt Britton Tower, and hiked to La Mina Falls. One of the most enjoyable hikes I've ever done! Barely able to walk after, we drove to the kiosks in Lonquillo to see the local beach hangout. Don't miss Tapas 13. WONDERFUL. Wish I could have spent a day at that beach, too! Beautiful! The hotel grounds were beautiful. Well groomed and landscaped. We didn't pay for the cabanas. Next time? They have little radios with call buttons when you want service, but servers from the Tiki bar come to check in on folks around the pool anyway from time to time. There were 4 small tents to buy jewelry from local crafters. Not overwhelming, very nice. Also, there was an airbrush tattoo place that looked fun. Areas for improvement: When we arrived, our room was not ready. We weren't given tickets or even asked to identify our luggage. When rooms became available, our suitcases were sent to the room of the men with whom we happened to arrive, aboard the airport shuttle. That was fine. There are never valuables in my luggage. He noticed quickly and had the bell hops retrieve them. Also, they offered us really nice suite if we didn't want to wait for a regular room. It only had a sofa bed, though, and I'm "too old for that." We were patient and got the room with the awesome beds and the gorgeous mountain view. Everyone was easy-going, and we were on vacation. It all worked out, and we were poolside enjoying the mahi mahi and mojitos, so it didn't FEEL like we were waiting. The tub drained well on the first day. After that, it didn't do so well but that was likely because we showered not realizing how much sand we had dragged in. I think I had a pound of sand in my hair from playing in the ocean waves. Our room was skipped by housekeeping one day, but because we're rather neat, that wasn't an issue ~ we called for and they quickly brought us more packets of coffee for our "wake up" cups.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: TimA990
Reviews.Content: The customer service is one of the worst I've experienced. I am a long time, well traveled person (been to 6 of the 7 continents) and I can't remember a resort with such poor quality. Ask a question and get ignored. Wait for workers to finish cell calls before assistance. Rooms are not well kept and we haven't been able to get it cleaned without having to call several times. In addition, the entire staff has been instructed to push their timeshare program. You can't get a drink without someone trying to sell you the idea. When you say no, they get angry. I think they're on commission. I am more stressed than when I arrived. Traveling the world you expect things to be very different than what you're used this. However, this place takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: FFFins
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough property with plenty to do (casinos, kids club, golf, etc). The rooms are a bit rough around the edges but the common areas are excellent. They have an adult pool and a kids pool that are both very nice. The beach itself is only ok and the water is typical of what you find in Florida rather than the Caribbean (which makes sense since the resort is on the Atlantic side). Everyone we dealt with was very nice and very helpful. The restaurants were very good. Renting a car might be a good idea but the hotel offers lots of excursions too.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great & relaxing trip!!”
Reviews.Author: LBBTM
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with my boyfriend for a week away to relax and enjoy some down time. We did just that...Yes, the resort is high priced (for lunch and tiki bar drinks), but it was a perfect location. Off the beat and path and close to some delicious restaurants that the locals enjoy as well. I enjoyed the Historic Old San Juan excursion as it was only $60 and included transportation, a great walking tour, and time to shop and walk around a lot. After dinner, the casino was a fun atmosphere, too. I would definitely go back to Rio Grande and to the Rio Mar... we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel...rent a car”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: After our recent stay at the Rio Mar Resort, I would somewhat agree with the reviews posted. The hotel rooms are not the most up to date and the bathrooms do need some work. With that being said, why would you go to PR and spend all that time in your room? The room itself and the bathroom are clean enough and serve the purpose of sleep and showering. The amenities are better than average; the spa is really nice, the golf course is nice and the restaurants seem nice. I say they seem nice because we only ever ate at the Tiki Bar located between the beach and the pool. We rented a car to save on the $150 round trip shuttle to and from the airport. The car rental and self parking amounted to the same as the shuttle and we had much more freedom. If you come out of the resort and go straight, you're 5 minutes from the rainforest, which costs $80 a person if you take the tour from the resort. Come out of the resort and take a left, you're 5 minutes from Luquillo Beach and more than 60 restaurants, which were incredible (at least the 5 we ate at). The food at the resort seemed overpriced (after all, it is a resort, it's expected). For what our lunch cost one day at the Tiki bar, we got an appetizer, two meals and drinks for dinner at the Kiosks at Luquillo. They're called kiosks, but they are all sit-down, open air restaurants. There is a grocery store 10 minutes from the hotel on your way in from the airport. Stop there, grab some breakfast stuff and save yourself the $26 charge per person, per day for the breakfast buffet. Overall, you can't beat the location; close to the rainforest and restaurants. The beach is a 2 minute walk from your room and there are a few different pools to relax by. I would definately stay here again, if just for the convenience to everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Will think twice, before coming back”
Reviews.Author: Frank G
Reviews.Content: First arrived late from California approximately 12am Puerto Rico time. Check in was prompt. The hallways/Carpet leading to our room was filthy.Stayed like that for two days. Are room was alright nothing you wouldn't get at a normal hotel. Bathroom door wouldn't even close. Last note the workers weren't that friendly. The bakery near the casino, employee was very rude and to top it off just threw the receipt on the counter and didn't even say thank you. UGH!! Never went back to that bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Not great experience for price”
Reviews.Author: lilizmom
Reviews.Content: I was not impresses by this resort. There are some great things - our view, the pool and the impeccable grounds. After checking in, we noticed the carpet leading up to our hotel rrom was very dirty. We thought it would be cleaned up the next day but it wasnt We had to ask them to vacuum up the sand that stayed there for two days Our hotel room floor was dirty and the balcony above or terrace is deteriorating badly. The hotel rooms need to be upgraded. We attended a few dinners/receptions here for work and the service was bad. Towel service gals at the pool were snooty until they wanted to ask you to attend their timeshare event.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful exotic place but service is lacking.”
Reviews.Author: pkripper1
Reviews.Content: My husband and young son were there for five days. We travel at least two times a year and really are very open and accepting. This is the first place that I have ever felt discriminated or ignored. I would say if you have the patience of a saint, and don't like to have a really good meal you will love it here. The room was nice except one bed was lumpy and kind of uncomfortable. I had to request face cloths daily. The most problem was getting service at the Tiki bar as they would ask me my order and the proceed to help everyone around me and ignore my order. We are not cheap people and tip well and had a tab but when I, not my husband was ordering I was ignored. The restaurants were another story. Very slow and they did not have the best food. The sushi restaurant had decent food and we ate there three times but the last time was horrible. The waitress forgot the sushi and brought everything out at once after waiting for a very long time stil no sushi. On the flip side if you have kids it was a really great time and our son made friends and had a great time . Make use of the cafe next to the casino, and rent a car, go to the closest sore and stock up, you'll be fine. Take a Dramamine if going on any island snorkeling trips! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster and Subpar”
Reviews.Author: Carla H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip to Puerto Rico where we stayed at the Wyndham. When we arrived at 3:30pm on Friday, they could not check us in until 6pm. This happened to many people, so beware if you book here that you could be waiting around for your room. Also beware that it's very loud if you are placed near the elevators or entrances into the lobbies. The elevators make dinging noises not only when they stop at levels, but when people are going in and out of them, which is highly annoying throughout the night. With the "casino" there, people are up late into the evening/morning. The rooms themselves were "ok", nothing special. We were in a room next to the lobby the first night and asked to be moved the second night since we were not able to sleep due to the noise. There are 2 basic pools.. one for the kids/family, and an "adult" pool. You have to be up early to snag any of the chairs near the pools, especially the adult one. People will place their towel on chairs near the pool and never surface again for hours, thus blocking the chairs from others. If you have a family and little kids, the kids pool area seemed good.
