There's a slide, volleyball net, music, etc in that area. The adult pool side is nice, but the chair area is too small. Most people end up on the beach, which was ok. The water was the color of beaches on the East coast in the US. The kids around us were having a good time though. You are pretty much captive to eating on-site if you don't rent a car. The restaurants are not great, but the breakfast buffet was quite good ($24 per person). Drinks at the pool started around $10.50. Completely disappointed in Shimas, the Asian fusion restaurant on-site. We ended up grabbing some sandwiches at a small counter near the "casino" some of the time, which were around $10 each, just to give you an idea. If you are looking for a big casino, the Wyndham doesn't have it. It advertises a "casino", but there were only a few blackjack tables running and a few rows of slot machines. If you are going for gambling, this is not the place for you. It seemed like the majority of the patrons were there to play golf, so if that's what you want, then this would be a good resort for you. The tennis area was pretty run down. I'm not sure if it was due to the time when we were there, but most of the patrons were families. We were hoping for a honeymoon type setting, but instead had kids running around and families to contend with everywhere. It was not a place to just relax and not run into anyone. We had an absolutely horrible experience with Dragonfly Tours, which has a tourdesk at the Wyndham. Be sure to triple check your reservations because they were the most idiotic and inept tour company I have used in my life. You most likely will want to go on the bioluminescence kayak tour, which we did... but just be warned that it's really not a lot of kayaking, and the kayak tour company Dragonfly uses is unprofessional and subpar. You would do much better going with another company. We also went on their 'Bacardi Tour and Old San Juan Tour", which picked us up at 8:30am and included so many stops to pick up other guests at other hotels, that we literally spent 1.5 hours at the Bacardi tour and 2.5 hours in Old San Juan, returning at 4pm... so the rest of the time was spent traveling and picking up people. We expected to see the inside of the Bacardi distillery... like how things work, etc... instead, you see a 10 minute video commercial for Bacardi, are given 2 drinks, and sent to the gift shop. I didn't learn too much on the tour, but you can buy some Bacardi wear at the store if you are in to that. Unfortunately for us, the day we went to Old San Juan was a Sunday and some meeting/protest was occuring, so many of the restaurants and shops were closed, and it was raining. So, not much to report there, although we did go to the fort which is a National Park. That was the only "historic" part of the tour that we were able to fit in in the 2.5 hours we were given to shop, eat, and look around. All in all, we were highly disappointed in the hotel and tours.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: jamey_mj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were just at Rio Mar for a business trip and we really enjoyed our stay. We had an ocean suite which was quite large with a great view of the pools and ocean through the palms. You can tell it's an older hotel but we had a flat screen TV and a very comfy King bed. Sometimes the water was not as hot as others and the water pressure in the shower fluctuated. We didn't spend any time at the pool ( I can go to a pool anywhere, I am a beach girl!). I loved the beach. There was really no seaweed to worry about. The sand was soft and there were plenty of chairs and umbrellas. The guys on the beach would set up your chairs and umbrella wherever you wanted them and they were so nice. We found several sand dollars walking the beach and you can walk the beach for miles which is nice! We never encountered a rude employee during our 3 night stay. We ate during company functions and the food was fabulous. Otherwise, we had a few wraps from the snack place by the casino and they were good. Oh we also had lunch at the restaurant near the beach. My husband didn't care for what he ordered (wings and quesadilla) I ordered pork chops and beans and rice and I thought they were good. I did notice the food was on the expensive side but there are local places close by to eat, which if we were to return, we would do that. We had a great time and would definitely return! Met some nice people and we enjoyed the casino nightly. By the way, the casino is small but everyone working there was so nice. My husband and I play blackjack and were able to find a seat each night we were there. It's a beautiful place and the weather was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific resort, cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ualnavy
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night anniversary getaway. Ms. Zandra Segarra, one of the hotel directors, gave us an upgraded ocean view suite on the 6th floor along with a delicious welcome cheese and fruit plate and bottle of wine. We had a refrigerator delivered to the room which was well worth the $10/day fee. The bed, AC, and overall room condition were excellent. We ate at two of the restaurants where we found the food and service great. Pricing was typical for a resort and you could order a la carte to avoid the buffet price. We enjoyed the adults only pool and the beach was very nice. The hotel grounds were beautiful and nightly strolls through the property were romantic. Rent a car....you will pay roughly 20-25 bucks a day but the freedom and adventure it provides are worth it. Pay the $20 a day for valet....it is 15-16 to self park! Call them 10 minutes before you leave and your car will be right out front. Visit the cafe kiosks just 10 minutes drive east of the hotel....great little places with terrific local and mainland style foods along with tasty ginger mojitos. We took the snorkeling catamaran day trip which we loved. The resort has a beautiful golf course that we did not use. There are also a dozen tennis courts that always seemed available. They are $25/hour. We found the staff and service exceptional. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham did not deliver”
Reviews.Author: RafySoto
Reviews.Content: Got the place using Priceline, bad decision. Upon arrival I was provided with the worst room in the place. My "Garden View" room was nothing but a balcony (missing one chair) overlooking the 3rd level roof. The garden was full of trash debris, anything from beer containers to McDonalds wrappers to construction repair debris. It was disgusting. The carpet in the hallway had a moldy smell and flushing the toilet next door could be heard inside our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: cbe0824
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a nice resort. Rooms are average but on a nice beach. The staff is friendly. Has a casino with tight slots. Seems very family oriented. Nice gift shop. Would go back for a business trip but not for a vacation

Reviews.Title: “Why can't we use the hotel stuff? otherwise awesome(:”
Reviews.Author: Teegan R
Reviews.Content: My trip to PR with my friends was unforgettable. We stayed in a golf villa, my friend is renting one, and it was amazing. My only problem was that the hotel did not let you use their amenities. We couldn't use their pool, work out room, or anything else. We had our own pool back in the Villas, and we were alone, but it did not have a hot tub. My adventures at the Wyndam Rio Mar was amazing, and I can't wait to go back! Have fun in PR! P.S. be sure to visit El Yunque National Rainforest. The waterfalls are amazing and the hike is really fun! there is a movie in the begining to show the history of the rainforest. OSJ is awesome to, be sure to visit El Morro(:

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but don't forget, you're in the Caribbean...”
Reviews.Author: Purduegolf1
Reviews.Content: Just visited the Wyndham Rio Mar this past weekend for a total of 5 nights with 8 people and 5 rooms. Check in was late at night (around midnight) and there wasn't a sole person around the check in desk, so i had to knock on the door behind. Check in was fast and all the rooms were on the same floor (4th). Self parking is a LONG way from the rooms, so i would advise to unload all bags at the front entrance. The rooms were all very nice. My room was supposed to be an oceanview, but all i really had a view of was a big palm tree in front of my balcony. The other rooms in our group were nice with nice views. The beds were comfy, the floors clean. TV worked just fine. Air Conditioning was good as well. The bathroom...well, the shower and tub needed a little TLC. And eventhough i hung my towel everyday so as not to be replenished, the maid still replenished it. Oh well...i tried... The hotel itself is very beautiful. Nice grounds. Clean and well manicured. The pool area which we visited each afternoon was nice. The first pool seemed to be the quiet adult pool. The second pool was more lively with volleyball games occassionally. The pool tiki bar service was SLOW...but much of the service our trip was SLOW...so no big surprise. Drinks were pricey...$11 for a frozen drink and $7.50 for a bottle of beer...but resort prices i suppose. The pool area had plenty of chairs and towels available...but we weren't trying to find a spot first thing in the AM.. The concierge was helpful..gave me a map to the El Yunque rainforest about 10 minutes away (which i highly recommend!). We ate at 3 restaurants in the Rio Mar while there. Breakfast at Malangas our first morning...NEVER again as it was $24 per person...and not worth it!! Dinner at Palio (Italian) which i found fantastic and not super expensive. Shimas for dinner was also good, service SLOW, but good food. Again, didn't think the prices were bad. We also grabbed desert a couple nights at the little bakery/dessert bar. Sometimes had a muffin, sometimes a milkshake. Both were VERY yummy. I visited the casino 3 times and the first night i went (Saturday) it seemed like all tables (all 5 or so) were open and i didn't have a hard time getting a seat at BJ. Won a little that night too...the second night (Sunday), there were only 2 BJ tables open and i waited a good hour to get a seat...another guy was getting mad and asked to open another table but apparently there weren't any dealers available. Finally got a seat and managed to lose all the money i won the night before...probably should have left because i was annoyed in the first place for having to wait so long to sit down...my last night (Monday) there was only 1 BJ table open and i waited about 20 minutes, played for about an hour and lost money. Decided to pack it in. VERY SMALL casino...cruise ships are even bigger...but entertaining none the less. I got my BJ fill. Overall, the resort was nice. The self parking is a bit of a joke as the spaces are so tight and SO far away...and $16 a day. I would go back again since it truly had everything that i needed! Just remember, you are in the Caribbean and NO ONE is in a HURRY! So have patience!

Reviews.Title: “The resort is very nice, the restaurants are over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Offbway
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting in a valley that ends in their private beach.Very close to the Rain forrest El Yunque,, which you shouldn't miss.Great pools, rooms are very nice, the staff helpful. The price ok if can get an on line deal.My only complaint is that hey get you on the extras.Their restaraunts are very over-priced for their quality.There are some wonderful sea side shacks with great food just a couple of miles from their entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and so easy with kids!!”
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: We recently visited PR for the first time and stayed at the Rio Mar for 4 nights. We were traveling with our two young children and I have to say that the proximity of the rooms, pools and beach at the resort were so convenient. My older son LOVED the waterslide at the pool and probably went down it 100 times. The beach was just a few steps from the pool and there was staff there to help with chairs and umbrellas. If you are going with small kids, you can borrow sand toys from the Club Iguana everyday--you just have to sign them in and out. The ocean was warm and the waves were good for body surfing. We loved the Tiki Hut for drinks and lunch by the beach. As far as other dining, we stuck mostly to the Tiki Hut, the ERL cafe where you could grab a sandwich, and room service. We had a car so we were able to go off property to eat dinner a few times, as well as go to the grocery store for some staples for the kids. We also used the car to visit El Yunque rain forest, which the kids loved--it's only a short drive from the resort. The staff at the resort was always friendly. Our rooms were cleaned in a timely manner, and any requests that we had were honored. They were nice enough to upgrade our suite upon arrival, so we stayed on the 4th floor ocean front, which had a fantastic view! The weather (in February) was in the low 80s and mostly sunny. Due to its proximity to the rain forest, there were a few morning and afternoon showers, but they were short-lived and sometimes followed by a beautiful rainbow. All in all, we enjoyed our time there and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, if you find a good online deal.”
Reviews.Author: gpotterw
Reviews.Content: Rooms a bit tired, needing renovation. But outdoor amenities very nice. Views were stunning. We found the food above average, and most servers were very friendly, though definitely operating on "Island Time". The spa was excellent, and offered some good promotional pricing on their specials. We recommend renting a car so you can visit some off site restaurants and activities. I personally prefer a more upscale room experience, but we got a very good deal through Cheap Carribean and would do it again. Ask for a high floor also for the best view. The front desk graciously gave us a view upgrade as this was our anniversary trip. Overall a good experience, just be prepared for an average room.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: tbarber10
Reviews.Content: Fell in love with Puerto Rico, but then again maybe it is anywhere you find soft warm sand and blue sparkling salty water. The weather was cozy and sunny with a few showers sprinkled in. The resort was luscious. Maybe we hit a slow time, the resort was not busy at all. Staff, each and everyone was professional and courtesy. Definitely a 10 for customer service. Not that we used the pool, we prefer the sand and ocean effect, but was impressed that they offered 2 pool areas, one for children and one adults only. Not a draw back, but need to mention, this resort is on the Atlantic. The was was not that Caribbean blue and the sand was not white Would agree with those that say it is "resorty" Other than an informative and entertaining trip into Old San Juan, you did not know you were in Puerto Rico. But as this trip was scheduled for the sole purpose of relaxation, it it the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad!”
Reviews.Author: riios
Reviews.Content: This hotel is was not nice to stay at. The rooms were not comfortable and smelled bad, the crew that worked there didnt want to be there since they rather speak to each other than the guests and the pool area was crazy. I did not have a good stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf, Pool & Beach destination”
Reviews.Author: JJH1
Reviews.Content: Went for a couple of days of great golf and was not disappointed. It was easy to find the hotel shuttle service at the airport and they did a very good job for the $75 round trip. The one van was nearly full so they rolled out another for me and a couple so as to not make us wait. The hotel is about an hour ride from San Juan with light traffic. It has two really nice 18 hole golf courses adjacent to the hotel, the Ocean and River courses. The beach side pools provided a nice place to relax in the afternoon, I didn't use the beach so canâ€™t comment on the quality of the sand and water, it looked very pretty. My daily routine was morning run around the property, golf, flop at the adult pool and read then a light dinner and drinks at the lobby lounge. Everyone was friendly and had no trouble making conversation even though I was alone. It being school season in the US there were not many children and no teens, so it was fairly sedate around the hotel. It was either young couples with no children or just infants & toddlers, or mature singles and couples with grown children, The hotel was only about half full so it seemed that most of the restaurants in the hotel were on limited schedules or not open at all at night. No dancing or music, (except Friday night they had a show, but I was not there on a Friday). I didn't really focus on the activities in the area and did not have a car. The hotel room was clean but it is not a brand new hotel and the rooms and bathrooms were starting to show some wear. I had a corner mini-suite with a great view of the ocean and a nice outside balcony. The bed was very comfortable. The two chairs and a table on the balcony were very basic and the balcony was very bare, no plants or flowers, but the view of the ocean was spectacular. The lobby bar and the small casino were about it for night life. My goal was to just go and relax for a couple of days so a daily routine of going for a morning run around the property (the beach sand even at low tide is much too soft to run on, so that running option was out, but it would be a nice walk) , play golf and sat by the pool, I did not rent a cabana, always got a nice spot a chair poolside but I could see that at full capacity it would be more difficult to procure a spot. The poolside drinks run about $10.00. All in all it was a quiet and relaxing experience with no problems experienced. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We're not "resort" people, but this was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: jlle
Reviews.Content: We usually avoid these kinds of remote golf-tennis resorts like the plague. I was a little dismayed that we'd checked ourselves into this place that was pretty far from San Juan. And the check-in wasn't great. There was quibbling about "ocean view" vs "ocean front." We had "ocean view" which meant there was a slim view of the water, and a larger view of some other rooms. All rooms have balconies, but with "ocean front" you are pretty much looking at other people's balconies. We changed rooms twice. In the first room there was a bad odor of cigarettes (although it is a non-smoking hotel) and we found cigarette butts on the balcony. The 2nd room was a junior suite that was huge and the bedroom had no window, just doors to the living room. The third room was very nice. A warning for people with small kids: my husband set the inner lock to "privacy" when he was in the shower, because he thought it activated the "do not disturb" button for the maid. In fact, it meant that I could not get in with my key! the cleaning staff helped me pound on the door until he heard us. I told the concierge that it was very dangerous for people with kids and he agreed. The valet parking service was very good. The hotel is so close you can see El Yunque, the rain forest, and I recommend getting the breakfast included, because it is very good. One oddity: they were reluctant to seat us outside since it meant that they could not manage whose breakfast was included and whose was extra. It was disappointing to eat indoors in air conditioning when it was a beautiful 80-degree day in January.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip!...Also pricey”
Reviews.Author: Kikiz868
Reviews.Content: My overall experience of Puerto Rico was amazing! Even the resort was beautiful and I loved the friendly service, but when it came to dining at the Japanese restaurant I ended up paying around $87 for three plates, two miso soups, plus drinks and tip. Another expense is taking a taxi; those were the most expensive so I would advise you to rent a car instead. Oh plus, there are hardly any stores or restaurants around the resort so the best way to get around is by car. The best car rental is The World Car Rental in Fajardo and the prices are decent, better than the prices at the rental place in the resort. Oh yeah, remember, if you drive at night, from 12:00am-5:00am you do not have to stop at red lights, you can treat it as a Stop sign. Make sure to book your tours at the resort with Butterfly Tours. They are the best! There is a casino so if you are 18 yrs. old make sure to bring your ID! I played the 25 cent slots and I won $430! I had remembered that I loved this flowered print dress at one of the boutique stores in the resort and went to purchase it with my winnings. =) Plus, the resort has fun activities for all ages during the day like bingo, feeding iguanas, volleyball, jogging, and much more. Also, make sure to enjoy a fresh cold coconut by the beach or the pool when you stay at the resort because it sure relaxed me! =D

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property ...Rooms in need of major renovations”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl35
Reviews.Content: rooms dont match up to the beautiful property they have a sorta run down vegas hotel feel dated furniture no frills at all not happy with this resort would NEVER go back unless it was about $100 a night everything is expensive. hallways were full of room service leftover trays if you must stay here get an ocean view it will soften the blow of the room

Reviews.Title: “Nice - and pricey”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: Our whole extended family stayed here for a week and overall, it was wonderful. It was, however, very pricey, so be prepared. The rooms were nice, but a little on the small side. The food was outstanding, as was the service. The pools and beach were excellent, and it was nice to have an adults-only pool and hot tub for those times we wanted a break! The concierge desk can arrange transportation from the airport to the resort, but it's very expensive. I suggest using a reputable cab service, instead. They can also arrange tours and activities. We chose to go horseback riding and it was very nice. We've ridden all over the country and the stable near the resort was quite good, but again, a little pricier than most, but not terribly so. Overall, a very nice resort, but I would say a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyTom
Reviews.Content: Nice resort. Clean. Friendly staff. Something for all my family. Daughter home from Med school just wanted to relax on the beach. Twin sons wanted to work out and party all night. Wife and I just happy to have everyone together. Rain forest nearby. Ate away from the resort most nights. Food good and reasonable off resort. Pricey on resort. Concierge very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: atrin
Reviews.Content: Great grounds, nice pool; adult pool. The best food was at the pool ! The italian restaurant, Palio, wasn't worth the money at all. slow, lower then average service and salty food! food at the bar was good also... Rooms are nice, good sized. Beach is awesome, water can get rough but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: heather b
Reviews.Content: Outstanding customer service, and beautiful room overlooking ElYunque National Park. (I actually think it was better than the ocean view!!) But be aware....on top of the charges, you will pay for parking...$15 to self park, and $20 for valet per day. And if you enjoy cocktails on your vacation, the outdoor tiki bar does not take cash, you can only charge it to your room or put it on a credit card. Two margaritas's can be yours for only $23!!! :-) And be wary of the BEST KEPT SECRET in Puerto Rico as they say. It's a time share. But other than that, the rooms were exceptionally clean, and the service was great. Good place with activities for families. They have an iguana habitat and incredible views from the front and the rear of the hotel. Outstanding landscaping. Would return (if we didn't have a vehicle to park...haha)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place a little far from port or cruise people”
Reviews.Author: mmemichele
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place in a nice location but not practical for cruise pax . We booked "blind" on Hotwire so did not know how far we were from everything . There was a shuttle available for a fee Calling the hotel directly we arrange pick up at the airport and were able to get an ocean view room VERY NICE Room was a good size .Quiet place where you could hear the surf at night ...very nice . Not too many restaurants as it is far from SJU People here were very nice We attended a VERY long BLA BLA about buying a time -share not called a time share It was hard to get the guy to break it down to $$$ and Cents WE stayed for over an hour in order to get our 75$ gift ...a big waste of time avoid it Nice place but for long stay not overnight All in all nice spot Food is not cheap here c. Next day cab ride to poprt 75$ again so like I said not ideal for cruise pax

Reviews.Title: “nice time”
Reviews.Author: johannavermont
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is located on a remote beach of PR east of San Juan. A car at this location would be very helpful althought we used Adames Luxury Transportation Service at a great rate and they were available at all times. The rooms were clean and large and each has a balcony . Our ac was good , there were a couple of times that the water wasn't very hot or powerful . The food was over priced and pretty bland. We ate at the bar several evenings and tried the plantain lasagna and it was delicious . We stopped at a grocery store to buy our own wine and snacks . There were no frigs to rent but a styrofoam cooler worked great as the ice machine was close by. The beach has brown sand and the beach chairs were the WORST I've ever had to use. There was a stack of white and green striped chairs that looked more comfortable but the young guy said he would be fired if he let us have one !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Mvislandrr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Rio Mar Resort for 3 days & The Ocean Villas right next door for 4 days in January 2012. I was in Rio Grande for my son's wedding. The resort accommodations & amenities were wonderful. I relaxed by the pool everyday, the weather was sunny & warm everyday. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise on the northwest PR coast....beware the fees.”
Reviews.Author: bbhouston
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days/nights here for conference and was very impressed. They have a huge convention facility that is very nice and, I assume, they must do alot of meetings. The property, hotel, pools, beach and restaurants are all excellent. Only drawback is the remoteness of the location. Unless you have a car, which would be an expensive hassle, you are stuck on the property. Fortunately, there are several great places to eat and a nice casino. Got meeting rate on a room, but they told us they add a resort fee to those rooms that brings the rate back up. Also, they add a few dollars per day + tax for the person who cleans the room AND same for bellman if you use them ($5 per bag + tax). If they had TOLD us about them, I wouldn't have left tips for all those services if I had known. Sneaky.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: NDvacationer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Years Eve / New Year Holiday. I have to say it was just average, nothing jumps out that makes it over the top or under the rug for us. We had an average room, it could have used some upgrades. The bed was comfory, the patio was small. The beach was nice, not over the top. The food was fine, but pricey, just like everyone else reports. It was however a long way from the cruise ship port, which was the reason we were there in the first place, but we had prebooked transfers to the ship, so not a big deal. I would stay in PR again, not sure if I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Fun at Tikki Bar & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Jungle_and_Brendasue
Reviews.Content: My wife and i went down from Dulles for a 4 day winter break. The 3-1/2 hour flight was reasonable. The taxi from the airport was about $70 each way which for the two of us was a little less than paying for the shuttle. We arrived at 2:00 and check in was at 4:00. We anticipated a wait but we were getting nervous when the room wasn't ready at 5:30. We were in by 6:00. It wasn't really a problem since there were plenty of things to do. We ate dinner, strolled on the beach, drank a few drinks at the tikki bar and toured the casino. We had a very nice room with one of the best views from the 7th floor. Our queen bed was very comfortable. The tile floors were not expected but I guess I just forgot that we were in the tropics. Several things in the room didn't work like the remote control, the bathroom scale, the outlet by the sink, and the safe was locked already. They were all minor issues. We didn't leave the resort except for one evening when we went out to eat. The food at the resort is just OK and it is a little pricey. For us, the real fun is on the beach, at the tikki bar, and in the casino. The ocean was nice and clean. The booze was flowing at the bar with great bar tenders, and we actually won a couple hundred dollars at the casino. Overall, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: kraemerskeeper
Reviews.Content: The resort grounds were beautiful. Plenty of pools, right on a gorgeous beach front, great foods at the restaurants. Be aware; rooms are hotel rooms, not timeshare suites. (Unless you pay the large difference). Additional cost for fridge ($10), internet in your room ($10), daily parking ($15-20), breakfast ($25). Every room has a small varanda, toiletries replaced daily. Restaurants at the hotel are at the highest cost bracket for the island, travel a short distance for great food at a lesser cost. If you rent a car, fill your own tank, you'll save money, and the gas station will be right around the corner no matter where you are. Roads are narrow and they travel fast. There are toll and non toll roads. The lights on the non toll roads will AT LEAST double your driving time, so endure the toll roads when able.

Reviews.Title: “better then expected”
Reviews.Author: WJBonds
Reviews.Content: This was to be a "budget" vacation. I was able to book an ocean view room for about $200 per night, so I was happy. We checked in to find that our room had twin beds instead of the king bed that we had requested. A call to the desk had us switched to an "ocean view suite". Located on the second floor it did not have much of a view but we were pleased with the "upgrade". The grounds are beautiful with every resort activity you could hope for. Yes, the bathrooms need updating and the hotel could use some sprucing up, but for 1/3 the price of the Ritz... Food and service are the weak spots of the hotel. Everyone is on island time. It took me 7 (over 3 days) requests to get the phone in our room repaired. There are 3 restaurants in the hotel and another at the golf club. All are adequate but none reached the level of good. The pool bar served the worst hamburger that I have ever been served - truly awful. So, what's the bottom line? A nice family resort with great physical beauty and great facilities at a great price. If you can overlook the weaknesses this can be a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AYLHOME
Reviews.Content: Disappointed from check-in on. We were promised an ocean view, jungle view or poolside view and got a parking lot view. We signed up for a tour with Dragonfly and though we reserved the tour before we arrived, they never callled us and told us the tour was full when we checked on it. Internet service was spotty. Service at all the restaurants was very slow and we received the wrong food and drinks several times. They did not bring us clean towels for 2 days in a row. Hallways were not very clean. Conference facilities were good and the beach was very nice. Would not choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wynham Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: Adrianne F
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week here after a conference. Took our kids, 11 & 14 also. Found all the staff to be very friendly. The rooms were comfortable. We rented a fridge to keep drinks and snacks in. The property was beautiful. The pool is pretty cool, but the ocean water is perfect! The food is very expensive so we rarely ate on the property. The lunch by the pool was reasonably priced and pretty good. Would definitely recommend a car so you can drive around other places. Recommend the food kiosks to the east on Rte 3. Take a left at bottom of hill, go down 2 lights and there are many food kiosks on your left. Ate at La Parailla (excellent) and the NY Deli, also good. There's also Antojito's which is just at the bottom of the hill from the resort with good Puerto Rican food. you can rent surf boards, boogie boards, jet skis right on the beach. The bech is wide and long, pure sand and the water is great for playing in the surf. Get a car if you want to go places otherwise tours through the hotel would be outrageously expensive. we went surfing in Luquillo with Bob, drove El Yunque and horseback riding in Hacienda Caribali all of which are very close to hotel. We loved Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation -bad dinner choice”
Reviews.Author: Ana1967
Reviews.Content: Make a good deal for $ 150.00 the night for those who reside on the island.; the room was spacious and nicely decorated without being glamorous. The overall service was excellent. The morning buffet a little expensive but top quality. The only thing I did not like was the restaurant at dinner time very expensive and of poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsTS826
Reviews.Content: My family is from PR and therefore I go almost yearly and have been to many parts of the island and hotels. I do not recommend this "resort." The Cons: They charge you for self parking and an extra resort fee daily making it too expensive for what you are getting (almost 50 dollars a day combined!). They need extra security since the pool was so filled with locals, a paying customer like me could not get even one chair by the pool (and there was 3 of us). Pool was so overcrowded, we couldn't even swim and my daughter had to wait 30 minutes each time she wanted to use the slide. I have never been to such a crowded pool in my life. Beach is just ok, there are much calmer and nicer beaches in PR. This hotel is boring at night! Please get some entertainment and/or make a nightclub! Drinks and food are very expensive but both tasted very good. Tried to get info at desk and had to wait forever although there was one person ahead of us and didnt get the info we needed. We had a basket sent to us of wine, fruit, and cheese and instead of delivering it cold to us while we were there, they left it in our room (which in itself is uncomfortabe that staff is entering our room without our knowledge when I have a do not disturb sign on my door) and left it there to spoil since we got back so late. Needless to say, I will never stay there again. Pros: Entrance to road to the Rainforest literally across the street. Close to Luquillo which is known for its food kiosks. Rooms were small but nice. Service and staff was good. Definitely not enough pros to ever make me go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Lots To Offer”
Reviews.Author: cpapgpr
Reviews.Content: Spent Thanksgiving week there with my wife. The hotel is beautiful, service is very friendly and efficient. Pool was nice and clean. Restaurants were good, especially the main Marbella room, real nice tall grand old dinning room and food was impressive. We both got a massage, massager was very skillful but receptionist was a bit snot. Valet parking was convienent. A nearby restaurant has a view that is breath taking if you are not so demanding on the food part.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar: Nice for families, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: katec
Reviews.Content: Hello, my family and I just returned from a 5 day stay in a mountain-view room at the Rio Mar. At first, I was disappointed, as our room opened above a lagoon and looked out over the main drive to the front of the hotel and I was worried it would be loud. Road noise did not bother us at all, and the lagoon was home to 5 or more iguanas and numerous turtles that we all enjoyed. After seeing several reviews on here that mentioned possible bed bugs, we did a thorough inspection of our room. We had no issues, and our matresses and box springs looked quite new. I found the grounds and landscaping absolutely beautiful. I am actually stunned that I saw reviews that said the grounds were "tired." The beach area was well-kept with comfortable chairs. The activity "kids" pool had the same chairs; those in the adults-only pool had blue cushions on them. The sand is darker than many other areas of the Caribbean, but the beach is wide and long. I love a long walk on the beach, and this was one of the highlights of this trip for me. We didn't eat at the restaurants on the property, except for the breakfast buffet at Marisol, as it was included in our package. We still were charged ~$30 for taxes and gratuity, as well as for one child for each breakfast. I found that a little ridiculous; if the adults breakfast is part of the package, then I expected to not pay extra for my children. The buffet was quite good, with fresh fruits, made-to-order omelets and waffles, and an array of standards. We had nice meals out in Luqiuillo which were much more reasonable. Also, the self pay parking is now $15 a day plus taxes, which has gone up from the $10 a day I saw posted here. We loved El Yunque, and I definitely recommend everyone spend some time there, as it is only 10-15 minutes away and a once-in-a-lifetime experience. All of the staff we interacted with were helpful and friendly. It made a good stay even better. One small word of caution: all of the interior of the hotel is kept very cold. We often had on sweaters and sweatshirts as we walked through.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Rates, Great Service, Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: FourDayTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Rio Mar is a large resort located on the beach about 30 minutes from San Juan. We found each and every staff member to be genuinely friendly, helpful and courteous, from the moment we arrived until the moment we departed. The resort features beautiful grounds, two pools including an adults only pool, and is located on an expansive stretch of beach. It's also connected to the larger Rio Mar resort featuring tennis courts, a beautiful golf course, and time share condos, and about 15 minutes from the glorious El Yunque National Forest. There is a spa on site, multiple dining options, and a decent fitness facility. You also have access to excursions through a destination management company on site. Be sure to join Wyndham's rewards program--you will automatically have free internet, late check out and a few other perks at no cost. What you'll love: This is a great resort for families-plenty of activities for kids. Many dining options with decent quality food Friendly, courteous service Reasonably sized casino Beautiful grounds Great beach Clean, well maintained building with spacious rooms What you'll wish were different: Food prices will seem unreasonable, but you are at a beach resort on an island in the middle of the ocean The wristbands you get when you get towels from the pool The lounge chairs on the beach are uncomfortable (but the ones by the adult pool are great) The walls are really, really thin...so you will hear everything that goes on around your room including flushing toilets, showers, loud televisions, slamming doors (by your neighbors and hotel staff including maid service and bellmen), and of course your neighbors having sex.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for a family”
Reviews.Author: Mindyman1
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous after reading many posts made by ppl claiming this hotel was not good but guess what folks... It is nice! I followed some tips made by previous guests like sign up for the rewards program, request the 7th floor, ask for extra towels, go to the grocery store... The one thing that's not up to par is the water pressure in the shower, the toilet has more flushing power lol. Ppl are very nice here, helpful, courteous and they smile. Best beach guy is Ferguson, he makes hats, bowls, fish all out of palms... Really talented! I'd come back with my family. :) oh! Beds are comfortable and don't let ppl scare you off by the previous posts!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jossie R
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this hotel to work on a Convention. We were treated very good. The rooms were spotless and the view from our balcony was breathtaking. The pool was very relaxing and nice too. I would love to go back for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service...”
Reviews.Author: Jenga1111
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the most terrible experiences I have had at any resort. To start with, the tv in my room didn't work and the safe was already liked upon arrival. There were dirty dishes and leftover food from room service in the halls that didn't get picked up from the time I arrived until I went to bed (this was a period of at least 6 hours). Â I am here for a conference and they did not give me my breakfast coupons until I asked for them the next day which means I had already missed breakfast the first morning. Â  I had booked 2 rms and asked for connecting rooms. They gave me adjacent rooms but the second room still is not ready for check-in and they say it may not be ready until 6 or 7pm. I will not return to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: After seeing everyone comments on here we expected this hotel/resort to be sub par and too costly! It was nice, easy to navigate and we enjoy it! The ocean views were incredible! The prices are costly but you expect that from resort food/restaurants! We will certainly go again and recommend this to everyone! Comfy bed, helpful staff, great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation spot. Great staff. Excellent Food!”
Reviews.Author: SeaHorseCrossing
Reviews.Content: We snuck a family vacation in over the holidays, and were incredibly surprised at this resort. Not only is the resort itself HUGE, with golf courses, tennis courts, etc. but two large tropical pools on the property, a water slide for the kids plus a playground and basketball court, and of course that beach! What a wonderful way to unwind on their "private" beach, which is over a mile long. The rooms were nicely decorated, but not overly done. They were LARGE, too...and our bath area was oversized...probably 40% the size of our room! The food choices and service were very very good, although a la carte prices were steep. They have a small casino which of course nabbed all our money (!!!), gift shops and everywhere a smile from the friendly staff. The concierge and excursion personnel were particularly helpful in us booking side trips, meals, shuttles, etc. Couldn't ask for better treatment from hotels costing much much more! We had a terrific vacation, and this is one of the places we'd love to return to again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice except for the food”
Reviews.Author: mikitruax
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit in Puerto Rico and we got a very cheap deal staying at this resort. Overall it was very good for the money. The hote staff were friendly and helpful, and the facilities were nice. A bit old but it was not a big deal. They also have time share there so they will try to sell you on that, but they're not pushy at all and if you're not interested you can just walk away and nobody will bother you again. Our only compliant was the food. The restaurants in the hotel sucked and they were way overpriced. We ended up renting a car for the remaining of our vacay and just drove out every time we had to eat. And we LOVE Puerto Rican food. They just don't have it at the resort. We were told it was because the government wanted tourists to visit restaurants outside of the resorts and that's why you can never find Puerto Rican food in resorts. The car rental was reasonably priced and so it was worth it to venture out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: zo p
Reviews.Content: It was a gorgeous place. The staff was amazing. It had an amazing private beach.

Reviews.Title: “Such comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: wombat1223
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a quick stop in Puerto Rico at Christmas time. While it was not really warm enough to take advantage of the swimming pools or the easy beach access, we did avail ourselves of the wonderful hot tub. There are several things I like about Rio Mar which is why I chose to come back with my family. There is an all adult pool which is very nice when you want to get away from the noise of music and kids. The beach is right near the pool so that you do not have to commute to get there (the way you do at some resorts in the area). The rooms are typical big hotel rooms. They are larger and better if you get resort view instead of the smaller ocean view rooms. Another thing I enjoy here is the iguanas which behave as if they own the resort. They wander the place, swimming as they like, climbing trees and sunning where they please. Very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: firebirdgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while looking for a location to have our wedding. Although we did not end up choosing this location for our wedding, it was a beautiful venue and our second choice. During our stay, the staff members were very nice. The grounds are huge and well kept and there is plenty of room to walk around, lay out, sit at the bar, enjoy the pool, or bask in the sun on the beach. The room we had was nice with a balcony that overlooked the ocean. This place is about a 45 minute drive from SJU airport. You pass by the outlet mall on your way here. My advise is to definitely pick up a rental car at the airport. This way you 1) don't have to pay for an expensive cab ride both ways, 2) can venture outside the resort for more local cuisine rather than paying the uber expensive prices at the 1-2 restaurants the resort has open, 3) can visit the rainforest which is not too far away, 4) don't have to pay the high car rental fees if you picked up a rental directly at the resort, and 5) travel into san juan as needed since there isn't any nightlife at the resort. Only thing we didn't like was the limited restaurant choices on the resort. Otherwise, we had an excellent and relaxing vacation. Overall, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Because I couldn't give them 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Crabjunkie
Reviews.Content: The staff, across the board, were so nice and polite I had to give them 4 stars. The facilities were closer to a 3 or 3.5, in the sense that you felt like you were in an all-inclusive. The restaurants were really not that great, the Italian was hyped but pretty basic. The Asian fusion was better, but really just the equivalent of a basic thai sushi restaurant on your block in your hometown. The prices were outrageous, but it's a resort. The beach was nice, beautiful terrain and topography, etc. I wouldn't go back, but I would recommend it to others for a few nights of R and R.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, not what I expected. Expected 4 or 5 star and it is not that. Laundry messed up clothes, rooms dirty, repeated calls for”
Reviews.Author: Rrmwork
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 4 or 5 star, this is NOT it! Had to change rooms due to leaky faucet, laundry ruined clothes, when u try to reach front desk you are always put on hold forever and there is nothing close by. Best experience was dinner in Italian restaurant and at the grille in country club. Poolside meals are not worth the money. I would not stay here again unless it was about 80.00 per night and I stopped at grocery on way to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even nicer than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Fred W
Reviews.Content: My kids and I just returned from a wonderful 4 night/5 day stay at Rio Mar. Thanks to previous TA reviewers we rented a car and what we saved in not taking the shuttle to the hotel paid for the rental. Also sign up for Wyndham By Request before you travel and let the hotel know that you are a member. That entitles you to free internet in your room (which we didnt use since the lobby has free WiFi) but more importantly a free refrigerator which will come in handy. Now that you have rented a car you can delight in some of the fantastic restaurants in Fajardo and Loquillo. Definitely try the Kiosks in Loquillo for a meal or two. The hotel staff was always courteous and friendly. The grounds are magnificent and the beach is very clean with soft sand. I would definitely visit Rio Mar again!

Reviews.Title: “Beach resort that leaves you wanting more”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: This resort was simply average. The grounds were beatiful, the pools were decent (open 24 hours) and the restaurants were overpriced. The resort would have received 4 stars if we didn't have so many problems. The phones in our room didn't work, we didn't have a remote for the TV, we were unable to connect to the Wi-Fi, the shower leaked, the place to rent beach supplies was never opened and the hot tubs were set at temperatures that were either too high or too cold to go in. The location was great for El Junque (which is a must to go to).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Was_It_Yesterday
Reviews.Content: We went to PR in November and stayed at this resort and LOved it. The view was extraordinary. We asked them to upgrade our room to a higher floor and we got a room on 7th floor with a balcony which had a beautiful Ocean View. Its all about the View. It was an off season so we got an amazing room. The rooms are big but it doesnt have carpet so flip flops inside the rooms are necessary. They have a good information desk which gives out good directions and tips. Also, Car is a must if you want to have good local food . Valet Park a Must. We bought a lot of things from grocery stores nearby like chips and beer. The resort is right on the beach and they have a big childrens pool as well as adult pool. Towels are ready and so are the chairs and umbrealla at the beach. Loved the stay. Will come back

Reviews.Title: “I've had better...of everything.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: Nothing made this property stand out. It was just over-priced and barely average. The Motel 8 I stayed at in Anchorage, Alaska has more to offer. We changed rooms 3 times at checkin the first night. (Our other family members changed 4 times each.) The 1st two rooms in East tower were DIRTY. The halls on the 4th floor weren't vac'd in ages. For the last room we were put in West tower, in Ocean Suite (at 9p). Was notably cleaner than other rooms but it still wasn't that clean and I had to rearrange the bedtables/bed to put it all back on the frame properly. First full day, I had a massage at the spa on property and ended up with severe bruises up and down my back, and legs. The bruises were deeper and darker on the side after I asked loudly for it to be lighter. The facial I had after the massage (same person) was amazing. The spa manager waived the cost of the massage and said the Spa Director would call us that day - its now been two weeks, no call. Because of the bruises, I couldn't sit/lounge by the pool very much the next two days. It took more than 10 days for the bruises to fade. During the first few days, our group actually tried to leave the property but we were told we would be penalized fiscally for that in addition to the added room costs for the new property = grin and bear it. The final two days of the trip improved when we figured out the following: The staff are beyond wonderful if you tip them generously at the first interaction. Think - like $25 for bringing you a drink at the pool. Do it. If you don't, it will easily be 1-1.5 hrs of a wait. Make all reservations as fast as you can at the Palio restaurant. It's the best/only decent restaurant there. The food made all of us so sick the first two days we spent the next two ordering PB&Js and/or eating small pizzas at the lobby bar. Also? Palio is the only place you can eat and hear one type of music while you eat instead of having two versions of muzak and a live singer with his keyboard. Book adventure tours before you arrive (the website said otherwise prior to our arrival and all things were booked when we got on site). Golf -- Don't bother. Particularly with the River Course. It isn't even maintained right now (rumor spread poolside that they were waiting on February renovations?). Its a round of golf the family wouldn't have paid $10 for and only added to the overall frustrations at the property. Since I spent so much time in the room icing the bruises on my back - a heads up on the TV - they are flat panel HDTVs but they are not appropriately set up with regards to aspect ratio and they are not HD. Try asking for a room with an air purifier. Ours had one, others in the family did not. The fridge another one of our family members was given had dented doors and wasn't cleaned out - they didn't use it. I ordered a grilled cheese one of these icing afternoons for room service and 2 hrs later I got a call they'd waive the cost of the sandwich and that it was on its way. ::eyeroll:: We went on our own for a day trip to San Juan and a day trip to El Yunque. The Casino HAS many black jack tables and two roulette tables but they will only ever open one -- including on New Years eve. It's also about the size of a small cruise ship casino. Oh? And we asked about the $120/pp banquet on NYE and the fireworks - we were told 12am-12:30. Fireworks went off continuously until 4:30AM along with shouts and cheers. Guests were allowed to do their own - so that felt really safe. Small thing: Not sure what the deal is with the coffee but it all comes from these push button machines and you never actually smell fresh coffee on the property. The trip to San Juan doubled as a "please-get-real-coffee" quest ;) Oh! And we've been home for a week now and it's the first day I'm not rubbing benedryl cream on my legs from the 30 minutes spent on the beach (with bug spray) one night doing a set of family pictures. Not everyone in the family was bit. Not sure the how/why on that! The marching band is only as great as its worst marcher = and that special marcher is this property. It just doesn't live up to the four-star rating they claim to have (was this given years ago? Is it on a ten-point scale?) and I am still shocked its a Wyndham property.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ElsaNY
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a typical mediocre beach resort. The rooms are in need of serious renovations. Dingy hallways, no wifi, poor shower water pressure and the shower went cold after less than 10 min. We stayed in a standard room, although they claimed we were upgraded. The view was of the dirty roof of entrance. I asked for other available rooms, and the other option was not any better. The restaurants are average and overpriced. The pool area and beach are nice, and that's probably why you are there anyway. It served the basic purposes for our stay, but I would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the thieves”
Reviews.Author: KarthickVish
Reviews.Content: Be careful with your belongings in this hotel, even inside any of their restaurants. There seems to be a gang of them working inside the hotel. I lost my iPhone from my dining table while eating dinner while i heard of another person losing his camera. These thieves know exactly where the cameras are and there is no way to catch them. So, beware! Now the good things. Don't eat anything in any of the restaurants unless you have prepaid breakfast. If not breakfast cost 25$!! Try don pepe down the road or drive 2miles to Guavas!! Really awesome and good food. Have a car, you will be able to enjoy this place better. The people working at kids club are great! Jose and Shelley are the best... But others leave a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: getupdosomething
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week from Dec 20-27, 2012 at the Rio Mar. They upgraded us from a mountain view to a beach view, albeit on the first floor at check-in. The days that this resort was a Westin with the Starwood decor and treatment are a distant past. While the hotel is on a rather large golf resort property right on the ocean there seems to be a lack of attention to detail. I will say the lobby was nice with its wide and very open spaces. There were quite a few annoyances though: 1. The property needs to be maintained-- the front of the hotel is not very attractive at all. 2. Drinks are very over priced except for the happy hour drink from 4-6 daily ( recommend having a car and driving to the grocery a couple miles away for alcohol and snack stock up) 3. When we checked in we decided to self park rather than valet. The self park garage is extremely dirty and very tight spaces. The elevator or escalator was broken and there were signs that told us to take the stairs. These signs were inadequate, and we as well as others, missed the right stairwell and ended up walking around the property, with bags in tow, finally having a guest opening up a side door. Needless to say, we valeted going forward. 4. You receive wash clothes and toiletries on check-in but you have to call and specifically ask for washcloths any other days because housekeeping doesn't have them. 5. The bathtub needs to be re-glazed, you can see spots of iron. There was also mold or dark grout in the shower that needs to be cleaned better or re-grouted. The water pressure in the shower was superior but the drains sucked--you always stood in at least 3-6 inches of water as you showered 6. The ceiling of the room had chunks of ceiling pealing off. 7. Several of the public bathrooms had absolutely no soap in any of the dispensers 8. There were missing canisters around light bulbs in one of the seating areas 9. They were very good at keeping the adult pool child free but did not maintain the pools or hot tub--there was always debris floating--at a resort at this price you would expect someone skimming the pool periodically throughout the day. 10. The restaurants were overpriced and lacked quality food, we did have a decent dinner on Christmas at what was known as the Grille before but I think is now called Estancia. The little cafe by the casino also had a good spinach wrap chicken sandwich for about $8. 11. None, I do say none of the casino slots paid. I played and watched others for a couple hours throughout the stay and I highly recommend staying out of this casino. 12. The soundproofing in the rooms is non existent. You could hear all conversations in the hallways and any sounds from your neighbors. One night we were woken at 11 pm because housekeeping was cleaning the room next door-slamming drawers, moving furniture etc. 13. There was very inconsistent towel policies and they always ran out of towels. At times they would give you a wristband, others they wouldn't, other days they didn't give them out but later came around and told you that you needed to get one. One of our neighbors at the pool went up and got a band for her and the other 3 people in her party and when I went up soon after they told me each person must come get their own. One time there was a family at the adult pool and pool boys came up and asked them to leave and reminded them everyone must be over 18. The family didn't leave. Another pool boy came up and told them everyone under 21 must leave...I was happy they addressed the kids being at the adult pool but train your people on what the policy is--I believe 18 is an adult. 14. We prepaid for our vacation and provided the required vouchers at check-in. we video checked out. Later I was billed again for the room. I called and left a message at the billing office and asked for a return call. After two days of no returned calls, I contacted my credit card company and protested the charge. After trying to reach someone for two more days in the billing office, I finally did reach someone, Elizabeth, who was extremely helpful and issued a credit. She said there is a problem with the video check out for prepays--so if you prepay don't video check out. In all, we won't be staying here again and unfortunately probably not another Wyndham property. I will say a lot of guests were very nice and we met a lot of great people. Many of them had similar issues.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Opinion if you are planning to stay here....”
Reviews.Author: L39Pilot
Reviews.Content: First rent a car at SJU airport and this will help you tremendously....trust me! Expect to pay $400 for Ford Focus @ Hertz at SJU airport with AAA discount. Make sure every nick and dent and scratch is recorded on rental checkout. Expect bad suspension springs on rental cars. There are a lot of pot holes on all roads in PR except the toll road 66. From SJU to Rio Mar DO NOT TAKE Rt 3 East bound. You will kill the whole vibe for vacation on stop and go traffic and 25+ lights you will encounter on way to Rio Mar. At hotel parking space is ample yet expect to pay $15/day for self park or $25/day for valet.....self park! The place has not been updated (esp rooms, hallways, garage to hotel access, elevators, balcony furniture) has not been updated in years. Only lobby area and restaurants are OK. Pool, beach area is also OK. Ask for 6th or 7th floor rooms. Note the lobby is on 3rd floor. Most rooms not facing the ocean side will hear noise from bldg HVAC systems. If you have small children then ask for a rental mini fridge at check-in. Expect a wait list in high season. Calling ahead early does not work. Expect fridge to be functional but banged up from outside. Next day use your rental car...go out of the resort, down the road, left on Rt 3 east bound to Luquillio town. Behind Wall-greens is Amigo grocery store. Buy milk, cold breakfast/cereals, fruits, beverages, whatever you need in terms of food that does not need further processing....Why? Your alternative is the Cafe outside Casino....Paper cup full of milk $3.50, cheese pizza slice $5, Bagel/cream cheese $4.50, Cappuccino more expensive than Starbucks. Single serve Cereal box $3.50. Resort restaurants are much to be desired. Food is mediocre but expect to shell $12 for burger, $20+ for adult breakfast buffet, $30+ for dinner. You may run out of taste buds before you run out of money. Lets talk beverages... Expect to pay at least $10 for a beer, $10.50 and beyond for mixed drinks, $5 for fresh coconut (buy better coconuts from street vendors on Rt 3 for $2). It is easier to stock on wine/beer in the fridge. After 4pm they run out of pool towels (towel service hut open from 9 to 6pm, but after 4pm take your room towel with you just in case). Use your rental car for following; Quick half day hiking/driving trip to El Yunque National Forest, Day trip to San Juan/Old San Juan. Lunch and dinner drives from hotel to Luquillo Kiosko (restaurant strip on Rt 3 in Luquillio) or Fajardo or to taste Artisan rum on Rt 135 (or may be 138 I forget) and other things you can do on the island as per your perference and taste. In general it is better to have wheels esp if you want flexibility and mobility. In 5 days I did not see more than a few people play golf. Course looks like needs water. Net net: good beach with soft brown sand without much ocean debree. separate kids and adults pool. Crowded kid area hot tub. Acceptable quality rooms. Pretty beaten up garage to hotel access. So so restaurants with not so great food for way too much money. Eat out!....all meals. Beds are not comfortable. Except tossy sleep. Pillows are way too soft and small. Oh and this is pet friendly place....so if you are allergic to pets and someone with a pet stayed in your room before you....be warned.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing, rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: votemom
Reviews.Content: there's no denying that this resort has a gorgeous beach and view. beyond that, however, i can't say much good about it. the prices for meals are EXORBITANT! we chose the advertised "family friendly" restaurant for our first dinner there, only to find there was NOTHING in the buffet that kids would want, aside from rolls and some fruit. for one adult and 5 kids, our bill was $220! and the assortment of food was just strange. you have to wear childish colored wristbands in order to get a towel to go to the beach. there is no laundry available, unless you want to have them do it at a very steep price. there was staff everywhere, but very few were helpful or polite. they advertised that there would be dvd players in our room, but there wasn't and when we inquired they said none were available. the carpets in the hallways were stained. the hallways smelled like old cigarette smoke from years of smokers. all the rooms are tiled floors and never felt clean. hair had been left behind from the previous occupant - on the toilet, sink and bathroom floor. decor was dated and just old. there was an ant in my little girl's bed. yuck! anyway. lovely area, but just way overpriced and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star but GREAT overall”
Reviews.Author: RestedMarissa
Reviews.Content: I am a 4 Seasons kind of girl but I am so glad we chose this 4 star vacation for our family between Christmas and New Years. It is not the nicest hotel I have stayed at but overall, it can't be beat. It is a good 4 star hotel. To move to a 5 star or stay somewhere else we would have paid twice what we did and would have had to make compromises that were not willing to do (e.g., beach). When you go to a 4 star hotel you cannot demand the service/facilities of a 5 star hotel. We went in with a good attitude and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. It has the best beach - huge. We rented surf boards and the beach was beautiful. The rooms - tile floor but most importantly, the beds were very comfortable and the sheets covered the comforters (I hate touching a blanket that someone slept in so this was perfect for me). The food - Great breakfast buffet. Dinners were very good. Service - very good. Facilities - Spa was good, fitness center was small. The outside restaurant was ok. The outside bar was good. The Adult pool was fabulous and the cabana available for rent gave the entire pool area an upscale feel to it. My daughter enjoyed the outside bingo and water aerobics and it was family friendly overall. Concierge - they were great. We enjoyed our trip to the rainforest! We stayed at the El Conquistador last year and the food was better but we had to take a ferry to the beach, no good. The Gran Melia is newer and fabulous overall but the food was more better/more expensive and the beach is small. We had a great trip for the money and would go back again:)

Reviews.Title: “May is the Rainiest Month in Puerto Rico ;)”
Reviews.Author: JessicaMarieB
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, very overpriced on drinks and food. Service was great, hotel and pool/ beach area are beautiful , had lots of fun. Learned quickly to keep an ice chest in the room to make our own drinks and and food, help us save a lot of money. Puerto Rico is very Americanized, Walmart, Sam's club, and many fast food places. I recommend renting your own car and driving to the activities, the hotel charges double for pretty much all activities they organize. The rainforest is about a 10 minute drive away and the trails are well marked, you do not need to take a guide here, it is beautiful. Top food spot was actually this small restaurant about 15 minutes from the Hotel called Pasta Pueblo, doesn't look like much but the food and service is amazing! As my title states we did get quite a bit of rain, but it never lasted for very long. Puerto Rico was great, and this hotel was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming Resort with Forgettable Golf Courses”
Reviews.Author: Sandee1
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort for three days for the golfing as a finish to our Cruise in December 2011. The good aspects were we had an ocean view room with a beautiful view on the 7th floor. The weather was good and we played golf. When we arrived our room was unavailable, no surprise as it was only 1 PM. I was not sure we would actually get to the resort as our taxi driver got lost and had to ask for directions 4 times to even get to Rio Grande. We got a tour of PR enroute to this hotel. We checked our luggage while the rooms were being prepared and booked a golf game. BEWARE of the concierge desk, it's really a front for timeshare sales. We used them to book the game and the next thing we were signed up for a breakfast timeshare meeting. We did not attend. We needed to sign up for a "new card" as well. Having said that they were helpful in getting reservations and printing boarding passes. But 3 times I was given a quick timeshare sell to get me to go to one of the selling sessions. Golf Courses - they have 2 river and ocean. In reality, both are river courses with 2 and only 2 holes anywhere near the ocean on the ocean course. This was our third golfing experience of our vacation, the most expensive and most forgettable of them. 1 - both courses are really built on a swamp and you can loss the ball in the mud on the fairways and in some cases this means the middle of the fairway. I realize this is the end of their rainy season but I was told by staff it never really truly dries up. The greens are nice and challenging with lots of bunkers with real sand. Not what we are use, just different. The challenge is from the size (often small) and the bunkers. I've never putted better than at this course. The fairways were in poor shape (lots of mud, even when you don't think there is any) and in some cases with a moss-like covering. Balls (and clubs) need to be cleaned every hole which is a good thing the club and ball cleaners are on the cart. The balls will not run on these courses and with all the water hazards (there are a lot of them) the courses can be unforgiving. The golf carts are fantastic with all the gadgets to enhance your golf experience. The rental golf clubs leave a lot to be desired (the budget TaylorMade or Callaway). I play with a variety of both these brands but the weight and shaft were definitely budget with high end rental price (60.00 per club rental...really). There is both a tennis facility and casino, can't comment on either as I did not use them. Food is way overpriced and not great. As we were only at the resort for three days we ate at the restaurants but the best food and price was the tiki-bar for lunch! Not good if you are on a budget or with a family. My final thoughts are first and last visit, overall a very underwhelming resort that is over priced. I will go back to resort golfing in Mexico thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Dreak W
Reviews.Content: Horrible service, food and decor! They're very dishonest too. I Lost a camera and a man came up to me and asked if I lost a camera and that he returned it to the front desk. We go to the front desk and they say no one has turned in a camera or claimed one! I Could tell that he was lying too because right when I asked, his body language changed. Don't bring anything you don't want to lose there! The food is bad quality too. The dinner costs us $236 for only four people! The beach and pool are disgusting and there's no lifeguard on the beach either! The rooms have no A/C, only fans. It's so hot and humid in our room! The shower kept changing it's temperatures and pressure often. We will never come here again! This is a horrible resort full of bad service, dishonest people and horrible qualities!

Reviews.Title: “Beautful Large Beach and Gluten Free Friendly”
Reviews.Author: maryellen k
Reviews.Content: We celebrated Christmas here with our family of 8. Fantatstic Beach, great fun for all in the water with jet skiing and other water sports. The water keeps you alert, but not too scary, so little ones can jump the waves. Great beach to walk and not to busy with other hotels nearby. We had mountain view room on 7th floor. Gorgeous sunset view. i read reviews that said plumbing issues on lower floors. high floor was quiet and mimimal issues. refrigerator in our room as requested. The entire hotel decorated for Christmas beautifully. Nice little fun casino for after dinner fun as well as lobby bar for sports and signature drinks. Fun entertainment, i was selected for latin dancing and it was such fun and i looked good too! Far from Old San Juan. For us that wasnt an issue. Poolside activities and nice jacuzzi. Pet friendly as well, but dont let that scare you off, just minimal pets there. Restaurant advice: Marbella is great especially for lunch and breakfast was included and worth it. A few steps from the beach you can go inside and enjoy chicken soup with rice like my grandmother made and or wonderful salads with grilled chicken, way better than poolside and very clean. Palio is Italian and worth it, Tomato soup, pastas or anything with pasta or risotto...fabulous. we dined there twice. The Grille on the golf course is a great little change of scenery, not as crowded but a delicious meal and service over the top. Kudos to the chef at Marbella for escorting my daughter with Celiac around the buffet the first night and showing her GF options as well as making her pancakes and waffles in the morning. Thats a wow in my book! Also many GF choices at palio as well as Grille. I didnt care for Shimas and they told us a meal was GF after we suspected it wasnt. We were correct, the other 7 of us didnt love our meals eiher there and that was Christmas Eve. Golf course nice as per the guys. Property clean and perhaps a little old, but we met people that go year after year for the last 15 years and families of 20 or better meeting there. That says a lot for a resort in my book. The only issue i did have was check in. It was messy and although we did have 4 rooms, we couldnt even get 1 until after 4 and that was with a bug push. The luggage was never sent up until i went down and Jose helped me find it in the hold room. the adjoining room was ready and we needed to go back down to request it again. After waking up at 3:30 AM to get there at 1PM, i was pretty patient until Ana told us we could wait until 6PM to get all our rooms. I was ready to race to the executive offices at that point. This didnt start off our trip with a bang, but as soon as we settled, the fun did begin and the staff was wonderful after that point. I suggest a review of the ladies behind the check in desk. Work with the gentlemen, you will get a more calm, professional agent in my opinion. Oh and last but not least, the massage was wonderful, just be aware the service charge is added to the bill, so opt to tip in cash if you wish and advice that you have when paying. Juan was a doll at Marbella as was Melissa and dont leave without trying Puerto Rican French Toast! I hope to return and it would be with my whole family again. For just my husband and I, we prefer a larger casino, and a newer property. i see myself again there with my children and grandchildren one day! Beds and pillows very comfy. i havent slept so well since ive been home. Hotel is clean but the dishes outside doors werent picked up as quickly as you would expect. We worked with Vianca the reservation manager and she was great wtih every detail. she helped us make all our dinner reservations a week before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: thompsondc
Reviews.Content: We are currently at the resort. I almost changed our reservations, because a lot of the reviews I read on here scared me! Well, we're really glad we're here. Yes, the rooms and hallways could use some refurbishing. But no, we haven't been nickeled and dimed, and the staff here is friendly. When we checked in, Tony the bellman was very welcoming and helpful, Jessica at the front desk couldn't have been nicer, and the Marbella staff has been so nice - especially Alex. This morning at breakfast they passed out samples of a mango frappe, and gave us a very generous cup of it to go when I said I liked it. Our two adjoining rooms each have a fridge, already in the room when we arrived. Pool is slightly cold - my youngest daughter doesn't mind. Hubby is enjoying the small, very manageable casino. We have all enjoyed Bingo and other poolside activites...in fact, everywhere we look we see relaxed people and very happy families. Tomorrow we are visiting the rainforest - will post again if there is some big problem here; otherwise I say come visit - it's not perfect, for sure. Not fancy 5 stars - but come with the right attitude, and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Bday weekend”
Reviews.Author: JMOTM
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went there for my birthday weekend with the idea of using it as a base to visit Vieques and Culebra. Coincedentally met the hotel manager and he was pleasant and accomodating. The hotel grounds are immense and fairly well kept. The hotel itself is very pretty and has nice rainforest views. The beach was adequate but being beachlovers we prefer the Caribbean Sea. While here if you get the chance visit the kioskos in Luquillo (5 minute drive away) for good cheap eats and drinks; also playa flamenco in culebra is worth the hour and a half ferry ride from fajardo. Fajardo is a 25 minute drive. Would recommend this hotel as a good base for traveling around this side of Puerto Rico -- some might enjoy it for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great for a Family with Older Kids Like Us”
Reviews.Author: GreatVacation84
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico was our best vacation ever! We went on a Segway tour of Old San Juan, did a rainforest adventure with ziplines, rented a sailboat, chartered a fishing boat, and took surfing lessons. We definitely plan to go back. Our family of 4 booked 2 adjoining rooms for 5 nights in July with an ocean view. The rooms are nice but the climate in PR made the bed sheets feel wet, which took some getting used to. If you choose an ocean view room, get above the 4th floor or all you will see are palm trees. There were a lot of families there with lots of small and loud children during our visit. On a couple of nights when the kids were still running the halls and screaming at 2am we put towels under the door to try to get some sleep. The hotel really is perfect for families with small kids--pools, beach, and activities. The hotel is about a 30-minute drive from Old San Juan but we had a rental car so that wasn't a problem for us. If you plan to rent a car, do it ahead of time. There is an Enterprise Rental Car place in the hotel and we got a great rate and a nice car by booking in advance. If you get it once you get there, I heard it is about $100 per day. If you rent a car there you can take advantage of the reserved parking spaces just for the Enterprise cars. You also get a free day of parking with an Enterprise rental. It is true what other reviewers have said-- the parking garage is a nightmare. It is small, dark, dirty, wet, and almost always full.
