Parking attendants do not tell you if it is full. You just drive in, get jammed up with others looking for parking, turn around and go to the outdoor lot. The hotel really should do something about that garage! It is so out of place at this nice hotel with beautiful landscaping and fantastic pool areas. We did not eat at any of the restaurants but they have a nice snack bar area with pizza, sandwiches, desserts, etc. and the prices were reasonable. We also kept a cooler in the room for drinks. Their ice machines work well. I went to the casino a few times--it is small but they had local live entertainment, which was really fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Christmas Trip”
Reviews.Author: Carol1942
Reviews.Content: Great beach and well done rooms. It is a good 50 minute ride from Old San Juan. I suggest renting a car as you are quite a ways to other activities. We enjoyed our stay but we had cars and access to many other tourist attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort in PR.”
Reviews.Author: johnmani
Reviews.Content: We - Husband, wife, two little kids aged 8 & 12. Stayed here from 12/23/2011 thru 12/27. Location: Excellent for a relaxing resort-style vacation. Away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan, yet close enough via rental or cab. (Cab costs around $70 to SJ or airport and takes 45 mins). Very close to El Yunque rain-forest, and to Fajardo for the beaches/marina. Outside food is somewhat of a chore - you'll need a rental car and drive 15/20 mins. Beach access: Nice, virtually private, long, wide & swim-able beach with mild waves. No reef, so no snorkeling off the beach. Beach facilities include basics such as pool chairs, showers, life guards & swimming pool close by. NO water-sports right at beach, and we didn't see any hotel rental facilities such as boards, paddle-boats, kayaks, etc. This might be true for other hotels in PR as well - not sure. Swimming pool - Average. Kid's pool is better with a small slide. But not very big, so can get crowded. The adult pool and pool area is not very clean. Overall has an 'aged' look. Rooms - Average. Big enough, with a small verandah. Ours had two queen sized beds. All the usual amenities like TV, etc. Nice, big, clean bathroom with tub and shower. Not very sound-proof, so could hear flushing actions from probably upstairs - but not a big deal. Pay-to-use fridge. Hotel - Nice lobby and impressive view/facade from outside. Good looking golf course. Resort grounds are huge, green and quiet; but does not have that immaculate well-maintained look. Food - Expensive. The Marabella and Grille room food was quite good, though $$. The Japanese/chinese restaurant (Shiba?) was a disappointment and certainly not worth the $$. You'll need a car and venture out 10-15 minutes out of town (either east toward Fajardo or west toward SJ) to get to local food. And with small kids, the immediate vicinity restaurants may not be very 'family friendly'. There's a cafe where you can 'reasonably' priced snacks at all times, but low quality. And your in-room bottled water? $7 ! Service - Average. Big resort, so no 'personal' service. We didn't have any issues, so don't know how the resort deals with problems. Price - We booked as part of a package. PR during the Xmas break is expensive anyways, so we got value for our $. But its probably a 3+ -star resort, so make sure your room price reflects that. Note that they charge $20/day for car parking - not terrible. Overall - Its excellent location makes it a good choice for families, but don't expect 5-star quality or amenities, and don't pay 5-star price. PR is anyways NOT a resort-dominated place, so this is a good option given the rather limited choices there.

Reviews.Title: “family resort”
Reviews.Author: sawlanimd
Reviews.Content: stayed at the resort from 12/21/11-12/26/11, about 30-40 min from the airport. taxi from the airport will cost approximately $75.00 and shuttle arranged through the hotel is $37.50/ adult and $25.00/child one way. Lobby and the grounds are impressive. Try getting a room above 6th floor to get a clear view of the ocean. pools are clean. beach is not crowded and clean. The hotel has 2 golf courses. like any other resorts, food and water is expensive. Among the restaurants Shimas and Palio are worth the price, staff go out of the way to accommodate your dietary preference. Rooms are clean, bathrooms probably need updated fixtures, especially for the price you pay. Internet wireless service does not work in the rooms. ethernet connection is available. Renting a car is a cheaper option as cabs are expensive ( $75.00 one way to old san juan). Avoid Enterprise counter located at the hotel, as half the time the desk is empty and getting hold of someone is a waste of time. pros; away from the city, not too crowded, kid friendly, beach cons; away from the city, small size casino, poor internet connection in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: Candy S
Reviews.Content: We are here now , family of four in two adjoining rooms. We made our reservation through Expedia, and our request for adjoining rooms, one king, one two queens was honored. However , our rooms on 5th floor look toward the mountains ( I didn't pay want to more for beach view) but we are on top of convention section, so we have large gravel roof and loud air conditioning compressors right outside balcony. Plus laundry lint all over our balconies. Pool is cold as others have said, adult pool area chairs are way more comfortable and cushioned, however there is limited sun there, as trees and building cut sun dramatically. family pool is too loud, constant music, and terrible hard rattan chairs. Beach is ok, but hard chairs ther, and pretty rough surf, not calm carribbean , or warm. I guess I wanted a deal, and as airfares are so high now, I compromised on the hotel. By the way, nearby kiosks that are recommended, are pretty scuzzy, and mostly closed on Tuesday we found today. We did our own rainforest tour in our rental car, very close to this hotel and took hour plus long hike, nice but pretty challenging for non-hikers. Hotel food is very expensive as expected, and very mediocre, especially lunch, trying to avoid eating or drinking here.

Reviews.Title: “december visit”
Reviews.Author: nd86
Reviews.Content: stayed at the rio mar for four nights before x-mas weekend. overall, good choice for this side of the island. huge property with the hotel and many vacation rentals. by far the best value for a family compared to the three other hotels in this area. the rooms are older and concrete which drops the rating down, but nice comfortable beds and decent bathrooms. rented a mountain view suite which is a better room and great view of the rain forest. the lobby is great and very busy and the pool area is beautiful with plenty of chairs. like the other recent reviews, the pool water seemed cool, and they should look into heating at least one of the pools. the beach was very nice and larger than any of the san juan beaches. could take long walks in either direction, and the walk to the east towards the river was right out of survivor. we rented a van at the airport and this is a must. we drove across the highway to the rain forest and ate out two nights. one night we turned right out of the property and went up the hill to richies cafe, which has an incredible view and good food. the other day we drove to the ceiba airport and did a daytrip to culebra(best day of the trip). on the way home we ate at metropol in fajardo(next to the cinemas) which was a good clean place and much cheaper. overall, great place to take teenage kids and see the east side of puerto rico. warning, if you book boat trips out of the fajardo area, they are likey to be cancelled if it is windy. the winds were strong the whole week and they did not sail to culebra or vieques any of the days. luckily we were able to do last minute flight on air flamenco out of ceiba($40 per person each way).

Reviews.Title: “Please heat the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie1976
Reviews.Content: We love the Rio Mar and try to stay there as often as possible since it is a great value. This stay was no exception, however, there are a couple things that visitors should be aware of. Depending on the time of year, the water can be a little rough with lots of seaweed. We stayed in December, and there was a lot of wind and cooler water. We were hoping to swim in the pool, but very few people were using pools due to the cold temperature. Normally there isn't trash on the beach, but it seemed as though a trash dump had washed ashore from the rough waters. Lots of plastic and junk strewn down the beach. Staff was making an effort to clean it. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful throughout our visit. We ate at Shimas, the Asian restaurant, and it was good, not great for the price. Food was over sauced and too salty. Lots of kids at the Rio Mar, which is fine until you want to have a quiet romantic dinner. We still plan to go back since we enjoy the landscaping, maginificent decor, and relaxing feel of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time... and a perfect wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Jorgeortiz12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently got married at the Rio Mar Wyndham and had an amazing and beautiful wedding. The resort was very nice, clean and comfortable; yes it is far from San Juan, but that's what we were looking for. The beach was also really nice, clean and perfect to walk for miles without being bothered by anyone. Our wedding coordinator, Monique, was by far the most wonderful, responsible and knowledgeable person we worked with while planning our special day - I highly recommend her and her team!

Reviews.Title: “Never visit in hurrican season”
Reviews.Author: MM W
Reviews.Content: First of all, do not take me wrong. This place is beautiful and should have a lot of fun, but when we visit in late August. We unfoutunatelly bump into hurrican. Even though the hurrican just left. The hotel was obvious unprepared, parking lot was flooded with only partial electricity, and no water. Can you imagine a hotel without water? and yet they still take us in and not until we flush the toilet and then found out there was no water. We have to go to the local MacDonald to get food and go to restroom. I guess the hotel is in a bit remote place, only at weekend and things getting a bit alive. Food and drink, of couse, is very expensive. I do not know it is PR thing or just this hotel, they seems trying to charge you from left to right. And you have to argue almost every item. It was just tiring. PR is unique, hardware of this hotel is good but the system of PR and management is not there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort & Love PR”
Reviews.Author: FY W
Reviews.Content: Booked my trip through Cheapcarribean.com, stayed at Wyndham Rio Mar Resort for 5 days on the last week of November 2011. I had a wonderful experience and would definitely come back again. Went on many excursions, had TONS of fun. Here are some thoughts: 1) Booked the "round of house" view, got a free upgrade to ocean view room with balcony! 2) Rooms felt humid, but their A/C is powerful, turn it on and you won't feel hot for sure. 3) Hotel ground is BEAUTIFUL, multiple pools, including one with a mini-waterslide. 4) Everyone is so friendly & helpful 5) Sat for the 90 min talk about Time Share (BOR-ING) but received $75 credit for excursions :) 6) BOOK A CAR! I booked mine through enterprise, it came out to about $15/day, crazy good deal! 7) Never ate once at the hotel, ALWAYS explored local kiosks, along with the little strip that everyone talks about, I loved TAPAS 13 !!! Excursions I went on: 1) El Yunque National Rainforest --> AMAZING HIKE, with La Mina Fall at the end 2) Old San Juan --> historic, beautiful & colorful 3) Bioluminescent Bay Tour --> kayaking in a lagoon under the moonlight, into water that lights up b/c of plankton in the water. 4) Esperanza Beach @ Isla Vieques -- crystal clear water 5) Flamenco Beach @ Culebra -- went there on private boat with open bar/ lunch provided, snorkeling/ explore beach. I loved my stay at Wyndham b/c it provided an ultra comfy bed, on a beautiful resort ground, but everyday I left for a different excursion. Concierge was very helpful, has LOADS of information.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive!! Unorganized!!”
Reviews.Author: Ron580
Reviews.Content: Being in PR is amazing but Rio Mar was not very fair with there prices due to you being stuck at the hotel. The Golf is very over rated, Play Trump down the road before thinking of playing there so called Championship courses! I am in the Golf Biz and was very, very dissapointed! THe course I booked was closed so forced to play the one they say was better and it was wet, the greens were the worst i have seen ever and the holes were less than spectacular! The hotel messed our room up 3 times! Once we were given a room not cleaned, second to a room without the proper bed, then asked for a beach front and 2 times they gave us the side view of the roof of the convention center! We finally just stayed in our side view room with 2 full size beds. The food was so over priced!!! PERIOD! Drinks so unfair!! $12 a glass for cheap wine.. $8 for a beer! Stupid! I love Puerto Rico for the people but I would not tell my worst enemy to stay here! Check out The Gran Melia or stay downtown San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: S51438
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: The resort is beautiful (At least on the outside) There are nice pools The staff are VERY friendly and will help you with anything There are several restaurants to pick from It has comfy beds The room was very clean THE BAD: The hotel is rather dark on the inside The rooms and hallways had an obvious feeling of humidity The food was expensive, yet was very mediocre. Ordered an expensive shrimp scampi dish from Marbella and it was cold It is a little hard to find The beach is very mediocre. Brown sand, high surf, dirty water. Rowdy people in the hotel It was an ok visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: my2centsfromlgr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long stay here. Overall, we had a good time and it is a nice resort, but not a great resort. Fortunately it was not a busy week so it was relaxing for us, which is what we needed. There were nightly rain showers, but we had good weather during the day. We agree with the previous reviewer who thought it was a bit boring. The grounds are very pretty, it has a nice pool area (though the adult pool lining needs renovation), the beach is right there with nice sand but dirty water, and we found all the staff pleasant and helpful. The food was good but expensive (as expected), we felt the menus were limited, and there was no outdoor dining at night. There is one main lobby bar and a casino, but no other nighttime entertainment. No live music except one night when they had a Flamenco dancer performing in the main restaurant. We planned our trip through Travelocity, and when we arrived we were given an upgrade to an oceanfront room which was nice, and we got all our other requests, such as a high floor to see over the trees. We had to switch rooms because of a very musty odor and a tub that wasn't draining. The second room was better but the drawers still smelled. Puerto Rico has had an unusual amount of rain lately, so maybe that was part of the problem, but we had to keep the sliding doors closed all the time, and still the room felt humid despite the constant A/C. I recommend keeping your clothes in your suitcase if possible. Other room notes, the walls could use repainting and more artwork, but the furniture seemed to be in decent shape, TV channel choices fair, tub was banged up, and the balcony furniture was just in fair shape. Sometimes we lost hot water while showering in the afternoon. We like a fridge in our room, which supposedly cost $10/day, but we didn't get charged. Also, we saw other people checking in with cases of bottled water (which we wished we had thought of doing on the way from the airport), but you can buy bottled water in the gift shop, and the tap water is drinkable in PR. There is an internet hot spot in one area of the lobby. There's a charge for in-room, unless you are a Wyndham Rewards member. We were only able to use our new ipads in the lobby on WiFi, the 3G signal worked fine for our phones but not the ipads. (Does anyone know if the 3G signal can be blocked for the ipad but not phones?) We planned to play golf on each of the two courses at the resort, but due to the recent rain, the Ocean Course was closed. We did play the River Course which was also extremely wet, and it was OK, but some of the greens were in poor shape. Callaway rental clubs were decent. After trying all the restaurants at the resort, we decided to try going local. We really enjoyed La Parrilla, a couple of miles away, and ate dinner there twice. We highly recommend it. I bet things are different when it's high season. There might be more going on, but you probably have to do a lot more planning ahead than we did, such as for dinner reservations etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Beautiful and Sterile”
Reviews.Author: TheMangoMen
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of going here for my 40th birthday with my friends. Most resorts this size have a little bit of everything, that you never want to leave the resort. I felt this resort to be very sterile and boring. The beach was pretty, the pool was pretty, the lagoon was pretty, the hotel was pretty. Everything was clean, the casino was good. If all you want to do is sit by the pool, play golf, drink wine and feel important, this place is perfect for you. If you are looking for people who look like they are on vacation having a good time, smiling, and looking like they are alive, then this is not the place. We did spend the day hiking the rain forest which is right there...now that was cool!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Turkey for Thanksgiving.”
Reviews.Author: sweetiedoris
Reviews.Content: Indeed. My husband had a business conference. We had a basement room. Mold on the curtain, dirt on the floor, the shower faucet stuck continuously when the dial was turned and steaming water came out. Our view was of the garage exit. We were nickel and dimed to death and charged for things we didn't use. The room was damp as the air does not work well. It was off season and restaurants were closed. Dining after 6pm meant either room service, or appetizers in the bar. The beach closed at 5pm and the pools closed at 6pm. Self parking was $20 and more for valet. Rent your car at the airport, Reserve an inroom fridge so you can eat something after a day of work. On the positive side, it was truly a beautiful piece of property with the mountains on one side and the ocean on the other. Despite the garbage at one end of the beach. How can you hate Puerto Rico? It's a beautiful place! As far as the Rio Mar, it was like how my brined turkey came out at Thanksgiving.... edible, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: FredandTig
Reviews.Content: It's just OK. Was here for a few days and the rooms were fair, service was fine. An average place. Would look for an upgrade if I ever were to return. No complaints... average...

Reviews.Title: “undisclosed charges: Wyndham corp. doesn't know what's going on down there.”
Reviews.Author: NMlocal
Reviews.Content: I had a conference organized at this resort. I was unable to go and had to send another person in my place. it was no problem to switch the name on the reservation, but 60 days before the conference a deposit was charged to my card. This deposit was never disclosed in the original online booking confirmation and the main wyndham reservations team was also unaware of it either so was referred me to the billing office of the actual hotel. They refused to remove it in spite of the fact that I no longer even had a reservation at their resort. It took about 3+ hours of my time on the phone talking with many different and exceptional rude people who thought I was stupid for not understanding these charges. Why would anyone sink money in this place? You can stay at some equally fancy resorts with Hilton for the same money and alot more convenience. Wyndham has no idea what is going on down there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place, but needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: DickJefferson
Reviews.Content: We went to Rio Mar at the end of October for our honeymoon. The weather was great and the staff was very nice. The first night our room was a little more than misty to say the least and could have used a good scrubbing. We requested to be moved and were given a beachfront balcony room. The new room was dry and much cleaner. We had a nice view of the beach, but the main air conditioning unit on the roof of the hotel ran the entire time. It sounded like a jet was taking off, which made it hard to spend time on the balcony. The beach and pool area are very nice and look like the pictures presented on Wyndhamâ€™s website. The staff is really nice and very helpful. My wife ordered a couples massage on the first day we were there. It was average at best, the facilities were nice, but the $500 price was shocking. We have had similar massage packages at other resorts and they are never that much. Her pedicure was $90, which seemed on par with other resorts. We ate a couple of the restaurants in the hotel and the food was good. The cost is what I would expect, with most dinners running around $100 a couple. Overall I would give Rio Mar a B-, because the building needs some cleaning and fixing up. The location is great and gives you access to the rainforest, San Juan & Bioluminescent Kayaking. If youâ€™re going to golf the club rental is $55 and 9 holes is $150 I think.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: loverat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Puerto Rico for the first time for our honeymoon in January, 2011. After reading reviews and looking at different websites, we chose Rio Mar Beach Resort and Spa. We were quite happy to leave the cold of New Jersey for the tropical warmth that greeted us in PR. It was a nice ride from the airport to the resort (I definitely recommend that you get transfers included with your vacation package). The resort was beautiful, tastefully decorated Caribbean style using a warm color palette. Our room was beautiful and spacious, overlooking the blue ocean and the grounds of the resort. We would have liked an All-Inclusive plan but Puerto Rico just doesn't offer any. The restaurants were great but a bit expensive. We didn't really mind since we were on our honeymoon though! The pool area was great, offering an adult pool or family pool. The family pool was huge and we had room to ourselves so we didn't mind the few kids in the area. We did spend a little time at the adult pool, but it was crowded. On the grounds of the Rio Mar Resort were colorful iguanas and little frogs which you can't see but can hear called "Coqui's" (that is the sound they make, adorable!). The iguana's like to mingle with people and are harmless unless you feed them! We had a lovely honeymoon at the Rio Mar Resort and would definitely like to go there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Resort”
Reviews.Author: agia
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar was previously a luxury resort when operated by Westin Hotels. It now has great facilities that have deterioated. The rooms have been renovated are well appointed and completly clean and comfortable. You can't expect much here. Like there being no water for about 6 hours on Sunday 11/20/11 and Wednesday morning 11/23. There solution was rolling around big barrels of water which they would use a bucket to pour into your toilet to flush it. "yuck". The hotel boasts 13 tennis courts. Only 5 were playable. The hallways smell and my balcony in room #5080 had standing rain water and was not usable. I would only book this hotel if you get a good deal. I paid a AAA rate of $110 per night and was upgraded to an ocean front room. Keep in mind that with added charges and taxes this still totaled almost $150 per night. Of course their is no refrigerator in rooms so you have to pay $3.35 for a can of coke. The food in the restaurants was very good however.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot ON beach”
Reviews.Author: biberbunch
Reviews.Content: Lobby is beautiful- rooms are fine. We were on the 7th floor with an amazing view! Our room had a mini fridge which helped with kid snacks/sandwiches. Location is across main highway from rain forest- so just drive yourself over- don't pay the big bucks! Concierges were awesome & can tell you how to see the sites without the big buck tours (told us where to park in old San Juan & how to ferry over to culebra island for $5 round trip!). During our stay the hotel lost water & air but they comped one night & shuttled people to golf club house. Water issues during the week were a pain but you could tell staff was trying their best- so we didn't blame them. It was an issue with the water main.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sherrena L
Reviews.Content: Harder to imagine a better place for a family vacation! Our room was great, the kids were more than happy with the food, the grounds were beautiful, and the staff was top notch! We had a bit of a drive to Old Town, but were right by the rainforest turn. We did both. There were other choices too! Nothing was THAT far away, so we were good. Our tour guide, Juan, with Dragonfly, was great and happy to keep the group entertained. We loved just hanging out at the resort too, with several pools, the beach, all there to choose from. Again, we had a great time on our trip!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Victorrp2000
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, good service and food also good, but expensive food options outside the hotel are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Staff, Nice View, Good Rooms....Some Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: Dave9988
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights 11/21 - 11/23. Firstly, staff were wonderful, especially Armando at that the Front Desk, he was very helpful. Property is nicely appointed and the rooms are average to good quality. Had not water on 11/21 during the afternoon and then no water on 11/23 during the morning...told they were getting this fixed. Hotel offered free breakfast and room credit for the inconveience - so they did step up and take responsibility and take care of their guests...Overall a nice stay with very courteous staff, everyone at the hotel were so nice and professional. The location to explore El Yunque is superb...the entrance to El Yunque is only a few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Over promised & under delivered...”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 11/17/11 and stayed through 11/23/11. On 11/20 the water was out from 12 noon till 10PM, and as a result we had no AC and the restaurants on site were closed. On 11/23 we got up to leave for the airport to find that the water was out yet again! Also, there is NO on site dive operation. Make sure to rent a car, cabs are super expensive. The italian restaurant was exquisite, the rest left a lot to be desired. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Guayaba33
Reviews.Content: Beatiful Place. It is located at the bottom of El Yunque National Rain Forest. The Service is very good (staff will go out of their way for you). I was there for Thanksgiving weekend and there were lots of activities for the family, specially the lighting of the Christmas tree was good. There is Tennis, Golf, Beach, The pool is huge (there is another pool just for adults) and there is a water slides wich kids love. Close to the hotel is El Yunque, Hacienda Carabali (Horse riding, Go-cars, fourtracks),Fajardo's Biolusent bay, etc....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jaschonh
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I (late 30s females) came here for a relaxing long weekend in November. We rented a car based on reviews from this site and found the price of car and hotel valet parking to be similar in price to what hotel/airport transfers would have been. Plus it was convenient for our afternoon/dinner trip to Old San Juan to have a car. The hotel is about 35 minutes away from San Juan. We got the lower priced rooms because we didn't need incredible views from our room. We planned to be by the pool or the beach. We went to two of the on-site restaurants and also had lunch at the golf club pub. The food was decent enough at all places, though the italian place ended up being great. Brunch on site was perfect as were our massages. My massage was great! The hotel gym had plenty of equipment though it was tucked in a room next to the spa area. We only went to the adult pool, claiming our chairs with towels by 8am each morning (this was a trend for many). The beach was great, though we were only on it a bit. The water was super warm and that side of the island had good waves. The tiki hut would have been more fun except there were a good number of bugs there attracted to the syrups in the drinks. It didn't matter since the waitresses came by around lunch time to take drink and food orders at the pool. You don't need cash with you while at the hotel. Room number and name is all they are looking for. If you do want to go the more affordable beer option, you can order room service "from the pantry" and get a six pack for a reasonable price. If you get regular room service (not from the pantry) then be prepared to pay. Or you could also do a run to the fairly close Walmart and get a cooler, etc. There was a varied age range at the hotel. Younger folks there for a wedding, all ages for a conference, familes with kids (at the other pool). The casino was small, but entertaining enough for an hour or so at night. There was also a hotel bar near the casino that usually had some one playing the piano each night. The resort provides access to a golf course and other forms of activities...that we didn't take advantage of since we were happy with our pool situation. Overall, it was a very nice place to go to get away. If we had stayed longer we would have probably done a trip to the rainforest or have checked out the bio ponds or driven into other parts of the island. But for a long weekend with 80ish degree weather, perfect sun, and bathwater temp ocean...this place was great for a chill girls weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Wedding Services”
Reviews.Author: twin942
Reviews.Content: I would not go anywhere near this place. We contracted for wedding services for our daughter there who is 20 years old. We had a few initial conversations with the hotel catering manager and were very clear that my daughter and her future husband would be traveling alone and my daughter was 20. They indicated that this would be no problem and they could get married with a notarized affidavit from us (parents). They even sent paperwork to us detailing procedures for such a case. After sending them a $500 deposit, we later found out (from the Puerto Rican government) that it is against the law for people under 21 to get married unless parents are physically in attendance to grant permission. We had to cancel the event and asked for our deposit back, since they misrepresented their competencies and their ability to perform this service. They told us to forget it. I did a quick internet search on Wyndham Resorts and was shocked to see how many complaints existed about this company. It doesn't surprise me in hindsight, but if you are thinking of a special event I'd strongly encourage you to look elsewhere. Too much risk to go with this place. In general, service was VERY poor even before this dispute (unanswered e-mails and phone calls, lack of information, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chris526
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that the staff are very nice. They always went out of their way to help us. However......the hotel itself is in need of some serious upgrades. It's my understanding that it's recently been acquired by Wyndham, so perhaps they will make the changes. The bathrooms are very outdated and we had to hold the toilet lever to get it to flush. The shower pressure was awful and the water changed from hot to cold and made very loud noises. One day, the water pumps completely broke and the hotel was without running water, air conditioning AND working toilets for over 8 hours. The best they could do was give a $100 credit to the room, which was a nice gesture; however, I think they could've done a bit more. The beach and pool were very nice but only half of the restaurants on the premises were open. Apparently, they rotate which ones are opened each day. Overall, we spent most of our time out exploring the island, so the hotel sufficed; however, if you are looking for a resort experience or anything close to a 4 star rating.....please try another resort. I was told by some locals that the Gran Melia is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: simplytiffany
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the rio mar with family and friends for just a few short days before going on a cruise. It was on the more quiet part of the island and about 40 minutes away from old san juan but it was only a 5 minute drive from one of the most amazing and beautiful rainforest, el yunque. The hotel itself was very nice and it is worth it to get a beach front so you can see the beautiful beach. Ask for a room in the 200 side so you are not right on top of the pool only because it is 24 hours and one of the nights, the people we traveled with said people were a little loud even around 3 am. The beach here is nice and they have chairs and umbrellas for you. It was never hard to find chairs by the pool or beach which was very nice. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. i encourage you to ask them for ideas where to eat or go because they give much better advice then the concierge desk. also, they have a desk there for you to rent cars for 24 hours at a time. we rented a car for one day and loved that we were able to leave the grounds and it was much cheaper then a cab. everyone complains about the parking but it was only a 2 minute walk from the parking lot and it was well worth it!The food and drinks are very good from here but a bit pricey ( $10.50 for a regular cup size alcohol drink!). just down the road (about 2 minute drive) there is a very delicious place to eat called anojitos. they had good breakfast and lunch and very good prices! all the food from here was great! also about 4 minutes away is another delicious yet cheap place called don pepes. we only had breakfast here but there lunch menu looked delicious too. From don pepes i recomend the coconut glazed waffles!! like i said if you stay at this hotel i recommend you visit the rainforest and explore different parts of it. I travel a lot and this is definitely one of my favorite places to just look and explore. overall, if i came back to puerto rico i would consider staying here again because it was a nice hotel and on a nice part of the island!! wish i was back!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2011”
Reviews.Author: realfan68
Reviews.Content: Another belated review but I thought I'd add it nevertheless. My family and I stayed here in late March of 2011. The hotel was nice, the beach was better and the overall location was so so. We ended up renting a car to be able to leave the property and explore the part of Puerto Rico in which we were staying. The rental car opened our world a bit more to local restaurants. Overall, we enjoyed our time here. There were some major corporate events going on at the property at the time we were there but it didn't interfere too much with us. I would say that if you have teens (as we do) and are later to the pool and restaurants, this resort actually works well. We often were looking for chairs by the pool as the first wave of parents with young kids were leaving. One major issue for my kids was a complete lack of in room Wi Fi or a DVD player. Make sure to bring plenty of power cords and your own entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, overpriced food and beverages, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: LindsayN016
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from the airport with the traffic and crazy drivers we arrived at the Wyndham resort. You know you're getting close the resort because the obnoxious fake bird noises are blaring out of speakers throughout the resort grounds. The view from our room was beautiful and the resort is right on the ocean/beach but the view was the only good thing about the hotel. The staff was VERY rude and not helpful. The concierge service's main goal was to rip you off. We booked horseback riding through them (had our own transportation--a rental car) and they charged us about $30 more than it would have cost us to just pay when we got there. When you stay at a resort you are paying for SERVICE, not to get money taken out of your pocket every chance they get. Also, there were several spiders in our room and none of us would walk in our room without shoes because the floors felt so disgusting. The food/drinks are always more expensive at resorts but this place was just over the top expensive for below average drinks and service. WILL NEVER STAY AT A WYNDHAM AGAIN! WORST RESORT EXPERIENCE EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, rooms need upgrading!”
Reviews.Author: CentralLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Rio Mar Beach Resort recently on a company trip. My review will not include much on drink and food prices since our company covered drinks & food for us. We arrived at the hotel via shuttle, which, I must tell you, the hotel is quite a haul from the airport...a good 40 minutes. This hotel sits on the OCEAN side, not the Carribean side, so if you are looking for white sandy beaches at this resort, you will not find them. The sand is brown, like a sandbox. And, yes, the stories about the sand fleas are correct. They do exist, as several in our group had "run in's" with them...hence, the reason I stayed off the beach & by pool and barside! The Tiki Bar was very nice wih great drinks & music. Bartenders are nice and pretty quick with service. The manager of the bar....his name escapes me, was just awesome and went out of his way to help any way he could. If you like coconut, buy a tropical drink in a coconut...I think it was $12...its neat to see them cut it open & drain out the coconut juice, and then insert your drink in the top. We didn't spend alot of time in our room, but I have included some pics of room # 5096 bathroom, that wasn't in the best condition and not so clean when we checked in. I should have requested another room, but didn't. the maids could do a little better cleaning the rooms because finding hair in the corner of your bathroom when you first check in is quite a turn off! We ordered room service for breakfast for 3 of the days...each day to be delivered between 8:30 & 9 am. We ordered the night before so shouldn't be a problem, right? WRONG. The first day was delivered at 9:15...second day at 8:15....no apology either time...hmmm...finally the 3rd day they got it right! Also, we were missing something on our order one of the days and noticed it after the server left the room. We call room service to request the item be brought to us, and they ARGUED with us thinking we were actually lying and got the order! We also asked for some extra butter...minor, yes? After they argued with us over the phone...they never brought our missing item OR the extra butter we requested....just ignored us. I would have thought they would have at least brought us the extra butter....but, no response. Worst room service in all the times I have had it, and I only get it on our company trips, so I don't ask for much, Restaurant wise, the Palio (Italian) is out of this world! Our waiter was top notch and very personable! Went to Shimas with some business associates another night, but unless you are a sushi/Japaneese food type fan, its no good. I am not, and didn't particulary enjoy it, except for the company. Everything is Shimas seemed to be slow, so plan on being there for a couple hours. The Casino is small but nice and centrally located off the very nice lobby area, but do not plan on winning there...very tight! The hotel lobby, pool and grounds are just beautiful.....our room was a little to be desired. It was sufficient, but a little better cleaning job and upgrading the rooms would make them much better. Our bathroom tub was patched all over...(see photos)...kinda yucky. Oh, and the walls ARE thin...you can hear your neighbors...and I think the tile floors in the rooms make it so there is nothing to "absorb" noise in each room. Many in our group complained about the quality of the rooms, so I know it wasn't just our room. Beds are very comfortable - I slept well. Yes, the prices for drinks are high, but you need to expect this at a resort type hotel anywhere you go...I have been to many and its the same everywhere. Bring your own food & drinks if you want to avoid the expense. On Friday nights, there is some live band in the hotel lobby, and it is LOUD..so loud, that after midnight in our room...on the 5TH FLOOR...we were trying to sleep and couldn't figure out where the low bass sound was coming from....well a quick phone call to the front desk answered that...band plays till 1 am! Now, if it was that loud on our 5th floor, I feel sorry for those on the Lobby floor just down the hall from the Lobby bar. Yikes! This definitely is a hotel suited for adults, not kids. There isn't much to do for kids except swim and go to the beach. I don't remember seeing any "kid" events, but I could be wrong...and, yes, unless you have pre-arranged shuttles and trip events planned, you will need a rental car (Enterprise is right on hotel site to rent) to go anywhere, since the hotel is set almost a mile back off the main road...nothing within walking distance. Spa is very pricey - $80 for a pedicure and $180 for a massage (30 min I believe) not including tip......eh...it could wait till I got home....again, resort prices....to be expected. Outside the resort - things to do - within 30-40 min driving distance on the island - Old San Juan..very cool....Bacardi factory tour - very interesting...and 4 hour catamaran sail, with snacks & drinks included - on the Carribean side, was incredibly beautiful! Our company provided the catamaran trip, but I remember hearing the concierge telling someone else it is about $150 per person to go...but, this is money well spent! I too, would rate this about a 3 star hotel, instead of a 4 star....I travel alot, and this hotel was nice but falls below the bar of a 4 star hotel as rated.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: estufilla
Reviews.Content: Good and clean hotel. Not recommended for young people. Overpriced, don't pay 6.00 dollars for a Medalla beer, this is the cheapest beer in PR and you can buy a box of 12 cans for 10.00 dollars. The price of onebeer is 1.25 around the island. Don't be fool!

Reviews.Title: “Beach location near the rainforest”
Reviews.Author: Adcarp08
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport and El Yunque. Check in was a breeze and we even got an ocean view room, which I did not book! The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were a nice size. There are portions of the hotel that show some age, but personally that does not bother me. We did not utilize the on site restaurants, since we had a car we chose to drive to nearby restaurants for dinner. The gym and pool areas were nice as well. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs were bad”
Reviews.Author: Keshab1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel !! Nice view however the beach wasn't too clean and the bed bugs kill my trip!! Overpriced !! Thank God for our rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room, Great Pools, Very Good Gym, Pricey Food & Drink, Lacks Personality”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1234
Reviews.Content: Positives: our comfortable and clean room at the Rio Mar Resort made for a fine stay on our first night in Puerto Rico, a drive of about 30 minutes from the international airport. The resort's grounds are expansive and beautifully maintained. The pool is ginormous. The fitness room is well equipped with modern work-out machines, but the sauna was not working. I enjoyed a small dinner at the tapas bar. Negatives: Food and drink are pricey, and you're kind of a hostage to it because of the hotel's somewhat remote location. That's got to be how this hotel racks up profits; Wyndham has some nerve to ask $7 for a bottle of water! Also, the atmosphere of the hotel itself was that of a soulless, impersonal convention palace -- kind of like living in a shopping mall. I'm sure the resort can offer a relaxing stay, but it lacked personality (apart from the property's gorgeous setting out of doors). My overall rating of this hotel would be 3-1/2 stars, if only the tool allowed for that.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back !!!”
Reviews.Author: sylvia G
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful but ... Day 1: Looks are deceiving . They screw-up our reservation with my husband's uncle room. Later that evening(late) Uncle Wendall arrived he had "NO Reservation and had to sleep in our room till the next morning. Uncle Wendall wears a sleep apnea device to sleep but guess what I did not. Day 2: While taking a shower (of course, the same time everyone else is) the water pressure was so low it quick altogether (no water) and then start again soooo one must take the shower as quickly as possible. Day 3 : People this was the "best day" because the bedbugs were sooo bad I again could not sleep CAUTION it was very bad. Day 4 : Among all the other days i had to inform room service to clean our room everyday and please change the sheets, PLEASE. They did but really should I have to make sure they clean the room. Day 5 Don't bother ordering lunch downstairs by the pool you will receive cold food and wrong order because they are short handed but you don't care because at that point you are starving, oh I lefted out overpriced. Not a good place to stay. Sylvia G.

Reviews.Title: “Great Tropical Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Duezoo
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had a great time at this hotel. It is close to rainforest. Beach was really nice. The food & bar was very expensive. I would recommend renting a car and checking out local spots. There is a great little out door style restaurant at the bottom of the hill. Great & food and very reasonable. You can also request a refig. for your room & get some beer & drinks. Would love to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dbirriel
Reviews.Content: To get started when we get to the room the hotel key did not open the door had to call security to enter the room. When I took my shoes off the floor was all dusty I had to put back on my shoes. The problem with the door happen 3 times that we had to wait for somebody to open the door for us and I travel with my kid that is 2 years old so imagen waiting for somebody to get there horrible. In conclusion not a very clean place and the security lock on the door don't function because it happen to others guest there that day and they did not offer nothing or excuse for the problem with the locks.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the bugs”
Reviews.Author: j w
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice. The workers were very nice and helpful. I wouldn't bother with the all-inclusive. The food is just average and there is much better eating outside the resort. The Booze is expensive so bring your own on the cheap. Watch out for the bed bugs, they claim that they are "certified" to not have them, but my wife and I were covered with bites. Also, if you are going to book any excursions outside the resort, do it on your own, the resort based trips are way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free- Loved it with small children!”
Reviews.Author: bptours
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all of the previous tripadvisor reports! This was a stress free vacation from beginning getting off the airplane until leaving to head home. We signed up as Wyndham members and received free WiFI and refridge in each room. We were so happy that our reservations came through with actually getting attached rooms. MARBELLA was a wonderful kid friendly breakfast and lunch place. Children were free under 5 years old for the breakfast buffet. The waiters on staff were very friendly and helpful. POLIO was also kid friendly providing a kid menu and crayons with paper to entertain. THE GRILLE ROOM was also good for their appetizers, but I did not like the main meal. It was more upscale for the kid friendly meals. The best part of every day was going on the water slide in the family friendly pool for our 6 and 3 year old!!! TIPS: Book restaurants immediately for the dining time you want! You do not need to rent a car as everyone mentioned in previous tripadvisor reports. We had a wonderful selection of restaurants (as long as you booked ASAP) and there was a casual food place next to the casino for continental food or a large pizza pie for the family! My only suggestion if you are going to play GOLF is reserve the OCEAN golf course. The greens on the Riverview side was horrible, only the view was beautiful. I did not care for the Puerto Rican dance show at MARBELLA on friday evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great stays”
Reviews.Author: Aimz78
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel. Easy and quick check-in with room upgrade to Ocean-front. No complain. And the ground is nice and clean. Love it!!

Reviews.Title: “New Family Tips and Impression for Stay”
Reviews.Author: bcmwk
Reviews.Content: We're a family of three (2 adults, 1 teen) who stayed during the off-season in November '11. Here are some new tips and our impression for this resort. Wyndham Membership - Unless you're already a member and you booked through Wyndham it's pointless to join. There are no benefits. Room Food Service - Besides the room service menu there's a pantry service for rented refrigerators ($10 a day) that includes various drinks and snacks. Pool & Activities - There's a tiny pool for little ones to play in which includes water fountains. Every morning board games are placed at various locations. There are a number of vendors located on the pool grounds from tattoos to gifts daily. Restaurants - If you don't have a reservation ask if they can still serve you. Palio accommodated us in the Lobby Bar without reservations. Check out the lounge menus as an alternative to the main restaurants. Pool Restaurants - The Tiki Bar only accepts room or credit card charges. No cash. Might be similar at Sea Breeze. Sea Breeze has a Kid's menu. If you are looking for something specific ask cause some items are not listed like adult size order of chicken fingers and fries. Beach - Visit the beach/river area during low tide. It's located towards the right side as you enter the beach. Better water conditions, less waves and wonderful views. Entertainment - A pianist played standards nightly in the Lobby Bar. There were also various Latin players featured in the Boleros Lounge a few nights. However, we're not sure if this is consistent. Internet - While they provide some computers for access the connection is terribly slow. Also, out of five computers only two worked. Unless you have your own service don't count on internet service. Parking - When leaving the garage let the attendant know you will be coming back. You simply sign a form with your room number. Impression - While this resort was nice to stay we traveled daily to other places. If you like to lounge around the pool/beach and don't mind resort expenses then this place will do just fine for you. However, if you really want to experience the truly beautiful attractions of Puerto Rico then a car rental is a must have! Feel free to contact us for more advice!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamid6
Reviews.Content: This place looks BETTER than the pictures. My family and I were looking for a reasonably priced hotel but are accustomed to 4 star resort facilities with everything on the grounds. What a Jewel. I was a little fearful b/c this place is in Rio Grande and fairly Secluded but I think I found our New getaway in PR ! ABSOLUTELY stunning !!!!!!!! The staff was IMPECCABLE :) and I'm picky b/c I've worked in the Business. This is how the Hyatt and Ritz treat YOU ! Very well maintained & Gorgeous, Gorgeous interior Architecture and Grounds set on beach and adjacent to El Junque...the views don't get better than This ! - also Separate Adult and Childrens pools. - has a Plethora of things to DO too. I noticed a few complaints about the prices but it's no different than any other place in terms of meals/dinners. and hey it's not like the Atlantis ! :) If you want to sitesee you will either pay for the tours or rent a car, no access to local buses here. HOWEVER, This is a steal and easy 50-70$ less a night than the Condado and Carolina Marriott resorts with larger/nicer facilities here ! DONT MISS OUT !!!!! I Would go back AGAIN AND AGAIN ! for 130 a night this was a STEEL and rates cheaper later in the season !

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, yet overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: Stay 5-9NOV11. Very nice resort w/nice amenities. Iguana Bar mixing "whatever" alcohol available, NOT what the customer orders. Too many people working behind bar. "Room with Ocean View" might just be a glimpse of the Ocean. Great beds, dirty floors. Very good food, nice gift shop & excellent room service!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Rio Mar Oct 25-29th. I was traveling with a larger group on a golf vacation. Overall, this is a wonderful resort with superb staff and great facilities. The Details: Grounds - absolutely beautiful. Well maintained and clean public areas, pool, and beach. Pool area had plenty of seating (occupancy was over 95% on the last two days) and poolside wait service was prompt and friendly. There were plenty of chairs and umbrellas on the beach also. Hotel - beautiful lobby and public areas on main floors (1 and 3). Clean, well maintained and spacious even when at almost full capacity. There were places to get away from the crowds on these levels. There were sofas and chairs tucked into quieter spots and floor to ceiling windows looking out on the grounds and ocean. On the 6th floor the common hallways were freshly painted (signs still on the walls), but the carpet looked a bit worn. Some areas of the exterior could use a power washing. This was mostly higher floors near corners of the buildings. Check in was fast and easy. Front desk staff were always pleasant and very helpful. Jessica was extremely helpful in helping us figure out if there would be a room for an extra night if we couldn't get home because of the snowstorm in Boston. We self parked ($16 per day) but the bell staff was always friendly and helpful when we arrived back with golf clubs or packages. Room - I was very happy with the room. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. Linens and towels were better quality and very clean. The bathroom was spacious and clean. I really liked the large shelf behind the sink to store toiletries and personal items. The room was equipped with a decent sized safe (would have accomodated a normal sized laptop), extra pillows, blankets, ironing board, and iron in the good sized closet. Body and Bath brand toiletries provided were very nice. The decor was tasteful. The sliding door to the patio was somewhat cloudy. The balcony was clean and had a small table with two chairs. The view was phenominal - over the pool and straight out to the ocean. Housekeeping was stealth - we never saw them but the room was always clean and we had more towels. The room also had a large desk and chair, dresser with 6 drawers, and a large flat screen tv. Food/Drinks - overall decent and definitely "resort" prices. The Tiki Bar and Grill has a drink special everyday so if you can be flexible with what you drink you can save some money. The tuna salad sandwich was great, the Mahi Mahi sandwich was just ok, and the grilled cheese was lousy. Towards the end of the week when it became busy our orders got a little messed up (wrong sides, drinks we didn't order arrived). Our package included breakfast at Marbella every morning. The menu was your average hot buffet offerings - including an egg/omellette station. The selection and food quality were good and the waitstaff was superb. We never had to wait for coffee, juice, or our check when we were ready to leave. We had the same waiter most days ("Winnie") and he was fantastic. The snack bar (ERL) had some fantastic desserts (Coconut Kisses and Chocolate Mousse) and their cheese pizza was pretty good. We ate most dinners off the property. We did try to order a late dinner from room service one night but they did not answer the phone. After 20 minutes of trying room service we went downstairs and ordered some risotto from Palio to go and it was quite good. Others in our party raved about the scallop and risotto dish there. Spa - I had a 50 minute massage at the spa. The facilities are very nice and Eleanor gave a great massage. She had some very helpful tips for me after the massage to reduce strain on my back. My time there was very relaxing. Golf - I played both the Ocean and River courses. October is off season and the greens were in transition on both courses so I can't speak to their speed or playability. Other than the greens, both courses were in fantastic shape and beautifully maintained. Both were very playable (unlike the El Conquistador- beautiful course but very difficult to play) but offered challenges along the way. While I was there there were a couple of heavy overnight rainfalls so the courses were pretty wet (the River course more than the Ocean). The scenery, wildlife, and backdrops (El Yunque Rainforest and the ocean) were breathtaking. Bring a camera with you when you play! The Ocean course only has one hole on the ocean (the 16th - a par 3) but it is a breathtaking and tough hole with the wind. i thought the River course layout was fantastic. The pro shop and clubhouse staff were exceptional (as we found most staff to be all over the resort) and if you stop at the snack hut after the 9th hole on the River course William will always make you smile! The shuttle to the course ran a continuous loop so there was never more than a 10 minute wait.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar: great golf, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rio mar with a group of 16 arranged by Dave G of Golf & Gamble. We really have to say the staff at this hotel were among the friendliest and most helpful ever. The property has a great pool & beach area and two golf courses, which we enjoyed. The River course is tougher so if you are new to golf play the Ocean course. As far as golf goes these courses are on the premises so you don't need to travel to play, which gives you more beach or family time. The best thing about this property is the wide range of experiences available: as far as food goes you can eat by the pool in flip flops are go out dressed up to one of their finer restaurants: we are at the Italian restaurant one night and the Grill Room the other: both excellent. Would definetely return! Gary from NYC

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: kiev1049
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our stay in this hotel. The best part of our stay was the fact that beach there is long and turns into lagoon, which makes it very nice to take a long walk and swim in the lagoon/bay where waves are not as strong and the view is breathtaking. The beach at the hotel is not very clean. It is a public beach, but is 100% partonized by the hotel guests. The drinks and food are offered at the beach by the hotel restaurant, but cleaning of the beach is left to a municipal services. There are plenty of plastic straws, cups, cigaret butts and etc left on the beach. Only one garbage can, which is at the exit from the beach. In general beaches up to the laggon are full of the refuse/trash and that is a spoiler. In the lagoon area beaches are cleaner. We did not eat at all at the hotel, due to high prices and there are plenty of eating places around. I read many reviews and was prepared for that. Our room was on the 7-th floor with a beautiful view of the mountains. We had fridge in the room and this was nice.There is no entertainment in the evening and casino does not have "fun" machines to play on. Hotel staff is very friendly. Drivers in San Juan are absolutly terrible, so be careful. They switch lanes without signals and when there is almost no space between cars. I got beaten by something from toes to the back during last several days of our stay. Not sure if it was during night or by the bugs on the beach. My husband did not get beaten as much as I did. The weather was perfect all week and that help to make this vacation memorable. Free internet is available, but only 2 computers were working and are slow. Pillows were not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jesse H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 days on business and had a very pleasant time. The food was a bit expensive for its quality, but the building itself and the setting was great and the staff is extremely kind and helpful. I had a couple of maintenance issues with my first room and for the inconvenience they upgraded me to a very nice ocean suite for the same rate. It is for sure a place to come back too!

Reviews.Title: “Looked great, but”
Reviews.Author: Nereida A
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice, but room was small for 3 people, smelled moldy and maid service was terrible did not get room cleaned on the 2 day till 4pm, and then did so with guest in the shower........ food was really expensive everywhere in the resort......took you anywhere from 20 mins to 40 mins to get to your car in the garage, and when you came back the lot would be full and you had to park in a dirt road parking lot that was not well lit.No posted signs for extra charge to use parking lot, still had to pay to park in dirt lot, too.Resort only had activities on Thurs. thru Sunday.We were there Friday to Friday nothing to do in resort 3 days, nothing at all look and felt like a ghost town. Music speakers did not work have the time........... I was not impressed at all. Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “It's just allright”
Reviews.Author: Alexd777
Reviews.Content: 4 star??? i doubt it Pros: Great location Nice private beach Friendly staff Cons: Pricey drinks $7 Bottles of water in the room -are you kidding???? Thin walls-- you will be able to hear everything you neighbors do High humidity inside the hotel and smell

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Erin Q
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal at Cheap Caribbean where we booked our vacation. The Rio Mar Resort is amazing!! Situated in the lush landscape on the ocean we had a room overlooking the courtyard with a scenic view of the sandy beach & blue water. Staff exceptionally friendly. Our room was so comfortable, the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Housekeeping kept our room looking great each day. We went with our 13 y/o and 2 y/o. The resort is kid friendly and the pool with slide was a family favorite. We recommend renting a vehicle so you can travel outside the resort for not only sight seeing (El Yunque Forest is a 15-20 min drive from Rio Mar Resort) but good food at a fraction of the hotel's prices. Great food isn't hard to find and its only 5-10 minutes away. Bohio de Luquillo on Hwy 3 has excellent prices and delicious food. Only quam is it was $15/day to self park & $20/day for valet. Often the lot was full. I guess the 3rd Friday of each month the Resort has some thing going on that brings people there in droves so be aware that if you book your trip and its on the 3rd Friday of the month parking may be near impossible. Overall HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! We'll be back for sure. Wyndham hasn't let us down yet!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed here for a full week. It was a great location, and yes, a rental car is a must if you want to leave the area. We got a pretty good deal, so I thought it was worth the money. We also got an ocean/courtyard view that was really fabulous. Good points: Beautiful hotel lobby and grounds. Pools were nice, as was the hot tub. Restaurant choices were good, especially the snack bar near the casino! Most of the staff was very friendly, and the valet service was reasonable. Concierge folks were great! The Mandara Spa was also very nice! The room had tiled floors. Not-as-good-points: Rooms do need some updating. There were some small spiders in our coffee maker, but it was replaced right away. One of our phones didn't work, and when the other one stopped working, it took two days for it to be replaced. Room service wasn't very timely. We also didn't have any information or a phone book in our room upon arrival. We did receive a $50 room credit when we explained our disappointments upon check out, so that was nice. I would definitely stay here again, but I also would be open to checking out other places.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellerUSA71
Reviews.Content: Just got back from PR and I can tell that Rio Mar was our good choice. The hotel locates in the nice area - so close to El Yunque National Forest and right on the clean beache. They had beautiful pools for both adults and kids. Restaurants on-site are quite expensive but the foods taste good. You should rent a car to run around the area. Don't forget to check out the Luquillo Kiosks - this long row of local restaurants are right on Route 3 - just minutes from the hotel. Will recommend this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh... Don't tell October is the Best time to Visit!”
Reviews.Author: joe-tricia
Reviews.Content: My second visit to Rio Mar was a success. We had a ocean view suite... Mostly good view despite a little blocked by the roof of the floor below us. This room was a little under decorated compared to last years smaller room. The suite was more than big enough with a nice sized walk-in closet, separate dressing area & bathroom. The balcony had cigarette butts & paint that had peeled from weather. There was unidentified garbage that appeared to be left over food wrapped up, between mattress & head-board. Only found it cause I dropped my hair band. We notified the front desk & after a quick apology, our room was deep cleaned & sheets cleaned. That was all my negatives over a seven night stay, so not too bad. Overall I love this resort & plan to return. I was a little disappointed in the lack of reaction in my reporting my findings behind the mattress, I was thinking the grossed out factor deserved free parking or room service! I enjoyed Shimas for dinner one night, even though the prices are way too high for the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with the best beach front”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: i went to the Rio Mar on a company vacation and to put it simply I was completely amazed how nice of a resort the Rio Mar was. Every possible luxury was offered there, it was by far the best vacation I've ever had, and it was a company trip!! The location is excellent, the food was perfect and I would gladly go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Amanda C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went aug 25 to the 29 (right after Irene hit). we were very hesitant about going but he had everything all planned the the hotel confirmed us that our stay would be pleasant. The resort was gorgeous! It is way up far away from the surrounding towns. The golf course was down though because they had flooding and trees that were down from the storm. Our room was nice, we had the mountain view, which was gorgeous. The room did have a fridge which was great because we brought a whole case of water with us instead of spending $7 for a bottle of water. The beach was great....we walked up and down the beach almost every day. The tiki bar which is right next to the pool/beach is great for drinks and pub food (take advantage of their 2 for 1 deals!) For a couple you can plan to spend about $50 for each meal...there are few restaurants in the hotel and they are expensive. The casino is very small, we didnt spend much time there. we did the bioluminescent bay tour which is a must see! it was so beautiful. We were dissappointed that the rainforest was closed while we were there, but we did get to do the horseback riding which goes along the bottom of it. we had a great time doing that eventhough we are beginners. we also went to old san juan for the day...lots of shopping and dining there. You have to watch out there because there are people that try to con you for money, so be sure to watch your things. the pool is also were we spent alot of our time. the adult pool is very relaxing. It gets very hot there and the sun is strong so make sure to pack sunblock! Overall we had a great time and thought the resort was accomodating to us. there is not much to do there at night though so be prepared to leave the resort at night if you want to go out. We would definitley go back to PR but maybe stay on a different part of the island next time. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico Trip”
Reviews.Author: jtaylor911
Reviews.Content: Everything was beautiful and the staff was excellent. We loved the 24 hour adult pool and hot tubs!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: EmJay_1956
Reviews.Content: A week ago I spent the weekend working at this hotel. Have stayed here at least 3 times before, but first time on West Wing. Truthfully I can not give this hotel a bad review. The people at the valet parking were very nice, the same at the check in counter. The room was spacious and the toiletries were top grade. The room was rather cold but better than HOT!!!. The small Cafe besides the Casino has an excellent selection of fruits, coffee etc. Yes! prices are high but they are everywhere. I ordered room service and was told 35-45 minutes. Well 25 minutes later there was knock at my door.Food Okay but nothing to write home about, although the Hotel has what looks like a great selection of dinning spots. My concern is that every time I have stayed at this hotel the smell of mold and humidity is very strong. It was less noticeable at the West Wing, maybe some air filters or dehumidifiers can help,I know I ended up with an asthma attack. Other hotels in the area have the same problem, it should be looked into,as it can make an otherwise nice stay into one you will remember by the amount of medications you have had to take once you leave there. I was not the only one that got sick with the molds in my working team. So please look into it,otherwise the facilities are nice and the staff is pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it was two years ago”
Reviews.Author: YancieDale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two years ago at almost the exact same time period (Sept. 13-16, 2009) and enjoyed it so much we booked it for this trip (Sept 16-21, 2011). The hotel seems to have slipped slightly in some areas from two years ago. This review is based on our experience during the â€œoff season,â€� so things may be drastically different if you go during the â€œhigh season.â€� First, the good points: The rooms are still very clean and well maintained. The indoor areas are very nice and they still have live music in the lobby on weekends. Service at the one restaurant we ate at (Palio) was good. The areas that have slipped: There was some trash and debris around the adult pool Jacuzzi (we did not go in the family pool). There was no wait staff on any day at the pool area. The service at the lobby bar was terrible â€“ our orders were all incorrect, food took forever to arrive and our waiter appeared to go on break and we had to hunt down someone to close out our tab. We were â€œupgradedâ€� to a room with a â€œbetterâ€� ocean view. Unfortunately, it was on a very crowded hallway surrounded by very loud families and we were clearly a couple traveling alone. There were very few families in the entire place, so it seemed odd for us to be stuck in the middle of what appeared to be all of them. When I complained, it feel on deaf ears. Overall, we would stay here again because it is a convenient location and on the beach where we get wave sounds, but it is not as nice as it was last time and is probably over-priced for what you get. Some advice if you are staying here: Visit the Kiosks in Luquillo! We did not last time and could have kicked ourselves after discovering them this time! We ate at 4 of them and the food was amazing at each one. Donâ€™t be intimidated when driving in because of the large crowds of local kids at the first few restaurants and the overall appearance of the buildings. The best food we ate on the entire island was at numbers 13, 2 and 21. We also had fritters at #60. They were excellent. I have written reviews on each kiosk individually. The pricing is a little less than the hotels, but the quality of the food is definitely far greater than large resort food. Also, if the waves at the beach outside the resort are too strong, then visit the beach in Luquillo. There are practically no waves and the beach is very nice and clean. Just go on a weekday when it is not as crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: JohnPD2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort while visting our son who was working in the El Yunque Rain Forrest on a goverment project. Would not have chosen to come here otherwise. As this was the off season we didn't know what to expect. The resort is very nice. We had Ocean Front rooms on a high floor and glad we chose this option. The room was well appointed, but could use and upgrade. The resort has four of five restaurants, but only selectively open during the week. You definitely need a car if you stay here. Since we had some local knowledge we ate a some local restaurants off the beaten path. We toured the rain forrest and took a day boat trip to Culebra, which require a car. The resort has two golf courses, but only one was open due to recent storm damage. The staff and people were friendly. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice, nice...”
Reviews.Author: Marieke17
Reviews.Content: Lovely property and beautiful beaches. We came in September and the weather was perfect! Food is a liitle pricy at the resort but there are enough local restaurants close by, easy to leave the property and eatore local fare. Would definitely come again and recommend to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: titibalou
Reviews.Content: Most posts hit the nail on the head regarding this average 'resort'. That this hotel is referred to as a 'great resort' by some is somewhat subjective and puzzling. For someone like me who has been around the world and stayed in really nice hotels (Australia, Africa, India, Japan and Europe), Wyndham Rio is average at best. Here are my thoughts: The good: * Grounds are well maintained. * Lobby is impressive, clean and luxurious. * Restaurants are good (but food is salty, like everywhere else on island). * Staff is helpful and friendly. The bad: * Restaurants are very expensive with somewhat slow service. * In terms of quality of materials and decor, rooms are just a notch above Holiday Inn. * Bathroom was very average. Looked good at first sight but quickly showed its average quality upon further inspection. Like room, hard to describe...you'll understand when you see them. * Alcohol in bars and restaurants is expensive. * In-room refrigerators are available, but for a fee. * On a daily basis room service trays were left outside rooms (in hallway) for hours before finally being picked up. Not hotelâ€™s fault if guests leave them outside, but Ritz or Four Seasons hotels would take them away quickly. * Hallways are no better than in an average hotel. Carpet was worn and old, some wallpaper was peeling and there were a few noticeable dents and scratches on walls. * You have to give up your beach chair and umbrella by 5pm! After that you're out of luck. I could perhaps understand if they did it 1 hour before sunset, but not at 5 on the dot in the summer! * Adult pool is worn and needs to be rebuilt. Bottom is patched up and clearly in need of repairs. Also, there were hundreds of little (1") white crabs thriving in pool which lead me to wonder if they use chlorine? * Casino is small, dirty and terrible. Never once did a waitress drop by and ask if I wanted a drink (after losing $60 playing slots in 1 hour). Beach sand on damp chairs and carpet, and staff looked bored. Bar inside casino was closed (indefinitely) and entire place felt dull. * Parking garage casino elevator entrance smelled like urine. * Not a cheap hotel - inexcusable given what they charge per room. * Pool-side massage and spa ridiculously expensive. Almost what youâ€™d pay at the Mandarin Oriental, but this is not the Mandarin. * Overall, hotel was disappointing and felt somewhat dirty (except for lobby and gardens). Maybe if they stopped calling it a resort, and charged less, people would have lesser expectations and enjoy it more. Tips: * Try at least one of the hotel restaurants. Food is good, but salty and service is slow. * Casino sucks! Not sure what else to say about it other than you will lose your money there if you gamble. * Breakfast buffet is not too bad, but overpriced and nothing special given what they charge for it (your standard boring hotel breakfast buffet). Just your average cheese selection, cold cuts, cereals, uninspiring fruits, doughy pastries, pancakes, omelets, bacon...a Dennyâ€™s breakfast in buffet format. What happened to island specialties like roast pig? Selection was as original as a breakfast buffet in a large city hotel. Save your money and drive down the road (PR-968) towards PR-3, where there are a couple of mom and pop restaurants. Nothing amazing, but cheaper than what hotel charges. * For lunch or dinner, go a couple of miles east on PR-3. On left side of road youâ€™ll see â€˜shacksâ€™ which are actually restaurants. Thereâ€™s probably 30 of them in one row; some bad and somewhat seedy, others that are excellent. * Try the roast pig (Lechon) around Cayey. Lots of restaurants in area and lots of choices; drive around and donâ€™t pick first one you find. * Try Richie's restaurant just up the road. Amazing elevated panoramic view, and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away they have bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: fharo
Reviews.Content: went with my family and came back covered in bites on body arms legs and feet. So many bites on legs and feet I couldn't wear shoes for weeks. The hotel didn't change my room but fumigated half way through our week there. It didn't help. Hotel also did not compensate us for our trouble,apologize,offer free night,nothing.stay away from these moldy infested rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Very sad and dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Michelle0612
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with my stay. I checked in at 1:00 and was given a very good room, I left the hotel and when I came back the room to the door was open. I went to the front desk and they told me housekeeping probably left the door open. I was not happy but I had an event to go to.
