The next morning I went down for breakfast I came down around 10:45, apparently they wanted to close down because the service was awful!!! My friend asked for the omelet and I asked for a waffle. The lady started to make the omelet and when I asked if I she could make the waffle with some chocolate chips she said that I had to tell her before she made them, she gave me the waffle and I told her I didnâ€™t know that she was already making it, she turned around and left. I was furious. I left and when I went to the room there was someone in my room, she told me the front desk had given her a key WITHOUT ID OR BEING AUTORIZED IN THE ROOM. I went to the front desk, I WAS SO MAD AND THE FRONT DESK DID NOTHING. The guy that gave her the key (joshue) simply said that he had given her the key without asking for ID. The manager on duty said that she could make new keys, but that wasnâ€™t the point, he could give the new keys to someone!! We left for the pool and it was filthy! The only good thing about the hotel was a guy that worked on the beach called Eduardo, HE IS THE BEST!! My nightmare didnâ€™t end there, the next morning I went to the front desk to get my bill and was charged something to my account that didnâ€™t belong to me!! I asked to speak with a manager and she was kind, she removed the charges and the breakfast so I decided to give Marbella another try, not only was the service HORRIBLE MY COFFE CUP HAD A LIPSTICK STAIN!!!!!!! I decided to leave at that point and never return!!!!!!! I use to love this hotel and am very sadden to see what it has become. I work in the hotel industry (in front desk) and know the kind of service you should give and this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diana D
Reviews.Content: Is a nice hotel, with a superb view of El Yunque Rain Forest but is not wheelchair friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndahm Rio Mar-Where Average is Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Glownug
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for a week in early September. First impression driving up the long drive is that the entire resort looked tired and after staying there for a week it was confirmed. While some things have been updated it is all superficial. The first night our door to our room would not open up with our key, I went and got it rekeyed and it would still not open. Not even a red light would flash. I complained and they sent maintnence to take a look. At this point they tell us to just listen to the door and after the first mechanical sound to hit the door above the lock and then press down on the handle. They were able to get it open after three or for tries but it took my boyfriend many more and I couldn't get it. After wasting an hour of our time the were nice enough to give us a new room with a door that opened but neither room was the 4 star quality they advertised. The rooms have been remodeled sort-of. The bathrooms have new sinks but old floors and tubs and the water takes about 5 min to warm up. The bedroom was fine. Tiled floors and a comforable bed with clean linens, yet when you opened the drapes to enjoy the view along the bottom of the sliding door there was a signifacant amount of mold. It rained one morning and about an inch of rain accumulated on our patio and did not drain. The food was average and not cheap but not out of line with what I have seen at other similarly advertised resorts. We had much more fun venturing out in our rental car and eating at some local places. The pool area, grounds and beach were a bit dated yet well maintained and we enjoyed our time out there. The bugs (sand mites, no-see-ums and mosquitoes) were very bad-bring bug spray. (It's not bed bugs like some say). Overall we had a great time but not because of the hotel, because of the rainforests, Old San Juan, our snorkel trip and the beaches. We are younger and not that picky while I have stayed at many worse places I have also stayed at many many better ones. We did use time share exchange points so it was very cheap. If I had paid a lot for it I may have been more annoyed. I'm sure there are better maintained places for the same $$ on the island. Go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - do not EVER stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Jen V
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely HORRIBLE time at this resort. First problem - there were bed bugs. We asked to be switched to another room and they would not give us another room. We were both bit all over our legs and back. They had the nerve to tell us we brought them with us!! This is a health issue and absolutely unacceptable. Second problem - for close to a day the entire resort did not have running water. This was never communicated to us and when we called the front desk they continually lied to us telling us the water would be on in a few minutes or would just hang up on us. Again another health issue as we could not flush the toilet in our room and the toilets in the main lobby were so filthy from everyone using them that it looked like a sewage pipe exploded. DISGUSTING. We had to go down to the front desk and we got no help from the so called manager Joel Rojas. We were not even comped some bottled water or a meal. Again unacceptable. There was a huge line of people in the lobby and everyone was absolutely livid. Third problem - there was an issue with the cooling system for an extended period of time. The floor of our room, the walls, all our clothes and our suitcases were wet with condensation. I had to wash everything and my suitcase still smells like mold. Again, there was no communication from the hotel that there was an issue. Horrible customer service. Other issues - The room and hallways appeared dirty and smelled of mildew and mold. The pool was also dirty and had frogs living in it. I cannot say enough about how awful the customer service was-probably the WORST I have ever encountered on a trip. I really expected more from a Wyndham. I wouldn't even give them 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great scenery, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Sonadora89
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful location for a hotel. The rain forest in the background, a scenic beach on the other side, a pretty pool area as well. But it is far overpriced. The cheapest breakfast buffet cost $16.00 without tax or tip. Drinks are outrageously expensive. Service is pleasant and the rooms are comfortable, although not spectacular. Also, the overall design of the hotel is unusual and not user-friendly. Long walks and hard to get from one side to another.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay for a "2 STAR"”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels around the world with my wife (we are in our early 30's) and when I see a 4 star hotel rating - 2, I have to write a review. These are my pros and cons; 1. First, the hotel was empty and we still didn't get a deal. We asked if there was a better price and the lady with the attitude said NO. 2. Needs remodeling-(AC was not working well, needs paint, a lot of rust, towel rails falling off, lamp flickered and I think the mattress had bedbugs) 3. The service was good except for one of the front desk girls who wanted to overcharge us and had an attitude. 4. We had to move rooms because we could hear everything from the room next to us (we knew when they were going to the bathroom 1 and 2) I felt like the walls were made out of cardboard 5. They were nice enough to move us rooms but our neighbors decided to have a party until 3am that day...so we didn't get any sleep. I would pay $99 a night for this hotel until they remodeled it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and charges you for every little thing...”
Reviews.Author: GreywolfAbilene
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property -- the grounds are immaculate and the furnishings are well-done -- however, the value is simply not there when you consider that the restaurants are overpriced, the room is overpriced, you pay for parking after paying for an expensive room, you pay for internet in the room after paying for an expensive room, you automatically pay gratuities (unknown until you get the final bill), and breakfast is not included unless you ask for a special "package" rate when making your reservation. You are going to pay tax on every charge -- in fact, two taxes. The food is not bad, just overpriced. The service is not bad, just overpriced. The room is not bad, just overpriced. The water pressure in the room is very good, however the bathtub did not drain, so by the end of the shower you are standing in a half-foot of water. There were bugs in the room (two). No refrigerator in the room. Air-conditioning was very good. Noise around the room was ok. The ice machine on my floor did not work and sounded an alarm that repeated every few seconds for two days. The entertainment on Friday night in the buffet room was great, however you are going to pay $40 per person, plus taxes and gratuities for that experience. Two nights there ended up costing just over $650.00, which is exorbitant in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ortizbbci
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this resort. Some things you need to know. Def rent a car and stop at the walmart or supermarket on you way up and stock up on alcohol, water and snacks. The prices are ridiculous about 10.00 for a drink. We bought our beverages and kept them in the room in the fridge. Beware parking is not included and is about 15.00 a day. The food prices are also ridiculous, since we had a car we went off the resort for dinner and hit up the food stands during the day. Ladies, the outlets on route 66 are amazing. If in the are please do the kayaking in the bio bay and hit up Luquillo for some delicious frituras. Your just moments away from San Juan and we enjoyed the nightlife there. Those not from the island do not go to the concerige for tour and restaurant ideas, ask the guys at the valet or the bell hops they will direct you the best local spots which are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rio Mar. Will DEFINITELY be back.”
Reviews.Author: fainall
Reviews.Content: I was at the Rio Mar from August 25-29. Like others have said before, I was somewhat apprehensive about what I had gotten myself into with the Rio Mar. I had read more than a fair share of negative critiques. Let me tell you -- pay NO attention to them whatsoever. The Rio Mar and its grounds are beautiful and immaculately maintained. I agree with some of the reviews that the hallways could benefit from new carpeting. But with that being said, the rooms themselves are spacious and well decorated. The room floors are TILED. I enjoyed that aspect of it, it was another way to keep the room cool. The pools are gorgeous and clean. I particularly appreciated that "kids" were not allowed in the adult pool area. The beach was clean and Rio Mar had attendants who would set up an umbrella and bring out lawn chairs for those wanting/needing them. The ocean was perfectly fine for swimming. There were waves, but nothing that would prohibit anyone wishing to swim. The drinks at the pool and Tiki Bar are $11.00. Sure it's pricey, but I live in Chicago and I have paid close to or MORE than that for Mai Tais. I had no problem paying that for a DELICIOUS, carefully crafted drink that was hand delivered to me while on the beach. For those who think it's too much, pick up a six pack of Zima somewhere and go crazy. The Marbella Restaurant was a good way to start the day for breakfast. Again, I have read reviews denigrating Marbella, saying it was too expensive. The breakfast is buffet style (though they do have a separate breakfast menu) with lots of local grown fruits. I can honestly say they had the best cantaloupe I have EVER had in my life. On Friday, August 26th, they had Noche de Boricua featuring cuisine and music of the island. The chicken and beans and rice were almost as good as mi abuelita used to make! The Palio Restaurant specialized in Italian Cuisine and was superb and the waitstaff perfection. Attentive without hovering. One last thing about the Rio Mar staff: they couldn't be friendlier, more helpful and accommodating if they tried. Truly a remarkable staff who seem to enjoy what they do. Everyone from the Gift Shop to Frieda at Marbella, the staff make the Resort that much more special. You most definitely will need to rent a car or expect to pay exorbitant taxi fares. But with a car comes the freedom of zipping around wherever you need or want to go. The Rainforest (closed when we there due to Hurricane Irene) is a ten minute car ride from the hotel, as is Luquillo. Luquillo is a town due east on Route 3 that has several restaurants or kioskos. They are amazing and a good value. I'm with everyone on making a pit stop at Amigo before getting to Rio Mar. it's on Route 3 about five minutes from the resort. I stocked up on water, beer and various treats for late night snacking as well as some sunscreen. So in summary forget the haters out there -- this is a fantastic place and i will definitely return in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beachfront resort”
Reviews.Author: R55wilson
Reviews.Content: It's a 1 hour drive to the old San Juan and somewhat isolated but it's great for golf and relaxing. They have a separate pool with slide for kids and showers coming off the beach. Very large resort with acres of grass and walking paths. The fitness center is very small and limited. As with most hotels don't expect the internet service to be fast or reliable. Restaurant food was good and prices were about what you would expect. Rooms and service were reasonable size, and clean. Large Iguanas around the grounds but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: Kyle B
Reviews.Content: Go to El Junque Rain Forest, Play Bingo with the Locals, have a hotel taxi driver bring you to get some real puerto rican food, swim in the pool with the Iguana's, lay on the beach, walk the beach for an entire day, would advise against the Steak Tartar due to my own preferences. Don't have a picnic on the beach by yourselves after sunset, apparently it's dangerous to do and the hotel staff rides a golf cart to the edge of the property to find you and warn you to come back..... allegedly. Enjoy, it's a beautiful vacation getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed820
Reviews.Content: Despite all the problems associated with the Hurricane and even missing a day of our honeymoon because the airport was closed, this was a great trip. Sure, nerves were tested because of the water situation (as mentioned below) but I mean itâ€™s a hurricane that passed through! Being from New England people are still without power and water a week later, so a few hours is not bad all things considered. The hotel did the right thing and took 25% off all meals and drinks to compensate. The staff was extremely friendly and super efficient in cleaning up the beach and grounds after all the debris from the storm. This is relatively far from San Juan but not that bad of a drive. I know most of the other reviews say rent a car but being our honeymoon, my wife and I just wanted to relax and not explore much more then the pool, beach, and Tiki Bar. If you do this, I would recommend taking a cab to the supermarket and stocking up. That saved a ton of money. The restaurants were very good and honestly not that expensive (maybe being used to NYC prices helped). This hotel will do everything they can to make things right and I would definitely go back or recommend to anyone wanting a getaway. One piece of advice, get a LOBBY ADVENTURE at the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: csrc222
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day after hurricane Irene hit. The hotel was very nice about offering guests free in-room movies and discounts at the restaurants. The hotel rooms need to be updated. The furniture and bedspread especially. The bathrooms don't have fans and it can get steamy. The most positive thing about the room was the beds. The comfort of the beds rival The Four Seasons'. Housekeeping was spotty but the staff in general was quite friendly. The adult pool was always really crowded while the kids pool was noisy. The beach was nice although after the hurricane it had a lot of debris.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: tcuckt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar 2 days after Hurricane Irene and this hotel was our 2nd choice. After reading the reviews, we were very nervous. Upon arrival, check-in was smooth and we had a partial ocean view room with a balcony. Our room did smell a little musty and we had to get an air freshener. The rooms, hallways, carpet, etc need updating but the main common areas are nice. The food at the hotel is barely edible â€“ we had a decent tuna wrap and something from Shimas but other than that, it was terrible. I had a spa treatment and really enjoyed that so splurge for a spa treatment. The pools are okay and there were multiple pools to choose from. The casino was small and the slot machines are limited â€“ lots of 1 and 5 cent machines. Check-out was also smooth so no complaints there. They have a lot of staff so very attentive to their guests. Overall, itâ€™s okay for the money â€“ I would expect better from a Wyndham resort. Some tips â€“ stop at Ralphâ€™s before you check in and pick up liquor and food â€“ worth it so you can save money. In the same shopping center as Ralphâ€™s is a Tacomaker and Maggie Mooâ€™s â€“ both better than hotel food. Try the Luquillo Kiosks (#44 Dieguito and Markitosis the best) where you can get good food and cheap but strong drinks.

Reviews.Title: “On The Verge of Being a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: RedPenguin02
Reviews.Content: Brought my wife and our two tween daughters for a family vacation. The location was perfect -- on the beach and somewhat secluded. The Rio Mar is a very good resort overall. The staff is friendly, the rooms and bathrooms are clean. The food is decent but way overpriced in my opinion. You'll probably want to do as we did and eat at the many restaurants along Highway 3 to save money. My one major complaint was the parking and the parking garage. I despise being charged for parking at hotels, though that does seem to be the trend in the travel industry -- to nickel and dime vacationers to death. As for the garage, it is poorly designed to start with, plus on Friday and Saturday nights when there are parties and dancing going on at the resort the parking garage fills up leaving no place for guests to park. To the hotel's credit, they did allow us to use valet parking and took off the difference in cost. Oh...the live music played on the lobby floor on Friday and Saturday nights lasts until past 1:00 and can be heard in the rooms unless the TV is on. By the way, I highly recommend having a rental car. As for the hotel, we had a view of the ocean -- they upgraded our room from a mountain view. However, you cannot go wrong with either the view of the mountain and rain forest or the ocean! It looked like all rooms had balconies. The hotel is on the verge of being an exceptional resort if a little more time and effort were applied to its upkeep. There was a poor patchup job behind our room door where the knob had evidently put a hole in the wall. The tub was obviously quite old and was stained. The exterior of the hotel, with the exception of the parking garage, was meticulously kept. If you go, be sure to watch for crabs crossing the streets at night and iguanas during the day!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Down!”
Reviews.Author: Arlene R
Reviews.Content: Too much to write so I am only going to list all that went so wrong! - rooms smelled unclean. Very loud bagging noise, black mold in bathroom - they only changed my room after I complained to getaway company i booked through - manager told getaway company they had upgraded me and I was happy. Manager never spoke with me and they only switched me to a higher floor room - NO Upgraded - Pool appeard dirty - All ice machines were broken and room where these machines were kept , had no working electric - Pool towels were stained/dirty - Althought the resort has lots of potential, it is very dirty and not resort standards. - We did speak to Danny Williams, General Manager and communicated all to him. For this we received a free breakfast in the not so good hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “No Way!!!!bed bugs and many more bad things”
Reviews.Author: UsaJess
Reviews.Content: ok well here we go...if only i could show you the pictures i took! bed bugs everywhere!!!! got bit everywhere on my legs and back.Told the front desk and they said we brought them here! haha. No running water for a day/night. that means no showering or flushing of toilets! Offered no compensation.People were running around looking for places to do their business...overflowing toilets. Dead fish all over the beach. Flooded stairways. looked like the titanic. Kept charging us over and over again for the breakfast that was supposed to be free along with the dicscounts in the package that we puchased and they had an excuse to why we coulndt use any of them! Horrible service..never even apologized for the inconvenience of the water...food was so expensive! 15 dollar cheeseburgers ..is probably the cheapest thing for a meal. i would not recommend this place nor will i ever return!

Reviews.Title: “Already thinking about making a trip back”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcW
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I had to put in my 2 cents. My husband and I traveled to PR for our first anniversary. Yes, the rooms don't have as many amenities as other Wyndham resorts, and they are a little outdated, but we did our research before going, so this was not a shock. First tip: rent a car! That was one of the first tips that I read in researching the property. Car rental is relatively cheap if you know where to look. We were even upgraded to the same model SUV that I drive everyday anyway. We did a biobay tour, repeatedly visited the Luquillo kiosks, drove out to Arecibo and old San Juan, and drove as far as possible into the rainforest before selecting a trail to hike. The price of the car for a week plus the few expenses we had for tours we booked on our own were much cheaper than booking through the resort. Second tip: stop at the Wal-Mart on your way to the resort and pick up a Styrofoam cooler and your favorite adult beverages, as well as snacks the will keep well. You can take anything down to the pool and no one will bother you. When we checked in (very late at night!), we asked about an upgrade, but there were 2 conferences on site and the place was booked! We were given a room on the first floor facing the pool and did not care for it. We asked for a change and were immediately moved to a higher floor, facing the rainforest, with the on-property nature preserve right outside our room. The property is wonderful. We thought all of the common areas, inside and out were beautifully maintained. Having the beach so close was amazing, although it is not the cleanest beach I have ever seen. We ate a few times at the pool bar and the lobby bar and Iguana's Pub, but not so much at the other restaurants, mainly because we were out and about so much during the week. The food and drinks were a little pricey, but, again, we knew what we were getting into before arriving and budgeted accordingly. Richie's, up the street from the resort, has a gorgeous view and the food/drinks are a little cheaper. But watch out for their signature drinks because you will spend twice as much as the resort! (But they are so good!) It's hard to find, but watch for signs along the road ;) We visited the concierge desk just about every day before heading out on our excursions. The staff was very helpful. Ask for the best directions to drive to Old San Juan and they will give you parking recommendations and a run down of the best restaurants and attractions. We planned to see the Bacardi factory, but we were told the locals thought Bacardi was swill and to drink DonQ instead. Loved it so much that we brought many bottles home! We also visited the pool bar almost every day for happy hour... 2 for 1 rum punch! On the last day of our trip, we rented a cabana (which we received for free by attending the owner update). When we scheduled the cabana, we had no idea which one we would possibly want, but the guy who set us up gave us the best (#4) available, right along the adult pool. The cabana came with a cooler full of assorted sodas (and plenty of room to add your own favorite adult beverages) and a basket of snacks. Around lunch time, they delivered fruit salad, and they had servers to bring you anything else that you need. We had 2 issues at check out - we were charged 9 days of parking when we only stayed for 7, and our cabana rental was not properly credited. Both issues were fixed immediately after a quick stop at the front desk. Overall, the rooms could use an upgrade, but they are still very nice. It may seem that everyone is on island time and the service is a little slow, but relax and enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Would try the Melia resort next time I wanted to stay in this area of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: thegyp26
Reviews.Content: If I were to go to this part of PR again I would try the Melia resort as I did not enjoy the Wyndham Rio Mar. It has gone down hill since Westin sold it to Wyndham. The lobby of the resort and the grounds including the pools are still very nice and you will enjoy them. The problem is, that is where it ends. The rooms are ridiculous, they are in need of being up dated and need a thorough cleaning. Our "Ocean Suite", really a big guest room with extra space, stunk of mildew so bad that I had three air fresheners in there and I would spray constantly, but nothing helped. The furniture, couch and chair stunk so badly that I would not even sit down. I guess you are wondering why I did not switch rooms, well I did, four times and they all smelled the same. In addition to having that horrible smell all the furniture always felt damp and wet and it is also out dated and needs to be replaced. All the concrete around the sliding glass door, both inside and out, looked rusty and needs to be repaired. The other thing about the room was that you had to keep the air conditioning on BLAST at all times or the room would become swampy and the tops of the furniture, the mirrors and the floors get wet and the floors are slippery, as they are tile. When the housekeeping dept. came to open the sofa bed I asked about the air conditioning with relationship to what happens to the room and they said you have to keep it really cold or it gets wet. Wonderful, 90 during the day outside and 40 degrees when we went to bed. I actually considered sleeping at the pool but my husband thought I was crazy. The food is rather expensive but the real problem is that it was terrible. I mean terrible as in you will not be able to eat it, sometimes. The buffet breakfast was good and the lunch at the pool was adequate but otherwise the food was lousy. I strongly recommend you leave the property to eat. In order to leave the property you absolutely need a car. There is nothing immediately around the hotel. If you have a car the charge is 20 a night for valet or 15 a night for self park. Added to that charge are two taxes. If you do self park the area you park in is underground and disgusting. The concierge is a waste of time. No matter what you ask for their only advise is to do it in the hotel. For example, I asked for a good Italian restaurant and they said to go to Palio; I asked for good pizza and they told me the little quick food kiosk outside the casino; we asked about zip lining they only wanted to tell us about the tour company they have there. In addition, be prepared to be asked to take part in their time share program. I think it was time share, but I know for sure they wanted you to go do something to buy into the condos they are building. You will also be constantly asked about attending one of these things at the pool when you request your towels. Generally, the concierge staff is useless so do your investigating before you go. Housekeeping was fair at best. If you stay a week they will probably skip your room at least once. You never get everything on any given day, sometimes no bath towels, other days no face cloths, others no coffee packets. If you have an accomodation that has a sofa for other people to sleep on, they will open it the first night and then never close it, so you never get to use the sofa, as a sofa, not that you would want to. Another small problem was that you are not allowed to bring any coolers, even small ones that fit only two drinks, to the pool area. They want you to buy their drinks, which are not cheap and not large, they actually have people walking around, like pool police, and if they spot any beverage that does not appear to be purchased from the pool bar, they will ask you to get rid of it. Finally, the last complaint I had was that on the two weekends that we were there, the occupation of the hotel was increased drastically with local people who come for the weekend; they check in on Friday and leave after breakfast on Sunday. While they are there it is really crowded and you wait for everything. PS I would have left the Rio Mar and gone somewhere else but we were travelling with other people.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous beach resort”
Reviews.Author: jacki_scott
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice at the Rio Mar. No suites were available, so we had side-by-side rooms with our family. The whole place was beautiful...and what a perfect beach. Warm, wavy waters and a great pool as well. The restaurants and beach bars provided everything that we could need, although it was very pricey for what we got. Hotel service to rooms seemed slow when we called to ask for something. The staff was nice enough. There are several types of rooms you could stay in. We had friends who stayed in one of their apartment-style suites, which was very comfortable with a living area, separate rooms, and kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds,,,,,but the rooms need major updating!”
Reviews.Author: mommie1214
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through price line for $80. Per night. i was very worried about my stay after reading alot of mixed reviews. I enjoyed my stay in puerto Rico. The hotel grounds are amazing, the staff very friendly. The rooms are very out dated, and the carpet in the hallways are stained. if the hotel would update the rooms the hotel would be a 5 star hotel. The beach is amazing, it's like a deserted beach on your own private island. The food at the hotel was extremely expensive. We ate at the hotel once; and that's all it took to realize not to eat there again (the food was not good for the prices they were charging). We ate at the bakery down the road called Isamar bakery (all Im gonna say is AMAZING)

Reviews.Title: “Might be back”
Reviews.Author: Buchka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. Check-in is at 4pm. We arrived there earlier ant they checked us in promised they will contact us when the room will be ready. They didn't and after waiting until 6pm we asked what was happening. Someone forgot to call us and we got the room immediately. We asked whether an upgrade is possible and they apparently upgraded us. When we entered the room it was clean and nice however the view was horrible. I don't know where they planned to put us before the upgrade. The room was on the 4th floor and on the right side of the balcony we saw a wall on the left was the roof of the hotel. Luckily we didn't spend that much time on the balcony. They have GREAT beds! The pool area is nice with a water slide for children. The pool is clean they serve drinks around there. The hotel is kind of remote and if you plan to spend some time outside of the hotel you need a car. The tours that they offer in the hotel are expensive; you can get same tours for half the money elsewhere. What I missed was that someone (receptionist?) would inform us at the arrival on where to find certain things (hotel restaurants, tour desk, kids club, â€¦). Food: The breakfast restaurant was great. There is a choice of a la carte, continental breakfast (16$) buffet or full breakfast buffet (25$), buffet breakfast for children is 13$. There small coffee shop in the hotel is expensive (payed more for coffee than in Manhattan!). There are some small restaurants close and a small store (maybe a 5 min drive). Parking: they have valet or self parking. Self parking is around 16$ a day. We did not have any problems with the space. Donâ€™t just stay in the hotel â€“ go around and see the rainforest, go kayaking in the night and see old San Juan. It is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't our Caribbean dream vacation, but we still had fun.”
Reviews.Author: MyRally123
Reviews.Content: We own with Wyndham, and I must say that the other Wyndham resorts we've travelled to far exceed this one. But then, Rio Mar is just an associate resort (whatever that means). I read tripadvisor reviews months before our planned trip, so I kind of knew what to expect, but I have to say that Puerto Rico is a world of its own. It may be a US territory, but it's nothing like the US at all, other than having US chain restaurants, Walmart, and Kmart. The beaches at the Rio Mar were fairly clean, as long as you stay right in front of the resort. If you walk to the east, you will see a good bit of trash, but you will also get a beautiful view of El Yunque and a river that flows down into the ocean. We never had a problem getting chairs on the beach or around the pool. Towels were sometimes an issue, though. At our US beaches, the lifeguards start setting chairs out on the beach @ 7 AM, but that's not so in PR... they live on island time. Everything is done @ a leisurely pace (restaurant service included). We never ate at the restaurants at the resort because of the high prices. We ate in Luquillo at the kiosks or in Fajardo. These towns are 5-15 minutes away on Rt 3, but you really should rent a car to get there. I've heard taxi prices can be expensive. As far as excursions... if you rent a car, just book excursions through the companies, not the resort. East Island is good and that's who the resort uses, but the cost is much more through the resort. Maid service, room service we never used because we don't like people in our personal space, but we heard through other vacationers that their rooms were never cleaned, or either they wouldn't clean them until really late. Puerto Rico was really beautiful, but you must go in with an open mind. I can see how some people hate it because the island has a lot of trash. It seems like the islanders just lack the pride that I'm accustomed to where I live. A lot of them have an "I don't care" attitude, but don't let that ruin it for you. The rainforest and beaches are incredibly beautiful. We loved visiting Culebra and Vieques, and if you're the adventurous type, check out Aventuras Tierra Adentro for caving in the Camuy Caves... such an adventure-packed trip! Also, buy your own styrofoam cooler and beverages to keep in your room. It'll save you a ton of money. We never had an issue taking our own beer and drinks to the pool and beach. Hope you have fun! We did!

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: 4025NOMAR
Reviews.Content: We are here now, checked in August 20th and our check out is the 27th. Our first night we had kids making noise to well into the morning in the room next to us. Walls our thin and you can even hear toilets flush and showers start. Noises in halls are loud. We did complain to front desk and thankfully check out for those kids in 4023 (that seemed parents left alone in room while the parents were out) were checking out the next day. But this isn't the worse of our experience. Yes, we are here and Tropical Storm/Hurricane Irene came through. There are down trees all over the resort and the self parking is flooded which means every guest must valet. We purchased 3 rooms and are a party of 6 - room 4033, 4029 and 4025. We called the front desk to try and get complimentary internet service due to how crowded the hotel lobby is with all the vacationers trying to contact home and friends to tell them they are safe. The tables and chairs in Lobby are being used non stop. Casino is closed even after the sign said it would reopen Monday but it didn't. So back to my major complaint. They would not give our room complimentary internet access, hard to imagine any resort quibbling over $10 when you are dining at their restaurants exclusively due to conditions surrounding the area and having to pay valet each day and not be able to leave due to the mess of the storm. We asked to speak to a Manager but were denied. We did get a name of the manager and was told it was " Solebab" . Well Solebab if you or any of your service department are reading this then let me say that to deny internet access to your paying guests is a mistake. NO ONE LIKES BEING COUPED UP IN A HOTEL WITH NO CASINO AND AMENTIES CLOSED. At the very least you could have waived the $10 fee for internet, instead my husband and I are frequenting the lobby to find spots to converse back home when we could be doing it from the convenience of our room where we are basically bound to during this stay. Last night all six of us ate at Marabella, all they offered was $25 buffet due to the storm. We've tipped all your employees handsomely, "we" brought in the chairs and table off our balcony as you requested to get them out of storm and yet we are not feeling as though the customer service of this hotel deserves a revisit. This is our second trip to Puerto Rico and first and last to Rio Mar!! Pool looks nice but messy now - rooms are adequate but not worth the price. Food is okay but overpriced. Beer is $7.50 so be ready to pay high prices. We ate at Richieâ€™s our first night and our beers were $4. The view at Richieâ€™s was nice and food was okay. Not sure how the rest of the week will go for us, we have no idea how long the forest will be closed etc. and all we can think about is the poor service at our hotel for this expensive trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pools, a bit overpriced, rent a car if you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Arny E
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for several days in August. Pools were our favorite, they have a nice mix of sun and shade and are open 24/7 (towel hut closed at night). Nice grounds and decor all around. Easy access to large clean beach (note that sand is brown). Hotel has a small casino with limited games, and an even smaller cramped fitness center. Restaurants have great food, but are very expensive and not very Puerto Rican. We had minor issues (poor sound isolation, missing balcony furniture, scheduled events that didn't happen), but no major complaints (and no bedbugs). Overall a nice place, but in my opinion overpriced which is why I didn't rate it higher. Expect to pay extra for everything. Note that the hotel's West wing is near the casino and parking garage, East wing is near the pool. I strongly recommend you rent a car if you stay here. There are many good local restaurants and other things along Route 3, but absolutely nothing within walking distance of the hotel (which is over a mile from Route 3). El Yunque is less than 10 minutes away, and free (or $4 if you visit the visitor center), if you have a car. There's a great Mexican/PR restaurant one block west on Route 3 called Don Pepe's. There's a Walgreen's and an Amigo supermarket 2 miles west on Route 3 which are great for inexpensive supplies and snacks that will cost you a fortune at the hotel. Some people recommended the Kiosks (a strip of restaurants & bars in something reminiscent of a permanent flea market) that are 3 miles east on Route 3 along the water. We found them overall a bit dirty, unappealing and prone to mosquitos.

Reviews.Title: “Food NOT Fit For Humans”
Reviews.Author: KatyEB
Reviews.Content: We ate at all the restaurants located on the resort during our stay the Rio Mar. I tried to stay optimistic each day that one would somehow succeed the other, but sadly to say our eating experiences got progressively worse. We couldn't wait to return back home to NYC. EVERYTHING IS OVERPRICED!!! I wouldn't mind paying high prices for quality food, but every meal had some portion that seemed to be hardly edible. We are back home and I'm about to do a 7-day cleanse to rid myself of God knows what was in that food. Any attempts to find quality fruit or veggies, be willing to pay. $16 for fruit salad breakfast buffet at Marbella. Palio and Iguana's Pub over dress their salads, which makes the lettuce soggy and unappealing. Although the beaches were beautiful, we will most likely never return to PR. I can't tell you how many times I asked for plain tap water with a slice of lemon and they forgot to bring the lemon or even refill my water! As well as off the resort, the service is extremely slow and poor. You might pay considerably less for a meal, but expect it to be cold by the time you receive it. The only place you can expect to get decent service is in the Old San Juan restaurants. Besides the food, the pillows on the bed smell like body odor, so I had to use towels to cover them and sleep with.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but difficult to leave resort.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: When we checked in , they gave us our room keys and room #. That's it. No local attraction information, no brochures, not even information like a brochure on their spa. We wanted to go to the bioluminescent bay, rainforest, Old San Juan and the Bicardi Rum Factory. I went to the concierge desk. The woman there did not have any information. She gave us some tour brochures and said maybe we could take a taxi but that may be 150.00. She said she really didn't know. She said she would look into it and asked us to come back after dinner. We did and she siad she called a local personal taxi and he would come and speak to us. He was at the hotel quickly and had lots of local information, he spoke english too which helped. His name was Shawn Herrera from the Luquillo Taxi services. He was friendly and professional. We set up for him to take us to the rain forest the next day, he knew all of the trails and waterfall places. He stopped at all the important spots for pictures etc. (wear shoes with traction and your bathing suit under your clothes). After that he took us to the Kioskos to sample some traditional food. ( By the way, there are no resturants in the hotel that serve Puerto Rican food.) The next day he took us to Old San Juan which was also a great experience. So, overall beautiful Hotel, clean, friendly. But, if you stay here and want to go anywhere plan ahead and do not hesitate to call Luquillo Taxi and ask for Shawn!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Mack_1234
Reviews.Content: After spending a few nights in the heart of San Juan, my husband and I decided to move to the Rio Mar for a little decompressing and relaxation. Sadly, we were happier in the midst of city traffic and the hustle and bustle of the locals. We were given a king suite with ocean view. It turns out that while we expected a suite to have a refrigerator, it turns out none of the rooms have this amenity. According to the room literature, it's a fire hazard but honestly, we're convinced the hotel management would much rather not give the guests the opportunity to have left-overs or any kind of outside food which might prevent them from spending more money at the resort. This could further be evidenced by the $7 500mL bottle of water in the room. The good news is, the beach and grounds were well-kept and clean, with the exception of the dead cat (obviously there for at least a day) we saw lying on the curb at the golf course on our way out on our final day. There was no evidence of bed bugs (I always check) and the room was clean. The furniture could really use some updating and there seemed to be a major waste of space in our suite. Finally, check and re-check your final bill. We reserved the room with one credit card and later asked the person at the front desk to change the charges to another card. Unfortunately, we were billed twice: once on the first credit card and then again on our second card. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Hector V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this rio mar beach resort in puerto Rico and it was horrible. The hotel has an infestation of bed bugs, my wife got bitten as well as my daughters. The hotel has very limited activities and the price was too high for what they offered. They even charged $20 at night to the guess. I truly recommend for anybody NOT to visit this hotel

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED,HIDDEN FEES AT CHECKOUT,NOT WORTH IT AND WONT RETURN...SORRY TO SAY”
Reviews.Author: yorkzoo22
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one week trip, first impression when we (4 male family members) pulled up I asked the taxi driver if this was the right place. The overall resort foundation is deteriorating sadly, lawn and plants are pretty though. When we visited the tiki bar by the beach the first nightâ€¦get ready for itâ€¦14.50 for a cheeseburger and fried!!! What!!! But wait theres moreâ€¦tuna,turkey or chicken wrap by the casinoâ€¦8.50!!!! all the beverages and food are wayyyyyy overpriced. Yes I know vacation resorts are known for upping their prices for good reasons but cmon. Maid service was good..ski rentals by the beach are $50 for half hr meanwhile 20 feet next to the hotels ski rental place is a independent ski rental place that charges $10 less and their jetskis were much faster (we raced ï�Š). Oh and one of my favorites is the 5 min music video for free preview. While we got dressed to go out to the local bars we put on a song that it said was supposedly free. Well we got our hotel bill before we checked out yesterday and they wanted to charge us 16.43 cents for it going over the five minute time limit by one minute ( we finally realized its been more than 5min of it being on so we assumed that the hotel just let it run past the time and charges you and sure enough that was the case, a little underhanded? Thatâ€™s an understatment. It took a manager a whole 2 minutes to find in favor of me and eliminate those charges.) and my most favorite thing is the bell boys and most staff (taxi drivers ,beach boys etc) for some reason had a big staring and snikering problem seeing 5 african-american college educated guys from NYC walking around the resort.overall Iâ€™d say food is very very pricey,casino is small but ok, pool area is great,beach is nice and not crowded,stay away from the hotels ski rentals go with the guy 20 feet away, a rental car is a must since the resort is secluded in the el yunque rainforest, buy your own groceries at a supermarket 10minutes away called amigo,some guest and staff made it evident they donâ€™t see a lot of african american people there, the rooms are clean except for some mold in the vent by the shower and ants,atm charges are 2.50 by the casino,the gift shop is grossly overpriced,they charge $15 a day for storing your vehicle, only one nearby delivery place delivers to the hotel (itâ€™s a pizza joint),pool stays open 24hr.. p.s. I was really looking forward to seeing the lizards that their website says are plentiful around the pools. I saw one the entire time and mind you I stayed a whole 7 days! No I would not recommend this place when I return to lovely san juan. And I welcome a managers response. Oh btw,,i had a nearmiss in the elevators. they weren't working correctly from day one till the day i left.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach and pool but eating is an issue”
Reviews.Author: traveler1001_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort from 8/8 thru 8/13, 2011. Great staff, nice room with view of the rain forest. Hallway was a bit mildewy - carpets need cleaning. Only ate there the first day, after a very expensive lunch, decided to have their Mexican buffet at dinner. It was not edible and we were eventually credited for the meal. Didn't eat there again - there are great little places to eat in Luquillo, a mile down the road at the Kiosks, and in Old San Juan. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, the beach was empty and pool nice. A little quiet at night but we were there to relax so no real concerns. I recommend the hotel, just stop at Walmart to pick up drinks and snacks before you get there and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: quadfam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rio Grande and had a great time. As others have stated, Rio Mar is out of the way but that was what we were looking for. The hotel staff were very warm and the hotel itself was nice (nothing extravagant but we knew that going in). We rented a car for the weekend and had airport shuttles but in hindsight, we would have rented a car for the entire stay; it would have been approximately the same cost but would have given us a few more options. The meals can be pricey but we planned accordingly, packing snacks and buying a case of water. The beach was beautiful and the cabana boys, esp. Eduardo were very nice and helpful. My kids (11 & 14) spent a lot of time in the pool as well. We toured the rainforest and Old San Juan on our own without any problems. I wouldn't waste your money on paying a tour guide for either destination. In all, a nice time away.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, when the pricing is right”
Reviews.Author: libushe
Reviews.Content: I should start with explaining - we booked the hotel with some kind of promotion offer (Expedia or something), so the price we paid was really good value. I also know that this hotel's regular price is much higher, so don't think I would pay the full price, but I definetely have nothing to complain about in this hotel. First and foremost - its territory. It's huge! Of course, most of it is golf courses, but you can still have an evening walk enjoying the tropical sounds and smells, and this is so different from many other Puerto Rico hotels! The size, of course, has its drawbacks - you almost have no choice but to dine in the hotel's restaurants, because anything else is pretty far and hard to locate. That said, we had an occasional drive to a store outside of the hotel territory to have some fruit and water, because the food and drinks are expensive in the hotel. The rainforest is very close (this was my first visit to a rainforest so I was absolutely excited), the beach is nice and huge and if you request you can find some watersports available there (my husband attempted kiteboarding, but the wind was no good for that). Plenty of iguanas are wondering around, a nice room with AC and a great balcony (we had a sea view), and the spa was great too. One more important thing to notice - I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of service, not only in the hotel, but everywhere in Puerto Rico - from the rainforest staff to the cafes in San Juan everyone was very helpful and thoughful. One more thing - if you're there for a romantic getaway, go for the kayaking it the fluorescent lake. It is very pricey, but it is SO romantic! I enjoyed it quite a lot and I am not the type of person usually excited about putting my buttocks in water

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...stunning...a must go to”
Reviews.Author: 68blackbird
Reviews.Content: We just got back from PR with our stay at Rio Mar. The resort is spectacular! The grounds, beach, staff were all spot on. Played golf on the Ocean Course, it was super....I'm running out of words to describe our stay.....a few tips, RENT a CAR! Although the resort has everything you will need, those a bit budget minded will want to go off grounds to eat & drink. The kiosks at Luquillo Beach are very good, and much more reasonable. La Parrilla & ay Bonito(see reviews here on TA) serve very good food along with drinks.....did I say drinks? If you want to get your drink on, you HAVE to stop by theTattoo Tavern #17! You will not find a better place to have a few, or few more.... ;-/......family run(from the States), MORE than reasonable prices, and make sure you get Dev to make you a Cannonball..just do it! You might even get a little ink before you leave ;-O We also did some snorkeling over on Culebra Island....OMG.........it was a living postcard. The crew with Kayaking Puerto Rico - http://www.kayakingpuertorico.com/index.html made it easy and memeorable! Many thanx to Lucas & Mikey for a trip of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “It was All good in the Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: alxrod
Reviews.Content: before going l looked at all the reviews on here for this place, and i must say that most were of a negative nature. that being said i have to strongly disagree, i thought the hotel to be very clean well air conditioned customer service was excellent, pool area spectacular and the beach just steps away! I did not eat there at all because i did want to have the true taste of Puerto Rico so we ventured out. it does suck that u have to pay daily for parking(dont get that) i would just assume include that in the price for the stay. Oh yea almost forgot i had some noisey neighbors at 630a(everyday i was there, 5 days) they were talking like it was 12 noon..........I mean Come ON Trudy and whatever your husbands name is!

Reviews.Title: “(Nearly) affordable elegance”
Reviews.Author: BruinPlayer
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest hotel room I've ever had: gound floor on the corner; huge balcony thrust into beautifully maintained tropical gardens; view of people, beach, surf, ocean, iguanas; huge, suite-sized room with elegant, comfortable furniture. Staff was always friendly and helpful. The resort has enough to do to keep one busy for quite a while. And our room rate wasn't much more than what we paid for "standard" rooms in San Juan. Where they do make their money is on food and drink. That's why rooms (ours, anyway) have all amenities except a fridge and microwave. We spent $100 on a mediocre meal at the Japanese restaurant; a rum and coke will cost $13 all-told. They have an airport shuttle ($75 for two; a taxi is $10 cheaper). You can rent a car on-site for $55/day; a necessity for getting to other beaches, El Yunque, grocery stores, and off-site restaurants. It was a great (but expensive) place to come to after roughing it on Calebra.

Reviews.Title: “Tapas Night (first friday of the month) Best Dining Experience Ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: StrangerThings
Reviews.Content: We don't usually stay at large, chain resorts, but this room was included with our air fare so we thought we'd "tough it out" As it turned out, we loved staying there and found our own private world within the estate. We told the desk clerk we wanted privacy and she gave us a beautiful, huge room with a huge balcony on the east side near the forest area. What a breathtaking view of the rainforest and the ocean, as well as morning sunrises. We were disappointed with the in-house restaurants,and bars and the prices were very very high, but we were land locked without a car and tried a few of them. We found we could walk on the beach to the kioskas and share a cab into Luquillo, so that helped. But the highlight of our entire trip was the TAPAS NIGHT. The first Friday of every month they change the buffet restaurant into a tapas buffet with live Flamenco Music and Dancing. For around $100 a couple, we had all of the freshest tapas you could eat. There must have been over 50 items to choose from. Lots of local seafood,lamb and chicken, and the desserts were world class. The whole place was decorated for the evening,and the music was superb!!! Real musicians playing flamenco and a very artistic,soulful dancer. You won't find a better Flamenco Night, even in Spain. A must if you are anywhere in the area on the first Friday of the month. Lavishly delicious!!! A feast for all of your senses!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: zaneforce007
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar Beach Resort and Spa is a wonderful hotel. It is a 35 minute drive from San Juan, and a little bit out of the way but definately worth it. We arrived at the hotel at around 11 AM. They were very accomadating and allowed us to check in at this early hour. They showed us two rooms (One was forest view and one overlooked the pool). We were not satisfied with either of these rooms so they showed one other room- room 3130 on the with an clear view of the beach. We took this room, and the view greatly improved the stay. The beds are comfortable, and the room looks good. WARNING: They implement a "water AC" type cooler, so the humidity has to be low. If going out onto the balcony, shut the door behind you. Never leave the sliding door open, or you floor and sheets and everything else will get wet. During our stay we ate at the restaurant, Marbella twice. The food there was decent, and about the same price of most restaurants in Puerto Rico of that quality. The convenience of the beach was great. It is so nice to be able to walk out to the beach, and just get in. The staff is waiting on sand; ready to accomodate you with chairs and umbrellas. The water was nice and warm for most of our stay (although a bit sandy.) Right after leaving the beach there are showers, and it is nice to be able to jump into the pool after the beach (the slide is fun for people of all ages.) They offer internet in the rooms for $14 a night but I declined to take it. It is free in the lobby. The hotel has a very cozy feel- like a big house. You can constantly find half of the hotel's guests hanging around the lobby. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. There are lots of activities occuring during the night- ex. Salsa dancing, flamengo, etc. A relief in puerto rico is that pretty much everyone in the hotel speaks english. The maid service is superb. They clean the room spotless and even somewhat organize your things (I assume some people dislike that but I didn't). The one thing that was not as spectacular as the rest of the hotel was the valet. While it was convenient to have your car brought to you, it was subpar. The valet is relatively disorganized. They take a while to find your car, employ an odd system of giving a new ticket every time you bring your car, and are just generally not as enthustiastic about their job as every other staff member. I'm not saying the valet was bad at all; just not as good compared to the rest of the hotel. Overall the Wyndham was a great stay and one of the best hotels I've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: traveltara73
Reviews.Content: We had a great time traveling to Puerto Rico with our two children, ages 9 and 6. The kids loved the pool area - nothing to complain about. Big pool with a curvy slide and a lifeguard. Giant hot tub that was taken over by kids but there was also an adult only pool so people could get away from the kids if they wanted to. The beach was nice but the waves were strong in March. There were plenty of chairs and if you wanted to get away from the crowd right in the middle, it was easy to walk down the beach and feel completely alone. If you walk to the east side of the beach, keep walking down east and around the bend and you will come to the most beautiful beach area. Uninhabited with views of El Yunque and the ocean all combined together and joined by a river that runs from the forest to the ocean. My favorite spot of the whole trip. The food and drinks at the hotel were way overpriced but we ventured off the resort daily because we had a rental jeep. Drinks at the pool/beach bar were over $12 each. We saw many people bringing in coolers from the gas station down the street. Easy to get around in Puerto Rico - straight shot highways make it very hard to get lost. There was a quick serve cafe set up near the casino. It again was a little overpriced but I loved the convenience of it being there with a walk thru set up. Good items for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Our room was nice and clean - good linens and plenty of pillows. The bathrooms were nice too - no complaints. Our first room was looking at the rain forest - and the view was awesome but our deck was over the entry where the taxis dropped off. So after two nights there we requested to be moved to an ocean view room. Rooms were full but they did manage to get us a partial ocean view room and I was pleased with their service - they went out of their way to please me.

Reviews.Title: “The property is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Palzberg
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with family and friends a group of 14 . I booked with dragonfly transportation to get us from the airport to the hotel. I was traveling with two children and my mother. The driver of the shuttle put us in the car and closed the door, after we sat there for five minutes I went over o the driver an asked why we were waiting so long and found out that they were waiting for other passengers that didn't have a reservation to see if they needed a ride. That would have been fine if he ha explained that to me before they went looking for additional passangers but ok another family came on the shuttle an we were off to the hotel. The hotel itself is very beautiful, the room was clean and all rooms had a small balcony. The pool was large enough that everyone was comfortable in their own space. The beach was steps away from the pool which made for beautiful views as you walked through the property. Th adult pool was large as well. I have to say that the bevrages were very expensive so prepare yourself to pa a lot for anything you drnk and I'm not even talking about liquor. Just an example , at the cafe I ordered 2 coffees 1 apple juice and 1 powerade and that was 14 dollars . I'm not kidding. I didn't leave the property because m family was pretty much their to just relax and enjoy the resort. The restaurants were pretty good! You should really check to see what night which restaurants are open because they are not all open at the same time. Also make reservation with he concierge if you have a big group. We asked the waitress to split up the check according to our rooms when we went to the Marbella restauraunt since we were a big group which turned out to be a disaster for my brother in law and sister. All of us were served then about a half hour later they got their plates. Sufficient to say they were not happy We went to Shimas twice, I thought it was very good and the service was great. My family went to Palios tne Italian restaurant and said the food was good . The breakfast buffet was ridiculous , the management reall needs to change their prices, the adult hot breakfast buffet was twenty five dollars per person the adult continental buffet was 16 dollars per person and children's buffet was 12 dollars. I ate their twice for breakfast then ordered breakfast from the cafe counter. I liked the fruit and yogurt plate which I believe was 8 dollars and the breakfast sandwiches were 8 dollars. I really do not mind spending money but some things were just a complete rip off. All in all I would go back to this resort, the staff really did go out of their way to be extra friendly and accomidating. My children and nephews all had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: trip1wfriends
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 days at the Rio Mar. The service is impecable! I do not know how the resort has managed to put together such a fine and friendly staff. Guests are treated to competent and friendly service in all areas of the resort. The morning counter girl at the ERL Cafe was always pleasant and smiling regardless of the early hour. Sujaily who worked at the concierge's desk was wonderful. Anytime she saw us she would inquire how our vacation was going and ask if we needed anything. She is clearly an asset for the RIO MAR. The General Manager of this resort has done an excellent job of recuiting a talented staff dedicated to providing an excellent stay for guests. Cost- Excellent Value! We were concerned after reading previous reviews that the food and beverage costs would be extremely high. We did not find that to be the case. The prices were very similiar to the regular price of eating out. For example, at lunch a grilled cheese and french fries was $6.00 which is very reasonable. The evening menu also had affordable options. We spent far less than expected on meals. Additionally, the food was excellent. Palio's was our favorite! Transportation- The resort is approximately 45 minutes from the airport. We used Dragonfly transportation to shuttle us to and from the airport. The driver was professional and provided us with a calm and comfortable ride. We rented a car at the resort for one day to tour the area. The front desk is wonderful with providing detailed maps/directions to popular attractions. Driving in Puerto Rico was easy! Rooms- The rooms were a good size and very clean. The beds were comfortable and allowed for a good night's sleep. The rooms are kept very cool so be prepared. The ocean front views are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Myrouck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar Beach Resort for 2 days after our cruise. First of all, the location is gorgeous. The service at check-in was excellent (Mr. Joshue at the front desk was always courteous and ready to answer all questions). We had a room with ocean view (7th floor). The room was spacious, clean and the view was breathtaking. There were many families staying at this hotel, but it never felt crowded. We did not eat at the hotel, but went to the kiosks in Luquillo (excellent food!!) and to the supermarket for breakfast groceries. Nice to be so near El Yunque and the ferries in Fajardo. We loved this hotel and Rio Grande and we will definitely be back for a longer vacation.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the resort, but eat locally :)”
Reviews.Author: Komives51410
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and right on the beach!! We had read some negative reviews before we stayed here, so we were a bit nervous about the hotel. We were so wrong!! The hotel is clean, gorgeous, and friendly. However, do NOT eat at the hotel. We made the mistake of eating at the asian restaurant one night, because we were tired from caving all day. It was TERRIBLE!!! I cannot stress that enough, and overpriced. If you want to eat at the hotel, then go to the pub on the golf course. Delicious!! and reasonably priced:) Puerto Rico has such great food right outside the hotel, so no worries you cannot miss the restaurants. I also had a hot stone massage, which was on special at the spa. Best massage I have ever gotten, so try the spa too. Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “This is truly an excellent classy resort”
Reviews.Author: LAMAESTRARUBIA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at El Rio Mar for our 10 year wedding anniversary and I can say that we couldn't have asked for anything better. If your vacation goal is to take a vacation full of relaxation and soak up the beach then this is the place. If you want to dine at 5 star restaurants every night...then this is the place. However if you want to be constantly entertained and are looking to party every night till the sun comes up then there are a few things that should be mentioned. Number one, the resort is breathtaking and beautiful. It's a 4-5 star resort so don't think that you are going to be staying at a tacky Sandals all inclusive resort. that serves cheap drinks and food. I say this because I have read other reviews on here where people are complaining about the cost of food and that there is no entertainment. This is partially true but there are other options that are available. There is not much to do at the resort itself but relax at the gorgeous beach, pool or in the spa. Aside from that you have to leave the resort if you are looking for more action. We found that the conceirge "Coden" was very helpful. He advised us to dine at a local restaurant called "Guavas" which was delicious and offered a nice variety of local cuisine. Afterwards we went to a bar right next door that had live entertainment and Rum-Punch. It was nice to venture out and get into a local scene. We took a cab ride there and back which cost us 30.00 round trip. The following day we did take a tour of Old San Juan which was really fascinating. The tour lasted all day. There was alot to see and we were able to walk around old San Juan and do some shopping etc. By the fourth day we took a cab ride and went to los kioskos which are located in Loquillo about 8 minutes away. There are about 50 restuarants/bars and vendors to choose from. The food is very inexpensive. We were able to order some appetizers and taste some of the local food again. On the nights that we didnt go out we dined at Palio's and the Argentian restaurant which were both excellent. The food and service was awesome and well worth what we paid. In the mornings, we would order from the cafe downstairs. We found that splitting a breakfast sandwich was all we needed to fill us up till lunchtime. Breakfast would cost normally around 13.00 with 2 coffees. We did dine in Marbella for breakfast but it is expensive so be advised. If you stay here do not feel as you are stranded...there are plenty of places to see and venture out to. We found that taking cabs was more convenient than having to deal the hassle of renting a car. One reason is we had a designated driver, secondly I wouldn't recommend taking a car unless you plan on scoping out the entire island, thirdly they do drive kind of crazy down there. One great thing to mention about the cab drivers is that they were very accomodating as well. They would give us their cell numbers and we were able to call them to come get us when we wanted them to. Overall our experience was memorable! The staff at this hotel is very accomodating and friendly. We will be back for sure! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Missed the Mark a Bit...”
Reviews.Author: MichelleCJ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Wyndham Rio Mar in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico. The hotel is in a great location... About 30 minutes outside of San Juan.... 20 minutes from Fajardo... 5 minutes from El Yunque. Although we enjoyed ourselves, the hotel missed the mark on a few things during our stay. I'll start with the bad... Upon arrival, my husband and son (12 years old) parked the car (we rented a Nissan Rogue from Economy/Target - Great rates!!) while my daughter (15 years old) and I went to check in. Check in was smooth, and the front desk staff was very helpful, unfortunately we encountered our first problem at this point when we were told that we would not be eligible for any of our Wyndham ByRequest / Wyndham Rewards perks because we had booked our hotel stay through a travel agent. I own a Corporate Event Planning Company and have never experienced this at any hotel, but since it was only the wireless internet access that I really needed, I didn't make a big deal out of it, as they have wireless available to everyone in the lobby area. We arrived in our room (#7113, Ocean Front, West Wing), and although it was a bit dark, the view from the balcony couldn't be beat, so we were fine with the room. Our second issue was when we tried to open the balcony door (which was not a sliding glass door because of the way the room was situated, but an actual glass door) and discovered that the hook lock was stuck and required banging on it with something to get it open - This had to be done each time we wanted to open the door, but again, not a big issue, so we were still fine. We also realized that the roman shade covering the door was broken and wouldn't raise all the way, but again, not a huge deal. Issue #3 (or 4 depending on how you're looking at it) was unfortunately a bigger one when we realized that there were tiny ants all over the floor near the balcony door, but on the inside. Since we had already unpacked, and everyone was starving at this point (left our house at 5am, and it was now close to 7pm), I called down to Guest Services and explained the situation and asked if they could have Engineering come up and spray the room while we were gone. I also realized at this time that the balcony had very poor drainage (was only covered by a pergola) and since it had rained that day, there was about an inch of water on the balcony, so I asked if they could also have them "squeegee"(for lack of a better word) off the water so we could actually use the balcony area. Guest Services was more than accommodating and said that someone would be up within a 1/2 hour to do both things and that we would need to be out of the room for at least another hour after that. We came back later that evening and neither request was taken care of... No spraying.... No squeegeeing. After our second requests were ignored, we bought a can of ant spray to get rid of the ants, and used a bathroom towel one morning to direct all the water on the balcony toward the two drainage holes - Took about 1/2 hour, but worked like a charm!! ;o) Our final issue was discovered one night when we returned from a late dinner and realized that our balcony door was wide open. It was raining when we left, so we know we did not leave it open. I'd like to think they finally came to squeegee, and forgot to shut the door, but with another inch of water on the balcony after the rain, we're pretty sure that wasn't the case. Now for the pros of this property... The beach is wonderful, and they have plenty of chairs and umbrellas for everyone - We only had an issue one day when they ran out of umbrellas (not chairs), but it was a holiday weekend, and the hotel was full. The pool area is fantastic as well, and they have daily activities (ie. Bingo, Water Aerobics, etc.). There is an adult only pool, a kiddie pool and an activity pool with a water slide. The Tiki Bar right next to the pool had fantastic drinks (albeit expensive - Bring your own liquor and mixings if you are concerned) - The Mojitos and Pina Coladas were great! They even gave my son a lesson in how to open a coconut, which he thoroughly enjoyed! I can't tell you much about the restaurants on the property as we only ate at the breakfast buffet and coffee shop - Having Italian or Sushi while in Puerto Rico wasn't what we were after. The buffet was ok, and definitely the way to go if you like a large breakfast - We ordered a la carte one morning (we aren't huge breakfast eaters), and the cost was higher than if we had just gone with the buffet. They also don't have fruit on the menu unless you go with the buffet. :o( The beds in the rooms are very comfortable - A cross between a pillow top and feather bed - Loved it!! Restaurants in the area... We ate at the Loquillo Kiosks a few nights and thoroughly enjoyed them. Vejigante was our favorite (don't ask what number it was as we lost track of the numbers along the way) - They couldn't have been more helpful, and the food was GREAT!! La Parilla (first kiosk if coming from the west) was also very good, but more expensive than most of the others. We also ate at one or two that were just walk in and order type places - We plan to detox from all the fried food this week!! lol We also ate at Ritchies which is to the right, about 1/2 mile, if you are pulling out of the hotel property. The view is gorgeous, the food was great, and their Sangria was superb! What to do... We went into El Yunque one day and had a great time walking around many of the areas. We also drove into San Juan - We parked by San Cristobal and walked through Old San Juan all the way over to El Morro - If you go, plan on wearing comfortable shoes as it is a lot of walking (unless you take the trolley, which is free, and which we didn't use), as well as walking on a lot of uneven terrain. If you get in early, or even if you want an afternoon snack, stop in at La Bombonera for some Mayorcas! We had lunch at the Parrot Club, and although at this point I can't remember what we ate, I'm sure it included Tostones (fried green plantains)!! :o) We also did one of the BioBay Tours in Fajardo, which is a DO NOT MISS kind of tour!! We went with Island Kayaking Adventures and they did a wonderful job. Since we had our own car, we drove to the site in Fajardo (was about $54 pp), which is near the El Conquistador Resort (not easy to find). Our tour was kayaking, and although definitely not easy to do, well worth the effort. If you have anyone in your group who wouldn't like being in a kayak in a small channel, in the dark, I suggest you find one of the two tour companies that use electric boats. ;o) If you are adventurous, and can laugh at things that might go wrong (ie. banging into the mangrove trees, causing a 6 kayak pile up, etc.), then this tour is definitely for you.... And the BioBay itself is magical! We had planned to do the ziplining, but couldn't find a tour that was not an all day, 6-8 hour excursion. Hopefully our next trip will include that as it is the only thing we had planned to do that we didn't. All in all, the trip was wonderful, and although the hotel has a few kinks to work out, they have a wonderful property and location to work with, and I would still suggest this hotel to anyone going to Puerto Rico. I would however suggest going with an Ocean View room rather than Ocean Front - I was able to peek into a couple and they had a beautiful view as well, and saved a bit of money in the process! Suggestion to the Wyndham Management: If a guest calls down with a problem such as ants, even once, send them something to their room (ie. bottle of rum, fruit, etc.) to show that you care enough to acknowledge that there was an issue... It's a small gesture, but goes a long way. Problems occur with all properties here and there, but it is how you handle it that shows the guest that you value their business. You also never know when you will have a guest traveling with their family that also happens to represent many international corporations looking for locations to hold meetings/conferences outside the continental US. ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but would definitely go somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: larguita
Reviews.Content: Tips: Rent a car, buy groceries/snacks at Walmart, get pool towels early since they will run out! Eat outside the resort. Pros: Beautiful grounds, nice pool areas, oceanfront hotel.Large rooms, all have small balconies. If facing the back you can experience nice green foliage and iguanas in the pond. If you're lucky, you can face the ocean, somewhat obstructed...Personnel are nice. Nice comfy bed, fluffy pillows. Bathroom was spacious but missing the exhaust fan in both our rooms! Nice plasma TV, 2-cup coffee maker,coffee & tea supplied. Nice coffec cups with lids. Complimentary high-quality Toiletries such as shampoo, conditioner & lotion. Cons: Old, musty, humid rooms. Pool runs out of towels so you must bring from your room. Food N drinks are EXPENSIVE!! Pool closes too early & is poorly lit. Beach sand is dark, not white!! Bathrooms lack the exhaust fans!! Must pay a fee for parking & for renting a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Third World Feel With American Attitude”
Reviews.Author: MrsChambers
Reviews.Content: I need to first say that reviews are baased on what you have experienced in life in general. So if you have never been to a luxury resort, then how do you compare? With that being said, Rio Mar is NOT a luxury hotel. We were at this hotel from July 25th-July 29th 2011. We arrived to a so-so welcome from Dragonfly Travel.
