Our name was not on the transportation list, thank goodness that I brought all of my travel documents. We arrive at the hotel for another so-so welcome. The front desk called our room to make sure everything was ok, and thats where the "good" customer service stopped. We went out to the beach, and they were out of towels. They were also out of umbrellas. One of the guys at the beach said that the hotel was at full capacity, but there were so few umbrellas available. The guys on the beach were in no rush to make sure we got what we wanted. We went to the tours desk which was run by Dragonfly. Please believe everything negative that you read about them. So, if you want to book an excursion through them, you can do that ONLY of it is one of the excursions that their company is in charge of. For instance, we wanted to do the bio-bay tour. Because it isnt one of their tours it was a mess. We signed up for a total of three slots and didnt get any of them. Four people have to sign up, and after that, the company has to have availability. Unfortunately, Dragonfly is not high on the priority list. All three were canceled. They did call us afterward to tell us there was availability but we had to find our own transportation. When I asked what transportation options were, they didnt know. I was so frustrated because doing that really screws up your schedule. It was so hard to plan. I decided to rent a car and contact Pure Adventures and do it myself. Dragonfly charged $99 per person for this tour. Our rental car was $60, and the tour was $45 dollars per person. It was more economical to get our own car and make our own plans. PLUS we had a car for the day. Pure Adventures was GREAT!! The tour guides were great, and I loved Bio-Bay!! The only thing about PA, was that they dont provide transportation. Its worth getting a car. We gave our car back when we returned, to avoid paying $25 per night to park. Sometimes I felt like I was being scammed. For instance, we asked the concierge for a dinner recommendation. He recommended Hacienda something...I cant remember the second part of the place. Well he was sending everybody there saying how great it was. It was a 10 minute drive that the "cab" charged us $30 round trip for. Not only that, We shared a ride back, and he still charged us full price. When we got to the Hacienda, it smelled like horse crap!! COme to find out, this is where Dragonfly has the ATV, Horseback riding, and go carts. I was so disgusted, the food was average, and the service was terrible. When we got back I asked the concierge if they paid him to send people over there. He said in two years nobody has ever complained about the place being in the middle of a horse farm. Thats because most people arent honest to your face. We didnt eat at all of the eating establishments at the hotel. We did ERL, next to the casino, Palio, and Shima. ERL was good for breakfast and lunch. They had muffins, bagels, sandwiches etc. That was fine for eating during the day. Palio was really good. I had the asparagus risotto. Shima was disgusting. Really, the worse sushi I have ever had. SO bland!! How can sushi be bland with everything going on inside of the roll?? We were approached two separate times about 1) A secret, and 2) customer appreciation week. The secret was going to a time share presentation and getting a free massage. Customer appreciation week was the exact same thing, except that there was 3 days and 2 nights at a stateside hotel. It was all done in a tricky way. Overall, the hotel rooms look like a nicer Holiday Inn quality room. The service was definitely NOT UP TO PAR in comaprison to luxury hotels that I have been to. When I think of luxury, I think of The Ritz-Reynolds Plantation. Any hotel calling itself luxury should be up to that standard or better as far as I am concerned. If you have ever been there, then you have a point of reference. My room at Rio Mar was humid. Not to the point where it was unbearable, but enough for items to feel a little damp. For instance, my vitamins were damp the next morning. So thats all, if you have specific questions, feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, but stay away from the restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: Murray3553
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here and the beach was beautiful. Fortunately, we didn't let the poor quality of restaurants ruin our experience. The restaurants had horrible service, the food quality was bad, and they were extremely over-priced. When we were ignored in one restaurant and had a sandwich order take over an hour in another, the management really did not seem to care or do anything to fix the problem. If you stay here, definitely venture beyond the resort and eat at the local restaurants and the kiosks. Luckily many of the other guests had similar feelings about the food and we were able to commiserate while sharing restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Weekend Gateway, however avoid dates when the hotel is sold out.”
Reviews.Author: AgentCayey
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent that stay at this location From July 23 until July 25, 2011. Hotel rooms are excellent in size, perfectly clean and our room (7064) with a spectacular ocean view. The Bed is great. Restaurants are excellent in terms of quality of food and service. Prices are ok for a resort. They have 4 restaurants (Palios, The Grill, Marbella and Shimas). The first two were not visited. Marbella, an international cuisine restaurant, offers breakfast buffet for $24 per person and Dinner Buffet for about $25 per person. Food is Great!! Shimas (Asian Bistro and Suchi Bar) has main course for around $25 per person. Mongolian Beef is a must. Facilities are in excellent conditions. The resort has two pools, one for adult and one for the whole family. The resort is also an Ocean Front Resort. Basically is a private sandy beach. It is a beautiful ocean front site, however there is a rough sea in the area. Hotel staff at the beach is always available to help you with all your needs. On the Other Side, I will strongly recommend to avoid the dates where the hotel is sold out. For example, my room supposed to be ready at 4 PM for check in, but it was ready a 6:30 PM. Due to enormous amount of people, we never get towels at the pool side at anytime during our stay. We bring the towels from the room. Other than that, it is a great place for the whole family to enjoy with a friendly staff, great food and great facilities. If you have further questions, please contact me at jmartinez@empacaquenosvamos.com J. Martinez Independent Contrator

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: teutsler
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Rio Mar for a week this past June. What an amazing experience it was! Yes, the food and some of the amenities are pricey, but not any more expensive than other resorts that I have stayed at. The room was clean and well maintained with an amazing view (I only paid for a resort view but was upgraded to an ocean view), and the staff was amazing. One of the bellman, Stevie, made me feel welcome from the time I arrived until the day I left. There is so much to do around the hotel, so I highly recommend renting a car and exploring on your own. I did visit the spa while I was there, and it was just as amazing as the rest of the hotel. The beach is nice, but the adults only pool is a HUGE bonus. I travel solo and prefer to be in adult only situations, so it was nice to be able to cater to that preference on a regular basis. The only service related issue I had was reserved for the snotty concierge I encountered one day. I was not impressed with his service, and I didn't go back. Really, though, there's no reason to use the concierge, as you can book excursions on your own at a much cheaper rate. My experience was great and I hope to get back to the Rio Mar very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: izzydood
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The room was nice. We LOVED the pools and the beautiful beach. Be aware this resort is at least a half hour drive from San Juan, more in traffic. There just isn't much near this, other than the rain forest. We thought the hotel breakfast buffet was ridiculously overpriced. Go down the road to the little restaurant right before the stoplight at the main highway and eat there for much, much less. DOn't miss the iguanas -they hang out on the side of the hotel - we watched them from our room. We had a little trouble at the concierge desk. We asked about eating the local specialty whole roasted pig and were totally discouraged from doing so, although all the guidebooks rave about this. It was lovely here at the resort, but we did not enjoy Puerto Rico in general and will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever....”
Reviews.Author: jenniferladona
Reviews.Content: The RioMar is not even close to the awesome resort that we were led to believe. The workers at the resort lack professionalism, they are NOT helpful what so ever. The Hotel inside is Flithy, not even close to clean for our expectations nor for the price!!! The rooms need remodeling/updated. Our shower had not even been cleaned when we arrived. You have to PAY for a refridgerator in your room (IF)you luck up to get one before they run out, because everything there seems to run out, rental cars, kayak tours, snorkel etc.... PATHETIC on helping you find something outside the resort. They want to keep you there spending money apparently. The restaurants and drinks are way over priced! Not to mention that we had a waiter try and still money from us! FYI if you stay do charge to your room, or use a credit card, because if you pay cash and leave the waiter will then tell the manager you didn't pay and try and keep your money. We got that handled however, that was not a pleasant evenning, nor was it a good dinner. The Italian restaurant is good and their staff was nice. Marabella in the evening was a joke for service! Breakfast service and staff was good at Marabella in the morning. Beach front rooms are not BEACH front rooms, they are facing the beach but unless you up on the 5th floor or above you are NOT going to see it. The Pool was the nicest part of the whole resort! I suggest to definitely rent a car, because nothing is within walking distance to the resort. We were very unsatisfied with our stay and were pretty much miserable. I have never been so glad to leave a place.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: thsintexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our travel agent for a family vacation and I am not sure why. It is outdated and poorly cared for. When we arrived in our room (which was supposed to be an ocean front view) we overlooked a palm tree and the pool and there were multiple things broken. After complaining, they changed our room and it was not much better, other than a slightly better view. Most of the concierges were not informative at all. Some of them work for the time share company and are put behind the concierge desk and are either hardly any help (with lame attitudes), or give misinformation; we missed the ferry to Calebra Island because they failed to tell us there was only one a day. One concierge, Angelo, was the only truly helpful person at the hotel besides a few bell men, and a nice guy running the children's Iguana Club. The food and drinks are over priced, although, Palio Restaurant was excellent. You have to rent a car if you go. There are no hotel shuttles to anything - not even a restaurant 2 minutes away. I'd recommend buying groceries after you rent the car, otherwise you're looking at $5 per bottle of beer in the gift shop. The landscaping is gorgeous, but the beach isn't pristine as you'd expect; it's brown sand (not white) and messy (limes, pieces of glass & cups and straws not cleaned up). Waves are big and the surf is rough (it was stormy when we went- though it could be the time of year). Our kids had fun in the pool & on the beach but it was not what my husband and I expected at all. The beds are comfortable and pillows soft.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Trust All the Other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: GSBNF
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel for our stay we were a bit concerned reading the reviews, they were either really good or really bad. Our family with 3 children ages 10-14 stayed for a week and had a blast. The hotel was beautiful, clean, great location, staff was friendly and helpful (ask for a bellhop named Eugenio - had great information on local food & fun), beds were super comfortable, loved the tile on the floor instead of carpet, large bathroom, had a great view from the 6th floor overlooking the tree tops, pool and ocean. Rooms were a bit expensive but compared to what we stayed in at Myrtle Beach for the same price, it was 5 star! The beach was just outside the pool area and although it was a public beach had only hotel guests because of the location. Kayaks, jet skiis, etc were available for rent on the beach and hotel staff was available to set up chairs and umbrellas for no fee! There were activities at the hotel and pool if you checked the schedule (water aerobics, family fun & salsa dancing to name a few). Yes, we had to pay for daily parking and used the valet at $20 a day but was well worth it for convenience and timeliness and we saved more than that by eating meals at the local kiosks just a short drive away (plus you get to experience the locals). We highly recommend renting the fridge (there was a fee but we read online that if you were a member of their hotel club you got it for free - we had problems with signing up but they gave us the fridge for free anyway), plan on shopping at WalMart and bring snacks, drinks, etc to have by the pool and on the beach or for breakfast/lunch. We only ate one meal at the poolside hut which was expensive and nothing special. Don Pepe's on the main highway for breakfast is a must with it's coconut glazed waffles and mallorca bread, there is also a great souvinir shop a few doors away! Don't bother with the restaurants at the end of the street that Rio Mar is on. It is a short drive to El Yunque which was beautiful and FREE if you have a car - don't book an excursion. Would highly recommend the Hacienda up the road for ATV tours, horseback riding, go-karts, and EXCELLENT food (best meal we had). Ziplining is also a short distance away and a great experience. We drove to Ponce for snorkeling with Carribean Images Tours which is a must - worth the 2 hour drive, best snorkeling we've ever seen. The only reason I can think people complained about this hotel was because they visited during a busy holiday (such as Spring Break) and you have to expect crowds and problems when everyone else is traveling too. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “depends on what you are looking for..”
Reviews.Author: mikore
Reviews.Content: i travel alot with work and let my girl friend pick this resort. the pool area is the nicest part of the hotel.the beach is clean but the water is is dirty and the waves are 3-5 feet high. the service people where very nice and friendly but the service was slow. The rooms had a musty smell and needs updated the beds are comfortable and by far the best part of the room. This hotel has some great views but is showing its age and needs a major remodel.and with the high pricing on everything you would think it would be i nicer place. rent a car and explore. we ate RICHIES just a half mile up the road good food with a great view.go there you will be glad you did ! if you do stay here rent a cabana off the beach its quite and peaceful and nice for couples by far the best money spent on the resort. I give this hotel a 6.5 or 3 star.and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay unless you plan on renting a car.”
Reviews.Author: Luvmesomegreg
Reviews.Content: Not my idea of a resort. All the bars closed at 12am. The only place open late is the boot leg casino. Not enough of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Never, Never and Never”
Reviews.Author: Adrian1992
Reviews.Content: We weren't staying there but we decided to go there to have dinner because it was quite cheap compared to other hotels. Well we get there and there is two options to park, valet or self parking but in both you have to pay. Then we go up to the casino and OMG i was just 19 and he didn't even ask for my passport... The waitress came by while I was at the roulette and they had hardly anything.... After the casino we went to dinner, the place was quite good of appearance, however, we didn't know what awaited us. The food took 1 HOUR to get to our table and the restaurant was EMPTY just 4 tables... PATHETIC, when the food finally came we noticed it had been in the microwave, cause the plate was very hot and my hamburger was very very dry and the bun was like chewing gum... While eating my fruit salad I noticed a piece of fruit had MOLD, DISGUSTING.... After dinner we went to get the car but we didn't know how to get there so we asked four different people that worked there and guess what.. we got 4 different answers... Finally found it and when we went to pay a guy it was 8.83 $, I gave him 20 $ and he took out the CALCULATOR... Meantime I was "wtf, it seems nobody knows anything" Conclusion: POOR, EXPENSIVE, POOR SERVICE...= PATHETIC never going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny-N-Sand
Reviews.Content: We went to PR for one week and stayed at the Rio Mar Beach Resort. The resort is beautiful but is out dated, really expensive, and really lacks customer focus. Why - read on: Physical Resort: 4 out of 5. The actual resort is located in Rio Grande (North East) part of PR. It is huge and surrounded by luch greenery. The beach and pool are very well maintained. Pool Area: 3 out of 5. The pool is great however the service stinks. The food served at the pool is mediocre at best and is WAY over priced. Drinks are ridiculously priced. I paid $8 plus tip for a Corona making it $9! The pool staff are vultures and snitches. If you take a few drinks (waters etc) in a backpack they'll threaten to kick you out of there. The rooms: 3 out of 5. The rooms are dated. The bathrooms are out dated too. When you stop out of the room, the carpet in the hallways is filthy. It looks like they've never washed it. Housekeeping service: 4 out of 5. In general they deliver towels quickly. Of the 7 days we were there they forgot to clean our room once. When notified they fixed attended to it quickly. Food: 2 out of 5: The price of food and drinks at the restaurant is ridiculous. Absolutely crazy! We've stated at numerous resorts all over the world and this one offered mediocre food at a crazy price. A beer can cost you around $10. Water Activities: 1 out of 5. Nearly every resort we've ever stayed at provides non motorized activities for free. At the resort they nickel and dime you for everything and none of it is included. Would I go back - ABSOLUTELY NOT. Why? In general I liked the resort but I think there's a lot better value in Mexico, Belize, and even Hawaii. I hate being gouged for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK and I probably would not return”
Reviews.Author: gillscarol5
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very dated and parts of the room were not clean. The ceilings and walls were dirty and the dresser drawers smelled musty. We had to leave our clothes in our suitcases for the week so they would smell fresh. The beds were very comfortable and that was nice since it rained a lot while we were there. The resort is very expensive to eat and or drink while you are there. The breakfast buffet was $24.99 per person and really was nothing special and the food was mediocre. The Italian restaurant was great and the burger from the lobby bar was pretty good even though it was $15.00. The pools were very beautiful; but needed cleaning and the beach was georgous for the little time we got to spend there. I woud recommend getting a car while you are there and buying food outside of the resort to alleviate some of the cost; but parking is $20 a day. The resort is very family oriented which is good if you have kids, which we do not. All in all the place was just OK and overated for the cost and I do not think we would return. Just a note that you should have lots of one dollar bills. it seems you are tipping everyone.

Reviews.Title: “No way Jose”
Reviews.Author: nktwrk
Reviews.Content: Ok, i'm not one to give poor reviews just because and maybe since i didn't go to Rio Mar for golfing this could be a tainted review but here goes. Parking sucks (self park)...plain and simple, i went the self park route and they just have no idea what their procedures are..one minute i have my cousin lift the gate, one minute they check my ticket the other they don't. My cousin and i stayed from Friday to Monday so is that 4 charged of $15 or is that 3 charges since we left on Monday?? of course i was charged 4 times but didn't balk at it since they didn't try to get me anywhere else. Nothing is close.....it's an almost 5 minute drive to the hotel once you get on to the property...then when we self park it's a hike usually from the outdoor parking lot since for some reason people go to that crappy casino and fill up the indoor parking. Make sure you go through the indoor parking to get a ticket...of which never really used. Again poor procedures. Hotel...the hotel itself like others have said needs an upgrade...the carpet in the west wing was old and smelly...RIP THAT CARPET UP. The rooms had no carpet so just take the carpet out of the hallway and be done with it. My ocean view was me needing to go out on to the balcony to see the ocean...for an extra 100 i say don't do it! Save the money. I will say the pool stays open 24 hours so that is a big plus...i never went to the kids side and from the noise didn't want too. The adult side is a tad boring though lol. I've been to DR and the hotels there put this one to complete shame especially when the DR hotels are all inclusive with jaquzzies. I mean the price per night at this hotel is terrible for what you get and that's not much... 10 bucks a night for a fridgerator..really? Just go to walgreens and get a foam cooler and ice, theres a walgreens every 10 feet. Use your cell phone for internet since you are still in the US as Rio charges for internet in your room, free in common areas. Beach...no thanks..water felt great but the sand bar is at least 40 feet out so that means murky brown water for about 40 feet...scared the willys out of me but i still got in it. My cousin and i spent most of our beach time at Carolina beach by the airport..that beach and water was 10 times better than Rio Mar's beach. Though theres nothing they can do about it so i don't hold it against them. However the price per night should reflect the crappy beach. Food...first of all thank you trip advisor and thank you all who reviewed before me...didn't even go near the hotel bar or resturants..actually i didn't even see them. Drive out of the hotel and right BEFORE your turn on to route 3 turn left into the parking lot where ISHMAR (spell) Bakery is...reviewers got it right. The young lady taking orders could have smiled a little more..and the people who came behind us got served before we did...4 people got served before us 2 people did so it could be some kind of local thing where the outsiders have to wait...don't get bent out of shape over it, just wait and you will be enjoying your food. What ever you do get the strawberry or cherry filled donut...yo it was off the chain! even better than Kracky Kreme. We never made it to the Kiosks which is a Right on 3 from Rio Mar and about 5-10 min away on the left side of the road, you can't miss them. We went to the famous Lechonera Los Pinos...that's route 52 to route 184, once you get on 184 you can't miss it, it's a bit of a drive but worth it. From the airport 26 east to 66 east to 3 east there are tons of places to stop and eat on 3. When you get off 66 expressway east to route 3, turn left and you will find Walmart. There's also an outlet you pass at the 66 - 3 junction you can't miss it. El Yunque is a stone's throw away from Rio Mar which is a plus if you want to go there. My suggestion is IF YOU DONT WANT TO PAY 4 per person...just drive past the welcoming center and up the mountain...there you will see the hiking trails and parking spots....only one way up and one way back. On your way to the forest is the little town you see adverts for zip line and other things. I'll do zip line next time. Take my advice GO EARLY. like 6-7 am so you get prime photo ops..anything after that and it's crap picture time. bottom line, i'd rather stay close to Carolina beach save money and drive out to the El Yunque. Rio Mar is just not worth it unless your a golfer. Rio...rip up the carpet...free frigerators....more light in the main area...stop calling ocean view rooms ocean view rooms when it's view of ocean from room...fix the parking, guests should park free....free internet My next trip to PR, i'm staying at cheap hotel and spend my cash on beach and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pools, beach access, but lacked food options and was pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany830
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Rio Mar after a cruise. Having never stayed in Puerto Rico we wanted a relaxing, resort style hotel. The pros: the location is great. Very close to the rainforest and bio bay kayaking, two top and recommended attractions. The pools were nice. Two pools, one family friendly with a slide and the other adult only. I was a little irritated that they closed early and towels were hard to come by, but the pools itself were great. The cons: while they had quite a few restaurants on site, they were all about the same and served the same choices. It was limited and expensive. $15 hamburger and $7.50 bottled beer. It was good tasting though, so that was a plus but more expensive than it's worth. There were no other restaurant choices nearby without driving back to San Juan unless you wanted fast food (Burger King, Wendy's, and KFC were plenty). Overall it was ok. I wouldn't stay again though. I might stay just overnight while seeing the local attractions and then head to another place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property Service SO SO”
Reviews.Author: dot11do
Reviews.Content: When I stay in a 5 star resort I expect 5 star treatment.....My biggest complaint about this resort is all the HIDDEN costs....You have read the pay for parking at least it is only a daily rate and not everytime you leave the resort. I ordered the $7.50 pot of coffee for our room after hidden fees that pot of coffee was $16 Really??? Come on wydam....price gouge much? We used the spa.....the $99 special for a massage came to $137.00 before gratuity......that is with the hidden fees they don't tell you about and if I were honest the massage was just OK........ The property is pretty but if you want to do ANY kind of excursion you better book before you leave it is not like any other place we have visited. You can't just find a tour company on the day of or the day before. The resort is beautiful the service is barely above 3 star. Would I return probably not.......there are a lot of beautiful beaches with friendlier people and better service. I was dissappointed in the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler01NH
Reviews.Content: Beautiful site but felt nickel-and-dimed throughout our stay: $4 coffee, $10 drinks, charged for boogie boards, even for bingo! Every meal for four, even breakfast, was up near $100.00. What did we pay a resort fee for?! Far away from anything so having a car is a pain and of course is expensive. Recommend having your taxi driver stop @Walmart or Walgreen's for a cooler, snacks and drinks. Highly recommend setting up excursions well in advance - so much for spontaneity on vacation - they fill up quickly and then you're on your own (even during off-peak season)! Car would be cost-effective if doing more than one excursion - taxis are a lot to get to these. Wyndham pushes their own excursions with "DragonFly" and are not very helpful with other adventures. Tried hard to get on a Biobay excursion but one concierge in particular told me there were no other companies then she proceeded to give me the hard sell for The Vacation Club. There are several other biobay companies in the travel brochure and I was on my own trying to research them on the horribly slow, inefficient internet terminals in the lobby (Wi-fii quite costly) then trying to call these companies with really poor cell phone coverage. I gave up and tried asking concierge Nathan, who had a great recommendation but it was booked. Next time will stay at a place closer to a quieter side of the ocean that has snorkeling so the kids will have more to do without us planning a $100+ day trip weeks in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT hesitate to take this trip!”
Reviews.Author: Reuben32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar Beach Resort in Puerto Rico last summer. A group of 5 of us (all in our mid 20's) decided to vacation together and we got a great deal through travelocity. None of us had ever been to Puerto Rico before, so we didn't know what to expect. We did our homework on the property before we got there, so we budgeted in valet parking into our stay. The drive in from the airport did take a little while, but it wasn't bad, and it gave us a chance to experience a little of real Puerto Rico. I would strongly recommend renting a vehicle, not just because it is so far away, but because it gives you a chance to explore the island. We went to El Yunque one day, Bioiluminescent bay another, and into Old San Juan on a third. The location of the resort is amazing for exploring the Island's high points. It is right next to El Yunque so you get this great combination of lush tropical rainforrest mixed with beachfront views the entire time you are there. We had booked 3 mountain view rooms (the cheaper option) but when we got there they only had 2, so they upgraded one of the rooms to an ocean view for free. The mountain view rooms are great too, leave the door opened a crack and you can either go to sleep to the sound of waves crashing or to the sound of wildlife and wind blowing through the trees. The hotel is a little dated, but everything is kept very clean. We had some trouble with our key getting our hotel room door open, and the staff was always helpful in tending to our request as soon as possible. We made friends with the valet on the first day, and asked for their imput on where to eat. They recommended a place they go out to drink after work (and we even followed them there after their shift was done.) I wish I could remember the name, the food was AMAZING, the marinated skirt steak was one of the best I have ever eaten. We ate on site at the retaurants twice and ordered room service once. The food there is good, but it is expensive (especially compared to how good and how cheap the authentic Puerto-Rican food is around there. The beach is a little choppy, but enjoyable, and the pools are amazing (especially at night.) The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The one thing I would advise is that timing seems to be everything at this place. We went during the week before school was out, we came on Sunday and left on Saturday. We really wanted a nice quiet place to relax (some people may deem it as "boring") if you are looking for a place to rest with a group of friends that you come with then it is great. The last night we were there, school had just let out and the place got crowded FAST. So if you really want a lot of people there to meet and mingle with, then make sure you go on a weekend in June-August. If you are looking to find a quiet, secluded place, then try to go during the week around May or September.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: botis626
Reviews.Content: The resort is fabulous. Beyond words. the rooms super clean and the staff very friendly. The resaurants a little pricy but if you don't have a rental car--well then you have to eat there. If you do, get some food from the outside and go to the pool and eat it. You can also bring your own rum (cheaper) and make your own drinks. Our room had an ocean view and it was spectacular. We loved listening to the ocean at night and then waking up to the same sounds in the morning. It is about 45 min from Old San Juan so you will need a rental car. Unless you plan to stay there. We bought pizza (14.00) for a large and we the kids loved it. they do have different activities planned throughout the day. The rooms are big, the beds very comfortable, the restrooms are always clean. Our rooms were clean everyday with coffee set out for us every day too. Overall we would stay here again. I wish I had stopped by and done the 90 min time share presentation. You get 50.00 plus 3 nights at another restort. Well worth it if you are interested in doind a time share. you do have to pay for parking $18.00 a day. get there early because the parking is full early and your car will have to sleep outside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: ocamacho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of June 2011. The landscape is very beautiful with the views spectacular except the one room I first received. I paid for ocean view and got a view of mostly buildings. I asked for and got a better room without issue. The location is a few minutes drive to El Yunque and can be viewed off the beach if you walk towards the right of the hotel. You'll be greeted with a nice lake with El Yunque in the background. Great for photo's. The hotel is pretty well designed except to get to the main dining area. It's 30 minutes from San Juan and 30 minutes from Farjado where you can get snorkeling or kayak to Bio Bay. Although we rented a car ahead of time, there's an Enterprise in the hotel if you want to travel yourself. The hotel offers buses to various activities but have limited seating. Food is expensive here so if you don't rent a car you're pretty much stuck with what they have as the grounds are pretty far from any other places to eat. Unless you're ready to do some walking, a pretty long walk. Since we had free breakfast for 2, we only ate breakfast at the hotel. We also ate dinner on the first night. Breakfast was ok except the last day. They must have had another cook cause the eggs weren't as fluffy nor tasty as the previous days we ate there. We ate at various areas through out our vacation. There's a nice small restaurant call Tio Pepe's on the right on route 3 not too far from the road leading to the hotel that was pretty good with great prices. The hotel has a small casino that gets crowded in the evening starting Wednesdays. If you park in the lot and come in by 8pm, expect to start searching for spaces as there's not a lot of spots. It'll empty out later in the evening. Parking is $15 a day or $20 for valet. The hotel has two pools, one for adults and the other for children. We had no issues staying in the pool after hours. Not sure why others posted that this was an issue, but no one came by to tell us to get out. We enjoyed our stay here. The view of the ocean was spectacular especially in the mornings. I'm an early riser so I spent my mornings seating in the lobby with my laptop then repositioning myself just outside. Wireless is free in the lobby but you'll have to pay to use wired access in your room. Speed was pretty good with sporadic disconnections. They had just installed it so it was free at the time. Not sure if they'll charge later. There's also about 5 computers in the lobby in a small room for free internet. But 2 computers were not working. We had a great deal for the hotel room (2 days free) with free breakfast for 2. Drinks: If you like rum, go to the casino where you'll get free drinks. Do what I did, play the penny machines. If you have self control, you can get drinks for $5 each or less. But remember, the more you drink, the less control you'll have! If we get this deal again we'll definitely go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: jesusuk
Reviews.Content: I wish I could remember all that went wrong here. I'll do my best. There are three couples on a trip around Puerto Rico. Our last night is to be spent at Rio Mar. At 3:00pm the afternoon of check-in, one of the three parties gets a call from the resort that they are overbooked and will have to move them to another resort. After numerous calls explaining to them they were part of a group and that being moved is not an option, the resort relents and tells them they "found a room for them." How nice. I thought that's what reservations were for. Just to be safe, the other two couples call and confirm their reservations with the hotel, telling them we are all coming and we'll be there in a n hour. The resort reassures us that are rooms are there and ready for us. But when we arrive we find that the 2nd couple in our trio have now been told their room no longer exists; even though they called to confirm an hour earlier! We suggest canceling all of our rooms and heading back into San Juan, but the woman behind the counter tells us that all of San Juan is sold out and that we'll never get a room, much less three. I called Marriott from the desk of the Wyndham and they tell me they can accommodate us in any of their San Juan resorts. Upon hearing this, they suddenly find a room for the put out couple. But what room did they get? The living room of somebody else's suite with a murphy bed! That's absurd! One of the elevators was broken. The rooms smelled like the inside of a can of Lysol. There were so many people running up and down the hallways it felt like I was inside the Mall of America! Even our cab driver told us it's been a dump ever since Westin pulled out. I can't possibly imagine a scenario where I would recommend this hotel to anyone. You've been warned. Stay away! Oh yeah. Last but hardly least. When we complained to the concierge, we were told we need to drink more. For the record, I tried that and drinking did not help.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: bachernickel
Reviews.Content: Was worried on the plane after reading the reviews-hadn't told husband of the negative things I had read. But everything was perfect-from the food to the helpful staff. Yes the drinks were $10.00 plus, but that is what I would pay in the NYC area. A van pick up at the airport was part of my package from Liberty Travel. So I didn't have that cost. The ocean was wonderful-waves not bad-considering I live 15 minites from Jones Beach where the waves are rough with undertow. ALL the staff was wonderful and polite-but then again so were we-Juan in the breakfast area (might be assistant Manager) was both friendly and helpful. Rented a car for the day and had a wonderful time-went to rainforest and Bacarrdi factory. Ate in most of the restaurants and food was great. The Golf restaurant was a little cold-bring a sweater or wrap. All in all-would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “HOtel ok, DRAGONFLY ADVENTURES IS HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: redzins
Reviews.Content: The resort is very isolated. It is expensive to get a cab. The place is pretty, but I wouldn't really call it a resort. I don't think there is anything that is that great about it. There are two pools, one is adult only. That is nice. But oddly enough, at 5pm, you literally get booted off of the beach. They start putting the chairs away. At the pools, you get an extra hour, they start cleaning up at 6pm and it is a very awkward feeling if you want to stay at the pool. We did love Eli and John at the only bar that is open at night. (in the lobby). But I would stay away from Dragonfly adventures. We tried to book several tours and had difficulty with them all. We did get to the Old San Juan tour, only after being bamboozled into the time share presentation. (Ramon was awesome though on the tour) We did finally book the ATV tour, They called us at 5pm on Wed. for Thurs. morning. When Thurs. came around, we were in a monsoon! Lightning and Thundering outside. They would not cancel our tour. We refused to sit on a piece of metal in a lightning storm. I had to call the credit card company and dispute the charge. So I would recommend staying away from them. AS for back to the resort, concierge was lacking, grounds were ok. Beds were very good! Slept very well. Nice little balcony off of rooms, but just not much to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dnyc3000
Reviews.Content: Great location u need a car so much 2 do out here pool is great salsa in lobby best hotel 4 families yet

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: veskoteque
Reviews.Content: This was one of our worst vacations. Between the bad weather (it rained all 4 days we were there) and the below-the-expectations resort we felt like we almost did not get the breather we came here for. The worst part was the room. The airconditioning worked and kept the temperature bearable, but through either a fault or poor design could not keep the humidity at bay. Our room felt like a cold sauna. Our clothes were damp every morning, the sheets were clammy at night. I am surprised other reviewers did not remark on this, but based on the stains on the walls - this has been going on for a while. We simply did not experience the calm and relaxation we came to this island to find. The rest of the room was also sub-par for a resort (4 star, Grand-status). The bathroom looked like a Holiday Inn and the only touch of 'class' was the LG flat screen. Nothing else about this came close to some of the other caribean resorts (Windjammer or Excellence to name a few favorites) we've been to. It felt like an old three star business hotel states-side. The prices were fairly ridiculous as well, and they certainly did not provide the value in either quality or (especially) service. Staff was fairly rude, slow to respond, etc. The last day we waited 40 minutes to get our car out of the valet. It was not busy, but for whatever magical reason with 4 valets standing around no one was picking up the ticket until the third time I went and talked to the person behind the desk. Food was unremarkable as well. To be fair - we did not try Palio which everyone seems to like. Mirabella has a Flamenco performance every first Friday of each month. This was the best part of our stay. The performers were passionate, and really into what they were doing. The food was mediocre. Service was good. Do not book activities at this activity desk. Normally you get a better deal when talking to the concierge in a hotel. This time - after calling the ATV and bio-tour companies directly we went to the concierge and they wanted 30-40% more.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back here!”
Reviews.Author: MYTBAD
Reviews.Content: Gee, really a toss up between terrible and poor. Ice machines broken on 2 floors my niece was told to go to, called at least 5 times, passed around from guest services to room service several times before one ice bucket delivered about 6 hours after check-in followed by a second bucket of ice from another department 5 minutes later! Water stained spotty glasses in casual dining room, waiter didn't even pour beer in glass. Casino slot machines actions appeared to be manipulated when a pay off seemed near. Girls in Coffee shop near Casino delivered very good service. Latte's tasted comparable to Starbuck's. Crowded pools (Sun). Lock on ocean balcony room not secure. Bellhop very good service. Bathroom ok, but could use touch up for resort status. Outside of building needs touchup along with better trained staff. Will not stay here again. Taxi to San Juan or airport $65.00 plus 15 to 20% tip. Taxi from Pam Am Pier 6 adults 15 bags $120.00. Nothing near by so if you want to go anywhere, be ready to pay for transportation. Highlight: One delicious Pizza shop will deliver there! Requested delivery in 1 to 1 and 1/2 hrs. but it arrived hot within 15 mins. of call!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cammy28
Reviews.Content: Renewed our vows for 35th Anniversary. Everyone made our stay special. Loved Palio restaurant(Chef Sean made sure our meal was special). Server Hector was very attentive as was the whole staff. Really enoyed pool area and Carmen and Eduardo made sure all of our needs were taken care of. Coffee bar was super, especially Quesitos, mmmmmm. Loved breakfast and lunch at Marbellas! Can't wait to return for another visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Adult Pool”
Reviews.Author: cedarjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights and had an ocean front room (class D). The view was OK - We were in a section of the hotel that sits back from another section, so the ocean view was greatly blocked by another section of the hotel. It was technically ocean front, but wasn't the view that I was expecting. The pool was great. There was an adult section - the chairs had cusions in the adult section. We liked the adult area because it was more quiet and peaceful for couples. Chairs and umbrellas were free at the beach. The water is not as clear here as it was in San Juan (Isla Verde Beach). I was surprised how long the beach streched. I like to run on the beach and I could run a long ways on this beach - the pictures don't adaquately show how streched out it is. I loved the water slide. It was so much fun (for adults too). I would skip the steak house at the country club. Our meal was over 200 dollars (incuding a bottle of wine) and the steak wasn't that great. We also were not impressed with Palio, the pasta place. For the price, the food was only so-so. The BEST place to eat is actually a place away from the hotel, called hacienda carribe bar and grill. Check with the concerege - we got a coupon for two free sangrias. They can also give you directions - it is about a 10 minute drive. It was one of the best meals we had while in Puerto Rico - they have mostly Puerto Rican type dishes. Don't be fooled when you pull up. My husband was like, "where are we, a rodeo?" The grounds are very horsey. However, the restuarant is very cute - a darkish romantic atmosphere that is just a little bit country (not too much though). Please stay when you pull up - you won't regret it. Parking costs dollars per day in the garage. I can't remember if we knew that going in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: misc03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past February. Beautiful grounds and hotel. Highly recommend that you get a car rental so you can see many other parts of Puerto Rico. Dining at the hotel is fairly expensive but is to be expected because it's a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JoJo_in_SD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week including our two kids ages 8 and 10. The hotel was nice, the kids loved the pool and water slide. The uncrowded beach is very nice and clean. We never ate at the restaurants instead buying our meals outside including some snack and sandwich stuff at Amigo market which a few miles away on the main highway. We also ate at the kiosks in Luquillo a couple times one day we had the fried stuff and dinner at La Parilla. Bothe very good. We also drove out to Hacienda Carabali for an excellent dinner and to see the Paso Fino horses. We were not able to ride them but I wish we had. The resort is a few miles from El Yunque which was spectacular. If you stay venture out to the many roadside restaurants and do not worry there are plenty of stores nearby if you have a car. We loved the location but you need a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Resort but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: seetheworldb4ureyes
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is nice. The layout is a bit confusing as well as finding the entrance. Drinks and food were expensive but that was expected. The rooms were clean and the service was excellent. We had a pool/ocean view which was nice. The beach was a little dissapointing as I felt like it compared to beaches in the states. Not a clear turquiose color but more like a greyish brownish color. I was a little disapointed that they close down all the amentities at the beaches and pool area around 6pm. They close the bar, the slide and they start removing the beach chairs. I was actually asked to get off of a beach chair so they could put it away (VERY RUDE!). I agree with the previous post that there is not much to do in the area unless you plan on visiting the rainforest or taking a day trip to culebra or viesques islands. We did get a chance to visit the rainforest which is about a 7 min car ride away. Not as close as I had originally thought but still pretty close. Rent a car and do the tours yourself there is no reason to pay for someone to walk you around a rainforest. The concierge will provide you with directions and a nicely drawn out map of everything to see there. The tower and the waterfalls were the only thing I found worthwhile. The views of the mountains from the tower are breathtaking. I must mention that I had no problems with the valet as others said they did. I waited less than 5 minutes each time and that was without calling ahead. So in my opinion the valet is worth it. For food we tried the buffet at Marbellas, it wasnt horrible but nothing to write back home about either. Unfortunately Palio was closed for some reason but had an advertisement for a prix fix menu in the lobby that same night which I found rather odd. For breakfast we went to Antojitos which I thought was horrible. Maybe they are better for lunch and dinner but I didn't want to take a chance and go back. We also tried the kioskos for lunch one day, which were just okay as well. I would recommend the pizza shop there, everything else seemed a little risky but the pizza we had was actually pretty tasty. I would also recommend the little fruit smoothies from the truck there, best smoothie I ever had. The best meal we had the whole week we were in PR was at the Hacienda Carabali. The skirt steak and rice with beans is a must. Thanks Jorge for the recommendation! We spent the first half of our vacation in the Condado/Old San Juan area. Which I prefer over this area. There is alot more to do and the beaches there are better as well. Depending on what type of activities you want to do would determine where you should stay. If you prefer nightlife, shopping, and fine dining, go with Condado/Old San Juan. If you prefer adventure, hiking, exploring, go with Rio Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but hotel needs maintanance”
Reviews.Author: Anharin
Reviews.Content: We were there for five days this past week. I have to say that I was very proud of my Puertorican staff, very attentive and friendly. The Palio Italian restaurant exceeded my expecation, even my dad that is very difficult to please said it was excellent. Now on the other hand the hotel needs TLC, the green areas, the pool, everything in general needs more maintanance. The lock box was not working, I called and they fix it right away. I also made reservation for 11 people at the Argentinean Restaurant and they called 30 inutes before the reservation to cancel because the A/C broke. We were upset but they called back to appologize and gave us four bottles of champagne. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “I woke up in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Dlclay1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Rio Mar in celebration of our 1st wedding anniversary June 9th â€“ 13th. When we arrived we checked in with Samil at the front desk, our room was not quite ready, no problem, we had lunch and before we were finished he called and told us our room was ready. Much to our surprise we had been upgraded to the Ocean Suite # 7094; it was beautiful, with a great view, walk in closet, larger bath area, and much more. Everyone at the resort was very friendly and accommodating, from the front desk staff to the Rasta cutting coca nuts near the beach. The grounds were beautiful â€¦..The pool and beach were clean and very well maintained. We opted for a relaxing vacation, we did not participate in many of the local activities, we walked miles of beach every morning, went to El Yunque Rainforest (great) and had dinner at Richieâ€™s (great view). We also treated ourselves to a couples massage at Mandara Spaâ€¦.it was awesome!!! As mentioned in many of the previous reviews the restaurants are a bit pricey, however, we really enjoyed Marbella, and Shimas, Palio was ok, but had great ambiance, we dined there on our Anniversary night, we were serenaded during dinner, and were given a complimentary glass of champagne. Thank you Palio :) Overall we had a fantastic vacation and would recommend The Rio Marâ€¦.itâ€™s great waking up in Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Foodieguymadison
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last week and had a really good time. Before we traveled I read probably 50+ reviews on trip advisor and think the advice given made the stay far better than it would have been if I hadn't. Like most people have mentioned in previous posts renting a car is a good idea if you expect to leave the resort($35 per day) . We spent most of our days off the resort exploring different beaches and participating in activities. By the way, we paid for valet parking ($25 per day) and we never had a problem waiting for our car as long as we called 15 minutes before taking off. The best thing we did while we were there was booked a day trip snorkeling out of Fajardo. We set the trip up with the tour specialist at the concierge desk and spent $140 combined for a catamaran trip that went from 10-4:30. The deal included a free lunch, free drinks and a chance to snorkel in the coral reef with the vibrant fish life! Did I mention free drinks?!? All the rum drinks you wanted for nothing. We bought one of those $10 underwater cameras from Walgreens and ended up with some amazing photos. We also spent a day in the El Yunque rainforest. This was one thing we both were really looking forward to. Although the rainforest was gorgeous, the crowds were so heavy that it made the experience unpleasant. When you get into the park there are "trailheadâ€� signs. I would strongly suggest finding one more remote and with fewer cars parked in front! I wish I could have done it over again and heeded my own advice. The last day we were there we planned a trip to Old San Juan, unfortunately so did President Obama. There hasnâ€™t been a sitting president visit Puerto Rico since the Kennedy administration and we managed to plan our time in old San Juan right during his 4 hour visit. It was frustrating but we could help but laugh at our misfortune. We powered through the traffic and managed to meal in the area before high tailing it out of there before they closed off all the streets in the area for security. It is a really cool area and we look forward to spending more time there when we come back again. While on the resort we really enjoyed swimming in the ocean at night under the full moon and lying on the beach. We found that the majority of guest preferred the pool areas. We found this to be unusual since we both grew up near beaches and feel very comfortable in saltwater, waves and sand. I have read several posts where people complained about the waves. They are at best 2-3 feet and by no means rough or scary. We unfortunately weren't one of the lucky ones to get and upgrade to a ocean view room but they put us on the 7th floor with mountain views and found it to be quite nice. The room was clean, quiet and we really enjoyed the private balconies that each unit has. Our room was equipped with a high end dehumidifier which helped provided a dry cool environment. It was sunny every day we were there and the temp was in the 90's with 90% humidity, so having a nice cool room feels great after a day in the heat. The grounds are beautiful and the staff was friendly enough. We went to Ralphs on our way in and bought the cooler many people suggested along with booze and snacks. We did enjoy having a few drinks at the tiki bar at the resort and occasionally ventured down at night for a nightcap Vincent the bartender (great guy!) However, for the most part we avoided the resort food and drink prices. The best food we had the entire trip was from La Estacion in Farjado. It's offers an outdoor dining climate near the El Conquistador resort. They serve bbq Caribbean cuisine that was amazing! Dinner and drinks ran us around $60 and everything was delicious, give it a shot! Overall we had a great trip to Puerto Rico and really enjoyed the Rio Mar very much.

Reviews.Title: “The best on the island”
Reviews.Author: stickeq
Reviews.Content: We got to this resort and they couldn't find our reservation, with the help of my great travel agent, they upgraded us to a three bedroom suite. The place is the best. Right next to the beach and the great pool with slide they have made it the perfect place to be after a long day of sightseeing. The service was great. The first night we were waiting for our dinner and the restaurant manager notice that it took a little long for our food to arrive so he told us it would be on the house. He didn't give us a chance for us to complain. Like I said before, a great place for all.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the rain, was a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sailgirl33
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at the Rio Mar Beach Resort and Spa. The accommodations were very comfortable, we had an ocean view room with a small balcony. The balcony's drainage system was basically non-existent, so after a rain storm, there would be some rain water pooled on the balcony. This was not a big deal and the view from the balcony was gorgeous. You could even see the hotel's iguanas sunning themselves periodically near the fountain. Being sensitive sleepers, we did ask for a new room upon checking in, as our room connected with another and we'd had bad experiences with the arrangement in the past. The hotel staff promptly gave us a new room and we never once heard our neighbors - it was very quiet. The food is spectacular, though pricey. There is an Amigo grocery store nearby, we actually went there, and bought some food and a cooler so we could at least eat breakfast without paying $17. The pools were gorgeous, not much aquatic life apparent in the ocean (we snorkeled) but there were turtle nests on the beach, which had been roped off. The grounds are beautiful and the staff was exceptionally friendly. Enjoyed the trip very much!

Reviews.Title: “The Money Pit!”
Reviews.Author: donnawittrig
Reviews.Content: No doubt the Wyndham is a lovely, comfortable family property. We had an eggs, bacon, pancake breakfast for two adults and one child $75. Two rum punch and a milk shake $34. We had a wonderful breakfast down the hill at Isla Mar Bakery $16.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: jfkmichael
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Rio Mar this last week. The grounds are awesome, green, well kept, and an awesome beach. The Lobby is very nice as is the casino, and bar. We booked our rooms in February, and when we got there they didn't have a room for us. So, my family was all scattered around the hotel, the room we initally went to wasn't clean with alcohol bottles and a beachball in the room. Luckly we got a suite for.the night. I will say that the Rio Mar is an ok hotel. I might stay at it again.But if you're looking for.just the best thing ever, look else where. With a little work, I could give it ****.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HeyMelody
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2011 and had a great stay. Perfect for just walking the beach, using the pool, sleeping in and reading and relaxing. We chose not to do any excursions as we just needed the sunshine and rest. That's exactly what we got!! To answer some of the questions I had before I came, here's my advice: You can NOT buy alcohol at duty free in the airport when you are incoming, only outgoing back to the US. We tried it and they asked to see our boarding passes. So when we got there, we split a cab with a couple we met on the shuttle to the resort and stopped at the mini-mart at the corner and stocked up on drinks and snacks and a styrofoam cooler. We brought big glasses from home so just made our own drinks for poolside. By the way, that couple was so cool that we hung out with them all week! That was a plus! While we had the cab, we ate at Isamar Bakery across from the mini-mart for breakfast and ordered cuban sandwiches to go for lunch. They are all that everyone said. The place is small and rather shabby, but the food was really good, large portions and inexpensive. I think if we went back, we would want to see more things so we would definitely rent a car at the airport and pay to keep it at the resort. I think the traffic from San Juan to Rio Grande was only moderately busy and anyone who is used to a larger-sized town/city traffic would not have any worries to try this. The restaurants at the resorts ARE a little pricey, but not any more than a nice restaurant in your area. We generally don't pay that much for eating out around home, but one day we split the taxi again with the other couple and went to Loquillo and the costs were the same as the resort plus the cost of the taxi. Also, the four of us were not impressed with what we ordered there. We wouldn't go back there. So we ate at the resort the rest of the time. We had a great lunch at the outdoor restaurant (not the tiki bar) which we didn't think was too expensive. We ate at Shima's, the Asian restaurant and really liked our meal there. We ate at the buffet in the main restaurant and didn't really like it there. I would generally order an appetizer and my husband would get a main dish to help the price stay down. We split another meal at lunch, so employed these methods to keep the price down. Our room was nice, the bed slept great and the bathroom was beautiful!! We used ice from the ice machine for our cooler. We turned on the air during the day and slept with the patio door open at night to hear the sounds of the waves. We had an ocean view/pool view room and it was good. Oh, and the tiki bar had happy hour at 5 every day with rum punch drinks for $2 if I remember right. They didn't advertise it AT ALL! We had to ask for it. The first day there we got 2 mojitos which were FABULOUS but they and a chips/dip tray cost about $20. But I really loved those mojitos! We were never bothered about a time share meeting and found ALL the staff members to be nothing but friendly and helpful. Sometimes I wonder if people who think the staff are rude and rude to them first. People usually respond to you by how you come across to them. So all in all, I would go back, but rent a car next time. The initial cost was really good thru Cheap Carribean.com and the shuttle with them ran very well and was easy to do. I was happy with their services as well. It's the third time I've booked a vacation through them. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Rio Mar we go”
Reviews.Author: Seewalls
Reviews.Content: For the 3rd time, we've returned to Rio Mar, this time with Mom and our 2 sons. Once again, we enjoyed our time at Rio Mar. Great hotel, friendly and attentive service, great location. Activities included snorkel trip to Culebra, Bio-luminescent Bay kayak tour, a day in Old San Juan and a half-day to the rain forest (El Yunque)....Other than that, lot's of chillin' time at the resort with the expansive beach, pools, jacuzzi in the evening, tiki bar (albeit pricey). 5 on-site restaurants (we enjoyed Shimas (Asian Fusion)). Also explored the Kioscos in Luquillo and found #13 Tapas Restaurant to be perfect for us. We went to Richie's Restaurant just up the road from the Hotel, but now that since this has been our 3rd time there, we will choose not to return there in the future...Awesome view yes, food and service is just ok.....Will spend my hard earned dollars elsewhere. Also stopped at one of the roadside chicken BBQ's.....Awesome !!! .... Will point out that we are Wyndham Owners and enjoy being part of that family. Until next time, it's back to work and planning for another getaway. :-o)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family resort with great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: slev
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Rio Mar in June. With two kids, age 10 & 11- it was the perfect resort. Our family visited San Juan but enjoyed the area of Rio Mar much more. Here are the pros and cons. PROS: great , friendly service from everyone at hotel. Valet was very quick and efficient. Grounds were beautiful. Beach is soft sand with hundreds of live sand dollars and a few sea turtle nests (We got to see 62 leatherback turtles hatch!). Great location for wanting to do everything from Old San Juan to Culebra. Ate at Marabellas and at Pool Patio- great food at both locations (prices are resort typical, but not bad) Room service was prompt with delicious chicken soup. Pools were nice. CONS: pool bar and restaurants close early. Alcoholic drinks were expensive. Not many activities for night. Casino very small. TIPS: it gets dark early at PR. get an ice chest & snacks at Amigo Grocery to compensate for pool bar closing early and lobby bar serves some food. Get a car- a must if staying out of San Juan, but needed to really see the island, drive the rainforest, get to Fajordo/San Juan, ect. Take RT 66 toll when you can to miss traffic on HWy3 East Island Excursions Bio Bay trip to Vesques was the best part of the trip. Hacienda Carrabelli also gave family friendly horseback riding.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frida03
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations , I went with my two kids, and they love the pool!!! They have so much fun on the water slide! And the view is amazing between El Yunque rainforest and the beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: 1plus1equals3
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. Our room had a beautiful view of El Yunque and I loved opening our patio door at night to hear the chorus of coqui frogs. We had our 11 month old with us and they were able to bring us a crib for him. The beach was very nice and we were even lucky enough to see sea turtles hatching one night, making that the best experience of our trip. Overall, relaxing and enjoyable. I hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Know what to expect and you will love it”
Reviews.Author: TravelKish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on our honeymoon and selected this place in spite of the bad reviews just for the price/location. We got a good deal on Orbitz and had booked the cheapest room but guess what? Being our honeymoon and off season(i think) in mid May, they super upgraded us from 1st floor to 5th floor with sea/mountain view. (super happy). So while we were irritated with the whole parking scene (paying for self as well as walking all over), since we knew what to expect, it didnt feel so bad. Here are some highlights: Pool - We were out most of the daytime so never used it then. We loved using the jacuzzi late at night as its open 24 hrs. Take your own towels and never worry about crowds Sea shore - its right outside and you can walk as far east or west as you like and its beautiful with the sea on one side and El yunque on the other. Food - We didnt even try to eat at the resort (coz of reviews here). We drove all around or got food to the room. And yes, Amigo or Ralphs are the best places to buy stuff but I got my chilled beer 2 at a time from the gas station :) Location - Its super close to En Yunque and short drives to several water activities in Fajardo. Secret Tip - We met the friendliest of people you will meet in PR while unknowingly driving in the ghetto looking neighborhood of Playa Fortuna next to the hotel. Sammy got us freshly picked tender coconuts for $1 (i am not kiddin). He even prepped one for the road which we cud easily open with a plastic knife. Do not be scared of the neighborhood, the people are very friendly. My what an experience it was. Priceless!!

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: dna6412
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accommodations--We were upgraded to a suite with an ocean view. The room was comfortable, clean and absolutely beautiful. The resort is lovely and had an adults only pool for quiet and relaxation. The food was wonderful. Unfortunately, on Sunday night there was a limited choice for restaurants, as one was closed. Since it isn't an all inclusive, be prepared to spend a little more for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but quiet”
Reviews.Author: monicar
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 women getting away for a little break from the cold, snowy winter. We booked through Cheap Caribbean as they had a great deal. All went smoothly except for we did not get one of the rooms we were supposed to, however, they did find us one and compensated us. The place is beautiful, however, there is not much to do there. We read reviews prior to going that suggested we rent a car, so we did. But we probably did not need to do so. Depending on what you want to do while you are there, it may not be necessary. We did go to the rainforest, which we used the car for and out one night to San Juan, which we shared a van to. We could have just used the taxis instead of renting a car. We enjoyed our stay. Hotel was beautiful, a few nice bars and restaurants, and beautiful pool and beach. It would have been nice if there were some activities and more action at night. They even closed the casino early. If you are looking for a relaxing beach getaway this is it. If you are looking for more action, you may want to stay closer to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, breathtaking, unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: snuggles_03029
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spend a week at this resort, it is all that the website shows, i loved this resort, i have been to saint marrtins, punta cana, but this is by far the most beautiful resort i have stayed, it is clean, staff very friendly, the casino is nice, food is a bit expensive, but my husband and i had rented a car, so we would go out to eat, you should try hacienda carabali restaurant. beautiful lobby, great pool, there is a pool for adults only and one for family with children, i highly recommend this resort, definitely would return!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facilities, with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: l_brink
Reviews.Content: We had a rocky start to our stay at Rio Mar. I was traveling with a family of 8 and specifically requested rooms in close proximity. We reserved 4 rooms, but only 2 were available at check in. We were pleased to have been upgraded from a rainforest view to an ocean front room, however when the other 2 rooms became available they were at the farthest end of the same floor. When I talked with the hotel manager, they said if it is on the same floor they consider that close proximity. This is a very large resort, and this would not be considered close by anyone's normal standard. I was disappointed with the hotel's slow response in getting this resolved. By the second day, I think that the hotel redeemed their otherwise 1st bad impression. I agree that the food at the resort is expensive....that being said, I think the food in Puerto Rico is expensive! The kiosks at Luquillo beach were very reasonable. Otherwise, most of the restaurants that we were referred to had all the ambiance of a local diner. I think that the meals that were served should have been in the $8-$15 range, rather than the $25-$50 that were charged. Usually, when we stay at resorts we avoid eating at the resort because of the inflated prices, but in PR our experience was that the resort was one of the more reasonable places to eat with the bonus of air conditioning, tablecloths, and vegetables. The resort drinks were outrageous... $10.50 and small. Rooms were comfortable, resort was well kept, plenty of towels and beach chairs. We drove an extended van that would not fit in their parking, so we had to park in the employee lot...quite a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from begining to end!! Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: tropicalflower71
Reviews.Content: We held an event at Rio Mar on May 21 and stayed from May 21-25. The hotel is fabulous, all employees are very helpful. We had absolutely no problems at the hotel. The room was very clean, no musty smell as reported by other reviews. The grounds are impeccable, very well kept. It was rainy season in PR so we had a few days of rain. Also being so close to the rain forest a few hours of rain a day are expected. Obviously when itâ€™s cloudy the waters look grayish but their blue splendor comes out with the sun. This is NO Jersey Shore!!! The iguanas are a big attraction. They are not afraid of people and people should not be afraid of them. I did not see an iguana eat someoneâ€™s food or scare someone. I did see one take a dip in the adult pool and of course everyone got out of the pool; within seconds someone from animal control was there to remove it. I read other reviews and trust me these iguanas are not out to get you. I would definitely recommend this hotel for vacation or business meetings. Our event planner was outstanding; very accommodating and always on top of every detail. The food at the event was delicious. Everyone at our event had a great time. We have this event at a different location every year but my boss called this yearâ€™s event the best one he had ever attended. It is gratifying to hear great feedback from those attending an event (especially your boss), and I only received fantastic feedback from the group. This is not an all inclusive resort. You must expect to pay resort prices. I strongly suggest anyone traveling to Puerto Rico (especially if you are not staying in the metro area); if you want to see the island you must rent a car, even if itâ€™s for a couple of days. There are so many places to eat in the area, supermarkets, Walmart etc. You donâ€™t really have to eat at the hotel. The hotel does not mind food from outside in the room or alcohol from outside at the pool. There is a very nice place on the road to the hotel called Antojitos. Excellent! It has a very homey feel to it; you feel you are eating in someoneâ€™s terrace. Very nice food, not so expensive. If you choose to eat in the resort, the food is great and the service is excellent. The wait staff at Marbella was fantastic. Absolutely nothing negative to say about this resort, canâ€™t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: tsw8888
Reviews.Content: It was a very friendly and comfortable place to stay. The beaches were beautiful and the pool was great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “We liked Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: TanyaTT1973
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Rio Mar for 5 nights. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are a little hard to keep on a comfortable temperature. The rooms seem to either be really humid or freezing. Apart from that, we had a very comfortable stay and loved the hotel. The salsa nights and other hotel happenings were more than we expected, so that was a big plus. We would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip. Would recommend for anyone who enjoys the outdoors”
Reviews.Author: LordDash
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Location from May 30-June 2nd. Couple things I'd like to point out: The reviews on this sight absolutely made the experience better. Knowing what to expect made all the difference in the world, specifically as it relates to the Resort proximity to other areas, the cost of parking etc. That said, I do completely disagree with some of the negative reviews. One of the main complains is the service and the cost of food. I found the service to be outstanding. Everyone was extremely helpfull, friendly and knowledgeable without being overbearing. On our 2nd to last day at the resort, we had brunch at the hotel. The breakfast prices were a little high, but not absurd. Brunch price on the menu was approx $24/person on I believe. Our waiter, simply offered to "take care of us" and gave us a steep discount from the advertised prices (and I do mean STEEP). Not sure how that qualifies as bad service. We did dinner one night at another of the restraunts. Our Bill came out to just under $100 for two, but that including me purchasing one of the more expensive entree's on the menus (approx $35), bottled Water, Wine and desert. The service was exceptional, and the prices were about what one would expect from an evening restraunt. I'd say the menu included Entree's from $15-40. Price wise, it wasnt Chili's but its not Ruth's Chris either. The Resort itself is immense. Upon entering the gate, it took probably another 5 minutes of driving to actually get to the main building. The Overall layout was attractive, and though the exterior of the bulding could possibly use a little TLC, I found the resort as a whole to be very inviting, elegantly decorated in an appealing spanish mediterranian style. Our room itself was large, with a comfortable king sized bed, sizeable bathroom with a large tub, two showers (stand alone, and one in the tub) and two sinks. There is even a scale provided, and the toilet is closed off from the rest of the bathroom. If I had to venture a guess, Id say the bathroom was approx 10x18 Our view wasnâ€™t great. We were on the lowest level facing the pool, but not a big deal, since we were only in the room to sleep. Based on the location of some of the other rooms, they looked to have had some decent views. One slight drawback is that the elevator from the parking area broken for a few hours, and the lobby area of the hotel is generally pretty cold, which can be rough when youâ€™re coming in from water activities. Definitely get a car. The Resort is fairly isolated, with no real night life in the immediate vicinity. Again, knowing this going in, I didnâ€™t find it to be an issue. Parking Is $15, and they charge you when you check out, but we somehow ended up paying for only two days of parking despite being there 4 nights. But youâ€™ll want to have the freedom to go to the store, restraunts, or on any excursions without having to be on the hotel shuttle schedule. Its also simple enough to get into San Juan where there is more hustle and bustle. We rented a car near the airport and drove. It was a fairly easy drive (once we figured out where we were going) Route 26 to Route 3, took approx 30 mins one way. Traffic is a non-issue, and aside from the fact that there are virtually no street signs (to indicate the name of the roads), getting around is fairly simple. The location is great if youâ€™re going to embark on some of the outdoor excursions PR has to offer. Its 5-10 mins from Fajardo, where they have a Bio Bay Tour (a MUST see), and a port where there are shuttles to Culebra island, Vieques, St Thomas etc. If you are planning to enjoy any of the excursions, make SURE you book them yourself with the companies individually. As it will literally cost you TWICE as much to book through the Hotel. We did the Bio Bay kayak tour for approx $40/person through Pure Adventure. I believe its $75/person through the resort. This trip is a breath taking experience that is a must see for any outdoor enthusiast. Pure Adventure did a great job by providing instructions, directions, food and beverages etc. We took a day trip to Culebra where we went snorkeling, and then spent time on Flamenco Beach.
