East Wind was the company we used and again great job and great trip. We took a Catamaran to one side of Culebra to snorkel for about an hour or so. The Coral was alive with fish, and though it was slightly overcast, the water was so remarkably clear it allowed for excellent views. Then took us over to Flamenco Beach which is rated one of the most attractive beaches in the world. It did not disappoint. We swam to shore, hung out for about two hours here. East winds serves snacks, unlimited drinks including rum, a very good lunch bar, fruit etc. They also provide snorkeling equipment if necessary. A great trip for just under $100/person. The resort was slightly more expensive @ $115/person We also did the ATV tour through the Forest. This was a good time, but was cut a little short by flash flood concerns. It was raining on this trip, though it only heightened the experience to me. I believe we paid something like $80 for the driver and it was $40 for a passenger. Resort Prices are $111 per driver and $195 for driver/passenger Overall, a great experience that I would recommend to everyone. I was somewhat disappointed by the fact that I didnâ€™t run into any Iguanas. I was looking forward to the encounter. I did see one, but he was just making his way off the road on our way up to the hotel. The constant din of the Coqui song is rather soothing in an unusual way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: redbayce
Reviews.Content: Overall, this resort is perfect. It was a little ways from the airport, and getting directions in Puerto Rico without a GPS device is daunting at first. But it's very easy to find the resort once you figure out how to navigate the PR roads. The room was fantastic. It looked almost like a bachelor apartment instead of a resort room. It was very spacious, very well decorated, and had a very open floorplan design. It had two closets, two sinks in the bathroom, two showers and one bathtub, and a secluded toilet area. The walls were thick enough to keep out most of the noise from other guests and the "coqui" frogs that chirp all night long. The pools were great and spacious. There were two in all: one for children and another for adults. The beach was close to the resort (short walk) and very clean. It had very soft sand; and even though it was on the Atlantic side, the waves were small and the water was warm. There were also many palm trees and other foliage that afforded great tropical scenery for anyone who decided to spend time on the beach. The interior of the resort itself was extremely attractive, with a modern mediterranean design. There were large windows that provided great views of the beach, and numerous spacious foyers for guests to lounge around in. The employees were very friendly and helpful, without making it obvious they were fishing for tips. Prices in the restaurants were comparable or tantamount to prices in such American restaurants as: Chiles, Sizzlers, or Elephant Bar. As with any restaurant trip, you spend what you want to spend and don't blame the resulting bill on restaurant prices. I was even impressed with the prices at the gift shop, whereas they were very reasonable! I was prepared to be bombarded with iguanas, yet I only saw one crossing the road near the entrance of the resort upon our arrival. In all, there were not many animals in sight at the whole resort! I loved hearing the coqui frogs chirp every night in the jungle forest adjacent to the resort. The sights and sounds were beautiful. The resort is located in the perfect location to do many tourist activities. The concierge desk is very helpful in giving good directions to the attraction locations. The resort is also close to many shopping areas with popular stores such as: Walmart, Walgreens, Marshalls, and local grocery stores. Popular fast food restaurants also reign abundant nearby the resort. We decided to have a romantic dinner in one of the restaurants one night and the restaurant staff were phenomenal. They were very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. And most importantly, the food was delicious. The next morning, we decided to get brunch at the resort and the manager welcomed us and offered a discount on the pricey breakfast buffet! He gave us an 80% discount and I gave him a HUGE tip (smile). Parking is very easy to do at the resort, and we ended up only paying for two days even though we parked for four. The only "glitch" was that the parking garage elevator was broken one day and we had to walk through the employee entrance and around the resort to get to our room. This vacation was literally the best vacation I have had to date. I would return to this resort in a heartbeat, and recommend it as one of the best places to stay in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Property is beautiful but would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: luv2smile822
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to this resort from May 27 - June 3, 2011. It is apparently rainy season so it rained every day but we were still able to get a couple hours at the beach or pool each day. The property is well kept and beautiful. The rooms were very clean although the drawers in the room were a little musty as other reviewers had mentioned. This resort is VERY expensive. I took the advice of others and we took a taxi to Amigos Supermarket (do not go to the mini mart on the corner as the selection is not very good and they raised their prices as well) and bought water/wine/alcohol as well as snacks/fruit. The $10 per day refrigerator rental fee at the resort is well worth it since it comes to about $15/drink at the bar. They didn't seem to care if you brought your own to the pool or beach either, however, we didn't advertise it as we did it. My main complaint as to why I would never come back is that it is advertised that there are all these restaurants at the resort you can eat at and lots of excursions you can take which is the main part of the vacation. We were told that there was low occupancy and they had one maybe two restaurants open per day which to me, is not acceptable. Marbellas was always open but the breakfast buffet (which is expensive but very good) was only open a couple days the entire week due to low occupancy so you had to order off the menu which was not as economical as the buffet if you were hungry. We got tired of eating the same food every day (had enough burgers and turkey clubs to last me a long time) so we did take a taxi to Guavas, a restaurant which was a $15 cab ride each way, which was good (not great) but ends up being expensive after $30 plus tip rides to get there and back. In addition, the service at all the restaurants was very slow (they even forgot to put our order in at the lobby bar and it wasn't even busy) but since there wasn't much to do here, we weren't in a rush. As for the excursions, we were so excited to take the catamaran sailing/snorkeling trip as well as the sunset sailing cruise, however, neither were running all week since they needed 6 people for the catamaran and 4 people for the sailing cruise and apparently it was just the two of us that wanted to go. You would think they would try to accomodate their guests and if they are advertising that there are all these restaurants and excursions, they would make sure they are available to everyone regardless of occupancy. I did not get a price break and paid their expensive fees since I thought I was getting easy access to all the things they advertise they have. All in all, we do not feel the money we spent on this vacation was worth it and we would not recommend it nor plan on going back. I have spent half the amount of money going to all inclusive resorts that were amazing with lots of things do to in the Dominican Republic, Turks and Caicos, and Antigua. The water is even much nicer there (clear turquiose blue) where here reminded me of the Jersey shore with softer sand :(

Reviews.Title: “Awful for a Wyndham!”
Reviews.Author: Anubis218
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad. The pool, the beach and the golf course are very beautiful. Everything in the hotel is extremely expensive with anything especial to it. I was disappointed that the first night the water in the shower wasnâ€™t draining. At least they fix that the next day. Even know that late checkout is available with an additional fee I tried to make the arrangement for a late checkout and I was willing to pay the additional fee the front desk supervisor was rude and inconsiderate. But I still give credit to the rest of the staff they were nice and provided a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty decent, though parking could've been better”
Reviews.Author: altermood
Reviews.Content: When I booked plane tickets for my partner and I to visit Puerto Rico for the first time on a long weekend during memorial day, I wasn't sure which hotel to choose. After scouring through hotels.com, where I usually book hotels, I decided that the rio mar looked pretty decent and there was a great deal on it. I had read people's reviews about things like: it's too far from san juan, etc. but figured it would work for us, as we were planning to do things in the Fajardo area also and would be renting a car. When we got to the hotel (yes, it was pretty far...45 minutes from the airport), we were pleasantly surprised by the surroundings...very tropical. We opted for the valet parking. It was pretty expensive, something like 25 or 28 dollars a day and they would charge it all when we checked out. For the most part, it was nice, but there were a couple of issues. The first was when we were leaving in the morning to make a tour, the woman totally ignored us for 5-10 minutes while I was standing right in front of here with my ticket in plain sight. She was on the phone and even though she saw me standing there, she totally ignored me. Then, a guy walked right in front of me and handed his ticket right to her and she took it! I made a comment but she just took my ticket also, right then and ignored what I said. We got our car before them, at least..otherwise, I would have really said something! On our last night, when we drove back up to the valet, there was no one even there for ten minutes. There were two other people and everyone was looking around for the valet. Finally, the guy came out. For what they charge for parking, they should definitely have better service. We ate in the Marbella restaurant three times and all three times, it was really good. Yes, the food isn't cheap, but what resort has cheap food? (also, In my great deal from hotels.com, I was given a $100 f&b credit, which they took out when we checked out...sweet!) Our room was decent and we had a great view over the pool, with the beach in the background. Late at night, they were some loud people in the halls a couple of nights, but it wasn't such a big deal. Everyone was on vacation and enjoying themselves... I had read that every morning at 10 (or was it 11?), they feed the iguanas that hang out on the grounds but I was told by a staff member that they haven't been doing that lately because not many of the iguanas come around much anymore. Of course, that day we found a couple lounging around on the grass. It was really cool. The pools are really nice. They have two separate ones and one is adults only. Both are really big and fun to swim in. Overall, I would probably stay here again and would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For...”
Reviews.Author: Megonz47
Reviews.Content: We booked through name-your-own-price on Priceline. We got a decent price, however, I didn't expect the resort to be a 2.5-star hotel. Aside from the very friendly and helpful staff members, this hotel was far from resort quality. Parking fees were outrageous at $15/day and the parking garage is on the opposite side of the resort. (This isn't disclosed anywhere). The elevator to the parking garage from the hotel was broken for 5 out of the 7 days we stayed, leaving wheel-chair-bound people to sit and wait for someone to notice they were in the garage waiting. Area in hotel near conference rooms reeks of mold. No nightlife/evening activities during the week, doesn't make for a great honeymoon location. Shower/tub in our room was very dirty, even after cleaning. Hotel definitely needs to ugrade their rooms. Restaurants are way over priced, lunch at the tiki bar cost us $75. Food was lacking, not worth the money spent. When picking up towels at the hut by the pool, you are harassed daily about going to a time-share presentation for the "resort". Not something we wanted to be bothered with while on our honeymoon. "Oceanfront room" had view of the pool and a huge palm tree in front of our balcony, we were hardly "oceanfront". Ways to save $$: Rent a car from Enterprise at the hotel. They will pay for 1 day of parking (saves $15). DO NOT eat at the restaurants on the resort, go down rt.3 to the kiosks and eat delicious local food. Purchase a disposable cooler at walgreens and buy your own beer/wine/alcohol. Keep the cooler in your tub while in the room as they tend to leak. There are also souvenir shops next to the kiosks, buy your gifts there.

Reviews.Title: “We Found our Own Fun”
Reviews.Author: Newlyweds1217
Reviews.Content: We paid for the shuttle to and from the Airport in San Juan: Which we recommend because it takes about 45 minutes. Do Rent a car right when you get there! They sell out quick and you'll definitely want one to go out to eat, Walgreens, etc. Because the food/beverages are SO expensive at the resort!! Renting a Car is a Must Do! Other recommendations: El Yunque Rainforest, Kayaking, if you walk down the beach a ways away from the river there is coral where you can snorkel, & definitely the Kioskos (ask the staff) it is a line of authentic restaurants that has Amazing Food; especially Congas (Diners Drive ins and Dives was there!) We did it all on our own (tours causes to much time constraints and a waste of money) because we got to explore off the beaten path :) We Definitely suggest going here the rooms were clean and the Staff is VERY friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and amenities, not so nice parking”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: when I entered the hotel was like trying to find a gem in the jungle. Lot kof trees around and could not wait any longernto see the hotel. Finally I got to the hotel lobby and I felt like solving a maze. I was not impressed by the lobby, left my luggage and head to the self parking. Once there I felt like cancelling the reservation because of the aspect of the parking. Was just wondering if the hotel was just like that. Hopefully, the hotel lobby inside looked a lot better. Thanks God the worst part was over. Quick check in, bell took my bag to the room promptly. Room was ok but I didnt get ocean view a palm tree was blocking my view to other trees. Called guest services to ask for wifi to found it was 15 per 24 hr period. No thanks. I went to the pool and they were very nice, hot weather, perfect for a tan. Beach was ok but not that quite at the time so I chose the pool. Again, pools are very nice, my party played water volleyball and hotel provided the ball. There is also a sand volleyball court available. Activities during my weekend were very good since some puertorican rum companie were promoting a rum carnival with live music, typical food, dance contests. Very good. Restaurants are ok but a little expensive. Couple of options for checkout makes it very easy. I did it using interactice service in room tv. I liked this. I can recommend this hotel but please take the valet parking for 5 extra bucks so ypu dont see the worst part of the hotel which is the self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great staff and location"”
Reviews.Author: linda_marie_PDX
Reviews.Content: Room: Stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. My friend and I slept like rocks in the very comfy beds. View looked out over kids pool and ocean and was great. Room was a really good size and very clean. Super housekeeping. Flat screen TV. Only criticism was the very thin walls and loud, early rising neighbor. Staff: Very helpful and nice across the board. Food/drink: Common complaint was the high price of cocktails - and they were ridiculously high at $10.50 a pop. But they were tasty. We ate at a few of the restaurants and they were all very good. Spendy, but delicious. On our 2nd day we decided to pay the $30 to have a cab take us to the grocery so we could get snacks, light meals and cocktail makings. We probably saved $200-$300 doing that as it lasted through the week. We had a soft travel cooler and just filled with ice daily. The store, Amigo, also had styrofoam coolers to buy. Also, if you are not a fan of Walmart, Amigo is a Walmart store but we didn't know that going in. Rent-a-car: They have Enterprise on site, but book it online for significant savings. I think it's the 6000 rio mar blvd address. We rented for 1 day to hike El Yunque and tour Old San Juan which was perfect. I was told conflicting details about whether or not parking was free for rental car and I think it was. Other: There are some activities during the day but we didn't participate. The music at the kid's pool started a bit early for our taste, being on holiday (9:00-9:30 ish). The ocean was perfect and swim out far enough you can see El Yunque from the water. Overall, we had a really great time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: needavacationplanned
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent 6 days at the Rio Mar and had a beautiful stay. The grounds are well kept and very lush and green. The room was very comfortable with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The adult pool was clean and warm and we never had a problem finding chairs and an umbrella. We rented a car through Enterprise at the hotel and it was very easy - more expensive than elsewhere though. We had dinner at the Marbella restaurant once and weren't really impressed, but loved the Palio both nights we were there. The food was great and service was very quick. We also enjoyed the pianist playing outside the restaurant on our last night. The concierge and front desk were very friendly and helpful - never had to wait at either. The food at the pool bar and the 24/hr restaurant was very pricey and it would be nice to have refrigerators in the room. Parking is $15/day and not really convenient (even if the elevator to the parking garage was operating.) Also, you have to pay for wi-fi service in the room. There is a hot spot near the front desk if you don't want to pay. The location of the resort was very good - about 35 minutes from the airport, 25 minutes to Fajardo, and 10 minutes to El Yunque rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Knightrider2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are well kept and beautiful. The pool area and beach were very nice. The staff was courteous and responsive to any questions or requests. The paper thin walls in the rooms should be addressed. I guess I should be thankful that the noises heard were only complete conversations and laughter but it did make it difficult to get a decent night's sleep. The bathroom was ok. It was clean but could use some deep scrubbing of the tiles. The fitness center was quite small. There was no bike, which would have been much appreciated. Because the hotel is somewhat isolated from towns, restaurants, etc...more shops or boutiques would have improved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: wstar1
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay in this hotel, the grounds were incredible. I got a kick out of the iguanas wondering the grounds freely. Don't worry though they are not scary and are just walking across (if you can call it that). The rooms were nice and I was glad there was no carpeting but ceramic floors that gave you an old world flavor. If there were one small complaint it was a little noisy in the a.m. with the hotel staff not working very quietly. The staff was very nice and friendly so I chose not to complain at the time. The restauraunt food was good and would definitely recommenend the puerto rican suffed french toast and chicken and rice soup. I would definitely visit again and I am so glad I ignored friends warnings about Puerto Rico. We wondered all around the island for six days and never met anyone mean or with horns on their heads. One warning though be careful driving they do drive with their eyes close (LOL)>

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Rio Mar- despite the rain!"”
Reviews.Author: LKMartin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio Mar Beach Resort from May 18- May 24,2011. I booked at this hotel because of the location- the proximity to San Juan, the rainforest, and Fajardo made it a convenient place to stay. I had read some bad reviews here, but was not at all disappointed with our stay there. This was our second time in Puerto Rico- the first time we stayed in San Juan, and I definitely had a better experience staying outside the city. Before I launch into my review, just a quick warning about the weather- the rainy season starts in May and it rains EVERY DAY. Don't believe what you hear- the rain really CAN ruin your vacation. We only had one day where we got rained out completely, but be ready for roughly half a day of rain on most days if you choose to come at this time. The upside is the prices are lower, the downside is as it is the off season, there are overall less services available. I second the prior opinions that a rental car is a MUST- both for mobility and cost. A one-way taxi from San Juan to Rio Grande is about $70. If you fly into San Juan, getting to the resort from the airport is quite easy and takes about 40 minutes if traffic is light to moderate. Driving in Puerto Rico is very comparable to driving in Miami- drivers are very inconsiderate, NEVER signal when changing lanes, and will cut you off when you think it's impossible for them to squeeze into your lane. But overall, if you are from a big city, it is not that stressful driving in PR. Roads are less well maintained and sometimes not well marked. It helps if you speak Spanish, as most of the road signs are only in Spanish. Now to the hotel. It is a little bit of a drive to get from the resort entrance to the actual hotel, but it is a pretty drive. Parking at the Rio Mar is $15/day for self-park and $20/day for valet. we did the self park, but the elevator from the parking garage was broken nearly all week, which made it a pain to get in and out of the hotel- in retrospect, we should have just done the valet. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the front desk staff and concierges, who can provide you with maps/directions for Old San Juan, El Yunque trails, and the Fajardo ferries, among others. We had an ocean view room - I have read other reviews about the view being obstructed with palm trees- we got lucky and got a 6th floor room with a great view of Rio Mar beach. Our room was clean and spacious. The bathroom looked like it had recently been remodeled, with marble countertops- the bathtub was a little outdated, but overall no complaints. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The walls are quite thin, so you can hear people running around in the halls, which can make it hard to sleep. There is no refrigerator in the room, which was quite frustrating. The hotel grounds are immaculately manicured. There are two beautiful pools, including an adults-only pool with a waterfall/grotto, and hot tub, as well as a Tiki bar and fire pit. There is also a children's wading pool, tennis courts, and golf courses (which we did not use). There is also a nice spa, and a fitness center which I used every day- they advertise it as 'state of the art'- I would argue that is not the case; there are 3 cross-trainers, 6 treadmills, a stairmaster, and a few weights. It got the job done, but certainly not cutting edge. It would be better if there were windows looking out onto the property, instead of mirrors lining the walls. Regarding the beach: This beach is on the Atlantic Ocean, not the Carribbean Sea, so the surf is more rough than on the south coast of the island. I am a girl who loves her coral island Caribbean beaches- soft, white sand and calm, turquoise water. Rio Mar beach has brown/golden sand (which is nice and soft), and the surf can be quite rough to the point of being dangerous, so it can be difficult to swim there- but I did get into body surfing! The beach is pretty much only accessible through the hotel, which is gated, so it is safe and not too crowded- in the mornings I was the only one on the beach at sunrise. There is essentially no trash and the beach is clean with minimal seaweed. The hotel provides beach lounge chairs and umbrellas, as well as towels, which is very nice. One very cool thing is that it is turtle nesting season in May through roughly August, and leatherback turtles lay their eggs on the beach. There were several roped-off areas where turtles had laid their eggs! The hotel is fairly isolated. There isn't much going on in Rio Grande; the closest movie theater is in Fajardo, which is about a 15 minute drive east. There is a Wallgreen's and a KFC down the street a couple miles, and in Fajardo there is a Wal-Mart and some chain restaurants like Pollo Tropical (a favorite of ours from our last trip to Miami). The resort has several restaurants, which are open on various days, some require reservations and others don't. We ate at the Tiki bar once- the food was prepared elsewhere and brought out to us in plastic containers, and was average and overpriced. I had a $10 alcoholic drink that was served in a plastic cup that couldn't have held more than 8 oz and barely had any alcohol in it! We ate twice at Marbella, which we liked because it was casual and did not require reservations. It again was overpriced, but the food was actually quite good. The restaurant situation is easily remedied by renting a car (at the airport, NOT at the hotel)- we ate most days either in San Juan, or at the Luquillo kiosks, which are located about 5 minutes' drive from the resort. We also bought non-perishable food at the grocery store and brought it back to the room. In terms of location, there is lots to do within a short drive of the resort. We spent 2 mornings hiking in El Yunque, drove to San Juan a couple of times, visited Luquillo and Fajardo, and took the ferry to both Vieques and Culebra. Finally- one highlight of the hotel for me was the wildlife. Due to the proximity to the rainforest, in addition to the soothing sounds of crashing surf at night, you will be treated to the melody of the signature critter of the area- the coqui frog, named for their Ko-KEE! call. It was wonderful to sit on the beach at night, look up at the stars, and listen to the frogs! In addition, there are all kinds of cool lizards and iguanas on the property- they especially come out on sunny days. Be careful not to hit them when driving! Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Rio Mar. We are definitely planning to come back to Puerto Rico, and we will definitely stay at the Rio Mar again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sandy1992
Reviews.Content: I went to the Wyndham for a convention. The staff was very unfriendly at check in, thought it might just be the person who checked us in but found the staff as a whole was almost annoyed that we would ask for anything (with the exception of the time share staff) . The TV in our room was not working, they did fix that. We asked for extra towels which we never got, we picked them up from a cart two days later. The first day we were there they didn't even bother to clean our room. The pool was dirty. The casino left much to be desired as well. The restaurants were average. The property itself is very nice and it's such a shame that the hotel is so mismanaged.

Reviews.Title: “Great With Only Couple of Issues”
Reviews.Author: Shannon73
Reviews.Content: We checked into Rio Mar quickly and handed our car off to valet. If you park your rental yourself it is $15 a day plus tax, valet is $20 a day plus tax. Valet is well worth it. We would call down from the room and give them our ticket number. The car was waiting for us everytime we left the hotel. Once we were in the room I noticed it wasn't the room I booked. We had reserved through Travelocity after I had called the hotel directly to confirm the difference between an ocean view and an ocean front. I was told the ocean view rooms were caddy corner to the beach and the ocean front directly faced the ocean. I specifically asked for an ocean front and paid extra for that room. This isn't the room we were given. We were given an ocean view suite, which was very nice but again, not what we booked. That evening we had dinner at Marabella inside the resort. The food was great (a little pricey for the portions, $28 for skirt steak & shrimp) and our waiter Jose C. was the nicest person we met at the resort the entire time we were there. This was also our first taste of Mofongo, which my husband loved.....me not so much. The next day we traveled to the rain forrest, the entrance is accross the highway from the resort. It drizzled on us the entire time we were up there but no worries, we had our swim suits on anyway. The waterfalls in the rainforrest are beautiful and it's free to guide yourself around. There are plenty of maps online you can print out. We had lunch at the Luguillo kiosks about 5 minutes away from the resort. This quickly became my favorite place to eat. Traditional food and a great price! We also had dinner at Richie's while we were there. If you go past the entrance to the resort about half a mile up the hill Richie's will be on the right hand side with the parking on the left hand side. This restaurant overlooks Rio Mar and the beach, the view is fabulous and so is the food. If your a kitty lover you'll also like their resident mascot, a sweet kitty that walks around their patio but never jumps on anyone or the tables. We also took a trip through Rio Mar's casino. Long story short I walked in with $20 and my husband $25. I walked out with $50 and my husband $5. We aren't big gamblers so this was some cheap fun to pass the time while it was raining. The pools, beach, and hot tub are all great, no problems finding seating or extra towels. Every morning at 10 AM near the activities pool they fed the iguanas. If you were on the beach at 5 PM your chair was taken from you to make way for the leatherback turtles. On a few of the restaurants they say that slacks are required, however when we ate at Shimas there were many people in nice shorts and shirts. Don't miss Island Adventures Bio Bay tour! It was amazing and only 30 minute drive from hotel. Only big complaint was the electrical outlets in the room where uncovered and had like 10 things plugged into each. Fire hazzard!! Check out was easy as you can check out at the front desk, by phone, or through the tv. Great stay but just not sure Puerto Rico is the place for us. We like to be pampered on vacation and Puerto Ricans seemed bothered by us being there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel, nice beach”
Reviews.Author: muffy2000
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar was better than I thought it would be..the resort is big, the rooms are nice, didn't need to specially reserve the "clean air room" that they offer, the regular room was fine.. no mold or mildew noticed & the air conditioning worked well. The location is excellent very close to the rainforest, beaches & Puerto del Rey Marina, Farjardo. I recommend booking a trip w/East Island Excursions for the bio-bay tour it was incredible & not to be missed. They are the only company that will take you over to Vieques & back on the same night..although planning your trip to give yourself a few days on Vieques island would be ideal bc it seemed nice there with lots to do. We also did the snorkleing trip to Culebra w/ East Island which was not the best bc the snorkeling part of it was poor- the reefs were not very vibrant at all and there were not many fish but the trip over to Flamenco beach was outstanding, the best beach I've ever seen.. a few days on that beach would be awesome too. However, if you don't have a lot of time to hotel hop.. then Rio Mar resort is a great place to be. The beach there was nice, the sand is nice, the water was fine, there are waves but it's definitely not unswimmable as some other reviews said. There are jet ski rentals right on the beach, the hotel pool is big & there's a separate pool for adults only. It is very true about the restaurants being very expensive at the hotel. Go to Ismar's bakery down the street on Route 3 & the road you turn into to get to the hotel they have great breakfast & lunch sandwiches for very cheap, you will be thankful you know about it instead paying a fortune at the resort. Also PePe's just a few buildings away from Ismar's on Route 3 had good cheap breakfast also. Antojito's restaurant behind Ismar's was good for dinner, get Mofongo. The Luquillo beach kiosks were ok, not awesome La Parilla was pretty good not incredible we had the Dorado (red snapper fried fish) it was tasty. You will absolutely need a rental car for sure. Don't try to do this trip without a rental car, don't rent at the hotel- too expensive, rent at the airport. Driving in PR is like driving in any city, wasn't a problem at all, didn't see any crazy drivers & the roads are paved & are totally fine. You definitely don't need a 4x4 & should get the smallest car possible to make it easier for parking. We spent 4hrs in Old San Juan after we arrived at airport picked up the rental car drove to Old San Juan toured around for a few hours & drove to hotel that night & it was easy, didn't feel like we needed much more time in Old San Juan we got the feel for it in that short time. Although driving to old san juan again to eat at some of the restaurants there would have been good but we didn't have the time, it's about an hour to OSJ from the hotel. Being closer to the rainforest & to Fajardo marina to get to Vieques & Culebra was better than staying at a hotel in San Juan. CheapCarribean.com had great deals for this resort. Very Cheap for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you read the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: nacardavid
Reviews.Content: I was some what worried about my stay after reading the reviews but i couldnt have been more plesantly suprised. Yes the prices from food, drinks and parking etc are high. If you have a car you can stay at a decent price. The kiosk in Faharda were good , They look a little run down but the food and prices are alot better than at the hotel.The kiosk are only about 3 or 4 miles away. on left heading towards faharda. There is a resturaunt up the hill the second on right that was the best . They had great seafood and steaks alot cheaper than alot of the other places. no mnight life to speak of.The weather was rainy just about every day but all in all the Rio Mar was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico is a terrific destination for a family beach vacation.”
Reviews.Author: TripTalk11
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two kids 7 and 10) traveled to Puerto Rico for Spring Break in April, 2011. Wyndham Rio Mar. Very pretty hotel, both the lobby and the grounds, and family friendly. The pool is terrific and the beach is beautiful. Although the beach is public, you do not need to worry about vendors trying to sell you little items every 5 minutes. We did not see any of that. The Wyndham has staff who will set up chairs, tables and umbrellas for you on the beach. The hotel ran out of towels, chairs and umbrellas almost every day during the week of our visit. The key is to send one adult to the pool or the beach early in the morning to get towels and set up your familyâ€™s chairs and umbrellas. The adult can leave a beach bag or shoes on the chairs and go back and meet the family for breakfast. When you come out to the pool or beach after breakfast, you are all set. We strongly recommend that you rent a refrigerator for snacks and drinks. The Amigo supermarket is not far from the hotel, and you can pick up everything you need there (we also recommend that you rent a car â€“ see below). My big criticism of the hotel is that it did not honor its agreement to provide us with connecting rooms. I specifically contacted the property before making the reservation for two rooms and I was told connecting rooms would not be a problem. We also confirmed our reservation for connecting rooms before departure. Upon arrival we were told that there were no connecting rooms available. It took a lot of time and frustration as we spoke with one person after the next until hotel management would do something more than say â€œsorry we canâ€™t do anything.â€� While management finally upgraded us to a suite for the first two nights, we still had to change rooms in the middle of our vacation in order to stay in the rooms we had booked. Restaurants: The food at the hotel is very, very expensive. We ate dinner at Palio (Italian) and The Grille Room (steak). The food was very good and both restaurants are kid-friendly, but also pricey! Bring a sweater to wear in the restaurants as it is quite chilly. We ate off-property at The Brass Cactus in Luquillo, which I highly recommend. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. The hotel sent us to Guavas, also in Luquillo, but the food was mediocre at best and I do not recommend that restaurant. Car Rental: We strongly recommend that you rent a car so that you have your own transportation to and from excursions, restaurants and the airport. As noted above, you can also go the grocery store to pick up snacks and drinks to keep in the room. This should save you a lot of money. We rented through Alamo, and we had a good experience. Alamo advised that its car rental is â€œin terminal.â€� You still need to take an Alamo shuttle with all of your luggage to get to the Alamo facility. As far as I could tell, you had to take a shuttle to get to any of the car rental facilities. We read reviews stating that GPS systems are unreliable, but that was not our experience. Our GPS system (rented with the car through Alamo) worked exceedingly well, getting us to the hotel, the airport, the excursions and the restaurants off property without any problem. I would still bring printed directions anytime you venture off the resort just to be safe. Bio Bay: We loved the Bio Bay kayak trip through Pure Adventure. There are usually two excursions each night, and we recommend doing the early excursion. This allows you to meet with the tour guide for the instruction during daylight. You also kayak out to the Bay during the daylight. It gets dark while you are in the Bay and it is pitch black as you kayak back to the base. By kayaking out to the Bay during the daylight, you have some familiarity with the route on your way back to the base. Pure Adventure was organized and ran on schedule. There is a discount when you pay cash. Horseback Riding: Our kids loved the horseback riding through Hacienda Caribali, which is very close to the hotel. The horses are gentle, and the kids were fine. It is worth paying extra for a reservation for a private 2-hour tour. Bring your own helmets!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: upsouthvolleyball
Reviews.Content: I read all of the poor reviews and decided to stay at the Rio Mar anyway. It's location to other activities we wished to experience was perfect and we have never had the need to be treated like 5 star resort guests. We never got hassled about a timeshare. I guess they saw us walking in with the grocery bags (and a cooler) from from the Econo and Amigos and figured it was out of our price range. Never saw any of the restaurants open except to serve the convention guests. Didn't bother us as we were headed to the Kioskos and other dining options nearby. Staff was friendly and attentive but we made very few requests. Parking is a joke. One time it's: sign the form and get your card read, another time it's just sign your own card and indicate room number, another time they just keep the card, no signing the list because there's nobody at the gate and it's open anyway. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The rooms were most adequate and I have to agree with another reviewer that liked the lagoon view room the best. Thought more than once about going to the casino but after hiking the trails in El Yunque all day you really might not feel like getting all resort casual? Hate to tell all the folks that complained to no end about the pricing but I only had a $110 "extras" bill for a 5 night stay and that included one phone call, self parking and 2 morning pots of coffee (delivered promptly and pleasantly). I hope to get back to Puerto Rico one day and I would stay at the Wyndham Rio Mar Resort again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but improvement necessary.”
Reviews.Author: FLJayJay
Reviews.Content: PLUSES: Fabulous beach, beautiful gardens, pool and spa area clean and well-maintained. Easy check-in and check out. Great priceline rate of $90 (add parking at $20/day and 14% resort fee plus 13% tax per day). Two miles away from a great little authentic steak restaurant (Hacienda Caribali), to which I was referred by friendly front desk staffers. Directly across Rt. 3, the main road, from the entrance to El Yunque rain forest. I got a second-floor room just off the lobby, overlooking the pool area. Free high-speed wireless internet in the lobby. MINUSES: Obviously dated rooms, lots of little things (rust and broken tub fixtures, moldy smell). SLOW service at breakfast, despite only ten tables out of 50+ occupied at 8 AM on a Sunday morning. Several restaurants closed (low occupancy). Gotta have wheels to get there. I had stayed there some years ago when the property was owned by Westin. I would have been unhappy with it if I had paid the rack rate, but at the Priceline rate plus taxes and fees, it was a bargain for a great location and a nice, short stay. Coquis sing you to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort but beware of Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: SimpleTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for a few days last week with my wife for a Caribbean getaway. Overall, the hotel wasn't bad. I don't consider myself a picky person who looks at every small detail, but there are some details you cannot overlook no matter how hard you try: Valet parking is a rip-off. I had a horrible (without exaggeration) experience and I wasn't the only one. The Valet desk became more of customer complaint desk during our stay there. Guests would make the line to complaint about how the valet parking staff lost their car keys; one person ended up waiting for almost an hour for her car, I didn't quite reach the hour wait. My average wait time was about 40-45 minutes. I even insisted to the attendant to give me my keys and that I would get my car myself, but they refused. The supervisor on staff (Got his name initials - J.V.) saw my car keys were next in line after the 40 minute wait, but proceeded to help out a "buddy" instead for a few bucks slipped with the keys if you get my drift. I was disgusted at this and next time will do the self-parking as the $5 difference is simply not worth the headache. Parking is expensive as it is at $15-$20 per day. Good points about the hotel: The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are very clean; one restaurant Marbella was simply delicious and worth paying the marked up prices charged by the resort for food there. The Casino was just plain silly. Everyone went there to lose money. The cashier line was always empty and when we were there, they were raffling off a car, but everyone seemed to qualify for the finals. After a while, it was more entertaining to see people's faces as they left the casino than to actual go in it and lose money myself. Make sure to rent a frig for $10/night. It's worth it, trust me. Unless you like to pay $6 per water bottle when you can buy a box of 24 water bottles for $5 outside of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not spectacular...........”
Reviews.Author: Liz0629
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week with my partner from May 7 to 13. The grounds are immaculately maintained, golf course, beach and pool are beautiful, the views from our ocean view room spectacular and listening to the waves of the ocean are calming. Just very surprised that the carpets in the hallways seem very old and there is a stale smell in the hallways. Surprised this is a Wyndham property (remodeling should be planned for the near future, those bed comforters and curtains need some replacing.....)!!!!. Firstly, the hotel rooms need some kind of vent to circulate the air. It was cold and damp in our room, especially after you took a shower, all the mirrors in the entire room were foggy and wet. This facility is a bit pricey - a 12 oz can of coke cost $3.21 along with a bottle of water for almost $7.00 total. Then comes parking which is between 15 to 20 per day. Oh, and watch out for getting charged twice. They charged our room and got cash from my partner each day for parking until she realized and discussed with the hotel and they took the charges off our bill. At check out, I asked for a copy of the bill and they said...you don't get one because your balance is at zero and I insisted on getting a copy of it (so always get your copy because you just never know). The staff is completely approachable and very informative especially Wilson and Angelo (these two guys at the Concierge desk know everything there is to know about the island). It was close to El Yunque and to Fajardo where you can catch a ferry to get to the island of Culebra and Vieques (that should definitely be on your itinerary when you are there). A bit distant from San Juan where we would go to for dinner and shopping and even breakfast. For an amazing cup of coffee and an inexpensive but surely the best breakfast you will have, is at La Tortuga in San Juan and dinner at Raices is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly 4 star, but pretty darn close!”
Reviews.Author: PowHow
Reviews.Content: A few of my girlfriends and I booked an amazing package on cheapcarribean.com and we stayed at the Rio Mar. The pictures were amazing and frankly, I was mostly excited by the swim up bar. Unfortunately, the swim up bar was no where to be found. Bummer, but not a deal breaker. The hotel is actually about a 45 minute drive from the airport. Thank goodness I read some the reviews on here because I was able to convince my friends to rent a car and let me tell you, it was WELL WORTH IT! We zipped around town: drove down the road to the local beach (Luquillo), drove to the ferry that takes you to Culebra (DO IT) and drove into Old San Juan twice (second time was for the Bacardo factory). The service was amazing. Everyone was so nice to us and helpful. The Spanish is a little hard to get because they speak with a different accent, but I was able to communicate just fine (I'm speak conversational Spanish). The hotel is a slightly run down, the bathrooms weren't the cleanest, but we weren't in our rooms that often. I will say that the beds were AMAZING... I literally fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. I still dream of those mattresses. Our "resort view" was a view of a driveway. When we asked for higher room, they weren't able to accomodate us...oh well. Again, not a deal breaker, but it would have been nice to have a view of the grounds or the ocean. SKIP THE CASINO. It's tiny and I didn't see one person walk out with any money in their pockets. I think next time we'll stay in San Juan, but I wouldn't right this hotel off completely. I'd be more than happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice, pleasant place, but when you're on vacation it is very easy to be taken advantage of.”
Reviews.Author: bfiftytwos
Reviews.Content: It is nice that this resort is across the main highway from an incredible rain forest. The beach is very nice with decent waves for body surfing or just boogy boarding. The staff that help on the beach were very nice. We liked a pair of shoes that the beach staff were wearing and one of them actually went out on his time off and bought of pair for me ($10). We know that when on vacation people spend $$ and we are in that population that somethings will just cost more. This resort had a high price on everything, from the $4 coffee, and the $15 burgers. We rented a car which was basically free due to CC rewards. The $15 -20 parking fee/day was not convienent. I was actually charged an extra day that I could not have removed. There are 5 restuarants at he resort and out of allof them the Italian restaurant was the best, even though the total service was horrible. The staff was nice, but not very talkative. They were not attentive to us as anyone would like in food service. when I am done I would like my plate out of my way. And if there is "noithing else" needed isn't that a clue to bring the check. Waiting 10-15 minutes for the check when the restaurant is slow is bewildering. I suggest to anyone going for at lest one week to bring a car, go buy your own alcohol, beer and get styrofoam cooler at liquor store on corner highway for $5. Overall $ being taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View, Impecable Service”
Reviews.Author: meghanlynn
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing. Beautiful everything---view of the ocean was priceless. Pools, jacuzzi, great adult pool so that you can have some peace and quiet, but wonderful slide at the other pool for kids and adults. Golf course as beautiful, but pricey. Wonderful service, room service called you by your name. Cool Tiki bar, beach chairs and umbrellas set up for you. Only downfall was food and beverage prices. I recommend packing or buying a cooler when you're there and buying some snacks, beer, wine, etc, at a local market. But, definitely treat yourself there too! The tiki bar is great and has a rum punch two for 1 from 4-6 every day. But,. $7 for one beer is steep. The resort was 20 minutes from San Juan airport, the El Yunque Rain Forest, Luquillo, and Farjardo. All great and awesome experiences!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: dkchips
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had some business in Puerto Rico and first stayed in San Juan from 4/22-4/26 - then we checked into the Rio Mar and I was impressed with the top flight service especially Danny Williams - the Resort's GM - who met me at check in and upgraded us to an ocean view room. Nice suprise - and the grounds and beach are incredible. The restaurants are also rather good with the best buy being the breakfast buffet at Marbella - for $24 and all you can eat - of a wide selection of brunch foods. Their Japanese restaurant was also wonderful. Make sure you make reservations for the Italian restaurant and don't forget to try the Grill Room at the Golf Club. All in all - a wonderful and relaxing 5 day stay in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Resort? More like a massive HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MsKia777
Reviews.Content: This place sucks! I stayed in rooom 6034 on April 28, 2011 wiht my cousin. We ate out every nite and found out no microwaves in the rooms to warm our doggie bags and they charge you to warm your food up. I complained to manager and concierge and they could have cared less. The only advantage is that its directly across the street from El Yungue but it rains alot in the area because they are so near to the forest. You must rent a car when there or you will be stuck in a very boring place wiht a lovely view. See Carlos (tell him Kia told you about him) at guard gate for travel tips and he may even show you around on his day off if he can. He gave us alot of help! DO NOT STAY HERE! IT IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY THEY CHARGE FOR STANDARD HOTEL ROOM, NOISY HALLWAYS, PAPER THIN WALLS, ICE MACHINE BUT NO ICE BUCKETS, PARKING GARAGE LEVER DIDNT WORK TO LET ME OUT EVERYTIME, HAVING TO HAVE MY TICKET VALIDATED EVERYTIME I WANTED TO LEAVE OUT, UGH...I CAN STILL GO ON! save your money and go to El Conquistador or someplace else because Wyndham will NOT see me again! Booooooooooooooo!

Reviews.Title: “Beach Resort Oasis”
Reviews.Author: axraupp
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds right on a large beach. However, there isn't much else for miles. The hotel is about 2 miles from the main road, but there are no theaters or tourist shops anywhere near. There is quite a bit of regular shopping areas close by. However, it is not far from Fajardo, where you can catch the rain forest, Biobay, Snorkeling & Viecas tours. The hotel itself is quite nice, with well kept rooms, public areas and grounds. The staff isn't that warm, but not unfriendly, which seems par for the locals. The large beach is very nice and well kept (even though the guests leave way too much trash at the end of the day) and the waves are pretty big; good for bodysurfing & boogyboarding but a little rough for sitting in the wash. We were there during a slower period, so were not inundated by spring breakers, kids & crowds. We were always able to find a lounge chair on the beach and space in the pool. We weren't able to experience the food or drink as we had a car and ate outside and don't drink so can't comment on the expense. We brought cereal & fruit for breakfast, and left for the day for lunch & dinner. (Warning: no fridge in room) There are restaurants close by, including Antiojitos, which has local food, right at the main road. Yes, parking is US$15/day, and is pretty far from the rooms. Kind of a hassle. As for kids, there really isn't much to do other than beach & pool, both of which are great. On a rainy day, you will be hard pressed for entertainment. There is a kids club, but it seemed small but ok for smaller kids. Rates are US$75/day, $45/half-day. Maybe a movie night every other night would be a great thing. We were upgraded to an "Ocean View" room, but with the amount of palm trees, it can really be called a "Pool View" room, which was fine anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and fun but pricey (bring your own snacks)”
Reviews.Author: mdnightsky
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to PR for some beach and adventure time. We were only there for a short time but thoroughly enjoyed our time. After reading other reviews about pricey food, we packed granola bars and other snacks in our, brought water bottles to refill and shared food when we did go to the restaurant (although we did splurge on the $10.50 too small frozen drinks by the pool). The beach, pool and grounds are wonderful, clean and relaxing. We spent day one by the pool and went kayaking in bio bay at night (so cool!!) day two was rainy so we got a late breakfast (Shared a $13 omelet - it was huge so that was good) and caught a taxi to old San Juan (a 45 minute ride each way - $140 round trip - not terrible when splitting 4 ways) the fort was really neat and we did a little shopping before dinner at Cafe Puerto Rico - delicious! Overall great trip, pricey food was only down side.

Reviews.Title: “puerto rico - yes. rio mar - no.”
Reviews.Author: grantst
Reviews.Content: we fully enjoyed puerto rico - however this wasn't the case with the rio mar. as with others who have recently reviewed the hotel - i really want to drive the point home that this place is not able to handle capacity. there was a large group at the hotel that the normally friendly staff blamed for everything - lack of beach towels, lobby space, refridgerator availability... too many to name. and it definitely didn't help the rio mar cause when the staff complained to US about the group, too - separate employees on separate occasions. not a lot of sympathy coming from this guest point of view. in fairness, one of these employees was trying to be helpful, the other was just straight up rude (which was NOT a common quality with the staff). tried to look past this annoyance to relax and enjoy our vacation, but little things kept adding up to eventually deposit quite the bitter taste in our mouths regarding the rio mar. the big one being when the running water stopped in hotel rooms (different rooms on different days/times) ultimately - if you are going to stay here, don't pay full price if you can avoid it. definitely get a car and do puerto rico on your own. visit old san juan, mosquito bay on vieques, el yunque and richie's cafe (definitely for lunch or early dinner, it's all about the view). avoid the rio mar beach if it's super windy, otherwise it's perfectly swimmable. walk up the beach to the right for calmer waters at the mouth of the river. pools were pretty, but dirty. avoid a visit to the spa at all costs - what a mess. we chose this area of the island because it seemed like a good location to do day trips here & there. if you're looking for beach/nightlife you may want to look into hotels in san juan. if you're looking for pristine, white sand beaches go the culebra route. but if you're looking for a bit of everything at a resort in the rio grande area you're a bit out of luck. if you just want a decent room to sleep in and a cape-cod style beach in a pretty, safe area - give it a go.. but if you plan on staying on site for your entire vacation don't get your hopes up. check out puertoricodaytrips.com for information and ideas - we used this resource, in addition to trip advisor, for just about everything we did. we've been to a lot of different countries and more than a handful of islands where we've been hesitant to explore on our own - puerto rico is easy to get around and far from intimidating. puerto rico is an amazingly beautiful and welcoming island but the rio mar is not going to help you realize that.

Reviews.Title: “Resort is beautiful, however if you are not part of a large group BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: Gooselee
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Ocean Villas at Rio Mar (which I will review under the Ocean Villas), however we used several of the hotel services/amenities and do the poor customer service I had to share our experiences. Positives: beautiful grounds, staff is friendly and nice, liked Iguana's Pub (next to the Grill room at the golf course). Very child friendly and you can order off of the Grill menu. Over priced, yes, but not horrendous. Good experience at the kids club (and bad experience below), counselors were welcoming and warm. Negatives: Chair hogs (many families reserved large blocks of chairs at both pool and beach). Lack of beach towels after late morning. Easter Brunch in Mirabella was awful. The food was presented in a nice way, but obviously in a manner to prevent you from eating the pricey stuff (shrimp cocktail plated in a shot glass with one shrimp), and tasteless. There was a large group (500 plus) of families staying at hotel. Half the beach, several cabanas, all grassy fields, the conference center, and a large section of the lobby were blocked off for them. That meant the other hotels guests could not use them (at any time). While I understand this, it was very difficult to explain why my kids couldn't step foot in any of these areas, most of them not being used. We actually were scolded once for walking through of these areas by one of the friendly (not) group members. While we had planned two afternoons in the kids club, the 2nd never happened. As we went to check in, we were advised that it was full (we had reservations). When I said such I was then told it was closed. I had confirmed the day prior. After politely requesting the truth, we were told 'management' closed it when the large group asked for more babysitters at the last minute. The hotel advised no one and there were several angry non group guests. I understand that the large group is a $$ maker for the hotel, however everyone else's vacation suffered as a result. Very frustrating when most of the reserved areas were underused and the common/open areas were overrun with the group. Think this all could have been handled better. My husband spoke to some of the group folks and they go back every year during Easter week. I suggest if you want to stay at the Rio Mar during this week, you either join they're group or chose another week!

Reviews.Title: “Some aspects of our stay were great, others were maddening...”
Reviews.Author: motherbored
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a beautiful property located directly on the coast and about a 40 minute drive east of the San Juan Airport. The hotel is lovely and has many amenities. Our room was amply sized and clean. Most of the staff were very helpful when they could be. The hotel restaurants were great--we highly recommend Shima (Asian) and the Grille Room/Steakhouse at the Golf Club. We took advantage of the spa, kayak rentals and golf. Spa-okay/good, kayaking fun, and golf great. Here are some of the things that made me shake my head in frustration: The hotel was 100% booked during our stay. That being said, I did not feel as though the hotel staff and facilities could handle the number of guests appropriately. 1. You could NOT get a beach chair, pool chaise, umbrella, or towel after 10AM--they were full/taken. Also, there was a huge party of guests that had reserved chairs that lay empty the everyday and could not be used by other guests--crazy! 2. Water pressure at peak times was non-existent. At 5PM I turned on our hot-water faucet and only air came out. 3. HUGE iguanas roam the property and pool areas, which is a blast for the kids, who enjoy feeding them. However, when they defecate around the pool and no one cleans it up for days, it can be a problem--I even mentioned the situation to two different staff members. On day three, someone addressed the messes. 4. There were no refrigerators available (when a bottle of water costs $7 dollars, it's nice to have a refrigerator). Guests must reserve or request a refrigerator in advance, but I think the hotel has very few. We were on a waiting list of 65 people who requested one and never got one. 5. Room WiFi will only work if it is hard-wired to your device via ethernet cable in the rooms (no phone or iPad usage in the rooms, you had to go to the lobby to get service). 6. The health club is tiny and was packed everyday--there were only seven treadmills for the hundreds and hundreds of guests. 7. I had never paid $24 for a salad served in a plastic container before until we arrived at the Rio Mar and had lunch by the pool on the first day. Drinks and salads for the four of us came to $162.00--ouch! 7. When anyone vacations during school vacation week, Easter, and Passover, there are going to be a lot of kids. Some families feel it is perfectly fine to let their kids play in the hallway running from room to room screaming and slamming doors. We asked to be moved to a different room, but our request was never addressed. We just left our room by 7:30 a.m. everyday to secure our beach chairs and towels. I don't mean to be overly negative about the hotel, but I felt we had to have our own system of coping to beat the madness of the numbers during peak holiday time. We made sure to arrive at the pool/beach/health club very early to secure chairs, towels, and services. We rented a car to drive around to shop and visit the rain forest (which is wonderful). We drove to Walgreens and Ralph's grocery store (about 2 miles west of the hotel on rte. 3) to purchase a cooler, waters, and drinks. Our family had a wonderful time, but at some level, it was less relaxing then we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for offsite activities and pool and beach were beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gwmorris
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel itself was nice but not spectacular. There were some minor issues, but the room smelled fine, was very clean, and the beds and pillows were surprisingly comfy. The hotel was sold out but did not feel crowded. The beach was great and really nice service of staff providing chairs and umbrellas. There was some sea grass and seaweed washing up in the water but I suspect this was a temporary condition due to currents/season/etc. The pool was very nice. The pool others are describing as a â€˜kiddie poolâ€™ is actually a very large and nice pool with a waterslide. I also liked that my 2 yr old was not forced to use the smaller baby wading pool like some cruises Iâ€™ve been on. It would have been nice if the hotel had an â€˜after dinnerâ€™ kids camp as we retired back to our rooms shortly after dinner with nothing else to do. My wife went to the casino one night but I remained back to watch the kids. This hotel is in perfect location to El Yunque and the many activies to do in the Fajardo â€˜cabezasâ€™ area. I used the valet service. Was very convenient and the car was retrieved very quickly every time. As for food, I took some othersâ€™ advice to go offsite, but in order to keep sanity in the household did not run offsite for every meal, which I think was a good idea. The coffee shop in the hotel was â€˜resort pricedâ€™ but I did not think outrageous. The muffins, pastries, and coffee were quite good and while it was not a $3.50 breakfast, the convenience was worth it. I ordered lunch once at the poolside cafÃ© and twice poolside. The staff around the pool brought our order very quickly. At the poolside cafÃ© (or whatever they call it) the food took a very long time, but they offered a round of free drinks (like 5 frozen drinks although 3 virgin for the kids) which was very nice. Fairly expensive but reasonable I felt for a resort. The â€˜Shimasâ€™ sushi/Asian restaurant in the hotel was excellent, and the deserts absolutely phenomenal. Offsite I tried a number of restaurants. I felt La Parilla (Luquillo Kiosks) was overrated. Atmosphere was better than expected, but deep fry and add a lot of salt to anything and itâ€™ll be tasty. Appetizers are very good. Corn sticks are like corn bread hush puppies. Not much for healthy alternatives for the entrÃ©e menu. Mofongo was good, but not amazing. Terraza Montemar just up the street from Richies was a gem. Lunch type atmosphere with a terrific view, but a dinnerish menu. We arrived late so got a late lunch before checking into the hotel. Kids nuggets were great, and the seafood mofongo was my base of comparison for all others, which none else compared. They spoke little English, with a kid crying in a crib in a corner, but the food was great. Metropol in Fajardo â€“ interesting, Cuban. Calizo in Fajardo â€“ Good atmosphere. Seafood very good. Heaps of delicious lobster and shrimp around a bed of rather bland mofongo. Mahi (dorado) nuggets for the kids were very good, as where the chicken nuggets. For a thrilling adventure do the miniboat snorkel through â€˜kayaking Puerto ricoâ€™. Kids will be raving about this one for years. Bio bay kayak was cool, but not â€˜amazingâ€™.

Reviews.Title: “wyndham cafe close to the casino”
Reviews.Author: vacation96
Reviews.Content: very bad custumer service went to get a icecream ,i give her $20.00 dollars and she said i give her $10.00 .i tell her to call the manager cause i want to see the video and she call Anthony Rosa. he did not belive me i give her 20 dollars so i tell him to call the resort manager and Soledad B.Concepcion came, i explain the situation and she went `to tell security. i was the for 30 min and they did not resolve the problem.i tell them that i dont want the ice cream so i left it there and that i want my money back. Anthony Rosa tell my that i cant return the ice cream the way i did just put it in the counter. Soledad Concepcion came back and tell me that they still working on it.i tell her i want to see the video and she tell me that she dont . i left and went to the front desk to see who is the manager and she was the one,the same lady Soledad Consepcion. the amount is not much, but the action and the customer service is very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful, and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Catherine313
Reviews.Content: We will be back to this resort! The beach and the resort are beautiful, and the service was great. Tip #1: Rent a car. It will save you a lot of money. Tip #2: Eat out. There is a delicious and very reasonably priced Tappas place called Tappas 13 very close by (take a left at the light) and we ate there for four days straight! Also, Antojitas, which is just at the end of the road, has great breakfast and delicious coffee. It opens at 8 am. Tip #3: If you want to sit on the beach, you better get there by 10 am! Chairs are taken! Tip #4: If you are going to play golf, and you want to save $$, play after 2 pm. You will definitely get all 18 holes in, and it is half the cost. Also, PLAY golf if you are a golfer! What a great course! Tip#5: If you are not into shopping (because we are not) do not go to Old San Juan. It is just like going to the mall, only hotter. We were there for 15 minutes. It is also a 40 minute drive, each way. Tip #6: Definitely go to the rainforest and take a hike to the waterfall! It is 10 minutes from the resort and so much fun! Enjoy it! We did and we will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ams5252
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel. everything was well done and beach was beautiful. rented a car (a must). saw bio bay, rainforest, and ate ate local restaurants and Kioskos. Hotel food was not great and very over priced. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The 2 pools were beautiful. walked at 7-8 am everyday and reserved beach and pool chairs early (because pool and beach get very crowded). Bio bay was a great trip. rainforest was not great, but fun to swim in waterfall. Not a carriben calm beach, but pretty to sit at...not like typical Carribean beaches).The hotel had few activities for kids and teens and nothing at night (except pool swimming ). Very relaxing vacation. Highly recommend having a car to explore the area. Also, buy some water bottles and snacks at the local supermarket because hotel is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful weather but resort didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: blackhawk2010
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Rio Mar in Puerto Rico. The trip didn't begin on a great note. We arrived around 11:30 at night and our bags didn't arrive at our room until nearly an hour later. Our ocean front room gave us a great view of a huge palm tree which blocked out the view of the beach and pool area. I guess ocean front doesn't necessarily mean ocean view. The room also felt very damp and a small pool of water would form on the floor each night which I have never experienced in a hotel before. Someone came and adjusted the thermostat plus provided us a de-humidifier for the room which helped. The beach is long with beautiful sand but unfortunately alot of garbage like cigarette butts, plastic cups, cellophane, paper, etc litter the beach. I have seen much more pristine beaches in the Caribbean. The food on site was expensive (dinner for 4 adults and one child ran about $250) and nothing to write home for. However the weather was perfect and the trip to the rain forest (10 minute drive from hotel) was great. Also, we rented a car to go to Old San Juan and the rain forest to save money. It was fairly easy to get around by car. Overall, the resort was nothing to rave about. It wasn't a disaster but it didn't live up to our expectations. We won't return - there are too many other beautiful resorts in the Caribbean to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: drmartha
Reviews.Content: I have travelled the world, alone and with family and friends and have never been in a worse hotel. It was supposedly a beach hotel, but the beach was a public one and unswimmable at. Filthy water full of seaweed and debris, undertow, crashing waves, totally unsafe. We didn't have a car so either had to take a $59 pp catamaran snorkel cruise, which we did, or swim in pool. I was allowed in adult pool, my 13 year old grandson wasn't and had to stay in the kiddie pool. Food prices astronomical. By pool bar one hamburger was $16 and took an hour to produce. Supposed buffet restaurant, Marbella, was closed "for renovations" for 3 nights. Average dinner, sharing entree with grandson and having one glass of wine, was $65. No minibar unless you paid $45 , no cold water to drink in room. Oceanfront room had ocean and beach completely obscured by palm tree. TV gave no free shows in English, just $5 for each American show you wanted. Signedd up early for catamaran trip and prepaid, had voucher but when we got there there was no record of our being expected. Had to beg and plead to get on boat. Safe worked fitfully, same with phone in room. Without car, expensive taxis to town ($30 roundtrip) were only way to get to eat in typical Puerto Rican restaurant or buy groceries or beer ($5 for a small can in hotel). Rainforest trip OK, same for snorkeling trip but pricey. Walls thin, difficult to sleep with screaming kids on other side. Nightlife nonexistent unless you like casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: BeachSkiwith2Kids
Reviews.Content: Great Beach Big pool, great for kids (that can swim, tougher for the littler folks, and sub par kiddie pool) "Roomy" Rooms VERY service oriented upper management Very service oriented restaurant staff (we ate on premises for each of the 8 days we were there) Some of the rank & file hotel staff need some service lessons, but senior management straightened out the issues right away Casino is the size of my living room Difficult and expensive to get off property unless you rent a car - on site car rental can get you a Yaris for $60 for the day - nothing really great to see close by - 45 minutes to an hour trip to Old San Juan Felt a little nickel and dimed for stuff thats complimentary at other resorts: Have to pay $75 per day per kid for kids club Have to pay for use of Kayaks, boogie boards etc Overall an enjoyable and relaxing stay, but there is definitely room to improve.

Reviews.Title: “the good the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: john_34260
Reviews.Content: The room, the beach and the pool are all very nice. We had our own alcohol both at the pool and the beach. Nobody said a word about my cooler or what was in it. The $15 a day parking as well as getting your ticket validated is a joke (the bad). Having our beach umbrella pulled at 3:45 was ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Staff, Watch What You Bring In...”
Reviews.Author: AlexM001
Reviews.Content: We chose Rio Mar as our friends visited recently and they had such a fantastic experience. The staff went the extra mile to make our visit absolutely spectacular. The only challenge we had was after we read all the previous reviews we brought our own beer and alcohol to the pool and security informed us it was not allowed and escorted us back to our room to leave everthing there. Apparently it's only allowed in the privacy of your room and any items brought into the hotel must only be consumed there and not in public. They were very professional and we abided as our stuff could have been all taken and we spent some bucks getting it in there.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!!Look forward to going back!!”
Reviews.Author: jsprill
Reviews.Content: We own Wyndham timeshare so I don't know the cost of the room. The resort is beautiful! The room was nice, clean and large for a hotel room (We usually stay in 1- 4 bedroom suites, but Wyndham had not available here. Guess gotta book early). The cleaning staff did a great job. The front desk and concierge staff are extremely helpful and informative. Gave great recommendations on places to eat. We rented a car which reduced the price for many excursions & allowed us to come and go as we pleased. Transportation is provided (for a fee of course) to many major tourist areas. BUT the taxis are pricey! We met up with a couple in San Juan and a taxi charged us $30 round trip to take us to Old San Juan (10 min ride!) Anyway, back to the resort. This resort does charge (approx $15-$25 per day plus tip if you valet) for self parking and valet parking. The food & drinks on the resort are PRICEY so it is better to eat offsite (We'll pay Ruth Chris prices for dinner (while on vacation), but not for breakfast, lunch AND dinner!). I recommend doing a timeshare tour to get room credit to offset onsite dining & activities. The resort is close to many attractions(catch the ferry to another island for the day or be in San Juan in 20mins) and ur on semi private beach! There is plenty to do and in February, it was 80 degrees. Loved it! We slept out on the beach in the afternoon under a palm tree. Multiple swimming pools one w/pool slides for the kids (some adults had fun on them 2)and pool activities. Very relaxing! Look forward to visiting again1 Oh, they do have a great spa, a casino & golf course on site, but we didn't partake in the last 2. The gym is very SMALL! I guess people don't go there workout.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: dlabrie69
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from PR and had to dispel all of the bad reviews. This was a great hotel with wonderful ammenities and helpful staff. The grounds were gorgeous and the beach was fantastic! It's on the Atlantic side - so yes - there are a few waves! Nothing too crazy and no riptides to speak of. You can go out past the waves and still touch the bottom. The pools were great - the iguanas were around, but not a nuisance. The beds were very comfy! Slept like a baby! The restaurants were reasonable. I didn't find them any more expensive than at home. We went to the japanese restaurant and at a huge meal - with drinks - for $80. Parking was average for a hotel! San Francisco is $25 a day, so Puerto Rico really isn't so bad at $15 for self park or $20 for valet. I liked the location, as it was in the middle of everything - San Juan to the west by 30 minutes and the marina to the east by 30 minutes. The Yunque Forest is right behind the hotel and you can hear the Coqui frogs every night! We loved it! Just GO! You will not regret it! (one hint - become a Wyndham member before booking and the wifi and fridge are free!)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, breezy, easy”
Reviews.Author: nycmoodle
Reviews.Content: Rio mar Hotel: Easy open layout and access to every facility including regular shuttles to the golf club and restaurants. Elevators arrive in an instant. Concierge and tour desk never unmanned from morning till late at night. Although itâ€™s not readily apparent, the hotel is beginning to show some signs of wear. The first room I stayed in (I asked to switch) had a lovely â€˜mountain view,â€™ but it did have a slight smell. I thought perhaps in its previous life it had been a smoking room. The room I moved to was fresh. The beds and pillows were new and wonderfully comfortable. True, turn-down service was spotty, as in it didnâ€™t always occur, and daily room cleaning occurred sometime between breakfast and dinner, but hey. The good news is, itâ€™s very clean - everywhere. The staff is excellent: friendly & polite, helpful, patient. They aren't lax. Whether cleaning rooms, tending the lovely grounds, waiting tables, working in a back office, or helping with transportation, the people I met were industrious and couldnâ€™t have been nicer. Also they were well turned out in clean, attractive uniforms. What more can I say? No free Wi-fi: it almost seems archaic these days, not to mention outrageous to pay over $15 a day for it! Puleeze! 2 of the 5 lobby computers weren't working, though I walked by several times a day when no one was in the room. Food: Room service arrived on time to the minute. Maybe the hotel wasnâ€™t packed that day. Marbella, the glorified hotel coffeeshop/restaurant, serves up a good breakfast buffet.
