Lunch in the hotel is probably the least satisfying, while dinner was very good at the pricier restaurants if one ordered a deluxe dinner. The best food to be had is off-campus at the truly local spots. Ask the concierge. Cabs are $15-$17 each way if you havenâ€™t got a car. WHICH YOU SHOULD!!! Despite the injurious daily parking fee. The coffee is watery no matter where you go. In-room machines have unique pods, so thereâ€™s no way to strengthen a cup. We survived. The 2 Â½ mile beach: silky soft brown sand, raked clean daily, with perfectly clear unobstructed water for swimming, kayaking, jet skiing. The staff provide plenty of chairs, towels and umbrellas. The pools: Thereâ€™s a couple, and one for adults only, plus a water slide for the kids, and Jacuzzi. Rentable cabanas. The Tiki Bar and tables are for snacks and lunch, or thereâ€™s another outdoor restaurant for lunch only. Mandara spa: Absolutely 1st rate, lovely, peaceful setting. I only took a massage, and it was great. I heard reflexology was terrific, and all the other usual services looked alive and well.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Hrmefs
Reviews.Content: A one way cab ride to Old San Juan was $75. Too far away from everything. Food average and overpriced at the resort. Needs some updating overall. Relaxation room in spa was co-ed. Was an okay 4 night stay but Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised, and Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SABoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first of April at this Hotel, and although most of the reviews were bad we had a great stay. Trip advisor warned us of the obvious that we would not have expected, resort fee, parking fee, the bellhop fee and the price of drinks and the prices of the restaurant. Not knowing this we would have been upset. Our room was spotless every day. Our AC was broke but the entire hotel was so cold we just turned it off and were fine. The staff was surprisingly polite and the food was good if you ask me. The property was well kept and looked like it had been recently updated. Al in all one of the best stays I have had. The only problem was the parking. Like a typical person I keep my parking ticket in my car, not on me at all times. When you exit the parking garage you have to go to the Valet station to have them sign off on it before you can leave. It was a true pain and the walk was pretty far to do twice. That is the only negative I can say about the hotel. Some advice for this hotel: 1) rent a car 2) Buy an entertainment book for restaurant coupons 3) Buy your own alcohol and sodas at Walgreens for the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_addiction
Reviews.Content: I have to say with all the bad reviews I read I was concerned. Let me tell you by following everyones recomendations we had a fabolous time. We rented a car and did not eat at the resort as suggested, although we had a charge for parking the car, valet 20/day self 15/day, we did the wyndham update/sales pitch, not painful at all that covered our parking plus some. We hiked to the top of El Yunque peak, rainforest which was amazing and should be done in the morning as early as possible before the clouds come in, you get a panoramic view of the entire island, take your binoculars, wish I would have brought mine!!!!!!! Allow time to do the ferry trip to Culebra, that was wonderful. The Kiosks (food huts) were amazing on Laquilla beach. Make sure you ride the 187, amazing sites to be seen, and some great authentic PR food!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back tomorrow if I could”
Reviews.Author: HCN77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Rio Mar from March 11 through March 15 and overall it was quite enjoyable. The perfect weather helped make the stay even better, but the resort alone was lovely. It was easy to get to from the airport (about a 40 minute drive) and it was a great location for day trips to Fajardo, Las Croabas, Luquillo, and Seven Seas beach. Self parking was simple and it's well worth it to have a car and drive around to check out the Ceviche Hut in Luquillo and the Ocean View restaurant in Las Croabas. We had a rainforest view room which was amazing! Eduardo at the front desk was nice enough to put us on a higher floor (6th) and we loved the view. The room was clean, bright and modern. We also loved our housekeeping staff who were so friendly and welcoming. The pool was amazing, but a little cold at times. That's not a drawback when you're ready to be refreshed after a few hours on the beautiful beach. We never had a problem getting chairs on the beach or at the pool, though there are folks who get up early and put down towels (especially at the adult pool) so if you are particular about your seats, you'll want to do that. The only two things that went wrong was the valet attendants misplacing out keys the first night (so we self-parked from then on which was easy) and the cold wings that were delivered from room service. Hey, these things happen and in the bigger picture, weren't enough to bring all of the other positives down. The best things about the resort is that they were so cool about guests bring their own drinks to the pool/beach area. They don't have to do this and could force you to buy the $7-$11 drinks on site, but they don't. Amigo supermarket and walmart are nearby and you can pick up a disposable cooler and snacks/drinks to keep in your room. There's an ice machine on every floor. I was also so proud of the hotel and Puerto Rico in general for their "go green" initiatives. Every cup and plate used at the resort were biodegradable and they emphasized that use your towel/sheets more than once to help the environment. It was nice to see that Wyndham cared about keeping PR beautiful! I got a great deal using jetblue vacations and like the title of the review, I would go back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: DeadEyeACE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Puerto Rico. Stayed at the Rio Mar. Was a very nice resort. Nice adult pool (Kids pool also). Things were a little run down. Fairly quiet. Food was pretty good but expensive. Morning brunch was extremely expensive for what you get. The other restaurants were very good however. The staff was OK and generally friendly although some were not exactly anxious to jump up and help you. Especially at the valet stand. Very expensive to park also. If you are an average golfer, the courses are OK. If you are a low handicapper I would suggest the Gran Melia Trump course. Costs more but the greens are MUCH better. The GPS never worked for me at the Rio Mar course. Overall, for a family vacation I would say this would be a good spot. If you want a little more luxury, I would go to Gran Melia or El Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Scenery, but definitely Not Hopping”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl78
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is best for families or couples who call it a night at a very early hour. I loved the land and it was very well-kept. Pool and ocean beautiful, architecture of the building very nice. However, coming from Chicago where I have been in the cold for months was very disappointed to see that almost all of the dining on-site was indoors and almost everything closed very early. There was only 1 outdoor area-the Tiki Bar and that shut down by 6! We went out a lot in the town, but it certainly wasn't too happening of an area. We weren't looking to go crazy or clubbing, but some outdoor drinks with live music would have been phenomenal. Our favorite Puerto Rico Moments: 1. Bio Bay at night on a barely visible moon night, 2. A bike ride starting in Isla Verde and going east (awesome sites). Pretty cheap to rent a bike and it was on a bike path so it was very easy to get around. 3. Short hike through the rainfall. Big Tree was easy 4. Relaxing by the Pool

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, warm ocean, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorman
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here. The hotel was fine, speedy check-in, good bell service, helpful concierge desk, great view of the ocean. Rooms were clean with good linen and towels. The bathrooms were not luxurious but fine. The service from all the staff was good. You are right on the sandy beach and the ocean was really warm. It's not a top class luxury resort but it's pretty good and reasonably priced. If you're looking for a reasonably quiet beach vacation this is worth a try. Rent a car if you want to see anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, decent restaurants, if want to see outside of resort rent a car”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The beach was great with body surfing waves. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas to go around even had little tables, not many people on the beach that weren't from hotel. The iguana feeding everyday was cool. We ate at the sushi place, room service and the buffet. The sushi was good the other stuff at that restaurant was okay. The best item from room service is the cheeseburger meat was mixed with something, grilled onions & mushrooms not really burger girls but we each had two when we were there. A short drive u can get to local restaurants as well. Make sure to get a ocean front instead of an ocean view, ocean front has great balconies facing the ocean. Don't take a guided tour of the jungle u can do it your own and see more stuff. Bakeries here are awesome! The island isn't know for spicy food, but each restaurant has their own hot sauce. Also, buy fruit from the stands on the freeway before u get to the hotel to save money on breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Disputing all negative reviews as incorrect.”
Reviews.Author: lonetmover
Reviews.Content: It is my practice of writing reviews, but, I find it necessary to set the record straight about the truth regarding the quality of Rio Mar,contrary to the many negatives reviews I have read about that property. During my 87 years, I have traveled extensive to many parts of the world. I have stayed in a variety of Hotels from zero to 5 star properties. I could not find one negative review of this property , during my stay from Mar.24 thru Mar.29, 2011. People have complained regarding the prices charged in the Restaurants. The prices were in line with the qualiity of food, the ambiance of the restaurants , the proficiency and friendliness of the servers and the cleanliness of the Restaurants My room was impeccably clean and very quiet. The bedding was fresh and comfortable as advertised.. The ocean front room was delivered as promised.. 100% of the employees I encountered were friendly, courteous and very knowledgeable. I rented three cabanas and recieved a 25% discount on each of them. The cost was, again in line with the quality of the service I recieved. The cost of parking was no where close to the negative compaints about the high cost of parking. Certainly, the cost of Valet was in line with the service I recieved. The AC worked perfectly . Yes, the light bulbs worked perfectly. And, the water was always hot for showering. No.. There were no Mosquitoes in our room or any other little kritters The room always had a fresh aroma. Yes, moist, but, we were on a tropical island, not in a arid desert. The bottom line.. I got what I paid for, with no complaints. "There's no free lunch" Rio Mar was everything i expected, contrary to the negative reviews I read, before leaving for PR.

Reviews.Title: “Confused...Don't see how it deserves 4Stars”
Reviews.Author: Debster14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at The Rio Mar. we were there with another couple. While I would say we had a great vacation, it had nothing to do with the hotel. This is why I am confused. When rating a hotel, with 5 stars being the highest, the Rio Mar does not even come close. Even the good reviews revealed many problematic areas. Let's begin with check-in. We had early check-in, we arrived at 1:30 and told the room would be ready after 4. We also booked an oceanfront room. When we complained about waiting so long for the room to be ready,they found us another. Fine,no view,it was obscured by palm trees. It took 2 more tries before we had a room with a view. My first impression of the room was dirty,which is how I would describe the entire hotel. We ate breakfast in Marbella each morning. On the first morning, I saw dirty windows illuminated by the sun. For the next 4 mornings, the same windows still had the same fingerprints. We had drink one night at the bar outside Palio. Want to see dirt? Look up At the shelves behind the bar. The service was incredibly slow,which appeared to be because they were understaffed. The gym was minuscule and out dated. We stayed at the resort 7 years ago when it was a Westin, and the gym was exactly the same. Also,dirty and ill equipped. We met many wonderful members of the staff. They provided us with great suggestions for places to eat and excursions. That's the good news. The bad news was, the food was so overpriced and not good. The excursions through the hotel were a rip off and booked until the next week. The concierge told me the resort was 90% full,yet some of the restaurants were closed. When I asked what people did if they couldn't get reservations,he told me it was a problem-no kidding. The good news is,we left the hotel and had great meals at Hacienda, Pasta y Pueblo and the Kiosks. Our kayaking trip to the Bio Bay was awesome. Finally, the idea of charging guests for the Internet is ludicrous . The hotel would rather have you sit in the lobby "hot spot" than provide free service. So, while I would say our vacation may have been 5 Stars, it had nothing to do the Rio Mar S

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel/Pool/Beach and Spa”
Reviews.Author: jessicak76
Reviews.Content: Just adding my two cents. I was hesitant to go to Puerto Rico. I love Aruba but gave PR a shot. The island is very lush; not a desert like Aruba. The hotel was clean; up to date and very pretty. It is a 7 story hotel; with most restaurants on level one. Yes, they are expensive. Just know that going in. The two pools were always clean and never had a problem getting four chairs together at the activity pool. The adult pool could use more space; but we did opt for a cabana there and at the beach 3 out of the 4 days. It was a nice treat to be out of the direct sunlight all day long. Not an expensive for everyone; but we wanted to do it. The staff does ask about the timeshares; but just realize that is their job; and a simple no thanks ended each proposal. The casino is small; but the staff is very friendly. The staff all over was very friendly actually. It is a 45 min drive from the airport; again-know that going in and your fine. The spa is nice; also expensive, but it's optional. I would return to PR and this resort again. Oh and we had 5 days of perfect weather; no rain; 80 and breezy.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful slice of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: makenamaui6
Reviews.Content: This is a spectacular resort on beautiful grounds. Terrific location. Lots to do on the resort and in the area. Great kids club (my daughter loves feeding the iguanas!). Food is terrific at the resort, but it is a bit expensive (law of supply and demand??)...I would recommend renting a car at least part of the time (they have an Enterprise desk onsite) and driving to the store to get snacks and drinks (especially if you have kids) and to check out the other restaurants in the area (the kiosks in Luquillo are awesome! Richies, located on the drive above the hotel, has a spectacular view but marginal food). Beds are so comfortable. Love the balconies. Puerto rican coffee in the room is delish! Internet is $15 a day, but if you're a Wyndham frequent stay guest it's FREE!!!! Great golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel except for the iguanas”
Reviews.Author: chlaclair
Reviews.Content: Everything about this resort is lovely. The friendly staff, the beach, the pools, the food, the rooms are all pleasant and top drawer. The pesky iguanas ruined the experience for me however. They are agressive, jumping on to the lounge chairs to eat the fruit on the side of my drink. They are in the trees and poop onto the pool deck. They even swim. When the cabana boy encouraged one to move along, the ugly thing jumped in to the pool, swam across and got out the other side. People feed them so they are no afraid. I spent my last 3 days on iguana watch trying to avoid them. They don't like the beach so avoiding the pool and moving to the sand is a get away from them.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Shows Lack of Compassion for Injured Guest”
Reviews.Author: TomH1954
Reviews.Content: My wife cut her hand on an excursion with Dragon Fly Tours. The resort had no medical staff on call and made very little effort to assist us in getting to an emergency room to stitch her cut up. Absolutely no follow up from staff. The taxi driver the resort connected us with didn't know the way to an emergency room and took us to a clinic without proper facilities first and on the second attempt took us to the emergency room in Rio Grande. Then he didn't come back to pick us up. We had another taxi company return us to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: cat46619
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico was not our first choice of islands to visit. After talking to our travel guide we decided to try it. We our so happy we did. The hotel was great. We did rent a car. This was a good idea. We explored the island at our own pace. We even went to the race track, it was fun. We had a great meal at Richie's cafe. When you leave the resort turn right and go up the mountain. The view at the resturant was unbelieveable. The waiter named Fish hook made the evening one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “My first review--because I wanted to put your mind at ease, if you've read poor reviews.”
Reviews.Author: caroleena5
Reviews.Content: I was nervous reading bad reviews here...we had a wonderful stay at this resort. The beds were so comfortable, the grounds are gorgeous, the hotel staff is friendly and attentive. The one or two times we had to call the front desk (asking for extra towels, or asking them to fix the phone that wasn't working), they had a person at our door in minutes. The rooms are clean and spacious, with wonderful balcony views. The concierge staff gave us great recommendations and directions. The location is perfect for a lot of the local attractions. Of note, since it's near the rain forest, don't be surprised when it rains.....the rain usually passes in a few minutes. Listen to the timeshare presentation, and you will be rewarded with a resort credit, an excursion, or a free massage (my choice), which I highly recommend. Get yourself a cooler, and hit the grocery store for snacks, soft drinks, and alcoholic drinks. You'll save a small fortune mixing your own margaritas at the pool (completely allowed), as we did. The hotel will even give you cups of ice! Don't book excursions through the concierge. You can save a small fortune using different companies than Dragonfly. Great horseback ride....find the sign posted on the street leading to the resort. $45 and you'll ride on the beach with a personal guide named Jose. Don't miss the luminescent lagoon. Pure Adventure took us kayaking on the lagoon for $40. Don't trust your GPS to find specific restaurants or stores. We made the mistake of traveling into the hills for a grocery store b/c ours didn't list one nearby...only to find there were several within a mile or two of the resort. We'd heard there was a Walmart, but the GPS didn't find one, even as we passed it. Beware that internet costs $15 day. However, just about every restaurant off the resort offers it for free, so we brought our laptop to dinner. The hotel has a few computers for guests to use, too....and they are online. We loved this resort. I'd go back in a heartbeat. We paid $604 for 4 nights through a promotion, and that included all taxes and fees. We booked through vacations to go, which we found online.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: WaiPRUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel or resort has all the pros to be excellent all around. The only negative thing that I found was that it is too far away from the closest major road. Overall the service was excellent, specially the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was the worst part of a rather lovely trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lovey13
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar valiantly claims to be 5 star- but their service, pricing, and management are no more than 3 star. The staff were always on their cell phones, and rarely aware that there were customers in need of help. Most staffers assumed we did not understand Spanish, so I was appalled as my boyfriend translated their conversations. Knowing the employees themselves were unhappy working for the resort did not make our experience any more pleasant. The bar ran out of beer during our stay, the casino was robbed (mere hours after we left), and all activities were booked days out. We couldnt get towels for the pool/beah area 3 of the 5 days were at the resort. The restaurants were overpriced. The food quality was quite poor, with service begrudgingly given only when we could track someone down. When we arrived, most of the restaurants were closed- the management said it was bc there werent enough people staying at the resort, though we were informed at the front desk they couldnt upgrade us bc the resort was sold out. They kept the most expensive restaurants open- again, the quality was subpar. Finally, please be aware that on our final day, my boyfriend killed a roach in our bathroom. That sealed the deal for me- I will never stay in a Wyndham Resort if I can help it. If the resrot took half the time and money they use to maintain the grounds and put it towards their management and customer service, I think they would be in a much better place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach. Rude Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonzy18
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Rio Mar for a short trip (5 days). The room was fine, the bed had to be the most comfortable I ever slept in. The beach was beautiful and the grounds were nice. Let me tell you the staff there was just so apathetic to everything. No one smiled ever!!! They just acted like they hated their jobs and didn't want to be there. If you asked them a question they got annoyed cause they actually had to do work. This one guy at the front desk was a complete jerk and I have no idea why the hotel would hire someone like that to man the front desk. We just asked him about the car service on the way to the airport and he was so rude. The food there was eh. The Italian place and the Grille room were the best and had the best service. The Asian place was terrible and the service stunk. The rainforest was okay and the kayaking for the bioluminescence bay was pretty awesome. I'm from NY so the prices didn't surprise me for the food or drinks but it is expensive. Overall the weather was great and the beach was nice and we got nice tans.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - highly recommend renting a car”
Reviews.Author: 2BoysMomKS
Reviews.Content: We are really glad we read other Trip Advisor reviews of Rio Mar before our trip and rented a car. We rented through Hertz at San Juan airport for $225/wk (with AAA). And although we had to pay for parking at Rio Mar it paid to have the flexibility of the car to go out for meals, do sightseeing and take trips out for supplies. There are some fabulous fun places to explore and eat around Rio Mar. We enjoyed dining close by at Don Pepes, Antonijitos, and Palmar Bakery (amazing chicken sandwich). El Verde Grill (W on 3 & 186) a roadside "hole in the wall" was recommendeded by friend who travels to PR often and it was wonderful $24 fed the 4 of us including drinks! La Parilla at Luquillo kiosks had yummy food when you finally receive it - we waited 1 1/2 hours for our food and found the service to be really lacking. El Yunque is a must have and another reason to have your own car. The tours through the hotel are over $100 per person and it is less than 10 minutes by car. Plus I can't imagine tour buses being able to get you to some of the locations we could go in the car. Be warned though the parking situation at the top will test your driving skills and nerves! If you want to zipline with your kids try Rainforest Zipline Corp. They are along the road into El Yunque and they are wonderful! Our 6 year old backed out after he got all suited up and they were nothing but accomodating to allow the rest of us to continue and still keep the 6 year old entertained. They even refunded our money for the 6 year old. Wonderful group of people! We also traveled to Old San Juan one day. The two "forts" are amazing and our teenager loved the Carmelo Anthony street ball court right outside of San Cristobal along the ocean. Old San Juan shops were too touristy for us and too crowded. Back to Rio Mar though - our kids really enjoyed it - the basketball court by the beach was a hit with the teenager, the beach was great and the beach service (chairs and umbrellas) was always available, the pool although beautiful was surprisingly cold and that meant a lot of people used the hot tub at the activity pool for swimming. We think it contributed to the fact that we all came home with strep! Feeding the iguanas was bit hit with our 6 year old. Rio Mar is a nice family resort however I wish there were more activities past 5 pm for families. Even the movie night and bonfire started at 5:30 pm most families are trying to get dinner and get cleaned up from a day at the pool by then. Also the towel cabana ran out of towels by 5:30 one day and you can't get towels after 6 pm anyway. If they are going to have a "24 hour" pool they need to have a way to get towels. The biggest "con" at Rio Mar is the price of food and drinks! $10.50 for a pina colada is a bit out of line. I can understand paying a premium price at a resort but $80 for lunch, drinks and 1 ice cream bar for myself and 2 kids one day was insane. We went to Amigos grocery store spent $60 and had bottled water, sports drinks, fruit, snacks and sandwich fixing for several days. Get the fridge from the hotel or a cheap cooler and you will save a lot of $$ - even if you just buy your own water and drinks. Bought a case of water for less than the cost of 1 bottle at the resort. Last but not least, stay on top of housekeeping. Our service went down hill each day we were there. 4 in our room and they begin taking all our towels but only leaving 2! Oh and hopefully you will get Tony R as your bellman - he is wonderful! Not the best place we have ever stayed - service a bit inconsistent - but the location is worth a possible re-visit. Our kids loved PR and want to return - as do we.

Reviews.Title: “Only a deal if you can eat & drink offsite!”
Reviews.Author: louie734
Reviews.Content: 7 days at this grand resort. Overall : 3/5. Value thru Cheap Caribbean was excellent, 5/5. If a great deal can be had, you'll be enjoying a gorgeous property and any headache can be chalked up - "Well, at least the price was great!" Because we got such a great package price, I was willing to spend extra on renting a car. Value once on the property: poor to fair. Read on. Service at this property - 1/5. After our first interaction, though it sounds terrible, we did all we could to avoid having to interact with the friendly, but generally overworked, understaffed, and therefore sorely under-helpful staff out of a desire to protect our easygoing vacation-minded attitudes. Waited in line to check in about 20 minutes. 3 guests ahead of me with various complaints about their phones not working, their room keys being deactivated, and witnessed an argument between 2 frustrated parties touched-off by the length of the lines. Only 1 employee at the front desk, who had to continually disappear through the behind-the-desk area multiple times to meet each guests' request. Other employees appeared to be behind these closed doors, but if they came to the desk it was with eyes lowered, on-a-mission-to-staple-this-paper, don't-bother-me, can't-help-you. When we were finally checked in we had to ask specifically about the fitness center, pool towels, self-vs-valet parking, and the instructions we got were basic, but incomplete. For example, on our 2nd-to-last day, the self-parking garage attendant told us we had to have our ticket validated at the front desk. Now, no other garage attendant ever mentioned this, but we would've complied with this stipulation all along had we been properly instructed at check-in - or, based on our front desk experience, we probably would've coughed up another $5/night for valet. (Since it was almost time to check out, we ignored these instructions for the last 2 days and the attendants let us in and out with only a mild scolding each time until we left.) Bellhop service was the brightest of the trip, with the gentleman sharing tips for restaurants and bars off-property, even writing us a list of places to go on the room's notepad. Pool towels were always available, but only after standing in a line to be asked for your room number, # of towels requested, and given a wristband for a purpose I could never surmise. When there were 2 employees behind the desk service was even slower, as 1 person did all the talking and wristbanding, while the other stood idley with the pile of towels, "handing" you them from the pile stacked up directly in front of your face. The concierge gave us inadequate directions (a printout) to a local restaurant one night after standing in line for 15 minutes. We ended up turning around and going to a place we'd already been. We avoided bar service there as the drink prices were astronomical. Afraid to brave the front desk line again upon checkout, I was pleased to find our (correct) list of charges and directions for telephone, automated checkout upon waking up on our last day there. We left our room keys in the room and breathed a sigh of relief. Beach and Pools - 4.5/5. The grounds, and pool areas were manicured and elegant. Lovely water feature at the adult pool, comfortable deck chairs, and many more available then 'saved' chairs. Only the adult pool area had a shortage of available chairs at any given time, and if they would do away with the ridiculous cabanas (or at least disassemble them, with their "reserved" signs, after no one reserves them), there would've been more space. Docked because there was no attempt at heating the pool, which felt icy. Only a few guests braved the waters daily. The hot tubs were almost always in use, and were comfortable. The beach area, red-flagged each day, was spacious, mostly clean, and plenty of chairs. Umbrellas were brought out as guests asked for them, and tipped - perhaps paid - we didn't ask. Instead we pulled our chairs under the palms lining the edge of the beach. Lots of people playing in the waves and water despite the red flags. The beach and ocean were sandy, not rocky. Dining Options - 2/5, because there were options, but the prices prohibitive. Ate 1 meal there after a long day spent driving around the island and just couldnâ€™t drag ourselves to the car for a dinner out. $80 for 1 app, 1 salad, 1 pasta entrÃ©e, 2 glasses wine, tip. Service slow but acceptable. Quality fine but the markups left a bad taste in your mouth. Breakfast kiosk at the hotel was especially laughable as we found a local bakery just down the hill (Palmers) and ate for less than $5 each day. Passing the kiosk with its posted prices always gave us a laugh as a pastry was $3.50 and we'd just eaten 2, a sandwich, and coffees for almost that mush. Beer (local Medalla, $2 at bars) priced at $6, cocktails $10, soda $3. Water in room $7. Burger $16. This is just silliness. Room Comfort and Cleanliness - 4/5 We paid for a mountainview room and were upgraded to a partial-oceanview. 4th floor, above the bar's patio so some smoke and talking in the evening but we were happy with the proximity of the waves. All rooms here have a balcony, and we spent lots of time on ours. No king rooms available, so we had 2 queens, which we were fine with. The beds, sheets, and pillows were comfortable. Air conditioning was adequate, we only ran it during the day, and at night we cracked the patio door. Unfortunately our sheer curtain was missing, and we weren't dealing with the front desk, so we just went with it. Bathroom and shower were spacious. Toilet ran, we jiggled the handle (button, rather) till it stopped. Water pressure fine unless the next-door neighbors were showering too, then it was not great. No fridge in room; instead a glaring empty space and a notation in the resort guide that they're available for $10 per day. We didn't pay for wi-fi or internet on principle; our iphones had to make do. English and Spanish channels on the TV, some with very poor reception. We eventually gave up on having housekeeping visit our room after 2 days passed without any service. Oh well, we thought, at least the room was cheap, and anyway we have enough towels. They did come on the 3rd day, and the 5th and 6th days. They did throw away our toothbrush case caps, and take our (cheap, Walmart) beach towels which we purchased to take to public beaches. They bore no resemblance to the resorts' pool towels but it was on our last full day there so oh well. I should mention that on day 2 my husband woke early and went to use the fitness center (he said adequate, with some broken treadmills etc). The carpeted hallway outside our room and all the way to the elevators was squishing with water underneath his feet. From what we can tell, the ice machine a few doors down had leaked overnight and the carpet was wet for days. On day 3 the smell in the hallway was unpleasant, by day 4 we took to running from the elevator to our room, holding our breath. Management placed a blower in the hall for 4 days, moving it periodically, but even when the carpet finally dried, the smell remained. Miraculously, our (tiled) room didn't take on the odor of the hallway, and though this was unpleasant, we ignored it as best we could. All in all, we enjoyed a lovely vacation despite some challenges. I intend to email Wyndam's corporate offices with some of our concerns as I believe this property's management does a disservice to their guests. The beautiful grounds and location makes for a confusing, inconsistent image when paired with such shabby service and nickel-and-dime atmosphere. Please consider some tips if you'll be staying at this property: Rent a car. Self parking is about $15 per day. Buy a styrofoam cooler for your room at a drugstore. Buy your drinks and whatever you'd like to have in the fridge. The wastebaskets, bag removed, make a terrific ice container to fill up the coolers. The bars sell Medalla Light cans, so we just brought our cold cans to the beach/pool. They frown on coolers at the pool and in the crowded beach area - so seclude yourself a little and enjoy your cold beer. Visit Palmer's Bakery for pastries, sandwiches, and coffee. Breakfasted here daily for $5 or less. Don Pepe's restaurant is the best for PR food (try the skirt steak!). Antojitos food wasn't great, but atmosphere wonderful at night and drinks delish (sangria and mojitos esp). Visit the kiosks at Luquillo Beach, esp El Jefe and La Parilla. Go on a sail/snorkel day with Erin go Bragh. Don't forget to drive to Old San Juan and wander through its magical streets on foot. Visit El Morro for some unique history and photos.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Birgitta_11
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the 'Ocean Villas' (condo units, NOT hotel!!) which are on the Wyndham resort property next to the hotel but are independently managed by a real estate office on site. (They give you an ID card to use at all the hotel facilities & restaurantes while there) Rented a 1BR condo on the 4th floor after 2 disappointing days at a condo complex privately owned farther south in Yabucoa. (There were some serious issues with the accomodations but will not mention the place since they refunded us the remaining 4 nights...) While south in Yabucoa the first 2 days of our vacation we checked out the southern coastline which has some truly breathtaking views, but would overall not really recommend that part of the island if you are looking for nice and CLEAN beaches and things to do... (A lot of the areas/public beaches that are not under any resort type management are usually covered with trash and seaweed with homeless dogs running around and the beautiful looking ones can't be reached due to the mountain terrain...) We explored the coastline almost to Ponce in the south -dessert and brown mountains- and all the way up north to Rio Grande- lush & green. The Rio Mar resort in Rio Grande was by far the one we liked immediately! Had gotten the info from a real estate lady at the "Marbella Resort" in the east which we checked out, but did not like as much. The Rio Mar has a beautiful lush tropical landscape with a huge golf course, great upscale hotel with small casino and several restaurantes to eat at and a great clean beach with palm trees and chairs!! We paid $350 plus tax per night which is not cheap, but we were shown several units and had our pick which one we liked the best - was not very booked! All of them were wonderfully laid out with a cute kitchen with lots of dinner & glassware, W/D and nice furniture, balcony facing the beach 30 feet away and a really comfortable kind size bed- and security so one doesn't have to worry about the car getting stolen over night. (From what I understand most of the units are remodeled, but not all of them!) We hung out at Luquillo Beach 10 Min. down the road for the most part of the 4 days, which is truly one of the most beautiful beaches on the island! It is a State Park, meaning it has facilities, a kiosk to eat & buy food, is clean and park rangers patrol or are in range if need be. El Yunque Rain forest is also only 10 min. away and San Juan can be reached within 30-45 min. given the dense traffic everywhere. 'Seven beaches' a short trip to the east is also a nice visit since not too far, but is not as pretty as Luqillo Beach State Park. And "the kiosks" are just down the road. We will most definitely go back and book either through the real estate office or just show up and see what's available on Villas now that we know how things work. I guess another option would be to rent directly through VRBO from the owners, but the only issue is that if there's an emergency with the condo the owner is the contact, not the on-site real estate office- something to keep in mind! The resort is close to a lot of things, including supermarkets and plenty of other little local restaurants. Would recommend a car, unless you plan on staying at the resort the whole time, which is perfectly fine also. Great place to spend your vacation and long pretty beaches!! Wireless in condos, not for people who want to dive into 'night life' since more of a quiet resort for people who play golf or want to gamble at casino. San Juan not too far though. Also no pets at Ocean Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised at high quality of service and beauty of resort”
Reviews.Author: amcConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Gran Melia next to this resort on previous occasion and receiving the worse service ever I was prepared for some aggravation. I brought my father to Puerto Rico as he had not been back to the Island since 1965. From the valet, bell hop who took oour luggage, the front desk employees and every else I encountered they displayed the utmost courtesy and professionalism. Minor issues were resolved immediately with a phone call, towels for the beach were provided. One day they ran out of towels and the attendant excused himself to personally see to rectifying the problem within minutes. Grounds were immaculate and the beach clean with charis, umbrellas and little tables provided for guests. The casino is small, but has enough to keep you occupied. One recommendation would be to have a little more night life, as not much to do after dark, although sitting on the verandas reading or having a drink is very relaxing. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel for the service and the beauty of the resort. You have your choice of the rain forest on one side and the ocean on the other, how can you beat that combination!!Only complaint is the high prices of cocktails and food. However lots of places ie: Walgreens's, Ralph's and Amigo's supermarket to buy water, snacks and alcohol which you can bring to the beach. Will save you tons of money as a mixed drink on average was $15.00. Isomar and Palmar bakeries were great for breakfast. King Seafood in Luquillo delicious

Reviews.Title: “Run away don't walk RUN!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin! As we walked to our room the dirty carpets, hallways that looked more like a public housing project than a resort hotel was the opener. Then the door to our room opened after two sets keys and it smelled like mold, this room should have been renovated years ago. The view from our balcony of the convention center roof was another nail in the coffin. The service was non existent or ridiculously slow. You needed to order dinner at lunch time to hopefully get it before midnight. This hotel has no redeeming qualities, the beach is rough, windy, buggy and uninviting sand. We moved our departure up a day and can't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “We made the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: randorigirl
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I enjoyed a very lovely week at the Rio Mar. I do a lot of business travel so I am an "observant" guest. We chose the Rio Mar because we wanted to hang out and relax at a large place for several days, and not try to see the whole island. The property: The hotel building is Spanish style and gorgeous. Large spacious lobby with a beautiful view of the beach. The grounds are extensive and beautifully maintained. The two main pools are designated as one for adults only and one for families/activities. We loved the adult pool because it was quiet and peaceful all day without blaring music and kids running everywhere. Our room was large with 2 queen beds, tile floor, very clean. The bathroom was also very large with nice products from bath & bodyworks. We reserved an "ocean view" room, but if you really need to see the beach from your room, pay for an "ocean front" room. Our view was obscured by huge palm trees--not a big problem. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food: There are several restaurants on the property offering a nice variety of choices. Marbella (pronounced Maybella) is a big buffet and is open for three meals throughout the day. Dinner is a fixed $25. per person. We didn't have breakfast there, but it was also $25. per person--steep for a plate of eggs and fruit. Shima, the Japanese place was very nice--they did it right. The italian place call Palios is their highest-end dining experience. Entrees are $25-78. For the price, there was too much rushing around on the part of the wait staff and it was very noisy for a small place. The room is pretty, but the experience didn't match with the price tag. A basic margarita everywhere was $10.50. The 2 outdoor dining places, only open during the day, were fun--salads, burgers, and sandwiches --these two places were reasonable for lunch $9 and up. Overall, just be prepared to drop some money on food and drink. In my experience, there are no food deals in Caribbean resorts. Lots of people brought their own food and snacks to enjoy by the pool. The tap water is a-okay to drink. Bring your own water bottle to refill--you'll quickly get tired of buying water at $7. per bottle. Getting around: The hotel is about 40 minutes by shuttle bus east of the airport. We were very happy NOT to be staying in the concrete jungle of the larger hotel chains in San Juan. So once you get to the resort, it will cost you to get out and around. The Dragonfly transportation service will own you if you don't rent a car. We didn't. If I was traveling with the family I would strongly recommend renting a car. The hotel will charge you $15. per day for parking. The daytime excursions, run by Dragonfly, will cost $60-150 per person just to get to the places. The desk will call you cab, but many of the cabs don't have permits to get to places like the rain forest, so you will be dependent on Dragonfly. It's just how things go there. The Dragonfly shuttle buses are very modern and clean. Night life: The casino is fun and there was music over the weekend which we missed. Dinner is the main evening activity, and a stroll outdoors--nothing else goes on--no dancing or activities. Staying connected: The hotel offers 5 slow but free computers to check email--but 3 were down during our visit. Some of us had cell service, some didn't. Free wi-fi in the lobby, but if you want it in your room, it cost $40. per day. I heard this from a grumpy guest. Isn't the whole idea to unplug oneself?? We'd go back there again--they did it right.

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort, Overpriced Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: dcquetpy
Reviews.Content: In general, the property is nice and the staff is attentive. Our room was clean and the beach/pool areas are well maintained. The property needs to be "refreshed" and "updated". It's not a four or five star property, so we found the costs of daily parking at the hotel, a round of golf, spa services, and restaurants to be VERY overpriced. The "vacation stimulus package" (stay 4 nights, stay 2 nights free + $100 food and beverage credit) made the stay a bit more economical. Suggestions/Tips: (1) Rent a car for the length of your stay and enjoy great local dining and sightseeing around the island; (2) Walgreen's stores are everywhere, so be sure and grab a disposable cooler (no refrigerators in the room), beverages, snacks, and sunscreen; When you leave, pass the cooler on to another family :) (3) Drive across the street and visit the Yunque rainforest via a ranger-led tour (it's free!); (4) Carefully review your final bill when checking out - many guests had isues with "random" charges that they had not incurred, including us.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort...if you are prepared.”
Reviews.Author: sarapal2024
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of the reviews here and was prepared. I was amazed at the number of people who never read about the hotel they plan to stay at. We booked our tour thru Cheapcarribean.com. Anyway, we rented a car for around $110 from the airport. It was not very difficult to drive down to the resort with the help of a GPS. GPS is a must in PR. Went to the resort and got the mountain-view room on 4th floor. Trees were blocking half the view. Room was decent with comfortable beds. Not having a fridge and microwave is a minus. We went to Walgreens and bought a cooler and being vegetarians we purchased some food and bought packaged meals from home. Didn't buy a thing at the resort for food. Only charges we had to pay were the parking fees, which is a rip off at $16 including taxes. We did the Bio Bay thru Pure Adventure. It was good not great as there was moonlight and the glow was not as bright as they show in the pictures. Still it was a new experience for us. We did snorkeling the next day thru East Island Excursions and they were good. They charged $49 for our 3-year-old to just come with us on the boat. That was kinda expensive for the kid. Went horseback riding thru Hacienda Carabali. Definitely recommend that. Isamar Bakery was great. They make good vege omelets and vege sandwiches. The beach area at the resort is awesome and lots of fun for families with young kids. The only thing I dislike are the iguanas. The iguanas freak me out! I would visit this resort again if we got a good deal. They need to stop charging for parking.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the crummy service, resident pool pedophile or the spa (aka: local nail chop shop)”
Reviews.Author: JP-1999
Reviews.Content: This large tourist class resort could be great but wasn't. Â In fact it was terrible. Service quality varied widely from extremely helpful to surly and indifferent. Our room was very dated, noisy, dingy and inÂ need of renovation. Â Despite having some great advantages (price was moderate and it is well located to the rain forest, beach, golf, etc.), we were wholly unsatisfied. Three particular incidents worth noting: 1) The creep by the pool who kept aggressively offering "swim lessons" to families with young girls. A young man in his early 20s named "Cesar" was lurking around the pool and jacuzzi area stalking families with very young girls (including us). Despite declining Cesar's offers multiple times, he continued to follow us around the pool area for over an hour. Â Cesar only targeted families with young girls (2-4 years old) and showed no interest in families with similarly aged boys. Â We reported the situation to the pool staff who dismissed our concerns by saying that Cesar had been "coming here for years" and that he was "a sweetheart". Â The harassment was so bad that we did not return to the pool area again during the rest of our stay. We reported the incident again at checkout and were advised that the situation would be reported to the manager. Despite my best efforts to inform both hotel management and Wyndham corporate, I have not received any response.Â  2) Mandara spa. Overpriced and terrible service. Staff were unbelievably rude and obnoxious. For $87 my wife got the privilege of a pedicure that she waited 45 mins past her appointment time for next to a friend of a staff member who snorted noisily and rubbed her nose making disgusting sounds. Once her service did start, the snorting woman brought in a laptop and the entire salon staff proceeded watch aÂ slideshow of photos, presumably from a recent wedding at the hotel and chit chat. The technician never once introduced herself and barely even paid attention to the pedicure she was performing. 3) The reception staff were downright hostile. When we checked out we inquired about showers and were told we could use the spa's facilities only to be told by the spa that the showers were only for spa patrons (I guess suffering through the spa the previous day didn't count). Â Furthermore, our "escape to luxury" package, which was supposed to include steeply discounted "spa services" didn't cover pedicures, despite the fact that these were done by the spa (go figure). Â Save your money and avoid this trap.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: askjck
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing! The views are spectacular! Food and drinks are expensive, but we went to the grocery store and stocked our own beer and snacks. We carried it down to the pool and beach and it was not a problem. We also found local places to eat that saved a ton. Antojito's at the bottom of the hill was great. $30 for 4 to eat breakfast. Don Pepe's was close and reasonable. $80 for 4 for dinner - that includes drinks. The front desk staff can give recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Been here, done it, paid too much for the tshirt, won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: JetHeller
Reviews.Content: This is as concise as I can be about our experience here in Puerto Rico. Puerto Rico is a very interesting place. It has its goods and its bads and I'll tell you about both. Keep in mind that I speak fluent spanish and english and am very polite to people. The goods: The hotel grounds are beautiful. The pools are nice, they give you good quality fresh towels, and the food at the hotel is good. There are beaches that you can drive to which are not very close but are ok; Seven Seas Beach which is only a 25 minute drive, and Cabo Rojo which is a 2 hour drive. The El Yunque National Forest is across the street and is awesome to visit. Vieques island has some of the best beaches here, but since the ferrys don't allow rental cars to go, we stayed on the main island. The hotel management are friendly and curteous but not very helpful. A visit to Old San Juan is a must - the forts are a sight to see! And you'll be glad to know that there are Subway, McDonalds, and most other American fast food chains nearby. (you'll see why below). The bad: Oh, where to begin? If you booked with a discount travel website, like we did, you will most likely get shafted with a sub par room. Our room was said to be partial ocean view, but it really didn't offer a view of the ocean. If I stick my neck way out I can see a sliver of ocean. There is nothing really to do at night in the resort, except for gambling at the casino, or drinking, which will cost you about the same. The beach sucks. It's very windy, and there are biting bugs from 5pm on when the wind dies down. The surf is really strong and it's not pleasureable to swim unless you like to jump big waves which I love, but my kid was scared to death. Not a beach for kids. Our room was on the bottom floor and it was very humid and the air conditioning is stuck at 66f which makes the room into a deep freezer. Maybe that's why there's no fridge included. They charge you $15 per day for internet. $15 per day for self-parking. $15 per day as a resort fee even though this resort offers no activities or amenities that warrant this $15 fee. I thinks it's their way to offset the cost of towels that are constantly being stolen off the beach by local puerto rican kids and guests on a daily basis. Don't bother asking the staff to rationalize. Their excuses don't really make sense. Puerto Rico is one of the most expensive vacation spots I've ever been to, and I can't see why since the island is not that nice. They nickle and dime you for everything. The hotel is like a giant vaccum cleaner that sucks money out of your wallet. Read below to see how we got around this. The local puerto rican food is tasty, but extremely greasy, oily, starchy and heavy, which is hard on your system in hot weather. I couldn't handle it past the first day, and keep in mind that I am a professional chef and have enjoyed local food in many countries. The cost of food at the hotel is insane. As I'm writing this review, the idiot in the room above us decided to vomit his aftenoon drinks and lunch over his railing and all over our balcony, including my shorts which were drying on a chair. The hotel sent someone to clean it, and after we came back, the vomit was only half cleaned. The hotel management is unwilling to give us another room as they insists that the hotel is fully booked, which is a lie. There are 600 rooms and the parking lot is a third full. They are now sending someone to clean the rest of the vomit which I am going to have to supervise. Update: Cleaning person did not show up. I had to go up to the front desk and politely demanded in Spanish that someone come clean the rest of the vomit. Cleaning lady came to the room and got up in my wife's face. Wife called me on cell phone. I took the manager down to the room. The manager came and did it himself with the help of a groundskeeper. It seems the cleaning lady refused to do it. Joel the manager is probably the only helpful person in this hotel. He should probably get promoted to hotel manager so that things can run properly. I really commend him for helping us. In continuing this review, if you are still considering throwing your money away in this hotel, read my tips for saving money and salvaging your trip. Tips: Before you travel, buy a Puerto Rico edition of the Entertainment Book with coupons. As this has coupons that will give you 50% off the hotel's restaurants as well as many restaurants and activities all over Puerto Rico. But when you use the coupons in the hotel restaurants, order water to drink, as they will try to charge you a high amount for drinks in order to make up for the coupons. It also has a free upgrade coupon for enterprise car rental which you can use after booking your car rental online at a cheap price. Rent a car. There is nothing really to do at the resort, especially at night, and the beach sucks. So a car will be your only way to go to other places around the island without being herded into an expensive tour. It will also allow you to leave the resort to buy water, food, alcohol and groceries near by so that you don't have to take out a mortgage just to eat and drink. Unless you are a wealthy high roller, in which case you'd probably be in a nicer place. Expect that most puerto ricans that deal in commerce with visitors will try to squeeze you for every dime you're worth. So do things on your own rather than depend on vampires that feed off of tourists. This includes local restaurants, business owners, and tour guides. A little research on the internet and a rental car will allow you to enjoy most activities on your own. Don't pay the ridiculous fees for internet. Bring your smart phone and use that to check your emails, etc. This is a US territory and your cell phone will work here at no extra charge. Also, there is free WiFi at the hotel lobby which is not often advertised. To save money on the room you should book through a discount travel website which they probably won't let me mention here, all I can say is that you should name your own price. Overall, the best tip that I can give you is to avoid this island. There are much better islands in the caribbean. I could have stayed at a much better resort with superior beaches for a fraction of the cost in Florida. Or I could have gone all inclusive to a better island for less money, like turcs and caicos, aruba, dominican republic, virgin islands, st kitts, bermuda, margarita, the bahamas and the list goes on. This island is shabby and is a rip off. What enticed us to visit PR was the cheap airfare. Been here, done it, paid too much for the t shirt and won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice honeymoon, nice people, nice place.”
Reviews.Author: MrsLJackson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and really enjoyed it. We were given a room upgrade to a 7th floor ocean view room that was clean and lovely, the housekeeping and front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. The beach is gorgeous as well as the pool and tiki bar area, yes the drinks are expensive and the fees can add up, but taking a few extra steps really helps, like getting a cheap disposable cooler at wal-mart and buying your own drinks and snacks. Renting a car at the airport is the way to go, yes parking cost money but the freedom to explore the island without paying for every little trip off the resort is priceless.The only fees we encountered other than parking was the hold they put on our card which turned out to be great cause we were able to eat, drink, and shop around the resort with ease. No extra charges or fees showed up on our final invoice. We also went off the resort for most of our meals, the Luquillo Kioskos make for some yummy and cheap local eats as do most of the little stands on the roadsides. We played in the casino, ate at Marbella one night(yum) and enjoyed live music and dancing in the lobby bar, all in all we had a lovely time and are very excited to get back in May 2011. I have recomended The Rio Mar to several people and will be happy to stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice amenities, but expensive to eat and park!”
Reviews.Author: CheerJAM
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms were clean, maid service was prompt, views are gorgeous. They have two great pools, one which is strictly for adults and the other which is geared more towards families. It sits right on the beach. My only complaints were the food and parking charges. We rented a car which I highly recommend unless you plan to stay on or near the resort the whole time. We did a lot of activities so the car was great. However, they charge you 15 dollars a day for self parking or 25 dollars for valet and it is completely unnecessary, the resort is huge with plenty of parking space so charging is something they do because they can. The food at the resort is not bad but it isn't worth the cost. We paid 60 for breakfast for two people and both dinners were about 100. Our best meals were the ones we ate off of the resort. If you head east on route 3 a couple miles down is a row of restaurants in Luquillo that are great, including La Parilla, it may look slightly run down but all of them sit right on the beach! We ate at Shimas and Pailo at the resort a Japanese and Italian place that were no better then pf changs and olive garden but triple the price. Overall this place is great if you want the true resort experience but if you are willing to venture out you will find some much better deals on food. As far as excursions go do not book through the concierge they double the price. Do your research, book in advance of your trip, and book directly through the excursion company. Kayaking puerto Rico and yunke zip line were both great and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Good Location but watch out for charges !”
Reviews.Author: N.SURESH
Reviews.Content: We were able to book this through top secret hotels through travelocity for $ 99 per night instead of paying $ 300 per night ! When we arrived after a long trip, we were told that the hotel is overbooked and we were bumped because we paid the lowest rate to Gran Melia for one free night. We insisted on getting free parking for their mistake , otherwise the parking is $ 25 per night for valet ! We insisted on getting one night of free breakfast , very expenseive for $ 24 plus tax with is about $ 28 per person. Luckily we were compensated with a ocean front room which was fantastics. The view is outstanding. The beach is beautiful. Watch you bill when you check out, they add $ 14 for Fiji water which was never taken. When I asked them how did you add this . You dont even have a fridge in the room, they took the charges and were rude. Great place to stay if you can manage to get through hotwire or travelocity top secret 4 star hotel for below $ 100 !

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation...”
Reviews.Author: colara1
Reviews.Content: I am writing this because my friend is going in a couple weeks and is worried about what she's reading here. I thought the place was great. Yes, expensive drinks and food was mediocre but the location and the beach and the rainforest...all to die for. It depends on what you're going for. If you want fabulous service and people waiting on you hand and foot then don't go here..Don't even go to Puerto Rico because that's not the culture. we're talking about a poverty stricken island with stray dogs, chickens and horses...consider where you are and then consider the service...and Johnny on the beach bringing me an umbrella everyday was quite fabulous and so was his smile. If you want a large resort with plenty to do, fabulous weather and a beautiful beach, go here. Try to get a room on the 7th floor on the mountain side for more privacy... Tips: Get groceries, bottles of alcohol etc. Keep them in your room, that fridge expense is well worth it when you consider having to buy everything at the hotel. Get to the pool by 7:30am with some towels and books or shoes if you want to reserve a good spot. Use a set fee taxi, we had a great woman who owned her own car and wouldn't charge us extra if we wanted to stop for groceries quickly. Get reservations for dinner EVERYWHERE, they will ask. Checking a bag to be able to bring sunscreen, etc. is well worth it, as it is more expensive to buy there than to check the extra bag Become a Wyndham rewards member if you want the room internet fee waived. The concierge takes a long time, and so does Dragonfly tours, don't leave anything until the last minute...it will frustrate you...

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money, but not super nice”
Reviews.Author: aes37
Reviews.Content: I am torn. I would probably go there again, because with the deal that we got on cheapcaribbian.com (ended up being about$85/night) but I would NOT go there if I were just paying their posted prices. Pros: Awesome pools, awesome grounds, pretty good beach, best location for what we were there to do, good service at front desk, and awesome maid service Cons: Crazy expensive food, crapy and slow service at resturant, TERRIBLE service at the pool cabanna.. always running out of towels and only wanting to talk about their timeshare deal. We had mixed service at the conciege desk. Some attendents were very helpful and kind, some were lazy and rude. Ask for Nathanial.. he bent over backwards to help us. When we first got in, our "ocean view" room had a full view of the parking garage, and only a glimmer of the ocean.. if I stood in the right place. I called the front desk, they completly understood my frustration, and got me a nicer room the next day at no charge. Great service there. There beds are very comfy, never had a problem with water pressure. Um what else... oh, yeah, they say that they have computers and internet for the guests for free. Out of the 5 computers, only 3 worked our whole time there, and they were too slow and ancient to access yahoo. I was not able to check my email the entire time. I should have just brought my laptop, but it did not want to pay the $15/24 hours of internet service. Crazy. So... I paid the price of a Motel 8. And I can honestly say that is was nicer than a hotel 8. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “I am happy as well to see some nice reviews”
Reviews.Author: jjs12959
Reviews.Content: Agree with most assesments here. Beautiful resort, beautiful location. What weather! The River Golf Course is awesome and all personnel associated with the golf courses were WONDERFUL. Yes, staying and eating at the resort, very expensive. We ate off the resort several times, taking alot of advice and getting a rental car. $15 daily fee for parking that. El Yunque Rain forest, very worthwhile and free if you just go up by car. Cool, rundown road side stands to get cheap food and drink on the way up or down. Some service personnel at bars and restaurants on the resort slow and disinterested. Concierge desk a weakness in our opinion. But I loved this vacation. Clean room, beds and linens extremely comfortable. Great beach and great pools. Most of the staff very helpful. Would easily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location--exactly what you see on their website”
Reviews.Author: bookcrazi
Reviews.Content: The positives of Rio Mar--absolutely beautiful hotel in a great location. Staff is attentive to needs and always pleasant. The negatives- -food is very expensive. Restaurants on site aren't great with the exception of Shimka and Polio. Forget Marabelle--think cafeteria buffet but at a whopping price. If you visit Puerto Rico you know you are going to spend a lot on food. However, it should be better than what you get here. Drinks are very pricey. Again, nothing that we didnt know about prior to our visit. The only thing that really bothered me was the cost of internet--$14.99 per day! There are computers available for checking e-mail, but two of the five were not working. I really hate it when high end hotels nickel and dime their guests. Internet access is part of 21st century travel and it shouldn't cost almost $75 a week.

Reviews.Title: “The room charge is just the beginning of what you'll pay here.”
Reviews.Author: PaulinATL
Reviews.Content: Paid $109 base rate on Priceline and got a Mountain view room. Very good price for high season. However, had to pay an additional $15 for self-parking and a "Resort Fee" of about $20 on top of that. The on-site restaurants are expensive and of the same quality as airline food: $15 for a flavorless chicken Caesar salad the size of a small cereal bowl, and $5 for 1/2 cup of fruit in the "To Go" cafe. I understand this is a resort, and I don't mind paying a premium, but I really don't like the feeling of being ripped off (the fee for self-parking is just obnoxious). The beach, grounds and pools are nice, but the service here needs serious work, as we saw cigarette butts left in many places and the property is looking rather worn at the edges. I would ONLY recommend this place if you get it for a deeply discounted rate - it is by no means a 4-star hotel in any sense.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort! Great Service, food, fun!”
Reviews.Author: cmoore99
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife for a 3 day/4 night trip. I have nothing bad to say about this resort. It was beautiful! The beach is immaculate, the pool is great and the service is wonderful. You pay resort prices for food and drink but what do you expect??? This entire trip was still about $400 less expensive than what an "all inclusive" would have been in the Bahamas. Get to the rain forest! It is a sight to see for sure. We rented a car right at the resort. They have an onsite Enterprise stand. Get to the stand early, its opens at 8am. The line gets long quick and can take a while. We rented the car for a day, went to the rain forrest on our own and hiked the waterfall trail from bottom to top. Park in the Big Tree lot, hike the trail all the way to the top, and walk back to the lot on the road. That way you see all the falls and can swim in the pools up top that are a lot less crowded than the pool at the big falls. All in all I would give this a 5 start review!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boring and Too Expensive and Uncaring”
Reviews.Author: sienaltd
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but this was a mistake! There is NOTHING to do there for teenagers. If your kids are 10 or up, stay away, go elsewhere. The grounds are very nice but this hotel is immensely boring. There aren't even activities for any of the kids, except an iguana feeding each day at 11 (once you've done it....) and bingo (which lasts 20 minutes) and a short slide for grade school aged kids. THAT IS IT!!! The beach does offer a few opportunities to jet ski but the ocean is SO choppy that it wasn't very popular. I never saw anyone go banana boating, nor did I see the boat that they would use, if you did sign up. There are windsurfing opportunities but I never saw anyone do that either. Basically, there are VERY LIMITED beach activities. Further up the beach is a mouth to a canal that heads into the island, and you can kayak on that, but heading to Bio Bay in the evening is a much better kayaking adventure. That I would highly recommend. We used the Island Adventures Bio Bay group (as there are several to choose) and they were terrific, start to finish. Try to pick a night with no moon - just spectacular and fun and memorable for all ages - elderly to little kids. Another big problem was the staff. While some were wonderful (the concierge desk in general), they are very UNACCOMODATING at the front desk and in their management staff. It started with a king bed instead of two doubles for me, and the next thing I know I am stuck accepting the king bed, and taking a pull out, with two tall boys 15 and 17. We all brought laptops or iPads to stay in touch, do a little work, but guess what ! (Internet service is $15.00 per day per device! I called El Conquistador and St. Regis and both are free, by the way.) It took us 2 days to get a refrigerator and we went to a local grocery store for drinks and provisions but had to keep icing them down. The two ice machines on my floor (6th) were broken all week except the last day, so I had to go to the 7th floor after discovering that the 5th floor ran out of ice all the time. The cash machine was not working in the hotel, and the line is very long for the buffet breakfast by 8:30 am, and on and on, but the management could not care less when I complained. The housekeeping staff were very accomodating however, a bright spot. I highly recommend renting a van or a car to visit adventures. The ATVing in the rainforest was a wonderful 3 hour excursion. I drove an ATV with my 15 year old on the back (no license) and we laughed and laughed throughout it, with all of the twists and turns, "straitaways" and bumps and beautiful scenery. Stopped at a river for a swim, jump off a rock and education which was unforgettable and so terrific. The guides were laughing right along with us - very nice people. We used Four Track Adventures in Rio Grande. They also have horses for a trek through the rainforest. We spent the afternoon walking through Old San Juan and then had a wonderful dinner at a small restaurant off the main square, and would highly recommend devoting at least 6-7 hours doing this. My teenagers enjoyed it and it was both educational, beautiful, and so very different from "real life." Our final problem with the hotel is all of the "extras" that shouldn't be and the expensive pricing. I had about 10 pieces of sushi for dinner at over 30.00 (18.00 in my home town) and the prices in PALIO were jaw dropping, except for the spaghetti bolognese at 24.00, the cheapest thing on the menu !! I think you catch my drift. Unless you are two people who don't care about pricing, and just want a quiet time without kids by the adult pool, don't come here. But even two adults alone have a lot more choices, like LeSport in Antigua or several places in Turks and Caicos. I just don't get why anyone would come to this hotel with the other choices out there. This was mediocre at best in all categories.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed on Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bjn115
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was beautiful. The beach and pools were great. Our experience with the customer service, however, was very disappointing. After having booked and paid for a shuttle from the airport, our shuttle driver met us without a shuttle. We waited an hour before getting a taxi. At the hotel front desk, we were told that they had overbooked and our only option would be a sofa bed in a "half suite." No compensation/perks/free breakfast - anything was offered for this inconvenience. After insisting that this was unacceptable, we eventually got a room that was definitely not the "honeymoon suite." The bed was comfortable and king size. the "mountain view" I'd reserved for this special occasion trip was instead a view of the valet parking garage. a pipe in our bathroom leaked and the floor was constantly wet, housekeeping took our old towels yet didn't leave us clean ones one day, and the noise between rooms was much more than I'd expected for a hotel that looked so nice. The restaurants were nice, we ate at the Marbella buffet every evening because it was such a great deal price-wise for what you get. However, service there was poor as well - we waited at least 15 minutes before being greeted, had to ask for a glas of water multiple times, and our order of cocktails was forgotten and we had to ask that it be taken off our bill later. The food was quite good though. The location of the resort was good, and Dragonfly Tours in the lobby ws quite helpful - they booked several tours for us. One tour actually resulted in a shuttle crash and broken windows...but other than that, I'd reccomend using Dragonfly for any tour you want to do.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: fjy_nyc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort on March 3rd 2011. I came with 3 other friends for my birthday celebration and we had two rooms on the same floor. To make things short and simple for everyone to read here is a list: -our bathroom wasn't very clean. some ladies long black hair was stuck to the walls. -the bathroom at times had some weird odor coming from the pipes behind the toilet. it smelled it the sewer. -everytime the house keeper came in to clean they never locked our balcony doors. we always leave it locked when we leave the room but everytime we came back it was unlocked. anyone could have came in our room from the balcony since we were on the first floor right where the entrance was to feed the iguanas. -we knew from reading other tripadvisor reviewers to rent a car and buy drinks at walmart. this was the best idea. thank goodness we did that. renting a fridge costs $10.00 extra a night. the food at marbella in the resort was a buffet at night for $25.00 but there wasn't much variety and the food didn't taste good at all. the steak was dry, ribs had a weird taste, chowder was salty, salad dressings were gross, rice was hard and the chicken tenders were too fried and burnt looking. the only ok thing to eat was the pasta alfredo. also the manager tried to charge us for taking the beers and soda that was with the buffet food. there was no sign of saying extra charge for drinks and no one was there stopping us from taking them. thanksfully our waiter told him it was there fault and he didn't charge us. -the location of the hotel was alright. close to the el yunque rainforest and the kioskos where they had many different restaurants but they all served basically the same bland tasting food. it was about 30 mins or so from san juan without traffic. we were stuck in traffic due to san juan's cooking gas pipe breaking and it took us about a hour or more to reach our destination. -beware the iguanas and lizards roam around freely on the resort grounds by the pool. it was hard for us to tan and lay by the pool. the huge iguana did a belly flop into the pool and we ran out. -the drinks were very expensive and were only mediocre. we had pina coladas, strawberry daquiries, peach freeze and mango slush. each at $8.00 a pop without tax or tip. -there were so many conventions going on here and no entertainment for the rest of the people staying except the casino which is very small and not very entertaining for those who don't want to gamble. there was a guy playing thr piano and a sax at the lobby bar but it wasn't great and it would have been nice to listen to some spanish music since we were in a spanish place. -they have free internet only in the internet section of the lobby but 2 out of the 5 computers were out of service and there a line to use them. -the phones in the room, cordless and non cordless were dirty. they need to clean that. the only thing good about this place was Ruben the bell man for helping us and the men that helped us with our beach chairs and umbrellas, setting them up nicely facing the sun. oh and the 1.5 hour late check out they gave us when we requested it since our flight was at 6pm. checkout for them is 11am

Reviews.Title: “I wish I went somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: winterbreak11
Reviews.Content: Starting with the airport transfers (included in our package), they did not have our names on the list to pick up, but they did add our names and take us to the hotel, no questions asked. Then, we found the charge for $525 (party of 7) on our hotel bill. They took it off after we brought it to their attention. No apologies from them. We checked in to our rooms. We requested 2 ocean view rooms, each with 2 beds, adjoining. We received two rooms (not adjoining) on the 6th floor (West). One room had 2 beds overlooking the roof of their conference center and only a "peek" of the ocean if you craned your neck to the right off of our TINY balcony. The other room had only ONE king bed and a peek of the ocean from the same TINY balcony (for 3 people...). We spent the rest of the afternoon, waiting for a room that didn't look at a roof (still had the tiny balcony), and kept the King room and took a rollaway. Note: the majority of the rooms have a nice sized balcony, but the only rooms we were offerred had these tiny balconies and were tucked into the corners of the hotel. The rooms on the 6 & 7th floors are above the palm trees and have decent views. Ours was on the 4th floor and looked directly at a palm tree (6-10 from our balcony).
