Our room was also really close to the bar which had an outside area, a little noisy, but expected and wasn't a problem. Internet: Not free. We were told that if we became Wynham "By Request" members (free), we would receive free internet. Not true. Only true if we had booked directly with the hotel (we didn't). Also, at $15/day, PER COMPUTER in the same room, it was a huge RIPOFF!!! Our boys each had computers and so did I. $45/day?? Not us. Our biggest complaint about this hotel was that the staff had huge attitudes. They were never accomodating to our requests. (new rooms, charges on bills, forgotten food/drink orders, etc.) We were firm, but polite with our requests. Didn't matter,. It was clear that they received many complaints and knew how to handle them. We did not rent a car and instead went on the advice of other reviews and used taxis. (for us they were always vans -- party of 7). First day to Amigo grocery store. $40 (they wait for you - not a bad deal). Bought snacks, drinks, rum, milk, cereal and a styrofoam cooler. Saved lots of money. No coolers allowed at the pool -- no problem. First dinner off property, we went to La Parilla in Luquillo. Highly recommend. Asked for a taxi and when it was ready, our driver "Israel" took us to the restaurant and came back for us ($45?). This is where the trip turned sour! Israel asked us what we had been doing on the island since arriving and we told him some ideas we had. He then told us he could book an excursion for us to the "Bio Bay." Ok, why not? We hadn't checked for available times ourselves, but the time he offered worked. He then told us he would pick us up and bring us back from Bio Bay. Price $225!! WHAT? After dinner we went directly to the hotel concierge (very helpful in every way) and inquired about renting a van for a few days and the cost. We were able to get a van for $95/day for 4 days total. Enough to do some activities outside of the hotel and still enough time to eat at the hotel restaurants as well. Early the next morning I called "Israel" and told him we did not need the taxi ride to Bio Bay. He was furious! He then told us he was not a taxi driver, but a tour operator that booked excursions for people. So, he made money driving us to our activities and he made a portion of money on the activity. Hmmmm. We had only asked for a taxi driver. This man called us several times on our cell phones and harrassed us! We apologized for his dissapointment and he eventually told my husband that we only felt he was a stupid "racial slur." We were appalled. Never, did we say anything close to that. We spoke directly with the hotel manager on duty at that time and she was very sorry and promised to speak to him. PLEASE stay away from this man and be careful with the "outside" taxi drivers that the hotel brings in to supplement their needs. Now for the good times! Bio Bay -- a must (kayaking at night in a luminescent lagoon -- really cool!)$45/40cash) ATVing in the rain forest - another GREAT activity. Guides were fantastic & fun; wear crocs, not sneakers if you want to swim, it will be easier. ($75/driver, $45 passenger) Old San Juan - wonderful history & architecture. Spend a full afternoon here and then have dinner in one of the wonderful quaint restaurants. Zip Lines in Rain Forest - couldn't get a reservation, sold out. Book before you leave home. Hotel is nice. Rooms were fine, bathrooms were roomy. Not a five star property by any means. Food is expensive! Fruity drinks with alcohol $10.50, virgin $8.00. Gift shop prices on bottles of wine - insane. i.e. Santa Margharita $45.99/bottle A glass of wine in bar $12.00 for least expensive white. By the end of the week, we were used to the prices and just paid them without thinking about it. Restaurants that we would recommend in Hotel. Marbella for buffet breakfast, sushi restaurant, italian restaurant $$, and the Tiki Bar (hamburgers, chicken burgers $14). Restaurants off property that we recommend. Isomar Bakery at corner of Rte 3 (cannot walk) has fantastic pastries and sandwiches at very reasonable prices. LaParilla in the kiosks in Luquilla was delicious. Guava's Restaurant on the waterfront (looks like a bar - not at the kiosk locations) was incredible! 787-889-2222 (homemade ice cream around the block too). Old San Juan: Puerto Rico Cafe, the absolute best food! All in all we had a great time. The hotel does not have any night life, not enough activities on property for teenage boys, but we did have a relaxing time. Yes, you do need to reserve your lounge chairs at around 7:30 a.m. Keep your beach towels that they give you as they are constantly out of them! Next vacation, definitely won't be in Puerto Rico. Been there done that. I'd rather go to Turks & Caicos. (been there and will go back)

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: karen0503
Reviews.Content: I'm glad to see that there are some POSITIVE reviews about this resort. I read so many bad reviews after I booked this resort that I was truly frightened to stay there!! I don't know if we were not expecting much bc all of the reviews, but my friend and I had a GREAT time, with each other and with the staff. There was not one staff member that we did not like. All of them were so friendly and helpful!! It seemed that the hotel was overbooked, so we excepted an Ocean View Suite that only had a sofa bed.The room was so SPACIOUS and sleeping on the sofa bed was well worth the beautiful view we woke up to every morning! I think the only downfall was the price of the food. HOWEVER, if you actually look, the resort does provide menus with prices on their website. NO SURPRISES. Everything was delicious, but would of liked to have authentic PR food.

Reviews.Title: “Better Resorts for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: SoloTurtle
Reviews.Content: I booked an ocean-front room, they booked me into an ocean-view room and told me I was wrong until I produced my confirmation page. Definitely a price difference and as a result of the last minute change (a mistake on their part), they put me into a room that was suboptimal. The room was not oceanfront, even though that is what it was listed as. I was a solo traveler and preferred not to be in an adjoining room, to which, the staff at the front desk said they could not accommodate. The room was supposed to have a king size bed and non-smoking. The people in the adjoining room were so loud, I could hear everything they said, and smell the cigarette smoke from their room. Internet was ~ 15$ per day, outrageous!! I agree with other reviews, this place does nickel and dime you for every little thing. The worst part about the stay, was there was no running water in the whole resort two of the mornings (for several hours) I was there, with no explanation or apology from the staff. The hallway has old carpeting and smelled moldy. The rooms and hallway could use remodeling for sure. I've stayed at better resorts and would not return to the Wyndham Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: seekinsun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Rio Mar Feb 25-Mar 5 2011. I picked this resort because we wanted to be away from all the crowds in San Juan. It's in a great location, not far from the Fajardo ferries if you want to take a day trip to Vieques (which I highly recommend). It's also situated on a beautiful stretch of beach with hardly a view of any other hotels in the area. The rainforest is very close by as well, and worth checking out. ~HOTEL- The grounds are extremely well maintained and very beautiful. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The lobby areas are large and comfortable. Although it is a large hotel, it is very easy to get used to the layout . I didn't like the fact that we had to pay $20 a day for parking. It adds up. The crowd at the hotel was very mixed... young, old, families, singles. There's not much activity at night, so if you're into a lot of night life, I would suggest getting a hotel in San Juan. ~FOOD/DRINKS/RESTAURANTS- The food and drinks are expensive. Best to have breakfast outside of the hotel at Isamar or Palmer bakeries, just up the road. Drinks are expensive, averaging about 12-14 dollars for a mixed drink (in a smallish glass too!). Bring a small cooler if you want to save some money. Lunch is also expensive, save your $$ for dinner. We tried four restaurants at the hotel. I was not impressed with Marbella, the main restaurant. We did , however, LOVE Palio, the Italian restaurant, and dined there twice. It's a little high priced, but the quality was really good, and comparable to a NY restaurant, so we didn't mind. The Tapas bar had good food for a quick bite, and the Tiki Bar at the Beach was also pretty good, but on the expensive side. ~BEACH/POOL AREA- For those of you who are wondering if you can swim in the ocean at the hotel, the answer is YES! It isn't super calm water, but the waves are fun to jump around in, and the beach is long and roomy. There are no waitresses coming around to take drink or food orders if you care about that. We didn't. It's easy to walk over to the Tiki bar to get something. A walk along the beach south of the hotel is worth exploring. I liked the fact that there was a kids pool and an adult pool, each with it's separate hot tubs. The hot tubs were great, always in working order, and very relaxing. The pool areas fill up quickly. (It could have been crowded because we were traveling in a very popular week during high season) Many people got there early to claim their spot, and it was hard to get a lounge chair in the morning or early-mid afternoon if you didn't have a spot. You can rent a cabana area for $100 (!!! ) a day,if you want a guaranteed spot by the pool. We stayed on the beach most of the day, and moved over to the pool area later in the afternoon and had no problem getting a spot. ~DO YOU NEED A CAR?- I would say yes. BUT.. if you just want to stay at the hotel during your whole stay, and take a few planned excursions, you can probably get away without one. We love to explore our surroundings, so a car was a must for us. ~ROOMS- We had a king ocean front room. The view was really nice, and the room was pretty spacious and super clean. The decor was nice.. not ultra updated, but I had no complaints. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was roomy. My only complaint was that there were no refrigerators in the rooms. All and all, we liked the hotel and would definitely recommend it. We had a great time there, and loved the location. It DID seem like you were getting over charged for every little thing. Just be aware of this, and plan ahead to save money. I think they must need to pay for all of the villas they built surrounding the hotel. They DO ask you to attend a seminar to tell you about these villa sales, but they don't press you if you don't care to attend. The resort is very nice... enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel that Nickels and Dimes you to death.”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerOR
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a nice hotel with a great location, but tries to squeeze as much out of your wallet/purse as it can. I reserved an "Ocean Front" room and received an Ocean Front room on floor five, but it was blocked by huge palm trees that limited the view. A lot of the rooms on floors five and below have limited ocean views no matter where they are. Although there are two floors higher--floors six and seven that have better views--the trees aren't that tall yet--not sure how you get on those floors--perhaps grease the desk manager's palm. ?? Nickel and Diming-- almost $8 for a bottle of water in the room, $10 per day if you want a small fridge in the room to keep your snacks cold, $25 per day for wireless internet service, $35 per hour for tennis court time, $5 per hour to rent a racquet, $7 for a bottle of "light" beer, $12 for a mixed drink--diluted rum punch, and tours arranged at the concierge desk are very expensive--take a little time and plan your own. As suggested by others, rent a car at the San Juan airport. $120 per week with unlimited mileage from Enterprise Rent a Car versus about $40 a day at the hotel--same company. Driving around isn't that bad--if you drive on the mainland you can drive here-- and save tons of money on sight-seeing. I don't mind people making a profit, but this is price gouging at it's finest. Enjoyed several "false alarms" that requested guests use the stairs to evacuate. One at 11 PM at night. As others have mentioned, this happens rather frequently. One of these days there will be a real emergency and no one will pay attention. Accident waiting to happen. Would not stay here again. Service staff are nice, but limited by hotel policies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beach, nice hotel, pricy food and extras”
Reviews.Author: meg_arita_11
Reviews.Content: I waiver between a 3 and four star. My girlfriend and I went for a girls mini get away price was right and it was right on the beach, two deciding factors for us. First off we rented a car at the airport, IMO a must have, I can't stand being prisoner on any resort but that's just me. Driving is fine in Puerto Rico, don't let other ninnys tell you otherwise, it's pretty much like in the states (in fairness I'm from Boston so maybe I'm immune to crazy drivers). Bring your GPS, you'll be fine. I though the hotel itself was very nice, spacious and clean. Check in was fine and the room was nicer than expected with a balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. Big comfy beds, we had no a/c problems like so many people complained about. The pool was really nice looking tons of lounge chairs (but yes everyone does that "saving thing" where they leave their crap on the chair to reserve it then go off for the day). The staff was nice. We had no problems with towels there were plenty and they would give you two. The ocean was beautiful, and they had lounge chairs there and free umbrellas....what could be better? Now for the bad. The parking is $15 a day and I heard the garage was on the opposite side of the resort so we valet(ed) it for the week at $20 a day. Second the food and drinks were CRAZY EXPENSIVE. And not just mixed drinks beers were $8-9 a beer so don't think you'll cheap out and just have a beer. Coffee was like $4.50 a cup. The breakfast buffet was over $50 for 2 (no drinks). Want to grab a salad at lunch at the outdoor bar? $18 for a salad with chicken on the top. The first two days I had free wifi on my phone, the next days they had shut it down so you had to pay or leave the hotel to get internet. In all I think they would make so much more money if they would be reasonable in pricing. For instance we would have wanted to stay at the bar and had drinks, instead we brought in drinks from other places, thanks to the other reviewer I brought a cooler bag. We desperately wanted some nightlife at the hotel but it was not be be had (at least mid week). I think the prices drive people off. It's almost like they want to drive you off....doesn't make sense to me. . There are a lot of good options for food and drinks if you have a car. Anonijitos at the bottom of the hill was good. The bakery, Isomar, right at the lights is awesome! Great breakfast sandwiches and oatmeal, and nice people. Going towards Loquillo there are some nice restaurants that look very divey from the outside but are very good. You'll find most all the restaurants to be very heavy on meat and starch. Tough to find vegetables or salads which for some reason I crave when I go to the Caribbean or a warm climate. The rainforrest is right across the highway and it's pretty nice for a few hours diversion. The waterfall itself is pretty small but picturesque. In all I'd go back to the Wyndham Rio Mar but again only with a car and I'd plan to leave for every meal.

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel with over-the top beverage and food prices”
Reviews.Author: marco_carlson
Reviews.Content: Westin built this beautiful place with first rate class through and through. And . . . they charged for it, but there were no hidden fees. Wyndham attracts people, mostly families with relatively low room rates but then kill you with $6.00 per beer charges and $10.00 for cocktails. The food is priced the same way, a mediocre salad at $10, ad a piece of fish ti it and it $17. They have a captive audience so if you don't have a car or transportation you're stuck. The brunch is great but be prepared for a $60 breakfast bill for two. In addition . . . if you do have a car, there's no place to park other than their lots, indoor or outdoor, but they're going to nail you $15 a day plus taxes. Seems to me guests should some how be able to park for free or at least a discounted rate. My wife and I liked the place, the help is very professional and friendly but gouging for food, drinks and parking is just not right. What really pout us off is the "come on" to sit through a presentation and a series of questions regarding their Wyndham "Point System", to become an owner, travel the world, stay at their properties throughout the world, time share crap, you know. My wife and I know better but we went anyway. We were told it's a no pressure info session. It's not. It turned into a "we're not letting you out of here until you give us a down payment check and a signature on the bottom line". It was really "off-putting". We won't go back and probably won't recommend it even though its a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, outrageous food prices”
Reviews.Author: Springtraveler06
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a superb location if you want to relax poolside or at the beach, explore El Yunque, Luquillo Beach, the Bio Luminescent Bay, and the Cabezas de San Juan. The grounds are lovely and every staffer we met was very helpful. Our room did not have a view (none was expected), was spacious and clean. Caveats: 1. You must have a car. Rent at the airport and drive the 45 minutes,either along 187 via Loiza to Route 3 or via the expressway(66/3) combination. 2. As a frequent traveler, I expect to pay more for hotel food. However, I do not expect to pay multiple times the value of the meal, snack, etc. Follow the cars to Isamar Bakery, Palmer Bakery, Antojitos, the kioskos in Luquillo (#21 in particular), Kings Seafood or Rincon del Sabor or La Estacion for meals. 3. None of the pcs at the hotel had Internet access during our stay. We had iPhones and no problems, but it was a great inconvenience for other travelers. 4. The parking ticket validation is very inconvenient, as one must go to the front of the hotel, then hike back to the parking area.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and I have only 1 major complaint”
Reviews.Author: tripletmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar from 2/20-2/26 and had a very nice time. First,let me tell you the things that we liked...the grounds, pools and beach are great. There was always plenty of room in the pool and on the beach for everyone to enjoy themselves. Our room had a mountain view and we thought the beds were comfortable and did not have any problems with the cleanliness or the heating and cooling of the room. The hotel parking was fine, we never had any problem finding a parking space. The hotel is in a good location; right across from the rainforest, 30-40 minutes from San Juan, close to Fajardo and the marina for excursions, and close to restaurants and grocery/drug stores. My biggest complaint is the extremely overpriced food and drinks at the hotel. As other people have mentioned, a beer is $7, a mixed drink is $12.50, and a kid's lemonade is $4! We only ate dinner one night at the hotel, it was the night we arrived when we were very tired and very hungry. We ate at Shima, the asian restaurant, and the food was average in taste and over priced. We did have some issues with our room key not working and with there not being enought towels by the pool, as other people have mentioned. Here are my suggestions to make your stay at the Rio Mar and your trip to Puerto Rico great... eat breakfast at Don Pepe, right down the road from the resort. The "mallorca" is fabulous (breakfast sandwich with the best bread ever!). The pancakes, made with cinnamon and vanilla are also awesome. Stock up at Walgreen's and the Amigo grocery store for snacks, food, and water/drinks.Get some sandwiches for lunch at the Miramar Bakery which is right at the end of the road when leaving the hotel. Eat dinner at Hacienda Caribale which is again, near the hotel. The "mufongo" and the skirt steak are wonderful. We went there two times because the food was soooo good. We had mexican food one night at Lolita's and that was good too. I know a alot of people recommend La Parilla (one of the kiosks), but we had a terrible experience. We waited over an hour for our food and when it arrived our steak was only half cooked. I would highly recommend booking your Biobay excursion through East Island Excursions; they were fantastic. Very organized, professional experience from start to finish. Your excursion includes the boat ride to Vieques, dinner, and the biobay experience which includes swimming in the bay. It is a must do while in this area. We also enjoyed our trip to the rainforest (we hiked on our own), visit to San Juan and San Cristobel fort and zip lining with the company "Rain Forest Zip Line Corp". They are located right outside the rainforest and are great for familes with young children. Overall, a great experience in Puerto Rico and I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO!!!”
Reviews.Author: mair813
Reviews.Content: If your mind isn't already chaged by all of the negative reviews, let this be the last one. Save your money, time and well deserved vacation and don't go. Everything about this place was a total NEGATIVE. We've traveled to many places and had numerous experiences, but this place was just a bad joke. We didn't believe all of the reviews and went anyway, DON'T. Go to Aruba or anywhere but here and Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar-red! It's not pretty.”
Reviews.Author: luvdabigeasy
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights for leisurely meeting of company directors and spouses. Good people but shoddy, dirty, unkempt facility. Tile floor in room smelled sanitary but was gritty from sand and leftover garbage from previous guests. Door to balcony difficult to open harder to walk through as curtain was broken and wouldn't go up or down. Good sized bath but curved shower rod inhibited door fully opening and reducing space. Mirror at lease 5 feet from end of basin. Tipped daily (7-10 bucks) and service improved but still didn't pick up corks, wrappers from prior days and foot stool for chair had cobwebs hanging from the edge. Wall opposite air conditioner vent covered with mold. Facility in general needs full overhaul/cleaning to be on par for a resort. Received great, friendly service from everyone, everywhere. Had issue with self parking attendant who asked for receipt when checking out. I asked why and she lookes at other valets and says in spanish, "Why do Americans have to be so rude!" I responded in spanish for her to shut her mouth and get me my ticket to get out of this lousy hotel which was followed by her fellow employees laughter. Everything is expensive, so stock up on essentials and booze at the WalMart on Route 3 or be prepared to pay. No fridge in room. Brought a soft sided cooler. We ate at the buffet restaurant once for dinner and breakfast. We named the place The Trough. Mediocre food, sky high prices. The Grill at the Country Club offers great food, good service and a Manhattan dinner check. Beach, pool and grounds are great and picturesque. Activity for kids. Bring your own beer, etc., unless you prefer to pay 50 cents an once for your Coors Light before tip. Golf courses are in good shape but don't offer anything outside of flat, predictable resort courses. Senic does not come to mind. Overall, very disappointing. As said, needs to be cleaned, scrubbed, painted, fixed up and maintained to match the good attitude of the staff. Stayed at Marriott in Condado/Ashford Street for four days prior. That is a first class experience with many outside food, bar, shopping choices.

Reviews.Title: “Like Draculas' holiday escape”
Reviews.Author: acrist623
Reviews.Content: I have been to Peurto Rico many many times and have a complete knowledge of the area and it's many wonderful offerings. This resort could and should be an excellant offering for the mass tourist looking for a well situated mega resort. Unfortunately it falls short in almost every important area. The somewhat tired but still beautiful lobby with open vistas to the sea is woefully dark and dreary yet it would be easily remedied with increased wattage in the already existing light fixtures .. really really dark and depressing ... walk to elevator is like walking to the gallows.... Freakishly cold common areas.. really.. I get the need to compensate for openning doors and tropical heat which was the flippant, condescending answer I got from the engineering guy. It was in the high 50's at all times in the lobby and bar areas. As for the rooms' they provide no heat, yet housekeeping kept overriding our thermostat setting of 69 degrees and resetting it to 51 !!! 51? yes I swear 51 freaking degrees !!! What was she thinking? 51 degrees? Is there any human who actually wants there room 51 degrees? Ever? With no heat to counter it, we had to open door all the way and huddle in 1 bed like eskimos and share comforters from both beds ... really... 51 degrees. Also as a beach resort you would think that beach/pool towels would be something they had plenty of..... NOT!!! I spent 4 days there and was only able to procure towels... any towels 1 of those days...The only thing worse was the "what do you want me to do" attitude of the severely out of place midwestern ,early 20 year old whose only job was to hand out towels. Service around pool area waas non existant unless it was the "pop -up " revenue generators such as the rolling popcorn vender with $3 cups of popcorn or the $5 smore kits... other than that you could die trying to get service by the pool or anywhere for that matter.....I know you get what you pay for and the price I paid was not Ritz Carlton, nor do I expect it but is a normal temperature, a beer by the pool, towels and the ability to see my hand in front of my face really asking for too much for $200.00 + ????

Reviews.Title: “4 Star prices..train wreck resort”
Reviews.Author: hughm88
Reviews.Content: They overbooked the rooms and put us in a basement 1 bedroom and then proceeded to make up so many stories over the next two days about our proper ocean front room that i asked them to stop. Gave a $150 credit that didn't come close to making up the difference in cost. Tell them about problems they caused and watch people turn invisible, especially at the front desk. The prices on food, beverage and activities are 50% higher than rip off levels. They attach a vacuum to your credit card and hit the "everything" button, they charge like its the Ritz Carlton. You can't get an honest answer from anyone at Wyndham Rio, they are trained to first avoid you and if that doens't work, lie to your face. The place is in a beautiul setting but desperately needs remodeling, "durable" is the nicest thing i can say about this resort. I can't for the life of me understand why some people are so happy with this resort, I wouldn't send my dog to kennel at Wyndham Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort with Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Arctic-R6
Reviews.Content: I would really like to recommend this Resort/Hotel but there were just way to many small problems to do so. First off let me say that this is a beautiful hotel, pool, and beach. The whole resort is just stunning. But, it all started off badly and then there were just too many problems. Service was terrible, so we wont be going back. When we checked in we were told our chosen double bed room was not available. Ever tried to fit a family of four into one King sized bed? After politely asking for the correct room , the clerk said â€œsorryâ€� and just smiled at me. After getting mean and demanding a room, she disappeared into the back for a long 10 minutes, came back out and said â€œwe were able to find you a double-bed roomâ€�. Like the room just miraculously came open in the last 10 mins? at 11pm? Like they were doing me some kind of favor? That was just the start. When we trudged our family & gear to the room (no bell hops available), our electronic key would not work. After three trips back to the front desk, someone finally came to the room and opened it up for us, and told us to go back in the morning for new keys. Over the course of the 10 days there, the keys quit working about every other day and we kept having to go get new ones from the front desk. And no, we did not place them near cell phones, speaker magnets etc which can erase them. Annoying. If you have a car they charge $15 a day to self park! This might be ok if this is a big-city hotel with limited parking, but they have acres and acres of parking, why charge? And the process for self parking and validating your ticket was a huge pain. To make matters worse, we left the resort for two days on an excursion to another island, and they still charged us for those two days we were gone! I am sure I could have gotten them to take that off my bill, but why shold I have to? And by the time we checked out I was just too frustrated to deal with it. As a comparison, I stayed at the Maui Ritz last year and self parking was FREE. The vast majority of staff were not very friendly at all. I just want people that work there to be nice, helpful, friendly, courteous, etc. Apparently that is too much to ask of the folks at this 4-star resort. 10% were friendly, 40% didnâ€™t notice you, and 50% acted annoyed. The restaurants at the resort are nice, but expensive. Typical for a resort like this but not unexpected. All in all, service was a huge disappointment, and the main reason I would not go back. If they can fix this problem, this would be a true dream resort, but somehow I donâ€™t think that is going to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the ocean villas”
Reviews.Author: SoVtRealtor
Reviews.Content: Good location. Proximity to the hotel and it's amenities was convenient. The villa was a little run down. The staff was helpful and consistent. Weather and water were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mgodin
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice with this resort! Its off the beat & path enough to enjoy some peace & quiet, yet easy enough to rent a car & go explore the island!! The rain forest is right by the resort & beautiful!! A day trip into San Juan is a must. Fort Morro is great to explore & the city!! Just beware of driving because its a bit crazy.....and parking is crazy also. BUT totally worth it & do-able!!! Do it!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, but if you want luxury....”
Reviews.Author: scarlett1211
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights In February and booked through CheapCarribean.com. The resort itself is beautiful, secluded and right on the beach. Really, the location is the best feature of this hotel. We woke up every morning and looked out at the ocean from our balcony...beautiful! Also, you could walk to the beach and get chairs and towels for free and there was lots of space to spread out and relax without someone right next to you. There is about a mile of beach, so going for a walk in either direction will let you take beautiful photographs from many different locations. Also, the hotel is right near the rainforest, so excursions are close and easy to get to. Service: Everyone at the hotel was friendly and responsive to our needs, although sometimes service was a little slow at the Tours and Travel desk. be prepared to wait 15-20 minutes if there is anyone in front of you. Also, they have an antiquated system of booking excursions, having to call each time to see if they had space available on tours and then hand write out each voucher...can't they book trips on the computer? The room service was exceptional and a much better value than some of the restaurants. Food and drink: WAY overpriced. I realize that you are on a resort and things are going to be a bit more expensive, but $7 for a Corona and $6 for a bag of Doritos? We didn't rent a car, but paid for a taxi to Amigos Supermarket for snacks and drinks and that easily saved us over a hundred dollars. Also, I wouldn't mind paying for the food in the restaurants if it was delicious, but truly it was just adequate. Why would I travel to the Caribbean to eat fast food take out or cheap Italian? It would be nice if they offered some local cuisine. Again, it will cost you, but a cab ride to eat somewhere else (Hacienda or Richie's) will be well worth it and you'll get better food. Rooms: The rooms were big and clean with a great view. The water pressure was poor and inconsistent, sometimes barely even a trickle coming out of the shower...not fun to try to wash off a day at the beach with a trickle of water that may or not be hot. It was a minor annoyance, but you expect more from a "resort". Location and excursions: We booked ahead of time through Dragonfly adventures and we were happy with their service. They pick you up right at the hotel and take care of everything. Bring an empty backpack so you can fill it with snacks because often the excursions last several hours and nothing is offered with them. Also, if you prepaid, book your tours right when you get there. We almost missed out on a few because they booked up so quickly, so we had to double up on our last day there. We took the Rainforest "Hike" (more of a walk), the ATV rides (very fun and gorgeous setting), and the Bio Bay Kayak (amazing and well worth it). Overall, it was a clean hotel with friendly service and a gorgeous location and view. Be prepared to spend lots of money on food and drinks that are just mediocre unless you go out and get some of your own. The value of the hotel was great especially when you count in the airport transfers, but I wouldn't pay much more than we did and I don't think we would make a special trip to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ohmsymbol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great 4 nights in heaven! Pay the extra and get the ocean front room! The views are amazing! Great beds, clean and nice, staff amazing. Lots of food choices and great central location to drive places. Beach and pool both well done. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Hrweeks
Reviews.Content: Got rec from delta vacations. Sad I did. Hotel is older. Caters to diverse crowd with lots of families which is good. very under staffed. Pool way to crowded with difficult time getting chairs and no chance for umbrella. Stingy on towels. LOUD. People running up and down hallway. Casino attached. Food service was slow. Poolside was almost nonexistent. Couldn't eat at hotel without making reservations a week in advance! Ok bc we had car and went to great off resort sites. Much nicer beaches away from resort. Check out seven seas beach. Gym cramped and hot. Overall impression - past it's prime, pool needs updating, understaffed, crowded. FYI. I am picky and like luxury and quiet. This doesn't meet either. If aaffordable and you have kids this will do but think of it as a regular hotel in a pretty spot

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Boston-Family76
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Rio Mar several years ago, I was very much looking forward to going back. I was surprisingly disappointed. Service was the biggest problem. They were seriously understaffed. Examples: Hundreds of people on the beach and two servers. Waiting an hour for food ordered at outdoor restaurant. 30 people in line for breakfast each morning. Alcoholic drink served to my 15 year old daughter. After all of this, I'd complained about a leak under our bathroom sink. Obviously wasn't fixed. We awoke at 2:30 in the moring to water gushing from under the sink like a fire hydrant. Room quickly filled with an inch of water. Although the response was quick, the leak should have been fixed in the first place. The facility was pretty run-down; not what it used to be. There are SO many better places to spend your money.....

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: maria_rivera_m
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much since it has water sport on site. There is a water sport named the Iguana water sport in which they have jet skii, surfing boards, kayaks and others equipment for rent at a very good price, being able to do water sport may my experience at this hotel very delighted : ). Also the bed was very comfortable, the room was cleaned and neat. The location was very close to the Yunque rain forest. The staff was very helful and friendly. I will def. go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: jlc16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar for five nights at the beginning of February and it was outstanding. We checked in close to midnight our first night and went swimming in the pools and went walking on the beach under the stars before ordering room service. When we woke up, we could check out the amazing view of the ocean and hotel grounds that we had. I had read all the reviews so we rented a car at the airport and did all our trips independently. We also paid the extra money for valet parking (only $5 extra per day and it is so convenient and quick compared to what people said about the hassle of the self-park lot) and internet service. We live in New York City so the food prices were fine with us and the food was very good with a lot of choices. We ordered room service a few times and they were quick, VERY nice, and the food was great. A couple times we went to dinner without reservations and they seated us very quickly anyway. The resort is very beautiful and very well maintained. They went above and beyond our expectations in every way. Definitely take the advice of others on this site and rent a car so you have some independence and we found it well worth it to pay a little more for some extras like valet and internet and we enjoyed a relaxing and fun vacation. Fun things to do: El Yunque rainforest Snorkeling in Culebra! We had a great experience with Kayaking Puerto Rico. It was one of the most beautiful snorkeling experiences I have ever had. Old San Juan Food kiosks near Luqillo

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very comfortable, Water went out for a few hours one day but Staff handled the set back great”
Reviews.Author: brobuttermilk
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and very comfortable, Water went out for a few hours one day but Staff handled the set back great . They provided us with free bottles of water until the water was restored.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Gorgeous View, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Havepointswilltravel
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we stayed here! The resort is beautiful, the location is great (we didn't want the crowds of San Juan) and it was convenient to the El Yunque, Luquillo and Fajardo. We booked through Costco Travel so we got a great rate for our 5 day stay that included transportation to and from the hotel. We got in late on Thursday and not having to drive late at night to an unfamiliar location in the rain was definitely a plus. Have seen high taxi/shuttle costs from airport to the resort so having transportation included in our hotel package was a big benefit. Make sure you rent a car! There is an Enterprise rental in the hotel so I made a reservation on-line and we picked up our car on Friday morning and dropped of the keys on Tuesday morning. VERY convenient. Just make sure that you make a reservation because while the agent was there at the time we were to pick up the car - she was hard to find at other times. Not an issue for us, but we often saw people waiting at the desk looking for her. Self- parking is $15/day. The valet is $20. Self parking is very quick and convenient though the parking lot does get very full on Saturday night. There is live entertainment in the hotel restaurants/bar/casino on the weekends. They posted a sign board with the various performers. It was good music and we joined others dancing in the lobby bar. The live music in the casino gave it a fun vibe. We spent Friday at Luquillo beach just because we wanted to get out and explore but the beach at the hotel is very pretty. On the weekend when Luquillo is crowded, it was nice to have a beautiful beach at the resort to walk, dip into the waves, and then rinse off at the showers and take a dip in the pool. We made it a point to spend some time at the beach or pool every day. Even if it was just an evening soak in the hot tub. We also had a tour credit as part of our package so we went horseback riding "in the foothills of El Yunque." The stables at Rancho Caraballi were very close to the hotel and the staff there was very friendly and helpful. My boyfriend has ridden a lot but I was 10 the last time I was on a horse - not a problem. The horse they picked for me was very calm. I think I was horse "sitting" rather than horse riding but it was fun. Go early rather than later (so it is cooler) and make sure you wear bug spray. From my oceanfront balcony on Valentine's morning I saw a couple getting married at 10 am on the beach. Was just the couple, the minister and a photographer. We later saw two more weddings at the hotel that evening. We wanted to go to the bio-bay but because of the nearly full moon, the tour company wasn't doing the catamaran out to Vieques. Apparently they stop the tours a few days before/after a full moon because of the bright moon. The kayak trips from Las Croabas/Fajardo were still available but we opted to wait until next time. All in all a wonderful vacation. We're planning to go back same time next year.

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor and poor service with no luxury amenities whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: adverturegurl
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else if you want service and luxury. The rooms are not made until late afternoon. There is old food and room service mess in the hallways all times of the day that sits for hours. No ice machines work on any floor except the ground level. The beach tiki restaurant is serving food that equals the choices you get in a local fast food place and serves you with plastic wear and in a clam-shell take out box. So tacky and has a high-end pricing like full-service. The exterior is gorgeous as well as the grounds and lobby, but the surprise happens when you get inside to find your room. The private guest areas are sorely neglected. We changes rooms twice for odor alone. They need to clean, rip out soiled and stained carpet, and update the furnishings and bedding. We were very unhappy with this hotel for the gleaming expectations we anticipated from looking at the website. The rooms do not look like when the photos were taken. That must have been a long, long time ago.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoette
Reviews.Content: I would like to start this review off by answering some of the questions I had prior to my stay at the hotel. Can I shop at the duty free shop if I am traveling to Puerto Rico from the US? -Yes! Even though PR is considered a US territory, it is an international flight. You can shop duty free at the US airport before boarding your flight, or at the PR airport after you land. Also, you only need to be 18 to drink in PR. Can I drink the tap water in Puerto Rico? -Yes! Tap water is treated and is officially safe to drink. I used it to make coffee in the room and it tasted great. Is there a car rental company at the hotel? -Yes! Enterprise has a desk in the lobby of the hotel and they charge about $50/per day for an economy sized car. I highly recommend making reservations ahead of time. During my visit, it was not possible to rent a car the day of because they were out. I had to contact Cabrera Car Rental, which is about 10 minutes away from the hotel and cost slightly higher than Enterprise. They offer shuttle service to and from the hotel. They will pick you up from the hotel to rent a car and when you drop off the car, they will drive you back to the hotel. Is it possible to walk to a restaurant outside the hotel? -No, absolutely not. It probably takes 15 â€“ 20 minutes to just walk to the entrance of the resort. Outside the resort, there is no sidewalk and the road is narrow. If you donâ€™t mind the risk of being run over by a car, it probably takes another 20-25 minutes to walk to the bottom of the hill to the closest restaurant. Cost: I booked through CheapCaribbean.com and spent about $600 per person for 5 nights including air from the Midwest. What a deal! Tips: 1. Rent a car from the airport. I know I was scared to (and thatâ€™s why I didnâ€™t rent one at the airport but wish I had). Itâ€™s about half the cost of renting it from the resort ($25 vs $50 a day). Cab ride from San Juan to Rio Mar would cost around $80. If you donâ€™t want to drive anywhere, you can purchase round trip shuttle from Dragonfly Adventures. Depending on how long you plan to stay, it could be cheaper than the cost of transportation just to and from the airport. Getting around in a car is easy and not as bad as some make it sound. Yes, I think there are lots of crazy drivers in PR, but just be a defensive driver. Parking at the hotel is $15 a day. You take a ticket each time you go into the parking garage and bring it to the valet to have it validated before you want to leave. Gas cost about $15 for 2 days (2 round trips to San Juan plus local driving). 2. Bring a GPS. My Garmin worked in PR and as long as I had the hotel location programmed, I knew I could always find my way back. http://www.puertoricodaytrips.com/gps/ is a great website and has a page with GPS coordinates so you can pre-program before your trip. I found them very helpful, especially the one for the hotel! (Latitude: +18Â° 22' 55.12" Longitude: -65Â° 45' 50.44") 3. Bring a cooler. I used my cooler every day since there is no fridge in the room. Each floor has an ice machine so itâ€™s convenient. 4. Bring travel mugs. They come in handy, especially when you bring your own beverage to mix. 5. Have breakfast at Isamar Bakery at the bottom of the hill. $4 for an omelet! They have breakfast, sandwiches, pizza, fresh bread, and amazing pastries. The coconut pudding is so delicious, I wish I had purchased the whole tray. The coffee is also very good here. 6. Try Mofongo! Itâ€™s plantains mashed, fried, and mashed again and served with a variety of meats. Room: The room was very big and had 2 double beds, desk and chair, dressers and big screen TV. There is also table and chairs on the balcony. The closet is large and contains a safe where you can store your valuables. There is a lot of counter space in the bathroom and it is supplied with Bath and Body products. The in-room coffee is delicious (tasty and bold) and is replenished daily. Restaurants: The food at the restaurants is quite good. They are expensive, but served in big portions. You have to take into account the cab cost if you were to eat off the resort and mentally subtract it from the bill. The sushi rolls from Shimas were very big, tasty and filling. Spa: The facility is outstanding and the services come with a big price tag. I was actually suckered into the 2 hour timeshare presentation and received a coupleâ€™s 25 minutes massage valued at $175 at this spa. Thatâ€™s the only reason for my visit to the spa. Personally, I donâ€™t make enough to afford $130 plus tip for a 50 minute back massageâ€¦no matter how big my knot is. Time Share Presentation: The presenter spent about 45 minutes giving a tour of the resort, which I quite enjoyed. Thereâ€™s an iguana feeding area where we saw several colorful and large iguanas munching on lettuce. The other half of the presentation was very boring as he tried to get a down payment from us, but bearable. Was it worth the 25 minute massageâ€¦the jury is still out on that. Casino: Itâ€™s small, but has all the essentials. Free drinks (small and infrequent, better tip your waitress well), slots, black jack, roulette, and poker. You can request $5 casino vouchers from within the casino or at the conciergeâ€™s desk that you can use at the black jack or roulette table (max of 5 per night). If you play your voucher on a winning hand, you get an extra $5 chip added to your winnings. Yay, free money! The black jack tables were fun, $5 minimum during the day and $10 min at night. Overall, we made a small donation to the casino. Service: Exceptional! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The concierge welcomed us after we checked in, provided us with loads of information and sent us off on our merry ways. They were also helpful in providing us with maps and driving directions. When I called to ask for a late check out, they were more than happy to let me stay until 12:30p instead of kicking me out at 11am. Pool and Beach: There are 2 pools and a hot tub that are opened 24 hours! The beach is beautiful and there were plenty of chairs to go around. This resort is huge! Location: Rio Grande is much closer to the excursions than if I had stayed in San Juan. Itâ€™s close the rainforest and Fajardo (Bio Bay and Ferry for Culebra). Itâ€™s about a 40 minute drive East of the city. Itâ€™s a 10 minute drive to the rainforest, and what a beautiful drive it is through El Yunque. Thereâ€™s also an outlet mall nearby if youâ€™re into that sort of thing. Excursions: You can save money by booking excursions yourself rather than go through the hotel. Sample of cost of excursions through the hotel (transportation included â€“ I think): Rainforest Nature Hike $59 Rainforest Horseback Ride $93 Old SJ Historical & Shopping $61 Bacardi & Old SJ $75 Bio Bay Kayak $99 Kayaking and Snorkel Tour $105 Culebra Day Trip & Snorkel $150 Bioluminescent Bay and Snorkeling: I was very happy with my Bio Bay and Culebra tour I booked with kayakingpuertorico.com. The website is easy to use, the tour guides were informative and charming, and they also post pictures from the excursion on Facebook. Bring water shoes for the Bio Bay tour, but you donâ€™t really need one for the snorkeling. The ferry ride to Culebra is 1.5 hours long. I am not prone to seasickness, but I have never felt sicker than on the ferry ride to Culebra. I recommend Dramamine and sitting on the top deck. The ride back was not bad since we were going with the current. The snorkeling was worth the trip! Ziplining: You can make a reservation with these guys: http://yunkezipline.wordpress.com. It was fun and not as physically demanding as I thought it was going to be. In fact, it was quite relaxing to be in the rainforest and enjoyed the slow pace. The meeting point is less than 10 minutes drive from the resort. It would probably cost about $20 to take a cab there, and you would have to call for one to pick you back up. Bacardi Tour: Itâ€™s free! Park at the visitor parking lot, get your 2 free drink vouchers, enjoy some rum drinks, and spend half an hour listening to the history of Bacardi. Pretty good way to start off a day if you ask me. Hipodromo Camarero (Horse Race Track): It was easy to find (about a 20 minute drive from the resort) and there are lots of signs to help you along the way. The track itself is beautiful and nicely kept. Entrance is free and itâ€™s a great place to see the locals. I didnâ€™t see many tourists while I was there. Thereâ€™s a clubhouse upstairs that gives you a great view of the track and it also has a bar and a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We aren't that picky but...very poor service, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pmaria2
Reviews.Content: I can't figure out why the other raters mostly wrote glowing reviews of this resort.! As I said, we aren't that picky but when you advertise excellence, you should provide something close to it. The biggest problem was poor service--staff just didn't seem to care. No one answered at the concierge desk, they tried only to sell very overpriced tour packages instead of helping, staff busy chatting with each other, inconsistent hot water--none sometimes, less than spotless rooms, no free internet inspite of their ads to the contrary, restaurants closed without notice (Friday night????), being ignored by the host/hostess when trying to get a table, waiting a long time for very overpriced drinks at pool side, fire alarm going off three times in one evening directing us (and parents with sleepy children) to the lobby in pajamas (no one cared or explained), highly overpriced everything including parking, inconsistent food quality...our tour guide and outside restaurant staff told us they hear bad reviews all the time since Wyndham took over. We liked Puerto Rico but wouldn't go back to the Rio Mar. There are lots of better places to go where they care about service. If you go to PR, stay near Old San Juan instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort. Decent value.”
Reviews.Author: lawfive
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Rio Mar. I can't wait to go back. I did read a lot of the reviews on here, and so I had my guard up. I'll try to comment on a few as I go. Cleanliness: Perfect. The housekeepers did an excellent job every day, and the grounds were in top shape. No complaints here. Service: Everyone that worked there was super friendly. With few exceptions, the staff offered a "good morning" or "good afternoon", and asked if there was anything I needed. The only exception to this, strangly, was in the casino. The pit boss was friendly, but most of the dealers just wanted to do their job and that was about it. No real complaints though: they weren't mean. They just didn't want to socialize. Perhaps English was not their first language? Location: A bit far from the airport, but not horrible. It is secluded, which is nice, and right across the street from the rainforest. The resort itself is right on the ocean, so you can't beat that. Value: The rooms are not that expensive. But everything else is. Tip #1: If you are coming from the continental US, stop at the duty free shop and pick up some alcohol before getting to the resort. That will save you tons of money. They have plenty of mixer-type drinks at the gift shop and around, so just get that and mix. The food onsite is good. I enjoyed the coffee shop outside of the casino and their restaurants. But again, they are expensive, but if you know that going in and factor it into your cost, I suspect the deal you get with the room rates makes up for it. So that's why I said "Decent Value". Rooms: We had a rainforest view, which was pretty good. I suspect the ocean view rooms were outstanding. No microwaves or fridge, but not that big of a deal. Big bathrooms. Quiet rooms. Sleep Quality: Slept like a baby every night. Caveat: I spent every night at the casino, so was plenty tired when I went to bed. A few other things to note: The casino: Offers Blackjack, Roulette, 3 Card Poker, Texas Holdem, slots and video poker. The Blackjack is pretty good. 3:2 on blackjack, dealer stays on any 17. During the day, the minimum bet is $5, but they raise it to $10 after the sun sets. Roulette is $2 minimum all day and night. Holdem...they had a wait list the one night for 2/5 no limit cash. I can't imagine they can find 10 people to play that on a given night. 3 card poker is $5 all the time. I suspect the slots have horrible return. However, FREE DRINKS if you are gambling. I was pleasantly suprised by this. This place is a nice way to wind down a busy day of fun in the sun. Tip #2: if you are playing a lot there - sign up for a players card. Each day you are there, they will give you a $10 matchplay. All you need is the card and to simply ask for it. The pool: Tip #3: If you love lounging pool side and will spend the day there, get a cabana. They are $100 (or $75 if you have the 25% discount card). This seems high, but it comes with a bucket of snacks (chips, cookies) and a cooler of water and juices. Given how high the food/drink prices are, this almost pays for itself. The ocean: take a walk down the beach and head east (turn right out of the resort). There is a river that bends into the rainforest. It is perfect for pictures with the rainforest in the background. Worth exploring. Speaking of the rainforest - it is right across the street and worth exploring if you have the time. I believe there is a shuttle from the resort, but if you have a car it is super easy.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable bargain”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniYA
Reviews.Content: 4 nights with air for $499 ea from BWI was a fantastic deal. Only word of caution is be sure to rent your own vehicle. Buy your booze before getting to the resort, and eat your meals off site. Pool is great. Beach is very nice. Rooms are spacious and very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: Sydophie
Reviews.Content: Got this property through Priceline for $105. Got an amazing ocean front room with a view to die for. The ground were beautiful and had a great time on their beach. The food and beverages on the property are expensive so would recommend stopping at a grocery store before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: Desiree626
Reviews.Content: Husband and I just got back (February 4-11, 2011). Had an Oceanfront Jr. Suite--would definitely do this again. Upgraded us to the suite for no additional money as our room wasn't ready and they forgot to call us when it was (due to a large group of conference attendees checking in). We did not have water one day, but we had a trip scheduled to Old San Juan (luckily we took showers the night before). Not their fault as a pipe broke, but an inconvencience for sure. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Not sure why people think there's a lot of noise, we slept very well. Clean room, comfortable bed. Restaurants pricey, but we only ate at the tiki bar (first day) and had the breakfast buffet twice. Plenty of good places in the area, but a car is a must. Glad I read that here at Trip Advisor before we went. As to Puerto Rico in general--lovely country, lovely weather (wish I could have taken that home), friendly people, terrible driving habits and traffic! Wish I was there now......

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, over rated and under serviced”
Reviews.Author: bob_in_phuket
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 5 nights, but that was enough to establish that this hotel does not live up to its promotional material. First room the TV didnt work and they had placed me above the generator, basically preventing any peace and tranquility as offered by their phone holding service. Another annoying factor was being placed on hold by reception for over 20 minutes. Eventually they changed my room and upgraded me, which I appreciated however there was no mini bar or fridge and when I asked reception about this they said a fridge was available to rent.

Reviews.Title: “romantic tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: pinlow
Reviews.Content: Palm trees, rain forest jungle,powder sand, turquiose water, foam waves and miles of beach to walk on. We found this location similiar to Hawaii beaches. The hotel is old but maintained and with some updates, like flat screen TV's and granite counters. The food prices are high in the specialty restaurants and the food is hit and miss. Our best meal was at the Italian restaurant.The Cafe was more reasonable and offered good breakfast and lunches. There are snacks and drinks in the gift shop too. The grounds and pools are very nice but we went for the beach and were not disappointed. It was sunny with a good breeze off the water every day. The rainforest makes a beautiful backdrop to the hotel. Other guest spoke highly of the rainforest tours and the bio bay tour. Neither accomodates the disabled, so I could not go. We are retired, if you are looking for nightlife, this location is too remote. There are water sports, golf, casino, spa and kids play area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, lovely grounds”
Reviews.Author: Brendabruin
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar is close to all of the outdoor adventures activities available in eastern PR including Biobay, El Yunque, and the small islands of Vieques and Culebra. It is a grand hotel with many rooms and even condos, a golf course, and many restaurants. I agree with most users that the restaurants are pricey! More interestingly though they cater to american taste so there is a steakhouse, sushi restaurant, and italian restaurant. Considering how much the entrees were, I did not feel the need to try them as I am sure they are not close to being as good as the restaurants back home. I did however have a meal at the tiki bar- a burger and it was good but not extraoridinary. Definitely rent a car if you stay here as just the shuttle ride to and from the hotel will cost as much as a car rental. Only thing with a car is that you have to pay for parking at the hotel. Considering how much land the resort is on, it is surprising how limited their parking is. A car is must for any of the adventures as you must drive to the locations. The hotel itself is 45min drive from the airport in San Juan. The room itself was clean with a tile floor. The bathroom was spacious and clean although the tub was stained. Our room had a small balcony and a view of the beach. I would not recommend opening the sliding door for long periods of time as it allows the warn HUMID PR air to condense in your room. Not a good idea! The beds were comfortable and the room nicely decorated. The resort has several pools and two jacuzzi. One adult only pool, and an activity pool for the family. The activity pool includes a waterslide which the children loved and a volleyball net. Right outside of the pool area is the beach with plenty of lounge chairs for enjoying the beach. The tiki bar is nice also and can make you all kinds of drinks plus order you some food for lunch. Overall I enjoyed my stay here during my visit to Puerto RIco!

Reviews.Title: “A good trip”
Reviews.Author: jlukose1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice hotel to go with kids. First the Pros: 1. If you don't want, you don't have have to leave the resort. They have everything you need. i.e. resturant, casino, entertaiment (live band) until midnight, Tennis court, Golf, wartersport. 2. The resort is beautiful so you can easily spen few (3) days just exploring the resort. Cons: 1. As all the reviewers said, it is expensive. I was not taken back by that because I expected it to be expensive. 2. If you plan on leaving the resort a Car is a must. You are in the middle of nowhere. Its a good 5 minute car ride to the front door of the hotel to the main street where you could find something. What we did.....we just hung out in the resort. We brought our own liquor (all though we bought some from the tiki bar, Mojito is phenominal), Go with an open mind and you will enjoy. If you have high maintanance then go somewhere else. Its only a 3 star hotel eventhoug everywhere they say its 4 star. We didn't have a proble with this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gottaloveit83
Reviews.Content: We looked at a lot of reviews on this resort before we decided to stay here. Yes, the food is expensive, so either plan on spending the money or stop by a store. We took the advice of others and bought a styrofoam cooler for $1.50 and used the hotel ice to keep a few items cold, everything else was fine at room temperature. We stayed for a week and we visited the store twice. We did have a car however, so that may be a serious consideration. We spent $100 on the car for 7 days and we probably would have spent that eating two of the cheapest meals at the hotel (for the 2 of us.) We ate dinner most nights in the kiosks about 2 miles down highway 3 or in Fajardo which is only 15-20 minutes away. You do have to pay for parking as well though. Our room was very clean and in very good shape. The only complaint is that there is no ventilation fan in the bathroom so if you take a shower you can't use a mirror for 30 minutes, not a big deal. The staff was all very friendly. We did get asked once or twice by the staff if we wanted to attend a Wyndham rewards seminar but they were very polite and not pushy. We politely declined. We asked for additional chairs for our balcony which seemed to exasperate the front desk a bit, but the chairs showed up in our room no more than 15 minutes later. The beach was great. They groomed it every morning and kept it clean. They had plenty of chairs and umbrellas and even though the hotel was sold out the beach had plenty of room. You could walk 50 feet up or down the beach either direction and have it all to yourself. It's not a good snorkeling beach but is great for just enjoying a beach and playing around in the water. Overall we were very happy with our choice and would highly recommend this, especially if you can get a good package deal or a discount on the hotel like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Flit_Wing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights escaping from snow and ice in the northern hemisphere. The hotel is not intimate but with a kiosk and a small store it stocks lots of essentials. Our room was spacious - not high end but very adequate for a tropical beach resort. We had a small balcony, a sitting area, no carpet (sand) and comfortable large bed. once the A/c was off it was really pleasant. Happily no bedbugs. The location on a long stretch of North facing beach is very nice if you like to swim in the salt water. There was enough action to body surf and surf. For some reason the hotels or condos nearby seemed empty and deserted but the upshot is that the beach is very unpopulated and the walks along the shore in the afternoon were very quiet. The staff at the hotel were friendly if not always informed. We generally ate at the hotel and found the food nice for dinner. Breakfast was okay. It was expensive but easy. We ate lunch off site twice at two diners our cab driver recommended and took us too. He waited while we ate and the cost is minimal. For such a large hotel we were not bothered by noise (5th floor room of 6 floors) but we don't live in the country. The tree frogs and surf were lovely to listen to. The wind kept the mosquitos from appearing though I doubt anyone can count on that. The hotel can arrange activities or you can do it on your own. We snorkeled through Mini Boat Adventures which was not offered by the hotel. It was less expensive than the catamaran cruise that the hotel offered. We motored our own small boat. There was one other boat of 4 and two guides, Winnick and Juan, (each with boat). These pontoons really moved and the limiting factor was really the surf which made it a wild ride at high speeds. My 12 year old was allowed to drive so that was a thrill for him. The guides were very kind, not too silly, and they knew a lot about the local fish, coral, ecosystems and islands and were very informative it anyone was interested. We hired a taxi driver, Israel, to take us to some of the attractions. +41 44919 8300. He was inexpensive and helpful and found us a guide for the National Rainforest, el Yunque, so we could visit at our own pace. If we visit again we will call him to meet us at the airport. We took the airport shuttle and it was the same price. Still, it is convenient. If you need or want to go to Walgreens or the market, Israel can get you there and back for about $30 - 35 dollars and will wait an hour. Through the hotel my son took a surf lesson and the instructor was great. He did not rush the lesson and offered that we all use his boards until he needed them again. We never swam in the pools because the ocean was such fun. With no connecting flights and no need for a car it was very easy to arrange this trip and minimize travel stress.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort with decent prices.”
Reviews.Author: Tumor723
Reviews.Content: Don't pay the regular hotel rates for rooms. Big discounts to be had through many places. The entire experience at this hotel was favorable and we enjoyed eating in the restaurants. Service in the restaurants was excellent, as was the front desk staff. The concierge desk was disappointing, not helpful or friendly. Only downside we can think of is the cleaning of the rooms. Not done very well and no attention to detail. Even with that said, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a bad hotel...plain and simple.”
Reviews.Author: regatta240
Reviews.Content: When you arrive, it looks very nice. The grounds are lush and surrounded by time shares, condos a golf courses. The entrance and lobby are spacious and decorated in a classic Spanish style - tiles floors, marble, stucco - very welcoming. It all pretty much stops there. Like other reviews mentioned the condition of our room was pathetic. The ceiling in the bathroom was falling in and looked as if my 9 year old son attempted to repair it. There is no exhaust fan in the bathroom so the room becomes full of steam and 'muggy' on day one. Opening the balcony door helps, but when it is hot outside you don't want that door open. The decorative pillows on our bed had some sort of liquid stain on all of them I convinced myself it was a water stain but was still grossed out. The sheets had stains on them, and it took multiple requests to have them replaced. As well the walls are paper thin. They seemed especially thin with 'frisky' neighbors - that was a real drag. The Food and Beverage service was a joke. Drinks anyplace on the property were $11+. Food was way expensive. Burgers and sandwiches were running $14 - $14 and the $10 appetizer were so small I was left wondering how they tasted. In one instance my ordered nacho chips and cheese to dip. We had to send it back 3 times because they could not figure out how to heat up the cheese. We were fortunate to have a car to go elsewhere to eat. We made plans in San Juan and Fajardo. Without this ability to to leave the hotel I cannot imagine how much we would have spent in Food and Beverage. We, as did many many, others, went to Walmart got a small disposable cooler, water, snack and beer. One case of Madella at Walmart = 2 Madella's at the pool. Many times when trying to leave the garage I had to wait for some one to come take my ticket and open the gate. One time the guy was washing his car and I suppose wanted to finish a side before letting out. I watched him for 5 minutes while he ignore me. Across the board the staff did not seem angry, grumpy and irritated. They did, however, seem like that just did not care. If they felt like it they would help, but in general they did not want to be bothered. Beware of being invited to the Wyndham VIP Club on the top floor. It is a timeshare sales presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ardenl
Reviews.Content: We went for a five day getaway to escape the wicked snowy winter this year. The resort is well managed; the staff is friendly and competent; the beach is wonderful for body-boarding and walking; the pool (separate one for adults--hooray!) and jacuzzi are well landscaped. The restaurants on site offered a good variety in menus. It would be a plus if the hotel had one modestly priced bistro for breakfast & lunch, besides the snack bar by the casino. If you have a car, there are alternatives to eating totally on site. If not, be prepared to be extravagant. To avoid every drink being $10+, I would recommend a bottle packed in a bubble wrap style bag for your suitcase, or buying a bottle at the San Juan airport so you can have a cocktail in your room. The hotel gift shop also has a limited offering of alcohol which is more modestly priced than the Tiki Bar. by the pool. All in all, a great vacation place, with no worries about security. The ocean golf course was challenging enough but not as attractively landscaped as other courses my husband has played on; more flowering shrubs should be added. We would recommend this resort and would return for another winter break.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great beach- BYOB and food!”
Reviews.Author: curlytb
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is friendly, rooms are comfortable, beach is huge- plenty of space for everyone, and plenty of chairs and umbrellas. the sand wasn't the prettiest, but a beach is a beach, and this one was really nice- no rocks, no garbage, no one hassling you to buy anything, plenty of space to spread out. I agree with other readers that the food and the drinks are wildly overpriced, but we managed. Some days we got the cold buffet for breakfast and made sandwiches we could eat at lunchtime, which makes the price worth it. We had a pretty unimpressive lunch at the beachside bar one day, but we didn't eat at any of the other hotel restaurants. Drinks at the beachside bar are about $3 more than the bar inside the hotel, so we bought most of our own alcohol at a grocery store and brought it to the beach. You also need to rent a refrigerator for your room for $10/day, but they didn't end up charging us for that. Highly recommend renting a car so you don't have to pay for the expensive but unremarkable food, and so you can explore on your own! the hotel has an iguana habitat which is pretty cool- feeding the iguanas is supposed to be a kids activity, but my friends and I participated, and all thought it was one of the highlights of our hotel time. Overall, this is a great property if you get a deal on your rooms. Definitely worth the extra money for an Ocean view, but can't see how there'd be much of a difference between "ocean view" and "ocean front". I would have been disappointed if we'd been stuck on the property all week, so definitely rent a car! Restaurants in the area to try: There is a place a little farther up the hill from Richie's, which is quieter and has more local food, as well as amazing fresh seafood at half the price and twice the local ambience of Richies. The antojitos place down the hill is not bad for breakfast. Best meals were at a restaurant called Calizo in Fajardo (upscale seafood, outdoor seating), Agua Viva (in Old San Juan) and Hacienda Caravali, which is just down the street. Great food, great service, and we even convinced them to let us do night time go carting after dinner! Don't miss this place- very cute. Activities- El Yunque, definitely go to the Kiosko beach (Luquillo) for tasty Puerto Rican snacks, and fresh coconut water served in the coconut with a straw. Also, kayaking in the bioluminescent bay in Fajardo was a once in a lifetime experience. Must see! Solid hotel- nice staff, clean rooms, nice exterior landscaping, good beach and pool amenities-towels, beach chairs, umbrellas all included (they say the hotel pool closes at 6pm, but we went in the pool and hot tub every night, and the staff didn't mind at all). We felt a little nickle-and-dimed by all the extra charges for fridge, drinks, parking, etc... but it was still a good time. I'd recommend to others, but make sure to consider all the info above!

Reviews.Title: “The owners of this resort do not seem to be investing in either the property or its people”
Reviews.Author: GJRiles
Reviews.Content: Second time being here in 3 yrs. We were here for a work recognition event. I can not recall being disappointed with the facility and staff on my first visit. This time around many of us commented on the poor quality of hotel and its staff. Many of us had problems checking in. Our room wasn;t ready and when it was, neither key worked. Not a big deal but after waiting 3 hours for the room and then not being able to get right in you would have expected at least a brief "I'm Sorry". Another couple we were with were given keys to another guests room. The room itself was quite spacious but seemed very barren. Little decor and a lot of empty space. With a little small touches our room could have been AMAZING. Being on a business related trip we tried to connect up to the internet to take care of a few things back at the office. We knew that there was a charge to use the internet (which was a little surprising) but were willing to pay as we needed to get online. After trying to follow directions to log on with no success we called the front desk and they told us our room did not have internet service. After follow up questions I learned that our room normally have internet service but it is down in a few sections of the building. Again, no apologies or solution. One night 20 of us traveled the 45 minutes to Old San juan for Dinner to find out that the reservations that the concierge made for us prior to arrival at the resort were canceled by the same concierge a couple hours before we arrived??? Again to explaination or apology. Concierge and the Tour operator (Dragonfly Tours) the hotel uses were useless. Workout facility was small without dated, rusty equipment. Location of resort was quite remote. Could be good or bad depending on your desires. On a positive, the weather was good, nice big beach, pools were decent. Food was pretty good but watch out for prices. VERY expensive. $13 for a glass of Cab that we can by a bottle for at home for the same price. Overall, if I were to ever return to Puerto Rico, it would not be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not so great service”
Reviews.Author: megaverett
Reviews.Content: The location and beach are wonderful. The service not so much. We were supposed to have an ocean view, yet we were on the bottom floor, with a view of the umbrella. When I complained to the hotel they said that there was error in the reservation. I knew nothing about this. They said I should have requested a room change, but at no time did I even know this was a possibility. We had breakfast vouchers for the buffet. We were charged a gratuity automatically, of 15%. Not once did my coffee get refilled so when I complained they apologized profusely and sent all sorts of things to the room. This however was not the point. The point was we were getting charged for the service we were receiving but not receiving it. I did not complain to get something for nothing. I was being honest in letting them know that there was a problem. They kept apologizing and offered to buy us dinner but I did not expect this or accept it. The food was very expensive and there was really no where else to eat without taking a cab. The cab was $75 to San Juan and $15 to the nearby restaurants. (Unless of course, there were 10 of you. Then it was $3 per person, $30 each way. It was about a one mile drive. When I asked about it they said that the fees were different for the hotel guests. The halls of the hotel (Carpeted areas) were very dirty. Filthy actually and the rooms were not very clean. Mold in the bathroom etc.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Hotel, Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: leelabeela530
Reviews.Content: We thought we were getting a deal because of the food and beverage credit and free days included in our "package" and we were totally wrong. This used to be a Westin hotel and apparently at one time was very nice, but it is now a Wyndham and has changed management MANY times in the last few years and it is not what it seems. They gave my boyfriend's personal information to other guests without our consent so that we could give some strangers "a ride" to their next excursion. Several of the staff are rude. Every day our key cards stopped working and they were annoyed that we kept needing new ones to be made. They pretty much rape you pricewise every chance they get - food, drinks, activities etc. Apparently a crappy Sysco foodservice breakfast is worth $55 for 2 people to them.
