The beach was very pretty, but the concierge warned us that it was not safe to go out there at night because "it is surrounded by 2 towns and you should beware of locals". Funny, come daylight all I saw were other resorts surrounding it. I think he was trying to convince us to go back inside and pay ridiculous prices for drinks. The walls are paper thin and we could here every word of the conversation that our neighbors were having when they were simply talking. Do not go here unless you are lazy and all you want to do is sit by the pool and you like to be ripped off. We should have gone to a bed and breakfast. We loved Puerto Rico, it was beautiful, the locals were very friendly and helpful but this hotel SUCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Cant put Lipstick On A Pig!”
Reviews.Author: Selmurphy2
Reviews.Content: Coming from 2 feet of snow, anything would be great, so I thought. We checked in and ask to be "upgraded" to an ocean front room, don't bother! Our room. 2 queens, at an additional$150 a night is outdated, musty and dirty. We are here for 4 days and after our first day will change hotels. The amount of money for food and drinks is so over the top for the relic of a resort that I will say save your money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel tainted by absurdly high food & beverage prices”
Reviews.Author: princetontraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel recommended by a colleague of my wife. It's about a 45 minute cab ride from San Juan, located near the rain forest and right on the water. Hotel is quite large and apparently caters to business meetings. Perhaps the above ratings are too harsh but we were blown away by the prices of meals and drinks. First day we had lunch by the pool - a hamburger and margarita each - and the tab was nearly $80 before tip - seemed a bit steep. Pretty much all the hotel restaurants and bars were the same - very expensive and not so great food. If you choose to stay here be sure to have a car available so you can get out to sample some of the local food and drink. Some obviously experienced travelers brought coolers and snacks purchased off premises to the pool - smart idea when a small bag of chips is $3.50 and a 6.2 oz. beer is $3. On the plus side the staff was very friendly and helpful - if not little too persuasive to attend the time sharing presentation put on by Wyndham resorts. The hotel has all the necessary amenities, the room pricing was fair, the pools were well maintained and quite pleasant, the beaches were also well maintained and just steps from the pool. Once negative was the room was not the cleanest - not dirty by any stretch but things like dust balls on the tile, paint spots on the tile and pretty grungy grout lines gave us pause. All in all, plan your trip well and research this hotel as well as you can and you'll probably end up pretty pleased with your choice. We didn't, hence the lower rating - our bad but we don't set the hotel's pricing policy.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and would still return.....”
Reviews.Author: KittenLori
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and just as good as the last. We arrived at 8pm because of the snow storm in Newark, so we lost a day.. but the good weather made up for it. I prefer Rio Grande over San Juan because I like to explore the island. The Rainforest is less then a mile from the Wyndham, and each time we are in Puerto Rico (this was our 6th) we visit a different waterfall, beach or anything exotic. Plus San Juan is only 30 min if we want to visit the fort or gamble.... The rooms are clean here, (soft towels, mattresses, sheets) the restaurants on sight are very good, (exceptional sushi) but slightly expensive (as is any hotel food) the beach is steps away... there is a great pool with a water-slide for the kids.... there is an adult pool with cushioned loungers... there is an on sight day camp that offers full or half days... They have activities throughout the day like.. a supervised Iguana feeding behind the hotel.. Bingo by the pool....s'more making by the beach... There are waitresses walking around serving drinks and a few places for lunch. They spray every morning for mosquitos.... never see any bugs come to think of it..... and the staff is very friendly.... always a smile... Our son is 8 now, so we visited the bio-bay in Fajardo (20 min drive) and I'm sorry we waited so long to experience it. What an amazing place. Literally anything in the water that moves, glows. My son said it was like a million glow sticks.... The trip to the actual bay is a mile through a beautiful mangrove full of Iguana, frogs etc.... then it opens up to this enormous bay that you can see every star in the sky from... and you can experience this amazing glow. Words really cannot describe if you are a nature type lover.... You can Kayak the trip which was the majority... or there are two boats that are electric motor that fit up to 6 people.. Really a must do ! There is one other place that if you have children or like to experience local flavor... you must try, It is an Ice cream place that f you come down the main road from the hotel and go straight across the light at 3, follow the road around to the right and on the left you will see a beautiful (teak?) wood stand... They have delicious local Ice cream flavors... made with no milk.....(coconut, passion fruit, guava, tamarind etc.) and on Sundays they have shaved ice with syrup, another local treat. I always enjoy my visits here, the only negative is the parking fee, we always rent a car to explore and they charge 25$ a night.....I think that hotel guests should receive a reduced rate. That's all for this trip... next stop St Thomas in March.... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: maythefal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from July 23-25. We were there to celebrate our 10th anniversary, and overall, we enjoyed our weekend, but the hotel does have some issues that need to be dealt with urgently. It was raining very hard on the day of our arrival. We live in Puerto Rico, so we took our own car and opted for self-parking. My husband dropped me off at the entrance, and went to park. As I waited, no fewer than 5 persons slipped and/or fell right at the entrance due to the humidity. Check in was quick and efficient, and the front desk female employee was very friendly and professional. We got to the room, and the room is average size, leaning more towards the small range. El Conquistador Resort has bigger rooms. Since the weather was so bad, we decided to eat at the hotel. We went to Marbella Restaurant, which was buffet style only on that evening. The service was excellent, the employees were very friendly and efficient, and the food was exceptional. The cost for two persons, with drinks and tax, came out to be $71. We had breakfast there the next day, and paid $23 per person, but the breakfast was not as good, and it was packed. The service was also not as good as for dinner, although that might have been due to the amount of customers. The resort is nicely decorated, and has all the appropriate amenities required of a resort. The pools look good, although I did not use them. The beach is beautiful! In this aspect, this hotel is better than El Conquistador, since everything is right there (no need to take a ferry to go to the Beach). The hotel also has a playground for kids. And yes, there are many large iguanas hanging around. Some people find this lovely, but I'm not a huge fan of them, so I steered clear out of their way. The casino is small, but has all the necessary tables and slot machines. I played and won a couple of bucks, which is more than I've ever won anywhere (even in Vegas). The only problem I have with this hotel are the rooms. Rooms need some serious upgrades. The pillows are way too soft, the curtains have mold, the shower had mold, and so did the shower curtain. There was a hole in the ceiling behind the curtains, from where the plaster fell off and it looks awful. The balconies are not cleaned, and the chairs and table are dirty. The bed cover was stained on the inside, and some of the towels had noticeable stains. And these are what I noticed, as I don't go out of my way to look for negative things to complain about. I'm sure that if I had opted to pay closer attention to all details, I would have found additional things. What really is the kicker, though, is the noise. Those walls are paper thin. You can hear conversations from both rooms beside yours and the hallway, can hear the TV, the phone, the shower, the flush of the toilets, you name it. And if you can hear it, they can definitely hear you. My husband is a sound sleeper, and even he would be awaken. In my case, it was worse as I am a very light sleeper. The first day I was rudely awaken by some woman screaming, at 3 in the morning, because she saw a spider in the hallway. The second night, I couldn't go to sleep because the kids in the next room were screaming and playing around. I have kids, so I was being patient. Then the fire alarm went off!! Since the kids had been playing in the hallway as well, my husband called the front desk but no one answered. We leave the room and join the other guests on the emergency exit. And this is where our stay got better. The emergency exit stairs were WET. VERY, VERY WET due to the humidity. No one could hurry, as we were slipping around, and eventually one child fell down some steps. We finally reached the first floor, and started to head towards the parking lot (there are no signs on the stairwell indicating the proper floor to exit from, at least none that I noticed). When we reach the area where we can see the lobby (which is on the third floor, above us at that point), we realized that the lobby bar was in full swing. So there we were, this huge group of guests, most in their sleepwear and all definitely looking as if we had rushed out of our rooms (which we had), and there is another huge group of persons drinking, dancing, talking, and at the Casino. No one at the lobby area had heard the fire alarm. Talk about a major safety risk. My husband grabbed a passing employee, and she had no idea what we were referring to. She contacted security via her radio, and security indicated it was a false alarm, that some kids had indeed pulled it somewhere. The security measures in the hotel are severely lacking. So, yes the hotel is lovely, beautiful beach area, nice pools, etc. BUT, if you choose to stay, be aware that there are some issues that may cause your discomfort. If you can overlook these details, you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: jworm23
Reviews.Content: This resort is really, really beautiful! A true get away from it all experience! The buildings, the grounds, pool areas are all very nice and well kept. We arrived pretty late at night due to a flight delay so we really didn't get to see anything until we woke up and what a suprise it was! We were blown away it was so pretty! It was so nice to be able to look down the beach and not see hotel after hotel lined up, definitely secluded! The room itself was spacious and had a nice large bathroom. The bedding and all of the room decor was very nice and comfortable. The balcony was large and a great place to relax and listen to the coqui at night--they are loud! The pool areas were clean and was really nice having a seperate adult pool area. The main pool with the waterslide was huge. The drinks were spendy but the bar down by the beach was great. The beach was a nice long and wide stretch of soft tan sand with plenty of chairs and umbrellas available. As others have mentioned It is not close to the airport and the driving can be a white knuckled experience to say the least. I definitely was not a fan of driving! The resort is pretty far off the main road and to try to walk to the nearest restaurant would be a minimum 15-20m walk and there are no sidewalks so be cautious of traffic as it is a windy road. If you do have a car and can manage the driving, it is a pretty great location literally a few minutes to the El Yunque forest, 3-4 miles to Luquillo Beach and about 15-20 minutes from Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler4ever_11
Reviews.Content: We read comments on tripadvisor before every trip we book. We read the reviews about this hotel and decided to give it a try. This is my first review of a hotel or any place on tripadvisor. Here are my comments: We rented a minivan and we are glad we did. The hotel is about 45 minutes from the San Juan airport. We went to wal-mart once we got settled in and bought water, chips, beer and lunch meat for the afternoons by the pool. We went to the rainforest one day. It was alright, but I have seen nicer! We did eat a cheeseburger in the park and it was good. Cheeseburger prices at the hotel are $14.00. They are big and good. Cons: We traveled with 2 small children who needed milk and formula to be cold. The first day we got there, we asked for a fridge to be brought up to our room and they put us on a waiting list. We got one 3 days into our trip. It was a little frustrating keeping a styrofoam cooler filled with ice for 3 days. I guess you need to request a fridge before you arrive to ensure you will get one. There are iguanas everywhere by the pool and the last day we were there one bit a lady on her arm. He was trying to get her sandwich. They didn't bother people, but I guess he was hungry! Just be careful. Pros: The resturants were good. Pricey resort food, but worth not having to leave the resort. The sushi was good and I loved the pineapple shrimp stir-fry. We got upgraded to a mountain view room just by asking. My mom got upgraded to an oceanview room for free by tipping the guy $10.00!! It doesn't hurt to ask. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. They leave plenty of towels and coffee in the rooms each day. The service throughout the hotel was good. The cleanliness of the hotel was great. Liquor drinks are between $11-$16 depending on what you drink. Beers are $7 and sodas are $3.50. The casino is small, but they have adequate games and machines. Your drinks are free while you gamble. Internet in your room is $15 a day. If you rent a car, the price to self-park is $15 a day and valet is $20 a day. The gift shop is pricey. If you have a vehicle, you can drive to a few cheaper places. At the bottom of the hill by the resort, there is a convenient store that sells beer, liquor and snacks. There is also a bakery that has wonderful breakfast sandwiches! We went there everyday to avoid resort breakfast prices. We ate at Richies cafe one night, it is above the resort. It was overpriced and the food was not good. I would eat at the resort for dinner. We drove into Old San Juan one evening. The conceirge gave us good driving directions. The hotel is secluded but that is what makes it pretty. The drive into the resort is nice. There are 2 pools, one that is adult only. We stayed at the kids pool which was nice. They have daily activities for kids. Overall, I had a nice vacation and I would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place away from reality!”
Reviews.Author: wenstroud
Reviews.Content: The best advice we received before traveling here is to stop by Walmart and stock up! Food at the hotel was great but quite pricey- drinks at the tiki bar were $12 each... cooler $3 at Walmart! Hotel was great -make sure to go to the end of the beach by the lagoon- a beautiful view- some sand dollars on that end- Go to Hacienda for ATV -through rainforest! Great Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach resort close to the rain forest”
Reviews.Author: divearnd
Reviews.Content: While this resort has some suites most of the rooms are adequately sized hotel rooms. If you want to tour Puerto Rico then rent a car. I found the best pricing with Enterprise. The airport shuttle is too expensive and the shuttle tour pricing was too expensive. The resort is located about 20 - 25 miles East of San Juan just off of PR-3 in Rio Grande. PR-3 is somewhat of a busy road with many traffic lights but as you near the turn off for the Wyndham Rio Mar resort there are good sized road signs. The resort has two pools. One is adult only. Of course there is the beach. Lots of walking/jogging paths. The gym (located on the lower level of the west wing) is in the spa area and is adequate. There is a charge for parking. Self parking, located under the conference center building, is $15.00 per night plus tax. Valet parking runs $20.00 per night plus tax. If you self park then you must take your ticket to the valet desk for validation before you take your car from the lot but this was not as inconvenient as it sounds. At checkout at the end of your stay have the front desk stamp your parking ticket before you go to the valet desk for validation. As mentioned by others the restaurants are expensive. I did not feel that $15.00 or so was too much to pay for a hamburger or wrap at the outside restaurant or the Iguana restaurant at the golf club but the buffet prices at the Marbella were high ($24.00 for breakfast and $7.00 for a pot of coffee). We ate one night at the Palio. Prices there seemed to be comparable to a nice restaurant at home. Just outside the casino is a self-service area with coffee, bagels, donuts, wraps, sandwiches, etc. The sandwich and wrap prices were okay but the rest of the stuff was expensive. At this self-service area a can of soda was $3.50 but just down the hall, at the gift shop, that same can of soda was $1.38! For breakfast we drove out of the resort toward PR-3. Just before the traffic light, on the left, is a fenced in parking lot with a bakery and chinese restaurant. The bakery is not fancy by any means but the donuts and coffee were good. They also serve breakfast sandwiches. If you're into hamburgers there is a Fuddruckers just off the east bound lane of PR-3 near the industrial area mid-way between San Juan and the resort. If heading to or from San Juan and the resort and get tired of PR-3' traffic and lights the jump onto PR-66. This road bypassed much of PR-3 and connects with PR-26 just south of the airport. PR-66 is lightly traveled and does have one $1,50 toll booth. To get to the rain forest from the resort just drive across PR-3, turn right at the gas station and then left at rain forest road sign (PR-191) and head up the mountain. If you drive to Old San Juan then I recommend you get off PR-26 onto PR-1 and drive past the cruise ship piers. Just past the piers, along the Old San Juan wall is a public parking lot. It cost us about $2.00 to park about 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Never again and Do NOT USE VALET PARKING”
Reviews.Author: TDBJR
Reviews.Content: The resort is quite a distance from San Juan so if you want peace and quiet it is great. Room was either too warm or too damp could never seem to get the correct temperature. Returned after day of sightseeing to find our room had not been cleaned. Used their valet parking because I figured it was safer what a MISTAKE. They STOLE my GPS and made no effort to investigate or pay for it. Said it was our fault because we didn't tell them we had one. Would NEVER stay at this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY AT A WYNDHAM RESORT again.”
Reviews.Author: laurenpit
Reviews.Content: This is my first time ever writing a review, mostly because I felt compelled to let everyone know about this hotel. I am a 21 year old business analyst for Deloitte and although I am capable of affording a nice vacation, the people at Rio Mar seemed to think otherwise. Because of my age and the age of the person I was traveling with, we were totally disrespected and disregarded. On two separate occasions (in only a three day span), servers at the restaurants (the Tiki Bar and Marbella) refused to acknowledge us. We sat for over 10 minutes before getting up and walking out since neither restaurant was busy at the time and there were servers who had clearly made eye contact with us. On a third occasion, we were sitting at the Tiki Bar again and we waited 45 minutes for a hamburger and the person who sat down 15 minutes after us got the same exact burger we ordered before us. When we decided to cancel the order because we were so outraged, the woman insisted it was ready so we then waited another 15 minutes. She did give us the burger for free but did not pay the whole bill (which only included one $6.50 10oz beer). RIDICULOUS. And that was only the dining component. But I will not bore you with the details from the rest of our trip. Just imagine how bad the rest was if that was only the food. The worst part is when we finally complained (after we had checked out and paid up), the woman that did a bad job of acting like she cared about what we were saying had the audacity to ask my companion to be quiet (with her finger in the air and all) as she spoke despite the fact we were the one's complaining. Shouldn't she have been listening?? I will say that the property was nice so they have that going for them. But that does not make up for the quality of the service. Last year I stayed at El Conquistador and although that complex lacked a decent beach, the service was impeccable. It is a shame when a resort is incapable of understanding that a dollar is a dollar despite who it is coming from. Never once did I not tip 20% throughout the entire trip, whether it was the cab driver or the server or even the Concierge. The service was so bad that I was often made to feel embarrassed which should never be the case.

Reviews.Title: “Have Fun and Don't Listen to Everyone else”
Reviews.Author: kjzv237
Reviews.Content: The place is great. We had a blast in Puerto Rico. Be smart plan your meals in Fajardo, Rio Grande, and surrounding areas. THe resort is very expensive. RENT A CAR! THe pool is fantastic the place is clean. We enjoyed it very much. We rode around town in a jeep relaxing. If you complain a lot and nothing is ever right then stay home, because nobody wants to wait on you anyway. Go to kyaking puerto rico and do the mini boat trip... best excursion I have ever been on but physical and high impact. Puerto Rico is beautiful and the people are friendly and it is safe.... as long as you aren't stupid.. Just like your neighborhood at home... use common sense. Make a plan before you go and map it out and enjoy life... one day you will be dead and not able to travel, so be prepared and enjoy the rio mar.... I loved it period!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but must have a car.”
Reviews.Author: Travelove_Stp
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful location - nice beach, very close to El Yunque, close to Fajardo & not too far from San Juan, but a rental car is an absolute necessity. Without a rental car we would have felt very trapped on the resort. Everything is overpriced once you're there, and the service is not great. A couple examples - day trips to El Yunque (3 miles away) were $59 per person. We drove up a couple times and there's no entrance fee or charges for anything. This alone paid for our rental car! (although they do charge $15/night for parking at the hotel). Another con - we talked with the concierge about things to do in the area. He was very knowledgeable & helpful, but then went into a spiel about going to a time share breakfast. The actual hotel was gorgeous. We booked an ocean view & I am so happy we did. Our view was fantastic! We spent a lot of time in the mornings drinking coffee & reading on our balcony. It was also great going down to the beach. You can request a couple chairs and a beach umbrella to be set up where you want. Overall, this is a beautiful hotel but I think there could be changes made in their policies to make it more enjoyable. I would recommend it, but only with a car or if you don't mind overpaying on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but very expensive--hidden charges, overpriced resturants”
Reviews.Author: CoCoMcMulley
Reviews.Content: Rio Del Mar is beautiful in it's architecture and grounds. We were blessed enough to have a 7th floor ocean view room so we could keep the balcony door open. We froze on arrival but with A/C turned down as far as possible we were warm enough, no problems with wet floors---like lower floors had and spectacular views--no trees blocking our view. We were also lucky enough to be on the west side which gets most of the sun. The room was spotless and the housekeeping responsive to our requests but the curtain had rips---my only room complaint. For the down side, you are pretty much a captive to overpriced meals and excursions. Take everyones advice and rent a car ahead of time. We caught on pretty fast since I did my homework on this website and followed suggestions offered here. We rented a car on day 2 and kept it until day before we left. We had to pay a $500.00 deposit on the car. And, oh ya, the resort put a $100.00 a night hold on my account so that was a surprising dent in my debit card. No one had mentioned this to me before hand--not cheap caribbean or the resort ($600.00). So there went $1,100.00 of our spending money we had no clue would disappear! Our first dinner when we arrived at the resort was over $60.00 and it was a la carte. Breakfast for just 1 was $22.00 and a lg pot of coffee was $7.00. We started tipping the housekeeper well to get extra coffee. Then we got the car for $65.00 a day from Carabbra and that included insurance. The car only had 2000 miles on it. We went to Walgreens and bought a cooler. Next door was Amigo's supermarket and I bought sandwich and snack stuff including soda. Next to that plaza is the most awesome bakery that also served breakfast and lunch. It's La Parilla and the propietor is very attentive and takes great pride in his bakery. They have the most wonderful desserts and donuts that I've ever see or ate in all my life. It's that good! The other places we really enjoyed were Antojitos at base of hill going to the resort, the kiosks in Luquillo is a must for authentic cuisine also. I recommend Antojitos (not affiliated with other resturant) but awesome. Great fahitas----sizzling when served and the burritos were delicious as were the tacos--al served with a side--we had beans and rice. It's kiosk #23, clean with attentive service. Next door was the Coral Reef #24. I had a 16 oz lobster tail for $30.00. Again, these people take great pride in their food and service. We saved so much in food by going off the resort that it paid for the car many times over. Most meals average $20.00 for 2 and that's for dinner. Lunch is about $15. Breakfast is cheaper. I'd also recommend Don Pepe's but their prices are what you'd pay here. Excellent resturant and service. Stay away from the lobster---it's caribbean, cost $25.00 a pound and they only had a 3 pounder. Research that type of lobster---only tail is edible and cost us $81.00. I had an excellent chicken dish for $15. It's the first right on Rt 3 and an immediate right into resturant. Extremely nice and spotless. We also ate at Martin's BBQ. Great chicken! Also traditional PR food. Less than $20.00 for 2. On the resort--a hot dog is $8.00 and a hamburger is $15.00. No authentic Puerto Rican food. Get off the resort to eat! It's easy to navigate around and you can drive to any attraction at your leisure. Hard to win at the Casino's and the parking is about $16.00 a day. Don't be held captive at the Resort. Enjoy the beauty, pools and ocean then leave and do what you want. Even if you're rich and don't concern yourself with prices--it's still the best way to really see and enjoy Puerto Rico and it's people by renting a car. Taxi's cost a small fortune for the average person. Will we go back? Probably not. We'll book a hotel on a beach, rent a car ahead of time and explore the island on our own. Do we regret it--- no, it was a taste of how the rich live. We are everyday, average people earning over $100,000 a year and found the resort expensive! The sales staff trying to sell a time share (now called a point system)also get quite cold when you don't buy a timeshare on the spot at their presentation but you get $75.00 for attending a 3 hr presentation. My time is worth more than that and I'm not inclined to spend $20,000 on the spot. Rainforest is across the street and there is lots to do. Usually a hugh massive cloud hanging over it. The wind keeps it blowing away from the resort. We didn't venture into Old San Juan because there was a festival that was said to rival Mardi Gras when we were there and we stayed away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been terrible if my company hadn't paid for the trip”
Reviews.Author: WanderHPM
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: do not trust the concierge, do not trust the "shuttle" or executive cab drivers. State what kind of view you want-beach or mountain view, or by default they'll give you the least desirable rooms (view of conference center, next to a noisy stairwell/parking garage). Do your homework before you come if you want to travel in the area, rent a car. Don't trust your bills/tabs, check them closely. The walls are thin, the bath/shower/sink drains are clogged & don't drain, housekeeping isn't consistent, any maintenance is loud & obtrusive. Conference rooms are hot & have bad acoustics. This area has beautiful surroundings, nice beach & pools and the lower level staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Can Be Decieving”
Reviews.Author: RatedRD
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Rio mar certainly looks the part of something great but with the help of some 3 dollar CVS reading glasses you can see a huge corporate pick pocketing. When i first arrived i had to switch rooms twice. The first switch was do to a non locking sliding door (which is not a problem for me but they suggested we move) the next room had female hair all over the floor(that is a problem for me) I had issues with renting a car at the airport so i had to pay to transfer fee to get to the place and then realize that the avis rental car agency at rio mar had jacked up their prices about 50 dollars more per day. of course after i found a better rental agent i had to pay to park my car every day that i stayed in the resort(20 per day). They have a concierge booth to aid in vacation planning and they must get paid on commission because anytime you ask them a question they are trying to force some timeshare seminar down your throat even if you have already registered for it. They attempt to charge 15 dollars a day for internet that is the speed of the internet that my cellphone provides(320kbps). The breakfast buffet lay out that they boast is to die for, and when you die you should leave your remaining assets to the person that has to pick up the check. i personally think 35 dollars is a little to much to pay for breakfast per person. I have money to burn when i go on vacation but i would rather do it using a bic lighter not a flame thrower. I suggest that people when visiting puerto rico rent condos or stay in hotels with breakfast included. people read alot about PR and think that they need to stay inside of a resort and pay 200 per person to golf but in actuality driving and safety in puerto rico is not a worry (especially during the day) you can have a great day without being robbed by a resort that looks the part of 5 stars but has the service of a Walmart(and if you where to get robbed on the street you would probably still save more money then the resort). Its a good thing i know the area or i might be even more disappointed with this place. I couldnt imagine looking at my bill if i had ate every meal at the resort for 5 days. If you find yourself in this place I recommend eating breakfast at Antojitos and using Rio Mar for the only things its good for, the view, the bed, and the Texas hold-em table.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: vahpr
Reviews.Content: I'd read mostly positive reviews here and on Expedia, with a smattering of poor/negative reviews and decided to book the Wyndham based on the predominately positive reviews. I'm glad I did. The grounds are immaculately kept, just beautiful. The service was very friendly and accommodating. Don't know if it's standard practice, but the front desk upgraded us from Ocean View to Ocean Front without my asking. They said they would pre-charge my card $400 (4 days @ $100 p/day) but that never did appear on my statement, just the actual restaurant/beverage charges minus a $100 F&B credit so that was cool. Beautiful view from the room balcony. The king bed was comfortable. My only suggestions on the room would be to include a small fridge and make the AC adjustable for a warmer temp - it was too cold and I couldn't increase the temp so I mostly left it off. Maybe engineering could have assisted - I didn't ask. Restaurants were OK, but pricey as others have observed. Great cheeseburger at the lobby bar but I didn't really care for the Asian restaurant. The breakfast buffet in the more casual place was good ($24 pp) Parking is $15 per day (self park) or $20 valet - I did the valet. The only real bummer was on the last night of the trip I'd either left my camera in the car or put it down in the hotel as I was having my boarding passes printed by the concierge and it got legs and disappeared. 400 photos and videos - gone. So keep your valuables close, don't leave anything in your car. Maybe back-up your images too. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cc0353
Reviews.Content: We got a free upgrade to an oceanview suite - it was great! Room was very clean. Bed was super comfortable. Bath and Body Works "True Blue Spa" products in room. I really didn't notice a mustiness in the room - you are in the tropics people, if you open the balcony door, and it is cold in your room, condensation will occur. I laugh at the fact that people gave this place negative reviews b/c of that. The room was cold when we got there - thermostat was at 60 - so I turned it up to a comfortable 72 and it was fine. We left the balcony door open at night so we could hear the waves and it was AWESOME. On the 2nd day, the maid came and did a great job - even mopped the floor. The 3rd day she must have forgot our room, but when we called the front desk, another maid was there in 5 minutes to clean it. They came to turn down the room every night too. Had to ask for extra soap one night but that is really my only gripe w/ the place! The drinks are expensive ($10) but the "Ziggy Zaggy" is worth it! We also bought the local beer "Medalla" super cheap at a nearby store to save some $. We didn't eat at the resort w/ the exception of snacks/bagels at the snack shop - very reasonably priced. The rest of the time we at off the resort - Antojitos, Don Pepe's, and a bakery that starts w/ and "I" (can't remember the full name) are all right around the corner and have DELICIOUS cheap food. Also the kiosks in Luquillo - 5 minutes away by car. Golfed the Ocean course - $165 each - pretty steep. Course was in good shape and very scenic. Carts are included, and range balls are supposed to be too, although the range was closed when we were there. The casino was fine.....video poker, penny slots, $10 min blackjack, poker, etc. Parking was kind of expensive - $15 /day to self-park. A resort in the middle of nowhere really shouldn't be charging for parking in my opinion. I did like the location - very close to Luquillo, Fajardo, not far from Old San Juan....yet far ENOUGH away to be quiet and relaxing. I thought the beach was great - very clean, sure there was a little undertow from the big waves but nothing I haven't experienced before at any other coastal resort. Plenty of beach chairs available. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: TysonsTraveler8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights over Christmas and I highly recommend it. Of course, they were very full at that time but you would never know it--the service was terrific--both the concierge and the front desk were helpful. We opted for the "mountain view" room instead of paying more for ocean view because we figured that the hotel is on the beach. Meanwhile, the mountain view was terrific--very green. Save your money! It's at an excellent location--has a terrific beach and decent pool(s), but is literally five minutes from the start of El Yunque and only twenty minutes (give or take) to Fajardo (which is where we did the bio bay tour--highly recommend it!). The weather was fantastic the day we came, (thus, we went to the beach as soon as we got there-- chairs and towels on the beach are free to guests). However, the next day, the front came in and it was rainy--which more or less was fine, considering we were touring El Yunque that day. Both days, we skipped the hotel and went to the bakery down the hill from the hotel for breakfast--a cute little place with excellent service. Cheaper and also more authentic than the hotel. For dinner, we had a tip from the concierge for a cute place 10 minutes away--it had "pasta" in the title. It was fun, had only 5 or 6 tables and I think only took cash. Recommend it. The second night, we ate in Fajardo after our bio bay tour. We did have one meal in the hotel--for lunch. It was fine--a pretty restaurant with huge windows. Will note that somehow a bird or two had flown in. Didn't bother us, though. All in all, it was very much an enjoyable experience. I hope I can come back someday

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the blastingly negative reviews, this place is close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: 2rabbit
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was scared to death to go here based on some reviews. I expected the worst and experienced the best. Our room was clean and yes, did get muggy, but that was because we kept our sliding door open part of the day. Once we closed it and turned the AC on, it was comfortable. No mold or mildew as others claimed to experience. The entire resort is clean, down to the daily manicured beach. I wasn't disappointed in the brown sand, as I had done my research and knew that's what it would be. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Although the staff manning the valet parking and taxi station weren't very accommodating and seemed to be put out whenever we needed their assistance. I was forwarned about the cost of food, but was still surprised. We got in around 11:00 pm and had 2 drinks, 2 beers and 2 burgers at the bar and the tab was $84.00! The next day we took a cab to the bottom of the hill and shopped at the store to stock up on milk, bread, juice, cereal, etc. Don't rent a fridge for $10/day, just buy a $5.00 cooler from the store and replenish with ice available on every floor. Our oceanfront room was very nice. Could see and hear the ocean. We were never bothered about attending their sales seminar. The beds are extremely comfortable, although the wall are paper thin. You can hear toilets flushing and showers running all around you. Overall a very enjoyable experience. I won't stay here again only because of the high cost of food and my unwillingness to drive off the resort for less expensive meals.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather find another place closer in to spend my money at”
Reviews.Author: AndreaBeltran
Reviews.Content: Cons: This hotel wasn't as customer friendly as you would expect. Our card keys never worked, which was super annoying and for the amount of money we spent here we would have preferred to stay at a different hotel. One night, our keys didn't work and we couldn't find anyone at the counter to help us out... It was ridiculous. No fridge in the room. The internet is slow and very expensive ($40 for 3 days) Too far from anything such as San Juan... it's a minimum of $40 for a cab ride no farther than 20 minutes out. The cassino looks like a joke... it's very small and just cheap looking (certainly NOT Vegas) Pros: Great view of the beach from our room (6132). The hotel beach here is wonderful! You hear the coqui frogs at night singing (so it feels tropical) and it's a nice view. Their spa was good, I got a deep tissue massage and she was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Facts”
Reviews.Author: katiebee14
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful, the rooms are very nice, clean and well kept. The pool and beach area are great and the grounds provide a spectacular view as well as plenty of space to walk or run outside. There are free computers in the lobby area, but they are VERY slow, many were missing a mouse/not working and don't have printers. There is a separate business center, but you have to pay to use it. The gym is small and equitment is older, but everything is usable and adequate. Parking is about $16 a day including tax. The staff is friendly, BUT the service at any restaurant and bar area is AWFUL. It is extremely, extremely slow - wait time about 45 minutes between ordering and getting food. The food mostly below average and EXTREMELY OVERPRICED. We did not have one single good dining experience at the hotel. Even Palio - food was way oversalted and we noticed many people at other tables were sending their food back. 2 dinners, 2 appetizers, and 2 desserts cost about $175 and not worth the price. Everyone tries to get you to go to the resort presentation - they say it's an hour, it's actually 2 hours if you read the form, and the 'free' stuff they offer for going actually free if you do it on your own 1) Rent a car before you get there - cost through enterprise was $80 for the entire week, if you go through the hotel when you get there they charge you $40 a day. If you use 'dragonfly' to and from airport it is $75 each way. You will need transportation to get anywhere outside the resort. Taxis are VERY VERY expensive. 2) Do not go on any excursions through the hotel. Cost to go to Bacardi tour including 2 drink tickets per person- free, cost through hotel - $79; Cost of rainforest - free ($4 if you stop at information booth to get map etc), cost through hotel $75 3) Try bakery and restaurant down the hill from the resort entrance/exit - better food, at half the price (or even less than half) of what the hotel food will cost you 4) Try the strip of food places (go to bottom of hill, make a left at light, they will be on your left down the road a bit) For the comfort and cleanliness of the hotel, rooms, pool and beach, we liked this resort; but the constant aggrivation with the service, bad food, and overpricing are likely to make us never patronize this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, close to a high 4 star but with spotty quality”
Reviews.Author: goodolympian
Reviews.Content: Go and enjoy it but only if you can get a good deal. Overall it is good but has issues here and there, so you deserve a discount. Pros: 1. Nice resort and beach. 2. Good quality food (but high priced). 3. Friendly staff. 4. Very nice and beautiful reptiles in resort. 5. Fine rooms, relatively roomy but not that luxury. Cons: 1. Not a white sand beach! 2. Very high price food in restaurants 3. Far far from anything! If you don't have a car you are to stay the whole time there and need to eat there. 4. General service is spotty (one day they forgot to put soaps, another day they forgot to put lotion, then they forgot to put tea bags, .... To be said that they always provided them after asking) 5. No fridge in the room. 6. No free internet in rooms. 7. The free internet computers in lobby were broken 3 days out of 4 days I was there!

Reviews.Title: “good for romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: too-err-ist
Reviews.Content: First, the 5 stars: the resort has two great looking golf courses and the treatment extends to all the grounds - you feel like you are staying in a botanical garden! The iguanas are a nice touch. The staff is great, everyone at every level was polite, friendly and efficient. The two pools, family and adult-only, are very nice. The view from the Tiki Bar is great. 4 stars: The beach is maintained and private (although maybe "public"). Nice walks both ways. Sand is not top notch. The lobby and public spaces are very good. 3 stars: the rooms are not so great. Others have described as 'musty' and and I thought how can that be, with tile floors and no carpet. Well the problem is the HVAC unit in each room. Our room was oppressively humid and musty the first night. The next day we complained and the engineer made an adjustment, which helped a lot but still was noticeable. They need an HVAC upgrade. When occupancy is down, they shut the restaurants on a rotating basis. The location is great, depending on what you want. It is very convenient to El Yunque, the Caribbean National Forest (which we loved), and a day trip to the Spanish Virgin Islands or the Lagoon Grande, or Luquillo Beach. But if all you want is San Juan nightlife, then you are better off in SJ. We stopped at El Conquistador, which is bigger - but I would come back to Rio Mar. (And skip Fajardo - it is a dump, despite what the guidebook says.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for relaxation seeking travellers”
Reviews.Author: Imlaris
Reviews.Content: This resort is top 3 on the island you get everything you need without having to step foot outside of the hotel. Perfect for people seeking a big space resort for relaxing and getting some sun. You have a few tourist spots minutes away from the resort, easy short ride via bus or taxi. The rooms are spacious and extremly clean, the lobby and common areas are huge and have several sitting areas to lounge. The food quality es amazing. I ate every night at the Marbella Restaurant casual dinning with a great menu to choose from, that night we had a seafood soup with a seafood paella both plates were extraordinary. Keep in mind though that there is no free parking

Reviews.Title: “Aqua Wave, Oauhu Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: botis626
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. very clean, near the beach. each room has a balcony. Nice staff. I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, but it's not close to San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: terrynkathy
Reviews.Content: Drive onto the grounds and the first impression is "beautiful." Pretty classy looking place entering the lobby, but not stuffy. Staff is very cordial and attentive. Check in is a breeze. we arrived via a very early flight and they allowed us in our room at 8:30 a.m....very rare for a hotel to offer. Complimentary upgrade to an ocean view suite, by my simply asking. Very willing to accomodate us. Room was very large but a little need of new paint and sprucing up. No frig or microwave unless you pay a daily fee for a frig. View was very nice. Palms somewhat blocked the ocean view, but it still was very nice. Very lush and manicured grounds. Adult pool is beautiful with waterfalls and private cabanas (to rent) while the children's pool had a nice waterslide. Outdoors was pretty quiet except at the kids pool area. Nice tiki bar and fire pit ( fire pit is not in use except weekends. Food and drinks are expensive. About 10-12.00 for a drink. Casino area is loud but you don't hear it from room or lobby. Very nice gift shop and again staff is very friendly. They have tours available at the concierge for the area. We stayed one night prior to cruise and two nights after the cruise. We will return to this hotel next year. Pay and valet parking. Good covered garage, with security. Real pretty place for a wedding. Didn't really mind the resort or parking fee, just comes with the fluff these kind of places add on. Did not use restaurants or bars. Need to rent a car in my opinion or you are stuck. Taxi's are more than a car rental for the day! Nice driving trip to the resort from the airport, just get good directions and watch out for the drivers! Locals are in a hurry, honk their horns ALOT, drive in the center of lane markers, turn right from a left lane and it goes on and on! Don't be that alarmed, just be on your toes!!! We ended up laughing a lot about it, during and after our trip. California and New York Cabby's have nothing on the P.R. drivers! El Yunque Rain Forest is really close. No charge to drive the rain forest. Take the drive, it may only be about 2 miles from the resort to start your drive and many stops along the way to see what the forest has to offer. I would personally skip the visitors center, anti-climactic, but the 8-10.00 visitors center entrance fee does help keep the place going. Nice gift shop as well. There are also gift shops and a couple snack bars and restaurants along side the road. I can see how a picnic lunch would be fun. The drive and stops take about an hour. You can see a lot from the side of the road and pull outs without having to hike around. From the hotel, you can get to restaurants, mall, fast food, K-Mart/Wal-Mart within 15 minutes. You feel so much freer if you have a car there. We rented from Charlie's. I hear it is one of the most recommended rental agencies from US travelers. We had a good experience. They have a few locations, and they will take or pick you up from the cruise ports and airport...at least they did for us at no additional fee. Feel free to contact me with any questions, and I have some photos.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel- But Wyndham loves construction!”
Reviews.Author: ShoeGirl912
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar for a week back in May 2010. It was a wonderful stay with everything we needed pretty much right there. The pools were clean and well kept, the rooms were very clean, the grounds were beautiful. We golfed and had a great time, especially with the awesome iguanas everywhere! They have no fear. The dive from the palms into the pools! As far as eating/drinking.... The sushi place on the first floor is VERY good- I recommend the Black and Blue Roll. Fantastic! If you are looking for a drink, go off grounds. You will have 6 to 8 drinks and not feel a thing... Less than cough syrup on the alcohol content. Go to the corner market, get a 10 pack of Medella or a bottle of Bacardi and enjoy making your own drinks in your room! For FABULOUS food, go to Los Kioskos and eat at any of the #'d spots. The food and service are incredible all along that strip! Once we found the kiosks we never went anywhere else. The only complaint I had regarding our room was the fact that we were right above the spa...which was under construction, so at 5 and 6am every morning it was banging and crashing noise that would wake us up. Also parking is a PAIN IN THE BUTT! Every day you have to get your ticket validated before you leave the garage- validation is in the opposite direction of the garage depending on where your room is... "Insert the ticket"... ugh! That will be stuck in your head the entire trip! Although it made for some great laughs. ***NOTE TO ALL PEOPLE ATTENDING THE RAIN FORREST.... even tennis shoes/ running shoes etc will allow you to slip and bust your butt in the rain forrest!***

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sewebster
Reviews.Content: We went over Xmas with 3 families with a total of 7 kids...the youngest being 8 months. We had a fantastic time! The hotel and food is expensive but totally worth it. Oceanview rooms are not really "oceanview" but the rooms are comfortable. We had two kids and a crib in our room and it was fine. Friendly service, we felt safe with 6 kids running around. Tips- 1. Rent a car 2. Prilla restrauant - GREAT food and views 3. Grab lawnchairs in the morning 4. Ask frontdesk about movie nights and WI games in the hotel. We heard something about that the last day. 5. Go to Amigo store and fill up on drinks and food. We drank our own alcohol the entire time and didn't spend one dime on drinks. 6. Rainforest - bring raingear 7. Careful with the waves (depending on time). My family are strong swimmers and had a couple of scary times. 8. Iguanna Pub - great food and right on location I highly reccomend this place. We had a great time and going to start doing this annually. If you find a wedding ring on the beach please return to hotel. A strong wave took it right off her hand.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: jones60745
Reviews.Content: Service and the staff were very good. The hotel and grounds were clean and well kept. There was the only good things about this resort. The room was clean. It was a confortable size. No control of the room temperature and was far too cold. Also, refrigerators in the room were not standard. There is a daily rental fee for a refrigerator. No newspaper or bottled water were provided. The internet service was horrible. There are five desktop computers available for free use in the lobby. Of the 5 only 3 were functional. And on the computers the internet was incredibly slow. I paid to have wireless internet for the room which was expensive and the interent was too slow to get any work done productively. It was a waste of money. Though there are a number of restaurant options on the resort, all of the food is the same, overpriced, and bad. It was only made tolerable by excessive drinking of overpriced alcohol. The resort is also so remote that without a car it requires a minimum of a $40 cab ride to the nearest decent restaurant. The resort offered no evening activities which left one to again consume overpriced alcohol in at the lobby bar or go to the tiny, tacky casino. The location of the resort is terrible. It is about 45 minutes from San Juan and the airport. It makes one feel trapped. Leaving the resort itself would be an uncomfortably long walk and once off the resort the area is not very pleasant. The only redeeming quality about this location is that it is close to El Yunque rainforest. The gym was merely adequate. It was too small for the number of guest at the resort and machines were broken. The beach is very nice and the hotel has two pools. The beach and pool areas are both clean and well maintained. Great for golfers; there are 2 18-hole golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: summervac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Christmas week The weather was not great-there was a lot of rain and clouds. I know people on this forum said that this hotel's proximity to the rain forest doesn't affect the weather but I still do wonder. We had a good time but probably if the weather had been better we would have enjoyed it more. Nice Hotel-This hotel is very pretty. Actually I thought it was nicer than the pictures! The food was expensive at the hotel restaurants, which I expected, but $4.50 for a soda at the snack bar was a bit much considering the area where the hotel is located. However, I thought the quality of the food was very good. But--While we enjoyed the food at restaurants nearby the hotel, many of the spots we drove to were filled with vacant and boarded-up homes/buildings. We did not walk around at night. In addition, the hotel has a pool for adults and a pool for children. At first the free roaming iguanas were a novelty. However, after 3-4 of them congregated at the adult pool daily and dove in whenever they choose my family had had enough of them. I'm not sure if I would go back . If I did I would stay only a few days and would likely stay on the hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “nice...but not a great value.”
Reviews.Author: Doug099
Reviews.Content: Room was a little dated...could use a fan to suck out humid air in bathroom. Every time we took a shower, the whole room became humid. The air system needs a "fan on all the time" switch. At night, it was hot or not...no in between. People were nice and helpful at front desk and conceirge. Beach was tons of fun because of the great surf...like being in a constant wave pool. NOT for young kids. Beach in front of hotel was clean...but not to the East...filthy. Food was expensive...but alcholic beverages were off the charts expensive. Enjoyed the casino...and they had poker on some nights. Only two poker machines in whole place though. I would advise to rent a car and get out at night. Bioluminescent Kayak tour was the huge highlight of the trip....if you go...you gotta do it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware-Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: hundinger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is way past its prime and overpriced. Its best years are behind it. Food is expensive and average. At $10.50 per drink you'll lose less in their small casino. They guide everyone to La Hacienda and La Parilla. I could hear the sounds from the bathroom in the room next to me, not the most appealing sound at 2:00am, flushing is one thing but the actual sounds I found unappealing. Room was cold for 2 days before it could be fixed. Nothing to do at night, you need to leave for action and if you are not familiar with PR then you have trouble. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, when I stayed a few years back it was much better, it has gone downhill. Beware! The room below me was smoking on the balcony and it drifted up to my balcony so I could not even stay on the balcony when they were out smoking. Weather was not good-not their fault. Food selection is way overpriced and not good. I do not know who would stay here anymore, I won't.

Reviews.Title: “Boring no day or night activities. Overpriced go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Assyrian
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the hotel. No day activities bingo is the highlight for the kids no night activities 2 days without tv or hi fi. A drink is over 10 dollars a sad casino a man playing a piano in the lobby is the most creative thing that this management can think of.

Reviews.Title: “outdated and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sistarae
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a relaxing resort, beach and golf experience in Puerto Rico, this isn't it. The beach is filthy, with trash everywhere. The hotel overall is outdated and overpriced. Our room was small, and our "ocean view" was blocked by a large palm tree. The air system would only cool, so it was either freezing or hot and muggy. There always seemed to be a fan or water running in the pipes of our walls, so there was constant white noise. Also, every time our neighbors flushed the toilet or took a shower, we could hear it very loudly in our room. Our sheets had dirt and hair on them even after we asked housekeeping to change them two days in a row. This was improved after we spoke to management. The television signal went out several times. I'm not sure if this was resort-wide or just in our room. They charge $14.99 PER DAY for internet, which is ridiculous given the $300 per night price tag. The golf course isn't bad, just very wet. Many places were underwater. They told us at the golf club that this was actually a drier month than usual (December 2010). I'd hate to see it during a "normal" wet month! They do have great technology on the golf carts, with digital maps, score card, tips, and a call button for the snack cart. They seem to cater a lot to children and families, so perhaps that experience may be more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Way too overpriced. Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: theraps
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are not a huge golf fan and don't play often, don't even consider this place. The tennis clinic was just for one hour in the morning for all levels and there is only one pro to take lessons with. If you're interested in tennis, go to Club Med. There is no lifeguard at either the beach or pools so you always have to be watching if you're traveling with children. The pools are small and overcrowded, even though there aren't many people. The restaurants have halfway decent food, but are way way way way way too overpriced. I got a club sandwich at Marbella (their cheapest restaurant) and it was $17. It wasn't even that good. Half of a grapefruit is $7. And the restaurants aren't the only thing that is expensive. Parking tops $15 a day. Oh, and even if you play golf, one round is $200, plus all the fees. Massages top $200 too, and is they say it's a 50 min massage, it's actually 40. The staff here is really unhelpful. Online it says that there is free Wi-Fi in the rooms, but when we ask they say there is only wired because they can't have Wi-Fi because then they won't know how much to charge people. On average, restaurant dining took over 1.5 hrs because of slow service and it took over an hour to get to talk to someone at the front desk. The concierge never helps, and nothing they give you is good information. The TV, which was the only thing that kept me sane, got knocked out for 36 hours, and when we asked, they said "they were working on it." Overall, this place is crap, I don't understand why people go there, and I recommend going to an all inclusive resort like Club Med. Also, after 6 P.M. the only thing still open are the restaurants and the Casino, which doesn't even have poker. ** If you don't follow my advice and you go here, rent a car and go to Old San Juan, (By the way, OSJ is an hour away because Rio Mar is in the middle of nowhere) which is really a place fun to be, and go to two restaurants nearby, Hasienda Caribali, and Don Pepe. which were really great.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the overcast weather we had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: carolinaexplorer
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rio Mar. We stayed there about 8 years ago. I was pleasantly surprised to find it just as lovely as the first visit. The resort is lushly landscaped. The rooms are clean and spacious. The service was excellent. We had some problems with our keys becoming deactivated but security was available in minutes to correct the issue. We paid to upgrade to ocean view and it was absolutely beautiful. We did not rent a car when we were there but met a taxi driver, NIcky, who was outstanding. He took us to our biobay kayak trip and then to the kiosks to eat dinner. He suggested La Parilla which was superb and he called the restaurant to see which course we were on and then was waiting for us. After that, we called Nicky Tours for all our transportation. His number is 787-408-2065. We also ate at La Hacienda and Dom Pepe. They were both very good. We really enjoyed the resort. The only complaint we had was while the fitness room had good machines and weights, the room is teeny tiny-not what we expected based on the quality and service . Oh , and do not miss the spa. It was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the weather reports not the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Llcoolsun
Reviews.Content: My family is at the resort right now as I type this. I almost cancelled my trip last week when I saw the weather reports, wish I did. I saw the sun once this week, when we landed at the airport. Since then it has been so windy that the resort suggests that no swimming should occur at the beach. The hot tub is packed with kids as a result and people are poolside in long sleeve shirts sometimes! The rooms do smell musty, it must be the humidity. There are no minibars in either of our two rooms. Do not pay for an ocean front view at this hotel! One of our rooms has a decent view. The other room has a huge palm tree view. You can peek between the leaves to glimpse the ocean. Not worth the huge jump iin price. Most ocean front rooms really just overlook the pool and then you see the water in the distance. I've seen better views at condos in ocean city Maryland! Bring sneakers. You can't tour the rainforest or do tours without them. We planned to sit by the pool or beach and weren't planning to do anything but relax and therefore are short on contingency plans. Food: pricey yes, but that's expected. I would just add that the restaurants that require reservations are not such a great value. My child wouldn't even eat his favorite food "lo mein" at Shimas. I tasted it, and it didn't taste like lo mein. Instead, just go local or stick with the buffet at Marbellas. They have a different theme every night, does not require reservations and there is something for everyone! The hotel couldn't do anything about the weather of course, but could certainly put together some ideas for their guests when they are served a week of wind or rain. That would have been appreciated! It's a decent resort, just not sure that timing of your trip in winter really works. It's not true that the weather is consistent. And remember! If you stay near a rainforest then expect rain!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jswan1963
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a good value and a good place to stay. Rates are reasonable and there's a lot to do. Restaurants are pricey so we ate out locally. Other than that we'd recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location, value, resort, everything”
Reviews.Author: AlMasri
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. The price is right and the location and service was nothing short of stellar here. The rooms are extremely clean and look brand new. We were recommended to this place by some friends and we would highly recommend this place to any of our friends. PR is an excellent place to visit and this is a great hotel to stay. We stayed at the doubletree in San Juan for a night (that's really all you need to see San Juan) and then we came here. The prices are the same but this place is MUCH nicer.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money, food and drinks isanely expensive dont make the same mistake we did.”
Reviews.Author: travelnow85
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed for our honeymoon in dec 2010. We stayed in a prime oceanfront room. The bathtub was peeling paint and the room was musty, when we asked to be moved they sent us to a room the had the same exact problems as the first only worse. eventually they found us a better room. all the restuarants are very overpriced for the quality. parking is very expensive. About the only thing they provide for free is ice.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway--but be Aware”
Reviews.Author: mkrivo
Reviews.Content: Pros: The grounds and rooms were excellently maintained and picturesque. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were spacious. The resort is effortlessly located next to the rainforest with views either of the foggy hills or blue ocean. The Italian restaurant was gourmet. Cons: As previous reviews state, it's important to do your homework before booking this resort. Unless you plan to pay exorbitant prices (we spent $30 on a self-serve breakfast, as an example) and stay on grounds, a rental car is necessary. However, the driving in Puerto Rico isn't always the sanest and San Juan and the Condado (excellent nightlife) is at least a 45 minute drive in the best of circumstances. Additionally, while we were there, the staff was peddling this Wyndham promotional lecture. The deal was great ($75 room credit for 1.5 hrs of your time) but the staff used every opportunity to try and get you to go. This became annoying enough to start avoiding the concierge staff so as not to be approached a fourth time. Overall: We were incredibly happy with our choice as we had done our research prior to going and used the tips below to have a pleasant stay. Tips: 1) Visit Don Pepe's (take a right onto Rt 3 out of the hotel and it's your first right). It's a fantastic restaurant (especially for breakfast!) at a great price. 2) Do some research ahead of time and if you are renting a car, book excursions on your own and save a ton of money ($40 cash for a biobay tour with Pure Adventure!) 3) Buy snacks, etc at a nearby Walmart to curb those late night cravings instead of splurging on room service.

Reviews.Title: “What an AWESOME experience!”
Reviews.Author: teeharr10
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a GREAT stay at the Wyndham Rio Mar, the weather was not so great but my partner and I met a wonderful young lady named Cathy who made our stay AWESOME despite the weather. I would like to commend Cathy on her AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Every Wyndham Hotel and Resort need more employees like her. Thanks Cathy for making our stay the BEST!! We will be back because of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: tcunning
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place, as long as you know what to expect. You'll get great views, a long sandy beach, and comfortable beds, plus a location that's close to El Yunque, Luquillo, and the Fajardo marina. You'll also get a $15 a day parking fee and massively overpriced food and drinks. Overall we were happy with our stay, mostly because we got a nice off-season deal on the room. If we had to pay full price, it probably would have been a different story. Pros: Views, right on the beach, convenient location. Cons: Parking fee. Overpriced restaurants. Long wait at front desk if there is any kind of line.

Reviews.Title: “Best $10 Mango Mojitos You'll Ever Taste”
Reviews.Author: Paddling_hiking_Gal
Reviews.Content: Far away from the big city this hotel was off the beaten path. The grounds were spacious and beautiful. The pool area and beach were both very nice and the rooms were big and comfortable. There are friendly iguanas around the resort and it's fun to watch them sun themselves. They will even eat out of your hand, but don't hold on to the food too long or they will get your finger. We saw one plunge from the top of a palm tree and into the swimming pool, very cool. The prices for meals and beverages were a bit expensive and since you're so far away from the rest of the world they got you by the... It felt a bit like highway robbery. The staff was nice, the beach was good for walking and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “You'll enjoy this property”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonRob
Reviews.Content: Well, we read all the reviews before visiting this Wyndam property, and most were on target. When booking, it's possible to get a good deal on your stay, which I think made many think the whole vacation would be inexpensive which was a mistake. Food and drink on property are not cheap, but we had no problem bringing wine, etc, which the staff cheerfully opened for me daily. And eating off property was a snap if you rent a car. The bakery at the end of the street is excellent for breakfast or lunch, and the Kioskos in Luquillo serve great food at great prices. #21 (ay Bonito) is fantastic, as are the burger joint (#9) and the civeche place (#34). Rainforest is across from the property, golf course was nice, pool is beautiful. No problem with provisions at the end of the block. And the guy selling chicken on the side of the road just west of the property does a great job.

Reviews.Title: “low key and romantic”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSweetee
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days here for our anniversary. This resort is absolutely beautiful, well maintained and romantic. The rooms were clean, fairly updated and nicely decorated(and I am picky when it comes to rooms) The bathroom was simple, yet nicely done. We recieved and upgrade to an ocean view with balcony. The hotel has many quiet candle lit areas to sit around on beautiful big comfy velvety furniture. It has a mediterranean castle feel to it, lots of wrought iron. The staff was warm and welcoming. Service at the italian restaurant was top notch.Prices were very "New York". We were on a budget so we ate there one nite. Drinks were too expensive-10 dollars each-The for 2 for one rum punch at the Tiki bar after 4pm sounded good but tasted horrid! We brought our own booze and made our own drinks.We were glad we listened to reviews that suggested renting a car.Rent on your own before you get there. A shuttle from the airport, for 2, round trip is $160! We rented a car and toured the Rain Forest, Fajardo, Luquillo beaches and Old San Juan ( not far- a must see)for less that that! We had GPS on our phone and never got lost. I would only recommend "La Parilla" at the Kioskos, food and service was very good and cheap. Breakfast was a rip off at the hotel, so we ate at The bakery at the bottom of the hill. They make omelets etc.-cheap and good. The beach at the hotel was well groomed daily, but the water was too rough to swim in, lots of undercurrents. We went in only waist deep only. We would have loved to gone snorkeling or done water sports,but you can't here. That was a little disappointing to us,but If you like to golf, it's got a beautiful course! The resort was big enough so that they seem to put families with kids on one side and couples on the other, each with separate pool and jacuzzi areas-nice! Overall we really enjoyed our stay, and I would recommend it! It's is great for a romantic 3 or 4 days. It is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Save Yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Meggied2
Reviews.Content: Quick and simple review - TOO EXPENSIVE!! My husband and I travel a few times a year for leisure. We came here for our 2 year anniversary. Rooms were good. Service was good - depending on where you were. Wine and mixed alcoholic beverages were weak and not less than eleven dollars per drink! Expect to spend no less than one hundred dollars for dinner each night. There are no close restaurants so you are stuck on site for each overpriced meal unless you want to pay a lot for a cab. Sunscreen was fourteen dollars for a three ounce bottle in the gift shop. We don't mind spending more money on a vacation if it is worth it but at the Rio Mar, you just feel like you're being taken advantage of. Not a good feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time! Excellent resort for families.”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0nBunny
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about staying here after reading all the reviews. Some were great and some were not so good. Happy to say we just got back and had a fabulous time! The resort is really pretty. The grounds are lovely and well kept. Our room was fantastic and we received and upgrade to OceanFront on arrival. I think if you book through Zell Travel or GoGo you will get this if they have open rooms. Our room was clean, comfortable and no issues with air conditioning. They do put the AC on very cold but we just shut it off when we were in the room. I think with the humidity they have to keep the rooms cool to avoid mildew. The service was great. Check-in and check-out smooth. Staff really nice from the restaurants to the parking people, house keeping, Concierge. All were great. Resorts are generally expensive and take advantage of having you captive but I think you need to have this mindset going in and you won't be upset about parking fees, etc. The restaurants are a bit pricey but there are plenty of places to eat right outside the resort. You DEFINITELY need a car. Some good restaurants: La Parilla (One night it was great and one night ok) Ismar Bakery (Great for breakfast) Palmer Bakery Estacion in Fajardo Don Pepe Marmalade in Old San Juan (Fabulous food!!!!!) The resort is about 40 minutes from the airport and about an hour from OSJ. We used our car every day so it is definitely worth renting. If you want to book excursions, I recommend booking them before you arrive. They are expensive to book at the hotel (almost double the price). We used East Island Adventures for Snorkling and Bio Bay Tour. They are really great and reasonably priced. They are also one of the few excursions for snorkling that allow children under age 6. I have children 7 and 4. They loved Rio Mar. The pool is big and has a sllide that is really fun. They have tons of big iguanas walking around. They let the children feed them which is great fun. This resort is very kid friendly. All in all I thought it was a really nice place and would stay there again. If you want nightlife you should stay in Old San Juan or Condado. If you want family fun, relaxing stay here. It is a bit remote but if you have a car everything is close. There is a Walmart or Walgreens about 15 minutes away. We stocked up on drinks and snacks to bring down some of the expensive food cost. The rainforest is right across the road and Luquillo beach is about a 5 to 10 minute drive away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will never forget this trip”
Reviews.Author: rwalia99
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this is a nice place to stay. If you want to stay a little bit outside of San Juan, this hotel would be a great choice. It's the closest resort to the rainforest and gives you easy access to the bio bay, as well as the ferries to Culebra and the other best beaches. The beach, pools, and casino are great because they have a fun energy without feeling overcrowded. If you want to stay outside of San Juan, I would absolutely say you should stay here. On a personal note, we had a life-changing experience on our trip during Thanksgiving week. To be more specific, it was almost a life-ending experience. We were caught in a riptide and pulled into the ocean, with very little hope. It was a matter of minutes until we would have died in that water. Through the heroic efforts of a surfer and a 21 year-old kid named Elijah who swam in after us, we were able to make it out. The jet ski rental place next door had an employee named Onyx who injured his knee in the rough conditions for the final rescue. It took the combined efforts of all these strangers to save our lives, and we will never be able to thank these people. The manager of the hotel is a lady named Zandra. She, like so many of the Puerto Rican people we met, is a remarkable human being. The last thing I needed after this ordeal was to talk to some unfeeling corporate voice. Zandra was anything but that. She is a great asset to the Wyndham name. We will never forget our time at the Rio Mar and in Puerto Rico. And hopefully we will be back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ice-bjorn
Reviews.Content: I usually do not stay in resorts, feeling that they artificially close off "the real world", charge artificially high prices and so forth. However, at Wyndham's Rio Mar I was perfectly willing to suspend with this "policy". Sure, the restaurants and services are expensive, and the place is almost a region to itself, but the resort is so pleasant in all other regards that it is a small price to pay a few bucks more for food/services. In fact I'm unable to come up with much criticism at all; I felt completely at ease in a place where staff went out of their way to both give you attention and privacy at the same time. I get easily bored on vacation if things are not happening, but I was content to stay on the property for days w/o feeling a need for extra stimulus. If you are on a budget, there's places around where you can find cheaper meals and supplies. The kioskos in Luquillo, the Brass Cactus in the same town and food stands along the road. The places very close to the resort tend to be pricey, so I'd either venture a couple a miles away or spring for the restaurants on site. Palio at the resort is a good Italian restaurant by any standard. If you only have 3-5 days in PR, I'd stay 1-2 at the resort, 1 day in El Yunque rain forest and one full day in Old San Juan. I would not bother with Rio Camuy, but instead concentrate on sights in the northeast area.

Reviews.Title: “Just a pretty face”
Reviews.Author: tootsweet2
Reviews.Content: If hospitality were a beauty contest Wyndham Rio Mar would be the winner. Lush and lovely gardens, interesting art, nice fresh flowers take the prize, but like a high-maintenance beauty queen it comes at a price. In the case of the Wyndam it is the confiscatory parking rates, mandatory bellman and housekeeping gratuities, inexcusably poor maintenance of the rooms, and service you don't get without nagging. Hospitality, after all, is much more about comfort than good looks. The first room they gave us smelled so strongly of mildew we couldn't stand to be there and lacked the wi-fi we were promised.
