After a whole day of wrangling the internet problem (instead of the sightseeing planned) with repeated promises and brief but ineffective intervention by the manager on duty, they finally admitted the internet service was down in the entire wing, and they knew it, and they were not planning to fix it. Instead they moved us into a room with the wi-fi that cooled to no higher than 66. When the engineer arrived to fix it, he suggested that we didn't know how to operate the thermostat, then pulled out a filthy filter, which my husband suggested should be changed, and then it took him an hour to return with the replacement. In the meantime, opening the balcony door caused immediate condensation on everything and made the floors dangerous. Then, it was when I came out of the shower, wet all over, and trying to get to the conference on time, that I discovered that the hair dryer was dead. My complaints to management were met with semi-sincere empathy and we were granted a complimentary very late check-out and small credit. The special check-out was so time-consuming and delay so great, the fault of poor coordination between the front desk and valet parking attendants, that we missed the closing time for the cruise-area car rental office and had to return the car to the airport, pay a taxi to get to the ship, and nearly missed the deadline for boarding the ship. Even some of the conference arrangements were poorly conceived. For example, box lunches requiring both hands to manage were served to the hundreds of conference attendees, but on the first day there were only a couple dozen places to sit to eat it. We did see dozens of tables and hundreds of chairs neatly stacked out in the middle of the lawn.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: 41952Wanderer
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar is a pleasant older but not rundown resort. We had a good size, comfortable, beach front room with a balcony. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Any request or question we had was promptly acted on. Rio Mar is located right on the beach, and the pools and pool surroundings are great both for adults and children. Many activities are offered during day the day for both children and adults. Their better restaurants were good, but not great. Drinks are expensive, but food prices are what you would expect at a resort. Their wasn't much night life except for the casino. For me(but not for my husband)theonly thing I missed were places to shop because there is only one store within the facility and that store didn't have much. Good side trips are offered through the resort. Because the purpose of this trip was totally R&R, and we had been to PR before, we didn't take any of the trips. If you like the ocean and pools and want a relaxing vacation, this is a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the beach, not the food”
Reviews.Author: LosCorazones
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four-day girl's weekend at the Rio Mar Beach resort. All the reviews are correct, parking is expensive and the food and drinks are pricey for the quality. That said we had a lovely time because we knew what to expect. We got a rental car and went out for most meals when we felt like it and we didn't drink much. Our view was terrific, the staff was wonderful and the beaches were fantastic. Request a room on the ocean side on the fifth floor as you will have a huge patio. (5072-5077 maybe?) I had a massage at the Mandara spa which was 40% off during the week and was a fantastic deal for the service. Our room was cold, but we had a simple solution, turn it off.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: danceur
Reviews.Content: I also traveled to the Wyndham Rio Mar for a business conference. Had the same problem that the room was 55 degrees when we got there and had to keep the air conditioner off. If you opened the balcony door everthing would steam up and get slippery. Engineering came promptly and said it was fixed, but they actually did nothing. My tub did not drain properly so showers were taken ankle deep in water. The hotel was kept way too cool for a place where you are coming and going in a wet swimsuit. Food was okay and expensive. We did not have a car and had to use expensive cabs for going off site. The plus side was that it was fairly close to the airport and the conference.had to have rooms big enough for the conference. We were going to rent a car, but when we found out the charges for keeping it at the resort, even though the grounds are large, we declined. Also did not like paying for bellmen who were not used. Resort shuttle around property did not operate as promised and employees were reluctant for some reason to call for one when it didn't appear. My biggest complaint is that everything was inside. Most hotels in Puerto Rico have open air lobbies, restaurants, etc so that you can enjoy the wonderful climate. Also, too isolated from anything (although my companion and I walked about a mile to the nearest restaurant (Antojito's) which was reasonably priced and wonderful.) I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great pool and beach area”
Reviews.Author: clscott
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of mixed reviews on this property, so I was really hoping everything would be fine, and it was. Yes-it is a resort and so relatively isolated-you should have a car. We didn't eat in the restaurants much, but the food was good when we did. The grounds, pool and beach are nice-they provide beach towels, and chairs and umbrellas for the beach-no extra charge or hassle. The rooms are OK-like most hotels in PR it is a little run down compared to the US. Could not control the thermostat-so just used the fan settings to get the temps right. The bed was very comfortable. I think if you are prepared by reading the reviews that there will be no real problems for you here. It is right across from El Yunque so a great location to explore the rain forest and only 30 minutes to Farjardo. We were having a meeting there with 500 people, so we had a great time. I didn't hear many complaints from other folks except the thermostat problems. Everyone enjoyed the location and resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “I should have listened to the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: UptownGirl68
Reviews.Content: Two stars is being generous. There were nothing but problems from day one. When I got to my room it was about 50 degrees and it would not warm up. Someone from engineering came to my room 3 times. When it finally warmed up to a reasonable temperature, the floor was soaking wet. Then they tried to talk me into making it cold again because, apparently cold temps are their solution to the moisture problem that comes with being so close to the ocean. When I complained that the floor was slippery, they told me not to open the balcony door. Okay, then why have a balcony? I did stop opening it but I was annoyed. Then the AC just stopped working and the temperature in my room sky rockected, close to 90. When they could not fix it, they had me change rooms. Then I had a tub that would not drain and a broken safe. The food the provided for my conference was terrible and it was cold everywhere in the hotel. I spent so much time waiting at my room to make sure that repairs were done and then it took time to move rooms. I missed parts of the conference that I spent a ton of money for. The grounds are very nice and pretty and the rooms look nice. The staff is only somewhat helpful. It takes forever to get through to anyone at the front desk, whether by phone or stopping by.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Wattaplace
Reviews.Content: All the reviews that note nice things are correct...nature preserve on-site, iguanas, tons of coqui frog chirping, cleanliness, meticulous grounds, friendly staff, great location on the beach, balcony for each room (ours was beach-view), pools etc. But they nickel and dime you for everything, meals and drinks are expensive. They charge $15 a day to park, and you have to pay it because you need a car to get around. At least the ice was free. The food is expensive but mediocre, although the breakfast buffet is good (although expensive). We ate out locally every meal we could.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place although service was spotty at best and food prices are very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: cmpqse
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very well taken care taken care of. Front desk staff , concierge, and maid staff were very polite. Bar Staff and Wait Staff could use improvement. The food was very good but expect to pay double the normal prices. Our room was clean and very comfortable. Pool and Beach was great. My complaint would be the wait staff could be much more attentive to detail for the prices you pay. This hotel knows that you are captive once here so for food and drink the hotel is it and very expensive. I would not return as I felt the prices did not match the service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and even better the second time”
Reviews.Author: PunkiMom
Reviews.Content: We have now been there twice. Everything was wonderful, the property is beautiful, best breakfast extravganza I have ever had. Restaurants were very good too. PS love the spa too!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a rip off”
Reviews.Author: expat_expl0rer
Reviews.Content: Nice enough but not good enough to justify the price tag of the room or all the extras and on resort prices. All the food and drink prices are excessive. Pay for parking, pay for internet. Simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great OFFSEASON Value”
Reviews.Author: lboogy
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and each room had a private balcony. I reserved a garden view room but was upgraded to a partial oceanview since the hotel was only booked at about 16%. Service was great. The Bell Desk helped with plenty of tips on the resort and places to eat around the hotel. Be prepared, you will have to pay $15/day for parking. One tip I cant stress enough: RESERVE YOUR CAR RENTAL BEFORE YOU ARRIVE AT THE RESORT. You will need it because the hotels location is so remote from all of the attractions and cabs are pricey. I booked my rental and paid less than $150 for the week. We met another couple that booked their rental through the hotel and paid more than $275. That's on top of the cab fare. Below are a few helpful tips I wish I would've known before the trip. On the way to the hotel, make sure you have have toll fare. We accidentally drove into the wrong lane which requires $1.50 in exact change only (in coins). Needless to say, we didnt have it and held up the line and were greeted with loud horns and dirty looks. Lanes marked with a blue C can break bills for you. GPS is crap in PR. The workers at the hotel will agree with me on this. We arrived in PR pretty late in the evening so everything is that much harder to see. We got lost and we extremely frustrated. Locals were nice enough to point us in the right direction. Be careful driving at night to the resort. The drive up to the resort after seeing the sign is windy and dark. Cars zip by pretty fast so prepare your defensive driving skills. Oh and no one uses their signal light in PR. Slow driving using hazard lights are the norm too. Seek assistance from the concierge but we careful with the people that are over-friendly and try to offer you free tours. It's the time-share ploy! I've done that once in Mexico and I'll never do it again. A firm "No" will suffice and they wont bother you again. The concierge desk has directions to everywhere. Just ask them. They'll provide you with a print out instead of having you jot everything down. Also, ask them for the list of dinner reservations. Most of them were good. Places we loved: Parilla, Brass Cactus, A few of the kiosks in Luquillo (be careful and make sure to inspect your food, a few of the items from the kiosks were spoiled). The one we hated: Hacienda Carabali. If you see the nice man selling candy in his truck, BUY IT! He's only there on the weekends. Do not book the El Yunque tour if you have a car. Save yourself the $59 pp and drive there yourself, it isnt far from the resort. Hotel food is pricey and so not worth the $100 bill we paid the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but removed”
Reviews.Author: doctorzeeod
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is obviously not as busy as they would like. My husband joined me and we stayed a few days after the conference, and on check-out day the place was desolate. The spa was also nice but nearly deserted. The grounds and beach are beautiful, and if you're going there to lie out and work on your tan, it's lovely. However, the restaurants are very expensive with food that's just ok. The excursions are also very expensive; it's cheaper to rent a car (which you can do at the hotel), and it's about an hour's drive from San Juan. All the staff were warm and welcoming, and it was relaxing falling asleep to the chirping of the tree frogs outside my balcony.

Reviews.Title: “always a great time”
Reviews.Author: treefreak
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this property 6 times over the last 10 years, 4x as a westin and the last 2 as a wyndham. i have never understood the negative reviews, especially those that give it a 1 or 2. part of the problem, i believe, stems from expectations and lack of knowledge of the hotel beforehand. this resort is 35 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from the rainforest. you MUST have a car to enjoy its location. this seclusion and proximity to the beautiful natural areas nearby are what help to give this resort a great feel. the grounds are meticulously maintained, the beach gorgeous with groves of beautiful coconut palms, 2 pools (one for adults only, 1 for families), and many iguanas to keep you amused. the rooms are large with comfortable beds and good sized bathrooms. we have always been treated in a very friendly manner by all of the staff, and most go out of their way to be friendly and warm. food at the property is relatively expensive, but not outrageous. mixed drinks (mojitos) were $10 and a salad at lunch at the outdoor grille was $15 and big enough to split. while the resort is secluded, there are many local restaurants within a 15 minute drive. among our favorites are la parilla (kiosk #2) in luquillo, pasta y pueblo, palmer bakery (panini breakfast sandwiches), and el verde (chicken and ribs puerto rican) a few miles back toward san juan on rt. 3. if you love a beautiful beach, nature, tropical grounds, and local food, you will love this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beach - but rent a car and see PR”
Reviews.Author: Venicep
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location! Beautiful beach, but its very expensive inside the hotel so worth it to rent a car and get around the isalnd. There is a great little breakfast/lunch spot right at the bottom of the hill and its very close to the rainforest (el Yunqe) and Luquillo beach. Only about an hour ride to Old San Juan. The beach was very nice, clean and relatively quiet considering we were there in March. Did not need to get up early to grab a chair or anything.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT - loved it and you will tooooo!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy1nj
Reviews.Content: I too have been tracking the reviews on this resort. And we were very afraid to go after reading the reviews. Well, we took a chance and we LOVED it . The Place is BEAUTIFUL, we traveled the first week in October and no one was there except a few people for conventions / seminars. The resort was a bit pricey on food, drinks, and sightseeing trips. That is why we rented our own car, which is available right there in the lobby. We drove everywhere, San Juan, Fajardo, Luquillo and the Yunque rainforest is right outside the resort! We shopped at Walgreens or Amigo for food and liquor .. had breakfast at Burger King for under $10 bucks for 2 people! It's $8 for a glass of OJ at the resort. Even had decent chinese food in same strip mall "Fina China". The iguanas weren't an issue. The sand jiggers a the beach / pool - Spray yourself with bug spray you will be fine ! Parking your rental in the underground lot wasn't an issue as lot of travelers reported. You don't have to pay parking if you rent from the enterprise right in the lobby. Gambling in the casino was kool ... Spa was nice...... We will be back ! And you should try this resort you'll love it !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: COmomCarbondale_CO
Reviews.Content: I had been following all the reviews on this property for several months...I must say I was concerned. However, we were upgraded to a seventh floor ocean view room with comfortable bed/bedding, large bath with plenty of hot water, balcony, and plenty of storage space. We bought a small styrofoam cooler and used it for drinks and snacks while there. Definitely rent a car and a GPS to get around - this place IS about 45 min from airport and Old San juan. There are Walgreens, grocery stores and fast food every 5 miles or so. The beach is great, as are the pools. Restaurants are fairly pricey but good food. In general, everyone we met in San Juan was super helpful and friendly. You can get free internet if you join Wyndham By Request at the website. Parking IS $15/day. Old San Juan with forts, etc. is worth a day or two. Lovely squares to hang out in, a free trolley so that you can leave your car in a parking garage, and shopping if you wish. Don't forget an umbrella or poncho - the rain comes from all directions and can be sudden. In comparison to Mexico destinations, I felt safer here, there was more English spoken if that's important to you, and it seemed much cleaner. Leave plenty of time at the airport on your departure day...if a cruise ship has come in, it will be a zoo, and you must put your bags through a USDA scanner if coming to the US. No Passport required. Overall, a great conference opportunity, but definitely not a cheap trip. Oh, there are some little no-see-ums on the beach in the afternoons so bring a couple bug repellant towelettes.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Beach Resort, Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Autumnbear
Reviews.Content: My associate and I went to the Rio Mar for a conference. We traveled 3 days early to enjoy the island before work began. We could not have had a better experience. The Rio Mar is Paradise. The grounds are beautiful, the staff are wonderful and attentive. The room was very clean and comfortable. The room we shared was on the second floor. Apparently the lower floors tend to be a bit more humid so there was a dehumidifier in the room. We thought the sound of the machine was annoying at first and started to request a room higher up but after the first night we decided we liked the low humming of it and decided to stay in the room the rest of our visit. It also was very convenient to the pool, beach and casino. The beach is beautiful and the location of the resort is in close proximity of the rain forest, snorkeling, sailing and what ever sight seeing you might want to do; or you can just stay on the property. The food at the resort is mediocre and definately over priced, but the beauty that surrounds you at the resort more than makes up for it. You can go to the kiosks on Hwy 3 for much less expensive fare. We got an ice chest and made our own drinks in our room along with some snacks. RUM is very cheap! Fortunately the conference we attended provided a couple of breakfast and lunches through out the week. There is a restaurant at the top of the hill called Ritchie's that has had some negative reviews. We decided to try it anyway and I can say we had a ball. Yes, the food is WAY over priced but, again, the amount of fun we had MORE than made up for it. We loved the Rio Mar and would definitely, and plan to, go again. I would say that for most people who are looking for a relaxing vacation this would be the place. If you are a young person interested in a lot of partying I would recommend staying in Old San Juan or a different type of resort. If you plan on sight seeing, definitely rent a car. The Dragonfly tours offered at the hotel are expensive. We went on a boating, snorkeling, beach day. The other people on the boat had paid 150.00 each for the excursion through Dragonfly. We drove ourselves about 15 minutes and paid 69.00 for the same excursion from the East Island boating excursions. You can hike the rain forest trails yourself. There is a visitor center and they provide maps for free. The Bacardi Rum Factory tour is free if you drive yourself. We checked that out and it was very interesting. Old San Juan, is the same, you can do it yourself if you have a car and just pay for parking at the parking garage or find a space on the street if you are lucky. If you do rent a car do not rent from PAYLESS car rental. Go with Enterprise or Hertz. Payless is a bunch of con artists, I won't go into it but Trust Me, stay away from them. Driving is a bit of a challenge, traffic is horrible and the roads are just as bad, but as I said, well worth it. OH, the Hotel will charge you 15.00 a day for self parking. That was the biggest negative we had about the place. We did sneak into the employees parking lot a couple of nights, but for the most part we just sucked it up and paid the fee. So take lots of money, lots of sunscreen and check your attitude at the door and you will have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It...”
Reviews.Author: samissamuel
Reviews.Content: When I stayed, I was VERY disappointed for a hotel that brags about it's "high status." A few fees where added at the end. One of those "little" fees that creep up. When I parked (they charge for parking too) and enter the parking garage elevator, the elevator was in badly in need of up keep. The doors had a lot of scratches, the panels were very worn. Inside the hotel you can tell almost everything needed to be replaced. It looked and felt "worn out" as though the property was abandon. Some of the employees told me there were massive layoffs, the previous hotel manager was fired, morale was low, etc. My room faced the ocean. The furniture in the room looked "beat up." If this was a regular hotel with regular prices, I would not write this, but this hotel claims itself to be "great" and above others along with its price tag, I think it is fair to point out this hotel does not live up to its standards plus nick and "dimeing" its clients.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded location far from the sites of Puerto Rico.”
Reviews.Author: MemphisMindy
Reviews.Content: Overall, the resort is beautiful. Great facility, clean rooms, beautiful pools and beach. But it is very far away from everything. And they know its far from everything, so they can charge you a fortune for food, drinks, excursions, cab rides, rental cars, etc. I would recommend staying in Old San Juan where you can walk to restaurants and shops. If you choose to stay at the Wyndham, be prepared to spend a lot more than you would elsewhere. We brought snacks and a few bottles of alcohol with us and still ended up spending much more than we planned. The food at the resort is good, just expensive. You can probably get away with splitting an appetizer and one entree between 2 people (we did). I would HIGHLY recommend renting a car, and you would be smart to book it before you arrive. Our vacation really didn't start until we rented a car on day 4 and got to experience the culture, see the sites and the people and eat the amazing Puerto Rican food. When we tried to rent a car at the Enterprise kiosk at the hotel, they offered us a rate of $75 per day for the Smart car, which was almost too small to hold our shopping bags on the way back from Old San Juan!!! I ended up calling the 800# for Enterprise and got a much better rate. You should also be aware that when you rent a car, you have to pay $15 per day for parking! Puerto Rico is a wonderful island! We did the Yunke Zipline Adventure (www.yunkezipline.wordpress.com) and absolutely loved the experience and our tour guides! It was amazing! We also did the Bio Bay Tour, which was pretty incredible too! I would not recommend booking through the hotel. You can save some money by calling and booking on your own, but you'll need a car or cab to get there. Our favorite restaurants were Pasta y Pueblo on the beach in Luquillo and Boricuba in Fajardo. The food was delicious; I recommend the Mofongo! The Islamar Bakery at the bottom of the hill has amazing omelets and baked goods. Be careful about taking the cab drivers recommendations for restaurants! I think they get a kick-back from the restaurant owners, and I believe some of the restaurants increase the prices when the cab driver tips them off. Our cab driver sold us on a restaurant called Don Pepe at the bottom of the hill near Islamar. When we agreed to go, he called ahead (in Spanish) and talk to the owner. When we got there, they gave us menus from a different stack which had very high prices. Stay at this resort at your own risk! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: dscotti
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mini 4nt/5dy vacation and had the best time ever. After flying in to San Juan, it takes approx 45 minutes to get to the resort but is well worth it. Tip: buy RT transfers with your package. The resort is extremely private, cannot get into the resort without an ID. Wyndham owns all of the property for miles so it is very safe. Walked everyday along the beach path. 2 golf couses, very well maintained. The staff everywhere was super friendly and very accommodating. Rooms are very clean, neat and comfortable. Maid service was very efficient. 3 restaurants were fantastic, We loved Shimas and Palio. Can't wait to return. The hotel had an Adult pool away from the regular pool for privacy. Drinks were expensive but if you buy duty free liqour after you land and take it back to the hotel, it is worth it. sodas at the convenience store are only $1.29 each. If you are looking for complete rest and relaxation, this is the PLACE. did noy need to leave the resort. the hotel is located right across from the rain forest. the views are beautiful. You have beach and ocean on one side and rainforest on the other,spectacular. YOU HAVE TO SEE IT FOR YOURSELF

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: treptow
Reviews.Content: I read a million reviews of this place and was nervous about staying there because of it. Don't be nervous. It's an awesome place to stay, but you should know a few things that will make your stay more comfortable. The rooms are chilly to avoid getting too humid. Just be prepared and bring sweats and a long sleeve shirt if you intend on hanging out in the room the whole time. It's comfortable while sleeping. If you try to warm up the room, it will be too humid as several people noted. Just use your head. It's common sense. As for parking, it's just what it is. But, if you stay at this resort, you really do need a rental car. It was worth the money just in savings on the side trips. If you set up your side trips on your own and have your own transportation, you save about 30%. For example, the ATV ride through the rain forest was $112 through the resort, but only $70 through the place directly. To save some money, we rented a mini fridge from the resort and went to the store to get food and liquor. That probably saved us $1000 total. You can bring your own cooler down to the pool, but you'll probably have to get ice from the bartender. There is only one ice machine that puts out much ice, and that is on the 4th floor. The pool and beach are amazing, and the tiki bar is really great. The food isn't perfect at the tiki bar, but we found that the fried chicken sandwich was probably the best sandwich choice. When we went (slow season) not all of the restaurants were open every night, but we did find something good to eat every night. We ate at Fajardo's marina one night, the kiosks one night, and Raice's in San Juan one night. You have to try the mofongo there. We also ate at the cafe quite a bit. Overall, the negative reviews come from the people who are not using common sense to save money and have a comfortable room. Just use your head and it will be an amazing trip. We had no trouble with the staff, but we did find that people told us the pool was open 24/7, and it really closed at about 2 a.m. one night. Just FYI. Side trips we recommond are the bio bay tour, ATV through the rain forest, snorkeling Culebra, and a visit to old San Juan. I'm sure there are many more fun things to do, but this is all we could squeeze in. I'd go back in a heartbeat. If you want a place that is near bars and nightlife - stay somewhere in San Juan. This is remote and relaxing. Not crazy nightlight, shopping, dining.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you would expect at an isolated resort”
Reviews.Author: cmm_travels
Reviews.Content: The reviews prior to travelling were correct: Nickel and dime you to death. If you want the 'resort' experience, head to the El Conquistador, we stopped by there, much nicer, much better facility, worth the extra money. We stayed at wyndham as part of timeshare. Minuses: Staff - tried to sell everything under the sun 'how bout our clean air room - 'instead of $100/night, we'll give it to you for $25/night' . ick . Parking situation - as mentioned, you pay to park, and the ticketing system is terrible, valet is overpriced and just a big pain all around --- but based on where this place is located you HAVE to have a car Food - so overpriced, never ate here. breakfast down the road at Isamar. Awesome local breakfast place. Dinner in luquillo @ Pasta y pueblo or the kiosks. Plusses: Pool area - nice lounge chairs, enough towels, slide is fun, beach is pretty clean/well kept Location to El Yunque. We mainly stayed there to hike, it's only 10 minutes away. On the other hand, it's a decent day trip to San Juan. Maid service - she did an excellent job all week.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Marylander10
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and picked this place mainly b/c of the reviews on here and the price. I think it was the right choice since it was my first trip to PR and wanted to do the rain forest and mini-boats in Fajardo (both were great!!). My GF and I stayed here on 9/23/10-9/27/10. We really lucked out with the weather thank God!! There's not a lot I can add to the other reviews... definitely rent a car (take or rent a gps!!) and eat off premises (except for lunch at the tiki bar is very nice and what a view!!). Richies was great for drinks/appetizers and Antojitos was great for breakfast. The bakery next door was just ok and same for the Luqillo kiosks - most are dumps except for La Parilla was very nice but a little pricey. Also further into Luquillo Pasta Y Pueblo was fantastic and the Brass Cactus was also very good. I would HIGHLY recommend both over the kiosks. Highlights for me were: 1) Hiking to/going under La Mina falls 2) Mini-boats 3) Walking around Old San Juan - very cool city - and the tasting tour!! 4) Laying around at the adult pool at Wyndham - very relaxing and beautiful!! The most disappointing/over-rated for me would be: 1) Roads/traffic/signage are all terrible 2) Luquillo kiosks 2) Candado/Isla Verde - not worth a special drive from Rio Mar IMO (plus we got lost - the signage is terrible!!). All in all I thought this was a great place to stay and we had a blast in PR!! The beach and pools are very nice, the rooms are big and beds very comfortable, the employees very helpful - they allowed us to check in early and check out late w/out any extra fees, it is close to the rain forest, Luquillo and Fajardo. If I do go back to PR again I'll probably stay in Old San Juan. We only went there for one day (hour drive is prohibitive) but wanted to see more of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A pitched tent would have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Kacey80
Reviews.Content: Concierge, bell service and housekeeping is terrible. Had to call 4 times to get luggage (the concierge was not helpful at all) finally went to the lobby to get it myself (the only bag there) and wasn't even offered help even though I was charged for bellman gratuity. I broke a glass in my room in the morning only to return to find the broken glass still on the floor but the bed made (why wouldn't housekeeping sweep)? Also, the sink nor the tub was cleaned all while I was being charged housekeeping fees. The only good thing was the room service staff and food. The hotel offered to reimburse me $100 which is not even one nights room and tax!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort - don't miss out on this and don't listen to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: latinalisa8991
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort on the beach that offers rainforest, hotel or oceanfront rooms. Shannon checked us in and he was very helpful and pleasant to speak with. Because we came through the week, all of the restaurants on site were not open but there are great local restaurants nearby. We were upgraded to an oceanview room. Everything operated perfectly, no leaky faucets, no wet floors as others complain about. The only downside to this resort is the $15/per day self parking fee. I thought this was a little high considering what we paid to stay here. By Thursday night, the lot was full of casino goers and the parking got a little hairy. I felt that those just visiting the casino should not be allowed to park in the same area as the guests because this was a great inconvienence for those of us staying there all week. The one other problem we had was the disappontment that the walls appeared paper thin when some ignorant mother decided to rent a room for her teenage/young adult sons and their friends to stay next to us while she had a room elsewhere. I had to call security twice to get them to be quiet as it was 2am and we had a flight to catch that morning early. If you read reviews about those that complained about the price of the food or the service this resort offered then they're just looking for something to gripe about. There IS free internet access if you go into the lobby area. I had no problem accessing the computers there. Who wants to access the internet while you're on vacation anyway?! Stay here because you won't be disappointed! The view is amazing, the hotel is gorgeous and the location is second to none. There is horseback riding 4 minutes away, a superior restaurant 3/4 of a mile up the road from the hotel, El Yunque rainforest and all its splendor is very close to the hotel, you can't go wrong! Do NOT miss out on the La Mina trail while in El Yunque

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: kentiashaw
Reviews.Content: Where to beginâ€¦I took this trip with 2 girlfriends. We were not impressed. The lobby is beautiful, but once you go to the rooms, itâ€™s a disappointment. The hallway carpets are dirty. The rooms were clean but the furniture was visible old and worn. Our air conditioner was set on 62 F and we could not make it go any higher. The air had to be cut off in order for the blower to stop. We called and asked for someone to come look at it. We were told someone would be right up. They never came. Then, we went to the front desk and waited for the guy to follow him up to our room the next day. He came in and said that is just the way it works. There is nothing that can be done. Overall, it seems that the bellman, front desk and concierge never speak to each other and no one gives accurate information. Self-parking stinks! When we arrived, there was plenty of parking Friday morning until the locals arrived. There is a casino in the hotel and the locals fill the garage parking. You can park in the parking lot marked EMPLOYEE PARKING but no one told us that when we checked in! Another lack of communication! The parking garage was full the entire weekend. We had to walk in the rain to get from the Employee Parking which doesnâ€™t really have parking spaces marked. Also, this is a rainy area. When we went to other towns like Fajardo, it was sunny and nice. Since the hotel is literally across the street from the rainforest, it rained every afternoon. The beach isnâ€™t that great there either. There were these little bugs that we could not see that bit us every time we were on the beach or by the pool even. I would recommend Puerto Rico, but not this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort-Wet Floors”
Reviews.Author: perry6162
Reviews.Content: Used timeshare at the Rio Mar, Nice Resort, Great View...however...The humidity made the floors in the room WET. We made a trail of towels and blankets on the floor so that we could walk without getting our feet wet. My husband almost slipped and fell on the wet tile. We called the front desk and they sent someone to check our ac, someone came out and "reset" the thermostat and said housekeeping would follow to dry the floor. There was no improvement, we called the desk again and were told they've moved other guests 2 or 3 times but it happens in all rooms. Housekeeping told us if we kept the room colder around 50/55 (freezing seems to be the only way) it helps. Freezing in your room doesn't seem like much of an option to me. We have stayed in many Caribbean resorts and have never encountered this before, we also live in humid Ft. Lauderdale on tile floors and do not have this issue. Returning to Puerto Rico is something we wish to do, but it is the only timeshare option for us and the wet floor issue makes us think twice. Is it worth it????

Reviews.Title: “more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: rodriguez9321
Reviews.Content: rio mar resort was more than what I expected everyone that we had contact with where very nice to us, everyone friendly and made friends. They all had good recommidations rent a car, bring a ice box with snacks GO to Walmart because it is a little expensive in the resort, Warren from the tikki bar told us take a drive to nearby shacks to eat, Juan from tour desk told us to go Huamacao, Fajardo,Punta de Santiago, Xavier told us to go Old San Juan historical sites and to eat at EL BOMBONERO great food. Thank you Rio Mar you have great staff. We made new friends, beautiful beach, crystal clean pools day and nights. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent Management, So-so Hotel, Bogus Fees”
Reviews.Author: Louis59
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham â€œNot Soâ€� Grand Rio Mar Beach hotel proved to be a challenge during a recent group meeting there, but there is opportunity for improvement. The good: Itâ€™s easy to see that this was once truly a local landmark, grand hotel. The public areas are expansive and impressive in their traditional Caribbean dÃ©cor. The pool and beach areas are well kept and inviting, although not over the top. The really good: the high spot of this hotel is the lobby bar, where Leeza, Juan, and Cici are very attentive, friendly, and serve as wonderful food and drink hosts throughout the evening. Kudos to the lobby bar team. The mediocre: guest rooms are large, and the bedding is comfortable. Lots of hot water for the shower, well-functioning air conditioning, and â€œfreeâ€� high-speed internet if you are a member of Wyndham frequent stay club or join while youâ€™re there. But the rooms are tired and worn, of average cleanliness, and while the concept of flat-screen TVs is good, itâ€™s of little benefit when there are no high-def channels and you end up watching blurry images, just on a larger screen. Guestroom corridor carpets are very stained and worn, and I had to visit five ice machines on three floors to find one that actually worked. Hello, Maintenance?? Mediocre, part two: Staff. In an operation like this, indifference or just plain bad service is bred from the top and at the Wyndham Not-So Grand, itâ€™s evident. When great service can overcome mediocre offerings at a hotel, why do the bell staff members and lunch-time restaurant staff at this hotel seem intent on avoiding all eye contact, and not going out of their way at all to offer hospitality? The front desk staff are OK, the lobby bar staff great, and everyone else very much needs a bit of training to remind them how to make guests feel welcomed and appreciated. The most laughable staff episode was the front desk person who told my colleagues and me, at 6:50 AM, that we could not have that dayâ€™s complementary USA Today because she was told not to put them out for distribution until 7:00 each morning! The bad: Bogus fees and indifferent management. Iâ€™m sitting here in my room, about to check-out, and as I review my bill I find a $7.49 â€œbellman tip,â€� but couldnâ€™t find one when I needed one and never used one. I see a $2.68 daily â€œhousekeeping gratuity,â€� even though I tipped on my own daily, and since when did a â€œgratuityâ€� become a mandated, taxed charge? And then thereâ€™s the 14% daily â€œresort service feeâ€™â€� which amounted to $9.73 each day as a way to grab even more money from my pocket for services and amenities I didnâ€™t use. Nearly $20 per day in absolutely bogus fees! Well-operated hotels have finally eliminated these bogus fees â€“ too bad Wyndham Not-So Grand canâ€™t see their way toward including these charges in the room rate, or negating them altogether. Indifferent management: a malfunctioning smoke alarm in my room that sounded at 4:15 on each of two mornings during my visit, which I reported the first day and following the second dayâ€™s episode, no one could find any record of it being reported or addressed the day before; lack of foresight to offer guests a route to the restaurant inside the hotel when heavy rain and wind would soak any guest who tried to make it to the restaurant through their standard exterior corridors; and no one seeming to monitor lack of staff at key areas of the hotel during a large group visit. Money-saving tips: If you are traveling with others, rent a car for the 45 minute trip from the airport. At $40 per person, each way, for shuttle service, renting a car is easily the more economical choice. And for a great, local dinner at reasonable prices, head to the Hacienda Restaurant, a casual steak and fish restaurant located on a working ranch 10 minutes from the hotel. Great food, friendly service, and half the price of the Wyndhamâ€™s over-priced restaurants. Register for the Wyndham frequent stay program for free high-speed internet. Remember that your final bill will include bellman and housekeeping â€œgratuities.â€� All in all, itâ€™s an OK hotel, run lackadaisically, that has seen better days. With so many better choices in the Caribbean, this hotel cannot continue to compete on mediocrity.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler07601
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was nice, the grounds meticulous and the food good, the "ala carte" policy for every amenity was absolutely ridiculous! I've stayed in many hotels, higher and lower caliber than Rio Mar, but I've never had to pay additional for things like a refrigerator ($15.00 per day), a microwave ($10.00 per day). Even parking was extra ($15.00 per day to park yourself or $20.00 for valet). I could understand parking when in a congested city area where space is limited but not on a huge property like Rio Mar. And then there was the shuttle from the airport to the facility. I've stayed at many other resorts where the hotel provided a free shuttle from the airport to the facility. Not so here.....the fee was $37.50 per person. For my party of 3, that equated to $112.00. It was cheaper to take a private taxi ($65.00)! I was told by another guest that when she inquired about having a plate of leftover food heated in a microwave, she was told that they would do it for her, at a cost of $15.00 per plate! Absolutely ridiculous! I would NEVER stay at Rio Mar again.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: cappleya
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay at Rio Mar in rio grande. We had a great time, yes the hotel is not cheap but it is a resort, and this is puerto Rico (not Dominican republic or somewhere where all the employees are on minimum pay). The location is great for seeing the north east corner of PR. We live on the south side of the island so took the opportunity to visit El Yunque on day of arrival. Ate down the road at Antejitos (typical PR food - good service). The next day we got up early and went on a 2 hr ATV tour with hacienda carabali. This was fantastic - all the guides were excellent and we had a great time. The trail was a lot of fun and they made several stops so we can take photos and had dip in the river. Our 8 year old girl had "the most fun ever"! She Also went on the go carts with my husband and enjoyed that a lot too. Lunch was good there and I would definitely recommend this option. The afternoon was spent back at the hotel in the pools and on the slide (which oddly closes at 5pm) and on the beach. Hired a wave runner for half an hour - again lot of fun but not cheap. We enjoyed the hotel overall - I was a little hesitant after some of the reviews but basically we booked at 48 hrs notice blindly (using the travelocity 'super secret hotel' option for the first time). in short though I knew there were only 2 four star hotels in rio grande so thought it might be this one. We had a room on rainforest side on 6th floor - very comfortable and no problems with damp. although this might be an issue on lower floors I also suspect it is more weather related (since I live here) - you are next to the rainforest after all! Drinks expensive yes - and service at tiki bar on a holiday w/ e slow.....but we came prepared with alcohol so mixed bought with drinking our own. Ate in the sushi place one night - expensive and mediocre but good drinks and nice surroundings. All in all I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent pool with beach at your back door”
Reviews.Author: butlerfamilyzoo
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, nice clean rooms, friendly service. Really liked the pool, great for little kids as there is a shallow kids pool, but plenty of places for mom and dad to hang out too. Very nice that the beach is right there as well and it's a nice clean beach. Breakfast was ridiculously expensive ($70 for 3 people) but very good. Location was good if you are going to the rainforest or sailing/snorkeling from Fajardo isnt that far away either. I think this is the best hotel around the area. Very nice and quiet for it's size, and we were even there while two conventions were going on! Drawbacks - parking is $15 or you can get valet for $20. However, expect a long wait for your car if you go valet, it's probably better off to just pay and park yourself. Food was just too expensive, though yes, it is a nice hotel, you dont expect to spend so much for some scrambled eggs!

Reviews.Title: “RIO MAR MY HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: gingersix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from4 days at the Rio Mar, We booked it with Liberty Travel with transportation to and from the airport. Rio MAR is beautiful the pools were clean and the view from my room was unbelievable. The bed was very comfortable house keeping did a good job cleaning my room. The only down side was Hurricane Earl tours was cancel but we made the best of it.My wife won at the casino all in all we had a great time Thank You Rio Mar for a great Vacation

Reviews.Title: “Happy teenage sons vacation with happy parents!”
Reviews.Author: Barbaraandted
Reviews.Content: The bell hops were attentive and accomodating, the desk staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and neat. We stayed in two rooms with an adjoining door so our sons could have their own bed and bathroom. The rooms had an ocean front view slightly obstructed by tall palm trees. The tile floor was wet often from the humidity. The location was just across the street from Hacienda Calibari which had go carts, ATV rides, horse rides and a restaurant. Our sons enjoyed the go carts but their favorite was driving their own ATV through the rain forest and leaping off a rocky cliff into a river. We also drove to the nearby Luquillo Public Beach that the locals enjoy and tried some fried favorites at Kiosk #8, Sylvia's. We ate dinnert at La Estacion in Fajardo, about 40 minutes away and my nineteen year old son said that was the best skirt steak he ever ate and if he could fit it in his stomach he would have had non stop servings of the hot banana turnover a la mode dessert. My seventeen year old son said that was the best grilled hamburger ever and the hand cut fries were great! I enjoyed the refreshing water walking class in the pool as well as the salsa dancing at the lobby bar. While definitely on the expensive side, we opted for the buffet at the resort one evening so the boys could eat all they wanted including desserts and drinks. I also enjoyed shopping at the different local craft shops set up near the casino entrance as well as the large souvenir shop just down the road on route 3. We bought all of our souvinirs there. Cute iguanas were all over and some quite large. They were entertaining yet harmless. Poolside music, morning swims in the ocean and late night hot tub soaks were the highlight of my husbands visit topped only by his golf outing on site. The only complaint we had was that we were not able to stay more days to add a zip lining trip, a visit to the natural water slide nearby and a visit to the biobay! We all want to go back next year !

Reviews.Title: “The BEST in Rio Grande!”
Reviews.Author: svwc
Reviews.Content: We went to PR for 6 days to check out wedding venues for next year. We stayed at 5 different hotels and Rio Mar was the best by far. Of course, they have their pros and cons. The Pros at Rio Mar were: service was great!, pool was refreshing, beach front (very nice beach), not hard to find (right off of the main road), continental breakfast was delicious (but pricey! $22 pp), and the hotel is beautiful! The cons were: restaurants close early (10PM), parking garage was trashy (as someone mentioned before), and everything is expensive (self-parking $15/day)-we rented a car which is always a MUST in PR unless you stay in Isla Verde & don't plan on venturing out. There were big iguanas everywhere! They look scary but they don't bother you. One of the guests told us that they swim in the pool so just be careful because they are territorial. The pool with the slide was closed for maintenance. Definitely a wedding destination for us and our guests! My recommendations regarding food & beverages: buy a cooler at Walgreens or Walmart (not far from hotel) and fill it with drinks, cold cuts, etc. You can always find street side restaurants with good food & great prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: LEPC
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar was a great hotel. We arrived early from our flight and they allowed us to check in 3 hours before the check in time. They even upgraded us to a rain forest view room for free. The rental car folks were great to work with and the rooms are very nice. The pool and beach area are well staffed and very well kept. My only complaint would be the wait for the travel conceirge. We waited in line an hour one day just to confirm a reservation they said they would call us to confirm. The restaurants are just okay and very pricey - rent a car and go to the local joints recommended on TripAdvisor, you will be soooo glad you did and the money you save will probably pay for the rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: goodgrief1121
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar the week of August 15th. We had read previous reviews that were very helpful so we knew what to expect. I am going to give the same advice to future travelers. #1-Rent a car and pack your GPS!! #2-know you are going to pay $25 per day for valet parking (well worth it if you need the car a few times a day!!) #3-go to Wal-Mart and purchase a throw away cooler, drinks, snacks and liquor/mixers. Drinks and meals are VERY expensive at the resort. #4-We did not eat at the resort at all. The best local restaurants are; La Parilla (luquillo kiosk) El Jeffe Burger (luquillo kiosk) and Pasta Y Pueblo (luquillo beach). These places do not have A/C and are not fancy but the food is outstanding. Pasta Y Pueblo was the BEST by far. Go early, they only have 4 tables in a beach side shack. The bakery at the bottom of the road to the resort is great and cheap too. #5-do not book excursions through the hotel. Venture out on your own or online and you will pay half the price. The beach is beautiful and not crowded. The grounds were clean, well maintained and beautiful. Our room was quiet and beds were extra comfy! The service at the resort was fantastic. Our room was too cold and they sent someone to fix it, twice. They promptly relocated us to an upgraded room happily. No problems here with service. #6-be prepared to tip nicely. They do have great service so please tip the workers. They knock on your door and ask if you need fresh towels!! We had a wonderful time and I would stay there again and again. Just be prepared and you too will have a great time. No one should go to a large resort such as this one and assume it will be cheap. Oh, and by all means, do the Bio Bay tour through East Island Adventures. It's a once in a lifetime experience. AWESOME!!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Never again,,”
Reviews.Author: SRA4
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Rio Mar Puerto Rico and I will list the good points first. 1. Palio and Shimas Resturants. 2. Old San Juan was an experience. 3. The Island of Calebra, that was the best part of going to Puerto Rico. just a great time. Bad Points, 1. They call them (u no see ums) little bugs like chiggers that will eat you early in the morning or early in the evening even at the pool. We were scratching all week and applying anti-itch cream. It seems these bugs were every where. 2. Very little to no waiter staff at the pool and none on the beach. 3. All the resturants are not open everyday. The Seebreeze and Grill Bar was never open the week we were there. 4. 2 Pina Colada's around $19.00, a beer around $8.00, very expensive resort. 5. Cabs very expensive, trip to the outlet mall and back 20 miles $60.00 so renting a car is a must. 6. Beach Area is secluded, no lighting to walk the beach at night but with the bugs we did not even attempt it. We like to relax on vacation so being on the beach everday was nice and the golf was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location if prepared, which we were”
Reviews.Author: MamaLuu
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to PR and I read up all the info before we went. We rented a car, ate most of our meals off the resort and did our own booking of excursions except for one through the hotel for horseback riding. The cost was the same as if we booked directly. The trip from the airport to the hotel was easy and once we arrived the resort was beautiful, better than the pictures on-line. We had booked 5 rooms and asked for them close together. We arrived around 10:30 a.m. so rooms were not ready. We started getting rooms between 3:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. All on the same floor, the 6th with a view of the rainforest. We went to the market, Amigos, just a couple miles away and bought a foam cooler for 3 dollars. Filled it with soda, water, beer and rum. Because of all this we really enjoyed the resort because we did not have alot of the extra costs others had and were able to get around freely. The resort really is lovely. The grounds are very tropical with the sound of the coqui all around at night. The pools were great and as long as you got pool towels before 6:00 p.m. when the towel stand closed you could stay at the pools until midnight. We also went into the ocean every evening until it got dark. If you ran your hands through the sand you came out with handfuls of live sand dollars. I had never even seen a live sand dollar before. To round out each evening we would go into the casino. Our trip was on a budget so my limit for casino money was $ 30.00 per night. 3 out of 5 nights I won, nothing huge but made it fun. We also got a big kick out of the iguanas, never saw them at the pool areas but everywhere else yes, they even had a feeding time and gave out lettuce. As far as service I found everyone very helpful and quick to respond to any request. They even supplied me with maps to any place I requested which made traveling around very easy. They also had computers in the lobby if you needed to look up something on-line. I'll try to add some pictures and if anyone wants to ask any specific questions about the hotel, nearby restaurants or the area send me a message. I had a great time but it really helped that I was prepared.

Reviews.Title: “What you need to know”
Reviews.Author: bcollins087
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my honeymoon and had an excellent time. I wanted to provide a little bit of information to those heading to rio mar. Just so those of you going can feel a little more comfortable, here are some recommendations that i wish someone told me before going...To begin, be sure to keep your baggage claim ticket (the little sticker) with you at all times. SJU airport will not allow you to leave the airport with your bags without it! Rent a car online before you go and be sure to get a number for them and call them when you land so that a shuttle will come get you...otherwise you might be standing for a while!! Cabs and the hotel charge outragious prices for rides...like $60 one way. Be very careful when driving especially at night since most of the roads have no lane divider lines and the locals drive crazy. (get the extra insurance!) i rented from a company call U-SAVE and paid around $200 for the entire week.. Hotel- Very nice but the parking garage is a bit trashy with stray dogs fighting for garbage! pool is very nice but watch out for the iguanas, they are harmless but everywhere. Excursions- 1. I recommend going to the rainforest and swimming in the waterfall, that was a highlight of our trip. 2. Old San Juan and bacardi distillery 3. catamaran sail and snorkel 4. bio bay kayak trip 5. beaches in Fajardo!! nice waves only about 6 miles east of the resort on Hwy. 3. 6. eating at kiosk #9...there are about 60 right down the road on hwy 3 east. 7. only eat at Richies if you want a great view but the weather needs to be nice. food was overpriced. The reasons i recommend renting a car is b/c the hotel wants to charge you like $45 per person just to take you to the rainforest when you can drive their in ten minutes for free..each excursions is like this, all you have to do is call them to reserve and then drive yourself. Also you can go to wal mart or walgreens and get snacks and drinks for a fraction of the price they charge you at the hotel..just get a styrofoam icechest and use the ice at the hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but with hidden expenses”
Reviews.Author: Shopgirl985
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a beautiful beach front resort located on hundreds of lush, beautifully landscaped acres. The beaches are beautiful and relatively uncrowded. Umbrellas, lounges, and towels are all provided free to guests. The resort itself is beautiful, and the rooms are large and nicely decorated, each with its own balcony. The resort offers a wide variety of activities available to guests for a price. The prices for activities such as horseback riding and kayaking were about twice that of local companies. The resort also charges anywhere from $15- $25 per day for parking depending on whether you self park, or have them park for you. Also, if you book through Priceline, they will charge you a 14% per day "compliment tax". Unlike many hotels, there is not complimentry breakfast, nor is there free internet. Overall, the resort was great, but I wish I had known before hand about all the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Never going here again”
Reviews.Author: isac012
Reviews.Content: This place was nice but the service!!!!?? Wow, the service was terrible. I'm hispanic so I'm not even being racist or nothing but the service was horrible. The "ocean Suite' we got had paint peeling from the ceiling in the shower, the patio was all dirty, no fridge in the room. The food over priced and not good, but the one thing that stood out the most was this dude at the front desk. I wish I remembered his name but that guy had attitude and was not helpful at all, they got our reservation wrong which made us leave a day sooner than planned. (thank God for our uncle who lives there and had a place to stay). But over all, not worth it. NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “No No DON'T DO IT!!!!! my husband and I...”
Reviews.Author: YoungHarmons
Reviews.Content: No No DON'T DO IT!!!!! my husband and I are at this "resort" right now 11:52pm puerto rico time on Aug 10, 2010 and on day two and we're writing this partial review right now while on our vacation to save someone else the irritation that we've gone through if thinking about coming to this hotel and if ur already booked to save u agony when u get here. I'll start with the positive (since it's such a short list)-- the bed is comfortable and it's a nice quiet place TO SLEEP, the property itself is pretty nice in itself and the golf course is insanely huge and beautiful (tho we don't golf), SOME of the staff is really nice and the service request girl answers the phone before it even rings, and the beach is pretty nice. Now the bad: Rent a car because this place will Nickle and dime u every chance they get, so save money and be less irritated eat elsewhere and hangout elsewhere case in point to re-heat my food ( there are no microwaves anywhere and the hotel charges $15 to reheat or heat anything if you didn't buy it here and there are NO refrigerators in the rooms they're a $20 daily charge). If u want a covered are at the pool that's a charge too(don't know how much bcuz wasn't paying for that either way!) my ocean view room that I paid an extra $350 is a building and pool view and u can only see the ocean if u step out into the balcony and look to the left. Parking is $15 a day for guests!! Concierge is NOT HELPFUL AT ALL!!! We spent three hours trying to book a ziplining tour and the asst manager had to come out and do their job. So now suggestions on how to avoid all the problems we've had the last two day ( and well write another review when our trip is done) : 1. Rent a car 2. Bring or purchase a cooler bag and ziploc bags to fill with ice and put in coooler bag daily therefore ur refrigerator. And know there IS A WALMART about 10-15 min from here 3. Book ur adventures/tours/excursions BEFORE you come because concierge is useless and will waste ur vacation time AND hotel prices are $35 and MORE PER PERSON GREATER THAN THEY ARE BOOKING YOURSELF. If you plan or want to do ziplining in el yunque like we wanted know there is only ONE company who does it at the rainforest. And book them before you leave for here because they were sold out for the solid week while we are here: yunque zipline 787-242-3368 and if ur unable to book with them as we were we found ON OUR OWN EcoQuest(which has great tripadvisor reviews btw) and the girl Erica was very patient and helpful number 787-529-2496. In my opinion this resort only deserves 3-3.5 stars max. And in day two of our vacation there have been enough problems that we've concluded that we won't be coming back here if we ever do puerto Rico again. On a positive note the island is beautiful(and we have much more to see ) and the local people have been really nice we've been having a great time except for when we're at the resort the room is an average room with a very average one sinked bathroom and a standard tub and shower combination there's nothing extraordinary about the room and the furniture is average so overall it's clean enough to sleep and stay but don't expect much else without feeling ripped off. The grounds ARE kept up pretty well from what we've seen and the walk on the beach was peaceful pools average but there IS A WATERSLIDE at one pool :). Will update if the stay gets any better. Hope this review helps someone avoid the issues we've had or the time that we've had wasted.

Reviews.Title: “It is what you make of it”
Reviews.Author: millslf
Reviews.Content: Overall this is an OK place. Like the title says though, it is what you make it. If you have already booked this hotel and are worried because of the mixed reviews....don't be. I was guilty of that and was pleasantly surprised. That being said here is all you need to know upfront. Rent a car, if you don't you will wish you had. The parking (if you are a guest) is 15.00 to self park and 20.00 for the valet. We did the valet. I was on vacation and I didn't want to deal with the hassle of self parking. If you are worried about driving in PR don't be. It is no different then driving in any major U.S. city. Getting to the resort from the airport is easy. PR26 to 66 to 3 if you want to pay a toll and save about 15 minutes. If you don't want to pay the toll then it's 26 to 3. Bring your GPS it helped us out a lot. Book all the tours you want...just not through the hotel. If you have a car you can book your own tours or self tour. We drove through the rain forest, hiked it, and did all the tourist stuff on our own. We met one couple on a trail to one of the waterfalls that had left their guide because he talked to much. We drove to Old San Juan ourselves(again not hard). Get a map from the concierge and follow the directions on the back. They will take you directly to a parking garage. We were there several hours and paid under 5 dollars. We also did one of the bio bay tours. I booked through one of the operators in my guidebook and it was 45 dollars per person. They gave us directions and we drove ourselves out there. The hotel wanted 99 dollars a person for this tour. Be sure you do this by the way. It was incredible not just for the glowing blue water, but for the experience of seeing what happens when you put 30 people, most of whom have no idea what they are doing, into kayaks at night, in pitch black dark and tell them to follow the leader....it was hilarious. That's all I will say about that. The reason you want to save money by booking your own tours is because as every other reviews states this place is expensive. I knew that going in and promised my wife I would not mention money once, it was hard. The truth is the prices are high but you have to know the secrets. Drinks-beer is cheaper at the tiki bar then the lobby bar. Medella, the local beer is cheaper than the rest and very drinkable. It is also 2 for 1 at the Tiki bar during happy hour making it a very reasonable 2.50 a can. Most liquor drinks are going to be about 10 bucks. They do have daily drink specials that can save you money. Rum punch was like 6.50 I think during happy hour and they would make it with 151. . During the day we made/brought our own drinks. Using our rental car we went to the grocery store (Amigo) and bought beer, snacks, and rum. The rum was dirt cheap there with decent bottles from 7-11 dollars. We also bought coke and coolers and for less then the price of one hours worth of drinks we were set up for the whole week. I never drank there before happy hour and saved a ton of money. Food- It is ok and depending on where you are from or where you are used to staying the food reviews will change dramatically. Breakfast, I didn't waste my money on. We bought croissants at the grocery store. Lunch, if you have to eat there is going to run you about 15 dollars a person before drinks. The food is decent but you are paying high end resort prices. If you have a car go out and get something from a roadside stall some place. Dinner, when we didn't leave the resort we either ate room service (not too unreasonable) or at the Italian place. If you live somewhere with a large Italian, or thinks they are Italian, population then you will hate this place and complain about it to everyone at the bar. If you are not one of those people then the restaurant isn't that bad. I have paid more, for worse Italian food and service. I enjoyed it, it was quiet, the service was good, and they had a couple of wines on special that we not as overpriced as the rest. You can get out of there with drinks and dessert for 80 dollars if you are smart about it. Where we live 80 dollars for dinner is not bad. Just a note about Riches to. It is up the hill and has a great view. It is easy to find because Richie has no fewer than 300 signs within five square miles of the hotel. The food is good but crazy expensive. If you have a car go for a drink and an appetizer to enjoy the view. Don't eat dinner there unless you really want to. The food there was about 30% more than the tourist restaurants in San Juan. Rooms-they were fine, not great, but fine. I didn't smell any damp, and I looked all over the place but couldnâ€™t find any mold. The A/C did just what we asked it to do, and the maid service was perfect. We had a rain forest view on the 6th floor. I recommend that you try to get as high as you can, so you can see something. We had a family with four kids next to us and we never heard them. The only time I could hear other people was when I was out on the balcony. Please folks, if you are going to yell at each other in anger or during "other times" close your balcony door. I honestly can only giggle at you for so long before I get annoyed. Service- no one ever offered me a timeshare. The concierge didn't like it when I asked for a map and not a tour. Other than that everyone was super friendly. The waitstaff was great when we ate, the bartenders were super friendly. Visit "big" Jose at the Tiki bar, you can't miss him and he will always remember what drinks you want. Fraliza(I might have misspelled this) at the lobby bar was always willing to help us figure out what to do while we were there. They all seemed to really care that we had a good time and enjoyed their island. The result was, we did. The beach is fine. It is not a pristine Caribbean beach, and it does not compare to any. It is a beautiful beach on the Atlantic. For those of you who frequent the Atlantic you will understand this. There was never a shortage of chairs or umbrellas. They have to pick up the chairs at 5 o'clock this time of year because of the sea turtles, that is a local law. I always saw people swimming until well after that though. The pools are way to small but as far as I could tell were open all night. We did late night swimming and were not the only ones out there. The adult pool had kids in it because their parents are the type that think they are better than everyone else and don't have to follow the rules. If you are one of these people, then I don't like you. If you like lounging by endless pools... go to Sandals, this is more of a beach place. Lots of kids, if you don't want kids go to Sandals. Overall had a good time. Clear your mind. If money is a concern and if it is going to bother you then don't go here. There are better deals out there and nothing ruins a vacation like worrying about money. Understand it going in, if you have to save money follow the reviews here like we did, and you will have a great time. Oh yeah, last thing. The casino is a huge rip off. The slots are tight, and the table games are empty. If you want to gamble find some guys playing dice in an alley....your odds will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: droman2010
Reviews.Content: We purchased points as part of a timeshare "trial period" and used some of the points here for a weekend getaway with our cousins. The resort is a little secluded so you must have a rental car, without a doubt. You have to pay for parking daily, which if you self-park, you could save a few bucks. Have to have your parking ticket validated at the concierge, even if you self-park. Rooms were nice- we had adjacent rooms with our cousins with a common door, but the rooms have thin walls and we could here if the 'discussion' next door got above a whisper. Rooms were a nice size, clean with good housekeeping services. Got to see iguanas from our hotel room balcony, and our view was to die for! The resort is large and could get noisy so if you are a lite sleeper you may want to stay on a higher floor. Had live entertainment in the lobby. It's right on the beach, and quite beautiful. 24 hour outdoor jacuzzi was awesome. Nice pools, but too crowded. Has a restaurant on site but was out of our price range, so can't comment to quality. We ate at more affordable places in the city. They have water equipment for rent, which we rented the kayak, which was fun until someone turned too fully and turned it upside down! My cousin was hit in the head with the kayak, but thankfully nothing serious happened since there's no lifeguards and there wasn't any staff around. Small area with a few computers with internet for everyone to use- I never had to wait to use one. El Yunque Rainforest was about a 30 minute drive from the resort. Overall, beautiful resort, and if prices are comparable to other local hotels, would definitely stay again. Considering our cost, it was a fabulous value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JulieBee813
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. My family and I enjoyed a relaxing oceanfront room, beautiful weather and we were so close to the attractions we wanted to see. The rainforest is very close, the ferry to Vieques and Cuelbra are just down the road about 20 minutes and San Juan is less than an hour away. My only regret is that we did not book this hotel for a few more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beaches and pool but room was lacking and service mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Philb19
Reviews.Content: Overall it was not an unpleasant place to stay but there were a few things that would make me think twice about staying there again. First the good: the beaches were nice and well maintain as was the pool. The hotel aside from being a little dated was clean. The food was decent and the wait staff was generally friendly and attentive. We used the shuttle service from the airport. When we got off the plane we were greeted by a representitive from the hotel and our bags were taken to the shuttle. We had to leave early in the morning for our return and the driver was there waiting for us. It was very user friendly. My wife used the Spa and was pleased with it. Like all Spas it was exspensive. Now the bad: From what I could gather the air conditioning in the rooms did not draw the moisture out of the room. We opened the door to the balconey ( beautiful view) and withing seconds the whole room was fogged up and every surface was wet. We knew it was because of the differance in tempature from inside to out. But after hours the moisture was still there. As time went on it got worse instead of better. By morning we actually had a visable puddle on the floor. The made mopped it up but by the evening the second day it was back. As you might imagine the bed linens drew moisture as well so we slept in a wet bed. I did not get much sleep during our stay and my wife developed a sore throat. The food was decent as I stated before but it was not nearly worth what we paid for it. We did not have a car so we had to bare it. Pluse we were on vacation so we did not let in bother us. I think that the two things that irritated me the most was the fact that the would not let us use the lounges on the beach after five o'clock so we moved to the pool only to find out that it also closed at dusk and we could not use it either. The pool bar also closed at five which left only the bar in the lobby to get a drink. Drinks were very expensive. $15 for a patron margarita and $10 for most mixed drinks. The casino was lacking but that was because they did not have enough buisness to keep enough of the games open. We didn't go there for that so it was not a big deal. If they fixed the A/C, lowered the prices a little bit and kept the pool open longer it would be a really good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: PicapiedraPR
Reviews.Content: food is HIGHLY overpriced, and parking lot is a mess. They charge $25 for valet and $20 for self parking, but they should not be charging at all due to the little parking space and its awful conditions. Besides that, everything else was fine. High prices on food forced us to drive out for lunch and diner, which allowed us to experience a lot more of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the quality of service..”
Reviews.Author: Lannes_Perlmutter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rio Mar for our honeymoon between July 26th to Aug 1st. We parked the car ourselves, saves you 5 dollars a day - $20 valet parking and $15 self parking - ( if you are going to Rio Mar DO RENT a car!). The employees at the parking don't speak English at all. I tried my poor Spanish but after the 3rd day I just pretended I couldn't understand them, once they are VERY annoying. We had no problems to check-in besides the long waiting line and the slow service to check in. We got a room on the 7th floor with mountain view, normal size room. Bathroom doesn't have fan, the ventilation is VERY loud and so is the plumbing. Every time the room aside of us used the bathroom we could hear it. Once you keep your balcony door closed, you have no problems with humidity. The pools were great, adult pool separated from kids pool and they don't allow kids in the adult pool. We saw the iguanas at the adult pool one day, they are big but if you don't get too close they don't bother you (I preferred stay away and we went to the beach that day).Beach was good, although a little dirty (empty cups and cigarettes ends everywhere). The water was amazing! Food at the hotel is EXTREMELY expensive. My husband and I paid $10/day for one small coffee and one small cappucino. I saw a lady paying over $58 for two donuts, two bagels with cream cheese, coffee and a bottle of water. I read some people saying good things about Richie's on the top of the hill, we checked it and found out its too expensive for the quality of food (They try to Americanize it and in the end has no flavor or special feeling). We found a place located on PR3 towards Fajardo where they have lots of kioskes (go during the day, at night may be a little too shady) and we went to Congas, AMAZING FOOD for a very reasonable price!! We went to a sales presentation and received a free massage at the hotel spa. Terrible massage by the way. You always have the option of choosing discounts or vouchers for the hotel. Employees in general are not very friendly and treat you with some attitude. Parking is extremely unorganized, each day we parked in a different area of the hotel, some days they gave us parking ticket, some days you don't even see the employees at all. Casino is kind of small, and smells like incense (yuck!). The computer area was working for the first day, after that they took ALL the computers at once to fix and when we left they weren't back yet. If you have Wyndham Rewards and paid for the trip through an agency you are not allowed to use your rewards for free wifi ($10/ day per room). Once the computers weren't working, I just took my laptop to the computer area and hooked it up to the internet cable. Free internet with my personal computer! :) The hotel was quieter during the week than on the weekend... Too loud music and people during the weekend. It was a nice place, but I've been to cheaper hotels with a better service.... About the activities, we booked our zip line adventure through Yunke Zipline Adventure, they don't answer their phones, no confirmation email, terrible service. We had to cancel.
