We then did the ATV in the rain forest with Dragonfly through the hotel, $195 for double ATV, if you book yourself you pay about $40 less, but it was a last minute deal, so... We also did scuba diving (Scuba discover, through Sea Ventures in Fajardo), they were awesome!!! Excellent service, very nice and friendly instructors and we paid $150/person once we were not certified.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: SCdeb
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival our room was fine, although my parents were placed in the wrong room type. They were allowed to move without a fuss. The service at the hotel was fine, the accommodations were also fine. The downside is that you're nickled and dimed at every turn and the food and alcohol is already overpriced. Especially the food for what it is. One example of having to pay for something that should be included was the parking deck. $15 a night for hotel guests - it seems this should be complimentary. It would be different if this were a deck in an urban area, but on a gated property, you would not assume parking would be additional. We did figure out that we could ask for and get extra rum in our drinks at the pool bar, which made everything slightly more tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much - and watch out for Mold”
Reviews.Author: mon08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and was disappointed in the staff and the rooms. Upon check in, I requested if it would be possible to be placed in a room with a view or at least one of their better rooms. This vacation was a special occasion and we were staying 4 nights. The woman at the front desk assured me I had a "really nice room" while handing me the key card. Instead of stepping into what I thought was going to be a "really nice room" I was hit with a wall of humidity/wetness and bad musty smell. I don't mean the tropical humidity that one could expect when traveling, I mean the room floor was damp, the counters were wet and it smelled musty. It had been raining for weeks in PR so I thought my standard room (without a great view) was normal to smell and feel humid. We had the worst night of sleep because of the lack of ventilation in our room. As I looked up at the ceiling after a horrible night's sleep, I saw black mold covering the ceiling of our room! We immediately packed and I requested to speak with a manager. The hotel manager was very kind and apologetic He changed our rooms as well as the other couple we were traveling with so we could be close to one another. Our next room was bigger and didn't have mold or a bad smell but our friend's room was a bit smelly. They didn't want to pack and move again so we all just dealt with it. What was most frustrating is the manager didn't offer anything for our inconvenience! No room credit, no discount on meals, no free parking... not even a free round of their expensive pina colada's! I've been traveling all my life but I guess sleeping in mold doesn't qualify for anything except the aggrevation of packing and changing to another room. TIP: if you are in a room where everything stays wet and it smells - check for black mold. Another huge upset - upon checking out, we received our bill which had a $100 credit listed on it. At that time I thought the hotel manager was being generous and gave us a free nights stay. Nope! The front desk never informed us of this credit upon check in and unless we used it for food and/or beverage, it would go to waste. So, instead of our huge bar tab that we paid cash for, we could have used the $100 hotel credit. I'm quite certain this was done on purpose. Why have the hotel come out of pocket for food and beverage when they already display very little gratitude towards their guests? The only positive aspect of staying at this hotel was the pool and beach. The iguana's and sound of coquis everywhere was relaxing and fun. Although one day I asked a staff member if someone could do a quick skim of the pool due to debris but no one bothered to show up. This was after two requests. Staying on their cell phone and ignoring the request was much more important than assisting a guest. With all my traveling and stays at the Marriott, not once have I experienced this much lack of regard towards guests. It is a good thing my next 4 days in PR was spent at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. I wished I had stayed 2 nights at this place and 6 at Caribe Hilton. The staff at the Hilton went out of their way to make sure guests were well taken care of. It was a perfect ending to a frustrating beginning!

Reviews.Title: “Victim of Wydham Credit Card "Hacker..."”
Reviews.Author: Chuck415
Reviews.Content: I called the Wyndham in regards to a letter they sent me about hackers getting personal and credit card information. They sent me this letter in June of 2010 a couple months after my January 2010 stay. A month after my stay there were fraudulent charges to my credit card and the credit card company cleared me of the fraudulent charges after 2 months of reviews. In the letter from the Wyndham they offered me a free membership to a credit protection company. Now I tried to book through the Wyndham after explaining to them all the trouble I went through and to see if there is any preferential rate I can receive to return to the Wyndham Rio Mar Beach Resort. I got a quick response of "Sorry we only offered the credit protection enrollment." Wyndham...I gave you my social security number for a credit check for your timeshare offers, I gave you $1600 for my last stay and almost put $1200 on this stay, and then you can't protect my credit card and social security information. I am saddened to never be able to trust or return to your resort Wyndham, but I am even more saddened by you acknowledging your responsibility and your lack of follow-up to the multiple charges you allowed on my credit card. If you decide to stay here PLEASE be careful with the information you provide the resort. (i.e. social security # for a credit check for their timeshare offer). Also, please don't let the Wyndham fraud change your opinion of Puerto Rico. Everywhere else we went in Puerto Rico didn't not give us this problem. Just make and informed decision is all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice destination”
Reviews.Author: BixUS
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and large rooms. Great pools. Access to beach but it was too windy when we went so we stuck to the pool. There is an adult only pool we never got to. Restaurants were nice and well appointed. Relatively limited children's menu and slightly pricey but better food than on a cruise ship. Casino on site - we didn't use. Great coffee shop - island brews. Nice stores including jewelry store (duty-free). Very convenient to El Junque, a rain forest. Just under 1 hour by car to/from San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise and iguana playground”
Reviews.Author: nordy62
Reviews.Content: Easy to find. Just 30 minutes from the airport. Adjacent to the beautiful rainforest! Beverages and food on permises were quite pricey but found plenty of quaint and reasonable eateries in surrounding towns. Richies, located up the mountain road from the resort had a fantastic view of the ocean and great food! Also located in Loquillo, was the Brass Cactus restaurant. Best bar grill on the south eastern end of the island. Hotel grounds were beautiful and very well maintained! Disappointed with the parking fees and garage was constantly flooded with water. Rent a car - it will save you tons of money in the long run. This was a nice and relaxing vacation for me and my better half.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star my @$$......”
Reviews.Author: Dramos631
Reviews.Content: My family and I are staying at this hotel because it came highly recommended, what a huge disappointment. The first night we arrive their was a problem with the keycard to get in the room. It took nearly 40 minutes to get in then another two hours for security and maintenance to fix the look. I had to cancel my dinner reservation. I finally had enough and went to speak with the manager,who seemed uneffected that a guest is inconvenienced at this hotel, the manager informed me the hotel was fully booked and nothing could be done until the next day. So we left to find a place to eat athentic Puerto Rican food and left them to continue working on the lock with assurance that upon our return it will be fix. When we return that night I had new key cards waiting for me at the front desk. The manager insisted the lock was fixed, and informed me our room will be upgraded the next day. Once we reached the room the new key card did not work ( what a surprise) and another 40 minutes later waiting in the hall for the maintenance person to unlock the door from the inside using a rod and string, yes my friends he went fishing for the handle. The next day we had to wait until 4:30 pm for our room to be switched, expecting an upgrade we got the exact same room layout with a different view, instead of a first floor pond we got a six floor ocean view, so once the curtains were closed the upgrade went away. No free wifi, no free refrigerator, no free parking, no free anything. So expect to bring extra cash. The rain this week didn't help much, lucky for us because the parking garage for guest, which is shared by casino patrons cost $15 a day for guest unless you valet then you only have to pay $25 a day what a deal, was flooded out and no one was permitted to park there. The island is beautiful and lots to do, unfortunately for us it rain the whole time we were here and the hotel did not have anything for my family to do, unless I wanted to take my six year old to the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay near the rain forest”
Reviews.Author: lovessmalltowns
Reviews.Content: I had a destination wedding at the amazing Hacienda Siesta Alegre near the Wyndham Rio Mar resort and we chose this hotel to have our group block for the wedding. Although communication with the block sales department was spotty months ago (the first agent we worked with no longer worked there, so there was some confusion about the block package but all that was worked out), our guests were all positive about the stay at the hotel, even our very well-traveled guests with great taste. Casino - small but decent. Nearly everyone I know who played won. The weekends were more happening, but there were only a few tables open during the weeknights, and even if there were people standing around wanting to play, no new tables were opened. Take a cooler with your own drinks because there was only one waitress getting drink orders and she never brought me my order. Pool - kids' pool has a slide and is right next to the adults' pool, which was great for us to be able to see everyone as we walked around. The Tiki Bar had good food but was really slow for lunch. I never really saw any waiters taking drink orders around the pool, so we brought our own coolers filled with beer and water and I don't think anyone said anything to us. They frequently ran out of towels on the weekend, but otherwise each room can get 4 a day (or more depending on who is staffing the area). There were many iguanas while we were there and they were quite entertaining. One jumped from the top of a palm tree into the water and swam through the pool to promptly get out. They didn't bother anyone and aren't dinosaur size as some say, but they do like food and might come towards you if you have some. The kids and adults in our party loved the slide, and people said the ocean was great. It rained every day that we were there, but sometimes the showers lasted 10 minutes and then the sun would come back out. A great pool and the grounds look spectacular. Parking - we had to deal with parking a lot as we actually stayed at a villa on the Rio Mar resort property several nights. We drove our golf cart over (dodging the numerous pot holes) and parked by the playscape, which was much easier, but we also used a few spots in front of the hotel or parked in the garage. Both times we validated our ticket and went to get the car, the gate was up so that we didn't even need to pay to get out. Check that first! By the last few days of our stay, it had rained so much that the garage was flooded with over a foot of water and they weren't charging people to leave or park in the overflow. Parking is hard to come by on the weekends. It is not far off and you don't have to walk far - just pay first and then take the elevator to the lowest level and walk to your car. Not difficult at all. Rooms - my mother-in-law said her first room smelled terrible so she was moved and eventually found a room that satisfied her. The ac thermostat on the wall might make you think you have control over the room temperature, but you really don't at all. My dad had issues with their room being too cold, and pointed out their thermostat wasn't working with the change of temperature, and the man at the hotel showed him it didn't matter what it is set on....so either it is on or off! We were to receive an upgrade to a 'junior suite' for our wedding package, and we actually received a major upgrade to the 'ocean suite' which was amazing. Came with fridge, coffee maker, separate bedroom, larger bath with sink/mirror on outside, amazing view and balcony...it was great. BTW, the floor numbers may be a bit deceiving. The lobby is actually on the 3rd floor, then there are floors 4,5,6, and 7 with rooms above. I think there are also rooms on 1,2, and 3, so definitely try to get higher. My MIL somehow got free internet by filling out some form but it took her awhile to get that to work. There are about 5 computers near the lobby with internet but they are always full. I can't really comment on the restaurants too much; several friends ate at Palio, the nice Italian restaurant, and their feedback was that it was salty and slow but really not that overpriced for a nice place. I think they got great service and loved the dessert. Mirabella was ridiculously slow for lunch when we went on a rainy day and they were dead, but our food took at least 45 minutes if not longer for burgers, soup, and a tuna sandwich. It was good though. The cold breakfast at Mirabella is included for our wedding block, which was nice for those guests who booked through the block, and they could upgrade to the full omelet/waffle/hot breakfast bar for $10 more. I did that one day and they didn't have pancakes or french toast so I was disappointed, but they had waffles, omelets, pastries, bacon, sausage, eggs, cereal, fruit, toasts, etc. One of my friends made the mistake of ordering off the menu and by the time she added up her meal, juice, and coffee, she would have been better off paying for the buffet. I loved the wrap I got at the little bakery/deli just outside of the casino. Know that you will pay more at the hotel, but the food is good and satisfying. Just invest in a good cooler or get the fridge for $10 a day so you can have your own beverages and perhaps breakfast. Other restaurants nearby - The hotel definitely is having issues with Richie's. We almost had our welcome dinner there, but our entire party ended up going there the night before. I ate with a group of 12 and our bill averaged out to $59 per person....some people got nicer seafood dishes, and all drinks are about $10. My margarita was great, but $59 for a margarita, beer, veggie burger, and a shared appetizer is a bit ridiculous. You are paying for the view, which is pretty great. I did get really sick the next day, so I am curious if Richie's was the reason.....we took cabs since the resort no longer lets the Richie's van on their property, and it was $16 for 5 of us to get there. I absolutely LOVED Antojito's restaurant which is at the bottom of the hill on the resort road off of #3. It was delicious and our food came out quickly even for our party of 10. My friends said theirs took forever, so who knows. It was probably my best meal and was $12. I loved it and wish I had gone back to try lunch and breakfast. Worth a cab ride and you will save money compared to hotel prices and get an authentic experience. Burger joint - Tattoo Tavern is supposedly the best kiosko to get a burger. I didn't go there but a local gave us the recommendation. Things to do - this is definitely a great hotel for going to experience the adventure nearby with ziplining, kayaking, hiking the rain forest, etc. I would be bored if I was just there for the resort. GET A CAR!!!!!!!! It is sooooo worth it to be able to explore different beaches and restaurants, and we even went to Old San Juan for an afternoon of shopping and dinner with friends; took only an hour without traffic on the way back. The resort is 35 min from airport if there is not traffic. We did Pure Adventure kayaking to the Bioluminescent Bay, did ziplining in Carolina at EcoTours, which was awesome and came with a tasty Puerto Rican lunch, and my friends did the rainforest and swam in the waterfalls. A few of my cousins did snuba and ATVing and like those activities too. When it was raining (which was all day for two of our days) there is nothing to do at the hotel. There is an outlet mall about 20 minutes back towards San Juan. Nightlife - There isn't really one at the hotel. The lounge near the lobby has some Latin dancing on the weekends and was pretty packed a few nights, but the place is dead during the week. The occupancy of the hotel determines what places are open and for how long (gift store closes earlier but is still open until 9). BTW take some Immodium AD with you as three of us had really bad experiences.....not sure what it was a result of. GOLF - my husband played twice and said the courses were good. Lots of iguanas out there too. FYI, the rental fee for clubs was waived, so if you don't want to take them, you can chance the free rental! Perhaps that was due to course condition with being wet. Couldn't play after Sunday as the course was pretty much underwater for the last two days due to the torrential rains that came through the area. Carts have GPS. Not fantastic courses but green fees were an adequate reflection of what you get. I liked San Juan but I enjoyed being closer to the rainforest and hearing the co-qui every night. They are amazing and I miss being lulled to sleep with their songs! I couldn't imagine paying the high season rates for the Rio Mar, but it was a great stay for our wedding group in July.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely do your research! A great 'get-away' destination.”
Reviews.Author: MrsWTT
Reviews.Content: First off - thanks to many travelers and reviewers on here so offered tips and suggestions for making a stay at the Rio Mar enjoyable! Some people come here to complain, but no one offers suggestions on how to make it better.. so I'd like to add my review of this trip with some ideas on what to do as well! RENT A CAR!!! - seriously! But it's probably safer and easier to rent from a company located at the airport. We went through Target/Economy rental cars (because of the cheap rate through Orbitz) and found ourselves in a sketchy side of town off the main Rt. 26 freeway. Finding the location to return it was horrendous, wished we went through a big name like Hertz or Avis located in the airport! Be warned - the drivers are HORRENDOUS! Some drive 100 mph on a local road, others will go 20 mph on the highway. Some dont' believe in the lane lines while others will iterally stop in the middle of a busy road, park, and get out to do business in the shops. Get a small car if you can, makes for easier parking and manuvering. The winding mountain roads are scary to manuever and be cautious when you get to those sharp curves, because you never know who is flying down the road! DIRECTIONS!! - if you do plan on driving yourself - make sure your directions are CLEAR and make sure you are choosing the correct route. We went through Garmin GPS for the first leg and got lost. Called the hotel and they told us to put in "Calle Yunque" and it literally brought us to a neighborhood's dead-end. Finally found "Rio Mar" in the lodgings section of the Garmin localsearch and made it there after an hour of being lost. If you want to take the "scenic/local" route like we did, then do this: from airport - take 26 to 187. 187 has lots of local beaches and kioscos to stop at to try the local flavor. Then right on 188 and left on Rt. 3. Follow Rt. 3 for about 10 miles and then you'll see the Rio Mar entrance on the left. PARKING!! - We arrived on a Sunday and had to drive around the the ONLY self-parking lot for about 15 mins before we finally found a nice gentleman who told us he was leaving and we could have his spot. The problem is that lots of locals take day trips to Rio Mar for the beach/pool/casinos and they fill up the self-parking lot. So either come really early or wait till late. The next day, due to the massive amount of rain, we were wading through that basement garage in water up to our ankles! Because it was a Monday, the place emptied out and finding parking was easier. Yes, it is $15 a day to self park. FOOD/DRINKS!! - The resort prices are horrendous! So expensive!! Plus, the only place I was interested in eating at was Shimas, and they were closed! If you plan on renting a car, make sure you stop at the Amigo on Rt. 3 (Amigo is their version of Walmart) and pick up necessities for snacking and drinking. A small bag of chips in the gift shop was $1.50. Bottled water was $3. Definitely treat yourself to one nice dinner on site, but don't be surprised if the food is "so-so". Vacation drinks (pina coladas, rum runners, mojiotos) were $10 for a small glass, beer was $7. We picked up a bunch of empanadas and plaintains in the Luquillo kioscos and had a great dinner for under $10! Antojitos at the bottom of the hill before Rt 3 was alright. We went at 11:30am expecting a lunch menu, but they were still serving breakfast. It took 45 mins to get my cold french toast and my husband's meal took another hour. There was a screaming toddler behind us, which made the experience bad, not to mention it started to pour down rain and we got soaked in our outdoor seating area! We didn't eat out again until the Luquillo Kioscos then a nicer meal in Old San Juan the following day. BEACH/POOLS!! - I wish I could say something about this, but it there was thunderstorms and lots of rain during our entire trip there. We never got to enjoy it. ROOMS!! - Request a 7th floor Ocean-Side room. We had mountain side. It was great to listen to the coqui frogs and "rainforest" sounds at night! Our room was literally above the valet entrance, so in the mornings, it was very loud with horns honking trucks moving in and out. Our room was clean, no complaints. Yes, I wish they had more towels. The tub/shower drain didn't close, and the water was slow to drain. I loved their "True Blue Spa" toiletries from Bath and Body Works, smells good! We had no issues with ice machines. I tipped the maid $2 the next day returned to extra towels, and more toiletries. They charge for internet. TV had basic cable. Balcony was nice for stepping outside, but no cover from the rain. CASINOS!! - Awful. There was one $5 Black Jack table, one $10 Roulette table, and one $15 3-card Poker table that was always empty. The place is crawling with local slot machine addicts who take up 3-4 machines at a time. There was BINGO night, and everyone was using the slot machines as their personal chairs/tables/bingo center. I love my slots, but it wasn't worth fighting with grandma. DAYTRIPS!! - El Yunque was closed when we tried to visit on Monday due to the torrential downpours, mudslides, downed trees, and possible flooding. Luquillo was okay, nice local flavor, but very dirty and smelly. Old San Juan was my favorite! If we go back, we're staying around there! Concierge had great driving directions to the main destinations! General resort comments: Lots of families and unsupervised kids. If you're looking for someplace romantic, you won't find it in the lobby or the main areas. The internet banks are constantly swamped with teenagers giggling over porn. The line to check-in was long with only 1 person working (at 3pm which was PRIME check-in time!). I watched one unsupervised toddler yank out a handful of flowers from the large vases and decor in the lobby and he proceeded to throw dirt all over the place. If it's raining, then you're pretty much screwed. Alot of the tours got postponed or cancelled altogether because of weather conditions. There was always a line at the front desk and phones were always busy. The bed was AMAZING! I got the best sleep there! I wish the weather cooperated with us. I guess I'm a little upset about this trip because we got no sun and no chance to really relax on the beach. But if you're looking for a place where you're okay with spending lots of money on sub-par service, then go to Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “boring!”
Reviews.Author: PR712
Reviews.Content: This hotel was boring! If you're looking for fun and entertainment, don't stay here. There was absolutely nothing to do. Parking during the weekends was ridiculous. Couldn't find a parking spot and ended up parking in the employee/overflow parking lot. Had to call the front desk daily for towels since we were always a towel short. If you can, stay in old San Juan, lots of fun, night life and entertainment. But stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: san1101
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. I traveled with my fiancee, my sister, husband and their teenage girls. The hotel is located 45 mins from the airport in the most poorest area of the island. The restaurants prices were exhorbatant, even for NY prices. The room didn't even include a mini bar unless you decided to rent one. There is no where to go within walking distance to the hotel. If you do decide to drive and look for a restaurant you need to drive 45 minutes away from the resort to find acceptable places to eat. We travel often and are flexible with regard to accomodations, etc. this resort left a lot to be desired. They even charge $20/day to valet and if you park your car in their garage it costs $15/day. On a Monday morning with a long line at the front desk there was only one person manning the desk. Our recommendation, definitely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Try someplace else”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelerL
Reviews.Content: I was attending a business conference, and had some time for leisure activities on this trip. When I checked in with the corporate group, the hotel staff was very pleasant. When my guest and I were on our own, at restaurants, walking the halls, or requesting room cleaning, the staff was quite rude. Prices were obscenely inflated on the resort property, and as other reviewers stated - it's very difficult to get anywhere without a rental car. The biggest problem was cleanliness - on the beach, in the adult pools and especially in the room. The bathroom had visible mildew, and smelled of it. The walls did not seem insulated at all. It sounded as if the people in adjacent rooms were in ours. The pipes in the walls were very noisy, and during the night, they would make knocking, whistling, and whining sounds that were very loud and disturbing. We may have been near to the pipes for the washing rooms or the kitchen, but regardless, these should be insulated. We did not get one good night's sleep. The floor was dirty, mostly in the bathroom, and this could be seen very clearly around doorways and in corners. When we checked into the room, there was a large dead insect behind the toilet. Four days later when we checked out, it was still there. I told the front desk about these problems, and they apologized, but the hotel was full at the time and they could not move us. I then wrote a letter of complaint when I returned home. The customer service representative, Tammy Forrest, responded to me. She thanked me for my feedback, and offered a "goodwill" gesture of giving me 1 night's stay in the form of a voucher - if I provided a receipt or credit card statement showing how much I paid! How rude! She knew darn well that this was a corporate stay, and the company paid for it - I said so. A customer service employee who is capable of giving out vouchers cannot make contact with someone in her own company to find out how much 1 night's stay cost? I responded and told her that I didn't have the info, and she would have to contact the hotel to find out. Two months later, she hadn't responded to me at all, and I still hadn't received a voucher. I emailed her again saying I haven't heard back, and I haven't received anything in the mail, so I'm assuming the matter has been dismissed? She replied that she would mail me a voucher for $100 and that I would receive it in 2-3 weeks. It's been 5 weeks and still no voucher. She managed to take a bad situation and make it worse. I guess terrible customer service runs rampant throughout the Wyndham brand. I would recommend that businesses find better location for corporate events, where the guests will be treated better, and the company will not be bamboozled into spending tons of money on rooms that are not properly cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Great but know before you go!”
Reviews.Author: nckyva
Reviews.Content: We (family with 2 kids 15 and 12) stayed here for five days during spring break. Cannot stress enough that this can be a wonderful place to stay AS LONG AS YOU READ THE REVIEWS AND PLAN AHEAD!. First of all, you must rent a car unless you are independently wealthy and/or plan to never leave the resort.. We flew into San Juan and had reserved a moderately-priced car online with Hertz, no issues, hassle free arriving and departing. Took about an hour to get to the resort. The traffic once you get off the toll highway can be heavy. The resort and the grounds are beautiful! We booked through Cheap Caribbean and knew going in we booked a very basic package but we were pleased. We arrived around 2 pm, our room was ready and we were upgraded to a mountain view room on the 4th floor. I would say you would need to be on the 4th floor or above to get the benefits of the ocean or mountain view rooms, so be aware of that. We ate at the pool snack bar/restaurant-knew it would be over-priced and it was, but the food was good and we were starving! We had already booked a bioluminscent bay tour in Fajardo for that evening, we stopped at the little restaurant at the bottom of the hill for a cheap dinner-nothing special but inexpensive compared to the resort. Had a bit of trouble locating a parking spot and finding our kayaking company in Farjardo but we did cut it close on time. Loved the tour, a once in a lifetime experience but be warned that it is kayaking in the dark, not for small children. With all the exercise we slept very soundly! We did hear some hall noise and some noise in the room next to ours but it was not excessive. Our room had a walk in shower and the water did leak out onto the floor, we called for extra towels and made a barrier, that took care of the problem for us, we discussed asking for another room but we LOVED the mountain view so much-literally we sat out on the balcony every chance we had-we decided to stay. The next day we drove back into San Juan to tour the Spanish Fort. On the way out we picked up breakfast at the bakery at the foot of the hill. Yummy and inexpensive! The San Juan trip is the only thing I would not do again, the drive was long and it rained on the way making the trip more than an hour. It was very hard to find a parking place in San Juan. However the fort was interesting once we got there and we had some great cheap food for lunch in a small cafe. We spent the afternoon at the beach/pool. We had drinks in a cooler, although the resort did have a good happy hour special each day we were there on rum punch, pina coladas and the local beer. Other than the happy hour special the drinks were very expensive. We went to the Amigo grocery store for our supplies, very quick in and out, others have suggested Wal-Mart but I couldn't face Wal-Mart on my vacation! That night we went to the kiosks for dinner, which I recommend for the atmosphere and the food. We went to a burger place to save money and it was very good, but we talked to people at the resort who went to very nice places and had wonderful seafood. The kiosks vary widely on food, price, and quality so ask around before you go. The next day we had booked an Eastwinds snorkling excursion. We had coffee from the snack bar by the casino and some fruit and breakfast bars we got from the Amigo for breakfast, lunch was provided on our snorkeling tour. Book everything yourself, you save a ton of money and it is very easy. We used our phones that had internet, but the concierge will give you a sheet with phone numbers of all the tour companies. We had never snorkeled and loved it! Initially we were disappointed that the sailing boat was full so we were on the motorboat, but that turned out to be to our advantage because we moved faster and got in more snorkeling time and got back earlier to enjoy more beach time at the resort. We liked the beach, it was clean when we were there. It was not crowded but certainly full. If you wanted more privacy all you had to do was walk to the left or right and set up your chair in a secluded spot, there was even shade available if you were willing to walk and find it. That night for dinner we ate at a horse ranch right down the street someone on the beach recommended. It was really good, and a neat experience, but not inexpensive. The third full day we went to the rain forest national park which is only about a mile or two from the hotel. We hiked and had a great time! Beautiful and very cool in the higher elevations. Very steep hike but worth it. Got sandwiches from the little bakery for lunch and ate them on our balcony, spent the rest of the day at the beach/pool. That night we treated ourselves to dinner at Palio. It was an awesome meal! The only misstep was the bottle of red wine we ordered came to the table quite warm, I thought that was odd given the otherwise superior food and service (and prices)! Probably should have said something but we didn't, just put ice cubes in our glasses! The only unpleasant experience we had was that twice in the late afternoon while reading a book I was accosted by an employee who insisted he had to "take my chair" because they were clearing the beach. They were clearing the beach, but I noticed the first time it happened that he was approaching women alone and standing there leering as the women stood up, put their things away, etc. When it happened to me the second time (same man!) I went to the front desk and complained. The female manager was very nice, she called the manager of the beach/pool area and I explained what had happened. They told me local laws required that beach be cleaned by a certain time, I told them I had no problem with that but clearly this man was not behaving in an appropriate manner. I really don't know if they took me seriously but they listened respectfully and offered us a free buffet breakfast a Mirabelle's the next day. We did appreciate that since we were planning just to pick up a cheap fast-food breakfast the next day on our way to the airport. It was a good breakfast, but I wouldn't pay the full price ($22) for it. I think this resort is very nice. It is true that the food and drinks and parking are expensive, but they have to make money to keep up the grounds and keep up the quality of the food. The few meals we did eat on the resort were certainly delicious. I don't think the reviews emphasize enough how beautiful the grounds, the pools, and the hotel are and that you are in a prime location with a view of the ocean and the mountains! If the prices are going to bother you either book an all-inclusive somewhere else or plan to eat most of your meals off-site. The whole time we were there we saw tons of families having a great time just like we were. We talked with lots of folks on the beach and at the pool and except for the griping about the prices of the food and alcohol people seemed pretty satisfied. We heard lots of positive things about the kids club but ours were too old for that. One day our room was not made up in the morning and I called and it was cleaned promptly after that. So many people in the reviews complained about the cleanliness but if they are willing to come and clean promptly when you are dissatisfied seems like it shouldn't be a deal-breaker. The employees do expect tips, Puerto Rico has a very high poverty rate and these are low-wage employees. The iguanas did not bother us, when we were there we saw them every day but not so many that they were annoying. We had a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location to outdoor adventure”
Reviews.Author: TeamExploration
Reviews.Content: This hotel acted as a great central location for my family - two adults and two kids (7 and 4 yrs) - for our outdoor explorations. Each morning we were in the hotel's activity pool (kids love the slide!) or on the beach behind the hotel. We rented two wave runners there at the hotel for 1/2 hour and had an amazing time (something we have never done before). Afternoons we hiked in El Yunque, toured the forts in Old San Juan, and tried unsuccessfully to take the ferry to Culebra from Fajardo. We did not dine at the hotel (because of reviews of high cost plus we prefer to experience local cuisine from local restaurants whenever we travel) and instead we used TripAdvisor for all our dinners and were very successful in nearby Luquillo (Pueblo y Pasta, Lolita's, and El Jefe Burger), Fajardo (Metropol)and Old San Juan (Parrot Club). Walmart (open past 9pm) is in the Walgreens plaza in Fajardo and this is where we shopped for groceries for breakfast, lunches, drinks, and snacks for the backpacks. The hotel provided a refrigerator at our request for a fee. The hotel does have self-parking and we were not charged a daily fee (couldn't tell if this was waived due to our summer rate we received for the room or not).

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar - Gran Melia - El Conquistador Tour”
Reviews.Author: djsdirect
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled over the 4th of July and Rio Mar was one of 3 resorts we stayed in. Our first couple days were at the Gran Melia (sol melia vacation club) and our next stay was at Rio Mar for just one night. We arrived later in afternoon around 4 and it was drizzling so I really don't have much to say about to pool but did notice they had the adult pool right next to the main pool and it looked well kept with lots of chairs and just steps from the beach. As far as the beach, it is very similar to the beach in Punta Cana Dominican Republic. I've uploaded a picture so feel free to check it out. I LOVED not seeing any other hotel on the beach ....just a big beach with lots of trees. The beach is so much better than the beach at Gran Melia. We stayed in a basic room and it was nice, air conditioning was awesome, and it was spacious but nothing fancy which i don't care much for since we only slept and showered in. As far as the hotel, I was SO surprised how beautiful it was. Gran Melia was beautiful also but this had an elegance that the Gran Melia didn't have. We are big fans of both resorts. We did like the eating spot right out the gate down the hill on the left. Again, we only stayed one night but it was a tour and I checked out the entire facility and took lots of pictures. The service was REALLY good and it was not as crazy as the Gran Melia. We spent an hr. in El Conquistador to check out the resort and it was nothing comparable to Gran Melia or E.C. E.C was aged and just all out hectic it seemed. Feel free to email or contact me here if you have any questions about the resort or Puerto Rico in general. We did old san juan, rainforest, culebra island, etc. [-]. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but there are much better”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugTim
Reviews.Content: Ok, here is my review, we just got back yesterday, and was very happy to be back. Let's start with when we arrived, I booked thru Cheap Caribbean, and it was a good deal so I thought. We arrived at the hotel and they didn't have my reservation, and of course using my blackberry with the booking ID on it, I thought they would be able to look it up. Fat chance, they made me sign up for a timeshare presentation just to get it printed on there computer so that I could check into a room I already paid for. Anyway, they still couldn't find it, but gave us a room anyway. The room was about as nice as a Hampton Inn for the interior, nothing special. Let's move on to the timeshare scam. All of the front desk and concierge will tell you about this "great continental breakfast" for couples, but what they don't tell you is that its not a continental, its a few muffins still in plastic wrap, and you have to sit there for two hours while they intensely pressure you into buying a timeshare points program from the Wyndham Vacation. Ours was over two hours and I just wanted to leave. The guy came back and told me that I had to put down $7k just in closing costs, which as I know is high even for a home equity, much less a $20k timeshare. Either way, stay away from that. So onto the hotel and beach resort, lobby is nice and open, the staff is very friendly. There is a tiny casino with much different rules on blackjack than I have heard of, so I stayed away. The hotel food, stay away from Shima, unless you want to pay for over priced Pad Thai, like $20 a plate of the worst Pad Thai you have ever eaten. Who goes to Puerto Rico and has Asian food? The one restaurant I would recommend if you don't have a car and can get off the resort is Marbello, its actually really good, but again, its pricey. Also don't get conned into going to Richy's, very very overpriced. I would recommend even taking a cab and going to the kiosks in Luquillo which is like 3 miles away and great local food for about $30, you can get a nice meal for two with apps and drinks, very cheap. If you go into Luquillo square area, there are a few places there and everyone speaks English, plus its even cheaper, maybe $15 for two meals. For breakfast, there is a little bakery at the bottom of the hill on the corner of Rt 3 and 968 called Isamar Bakery, great breakfast for a total of $10 for two. Marbello will charge you $22 a head for a good buffett of breakfast, however, not worth it. Proximity to anything. Not really, except for El Yunque Rainforest which is pretty much right across the street. If you are going to Culebra for a day sale or the ferry, you are about half hour and that is fine. It's not a bad drive at all. From San Juan, its about 45 minutes and not bad either. However, if you are looking to really explore past those two areas, you're going to need a rental car and drive quite a bit. I highly recommend driving a couple hours over to Jobos beach, its amazing and much better beach than you will get at the Wyndham or around San Juan. Beaches, which is why your down there, don't stay at the Wyndham, not a good beach and it's the Atlantic, if you are content with the pool, do that a few days and definitely take a day sale over to Culebra with East Island Excursions, they are great and good priced, but you can book separately and it will save you $50 a person. Let me go to value, there are hidden charges that others have eluded to including parking, make sure you park your own car, this will save you $10 a day, since its $15 a day if you are a hotel guest, $25 for valet, just take a left at the fork when its says parking. Also if you don't book thru a travel package, there is a 15% room cleaning fee that they tack on. I heard a few people yelling about it. Oh and before I forget, the drinks at the bars are $10 a pop, my recommendation and this is what we did after buying 4, was going to the supermarket, IE Ralph's and buying our own there, it was literally the cheapest Rum and Cokes I have ever bought, since Rum is made there, its very very cheap. Don Q was the best for mixing. Internet is non existent here unless you have brought your own jack to hook up to the ethernet, sorry no IPods or IPads here, no wireless. The golf courses are nice, big plus for me, as I am an avid golfer, they have a Tom Fazio course and a Greg Norman course, both are fun, probably in the area of 128 slopes, so fun, but not overly challenging. Don't even bother with the gym, just run on the beach or swim, the gym is terrible for a YMCA gym in Compton. Hopefully this helps. If you don't want to do anything but relax and quiet, this is probably a good place, however, if you like to explore, I would suggest the Conquistador in Fajardo, or Condado area which has a decent beach and is close to everything in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Del Mar resort not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Busterandapple
Reviews.Content: We will never return. We had an expensive mask and snorkel stolen from the room. Security came and said no one on the staff snorkels so couldn't believe that, but had it been a watch, perhaps! All they will do is investigate the incident. Then a couple of days later, saw a guest dealing with a car window smashed. The car was parked in hotel garage. That night before saw the bell man chasing after a car leaving resort and some guy running away! Not only the crime, but when we arrived on 7/4 there was no parking so had to park in a grass area with other guests. A few days later the put a boot on tire! They were constantly doing this to people parked in what appeared legit spaces even with no "no parking signs". The rainforest rooms overlook the entrance and as another person has written, it is noisy and they have loud construction going on with no mention of it! The beach was just ok, but there is a lot of trash. Plus we were here around a holiday and the public beaches afterwards are nasty for many days after! Oh and one more thing, the adjacent villas share facilities so it can be packed on beach and pool. We Gand another part of our trip on another part of the island with issues also. Will not be back to PR. There are a few nice places here, but not enough to make up for the problems. Way too many other closer islands to see and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Bedding from previous guest, horrible serive, hidden fees and thieves.”
Reviews.Author: eguard
Reviews.Content: Undisclosed 14% resort fee, 20 dollar a day undisclosed parking fee, Bedsheets from the previous guest were not changed, how did I know, my room and my families room both beds were full of hair. Maides get paid by the room. And when we stepped out of our room, my sisters camera was stolen. When we asked for a police report to be taken the hotel gave us the runaround. After insisting on a police report we were continually reminded that PR is not like the states. "What does that mean" I asked to speak to a manager and illianet the day manager responded by saying that I could complain all I wanted because she was thick skinned. "Go with the Holiday Inn" this place is HORRIBLE. The only positive thing I can say is that the grounds are beautiful. If you want nice grounds go visit El Yunque dont pay for this no class resort!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So great we had to go back a second time!”
Reviews.Author: cman1714
Reviews.Content: Im going to make this short and simple. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Everything was great! to the pools, landscaping, food(palios-the italian place was the best.) Even the beach was very nice. I had a great ocean front room, not alot of money the second time around because we were second timers. i recomend the rainforest, so beautiful with waterfalls and wild life. Also they have alot of activities for kids. Ex: Bingo, feeding iguanas, waterslides, and fun movie nights at the pool. Around Christmas time the resort is decorated to the T. the buffet all of the way on the quiet side is the best! Also by the pool if you want lunch you can order it and just watch your kids swim, or you can stop by the little lunch place for some tuna, burgers, salads .. the good stuff! Everything is very good, and well worth it. If you go you will enjoy it .. i guarentee it. I hope my advice will pursuade some of you who are discouraged by the other stupid reviews. HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon, but read this review for valuable advice!”
Reviews.Author: erik3putt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon in Puerto Rico and stayed at the Rio Mar. We were there 6/26/10 â€“ 7/3/10. If you are heading to the Rio Mar and reading this, you are definitely on the right track. I did a lot of research online, reading reviews and searching as much stuff as I could think of before heading down, which helped tons. So much in fact, we felt compelled to share our experience in hopes of helping others. You must rent a car and get a fridge for your room! Much cheaper than cabs and getting transportation to any excursions you may do. The fridge is pretty big and you can fit a lot of stuff. Our flight arrived at 11:30 p.m., if you can get in earlier I highly recommend it as it is very dark, roads are not marked very well and the scenery is incredible. The room we thought we had booked and confirmed, ocean view, high floor, king bed was not held for us! Supposedly the rooms are on a first come, first serve basis if you are travelling through Wyndham. Not sure how it works if you are through the hotel but they are 2 separate entities. We were put on the 2nd floor that night and promised they would move us up higher the next day. We were very happy to be moved up to the 7th floor with an incredible ocean view. If you want a good view of the ocean, you must be on the 6th or 7th floor as the palm trees are so tall. Self parking is very easy to do and not a long walk at all. Will save you $5 per day plus tipping the valets. The casino in the resort was fun and we about broke even for the 3 or 4 nights we went. The little cafÃ© next to the casino was great, decent prices for a resort and very good sandwiches and wraps. Great ham, egg and cheese croissants for breakfast and pretty good pizza. The gift shops by the elevator to self parking and the one by the pool had some really nice things and surprisingly, very reasonable prices. There is a Walgreens and local Amigo grocery store a few miles east on Rt. 3. We bought all of our beer, water, and snacks there. We also bought a small collapsible cooler and packed it full of beer every night we stayed at the resort and took it everywhere. Yes, you can drink your own beer in the casino! Beers at the resort bars are $7 - $8 each. We only charged the fridge and parking to the room. Be sure to check your room charges, we got charged valet parking every day when we did self parking. Was an easy fix though through the front desk. Sign up for Wyndham By Request and bring your assigned number, gets you free internet for your room. One last thing about Rio Mar, we never found a working ice machine. Literally thought we were on hidden cameras and a joke was being played on us. We ended up going to the bar and they were more than happy to fill our cooler for us. It is customary to tip everyone, starting with the bus driver to your rental car! We experienced some of the best food ever in Puerto Rico, extremely fresh and full of flavors. We did not eat in any of the main restaurants at the resort, just the cafÃ© as I mentioned. Richieâ€™s is a 2 minute drive up the mountain from the self parking garage, turn right out of the resort. Incredible, open air restaurant with very friendly staff and what a view! The food was super and prices were reasonable. Antojitos is at the bottom of the mountain from the resort just before you get to Rt. 3. Also awesome food and crazy cheap. We had a fantastic local lunch with 2 sodas and a $5 tip for $18! The Kioskos are the place to go. We felt everything looked pretty dirty off the resort and the Kioskos are no different. There are over 60 of these Kioskos on the left side of Rt. 3 and very easy to get to. #2, La Parilla and #12, El Jefe Burger Shack are the best. Tim and Sheri own El Jefeâ€™s and one of them is always there. Good people and super food at both, also very clean. Excursions, we went on a 2 hour ATV tour through El Yunque. Hacienda Carabali was the company and they were a 10 minute drive from the resort. They also do horseback tours for a more tame experience. We had an absolute blast on our own ATVâ€™s cruising through rivers, puddles, holes, jungle and incredible views. You stop to swim in a crystal clear river with a huge rock you can jump off. Alfredo was our guide and he was great. We also only had 5 total ATVâ€™s in our group which was nice. We took East Wind excursions for a snorkel trip, wanted to go to Culebra but the seas were too choppy. Instead went to 3 other stops to swim and snorkel and it was paradise. Every picture we took look like screen savers! The motorized Catamaran was the way to go as you get to places much faster. Lastly, the Caribbean Trading company was a very unique gift shop. Just go straight across Rt. 3 from the resort and follow that road to the right, it is on your left hand side. Very cool, local artisan things as well as your regular touristy gifts. The concierge at the resort can give you lots of good things to do but book the trip yourself, much cheaper. I think thatâ€™s it, enjoy Puerto Rico and the Rio Mar!!

Reviews.Title: “Our party of 15 arrived at this resort on...”
Reviews.Author: DaniKi
Reviews.Content: Our party of 15 arrived at this resort on July 1 for a bachlorette party. Our rooms (8) were not ready. A few of the rooms did not become available until 7:30 at night (we arrived at 1:00 pm). The room was clean enough but, our in-room safe was broken, the tub leaked, and the bathroom smelled like sewage. This resort really doesn't have any night activities, other than a casino. Getting off the resort to go to clubs, restaurants, and even the grocery store was a NIGHTMARE. The taxi prices were ridiculous. A trip to the grocery store five minutes away cost 4 people $20 round trip. A trip to Old San Juan to visit Brava night club at the Waldorf Astoria was $308 round trip! Prices were extremely high and options were limited. The resort has one restaurant that offers breakfast. Needless to say, the wait time to actually eat breakfast was often so long that it carried over to lunch time. The lobby bar served fingerfood and the pool side bar served lunch. A burger here is $14. Why does this resort not have an all-inclusive package? Unfortunately, I would never come back to this resort and I would not recommend that others come either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: profesc
Reviews.Content: I am truly confused by the negative reviews of the Wynham Rio Mar. Our visit was fabulous! The staff was very attentive, especially Daisy, Marilyn and Maria at concierge. We really planned for our trip and took the advice of the TripAdvisor members. That is the key. You may want to consider renting a car for at least part of the trip. We rented a car for three days. Javier with Enterprise was very helpful. He recommended that we reserve a car online for a lower price. You can find him in the lobby of the hotel. There is a fee for parking. The fee is $15 for self-parking and $20 for valet. You receive one night complimentary parking with a rental from Enterprise. Our room was cleaned each day to our satisfaction. If you have a car, you can do the El Yunque hike on your own. There is really no reason to book through the hotel. El Yunque is amazing. You may want to research other options for tours. If you use a taxi, please be sure that your expectations are understood. We used a taxi for the Bacardi/Old San Juan tour. We were overcharged for the service that we received. We decided to do the tour again but through the hotel. If you aren't interested in the Bacardi tour, you should opt for the Old San Juan shopping tour. You can purchase rum at the airport for about the same price as you would pay at the factory. Old San Juan is absolutely beautiful! We also drove to Fajardo one mroning. We were looking for the lighthouse but we weren't able to find it. We only ate a few meals at the resort. ERL is a good choice for a quick breakfast to go. It is located outside the casino. Upon our arrival we had lunch at the Tiki bar. The food was very good. We had dinner at Palio (Italian). It was excellent. The atmosphere was nice and the service was very good. You are able to purchase half portions. On the last morning, we had the breakfast buffet at Marbellas. It was another wonderful experience. The prices were what you expect to pay at a resort. On the first night we ate at Riches. We took a cab, but later saw a sign for free transportation. The food was average but the view was magnificent. We ate at the kiosks at Luquillo twice. We had dinner at La Parrilla. It was very good. We had lunch at Congas. It was very good as well. In Old San Juan we had lunch at Barrachina. The first pina colada was made there. The food was excellent, especially the black bean soup. On our second trip,we ate at The Parrot Club. The food was good and the portions were very large. My favorite meal was at the Hacienda Carabali. The churraso was so delicious. Two mornings we ate at Isamar Bakery as suggested by the reviews. The food is good and reasonably priced. One morning we ate at Antojitos. The food there is good and reasonably priced also. Both are near the resort. We also went to Amigo grocery store (associated with Walmart) to buy water, drinks, etc. Near there is a small restaurant ( mainly carryout) called La Verde. The food is excellent. Since my friend and I are both Spanish teachers, we were mainly interested in the culture and sightseeing. We did visit the beach and pool area some. The Internet lounge is always busy. At times the computers don't work properly. If you need something printed, the concierge staff would be willing to help you. We really had a wonderful experience and are looking forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not go here!”
Reviews.Author: MarynMikeS
Reviews.Content: We planned and planned our perfect vacation to have it all go wrong. The hotel room was OK, kind of like a Holiday Inn, but the beach was filthy! Yes, filthy with styrofoam, bottles, shoes, paper etc. We did not even get into the water because of all the trash washing ashore from the rivers. We traveled to a local beach and found conditions even worse. When I asked the hotel why the beach was not maintained, the response was "The sea will wash it away in a couple of days!" All our excursions were cancelled with no reason given. We flew home after 2 days and went somewhere else. What utter disappontment.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: SixtoRamos
Reviews.Content: What difference a year makes!!! We were very excited to repeat our nice experience from last year and even convinced some of our friend to book their vacation there with with us. I feel very sorry for my friends. There was construction at the front and the lobby of the hotel with lots of noise and dust and we were never advised of this at the time of booking. Walls and carpets dirty. Human feces at the pool. Advised staff and no action. After numerous attemps asked for a manager and the staff laugh at us. My friends called Wyndham headquarters, they told us they will send someone and they never did. No activities at the hotel. Very somber experience. Would not stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “A true destination resort”
Reviews.Author: makenamaui6
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of the reviews after going to the Rio Mar, and to sum it up, I think you should determine what you want BEFORE you come. Are you coming to enjoy nightlife and whoop it up? If so, this isn't the spot - go stay in San Juan. Are you coming to enjoy a beach, enjoy a true destination resort? Then this may just be the place! This hotel is very well laid out - it's a big hotel but doesn't feel that way. Rooms are nice and big, clean, hallways a bit dark and need some updating. Lots of choices onsite for restaurants and bars. Expensive - yes. But, as was recommended earlier, you can and should rent a car at least for part of the time you're here and drive a little way to Luquillo to go to the Kiosks (La Parilla is AMAZING). DON'T get a cab...it's too expensive and a few trips you would have paid for the car! Food at the restaurants is mostly very good. In Marbella, Caprese salad with guava paste (I know...it sounds gross, doesn't it?) was incredible along with the Gazpacho Shooters. Pizza at the little restaurant by the casino? Frozen pizza-esque, but I wasn't expecting much anyway. This little spot makes a mean cup of coffee however (even if it is $4...ah, well, so is Starbucks!). Service is very good, friendly and helpful. Dragonfly is ok...the drivers to/from airport are great, but their desk staff is marginal. Tours are interesting (sometimes expensive) but as mentioned before the minimum 4 people deal can mean you may have to change your plans. Pools are great whether you're here as an adult or with kids. Nice beach - sand is not a white sand beach and I'm sure there are better beaches in PR, but it is right outside your door (other hotels on this side don't have it) and my 6 year old had a ball for hours upon hours. If you stay here, be sure to either drive yourself to Old San Juan or take a tour of it. It is an amazing place not to be missed. Also, be sure to go to Richies around sunset (it's further up the road when you turn off to go to the Rio Mar resort). Food there is marginal at best - best to go for drinks & an appetizer - but the view is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Place! - Must be smart and plan ahead”
Reviews.Author: dquinny
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Rio Mar for the honeymoon with my wife. I often read reviews, but never leave them myself; however because other reviews helped me so much for this trip I felt compelled. Shame on anyone for writing a poor review of this place if you did not read other reviews ahead of time. If you are smart and plan ahead you can have a great time without breaking the bank. 1st, the resort. Absolutely beautiful. Very clean, wonderfully decorated, and the staff was as good as I've dealt with. That said, it is a huge resort, somewhat isolated from things. ***TIP 1*** Rent a Car! We used hotwire and got an $11 per day rate. Even if you factor in the $20 per day valet, we saved a boat load of money eating all breakfasts and lunches off site as well as booking all excursions by ourselves. Also, we packed our GPS. 2nd, food. Breakfast - either Antonijo's or Isamar's at the bottom of the hill have great breakfasts for under $5 per person. Did not eat breakfast on the resort but knew the price to be $22 per person. Lunch - $5.50 speacial at Antonijo's was wonderful. All other days we ate at one of the Luquillo kiosks. They were easy to get to, had amazing food at great prices, the people were great; what more can you ask for? Dinner - we also ate at the kiosks some nights. At Palio we both had a lobster/scallop/shrimp pasta special, which was amazing. With a bottle of wine the bill was about $100, exactly what we pay at home in Boston. At Shima's we both had a lamb chop special, also very good. The bill was also about $100, but the service was horrible. 3rd, the pool - We did not go to the "Activity"/Kid pool, only the adult pool. The fact that there were no kids there made my trip. I like kids, but not on my honeymoon. The pool was great, a bunch of chairs, and even though we didn't pay for one, there were plenty of cabanas to duck under for the occasion 10 minute rain storm. Drinks here, as well as everywhere, were expensive (about $10 each). ***TIP 2*** Have a cooler. Some bought syrofoam coolers, we brought two collapsable bag coolers which were very handy. Buy beer from a gas station, Walmart, or the store at the bottom of the hill and filler the coolers with ice. ***TIP 3*** If you want "island drinks" buy a blender and make them yourself. We got a blender for $20, and all the ingredients we needed for pina coladas and saved a ton. We were hoping to pass it on to someone before leaving but couldn't find anyone interested. 4th, excursions - Again, you're insane if you book through Dragonfly at the resort. We did the zipline trip, an absolute blast. Go to yunkezipline.wordpress.com for contact information. It was about $30 per person cheaper to book yourself and drive to their meeting point. ATV ride, also an amazing time. The name of the ranch is Hacienda Carabali and you can find all information on their website. Again, about $30 per person cheaper if you book and transport yourself. Both of these places are literally right across the street. We did a full-day snorkel trip to Iacos through East Wind. This included a 2-hour beach/lunch stop and a 2-hour snorkel stop on the reef. It was also an open bar all day. I highly reccomend; they were great. Also through East Wind we did the bio bay tour to Vieques, where you swim in the water instead of canoe. It was extremely cool, but I wouldn't reccomend doing the same say as the snorkel trip like we did. We were extremely tired and didn't appreciate it as much. Other things - the casino was ok, neither of us are huge gamblers. It did seem to have a huge amount of slot machines though. The spa seemed ok, neither of us used any of their services. The gym was weak by my standards, not nearly enough free weights. They did have a good amount of treadmills, but I ran on the beach in the mornings instead. The golf courses looked amazing, but I did not play due to it being my honeymoon. I forsee future trips in which I will play. People complain about the internet. In my opinion, if you don't need it enough to already have it on your cell phone, then you can probably survive the trip without it. Overall, as I have said before, if you plan ahead and are smart about things, you can certainly enjoy yourself thoroughly without focusing too much on the money you spend. The resort was an absolute paradise and I would certainly reccomend to other honeymooners, couples, as well as families as there is a ton of things they do for kids as well. If you are looking for an insane nightlife, I'd stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: olafdamm
Reviews.Content: We had a room with view of the beach and a balcony. The room was very clean daily maid service was very nice and thorough. The bed was very comfortable. These are the best things about the resort. Our balcony chairs should have been replaced years ago. The rest of the building needs updating. The food in the restaurants is expensive and not the quality you would expect for the price. The beach is nice and fairly clean, the staff is kinda rude about removing their umbrellas and beach chairs at 5:00 pm when the beach closes for the sea turtles. The don't kick you off the beach they just remove their property from the beach. We watched them take away a couples chairs even though there were other unoccupied chairs they could have collected first. This happened on more then one occasion. The Iguana Lizards around the pool aren't too bad, although you need to be careful of their droppings which they leave around the pool deck. On one occasion an Iguana dropped a mess from a tree nearly hitting a lady lounging. The sad part was the staff did not clean it up for a couple of hours. Overall the resort is expensive for the service you receive (they charge $15 a day for internet, $10 for a refrigerator and $15 a day for parking). If you do stay there I would highly suggest to leave the resort to eat much better food at locations outside the resort. Don Pepe is one example close by and reasonably priced food. Unlike $6.50 beer at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comforatble, and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KayakPatty
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. The staff was very attentive and made you feel special. We had reserved a room with just a view of the "rain forest" and were upgraded to an ocean view without even asking! My husband was a little disappointed with the golf but not too much. My daughter and I did one of the activities available through the concierge and it was ok - but it wasn't the hotel's fault. It was a new activity for them and although it shows promise the people don't quite have it together yet (it was ziplining through the rain forest) - although the guides were very nice they just were not organized at all. It was hot as blazes and they didn't even have any water for us.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmie63
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Rio Del Mar (Wyndham Resort) was very nice! The Hotel is beautiful and our stay was very pleasant! Hotel staff was very friendly! The food at the buffets was "WONDERFUL"! A little pricey, but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Beach resort made me wish i was still home”
Reviews.Author: r0ndy
Reviews.Content: the 1st 2 days of our 5 day vacation were shot, because the overbooked the Resort. So we got a room (at another resort) at 8 on our 1st day. Plane landed at 2 pm. The next day we had to come back to Rio and they still didn't have a room available. So we waited another 4 hr until a room was available. That just set the tone. The service sucked. At dinners we would sit at a table for 10 to 15 min while people walked around us, without taking our order. You would wait another 20 min to get coffee or juice once you placed your order. My account was charged for numerous activities that we didn't partake in.

Reviews.Title: “I should be able to live everyday like this”
Reviews.Author: Flowergirl84
Reviews.Content: When I came back, I could not stop talking about or thinking about our trip. I did my homework and already knew the resort was fairly secluded so we rented a car. We were there to totally unwind and that we did. The drive was easy and we were able to use the GPS on the cell phone from the airport to the resort and back again. The resort is beautiful. The pictures on the site are very accurate. The staff was friendly; the valet, the waitstaff, housekeeping, lobby everyone was great and they were more than helpful in telling us where we could go in the area for the things we wanted. If you want nightlife you need to drive to San Juan (45Min) The food at the resort was awesome. I loved the breakfast and Palio, but we also had meals at some of the local establishments so we could feel what Puerto Rico was really like. No matter where we went, everyone was great. We were thinking of going back in September, but now have to consider the oil spill:( We have fun no matter where we to, but this was probalbly the best time of our lives. P.S. It might not be so enjoyable if you are on a tight budget. Vacations are just so enjoyable when your not counting every penny so come loaded and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst vacation I ever had”
Reviews.Author: Por2gueseluv
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my boyfriend to experience the beautiful island of Puerto Rico. I figured a resort has tons to do and we could venture out. Well I was sadly mistaken. Let me start by saying the resort itself is beautiful, but way too far from everything. You MUST rent a car in order to get out and experience PR. The pool area is well kept and the beach is amazing. The hotel overbooked and ended up sending us to another resort only to come back the next day and still not have a room until late afternoon. We blew 3 of our 5 day vacation on complaining and sitting around with our suitcases in our hands. The restaurant selection is horrible and very expensive. How do you have a resort on an island and not serve Puerto Rican dishes. They have activities to do but the it is way too expensive jet skiing, El Yuque, tours are all way overcharged by the resort. They screwed up our room tab and we had to spend our last night arguing about it and then the next morning again because they didn't obviously take notes in the system. I have been to PR before and loved it but this was the worst vacation EVER and I was dying to return back home. If you do decide to select this hotel make sure you Rent A Car or plan to be very bored...especially at night since they have no nightlife at all. I would recommend staying at El San Juan because at least your in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation i've ever had”
Reviews.Author: CarleyJean
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this resort for a week in May. We loved everything about it. The resort itself is very beautiful and we couldn't stop taking pictures of the property! Our room had a great ocean view and a private balcony with a table for two. The bed was comfortable, the shower had great water pressure and the room was cleaned to perfection daily. All of the food there was great! We especially loved Palio, the italian restaurant. The manager, Anna, was wonderful. Expect resort prices, it is a resort after all. Not every restaurant was open every night. Find out which one is open on the night you plan to go ahead of time. There is also a piano player that plays nightly on the lower level, very romantic. The pool was never crowded, practically deserted after 6pm. The hot tub did not get very hot though. We took advantage of the 2 for 1 drink specials at the beach tiki bar, Henry, the bartender was hilarious! We didn't spend much time on the beach, too busy, but it was very pretty. The iguanas are everywhere but they keep to themselves unless you try to feed them. My best advice is, rent a car. We did a lot of exploring. We drove to the rainforest, Old San Juan and to Bio Bay for a bioluminescent kayak tour. All I highly recommend. You can do all of this without the help of the resort. The concierge staff is very helpful and can get you a map to anywhere you want to go. One of the most enjoyable things we did was took a catamaran/snorkel day trip to Icacos Island, via The Salty dog catamaran. I can't wait to go back to Puerto Rico, and when I do, I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: DELA22
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar is a very beautiful but expensive resort. It has 3 pools. One adult pool, one activities pool with a water slide and a small kiddie pool. It also has a jacuzzi. The beach is ok, but I've seen better beaches in the Caribbean (especially in Dominican Republic). The pool and beach areas have enough chairs and allow for a quiet ambience. There were some kids running around, but they have their pool area. It was just relaxing music and the sound of the shore. Our room was clean, the beds cozy and we had a beautiful mountain view facing El Yunque Rainforest. Beware, the walls of the room are thin. You can hear the water running and flushes in the room next door. I was awoken at 6am by the shower running next door. The restaurants are nice and the food ok, and the ambience is quite elegant. We paid over $100.00 for a simple italian dinner. Parking is $20.00 per night for valet and $15.00 for self parking. Self parking is "over the hill and through the woods". We opted for valet. Please be advised the resort is away from everything and about 35 minutes by car from the city of San Juan. You WILL NEED a car to get around, or you will be confined to the resort. We had breakfast down the hill from the resort (make a left at the exit of the resort) at a very beautiful and inexpensive typical Puertorican restuarant called Antojitos Puertorriquenos. We had dinner in a number of places. Many suggested Ritchies (up the hill from the resort), but it's a bit pricey and the food was not that good, but the view is outstanding! We did go to a wonderful restaurant in Old San Juan called The Latin Roots. They have live bands playing each night, and the food is good. Parking is available in the same facility as the restaurant. The staff at the resort is very courteous and outgoing. Overall we enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional beach resort”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_4Q
Reviews.Content: We selected Wyndham for the name & affordable price. There were no surprises, Wyndham met expectations. Overall a good value. The property is showing some age and efforts seem to be underway to dress-up this 80's style resort. The staff was accommodating, and upgraded the room to a beach view upon our request. The room was clean and modern, with a quiet a/c system. There are two pools, both small by today's mega resort standards. A single food and drink service is shared for pool and beach areas - somewhat inconvenient. The beach is not groomed, could use some cleaning around the food service area. Once you get further away from the food service area the beach is quite clean. Overall the beach is very large; we enjoyed long walks. Parking ($20+ for valet per day), and in-room internet ($15 per day), can add up quickly. As with any tropical destination, use bug repellent after 5 pm or you will get bitten.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort!”
Reviews.Author: lilygee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 day trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Rio Mar Resort and loved every minute. The place is just beautiful, and every single member of the hotel staff that we encountered was friendly and professional. Our room was lovely; the woman at the check-in desk upgraded us from a resort view room to a partial ocean view without us even asking for it. The view actually was pretty good. I like to stay at higher-end hotels, but didn't have any expectations for this one because I got such a deal, and booked not too far in advance. I was totally surprised at how nice everything was. Very clean, great pools and beach, and awsome food. That was a complete shock. I generally don't think much of hotel food, and my husband and I are total foodies. The three resaurants at Rio Mar were way above average. I didn't think the prices were too unreasonable for a resort, and certainly were less than I pay when I go out in NYC. Very high quality food, and generally good (but typically laid back time-wise) service. I will say that the drinks were very pricey everywhere on the property. But there is access to alcohol at the grocery and package stores if you want to spend less and have a car. We didn't have a fridge in the room, so we didn't do that. Not sure if any of the other rooms have them. There isn't a club for dancing in the hotel, although on Saturday night there was a live salsa band in the lobby. Tons of people were there and the dancing was amazing. Most of the dancers were from a wedding reception and from other groups staying for the weekend. Very fun! The weather was pretty good overall. Didn't interfere with our activities much. Its very hot and humid so be prepared for bad hair days. Rained every day, but mostly for brief periods, and the sun still was out in typical Carribean fashion. A couple of days it did rain morein the p.m., so hit the pool/beach early to ensure tanning time. Went on an outing with Salty Dog catamaran excursions in Fajardo. Booked it ourselves. $65 for the day, including food and booze, and snorkeling equipment. Sasso (Cap'n) and the cute boys were a blast! Went to 2 reefs (2nd was way better). Crashed the El Conquistador after with some new friends. That resort is a must see! Pay for parking and say you are having lunch/dinner at one of the restaurants (look up names; don't remember). Ate at the kiosks twice. The Burger Shack was great, as was La Parilla (although I didn't like what I ordered; not them, just didn't like it).
