If you are skittish about low rent districts, with lots of grime and "character", don't go to the kiosks, though. Its very local, but interesting if you are up for a very casual dinner or lunch. Definitely drive there; apparently walking is not advised. We had no safety problems anywhere we went in PR; never felt a moment of nervousness. But common sense should be exercised (anywhere, for that matter). Didn't have time to do the rain forest, which was stupid on our part. Couldn't get into any excursions with zip lining. They all need min 4 people. But we are going to get it in next trip within the first day or so. Did Old San Juan on our last day. It was Africa hot and rain forest humid, so it wasn't as much fun as it might have been. Probably wouldn't go back, though. Once was enough. Beautiful old buildings and lots of museums, but shopping was just ok. Only had lunch, but there are lots of hip looking restaurants at the east end of town in the SoFo district. Overall, for a 6 day getaway, this was a great trip. We are definitely going back, and will probably stay at Rio Mar again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a so-so island”
Reviews.Author: hkhoneycutt
Reviews.Content: Grounds - beautiful and kept top notch. We loved walking around and looking at the lush foliage. The iguanas are fun to watch too! The pools are both super clean. The adult pool is nice and quiet with plenty of chairs and umbrellas. Restuarants - We ate at Shimas and Mirabella. We really enjoyed Shimas - great service and food. Mirabella had about average service and food but fit the bill for our first night there (it was late and we were exhausted from traveling). Yes the food is expensive here but no more so than the Hyatt in Dallas so I'm not sure why that's surprising or unusual. Parking - the fee stinks but we knew that going in. Other than that, no problems. Rooms - We had a nice mountain view room with a king bed. Everything appeared clean and the bedding was very nice and soft. I always had very hot water in the shower and maid service was prompt and efficient. My only beef is 2 out of 3 times I went to the ice machine I got nothing out. This MIGHT be because so many people had styrofoam coolers and the machines couldn't keep up. Service - Front desk attendants were prompt and friendly. The parking attendants were less friendly. Casino - Hubby did quite well at the poker tables here so he was enjoying himself. I didn't do so well at the black jack table...lol. Hotel building - beautiful Spanish style decor. We loved that they lowered the lights in the evening and had the hotel decorated with candles. There is also frequently music playing to add to the festive atmosphere. Beach - plenty of umbrellas and chairs. I never saw more than about 8 people on the beach so the quiet was wonderful. Note - the sand is darker and therefore the beach lacks that clear blue appeal that many other caribbean beaches have. This is not the hotel's fault however :) Just be aware. We probably won't return to PR, at least for a while, d/t the fact that we are big beach people and are in love with the island of St. John. That being said, I would love to be able to stay at this hotel again. It was very nice and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced resort”
Reviews.Author: fallon3386
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort, but my boyfriend and I rented a car and upon arriving at the resort found that we have to pay approx. $16 a day to park there or $26 a day for valet service. That was pretty upsetting off the back. Then we arrive at our room, which was beautiful and we were starving. We figured we would go out by the pool and grab a bit to eat and ended up paying $70 for 2 hamburgers and 2 drinks. Resturants at the resort are insanely expensive, especially if you travel outside of the resort there are tons of resturants that are extremely inexpensive with a ton of food. When we settle in the room we notice that there is no refrigerator in the spot that one would normally be, so we call the front desk and they notify us that you have to pay $10 a day for a refrigerator. I paid approx. $180 a night for this place they are charging me to park and for a stupid refrigerator. Disappointed to say the least. Also, do not book activities through the hotel, we ask for a price guide, just to compare and ended up booking all of our activities by googling places and saved at least half of the price for everything. Also they charge for internet access in the room $15/day or $40/ 3 days. Overall very upset and the beach was incredibly littered with trash, bottles, cans, and TONS and TONS of tiny leaves that made the water murky. One of the reason's I chose this place was for the wonderful beaches and this was a huge disappointment. I absolutely loved Puerto Rico though and plane on booking many times to come back, just never to here. People are extremely friend, food is good and it did rain everyday, but only for a short time, then the sun was out again. Go to Old San Juan, went there a ton and absolutely loved the shopping, nightlife and sights of the historical places.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rio mar Beach Villa in Rio Grande Puerto Rico for 1 week May 12 thru 19 with my son, daughter-in-law and 3 children, ages 9, 5, and 2. So this review is mostly about the beach front villas, . We had rented 3 bedroom condo on the beach, What a wonderful week we had, very relaxing, lots of time on the beach and in the beautiful pool (loved the Zero depth walk in for the little 2 yr old!) The villa was very accommodating for our needs, 3 bedrooms, 3 full baths, with full kitchen, front room, 2 decks to enjoy the ocean view. It came with towels, (bath and pool), all bed linen supplied, and we did get a crib also. Also included a starter supply of paper towels, bath soap, small amount of dishwashing detergent, kleenix, and toilet paper, Basically clean rooms, (we did not hire housekeeping, did our own wash (washer and drier in one of the bathrooms) the first day we did take a run to the supermarket to stock up on basics, Ralphs Food Warehouse is 10 min from Rio Mar, and has everything you need, The pools, grounds, beach were very clean and well kept up, Staff very helpful with any problems (had some trouble with the airconditioner, which was fixed the next day.) You definetely need a car, as the resort area is too large to walk to anything outside, and even tho many restaurants in resort, they are very expensive! Lots of very nice reasonable restaurants just a few miles outside the resort. Several we had heard of from forums here, were, Antojitos, (just down the hill where you turn into the resort road, very good and inexpensive (esp. breakfasts) Terraza montana, up the hill, great views, Isamars Bakery, good also, close to Antojitos. .We did eat several times at the pool bar at the resort, but with all of us (3 adults/3 kids) for lunch it was over $100.00 for basically hamburgers!! With 3 young kids we didn't do any tours, but did some driving around a little and stopped in a few small towns, enjoyed some great lunches in off the road places.(sorry can't remember names) We spent most of our time at the beach resort. We had no problems with any bugs, day or night, (the bitting kind) The weather was great, warm, but very windy, rainy a few hours each day but mostly sunny. The surf was strong, so didn't attempt to go too far out, but kids loved spending hours in the ocean getting 'knocked down by the waves" and hunting for shells. The beach was wonderfully sandy, but shallow for a long way out so not good for snorkling . There is a small casino at the resort, and my daughter-in-law and i did go one evening and had a good time. There is a free shuttle bus that runs freq. between hotel and villas, which was great at night. Lots of Iquanas at the hotel pool, had daily "feed the iquanas" at 11:00am which the kids enjoyed, and also a nice slide in the family pool there, The hotel had a family pool and an adults only pool. We usually stayed at the villa pools as there was never more than a few people there. The walk to the hotel was only about 5-10 min from the villas, so no problem going back and forth for activities., and if you were at the villas you could enjoy any of the activities, pools, restaurants, etc at the hotel. All in all would recommend this resort,

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico's secret hide away...”
Reviews.Author: secretluv
Reviews.Content: Working in the hospitality industry for over 15 yrs, I tend to look for flaws, but could not find one thing wrong with this place. Do not believe anything you read about this place. Yes, to be honest, I did encounter some small issues but the staff was so quick to correct their errors and accommodate our stay. We were upgrade to ocean view. Wow..what a view. Room was clean, up to date & beds were comfortable. Yes the food was pricey and lacked of flavor, but what would you expect youâ€™re at a resort. Recommend, renting a car. Lots of local restaurants/stores to purchase food and liquor. Pool & beach was wonderful...except for the occasional iguanas that would hang out by the pool, in the pool or under your lounge chair. I just don't care for that & see a serious liability issue but the other guest loved it. If it rains all day, I can understand why some ppl had nothing to do, but that's when the rental car would be useful. The month of May is their rainy season but if you take a drive I can guarantee you it's not raining the next town over. Rio Mar is a perfect place if you are looking for just the 3 R's "rest, relaxation, & romance" with your spouse/partner.

Reviews.Title: “You have to read this review - wanna know what great staff is about... continue on”
Reviews.Author: SherBare
Reviews.Content: Now, being a frequent traveller, trip advisor is my main tool. I researched to Rio Mar prior to booking and buy doing so, I did not leave the resort disappointed and bitter. The cost per night is higher, we paid $180 per night thanks to Priceline, this also included staying on a Friday and Saturday night!!! There is a 14% Resort fee - $23.66 per day, the cost of food is a bit more than an average restaurant but don't rule out doing room service dining.... much more cost effective. We also packed in some muchies before we left home, as these killed the afternoon "gotta eat" moments. Please Read on.... you wanna know this........... We stayed for 3 nights at this resort. The first night was started off great until I was woken up by the guests next door screaming and yelling at each other. I was very VERY concerned about what was going on, so I call security. They came up immediately. They gave this couple the "3 strikes and your out" option. At strike 3 the gentlemen had packed and left. The next morning we approached the front desk and had a discussion. The staff was very accommodating and offered to move us, we declined in trust that the 2nd night would not repeat the 1st. Which it did not. The lady guest should be ashamed of her behaviour as it was not appropriate to behave in front of CHILDREN that way. ANYHOW..... the staff was wonderful about the situation and we felt safe! Carrying on..... There are set transfer costs about $75.00US per couple each way, to and from the airport... be sure to ALWAYS ask the cabby the amount before you get in. ALWAYS!!!!! The ride is about 45 mins. In the end, we budgeted $300.00 per day to stay at this resort... room, food, and additional items including a Canopy Tour and Resort Fees. The grounds of the hotel are immaculate with 2 pool areas and cabana rentals for $150.00 per day. Being a very white canauk, I of course chose the sun! Don't be to disappointed if it does rain at one point during your stay, after all, Puerto Rico does have wonderful rainforests. Most of all... Don't forget your sunscreen!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent will go back BUT will rent a car!”
Reviews.Author: MelaCo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the service matched the aesthetics. When we return to Puerto Rico we will definitely stay here again. The only thing I would suggest to others is to definitely rent a car. We were a little apprehensive as it was our first time to Puerto Rico and first time to this side of the island and we didn't rent a car so we were basically stuck on this paradise island which is NOT a bad thing. But next time we will venture out a little and get a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “First Class for the Lower Class”
Reviews.Author: RMSilverio
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch hotel with amazing employees/services, views, restaurants, etc.... My boyfriend (fiance now) were lucky enough to get the room for free through a Time Share presentation with Wyndham. If we hadn't, the room, plus all of the food and drinks and excursions would have totaled to over $3-4K for 3 nights!!I would def recommend this place if you want to be pampered and just want to splurge on yourself. Also, there is a restaurant nearby that you must try, Ritchie's. There is even a shuttle that will take you from the hotel to the restaurant. Old San Juan is a MUST SEE!! If you do not have a car, the hotel can provide a van to take you down to Old San Juan for a half day excursion I love Puerto Rico! It was a beautiful place and all of the locals were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Resort Across from Rain Forest”
Reviews.Author: great_deal_shopper
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a very relaxing time at this resort. The resort is large. We had a room with double beds with a view of the ocean and pool. Ocean view was obstructed because of the very tall palm trees. For dining, my suggestion is to rent a car from the airport and drive to local restaurants. There are several restaurants at the resort, a bit pricey and ok food. The restaurant just outside the resort (Richie's) had a very nice view. Also, try the Brass Cactus (a Sports Bar, friendly staff). Drive to the rain forest which is right across the street. Take the ferry to Culebro. I would advise paying for a tour to old San Juan. It is difficult to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “OUR DREAM VACATION”
Reviews.Author: chatkat6
Reviews.Content: We went to San Juan, PR for our dream vacation and found it at Rio Mar Resort and Spa. The pillow top beds are like sleeping on a cloud and the pillows are devine. From the first time entering the Resort, Joseph at the front desk made our check in a breeze, upgrading us from an oceanview to an oceanfront, overlooking the entire resort. Booking our tours on Dragon Fly Travels was made so easy Marie & staff helped us out & explained everything to us and were very courteous. We highly reccommend all of the resturuants in the resort. Wilfredo and staff made us feel like we were the only ones there at the time, seeing to our every need. When going to the gift shop please stop in and see Carmen & crew. She is an expert in picking out that "special" gift. After the exciting ATV trip through the Rainforest, make reservations for a relaxign massage at the Mandrian Spa. While soaking up some sun on the beautiful beach why not try a Mango Madness at the Tiki Bar. We give the Rio Mar a 10 in all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MsRHogan
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about the hotel but I was so disappointed when I got there. The pictures they have advertising their hotel needs to be updated. The rooms were not impressive. The pool area was swarming with igaunas EVERY DAY! They would jump from trees into the pool and one even jumped on somebody's table and ate their food. The location was not a central location so you definitely need a car. The food at the resort was very expensive and overpriced. The staff wasn't very friendly and most didn't speak English which surprised me because most tourists visting the resort spoke English. There was one concierge named Miguel who was excellent! He was very friendly and helpful. The beach water stayed brown most of the time for some reason. It rained a lot while we were there too. And be careful driving in Puerto Rico. They have no regard for traffic etiquette and most of the cars I saw were banged up. I definitely would not stay there again. My girlfriend is going to Puerto Rico in July and I recommended that she stay at the Hilton in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach honeymoon...but not treated well by staff”
Reviews.Author: armyfamily1
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my husband on our honeymoon last year. I am a Wyndham owner and this was my worse experience with them so far. I had notified them that we would be a day late arriving, but when we arrived they had not held our room and listed us as a 'no show.' We spent a night in a king room without an ocean view and then the rest of the time in an ocean/pool view room with two double beds. As a VIP owner...the treatment was anything but VIP. We were splurging and even by that standard the restaurants/food were EXPENSIVE! As far as relaxing by the pool/beach it was nice. I loved the cabana lounges, but you had to get there early to snag one! Don't know that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: bbsstuff
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days last week at the Rio Mar resort and well...didn't like it. The rating would have been lower except I opted to rent one of the golf villas from a private owner instead of staying at the hotel. The villa was great and came with the use of a golf cart and had kitchen and laundry faciltities which came in useful. I really didn't spend that much time at the hotel facility but the beach was awful and the pool was not much better. In their defense there was supposedly some rough weather the day before I arrived and a lot of rain run off from the mountains drain down a river near the neach which turned the water brown. It improved after a couple of days but still was ugly. The water here is much to rough to enjoy. The hotel was eerily quiet and when in certain parts you felt like you were the only one there. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants and went to the local places instead. La Parilla in the Kiosko's was great as was the Brass Cactus in Luquillo. Also went to Antojitos near the hotel but the food was average and the service not that good. The main benefit of staying at this hotel is to be close to the rain forest and the bio bay. The Fajardo bio bay is a must see. Do not stay here unless you have a rental car and plan on doing the local attractions. If you are lookin at it as purely a resort to spend all your time at you will be diappointed. I spent the last 2 days of the trip at the Caribe Hilton on Old San Juan which in my opinion was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon perfect”
Reviews.Author: mkc1mjb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week spent on our honeymoon at the Rio Mar. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was excellent with a view of the ocean and garden area. The beach and pool areas are beautiful and well kept. The food was very good, but somewhat expensive. Overall I would recommend the Rio Mar to anyone looking for a beautiful beach destination.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: singflysmith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Rio Mar in late April. We flew into SJU and rented a car. It's about a 40-minute drive from SJU, with a $1.50 toll along the way. It's dead simple: PR 26, keep following the signs to Fajardo; then right on PR 3, left on 968, and it's a mile or so to the resort. We had a little trouble finding the right place to check in, but eventually we got there. Our room was pleasant, no smell of mold or mildew, and the a/c worked great. I'm used to staying in timeshares, so I missed the separate kitchen and bedroom areas -- I couldn't get up early, make coffee, and take it out onto the balcony without waking my wife. We had lunch the first day in the Marbella restaurant. It was OK, not outstanding, and medium-pricy. We had arranged to rent a refrigerator, so we went into a nearby town and shopped at an Amigo for coffee (the in-room coffee was pathetic) and other necessities. Generally we made sandwiches and ate lunch in the room or by the pool. Yes, the restaurant and bar prices are high. We ordered mojitos from a waiter at the pool -- once. They were $10.50 each, so that was the end of that. We got an excellent rum (Ron del Barrilito) at the supermarket; the 3-star is about $20 for a 750 ml bottle. The pool area was pleasant, assuming you don't mind the occasional iguana. They really didn't bother anyone, aside from the occasional drama queen who would jump up on her chaise longue and screech whenever one got too close (defined as less than ten feet away). Yes, there is one iguana that occasionally dives into the pool from about 30 feet up in one of the palm trees. Who knew iguanas could swim that well? The parking situation is kind of strange; clearly designed to make you want to use valet parking for an extra $5/day. Once I figured out the system, though, it wasn't too bad: go down to the valet station, get my ticket validated, and then go to the garage and drive away. The only problem was that there is only one elevator that serves the garage area, and it is SLOW. Be warned, though, that when you check out you need to show your room bill to the parking valet so they can verify that you paid. After you leave the front desk, keep your receipt out, don't pack it. The golf course looked beautiful, but neither of us plays. We also didn't participate in any of the activities, since this was a veg-out week. The excursions offered through the hotel seemed outrageously expensive, though. We did our own excursion to El Yunque, which is almost literally right across the road from the resort. Go back down to PR 3 and continue across the highway, and in about a mile you're in El Yunque. It's very different from the beach, and quite interesting. But it can get really hot. Bottom line: It's a big tourist hotel for norteamericanos. The only locals we saw were on the weekend, and we figured the hotel sells day passes. Either that or locals from San Juan come for the weekend. So if you're looking to mix with the local population, it ain't gonna happen here. But it's clean and has beautiful grounds, and the staff are uniformly pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We prepared, so we weren't disappointed."”
Reviews.Author: hollyhol
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Rio Mar. We booked our vacation through US Airways vacations and paid a VERY reasonable price for a vacation package that included, R/T airfare, hotel, transportation to and from airport and a $100 food and beverage credit with the resort, taxes and fees. I will have to be honest and say that I was VERY apprehensive about staying at the resort after I read the reviews on trip advisor. But the trip was paid for, so what could we do. The reviews are very mixed, but all have some very valid points. I think you really have to pay attention to the comments from the reviewers whose travel situation mirrors yours. If I were traveling as a family with children, I would have found this place to be outrageously expensive. But I wasn't , so the prices did not send me into sticker shock. So for those traveling as a couple here is my review... Let's get the price shock out of the way first...Yes, the food and drink were somewhat pricey (roughly $22/pp for breakfast buffet, $10-12 for drinks, $20-$35 for dinner). But you are at a resort, on an island that is American "owned". Some of the prices at the resort reflect ones found in major US cities: Chicago, NY, LA, Miami, Las Vegas, etc. Yes, the car rental fee was a bit excessive ($59/day and a $200 deposit that is charged to your card, but refunded within 2 business days). Yes, if you rent a car the daily fee is $20-25 (but we're from Chicago, where the average price to park in a downtown lot on a daily basis can run from $15-26, so it didn't shock us). Yes, you have to pay $10 per day for a fridge (crazy!!). We arrived at the Rio Mar and had been told at check-in that we had been upgraded to a Junior Suite with an Ocean View. This was a very nice surprise. Not sure why they did it, nor did we question it. LOL! The room was very clean and our view was spectacular. No smell of mold or mildew as other reviews noted. It was a little chilly, so we turned down the air. Note: if you turn the air down to far or off, the floors become wet from the humidity so be careful. Also the beds were extremely comfortable (pillow top mattresses with down comforters). The hotel grounds were beautiful. The beach was clean. The adult pool is nice. If you are at the adult pool, everyday about noon, there is a huge iguana that is up in the trees, who jumps from the tree into the pool, climbs out and stops for pictures. Very interesting show. However on Sundays, there is not staff to bring food and drinks to the pools, so you will be on your own. No big deal though. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially a Ruben. He was GREAT!! He recommended some great places to eat and visit and each place was on point! Rio Mar Management, if you are read this review, you need to give him a raise. Also, all of the computers were in working order. I know that previous reviews indicated that there were only one or two that were working. We had planned to do different types of tours, however, when we got there, we decided to just rest and relax. But my advice is to book the tours outside of the hotel. Dragonfly Tours, located in the hotel, is very price. You would do better to go through sites like Viator.com, Yunke Tours (not sure of the address), etc. The food at the resort was very good. We ate a Marbella's and the Tiki Bar. We didn't get a chance to eat at the other restaurants, because we went off the resort to some local spots for dinner. Once place that has great food is Hacienda. They have a skirt steak, with rice and beans that is awesome! The atmosphere in the place is very relaxed. And as many of you know, it's NBA Playoff time. This place had TV's, good food and good drinks, so both me and my boyfriend were VERY happy. Another local spot we went to was called Guavas. It's located on Loquillo Beach. We went here to was the Mayweather/Mosely fight, have some good food and drinks. This place also turns into a nightclub, so if you are looking to hear good music and dance, this is a great spot. Finally, on a couple of evenings, we hung out at the Lobby Bar. Each night they had live music, where people could dance and have a good time. Also, the bar tenders were great. I have to say that my guy and I had a FANTASTIC time at this resort!! I would definitely stay here again. So, if you and your significant other/spouse would like to go somewhere that has beautiful grounds, quiet pool and beach where you can relax, and you don't mind spending just a little extra money here and there, I would recommend the Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - but wierd nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: windskisong
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning resort. Beach was beautiful (allowing for the constant junk coming out from the jungle - the staff cleaned it up the next day). Pools were clean and refreshing (other than one hot tub's controls were broken for the duration of our stay, but it was hot and refreshing). Facilities were clean. HOWEVER: AC - 1st room had thermostat, 2nd just had fan control. Staff explained functional change - we had moved to an older, less upgraded room that had a MUCH better location, and we were fine with that. Room location - we paid significantly extra for an oceanfront room. First room did face the ocean, but you couldn't see it because of the HUGE palm tree in front of the room, and it was set way back from the water. I asked about this, and the next day was moved to another room (less upgraded) that was still way back from the water, but you could in fact SEE the water and beach from the room. Internet - I saw on the web looking at the hotel and checked with the reservation 800#, and understood there was free internet, and there was internet in the room, and logically assumed there was free internet in the room. Internet in the room cost $15? per night. Free internet was 4 computers in the lobby that I never saw empty, and was told normally had waits of over an hour. Parking: The parking system was a disaster. We left the hotel 4 times including checkout. Process always took more than 20 minutes, sometimes as much as 40 minutes. Validated tickets worked less than 1/2 the time (I always did my best to beat the 15 minutes that I was allowed, and made it 3/4 of the time), there was frequently a line to get out. If you're going to charge $15/day for parking, use the room key, or staff the parking deck. Also, the $15/day charge just appeared on the bill, after making us jump through hoops to "validate" our parking tickets. If the parking staff had said "ok, this time we have to charge you", I would've paid the extra $5 and avoided the self parking the second day. The biggest negative of our visit. On the other hand, having an Enterprise car rental meant we got one day free. Won't let competing restaurants on the hotel to pick up guests. I understand why. We used the little sandwich shop by the casino, because it was the only semi-reasonable priced restaurant. Otherwise, portions are small, food is good, but VERY overpriced. Off-site, before you even get to the main road there are OUTSTANDING restaurants (Isamar Bakery) that are CHEAP. Final good note: Unlike in other places in Puerto Rico, we ALWAYS felt safe in and around this hotel. I obviously won't ding the hotel for this, but it did POUR for 80% of our time in Puerto Rico. Would've been nice for them to mention the weather and the lack of things to do if it's pouring.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!”
Reviews.Author: marsunset
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we checked into our room and the bathroom was dirty. After 3 attempts and 2 hours later someone finally came and gave us clean towels.The next day they came in and cleaned the room but made up only 1 bed. We were there for 1 week and the room was cleaned only once and not even fully. The poolside never had towels ready so many guest were not happy. Food was very expensive and you didn't get much of a choice. The fire alarm went off one night at 1230am and the following night at 6am....luckily false alarm. Night entertainment was non existent. The had to be one of the worst resorts I have stayed in. They don't cater to the customers and are not attentive to detail. I don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but if you are not a golfer, then not the best”
Reviews.Author: TripDrug
Reviews.Content: Hire car from the capital takes about 30 minutes - not difficult to find once you have worked out the maps. The hotel complex is very large, with golf and tennis and a very attractive hotel, lobby and location infrastructure, in a park, on the beach. Despite having paid in advance for the reservation, the hotel didn't have a record of our arrival, but that was sorted out quite quickly (we provided all the necessary documentation, so it couldn't really be in dispute). Be prepared for a $200 block on your credit card for incidentals, regardless of what you may take or not. Outside of the attractive lobby area, the hotel was a little bit "tired" (dark red corridor carpets that didn't look quite clean... a litte bit sticky... a balcony in the room that had an unattractive concrete floor that looked as though the tiles should have been laid several years ago and were forgotton). A shocking $20 per day for parking - this is a hotel in the middle of nowhere and on acres of land. An even more shocking $150 (not a misprint - one hundred and fifty dollars) per day for a private parasol pool area (those mini-marquees that have curtains around the sunbeds). Sorry, but who are they kidding? A large group staying at the hotel were drunk and noisy through to the early hours on the main terrasse for several nights running - without any regard for those sleeping above. The hotel staff chose not intervene. Not really a 5* Incidently, if driving in Puerto Rico, recognise that 1 in 2 people will drive whilst having an animated discussion on a mobile phone, and that overtaking on the right is a natonal passtime.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: SaanichRVer
Reviews.Content: I would not rank this resort as a 5 star or even a 4 star. I have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels and resorts and they do not nickel and dime their clients towards bankruptcy. They also empower their employees and ensure that service is there when you need it. Our room was good - as Wyndham rewards members we were upgraded to a junior suite, BUT no fridge or even a mini bar. ( this was the same in all the rooms- apparently they figure that guests might save some money by bringing in some of their own food and drink) For $10.00 a day, our friends rented a fridge from the hotel and got something that looked like it had been shot at with a shotgun and had little to no seals . Costs - Initial cost of stay was reasonable for what was expected BUT the extra added costs were almost highway robbery. 1st. - a 14% resort fee added to the room cost- this I was told was for services like towels pool etc and is not a tax put on by government but an extra charge levied by the "resort" and its competitors ( seems like price fixing to me). 2nd- The resort is isolated and about 50 minutes from SJU airport yet to further separated you from more of your cash, you have to pay $75.00pp return for a shuttle or rent a car. And if you rent a car you then have to pay $15 to $20 per day for parking. 3rd - The prices for food and Drink are outrageous at the resort - $4.00 for a cup of coffee, $22.00 for breakfast. Off resort coffee was 95 cents and breakfast $5.00 yet If you want to eat off resort you need a car or to walk 1 1/2 mile each way. Some restaurants off resort had shuttles but they were not allowed on the property. SERVICE - Weather was so so with several showers a day. During one of the more severe showers we took shelter at a table on the covered patio in front of one of the restaurants. We then ordered a jug of coffee ( $7.00) for the 4 of us but were told that we could not have it served outside. If we wanted coffee at our table just outside the restaurant door we had to go inside and upstairs to the snack bar in the lobby and get it (at $4.00 per cup). The concierge desk was manned by Wyndhan Vacation personel who tried to get you to sign up for their sales presentations. They were helpful and friendly BUT I went to a resort to relax not to be subjected to sales pitches.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise & fantastic deal!”
Reviews.Author: FootPrintsintheSand
Reviews.Content: We live on the west coast of Puerto Rico and had to take our son for an early morning flight out of San Juan. We decided to stay overnight to make the early morning departure time easier on all of us. We booked our room through the Travelocity's Top Secret hotel offer, not knowing which hotel we had booked until it was paid for in full. After reading some of the reviews here, I was a little worried. Well, our room was a delightful surprise-spacious (400 sq ft according to the brochure), full front panoramic ocean view (see our photo!), very clean, 2 extremely comfortable queen size beds with soft bedding and plenty of pillows, bright pleasant decor, great bathroom with wonderful toiletries, and AC that worked great. Nice balcony with a bistro table to enjoy our morning coffee and tea. We walked around the well manicured grounds. It was clean and lovely. We went out to the beach- beautiful! The front desk people were very helpful and friendly. Check-in late Wednesday evening was a breeze with Kaila. When we went to the airport very early for our son's flight the next morning, I asked Jessica if we might have a late check-out. She offered to let us have the room until 1 pm! We didn't need it, but it was nice to know we didn't have to rush to get everything out. You should know the hotel is in Rio Grande, about 45 minutes east of the San Juan airport (SJU) in weekday morning traffic. It is very convenient for trips to El Yunque, the US Park Systems only tropical rain forest, the ferry at Fajardo to Vieques and Culebra islands. The beach was lovely, with a few reefs just off the shore. They have an on site diving store with equipment and lessons. We booked this room for $102. When the taxes, resort fees, and yes, the mandatory self parking fee of $15 (covered parking garage) were added in, it was $143.53. My family of 3 felt like we had a great treat to enjoy this lovely resort at a price we could afford.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: finneganh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Rio Mar and had a great time. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, the rooms were immaculate, and the pool was great for the kids. It was conveniently located - 10-20 min from the rain forest and kayaking in bioluminesent bay, 50 min. from Old San Juan. The only downsides to the hotel were the expsensvie dining options and drinks - $7.00 beers (but often the case with hotels) and lack of organized activities for teenagers. The only night time entertainment available was swimming in the pool. I would definitely rent a car because it is easy to get around and there are some good restaurants near the hotel that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort, Great Service, Rent a Car”
Reviews.Author: lladybuggz
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this resort. I think it's crazy they charge $15 to park in their garage, but we knew this going in. The walk to the parking garage is not too far of a walk. We stayed at this hotel 6 nights. We booked through Expedia and got a $100 food and beverage credit. At check in, the employee was courteous. The resort had us only staying 5 nights, instead of the 6 booked through Expedia. My husband had a copy of our Expedia receipt and the attendant made the change immediately. Service: We stayed in a ocean room w/ a king bed the first night. It was a suite style room w/ a door between our room and our neighbor's. There was a screaming child and we could hear our neighbor talking. This was unacceptable. My husband asked for a room change and we were switched to an even better room w/ a better view, although it had two double beds instead of a king. We never heard our neighbor in this new room. I learned that an ocean and ocean front are very different. Our original room was an ocean view and we had to twist our neck to see the ocean. The ocean front room had the ocean front and center in view. At checkout, there was a tiki bar charge that was forged to our room. After pulling my husband's real signature and the forged drink signature, the employee definitely knew the signature was forged and removed the charge. Be careful of people charging things to your room number!!!! Comfort: Our bed and pillows were very comfortable. The drapes had some mold, but I didn't let this bother me. The bathroom was clean and we had our towels replenished and bed remade every day by the housekeeping staff. Convenience: I can't imagine staying here without a car. I would be bored out of my mind. We rented from Thrifty. The elevator to the garage cost us about 10 minutes and almost made us late for an excursion. It's very slow, so plan for this. Getting the parking ticket validated isn't that much of a pain, it's on the way to the garage. Food/drinks: They are expensive - get a styrofoam cooler at the Walmart and fill w/ the resort ice. We only ate at Marbella (the buffet restaurant) because we had the food credit. The dinner buffet here was a huge disappointment. Service was ok. The price was $25 a person. The breakfast buffet was much better, but $22. (We usually ate off resort at the kioskos or Pasta e Pueblo in Luquillo (HIGHLY RECOMMEND). We ate at Antojitos down the hill and hated it. Huge disappointment.) The resort was beautiful and well kept. We loved the adult pool and hot tubs and that they are open 24 hours. The pool was never overcrowded. We always got a chair. Resort towels were free, fresh smelling, and huge, but they are available only after 8am. We only went to the resort beach a couple times because there are much prettier beaches in Puerto Rico! We booked all our excursions through the actual companies and not through the resort. This saved money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: caribbean007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Rio Mar and had a great 6 day stay. We booked directly through the Wyndham and had a great rate with a $100 f and b credit. The resort was easy to find, check in was fast and efficient and the ocean view room had a spectacular ocean view. Here are some other comments: Room: Excellent condition on 6th floor (comparable to hyatt, marriott), very clean, awesome view of ocean, no mold, nice a/c, plenty of space for 4, decent size porch off room with 2 chairs. We didn't have a fridge - bought a $4 cooler at walmart and stocked it with beverages. Great beds, typical hotel TV stations w/ HBO, very clean bathroom. Staff: Fast and efficient check in and check out, housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room every day, each evening we received a knock on our door and a staff member handed us chocolates and more towels if needed. I had a couple of minor maintenance issues. I screwed up the safe and the door lock broke. Both times, maintenance came right up and fixed the problem. Restaurant staff was great as well - efficient, friendly. Also, received some cold beverages one afternoon for being a Wyndham rewards member. Everyone was very nice. Hotel: The hotel is in great condition with beautiful grounds. Great flowers, palm trees and staff were always working to make things nice. The beach in front of the hotel is immaculate and is cleaned daily. The beach about 1/2 mile away from the hotel and off the hotel property is not as clean, but that is not the hotel's fault. Both pools are very nice. Nice temperature and well sized. Plenty of seating at the pool and beach. We swam at both many times and never had a problem. Grounds are very clean. Saw a few iguanas, but they are fairly innocuous and stay out of the way. Kind of a cool thing to see in the caribbean. The ocean waves were a bit rough for our kids the first day as there were strong winds, but they were perfect the rest of the trip. The inside of the building is beautiful as well - lobby, hallways, elevators, gift shop. Everything was 5 star and the elevators moved very quickly and were always available. The beach closes for lounging around 5pm due to sea turtles, but we could walk and swim on the beach anytime if we had wanted. We ate offsite quite a bit, but did try the lobby bar a couple of times and had great food for dinner at a fairly reasonable price. Also, had the buffet in the main restaurant one night and this was reasonably priced (in comparison to other resort hotels) - $14 - kids and $25 for adults. All you can eat. Parking: Parking is located under the conference facility which is on the west wing of the resort. About a 4 minute walk from the lobby. My last stay at a Hyatt had about the same distance to cover. $15 a day was the fee and i knew this coming in. I didn't let this effect my trip. I would have looked elsewhere if i wanted cheap parking. Staff was very efficient at getting the parking ticket stamped. I originally booked us for just 4 days in an ocean view room, but then extended to 2 more days in a resort view room. When i asked the front desk, about how I should go about moving to the other room, they said, "don't worry about it, you can stay where you are". This was really nice as our view was spectacular. The only possible things that could be improved upon was the cost of drinks - very expensive, but resort drink prices are high. Puerto Rico is a fairly big island and we wish we could have seen a few more towns and sights. We did see the rainforest, old San Juan, Luquillo and a few other places closer to the resort. The pictures on the resort website are a fairly accurate depiction of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but rent a car if you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Abelle111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (in our 20s) stayed at this hotel earlier this week. We had a great experience, but largely thanks to having read the reviews here before ours. The restaurants at the hotel (all the way from the coffee shop at which a 99cent arizona iced tea costs $4 to the sit-down restaurants) are very expensive. A poolside cocktail starts at $10, and the service outside is really slow. We rented a car and so were able to try out the local food as well. We recommend Antojito's down the street towards PR-3, as well as the bakery just 10 yards further down. There is also a strip of "local" restaurants on PR-3 towards Loquillo at which we had an excellent meal. If you rent a car, the self-park is $15/day (16 with tax) and the valet is $21ish/day. We did not have to pay for parking over the weekend though in self-park. Also, if you rent a car then it is much easier to do some of the excursions. You can drive to the rainforest easily, go to the visitor center ($4/person) and hike the trails on your own very easily, without having to pay >$60/person for a tour. Also, all the tours through the hotel are more expensive than if you book them on your own. The horseback riding and ATV tours can be booked directly through Hacienda Caribaldi (sp?) which is a 5 min drive from the hotel. We requested an upgrade on arrival, and received a great one. The room service was very prompt when we needed something, and the concierge and front desk were all very nice and helpful. The pools were extremely clean and the area was well kept. There are two hot tubs and two pools (one for all, and one for adults only). We did not use the golf course or tennis courts during our stay but did see others enjoying themselves. The casino is small, and the gym and spa are great. All in all, a clean and well kept place, although a little pricey, and a little limiting if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: utuado1968
Reviews.Content: Very upscale looking place and very nice resort hidden off of rte 3 in the mountains. Resort has it's own beach (waves seem a little rough to be swimming there though. great for just relaxing by the beach though. Rooms are very very comfortable. Room service is great. I have no complaints about the staff. The parking situation is really ridiculous $16 per day for parking. but we knew that going in. the fact that you had to have the attendant input your information before getting your car is a little inconvenient. (sometimes you had to wait 10 minutes just to validate your ticket. not a good system. Parking area is not near either. Upon check out i got billed for an extra day of parking and had to get it resolved. It seemed like they can bury an extra day's worth of parking with all the fees and if you dont pay attention you will get billed. I stayed 5 nights and got billed for 6 days worth of parking. Lay at counter made me feel like i was wrong saying that wyndham billed for only 5 days and it might show 2 in one day and 0 in another. I HAD TO TAKE MY PEN OUT AND CIRCLE THE 6 TIMES I WAS BILLED FOR HER TO REALIZE THAT I WAS BILLED FOR 6 DAYS OF PARKING WHEN IT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE FOR 5. Dont get me wrong this is a really really nice place. yes a little pricey but if they would just give the guests free parking or a better system it would make it better. The parking situation was only a little pain. pools, staff, service are all good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great grounds and location, food a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Js3591
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the resort, got a great deal direct from Wyndham. At check in, we were upgraded to a suite, which was great. Room was large, clean, but a bit worn in some areas. Bed was great. A car is a good idea, as you can explore the area and plan your own excusions. Hiked the rain forets which was cool (Very close to hotel) Drove up to "Bio Bay" to kayak and see the weird glowing things. At at the Chinese restaurant which was good, and worth the money, but the steak place was poor. The steaks were mediocre at best and expensive. Sent mine back 2x. As for eating. Breakfast that the bakery on the bottom of the hill, lunch at Antonitos at the bottom of the hill, both very good and real cheap. If you like Mexican, Lolitas east on Rt 3 is awesome, we ate their 2x. PR is cool becuase the people are nice, its like the 51st state, and they have a CVS/Walgreens on every corener if you need anything... Eli in the lounge bar is a great guy and great bartender, clearly one of the employess that "gets it"

Reviews.Title: “Unreasonably high prices and terrible service don't make up for the view or the bed.”
Reviews.Author: RVANorthernVirginia
Reviews.Content: I visited Rio Mar with my girlfriend last year and had some issues but after a very nice and unexpected letter from the guest service manager, I decided to give them another try with some friends. It was a mistake and I feel as though I've wasted my vacation time here. We tried to make the best of the stay and the amenities but unfortunately, the service at this resort falls short of even the common hotel. I am not sure whether it's a drive cut corners and save money, or just a problem with the attitudes of the managers who run your hotel but it does not feel relaxing here and your staff does not seem interested in taking care of guests. The housekeeping staff continue to be outstanding and the beach and pools are very nice. However, there are a number of issues: 1. Bartenders and servers move as if they have nowhere to be and often will arbitrarily overlook someone waiting to buy a $12 drink. There is a single bartender who's done a good job this week, Elain, who is usually at the upstairs bar in the lobby. The bartender who waited on us at Bolero, another of the bars was miserable. He didn't know how to run the server computer, it took 20 min for him to come back with the bottle of wine that we ordered, while we waited with no water or explanation. It took another 20 min for him to ring up our tab so we could go. And, while we stood there, getting poor service, he actually poured himself a Heineken and drank it behind the bar. If I can't get good service, he really has no business treating himself to a drink - if that's even legal here. 2. We tried to visit Shimaz, the Asian restaurant, but it was closed with no notice. The karaoke sign was still up but it too was off with no notice. I tried to get help from the concierge and they tried to send me to some Mexican restaurant down the road with regular run-of-the-mill fried fare. Basically, there was no recommendation for me and my guests for dinner last night. Whether you are busy or not, when you're running a resort where it is hard to get to and from other places (it's 15 min or more by car to anything), the amenities have to be open. You can't close these with no notice because it really puts your guests at an inconvenience. As a result, we really didn't have dinner that night and there was no explanation or apology. 3. The dealers in the casino have no personality, they deal slowly, count slower, and don't make hanging out in there any fun. Have you ever been to a fun casino? Typically there people don't care if they're losing money because it's fun, but here, the dealers seem unhappy and uninterested. I do too. Furthermore, you can't get a drink in the casino and it's about 3000 square feet with a couple of table games and about 100 slots. Very tiny. 4. In general, the food is OK. However, for the prices that they charge for food and drink at the resort, the food isn't up to snuff. 5. When we checked in, it took 4 trips to the front desk to get a set of keys that actually opened our doors. How is that so hard? Also, after the first two trips to the front desk, why didn't someone escort me to my room to ensure that they would work. Or, why didn't the desk clerk offer to buy me a drink while he sorted out the issue instead of continuing to inconvenience the guest. This kind of selfish behavior seems to be prevalent. 6. On Sunday, I asked for an umbrella twice and didn't get one. On the third visit to the umbrella boys, I said, "Do you remember me?" The three of them were sitting on their golf cart laughing and chatting. "Oh yeah, you wanted and umbrella over there right? Sorry about that, we'll get one right over." 10 minutes later it finally showed up. Suffice it to say that I won't be coming back here. This isn't restful or fun. The people "caring" for your guests don't understand service or hospitality and it's clearly not a priority from the management. I'm embarrassed that I brought my friends along for the trip. They deserve a better vacation - frankly, so do I.

Reviews.Title: “Don't invite the people you love to join you at the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: xmanxman
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister and I were looking forward to an exciting "first-time" visit to Puerto Rico just recently. We were joined by our brother and sister-in-law and their teenage son. Our neice was to be married in Old San Juan and the Rio Mar seemed just the place to relax in the interim - WRONG! It began the moment to arrived when we were denied use of the luggage rack - if they cannot personally assit you, you are on your own. Drag your luggage in the best way you can. And what a surprise to learn that parking costs $15.00 at day! This should not have been a surprise - shame on you Wyndam. The Lobby was indeed beautiful and the view of the ocean was breathtaking. We did not spend much time at the pool area but it seemed very inviting. I only wish we were as pleased with our rooms. It was so humid our beds felt damp. We were unable to control the temperature the entire stay - even after "maintenance." The air conditioning was so cold, it was almost unbearable. It rained daily - the Rio Mar is 10 minutes from the Rain Forrest. We wanted to watch television some evenings, but were disappointed with the lack of "free" channels. We packed DVDs but had no DVD player in the room. We've visited a number of "Wyndam" Resorts with conveniences such as these. An expensive resort of this type should not require a fee for every amenity! We were afraid to drink the bottled water provided in the room for fear of an exorbitant charge, but remarkably there was no charge. The beach was in need of maintenance - one could enjoy a long leisurely walk had you not been dodging debris constantly. And, a clean lounge chair would have been nice. My brother-in-law suffered insect bites of some type. Needless to say, we were somewhat disappointed. If you are going to require excessive prices, your service/amenities should exceed expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, but that's it!”
Reviews.Author: CTAllie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar April 11-16. The grounds are beautiful, and very well kept, except for the beach whiich is just plain dirty. The plastic beach chairs are plagued with caked on dirt and don't appear appropriate for anyone to sit on. The beach is littered with plastic bottles, straws, cups and other debris. We visited the beach daily, and the same conditions exist. This beach is the worse carribean beach I've ever been to, and we've been to many. There were crab and lobster washed up on shore, as well as large tree limbs, sea weed, and other sea debris. The pool area was vey nice, but sometime littered with Iguana poop. And, one time at the pool, an Iguana fell out of a tree onto the back of a patron and wouldn't let go for a few seconds.....Yikes!!!! To say the least, a lot of folks at the pool spent the rest of the day looking up at the trees. The hotel rooms, weren't much better than the beach. The first room we checked into had food droppings on the floor, as well as hair on the floor in the bathroom, and a moldy smell. The furnishings were worn, and we were provided with a TV that was a least 20 years old. I complained to bellman, and he immediatly got us a room change. The second room wasn't any better. There was mold everywhere - on the floor, on the curtains, in the bathroom, on the terrace.....mold was everywhere. I complained again to the bellman, and told him the hotel should be clean, and that I felt grossed out how dirty the rooms were. The bellman told hotel management, and he said they were going to call me. They never called. We had a problem with the air conditioner, and had to call 3 times before someone came up to fix it. Hotel management called to ask if the air conditioner waa fixed to our satisfacation, and asked if there was anything else we needed. I told her, Alex, the deplorable condition of the room regarding the mold, and she said the next day, she wpuld have our room scheduled for a deep cleaning.....well it never happen; the mold remained everywhere our entire stay. Several of the staff people could use an attitude adjustment as well. The woman at the front desk the day of our check in was rude and condasending. I asked a staff person in the hallway if he knew where the business center was, and he said "no" and kept walking. Another person asked this same person, if he knew where the fitness center was, and he just shrugged his shoulders and walked away. I walked into the Casino or Hotel store, and no one said hi or greeted me. Customer focused they are not! And yes, they nickel and dime you to death for everything. Self parking is $15 per day,and a major hassle. Internet is $14.99 a day in your room, and the 5 free machines in the lobby were very slow, or didn't work. All in all, it was only an OK vacation. I'm not sure I would book any Wyndham hotel again based on the experience at the Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “This resort just misses being fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Doriegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 6 day trip. Our room had a simply glorious view of the ocean! Upon arriving at the hotel and checking in, our room smelled heavily of mold (of which I am highly allergic) in the drawers, closet, curtains, dots of mildew on lamp shades. The ceramic tiled floor was not clean and was missing the area rug around the bed as is shown in their web site. None of the rooms have a rug as pictured on the site. There is a lovely balcony with one table and two chairs (dirty also). We have traveled to Puerto Rico many times, but usually stayed in San Juan; we weren't prepared for this. The next day, they moved us into a "Clean Air" room at no extra charge. The room was to be equipped with a medical quality air filter, encased mattress, pillows, etc. After getting into the room, we noticed it had none of the above. The staff promptly arrived making the proper preparations. The bed was very comfortable (Pacific Coast Down Pillows) and pillow top mattress. Everyone on the staff (with exception of a surly coffee waitress one evening at the snack shop) were extremely friendly, helpful, welcoming, and accommodating. Our main problem is we felt the hotel and the rooms were not clean and maintained in a fashion we had usually experienced. We usually stay at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan, and this time, decided to try a different area and save $. We have also stayed at the Intercontinental and the El Conquistador. The lack of attention to detail as to cobwebs, clean corners, fallen plaster, etc. was not there. The bath tub in our first room and our second room looked dirty on the bottom, but it was the enamel on the tub showing the cast iron wearing through. There was ample storage and closet space. Robes were available, but you need to request them. Anything we needed, there was someone was at our door immediately. We thought the pool grounds were just as beautiful as Ritz Carlton in San Juan. There was a fully equipped gift shop in which I purchased a few beach dresses and cute beach jewelry. The internet cafe on the lobby level had 5 computers, two of which were broken and one ran slow. I know maintenance is difficult in the tropics, but we were surprised by the lack of it in this resort. The carpeting in Marbella was extremely shabby. The carpeting in the hallways was worn. The paint on the front of the doors was scratched and needed painting. There was fallen plaster in the hall one morning outside our room. There was an area on the ceiling of the room where plaster had fallen at one time and had barely been painted, but the ceiling was not textured. We tried to look beyond all of this because the grounds and the pool areas were divine. The beach isn't groomed as it should be and was difficult if you were to walk along the water line to avoid walking on all of the junk. Even saw a dead,blue rat on our last day when we were walking the beach close to the water. Palio (Italian restaurant) was just wonderful. We dined there twice and each time was memorable. The service was impeccable. I was surprised to read reviews stating the service was bad because we didn't experience that anywhere. I disagree that the food prices in the restaurants are outrageous. They were about the same as in Cleveland where we live. Most drinks at the pool bar are $10.00 and I did think that was steep. They were delicious! They have happy hour at 4:00 where rum punch and their beer is 2 for 1. All of the bartenders are warm and friendly. They have a large bar off the lobby with entertainment and yummy food and apps, a lower smaller bar with a pianist (outside Palio), and a snack shop that served small pizzas, sandwiches, salads, specialty coffees, etc. You could eat at Marbella's brunch every day for $12.00 per person and get everything from omelettes to oatmeal to smoked salmon to the usual. A great value, we thought. The sushi restaurant was nice; unusual drinks with sake as an ingredient were fun. Our visit there was ruined by a large table of adults and four children who were allowed to scream and yell (and I mean loud) the entire time. We weren't happy the casino did not have crap tables. One disburbing thing I also have to mention is I had a surprisingly terrible problem with bug bites (turning into red welts) literally all over my legs, and several on my arms, by the time we left. (In case you are wondering, they were not bed bugs). I had not experience this in Puerto Rico before. I would strongly urge every visitor if you are sitting at the outside bar, spray yourself heavily with bug repellant. We got home yesterday and I was kept awake the last two nights from the pain and itching of the no-seeums. This hotel doesn't put refrigerators in the rooms unless you pay $10.00 a day and I am wondering if they also save money by not spraying for bugs. They do have written material about the no-seeums warning guests of them. My husband started itching today. The technicians at the spa were wonderful. I had two massages while I was there, one by Ellie and one by Barbara; both I would rank tops. I had a Swedish massage the first day and then a Seaweed muscle wrap with a massage. I had wished I had become acquainted with the spa earlier in our trip. I was given recommendations on products (because I asked; not because they wanted to sell things). They have a small gym with the appropriate equipment which I did not use. One night, we ventured to the steak house at the country club/golf club. I thought the food was just o.k. The waiter was pressuring us to order a bottle of wine (we had our fill of drinks at the beach bar all afternoon) and also pressured us to order dessert and coffee. The golf course is gorgeous and the pro shop has beautiful golf attire. All in all, I don't know if I would stay again unless I left special instructions ahead of time to have a clean room. I don't think you should have to spend extra money to have a room clean of mildew. All in all, I am mixed as to whether I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: r0mantictraveler
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my mom to PR for her birthday; this was her first visit to this wonderful tropical place. The resort is very beautiful; the grounds are so well kept. We particularly loved feeding the iguanas. The beach is also very clean despite the fact that the week we went was very crowded. Waves were a little rough, but we were told this is the way most beaches are in PR. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to an Ocean View Room, which was wonderful with a nice size bathroom and great amenities. The staff was very helpful, friendly and extremely polite. The Dragon Fly staff was also very nice; my mom has a knee issue and is unable to walk for long periods of time. Wanda (our Dragon Fly tour booking person) helped me organize tours that would not require her to walk for too long. During one of the tours, our driver went of her way to drive us around and give us a private tour just so that my mom wouldnâ€™t stress out her knee. She even insisted to carry her bags and was very attentive to everything my mom needed. I read many of the reviews before we left, most of the reviewers complained about the price of the food, thus I was prepared to pay whatever came my way, however the truth is that the food was not as pricey as the reviewers claimed. As a native New Yorker, I am used to paying $120 for dinner or $30-40 for a good lunch, so I honestly was not faced by the price tags, plus the food was very good, so why complain. We specially loved Palio, the food was amazing and they were very nice to make special arrangements to help me celebrate my momâ€™s birthday including having the accordionist play â€œhappy birthdayâ€�. My overall favorite part of our trip was the spa; as part of our package we were entitled to a 50 minute spa service daily, which we took full advantage off. The ladies at the spa were so sweet and extremely informative. They pampered us in every single way. I had the most amazing massages. Thank you once again Carmen for giving my mom that extra bit of attention when she complained of knee spasms. My only complain was the waiting period at the Tiki Bar, it took over 45 minutes to get a hot dog and when I asked the bartender as to why the long wait he just shrugged and walked away! Overall this was a wonderful and relaxing trip. I would definitely go back, this time with my husband to enjoy a more romantic setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Pricey Food & Drinks, Rental Car Needed.”
Reviews.Author: Walk6
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us (family & friends) and overall we had a great time. We had to clear the beach @ 5 pm for turtle mating so we went poolside in the evening. This was the best time to get in the hot tub. Food is very pricey @ the property restaurants so we took a rental car to go stock up on some no perishable food items, alcohol, and a blender. My husband and I took a shuttle to the front gate and walked about 10/15 mins to a restaurant called Antonjitos on the main street and the food there was worth the hike if youâ€™re up for it.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL, DO NOT STAY..”
Reviews.Author: worktomuchChicago
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible at the restarurants.. It was a min of 2 hours before you received your food and we only ordered a salad and hamburger.. Yep and you paid $70 for that. we stayed for a whole week w/ poor service. Spoke to the managers about our concerns and they didn't care..If you want horrible service, over priced food, which tastes ok then this is the place for you...

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you enjoy feeling frustrated.”
Reviews.Author: weedesign
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I loved Puerto Rico! It is a lovely country, especially because of their scenery, people and delicious food. However, I hated the resort. Rio Mar was EXTREMELY overpriced and they had really bad customer service. The grounds looked nice at first glance, but Iâ€™ve traveled to many other places, and I felt that they only went about 80% of the way. Sadly, I felt they didnâ€™t focus on the small details...so much wasted potential). You would hear people complaining all the time: to the folks that ran the tours (Dragonfly), to the folks in the front desk. They would make mistakes on tours, people were irate and instead of appeasing them, they would insult the guests. I was dumbfounded by their attitude. I think the over pricing was the most frustrating part of it all. For instance, a cup of coffee cost $4.50. I considered a helicopter ride and almost fainted. When I took my family to Hawaii 2 years ago, I paid approximate $250 for each of us to go on a helicopter ride. At this resort, they wanted $3,700 (and that was the cheap ride). We took a few tours. We did Old San Juan, however, Iâ€™m sure we were overcharged for it ($100/person). We went horseback riding for about 2 hours ($79/person). I had booked the bio bay tour, but later found out that you could call the bio folks on your own instead of going through Dragonfly and it cost less than half! The resort folks were charging $100/person and the tour actually only cost $45. Thatâ€™s a HUGE difference. I HIGHLY recommend renting a car so you can get around and eat elsewhere. But get ready because in addition to renting your car, the resort charges you $20/day to park yourself in their lots! I couldnâ€™t believe it. You also had a choice to have them park it for you (valet service for $25/day). BTW, rooms donâ€™t have microwaves and you can have a small fridge installed for $10/day (another rip off). Also, you would think a big resort like that would have computer stations for their guests. Well, they had a total of 5 computers in a narrow hallway near the front desk. 2 of them were out of service the entire time I was there. 1 had a broken keyboard, the other was super slow, so only one worked OK. There were no printers so you couldnâ€™t print out your boarding passes. I was beyond annoyed. The front desk folks were horrible. Make sure you stay on top of them. Not only are they rude, they also tried to charge me for extra services. Upon checking in on our first day (we arrived at about 1pm), they promised that our room would be ready between 3 and 4pm. So we went to eat (at one of their expensive restaurants) and walked along the beach/resort to kill time. We kept checking with them to inquire about our room and were given the runaround. We didnâ€™t get into a room until 6pm. I was told that ocean front rooms (which I had booked and paid extra for) were in high demand by us folks from the â€œstatesâ€�. As if we are spoiled brats. I was fit to be tied...I complained to the management and they gave me a $50 credit, like that was going to make a dent. I was so tired, I didnâ€™t care, I just wanted to finally get into a room and relax. We had been up since 3:30am and were exhausted. Of course, at the end of the trip, when we went to check out, they refused to give me the credit I was promised on that first day. I had to fight with the manager until they gave it to me. I also paid for airport transfer shuttles when I booked my trip BEFORE arriving in PR ($100 total) and they tried to bill me $150 each way. I felt really frustrated the entire time I was there. Guests shouldnâ€™t have to complain nor feel raped by exorbitant pricing. Needless to say, they got a mouthful when I had to fill out the satisfaction questionnaire upon check out.

Reviews.Title: “Beware.....Don't trust this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ClementClement
Reviews.Content: Although we had paid for our rooms months in advance, they were overbooked and unavailable when we checked into the hotel. Most of our group was displaced to another hotel for 1 night but had to wait late the second day until the rooms were ready to check in the Wyndam Rio Mar. Although the hotel attempted to make it up with complimentary meals, parking, etc. , they just didn't get it when we were still dissatisfied. Bottom line, we paid for our rooms and wanted to be with and our friends and their families. There was nothing else acceptable! We have stayed at this several times when it was a Westin. Our experience with the Wyndam Rio Mar was not good!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel & Staff , Don't listen to the negs”
Reviews.Author: The_Saint_6565
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I was a little nervous about this hotel after reading all the negative reviews (and I still would tell anyone to read all the reviews first). My wife and I booked the Rio Mar on cheapcaribbean .com with no problems for about $120.00 a night and I thought it was a very fair deal. We rented a car for $165.00 through enterpise and their airport shuttle took us to Carolina, where we were quickly on our way down Route #3 to Rio Mar. I don't know why people complain about P.R. drivers! I thought they were great and I'm not a city driver at all. Once we were at the light in front of Rio Mar Blvd, we continued down Route #3, three more lights to the Walgreens & Amigo on the right, so that we could get a cooler for $3.50 and water, beer, soda, sunblock, P.R. t-shirts and bug spray (though we never saw one mosquito for seven days). I won't bore you with the parking fee speech, as I found the valet very speedy. Checking in went smoothly and we got a free upgrad to an oceanview room. The room was PERFECT! No mold, no noise, and very clean. House keeping did a wonderful job. They were always stopping to ask if we needed any extra towels or anything (they even organized my meds on the bathroom shelf, which I thought was very cool). So we left a little tip each day. The bars... this is where I get somewhat miffed. $10.50 for a (maybe) 8 oz. drink! But the service in the lobby bar was the best (Silvia, a waitress, was very pleasant and always took time to ask if we were enjoying our stay). Dining. We tried Marabellas twice, once for dinner and breakfast. We loved it, because it was so conveinent to stroll into (we all know it's a bit high priced, but hey, we were on vacation). The grounds are wonderfully kept and just a treasure to behold. The iguana in the day are a great point of interest for the young and young at heart (make sure to save some lettuce to feed them; it's a blast) and at night the Coqui frogs all sound as if they are talking to each other. It's definitely beautiful to listen to while having a Pina Colada on the balcony of the lobby bar. We loved the beach and its great breeze. There's nice waves to play in, lots of fun in the sun... the Tikki bar is okay, but didn't stay open long enough. All in all, I would have to say is that if you want to be in northeast P.R. this is the place to be. Even if you choose to do your trip on a tight budget, just do your research here on TA and find all the little things that save big. Rent a car and drive right across the street to El Yunque, book tours through tour companies directly, Kiosks are good for dining, Old San Juan is great and cheap, and Walgreens or Amigo has anything you might need. I hope in some small way this will help someone have a good trip to this wonderfull part of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to like it...”
Reviews.Author: canadeeio
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a beautiful hotel, there is no possible argument there. Our room was comfortable and well decorated although I didn't enjoy looking at the speckles of mold everywhere (although this is hard to avoid being in such a humid pace). We would have loved a fridge but did not feel like paying the rental fee ($10 a day) for something that should have been complimentary. The pool, beach, and hotel grounds are gorgeous and well maintained. While the beach does close at 6pm--this is due to the nesting season of sea turtles and is completely out of the resorts control and not at all inconvenient. While I enjoyed my 4 day stay with two friends, the cost of everything left a sour taste in my mouth the entire time. As other guests have mentioned, the food here is very overpriced. I live in the DC metro area and do usually pay $20-$30 for a dinner entree, but the quality of the food at Rio Mar does not nearly meet the price you pay. My first night there, I spent $30 for a drink, spinach salad, and soup. A breakfast of coffee and fruit cup will cost you $10. There is no economical option so each night I was spending around $50 for food, drink and tip (they even charge a fee for splitting an entree!). If I wanted a cocktail this was even more. A lot of other guests were renting cabs ($60 round trip) to go out of the resort and buy snacks and drinks and bring them back in coolers. While this does keep you from eating food from the Tiki Bar (which caused me a night of suspected food poisoning), you still must find dinner on your own. If I had been traveling with my husband, I would have felt more comfortable leaving the resort to find restaurants with more local flavor and lower cost. The hotel gift shop offers very little in way of fun souvenirs, and like everything else, was very overpriced. A family spent $25.00 for one box of benedryl for their sick child while my friend paid $8 for a bag of pretzels. Upon checkout, we found $100 in extra "room fees" for who knows what. Parking a car is $20 a day on top of the car rental fee. The hotel shuttle cost more than for a group to take a cab to and from the hotel ($60). Although I got the room for a very nice price, the cost of food/beverages and all the extra "fees" Wyndham applies to every service would have made an all-inclusive much more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: borntoexplore
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer we stayed at the "Villas" at Rio Mar (one-bedroom condo with kitchen) and not in the hotel itself. We stayed during teh very over-crowded time of SPRING BREAK/EASTER and would have had proabbly a different experience would it have been quiet and peaceful. ideal location of this resort - about 45 from San Juan airport (if not caught in teh horrendous traffic on #3) and about 10 minutes from El Yunque National Park (rainforest). One of the best beaches on PR - awesome pool at the Villas with a quieter area than at the very busy hotel pool. The Villas are obviously more spacious, the lobby is 'nice' but desolated, the units are certainly overpriced - try to rent directly with an owner. I am agreeing w/ another reviewers comments regarding use of hotel facilities: Although I did ask explictely before booking if hotel amenities are included and I was assured they would which proved to be incorrect. "The relationship with the resort itself was mixed - you couldn't easily wander over to the main pool as there were guards checking if you were hotel guests. If not, you couldn't use the hotel pool (which was very crowded anyway). " The restaurants were very pricey but average or above average. We liked the location although besides the rain forest, bio luminiscent bay and beach there is not a lot to do

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Vacation!! Loved Wyndham Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: eponaaries
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect!! We planned a mother/daughter trip with 3 families. It was an absolute blast. I read alot of reviews before and had alot of advice from previous travelers. Tips: Rented a car, Rented a Fridgerator for the room ($20 total), Eat off the Resort, bring your laptop and wifi card for internet access. Rooms: The room was just perfect!! Very spacious. We had 4 people staying in the room, 2 of them teenagers and we had plenty of space for clothes and personal belongings. The bathroom had a great set up with a long shelf over the sink area.
