The balcony was great and the view was amazing. We had coffee every morning out on the balcony and listened to the surf. The beds were super, super comfy!! Rented the refridgerator and had lots of room for drinks and snacks. Resturants: We didnt eat at the Resort at all. I love trying new places and enjoying the local culture. We went to Luquillo Kiosks and ate at LaParilla, Jefe Burger and the Italian place. Lolita's was great mexican food and Antonjitos was FANTASTIC! Service: The service here was wonderful! Checkin was a breeze and they had unexpectedly provided us with an ocean/garden view. The view was so beautiful! Housekeeping was great, our room was always clean and tidy when we came back from the day. Grounds: The resort is beautiful with its lush gardens. The green lawn areas in front of the ocean was great for the children. I loved seeing the kids play a game of soccer or fly a kite. The iguanas loved the lawn. Pools: The pools were warm and wonderful. We really enjoyed our afternoon and evening pool time. They do not close the pool off for the night. Which is great to swim at night and play a game of pool volley ball and sit in the hot tubs... which were very warm. Beach: The beach was great, very pretty and plenty of beach chairs. I loved jumping the waves and spending lots of time in the ocean. There wasnt any coral/rocks. But we did find live sand dollars. The beach was great to take a long walk on. A little stroll from the hotel lead you to the river that came out to the sea. The view was amazing with the background of the El Yunque . Toured El Yunque on our own and walked the trail to LaMina falls. Also went on the Catamaran Sailing Snorkel trip to the outer islands. That was a wonderful day at the beach and snorkeling reef had a lot to offer. The water was clear and there were many fish and plant life. I followed a long deep cavern and looked really, really hard and found a very sleepy shark just sitting in his little cave. Prior to Wyndham, we spent 3 nights in Rincon, and that was completely different than the East side of Puerto Rico. Surfed and Snorkeled on the West side. See my review under Rincon of the Seas. I drove all over this island and loved every minute of it! The little mountain side roads were beautiful for sight seeing and was pleasantly surprized to find a beautiful lake in the middle of the interior. We also ventured off near San Sebastian to see the Gozanlandia waterfall, which in my opion was better than Mina falls. There were no tourists there, just a couple of local families.

Reviews.Title: “An Okay hotel..definately NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: samdanmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 2 boys (aged 8 and 10) for spring break. The public areas of the hotel are very pretty, but the rooms and hallways are 1970's Holiday-Inn style all the way. The pool area is lovely, close to a great beach. There is a large hot tub adjacent, which was crowded with a million kids...some jumping in...you couldn't really relax in it. By the end of the day I thought it smelled pretty heavily of urine, but I think that is because the hotel was crowded with spring break families. The location.. close to El Yunque is good....we did some excellent hiking there. We had a car for our entire stay...which I do recommend since there isn't anything to do off property that is walking distance. As far as meals....we ate our one "fancy" meal in Palio....excellent...highly recommend and worth the 150 for the four of us (with a bottle of wine for my husband and I) Other eating venues seemed overpriced and not as good. We ate off property a lot. Would absolutely recommend Antojitos down the hill for breakfast or dinner (2 dollars for a plate of pancakes!!!) Dinner for the four of us there the first night..30 dollars!! We also ate at "Richies" (up the hill)...beautiful view but overpriced. There is a new place next door to Richies....."Terraza Montemar"...same view (though not open-air) and much less expensive...very friendly service. I would visit PR again but not stay in this resort. Our room had a lot of (unfixable) problems. The ventilation system blew out musty foul smelling air and had to be off for the whole trip. Our sliding glass door did not have a screen, so we had to choose between bugs or stinky air. The hotel was "full" and they couldn't move us. They also told us upon check-in that we would not be given any Wyndym credit for our stay (even though we are members) because we booked it through Expedia!!! We could not bathe our kids in the tub because there was not drain plug...not a problem for our age kids but if I had toddlers, I'd be pretty unhappy about that. I thought people, in general, seemed overwhelmed and unwilling to help...perhaps because of the crowds. The last comment I want to add is about the garbage around the pool and beach. Yes...it is there and I couldn't stand it. But why are people leaving garbage around in the first place? There are cans everywhere. Its unfortunate that a lovely environment can get spoiled by people who, I guess, feel a sense of entitlement when on vacation not to pick up after themselves and their children.

Reviews.Title: “The most enjoyable stay I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: luv2biketravel
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is located between the ocean and the El Yunke Rain Forest. With three children, there was always something to do...or just relax. The pool area is lovely, complete with slide, gorgeous plants, palm trees...and iguanas the kids can feed. The way the dunes are, only a little wind blew at the pool area, and that wind could be STRONG! I loved how the pool was close to the beach so there was minimal schlepping if we split up with some family at the pool, and some at the beautiful beach.Staff was kind, helpful, and pleasant, the food at the poolside restaurant was excellent, and it was truly the most fabulous tropical experience I've ever had. Being close to the rain forest was fun,too, as we sometimes needed a break from the sun. What a great experience there as well! The hotel was beautiful, spacious, clean and well run

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But The Villas Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelers72
Reviews.Content: We considered the El Conquistador and the Rio Mar Resort for our vacation. We had stayed at the El Conquistador before and decided to try something different. Note that we stayed at the "Villas" at Rio Mar (we had a suite with kitchen) and not in the hotel itself. Here are our observations. The location of this resort is ideal - about 30-40 minutes from San Juan and about 10 minutes from El Yunque National Park (rainforest). The beach was fantastic - perfect sand, warm water and long rolling waves every day which were ideal for bodysurfing or riding a on board. The pool at the Villas was also excellent - zero entry (good for little kids) with an infinity feature on the oceanside. The downside to the Villas was that they were a bit dated - looked like they "needed a little love" and weren't getting it. Air conditioners are loud and very old. There were rust spots around the building/unit that needed attention. Our unit had several easily preventable problems during our stay (including a/c) - which necessitated working with the staff and being annoyed that someone hadn't addressed these problems prior to our stay. The staff/superindendant were nice - but I didn't feel they were empowered to immediately fix things (unlike at other vacation spots we have stayed - such as Sanibel, Florida). In terms of value for money, our Villa was really over-priced given its condition. The relationship with the resort itself was mixed - you couldn't easily wander over to the main pool as there were guards checking if you were hotel guests. If not, you couldn't use the hotel pool (which was very crowded anyway). The restaurants at the resort were so-so - not as good as at the El Conquistador (with the exception of Palio (the Italian restaurant). We didn't golf or play tennis - but those facilities looked excellent. If you are deciding between El Conquistador and Rio Mar, Rio Mar has a beach right on the resort - at El Conquistador, you have to take a boat to a private island to swim at the beach (i.e., you can't swim in ocean on a whim at El Conquistador). However, the private island does offer excellent snorkeling (which you don't have at Rio Mar). Rio Mar is also very close to El Yunque which offers great hiking and scenery. El Conquistador is much more upscale and you feel like the resort was constantly reinvesting to make it better - at Rio Mar, from the landscaping (hardly any flowers) to the restaurants to the lodging, you felt that the resort was just milking an existing asset and not committed to improving it. I guess that is understandable given the lack of any competition in the immediate area from other resorts. In closing, if you want to hike in the rain forest (many trails), have a great beach and be relatively close to San Juan, this is a decent choice. But don't expect anything more from it.

Reviews.Title: “Repeated failures and broken promises...”
Reviews.Author: 2jbsdad
Reviews.Content: (What follows are excerpts from an email I sent to the General Manager and Front Desk Manager the day after we checked in.) Iâ€™m not sure where to start with this litany of failed promises, sham reservations, inept housekeeping and pass-the-buck policies. What follows are the "highlights" of my list of ten failures evident at check in: There was a used, wet towel in the bathroom . There were dead bugs on the furniture . There were leftover condiments from room service on the table. The floor was dirty enough to discolor my socks in minutes. The air conditioning did not appear to be cooling the room. The interior of the refrigerator was not cold. With respect to the refrigerator, the freezer unit was caked in ice at least three inches thick in spots. I removed the ice and the refrigerator seems to be working better. All minor failures, to be sure. But major failures, taken together, especially when a property bills itself as a â€œGrand Resortâ€� does not deliver on the basics â€“ clean rooms, attentive housekeeping, honored reservations -- of a first class, let alone premier, destination. Shortly after check-in Wednesday. My SO went downstairs to inquire about the charges for internet usage in the room. She was told by one of the front desk personnel that if she were a â€˜By Requestâ€™ member, the daily internet charges against would be reversed. â€œWould you like to be a member?â€� she was asked. Of course, she responded. And after she completed a membership form, she was assured that the charges would be waived. Imagine her surprise, then, when she was told Thursday that she was wrong â€“ and notice I emphasized â€œsheâ€� was wrong. Another member of your front desk staff told her this morning that the charges would NOT be waived. The reason? She had not been a member for the required three days. Please note that this person did not explain to her that the membership didnâ€™t count until AFTER she had checked out. When she inquired about the room promised for her daughter after 11 am April 1, 2010, she was told by a member of your front desk staff that it would be taken care of today â€“ and that someone from the desk would call on her cell phone. By this time, Iâ€™m sure you will not be surprised (we werenâ€™t) when we returned to the hotel after 9 pm tonight to learn that nothing had happened. No phone call. No separate room. No explanation. Just more broken promises. So when we talked with you, it wasnâ€™t surprising that you said â€œIâ€™ll have a room for her tomorrow.â€� I didnâ€™t believe you then and I still donâ€™t. As I said to you, we are leaving Saturday. Put us off one more night and the problem we represent has boarded a flight back to the states. And then? I come back to the room our daughter must sleep in, on a fold out sofa bed for the second consecutive night (not to worry, weâ€™ll take care of it tomorrow, promise!) and the air conditioning units donâ€™t work. I call for service; the engineer arrives and tells me after â€œrepairingâ€� one of the units that the room will be cool in about an hour. That was more than an hour ago and the room is not cool. The second air conditioner in the room? Motor is too hot, so the engineer goes to talk to you. Your response? You will have a room for her â€“ tomorrow. And tonight? Let her sleep on the sofa bed in 80+ degrees â€“ again. And the inoperative air conditioning? Still inoperative the next morning. And the room is clammy warm as a result. It seems to be corporate policy here to tell the â€œguestâ€� anything to postpone the so-called â€œsolutionâ€� until tomorrow. And this seems frighteningly transparent; my experience suggests your staff is terrible presenters of what polite society would not refer to as lies. They seem to be saying what theyâ€™re told to say â€“ â€œweâ€™ll take care of it tomorrowâ€� for example â€“ knowing full well that while the complaint wonâ€™t go away, the complainer will. We checked out Saturday, as planned. Never the second room we were promised from the moment we checked in. Our daughter slept on a sofa bed for three nights -- despite the fact that we paid for a separate room for her, for three nights. Before I sent the email from which this review is extracted, I stopped by the General Manager's office -- initially to get an email address. I was invited in to the office and had a very pleasant and I hope informative conversation with the General Manager. She took immediate action on our behalf. She was gracious in her generosity. I will report on our last day at the Rio Mar Beach Resort and Spa in a subsequent review.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort and staff. Lots of ways to save $ if you want.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfunKI
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about our trip after reading some posts from Jan and Feb. Here is what we found: - Had to wait for our room to be cleaned but they were sold out and very busy. When we did get to check in I teased that she could upgrade our room if she wanted and she did. We had a beautiful ocean front room on the 6th floor. -The west side of the hotel seems quieter, but still close to all you need. -Housekeeping did a great job. -Rent a car, eat outside of the hotel. Richies is beautiful but the food and service were not. -Not only is the hotel food expensive, it's just not very good. At Shimas stick to sushi, the menu items were awful. -Never had an issue with pool or beach chairs/umbrellas. -Beds were awesome, we slept well every night. -Saw a lot of complaints about thin walls, no worse that any other hotel. Did have a drunk knock on our door at 1 am looking for his room. No he didn't really knock he screamed and banged, but left when we said we were calling security. -Like I said rent a car and eat out. Try Pollo Tropical and Taco Maker, good fast food. -Coffee in the room is the same coffee downstairs but is free. The nice girls next to the casino will give you a half glass of milk or half and half for your coffee. -Beautiful beach, brown sand but lovely breeze and warm clear water. -My boys saw over 44 iguanas, 4 geckos, and 14 anoles. They are all over the place but they leave you alone. Fun to watch. -Beer at the gift shop is cheaper than the bars. Get a cheap cooler and use ice. Go to Walmart and stock up on drinks, beer and snacks. -DON"T BUY THE PALM PRODUCTS FROM THE GUYS ON THE BEACH. MY SON AND HIS FRIEND SPENT THEIR OWN $ 20 EACH ON HATS. THEY WERE A BIG HIT AND THEY GOT TONS OF COMPLIMENTS ON THEM BUT THEY ARE NOT ALLOWED BACK INTO THE STATES. THEY CARRY A MITE THAT IS A DANGER TO U.S. PALMS. NO MATTER WHERE YOU LIVE, THE USDA STATIONED AT THE AIRPORT WILL MAKE YOU DISPOSE OF THEM. MY BOYS WERE REALLY DISAPPOINTED!! -Overall a great trip. -Watersports are not included. Rentals are available, from tubes to boogie boards, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Family-friendly resort. Be sure to request a clean/hypoallergenic room.”
Reviews.Author: lisag67
Reviews.Content: I am not a big fan of resorts, but this is a great place to visit with kids. Very convenient layout--pool and beach are right by the hotel. There is an adult pool, a kid pool and a baby pool. The kid pool is nice because large sections never go above 3'6" so even kids who are not great swimmers can have fun and get around in the water. My daughter loved the simple things, like the iguana feedings and hair braiding each morning. It is also a very convenient location if you want to visit El Yunque or Luquillo Beach. Not too far from the bioluminescent bay at Fajardo either though it can take a while in traffic. I met some guests there who were happy with the tennis and golf facilities--I don't play either sport so can't speak to that. That said, I do want to alert you to issues with the rooms. Our room on the 2nd floor had a serious mold problem. Unfortunately we didn't notice until it was too late to change rooms the first night. I'm talking mold on the drapes, the walls, the closet doors, possibly even part of the duvet. A guidebook looked like it had been soaked in water after we left it out for a few hours. After the first night they moved us to a special "clean room" on the 5th floor where everything is hypoallergenic and they run an air purifier. No mold problems there. It had a mountain view, which was fine with us, but it also was set up for someone in a wheelchair, which was not so great because all we had was a showerstall with a handheld showerhead, and the sink counter was so high my daughter could not reach the faucets. But after I spoke to the front desk staff they did give us a credit for our first night and they did not charge us for a refrigerator. Overall I feel like they were responsive to our concerns and tried to improve the situation, but be sure to request one of their special clean rooms if you want to avoid the moisture problem. Otherwise, the rooms are nice and the beds are excellent. I thought the food at the resort was overpriced but our daughter loved the buffet restaurant. We ate at Ricky's up the hill one night, and that place had pretty good food but cost about the same as the food at the resort. (Better view though.) We also ate at a few local places that were much cheaper, at the bottom of the hill: Antojito's and Isamem Bakery. Antojito's is pretty good and popular with the locals. We met Roberto Clemente's son there at dinnertime. Isamem is cheap but the guy behind the counter could not remember that we had ordered coffee and milk along with the food. Final tip: If you want to go on one of the outdoor excursions I would suggest contacting the tour operator directly, not through the resort, to make your reservation. Someone told me that they charged a big markup for the kayak tour of the bioluminescent bay. We booked a tour directly with Captain Suarez, who runs an electric boat. His tour was one of the highlights of our trip and based on what I observed I think it was much more fun than the kayaks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - Great Beach - BUT Super Slow & Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Zapplus2
Reviews.Content: Dinner: On our first night we had dinner at their buffet restaurant and the staff there were not too friendly (my son is on a timing kick rite now so he timed it everything on his watch) The restaurant was not even half full and it took them 23 minutes to sit us down: there excuse was â€œwe do not have accommodations for 3 guest at the moment we only have accommodations for parties of 2 or parties of 4 but Not parties of 3.â€� We finally sit down and it took them 32 minutes to come and ask us if we wanted anything to drink â€“ we did stop every waitress/waiter that would pass us and we would request water and all they would tell us â€œIâ€™m not your waitress/waiterâ€� finally we did get a waitress and her greeting to us was â€œWho sat you here!? You are not supposed to be sitting here.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: schatziphila
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful resort, very tropical. The room was comfortable and clean and had a wonderful mountain/jungle view. Get a car at the airport and plan all the excursions you want to make yourself. Instead of buying food at the hotel, buy food at the grocery store, have breakfast at small bakeries like isamar(right around the corner from the hotel). Also, make your own coffee using the coffee machine in your room. Instead of renting the refrigerator they offer, take advantage of the ice machines on each floor, and simply place your items on ice. Bring a cooler! We drove in our car to el Yunque, old San Juan and drove to and parked in Fajardo where we went on to take the ferry to Culebra to see Flamenco beach. Be careful to return your towels on time or the hotel will charge you a $25 late fee. Unless you eat and make excursions independently from the hotel, you will quickly drain your wallet. They'll charge you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place " Amigos"..We will be Back....”
Reviews.Author: funinkyLexington_Ky_
Reviews.Content: Spent the week of 3/28 thru 4/4. We arrived around 4 O'clock the afternoon of 3/28 and were greeted with smiling faces and many welcomes from the staff. We checked in and all of our luggage was taken to our room by Albert. The room was spacious, clean and well equipped with everything you would need. Spent the evening walking the spacious, beautiful and well maintained grounds. Ate a small meal at the bar and watched the NCAA tourney game, got a good nights rest and started fresh on Monday am. The pools are fantastic. get up early because you may have to save a few chairs...fills up early. We heard all of the horror stories abouth the Iquanas at the pool but myself, my wife and kids enjoyed their company and it seemed that all of the other guests including the smaller children had fun feeding them. Enjoy good food and cold drinks from the tiki bar and a Gracious and most cheerful staff who went out of their way to make our stay and many of the others guests stay a rememberable experiance. If you go say HI to Henry, Jose, Warren, Jaun, Brenda and all of the other servers at the Tiki Bar, they were GREAT! Went to Old San Jaun a couple of times, a beautiful old city. Must see... As for local food. Go to Richies for good food and a great view. For Mexican, go to Lolittas just a few miles west of the resort. If you want to go fishing while in Puerto Rico look up: Mike Benitez Marine services in San Jaun at Club Nautico. How can I forget about the weather while we were their. Sunny and warm 88-91 every day. If you want to get around you must rent a car. Valet parking at the hotel was kind of a pricey ticket but the self parking is only 5.00 less a day, but a long walk. All in all me and my family had a great time and we will be sure to go back I hope in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Winchester Review”
Reviews.Author: Winchester9
Reviews.Content: Booked Total package for a pretty good price Flight/Hotel/Rental, if you spend more than $1300 please keep searchin for a better deal. First of all the Weather change was stunning because of a 20 degrees difference from the philadelphia are and PR. Rental car lines were vicious, but I paid in advance, and fill the tank up yourself and save around 15 -20 bucks. PR is very similar to most other U.S. spots so finding your way around isnt hard unless your in old san jaun, whcih is pretty much the hood and has very tight streets. The Hotel was Unbelievable, really sharp and after the intial amazment, then come the FEES. 15 dollars a day to self park, have to get it validated everyday in order to leave the garage. YOU MUST GET A RENTAL CAR, IF NOT, DO NOT GO HERE!! CABS ARE A RIPOFF Up the road on ESTE 3 there is a walmart in Farajado, and also alot of stores that remind you of home. Spanish people speak both english and spanish in most cases, but you ocasionally get one or two act like they dont speak so they dont have to be bothered with you. Rain Forest was HOT, free just across ESTE 3 from the resort just follow the signs Barcardi Factory tour(San Jaun) was wack and felt like a high school field trip, you just watch movie. The FREE rum they give you is worth it! Get a small foam cooler and get your do it fluid at walmart and a few other stores that sell boo's. SAVE MONEY cause the hotel will charge like 20 for a 6 pack of corona, and at the walmart they are 4.97 I am a huge drinker so I loved that. Resturants at the Hotel were expensive and they charged 120 to rent a jet ski for a half an hour. Overall I loved the hotel and my girlfriend cried the last day because she didnt want to leave, but she got it together. As for Winchester, I got smashed alot and saw some real beautiful Sites of PR, REALLY RELAXED without the kids(Grown up time) Me and the future Mrs. Winchester will be back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Research paid off - we had a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: kingfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a beach destination where we could bring our teenage daughters on spring break, but still have a family atmosphere. The week we were there, (Mar. 29-Apr. 3), this hotel was perfect for our needs. The hotel is beautiful, and our room was very nice with an ocean front view. The beach was wonderful, and the weather was great all week. The employees were all friendly, with some going above and beyond - a special thanks to Carlos Rosa who brought us beach chairs and an umbrella from all the way at the other end of the beach when we came out late one morning. Because we'd read lots of reviews, we knew to rent a car and not eat at the overpriced restaurants on the property. As every review of this hotel mentions, the parking charges are ridiculous. But at least we knew what to expect, and the $90 we spent on parking for the week was well made up for by what we saved on food and sightseeing by having our own car. This was one of our favorite vacations as a family, we all had a great time and really enjoyed our stay at the Wyndham. We would definitely go there again. Some tips: *requesting a fridge in your room costs $10 per day. A cheap styrofoam cooler at Walmart costs under $5. Ice at the hotel is free. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is $19 per person, plus a $4 carafe of coffee. Just by using the cooler for milk, eating cereal in the room for four mornings, I estimate that our family of four saved around $400. *When we were in the mood for a full breakfast, we went to Antojitos (right at the bottom of the hill) and spent only about $5 per person. The food was great. *You will see lots of signs for Richie's Cafe up the hill from the resort. Having seen some TripAdvisor reviews, we went for the gorgeous view and kept our expecations reasonable for the food. Yes, the view is incredible, but even considering our lowered expectations, the food was barely average and the service was ridiculously bad. Cost for our family of 4: $85. Later in the week we learned that if you keep driving a few hundred more feet up the hill, you will come to a restaurant called Terrazzo Montemar. Same gorgeous view, with wonderful food - and half the price of Richie's- highly recommended. *The Kioskos in Luquillo are not to be missed. They are a row of beachfront shacks right off Highway 3. We went twice for delicious lunches that cost our family of four less than $20. Yum. *In our opinion, the $20 valet parking wasn't worth it. After arriving late the first night and using valet, we switched to $15 self park for the rest of the week. We actually preferred getting our own car (quick and easy) to waiting around for them to bring it. *Do online research and reserve your rental car ahead of time. The hotel has an Avis desk, but obviously you'll spend more that way. We found the best deal by far with Thrifty in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: slip32174
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful with a lush tropical setting that was kept clean and beautiful.. the staff was attentive and courteous, the rooms were beautiful, very clean and was about as sound proof as I've ever found in a hotel. We ate in every restaurant and each and every meal was outstanding and the service

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off! The service is awful!”
Reviews.Author: auroraadventurer
Reviews.Content: The people who work at the Wyndam are lovely, very friendly and warm. The grounds of the Wyndam Rio Mar are beautiful, so is the beach. They keep the lobby clean and attractive as well. However, don't be fooled. It took five room changes before we got a decent room. The first smelled of mold, although attractive looking. We changed to a second room and people were sleeping in it. The hotel computer was not up to date. The third room stunk of smoke, in a no smoking hotel. By this time, the fourth room was just ok but we took it because we were so tired. The next day I asked for a change. Finally got a decent room after 5 tries. Management did reimburse us a few dollars for our troubles. Food is very expensive and the hotel is 40 minutes from San Juan. Breakfast buffet costs $25 p/p and if you don't want the expense, you can wait on line at the Express Kiosk and pay $20 for two coffees, two bagels, and one muffin. The length of time on the kiosk line is upwards of 25 minutes. Therefore, you will need to rent a car. Here in is another story. Avis was going out and Enterprise was coming in. The hotel did nothing to ease the transition of the two companies. Therefore, we were unable to get a car at the hotel for two days. Then there is the $25 parking fee if the hotel parks for you. If not, there is a $15 parking fee which is the most cumbersome I have ever experienced. First you park. Then you get a ticket. When you are ready to retrieve your car, you have to to go outside to the valet desk, get the ticket validated, walk back into the hotel, go down three levels to the garage and retrieve your car. It turns out that the parking is outsourced, as is the food consession, as are most services in this hotel. So, the left hand does not know or care what the right hand is doing. Now let's talk about the beach. You have to sign out for towels, so there is a line to get the towels and a line to bring them back. When you go to the beach, they give you a beach chair and an umbrella for free. That is great. However, you wait on a line, then you point to the spot you want. The beach chairs are brought over, then the umbrella never comes. If you opt to pay for a cabana for $150 for the day, you receive a cooler filled with expired soda and water. Fruit is supposed to come, one small cup was given to us. Otherwise, we were completely ignored. A young couple i met, booked the hotel online. They did not read the fine print and were charged a $32 daily resort fee in addition to the agreed upon price. The hotel does not have wifi unless you pay for it. I was so tired of paying for everything, I refused to spend another dime on the internet. All in all, if you think the Wyndam will give you quality and service, look for another place to stay. You think you have a pretty good deal and then you have to pay for everything that in most places is given to you.

Reviews.Title: “Property beautiful, rooms pretty awful”
Reviews.Author: Tink1234
Reviews.Content: So it is with a heavy heart that I write this review because I think this COULD be a great hotel (and two years ago I wrote a glowing review) and honestly, our family had a great time, but there are some serious issues here that have only gotten worse in the last two years. The main issues are - - the condition of the rooms - this goes from OK to atrocious. There has been clearly no upkeep over the past two years. We had to go to THREE rooms until there was one that was decent. The first one I was maybe a little picky about (our reservation was "partial ocean view" - fine, I expect to see just partial but in that room, you could see the ocean if the palm trees swayed just so and you stood at the edge of the balcony. And the worst part was when I called to complain the front desk told me "here, if you can even see a sliver of ocean it is considered partial". This, hotel management, is going to tick off your guests before they have even unpacked. A SLIVER frankly should be resort view - you make a few less bucks but your guests get what they thought they paid for.) I digress. So the second room was appalling. The smell of mildew was overwhelming, everything in the room was wet b/c clearly the dehumidification system was not working for some reason, and the curtain was torn and filthy. Really, I haven't seen a room like that in years. I thought about just crying uncle and asking for our old room back but when we went to get our luggage it was already occupied by a guy who said the door on their first room wouldn't lock no matter what they did! I was a little sheepish about asking for another room and tried to make the best of it for the night but when the adjoining room turned out to be loud honeymooners, I had to do something and I need to give credit where credit is due, the overnight front desk person gave us a spectacular room that was clean and had a lovely view. So it ends happily but based on the conversation poolside, SO many people were upset about their rooms that our first two rooms were likely more representative. But let me make this clear, the problem was not with housekeeping - they did fine, it was that nothing was being kept up or updated. It seemed like if something was dirty or torn, it was going to stay that way. - the food (other than the ERL CafÃ© and the poolside cafes which had pretty good food with expected resort-level pricing) is really expensive. This can be handled by renting a car and eating your meals off-site. But woe is he who has no car and is trapped. We loved eating out and getting the car from the parking garage was no problem at all. You will have to pay for parking, but where don't you?? - the service - everyone is friendly but there is not one bit of pampering going on here. So not a big deal if that isn't important to you, as it wasn't to us, but if it is, this may not be the place for you. Like I said, it isn't a big deal to us - all we need is for people to be friendly and they were that without exception. On the bright side, the waves are perfect for boogie boarding, the beach is lovely and the outdoor areas are pleasant and well-maintained. We rented Cabana #18 for two days and that made our vacation as the cabanas give you guaranteed shade, are stocked with snacks and drinks, have comfy chairs and #18 has the perfect vantage point to watch your kids and have privacy. Really lovely. Add to that the proximity to El Yunque and the great food a short drive away and it is a good vacation, but it is not for everyone. I THINK maybe that is why half the reviews are awesome and the other just awful. If you want to just spend a lot of time outside by the pool, playing in the perfect waves, seeing the rain forest, then you'll have a great time. If you want a luxurious experience with updated, beautiful rooms and VIP service (and there is nothing wrong with that on vacay!), this may not be the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Could be nicer”
Reviews.Author: Wfbtraveler
Reviews.Content: We've only been here for two days and already want to leave. The food is rediculously expensive. Every time you move your car (which costs $15 /day) you have to get your ticket validated. When we went for a moonlit walk last night two security guards stopped us and said it wasn't safe. This morning I called the concierge to ask about activities and she told me I had to walk to the pool to find out. Wouldn't you expect this to be coordinated? Weirdest of all is that the restaurants don't have much outdoor seating and are over air conditioned. Most of the problems with the resort would be easy to fix but you get a sense from the staff that Wyndham wants it like this.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: hsyu
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and two young kids (ages 6 and 4) spent 6 nights at the resort. Although the hotel gave us a room with the worst view (facing the valet-parking garage entrance), we could care less. Not many cars were in and out (because valet parking is $20 per day??) so the noise was actually very minimum!! Positive points of the hotel: - great location: 10 minutes from the rainforest; 15 minutes from the Bio Bay; 30 minutes from Old San Juan. - direct access to the beach. Plus, the hotel's swimming pool is 200 meters away. My kids were hopping between the pool and the beach. The kids loved it!! - comfortable bed - the air conditioning unit is not too noisy (my husband is a light sleeper. So, he was very pleased :) ) - friendly staff Minus: - High price: I have read a lot of reviews before departure. Therefore, I was very prepared not to get heart attack when I saw the prices on food (i.e. cold cereal for kids is $6) or water/sightseeing activities (kayaking at the bio bay is $99 PER PERSON). Everything is EXPENSIVE!!! Unless you really really want to spend all the money you have, sincerely suggest that you go a supermarket ( a local one called "Amigo") or a drug store (Walgreens are everywhere) to buy cereals, milk, soft drink, etc. We never dined at the resort. Fast food chains (i.e. Sizzlers, Burger King, Subways) and the nearby Isamar Bakery were our main sources for meals. - malfunction room keys: We had problems with the keys EVERYDAY! - inconsistant housekeeping quality Overall, we had great time in PR. So, enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location close to the Rainforest”
Reviews.Author: jorgemontenegro
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went after finding a deal on cheapcarribean.com and the hotel upgraded us to a suite. The hotel was very clean and luxurious for the price. We chose this hotel due to its close proximity to El Yunque. I recommend renting a care and exploring the rain forest on your own. There are several waterfalls that you can hike to and we were all alone. We drove up the mountain at night and listened to the frogs and it was magical. I also recommend taking the drive to the biobay which was also magical. The food at the hotel was overpriced and just not that good. We recommend the short drive La Parilla which is great! We got sucked in to the free massage for listening to the sales pitch...not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbpell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from the Rio Mar, the hotel is lovely and the staff is very accomodating. However, prices for food and drinks are very high. They also nickle and dime you; $10 a day for a refrigerator and a charge for non-motorized water sports. If you are thinking of staying here, definitely rent a car (at the airport, not the hotel). You will save a lot of money on food as well as any sightseeing trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: tburnettcsr
Reviews.Content: This place is a dream.The staff is courteous and always greeted us whenever they ran into us.The food/alocholic drinks at the resort are very expensive.Worth it to pay for taxi to go to store and stock up.Other reviews had complaints about cracks in paint, etc.How could they even notice it with the surrounding beauty.The hotel allows you to stay in the pool/jacuzzi as late as you wish. There is plenty of nightly entertainment on each fllor, paian liunge, salsa singers, karaokie.I enjoyed this place a lot.My only complaint was each day we had to get our room key rekeyed because it wouldn't let us in.We walked up the beach (quire a bit) & there were kiosks (row of stands) of Puerto rican food.You can see it from the beach.Walk straight up the beach & you can't miss!All day you can go from clear beautiful ocean to their lovely pools, 1 for adults & 1 for kids.Wish I could have never left!

Reviews.Title: “Fun For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: Panthers2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our family springbreak vacation and had a blast. We didn't know what to expect so going on this vacation was a suprise. The hotel was very clean and neat. The staff was very helpful. I would have to say the food on the property was a little pricy, but good. There are plenty of places to eat off property and you can get authantic Puerto Rico food. We did an excursion with East Winds and had a blast snorkleing. The staff at East Winds was wonderful and very pleasant. The rain forest is a must see but wear comfortable shoes. I would recommend this hotel. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Would love to own property here.”
Reviews.Author: Hernando33
Reviews.Content: Rio mar is about a forty minute drive from San Juan. There is a walmart on your way (we always need t stop for juice boxes and diapers). Hotel is quite large. Gated community wih many privately owned villas and condos. Very beautiful. Staff is friendly and willing to answer any question. There is a buffet on the first floor that is ok. The Asian restaurant is excellent!!! Food bythe pool is also good. The beach is beautiful. Luquillo is a short drive away and a great stop to sample local food. At the bottom of the mountain (where u would have turned off the highway to goto rio mar) there is an excellent bakery with great coffee and pastry. Richys (restaurant) is atthe top of the mountain and a definate must!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheated us - Didn't deliver on promises”
Reviews.Content: When I tried to check-in, the resort said that they had been overbooked and would transfer me to another resort for 1 night. To compensate me, I'd be given free breakfast, self-parking, and an upgrade of our 2 rooms to 2 junior suites. The next day, the resort informed me that they had no space for the whole week and that my group would have to stay at the other resort for our whole stay of 6 nights. They also claimed that they had not promised us any room upgrades and so couldn't put me up in a suite. Lastly, they told us that we couldn't get any extra beds in the rooms due to fire hazards, although they had told us that we could when we had made the booking 3 weeks earlier. All in all, the resort gave us wrong information when we booked the hotel, and also made promises that they later denied making when forcing us to move to another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but not a value”
Reviews.Author: Adventurelover67
Reviews.Content: I booked a package deal for my family through cheapcaribbean.com. After comparing resorts/cost/reviews, we decided on the Rio Mar. I have very mixed feelings regarding our stay but cannot deny the grounds and the property are indeed beautiful. We stayed on the fourth floor and had a breathtaking view of the El Younqe rainforest. There was even a small pond setting outside of our window that was complete with iguanas, turtles, goldfish and even some bats in the early morning. What a beautiful way to start the day! The pool areas were very clean and the lobby is gorgeous, very open and airy. The concerige staff were very helpful with questions and general information. Thanks to other TripAdvisor members we did rent a car and were very happy with that decision. We also used the valet service and would recommend that to everyone. The downfalls to this hotel are very overpriced food, poor restocking by housekeeping and not much effort from the front desk when there is a problem. We ate lunch at the Tiki bar our first day. The total amount for 4 burgers with fries, 3 lemonades and one tap water was approximately 75.00 USD (with tip). The burgers were good enough but we chose not to eat on property again. There are several nice restaurants, kiosks and stands close by with excellent food. The other two problems we encountered were that I had reserved 2 rooms (adjoining) one for my husband and me, the other for my 19 year old daughter and her 18 year old friend. When we checked in we were told the girl's room would be ready in about an hour. We took our bags upstairs, ate and when my daughter went to the desk to get her room key we found out they had given their room away. Luckily they were able to put them two doors down but it was still a bit inconvienient. The thing that bothered me the most was the condescending attitude of the man at the desk. I don't think he understood or cared that one of the girls had never been "away from home" and was a bit nervous. The other issue was with housekeeping. I give them an A+ with cleaning but not with restocking. This was a daily issue and even included running out of toilet paper. One morning my daughter's friend informed me that housekeeping had taken her "feminine hygeine" products that she had left on the top of the toilet. When I said something to the front desk the reply was "that's strange but there is nothing we can do about it". However, they did send up the shampoo and soap that hadn't been filled. Overall, I really enjoyed the hotel because of the cleanliness and views. The location was great but I don't think I would stay again because of high priced food, lack of stocking and the lack of rectifying the room situation. I felt as if the place was a money pit and we day travelled quite a bit, so for us it really wasn't worth the price we paid. If you're looking to just hang by a pool or the ocean and just relax you may very well enjoy this hotel, just be aware all food, excursions and any indulgences are very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: kgavagan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Puerto Rico for the first time, and we booked our hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. We planned on taking a day trip to Old San Juan and the rain forest, but ended up spending five days sitting at the pool. It was pretty quiet while we were there, which was nice. The room was very nice, considering the price we paid on cheapcaribbean.com. The room overlooked the mountain, but in the future I would splurge for the ocean view. Staff was very attentive and helpful throughout our stay. Food was good, however very overpriced. We ate at the Italian restaurant and really enjoyed the ambiance and food. The resort was very quiet at night and poor outdoor lighting and canceled night activities did not encourage guests to stay up. Overall, I was very pleased with the resort. Yes, the food and activities are expensive, but considering the price we paid on cheapcaribbean.com, the costs all evened out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: diva200781
Reviews.Content: Before I left for PR, I would look at this site to see the reviews. I had already paid for my package, so it was sealed. I read that some people recieved bed bug bite...... No, there were no bed bugs. My first night on the resort I took my dtrs on the beach for 10min. I left that beach with huge bites, not from my bed. The only mold that I seen on the resort, was by the pool....... Now the prices of the food, I was on vacation so it really didnt matter. I spent over $450 on food for the five days spent on the resort. My dtrs had a ball on the water slide. And they met alot of new friends. I will recomend renting a car. The resort will try to squeeze every last penny from your pocket. $61 per person to vist Old San Juan, our driver was the best though. You will enjoy your stay even though its expensive.... Oh, the staf and natives were absolutly welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Corporate should re-evaluate Rio Mar (long post)”
Reviews.Author: Injnbird
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rio Mar Beach & Spa. This visit was business-related as I was joining other consultants mid-point in our travels. I'd never visited Puerto Rico so I hoped I would enjoy a new destination. My job takes me all over the world so I've stayed in some poor conditions and the very best. I will give you MY honest opinion. -From the airport to resort is a 45 + minute drive IF traffic is good. Don't be alarmed if you see random horses tied or untied to traffic poles. I'm not kidding. Our driver from Dragon Fly explained that people are very good to their horses in PR and it's not uncommon for people to donate monies for care? Mmm. If you arrive on a Saturday, horse parades are common on the Main Streets. -Upon arrival, you will check in and be escorted to your room with your luggage. They speak FAST regarding where everything is located on the resort. Don't try to comprehend it. They offer no resort maps. Rio Mar is large and it will take a few days to get your bearing straight, especially how to get down to the pool from the elevators. -My first impression of my room was the over whelming smell of mold . It was terrible. I've stayed at many tropical destinations and by far this was the worst. When I got back home..my suitcase and clothing smelled horrible. No joke. As far as cleanliness, the attention to detail was not there. There was nothing "special" about the room which was an upgrade ocean view of the top of palms trees..just smelly and sub-par cleaned. I can say though, my bed was very comfortable. My patio furniture was rusty so I used bath towels to cover the seats and table. -The hotel food is not good, below average, and VERY EXPENSIVE. An average course buffet cost $24.99 US per person and if you drink, you will pay and pay dearly. We usually grabbed something light from the small coffee cafe at the entrance of the casino. Go off hotel property, eat dinner or buy groceries. Many guests we talked to did that. There are no refrigerators in the rooms we stayed in. Ask other guests, especially at the pool. People love to talk about good and not so good food. Rio Mar will provide transportation for a small fee. Do it, it's so worth it. ~ Hacienda Carabali is an amazing Paso Fino farm with an excellent restaurant. The steaks are to die for! Everything was excellent and the prices are very reasonable. We ate there 3 evenings and watched the horses in the arena. Incredible. Hacienda is only a 10 minute ride from Rio Mar. We also ate at a local seafood restaurant called La Parilla. AMAZING whole red snapper! Delicious. Another 10 minute ride. It's worth it. -There are two pools and two hot tubs. One for adults and one for children. Pool chairs are a premium. Get yours early or you will not have one. We found it odd that the bar and music was at the kiddie pool? Music was erratic. Some days you could hear it at the adult pool other days,nothing. Service is slow and hit or miss at the pool. At times it was several hours before staff would come back around. We did complain loudly to the front desk as well as several other guests that pool cleaning crews were hosing and cleaning the pools mid-day. Cleaning crews were spraying some unknown cleaner on the sides of both pools. NO ONE LIKED THAT! Pool skimmers were often FULL of debris and a light scum floated on the water. It's attention to detail that this resort lacks. Everyone thought it was very strange the resort didn't attend to the pool at night but in the middle of the day and cleaning staff were not dressed shall I say in proper attire, shirtless or without shoes was a bit odd at a resort. Be aware of the LARGE number of Iguana's roaming around the pools. We were quite disappointed that staff would often walk around iguana droppings without notifying someone to clean large masses of runny, disgusting "piles". Our group ended up putting bar napkins on top of them. GROSS. -The Beach. Don't expect white sugar sand beaches. The beach is mocha brown, they do not rake. It was dirty with plastic debris, dead fish and sea greens. Shells are limited but if you wade out past your waist, we found multitudes of sand dollars. The surf can be rough be careful of the undertow. It's sea turtle nesting time, the beach closes at 5pm. If you walk to the right ,past the jet ski rental you will find a fresh water river. Don't go by yourself and yes, you can cross the mouth of the river. It was stunning, clear and lush. -Resort Grounds. You will find a vast majority of the grounds unoccupied. The are large empty fountains, flower pots and cabana's. The golf clubhouse and greens are TERRIBLE. We walked extensively and noticed the clubhouse nearly run down but open and the tennis courts vacant. What a shame. Totally under utilized. Large broken pots and yard debris littered around the courts. Shame. Once inside, you will notice the same thing. Rio Mar is a huge resort. Many of the common areas set empty. The maintenance and overall appearance of the interior is dirty, not filthy but just not clean. Example. You know your stair banister rails, the ones you hold on to walk down the steps? We noticed extreme wear/dirt on the tops of the rails. Dirty, where everyone holds onto. The ceilings and moldings are split and or cracked especially around the main bar area. Just look up. Many people we spoke with at the pool complained of the overall cleanliness of the resort and lack at attention to detail. It's a sub-par resort at best with no night life. The resort shuts down around 7pm. You will find people out walking around the pools and the occasional swimmer but there is no night life, no music, no activities. -Spa. What can I say. My friend and I toured the spa. The receptionist was very unfriendly and the services are extremely overpriced. Nearly $280.00 US for a 30 minutes massage and wrap. I passed. You will find spectacular views of the rain forest if you choose a mountain view room. It's stunning. One of our consultants stay in a mountain view room. The photos are lovely. If you expect an Iberostar or Excellence quality resort then you will be disappointed. Rio Mar is 45 minutes from San Juan, no night life and the food is sub-par, expensive. Attention to detail is lacking. Cleanliness is questionable. Service was terrible. Overall, our experience was poor-fair. We survived but without a doubt will not return. This resort needs much needed TLC along with a major change in menu. Our group spoke objectively to many guests and by far they were unhappy with Rio Mar. I hope review helped you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but certaintly not cheap”
Reviews.Author: mkbirdwell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from this resort, where we had our honeymoon. For what we paid is was a nice place to stay. I had read the reviews for this property before we went so I had a pretty good idea about what to expect. We did rent a car, which was a huge savings. Go to Ralphs right up Hwy 3 for snacks and drinks! We ate at Richie's and yes it is overpriced, and the food is just okay. I think you are really paying for the spectular view so make sure you go while there is still daylight. The coffee shop at the end of the hill is the place to be for breakfest! Not only is the food and service great, it is also cheap! Book your excursions before you go... you will save money and not have to stand in line at the hotel. However if you need directions, ask the tour desk at the hotel, they already have them printed out and ready to go. Parking is expensive, but we paid to $20 per day to valet and let me tell you it was worth it. They will pull your car around as many times as you need it. It was worth the extra five bucks plus tip not to have to walk to the parking garage. Word to the wise...if you plan on eating in the VERY expensive hotel restraunts... pack the correct clothing as they do have a strict dress code. No open toed shoes for the men and no flip flops for women. I had, what I thought were nice sandles and was told they were flip flops and that I could not eat in the restraunt. Oh well...their loss, we had a cheaper dinner else where. Also there is no use complaining, because when I did, to the manager on staff, he did not really seem to care. That was the only instance of poor service that we had the entire week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “On a slippery slope”
Reviews.Author: miaacm
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been sponsoring Rio Mar for many years and stay there at least 2-3 times per year, usually at the villas, for vacation or local conferences. We used to prefer the oceanfront villas, but now we really like the "golf villas", cheaper and quieter. The new oceanfront project (Ocean 16) has ruined the coastline and the view, and is really an eyesore that looks totally out of proportion with the rest of the resort. This, and other detalis seem to have the resort on a slippery slope. The roads are in the worst condition I've ever seen. The hotel restaurants keep increasing prices but not the quality. The pool area is usually so packed, we have opted to do other activities, like staying more on the beach or jogging around the resort, which is quite refreshing, especially around the mangrove areas. Wyndham seems to be penny pinching when it comes to ammenities. One would expect more ammenities as the resort grows, but actually there are less. The tennis courts are unique in PR, because they are clay, and although we do not play tennis often, we always play at least once on our Rio Mar vacations. The courts and the area need TLC, but are still nice to play. The golf courses also need TLC. The magnificent Ocean course has been massacred by the huge Ocean 16 project and by the shortening of a signature hole - hole 15. I heard they plan to shorten other holes. Some juniors and college players that play there every year told us this was their last year because of the bad condition of the courses and this shortening of the holes. Why on earth would they do this!? We found the courses to be ok, but not worth the price compared to others in PR, and less challenging. They should seriously consider adding ammenities instead of shortening or eliminating them. For example, the gymn is extremely small, and only for hotel guests. There are no walking trails, just one short jogging trail. Walking and jogging is becoming dangerous with the increased traffic. All in all, Rio Mar is still a nice place to spend a vacation, but they should not continue this slippery slope of deterioration and disregard to the concept and the needsJust in case, we are looking for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL resort; pricey travel & food”
Reviews.Author: ncsuwolfpackfan
Reviews.Content: Everything about the resort was absolutely beautiful. The views, the lobby, the rooms...everything! My favorite thing about the resort was the comfy and spacious rooms, the view from our room (the rainforest), and the front desk staff. They were very helpful and friendly. The staff on the beaches setting up umbrellas and chairs were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend going before lunch to get adequate service. The food at the cafe next to the casino was very good but slightly pricey. Shima's food was not good at all and excessively over priced. Would not recommend the restaurant. The service at the Tiki Bar was TERRIBLE. The staff was not friendly, the drinks were WAY over priced, and were lacking in the alcohol amounts that you were paying for (ie. $15 for 12 oz. drink filled mostly with ice). I would defiantly recommend renting a car while you were here. The AVIS staff was very friendly and helpful. The price of a small 4-door car for one day is $150. Parking in the parking garage is around $15/day and parking around San Juan can be anywhere from $10-20/day. The shuttles at the resort were extremely, extremely, extremely over priced. I came with a group of 5 and leaving the resort to get lunch and stop at a gas station 1 mile down the road was $40. The taxis aren't much better. We walked to the store and got a taxi ride back to the hotel and paid $30. Most of the shuttle drivers were very friendly and gave good advice for places to eat, nightlife, and excursions adventures. We chose to do the Bio-Bay tour out of Farjardo instead of the ferry ride or plane to Vieques. The company we chose was Kayaking Puerto Rico which was excellent. The tour was fun, inexpensive ($45/person), and we were even served snacks afterwards!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but glad we had a rental car!”
Reviews.Author: railbird21
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Rio Mar is a decent place to spend 5 days on the beach. It's not by any means a luxurious resort but the room was pretty clean and the staff was nice and helpful. PROS: * Bath and Body Works Spa toiletries (including after-sun cooling gel) * Clean resort grounds * Have staff to help you set up umbrellas and lounge chairs where you want on the public beach (they run out of umbrellas by 11am though, so if you must have one, go down early!) * Adult only pool (although the pool with the screaming kids is right near by) * Rooms have balconies CONS: * Rooms have VERY thin walls. You can hear EVERYTHING. * Slightly musty smell in the room (but PR is quite humid so maybe this can't be helped?) * No bath robes provided * Sand in drawers and sand in the bath tub when we checked in * While the sand on the beach is for the most part soft, I got several splinters from the little pieces of wood lying just below the surface of the sand. * Elevators are SLOW. We found the back stairs and just opted for those each time. * Meals are really expensive and add up quickly. OTHER TIPS - including where to eat :) 1) Seriously, RENT A CAR!! The resort is not really walking distance from anything except its own golf course and taxis are expensive. Tours that the resort offers are also really expensive (pretty much at least $100/person). Best to do stuff on your own. Self-parking is $15/day (we did this and didn't find it to be a hassle) and valet is $20/day. Rent the car from the airport, not from the resort which has Avis on site. You'll get cheaper rates if you don't go through the resort. We scored a rate of only $17/day at Enterprise. Because we had a car, we were able to enjoy our dinners and evenings outside the resort where you can find much cheaper and much better food! The first night, we went to Lolitas (a pretty good Mexican restaurant - entree platters are around $10-14, beer $3/bottle). Next night we went to La Parilla - yummy seafood place but more expensive ($25-35 for entrees). We shared the fried snapper stuffed with lobster and it was good. However, my favorite dinner was at Pasta y Pueblo. Although we didn't have a reservation, we were able to be seated outside where we ate dinner on a long board in candle light! So fun and the food was absolutely DELICIOUS. (You might want to make reservations though because the number of tables is quite limited and people without reservations do get turned away. They do 5pm, 7pm and 9pm seatings.) We had the mahi-mahi on pesto pasta and the coconut curry shrimp on coconut rice. Both dishes were really really wonderful but I have to say that I had never had mahi-mahi that was so tender and juicy. I wanted to go back the next evening and wish that we had. Instead, we ended up eating at Palio, the touted resort restaurant where they expect you to dress a little nicer, which was decent but expensive. I had the sea scallops which for the most part was good - 2 out of 4 scallops were cooked perfectly, 1 was a little under cooked but edible and the 4th just tasted bad - very fishy, in a foul way. My friend had the halibut which was ok. I tried it and it was a little dry and not in any way as good as the mahi-mahi from Pasta y Pueblo which was less than half the price! There is a little bakery (Isomar's - last left coming down from the resort before you hit Rte 3) which has fabulous sandwiches and breakfast foods. An omelet at the resort will cost you $15, but an omelet at Isomar's is only $3.75! We found a Walgreens (just a few minutes further down Rte 3) where we bought 30 bottles of water for $5 (vs $2.50/bottle at the resort) and several more tubes of sunscreen at a "normal" price (vs $16-$20 at the resort). And yes, we finished all 30 bottles of water - the Puerto Rican sun is HOT! While you're outside the resort, visit the supermarket (next to the Walgreens) and buy your own smores ingredients (they also sell you the stuff if you don't have a rental car). There is a fire pit near the Tiki bar where you can roast your marshmallows! Yum! 2) Register for the Wyndham Rewards Membership - it's free! You can get free internet access from your room. You'll still have to click on the $14.99/24hr rate but they'll take it off your bill at the end of your stay as long as the person whose name the room is under has the Wyndham Rewards Membership. 3) Bring some bug repellent. Not necessary for the day time, but helpful if you're out and about at night or if you go visit the rain forest. I still got bit twice even with the bug repellent... 4) Make coffee in your room for free. Don't drink the coffee at the table if you go to Marabella for breakfast - it's deceiving because they put a carafe of coffee on your table and you think it's complimentary. Nope. $4/cup and tastes watered down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach. Good value. Eat somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: V-ger128
Reviews.Content: We laid out by the beach. Due to sea turtle nesting season, the beach was closed at 5pm. After enjoying the beach, we elected to eat at local eateries rather than in-hotel restaurants. We were there primarily for the beach and for the location of the hotel as a jumping off point to other places around PR. We have been to this hotel on three previous occasions over the last 10 years and have been happy overall with the experience. We think the hotel restaurant food is overpriced. As an example, the casual cafe offers coffee at higher prices than say a Starbucks - but does not match the quality of the offering. So our MO generally was to enjoy the beach and go offsite for breakfast lunch and dinner. When we did order room service, the order was lost. After a couple of telephone follow ups, and two hours late, the order was fullfilled, the staff apologized profusely and did not charge for the food.

Reviews.Title: “Beware-mold and more!”
Reviews.Author: marymeyer
Reviews.Content: Having checked trip adviser and seen the reviews for musty rooms I had asked for a room on a high floor and that advertised being "an ever pure Jr. Suite ocean front". Well, what did we get? A room with a smell so over powering that the bell boy apologized immediately.The front desk said they were completely full and that we could not change our room. Well, the smell was awful but there is more...the room was very dirty,there was mold growing on the lamp shade. The bell boy made a show of taking pictures of the mold to show to the "manager' in the morning. The lamp shade was ripped and falling off the lamp, the couch was stained. The ever pure machine was a joke-not even turned on and not working when turned on. This was by far the worst room I have ever been in and hope to never encounter again. In the morning management said they were still no more rooms. We went next door to the villas-cheaper and gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...Rent a Car!”
Reviews.Author: Southwood6
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a beautiful resort. We followed the recommendations of reviewers before us, and rented a car. It was the smartest thing we did! It pays for itself if you do any of the excursions. I recommend the website PuertoRicodaytrips.com, and make the reservations yourself. You save a ton of money, plus get a lot of great ideas. The food on the resort is not that bad, nor the drinks that over-priced...after all, it is a resort. The worst meal we had was the restaurant that was recommended by so many, Richies. It was terrible. The food awful, and way overpriced!!! The beach was clean, the pools sparkling, and lots of iguanas roaming around. We loved the Tiki bar, but it closes very early. We drove a short distance to a public beach that had the white sands and blue waters of the Caribbean. Kayaking and snorkeling, and Bio Bays tour with KayakingPuertoRico.com is the only way to go. The guides are awesome, and the tours extremely reasonable...again, if you have a car, no transportation fees! El Yuenke is a must. Free, except the visitor center-worth the $4. All-in-all, we a wonderful time, but we did do some research and planning before hand. Also...the parking is awful...do the valet, $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: bluesmoon
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar Beach resort has everything you could want for a vacation. It is located on a stretch of beach that can only be reached from the resort. Leatherback turtles nest on this beach, so it closes early. Right across the road from the resort is the start of the El Yunque mountain and rain forest. The hotel staff are very friendly and very helpful. There is nothing that they didn't help me out with. There are several restaurants at the resort, serving different cuisines, and the food at all of them is delicious. The two pools are also a lot of fun. If you like to play in the water, then the activity pool is for you. In the evenings, a band plays local Caribbean music in the lobby right outside the Casino. The only problem we faced was the floor of our room became damp and sticky if we left the window open for some sea breeze. This is a side effect of the high humidity and salinity and one can't really fault the resort for this. They also have a golf course, though we didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay for those who don't want to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: spunkyeddy
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding. Everyone was very polite and any requests we made were met in a timely fashion. The entire staff whether at the beach, pool, restaurants, lobby or the cleaning staff always greeted us with a smile. While we ate about half of our meals on the property we also tried local restaurants in all price ranges. The Rio Mar staff was more than happy to tell us about these options. They did not push their own restaurants. The dinner and lunch prices were a little high but one does expect that at a quality resort. Plus the food was good. One complain I do have is the price of the tours you can arrange in the lobby. We found it cheaper to rent our own car for several days. They do have a car rental service on site. One warning however- the drivers in San Juan are crazy. Rio Mar is perfect for golfers but since we don't golf we would have liked some cheaper prices on the tous. The hotel is showing a little wear and does need some sprucing up. I would happy to return to the Rio Mar. Our experience was as great as we hoped it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous- Thumbs Up, but RENT a car”
Reviews.Author: spantheglobe
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and don't understand the complaints about the physical condition of this property. The grounds are stunning-- among the most beautiful I've seen after visiting numerous resorts throughout the Caribbean and Hawaii. The rooms are so-so: don't expect anything special there. We had a partial ocean view. The balcony and view were nice. The walls in the room are quite thin, so that was a disappointment, but I sleep with earplugs regularly, so I have no idea whether it was loud enough to disrupt sleep-- my husband and 2 year old slept fine. Having done a lot of research ahead of time, it seemed renting a car solved for most of the 'complaints' about this property. I was right. The resort location is remote, but it is not desolate. About a mile away, are countless retailers, restaurants, etc along the bustling 'main' drag (PR-3). The hotel concierge includes only 4 or so restaurants on its list of recommendations outside the hotel grounds, but you'll have many more options than that within a short drive. We ate at Isamar Bakery (phone: [--]) for breakfast (coming from the Wyndham, take the last left into the parking area before PR-3)-- it was GREAT--nothing fancy, but very inexpensive and delicious. We also regularly patronized McDonald's for breakfast-- prices were consistent with those in the continental US. We ate at Ceviche Hut (Peruvian food; head East on PR-3) and their paella and chicken kabobs were very good. Bottom line-- if you stay outside San Juan, expect a true 'resort' experience-- i.e., without a car, you'll be trapped . Car rentals are inexpensive: check Expedia, Hotwire, etc. Our midsize was $28/day. There is an Avis onsite at the Wyndham, but I would assume their prices are inflated. With a car rental, you'll get a better feel for PR, some freedom, and the ability to offset some of the hefty onsite inflated prices. And yes, the parking is pricey. $20 if you valet (no need to do that, parking lot is under the main building); $15 if you self-park. Parking gets a little tight late at night with the casino crowds, but there is an overflow lot across the street (I think)....should not be a problem. Bottom line: great resort to enjoy some R&R, but if you are on a budget and/or want to see more of PR, rent a car. I heard that going to El Yunque Rainforest, which is right across the main drag from the resort is offered by the resort at a price of $60!!! Pretty incredible considering its proximity to the resort and the fact that there is no entrance fee charged to visit El Yunque. Your rental car will pay for itself. By the way, the iguanas don't bite-- you will see a few near the pool, try not to get freaked out. They won't run from you, but they won't approach you either. Bon voyage.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Sack
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Caribbean trip that included 3 nights at the Wyndham in Rio Mar. This was my first time in Puerto Rico and we were SHOCKED at how bad the service was and how unfriendly and unprofessional the staff at this resort were. My wife and I and our friend first ate at Shimas, the over-priced Japanese restaraunt at the hotel. The waitress never cracked a smile and acted as if we were a bother to her. The next day after spending some time on the beach we walked up to The Breeze outdoor restaraunt on the property. After waiting 20 minutes and being completely IGNORED by 3 different waiters and a busboy we left extraordinarily frustrated. We went inside to the bar in the main lobby and ordered hamburgers from a bartender who also had a bad attitude. Other customers around the bar were frustrated because she did not have any change in the cash register and was missing basic ingredients to make drinks with. After 35 minutes of waiting for a hamburger with no explanations and no offer of an apology or complimentary drink we left there as well even more frustrated. My wife and I and 3 friends have vowed to never give this hotel another penny of our business.

Reviews.Title: “More charges than you bargained for”
Reviews.Author: lunajewell
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful, unfortunately it rained the entire time we were there, so we did more discovering of the nearby cities than of the beach. Everything was top notch; rooms were great, staff was friendly and everyone spoke English. Although the price of our ticket booked through cheapcaribbean was great, to eat every meal in the hotel was extremely expensive. I heard many guests complaining about it. I found out later we could've rented a refrigerator for the room. We ended up renting a car from the lobby to get out and find other places to eat and explore. After researching, it would have been easier, and cheaper, to rent a car directly from the airport for the entire week than it was to pay for the shuttle to and from the airport and 3 days of car rental from the hotel. It was not that hard to get from San Juan to the hotel. Plus if you have a car, doing the other adventures are much cheaper. We went into El Yunque by ourselves, it was very easy to find our way around without a tour guide, and it was extremely beautiful. We also did the bio-luminescent tour, which I recommend. You save on half the cost if you have your own transportation. Be aware though, there aren't many road signs when you get into the country. At times I just had to know what direction I was facing and where I wanted to end up, we always found are way where we had to go.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and some great tips on how to save $$”
Reviews.Author: beebs1966
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research on this hotel and was a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews so I thought I would give my two cents. I am from northern NJ where the cost of living is high and so is the price of eating out; so, I am used to it. THE GOOD: Staff - every single person from check in to check out was EXTREMELY helpful. I felt welcomed everywhere I went in the hotel. I commend these people on their command of the English language and their ability to communicate efficiently and fluently with their guests. Room: We did get bumped up to an Ocean Front Suite and the room was very clean and the view was beautiful. Are the rooms a little dated? Yes, but they are kept in great shape. Grounds: The hotel grounds were absolutely gorgeous and well kept. Beach: I have to say that when the clouds are around (which they were almost the entire time) the beach/ocean looked just like the jersey shore . However, when the sun did peek out it looked spectacular. Palio's Restaurant: Italian restaurant at the resort which was very romantic and delicious. Only restaurant we ate in at the resort. THE BAD: The cost of EVERYTHING. As mentioned earlier, I am used to paying a lot to go out to eat; but the prices here are truly disgusting. $11.50 for a frozen drink, $3.50 for one cup of coffee. $15 per day for internet in your room!! This is the 21st century and WIFI should be commonplace today. They only had 3 working computers in the lobby. TIPS ON HOW TO SAVE Make coffee in your room. They do not charge you for it. Go downstairs to gift shop and buy Parmalet milk (which does not have to be refrigerated). BYOB!! Without a doubt. If you don't have a car; pay the $15 R/T and go to liquor store and stock up. Get a cheap disposable cooler to keep things on ice in your room. Eat Dinner Out - even if you don't have a car it is still less expensive to pay for cab/meal than it is to eat at resort. May I recommend the following: LaParilla in Yocullo which is a $30 R/T cab ride and Hacienda which is a $20 cab ride. Both were spectacular food/service/price. Ritchies on the hill was nice but just a pricey as hotel. BYOS - Bring your own snacks! Packed lots of granola bars, Cheez It's, dried fruits, etc. and snacked on those during day. Did not need to eat lunch which can run you $50 for two people. Rent a Kayak and do the river. A tandem kayak was only $35 for an hour and we took it up the river towards the Rain Forest. What a breathtaking little tour. Do Not Book Tours through hotel as they charge so much $$. Go online and find a reputable tour - some even offer R/T transportation from the hotel. I would definitely go back and maybe even rent a car. It was unfortunate that we had such bad weather. It has been pretty rotten weather down there for quite some time. However, don't forget the sunscreen because even though it's hazy you will get burned. Puerto Rico is a beautiful island filled with beautiful people. If you are on the fence just book it knowing that it's going to be expensive; I don't think you will be disappointed. A word to Wyndham: You have a jewel here in the Caribbean. The only negative is the nickel and diming that you do to the guests. We met people from all over the US and the common theme by everyone was the price of food/drink. It did force me to leave resort to eat elsewhere. Also, a steel drum band poolside/beach music is needed. An authentic PR restaurant at resort would also be a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Room Categories/The Run-Around/Fees for Everything Spoil Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tarheels0607
