Reviews.Content: My wife and I were excited to get away for a mini-vacation before I have to hunker down for law school final exams and bar exam preparation. We booked with the Wyndham Rio Mar on Expedia because it seemed like a great deal. We decided to splurge and paid extra for an Oceanfront room with 1 King Bed. When we arrived check-in seemed to go okay, although the wait was a little on the long side, but then we went to our room. We had booked the most expensive non-suite oceanfront category w/ a King bed and yet you could not see the ocean from our room and it had two queen beds. The room should be categorized as a pool/garden view, because that's all you can see from it. The room was also located on the lobby level which has VERY loud music most nights that plays well past a reasonable hour. We went to the front desk to change rooms. We were informed that they did not have any oceanfront rooms available that had a king-sized bed in them so we were moved to the mountain side of the resort. Our "rainforest view" in the new room consisted mostly of the conference center's roof and air conditioning system. At least they refunded us the difference in rates. Also, even though the floor has a sign saying that it is a non-smoking floor, the second room absolutely smelled like people have been smoking in there for years. We had to go to Walgreens to get an air freshener just to be able to stand it. The resort also charges an arm and a leg for everything. They charge a substantial parking fee, and if you really want to see a decent amount of the island you have to rent a car (the hotel is a $75 cab ride each way from the airport). Our first night we at the sandwich shop near the casino to get something fast and we had hoped cheap. However, basic wraps were $8 each and drinks (bottled water and Gatorade) were $4-$4.50. We ordered room service for breakfast the following morning. To save money we split a single breakfast and this was the way to go. The Continental Breakfast was $17 and consisted of two croissants, two muffins, some fruit, orange juice, coffee, and (for some reason or other warm) milk. It could definitely feed two, but given what it was not really worth $17 plus 18% service charge + $3.50 delivery charge (almost $25). The only other time we ate on the property was at Marbella, which is a buffet. The food was decent, but I expect better for $26 a person. I know it seems like I'm piling on at this point, but the parking situation was not spectacular either. The fact that the parking was covered was much appreciated since it rained almost every day of our trip, but it is poorly lit, often difficult to find a space and the method of getting in and out is annoying. Rather than giving guests some form of a parking pass to get in and out of the garage you have to take a ticket when you enter, go to the valet stand to validate your ticket whenever you want to leave (which is at the main entrance of the resort, not near the parking area). If the valet stand were on our way to the garage it wouldn't be too bad, but this unfortunately was not the case. The resort gift shop was decent. It has a pretty good selection of items, but definitely check around before buying anything because prices can be steep compared to other places on some items (though others are reasonable and in-line with other places). For example, Bacardi rum is $26 at the resort for a 1L bottle. Pretty much anywhere else on the island that one liter goes for $10-12. Do yourself a favor and get all of your rum right from the source, the Bacardi distillery, which is open for tours, which is a neat thing to do on a rainy day. Another positive for the resort is that on weekends they have tables set up with local artisans selling their wares. Most of them have pretty good deals for unique handicraft gifts/souvenirs. Another place in the area to go for souvenirs is Coqui International which is nearby on the way to the rainforest (a must see). Which gets to the best aspect of the resort, its location. It is probably the closest resort to the entrance to the rainforest. This means it's about an hour from the sites of Old San Juan and you have to deal with substantial traffic to see those, but the area around El Yunque is very pretty. Overall, the resort has some good promise but fails in the execution of it.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar: A Bummer on The Beach”
Reviews.Author: vacationjubilation
Reviews.Content: OK, folks: the straight skinny on Rio Mar. And know that Iâ€™m posting this because my husband and I feel obligated to give unsuspecting guests the heads up. We booked 4 nights at the Rio Mar--arriving Thursday night, and leaving Monday morning--for a little â€œbabymoonâ€� before our second child arrives this summer. We love going on little getaways, and typically choose upscale hotels or resorts that weâ€™ve gotten a bargain on. We work hard, and like to enjoy a vacation treat once in a while, but still try to keep within a budget like most people. First a few bright spots: the grounds facing the beach were beautiful, the pools were nicely laid out, and we were upgraded to an ocean front suite, which was spacious and clean. But outside of these details, there were some glaring disappointmentsâ€¦ This place was rated a 4 to 4.5 star-property by many of the travel websites, and although we eventually booked it for a â€œstealâ€� on Hotels.com, we did consult a Liberty travel agent that weâ€™ve used several times for advice, and were told that it was one of the properties they send many guests to. We were, therefore, surprised from the outset of the physical condition of the Rio Mar was in: the exterior was in desperate need of a paint job and interior dÃ©cor was drab, overly dark and outdated; the handrails on the stairwells of the main lobby were visibly dirty and signs of untended wear were all around. So right off the bat, it was clear that this place provided far from the luxe feel that we were led to believe we should expect. And yet, despite the malt-beverage-atmosphere, this place charged Dom Perignon prices for everything from a cup of yogurt, to parking, to transport shuttles. Rio Mar literally up-charges its guests extraordinary prices for every basic essential one canâ€™t pack in a suitcase. Let me put it in perspective: we had dinner Thursday night, and meals Friday, Saturday and Sunday on the property; Keeping in mind that I couldnâ€™t enjoy a cocktail because Iâ€™m pregnant, and my husband doesnâ€™t drink, we did not order booze; And once it became clear--by about 10AM on Friday morning--that options on Rio Marâ€™s menus were going to cost us as much as black-market major organs, we refrained from deserts, appetizers and the more premium entrÃ©e options (p.s. not the way we like to vacationâ€¦watching every dime). So this meant NOTHING fancy: pasta dishes or burgers at dinner, simple (and tiny) sandwich wraps for lunchâ€¦you get the pictureâ€¦and even with this budget conserving strategy, our food bill came to over $700 for three days of meals!!! Let me repeat that: over $700 for three days of no-frills, alcohol-free, tiny-portioned mealsâ€¦for two people!! It was gross. Getting a fridge and picking up some items at the grocery store would have netted us a per-night service charge. Renting a car and using it to travel each day--â€œoff-campusâ€� as my husband joked--not only would have cost us the rental fee, but a $20 per night parking charge for the car (even though there is an AVIS fleet, with itâ€™s own parking spaces on the premises). Everywhere we turned there was a Rio Mar charge, and for every possible work-around solution, a Rio Mar counter-charge. It was like a game of chess that was rigged before the match started. So the bottom line is, if you want to visit Puerto Rico, donâ€™t stay here. Itâ€™s not worth the hassle, not worth the money and nobody should have to work this hard to outsmart their resort on vacation!! ...And it's tough to relax when your pockets are being picked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Resort but with Issues”
Reviews.Author: Bronzegirl6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed @ Rio Mar Beach resort for a week long getaway. First the good points, after checking in to our room on the 1st floor we weren't pleased with the location and it being ground level. We went back to the front desk, and they placed us into a room with double queen beds although we wanted a king size bed, basically what we paid for. The next day a lady @ the front desk upgraded us to a junior ocean suite! I heard more guests had issues with their room satisfaction. The beach, pools (adults and kids) and landscaping is absolutely beautiful! The restaurants, lounges (service and food) were good although very pricey and the Old San Juan tour was very nice. Go to the Karaoke bar, too funny! Now the poor points, the resort no longer offers shuttle service to local restaurants as before. We were told they did when we checked in but then midway into the week they said they was not providing it anymore so unless you rent a car or take a taxi (which is very expensive) you're stuck on the property. The gym had broken down equipment and both steams rooms were not operating properly although we were told it was fixed. The carpet in the hallways should be replaced or removed altogether (smelly and old). Instances of inconsistent communications between the staff and us when we asked questions became irritating after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, Beautiful Grounds, Nice Hotel - Not a great place to eat & drink at though.”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay and we enjoyed our time there, however the some of the following notes will cause us to look for another resort when we return to the area. Beach was beautiful - workers set up complimentary umbrellas for you and plenty of chairs were available. Drinks were really expensive - said they included Bacardi 151, but they didn't. Food was very expensive - breakfast buffet $22 and not really any cheaper options at resort. "Ocean-view room" had only one chair on balcony and required one to lean over balcony and look over your shoulder to get a glimpse of the ocean. Parking was expensive - $20/day for valet, $15/day for inconvenient self-park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: wesoc
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone. This hotel and property where nice. I stayed here w/ my baby and wife for 5 nights. We had a beautiful oceanfront room. The housecleaning was great, as were the beds. The pools were very kid friendly and we always found a spot no matter what time of day. The beach was very nice although the hotel doesnt take care of it, which they should but anyways, everyone we met here where very nice along with the staff. 2 negative things i would say is, the food is definately overpriced and there wasn t much for desserts for us as we like that kind of stuff. And everything was 2 to 3 its normal price so be prepared to spend heavily on everything! But all in all i was very relaxed and it was definately well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be a prisoner in your own hotel, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Candi256
Reviews.Content: NOT super impressed. The staff was hit or miss--either reasonably nice, or actually pretty mean. They made us leave our motorcycle at the front gate and HIKE to the hotel unless we could catch the shuttle at the golf course. Might not have been a big deal, but we were carrying gear. Gimme a break. At least we didn't have to pay the $15-20/day for parking. We accidentally thwarted a drug deal between a shuttle driver and some thug looking guy who didn't realize we spoke Spanish. The food and beverages are WAY, way overpriced so plan on renting a car so you can go out to eat and don't have to file Chapter 11 when you get home. The beach closes at 5. That's right--5. They pull your beach chairs out from under you. On the up side, the rooms were clean, and I think they all have little balconies. Housekeeping was really good. They give you nice bathroom soaps and things. And it is in a tropical paradise so it can only be so bad. It didn't ruin our trip or anything, but I think you can do better for the money--especially if you like to do your own thing.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Resort sounds good, but leaves something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: blreif
Reviews.Content: Rio Mar's strongest suite is their staff, all of whom were well trained and professional, and very personable. Weakest link in the hotel is the food service --- no variety of food, very over-priced dining rooms. We "heard" that the resident chefs have NO authority to create menus or signature dishes -- everything comes down from corporate. Our two best dinners while in Puerto Rico were off the Wyndham premises. Also, the beach was great, but not many activities compared to other resorts we've stayed in (Sandals). Coffee was $3.50 per cup, and for each refill another $3.50. We felt Wyndman Corporate ( or local management) micro managed the entire hotel, and deliberately hindered our ability to see the natural flora, fauna, food of the island. They worked overtime to KEEP US IN THE WYNDHAM by controlling the taxis, all tours etc.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar - should it only be for the Caucasians?”
Reviews.Author: pujayatra
Reviews.Content: This is a very well maintained resort with some great views of the Ocean as well as he Rainforest. The rooms were always clean and the grounds were beautiful. The beach access was easy and the beach was unspoilt and mostly clean (except near the Tiki bar area) where there were more party going types who littered the nearby beach. I particularly liked the pool area in the evenings. The service was good in general...except for one glaring observation. We are Indians and many of the hotel staff assumed that we were Hispanic and treated us below par!! They would greet all the white Americans with great courtesy and friendliness....and then just curtly ask us what we wanted. This was particularly obvious at Marbella and ERL cafe. The staff at the tour desk are also very curt and unhelpful. The concierge seems to have very little useful information to offer us as tourists....they would keep referring us to the tour staff. But I would still recommend the resort if u don't care about being treated differently due to skin color.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NycMags
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio Mar last week with my husband and two small children, the drive to the hotel took 45 minutes with no traffic. The moment I entered the hotel I felt relaxed, it was beautiful. We opted for the room with the double bed on the higher floor, since it was still morning when we checked in we didn't have much to choose from. When we got to the room it was ok, the mountain view was breathtaking. The sheets and a pillowcase had stains on them. The bathroom was a disappoint, the bathtub/shower wall had significant amount of black mildew on it. And, when I sat down by the desk what did I see?.. a roach! That's right, a roach! It was a little one, I freaked out and told my husband. I managed to kill it immediately, last thing I wanted was to have one crawl into our luggages. My first thought was to call the front desk, but my husband thought I was making a big deal so I didn't call. I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt hoping that this was just a single roach that lost its way. Later on we went down to the pool, it was very nice and well kept. We saw iguanas everywhere, people were feeding them all sorts of foods. That night we ate at Palio's Restaurant, the food was very good, the price tag was as to be expected, over $100 bucks with no drinks just water. The next day we went to the market Amigos the cab ride was $15 each way. We got some water, milk, beer, and snacks. On our way back we asked the cab driver to take us to his favorite spot to eat, he took us to Don Pepe. The menu sounded better than how the food actually tasted... it was too salty. I wouldn't recommend it. Later that evening around 10 pm, after we requested our refrigerator and put the groceries away what did I see, it was another roach this time this one was a little bigger in size. I was livid, I got on the phone and explained to the operator what happened and he said he would send up an engineer to fumigate the room!! And that I would have to leave the room for about an hour! I said, "Uh, NO, I have a 3 month old and a 2 year there is no way I am exposing them to the fumes, I would like a room change. I did an intense search to find a suitable place for my family to stay in Puerto Rico and no where did I come across any complaints about roaches in this facility. I am very disappointed and I don't want to stay in this room any longer". He patched me through another operator and after explaining him the situation my request was granted in a heartbeat. The bellman was at our door in 15 minutes, and I was ready to move with 2 sleeping babies I might add. The next room was on another floor in a completely different wing. I was very pleased with our new room, it was bigger and much more airy than the other room. It was also an ocean front view room with a balcony that extended outward. The only complaint my husband had the next day and every day afterwards was the fact that the walls were very thin. You can hear foot steps and talking on the top and side walls. It didn't bother me, as long as I didn't see any roaches I didn't care. The bathroom walls were in better condition too. Overall the hotel is very nice pricey but nice. The staff was very nice and accommodating, they treated my family very well, they made me feel welcomed. The beach was also very nice, it could be better...cleaner. At the end I got what I came for and that was to relax, and I did just that. Thank you Rio Mar. Just fix that roach issue, and I wished that they changed my sheets, I had the same stained sheet on the bed throughout my stay in the new room ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: kratour
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Rio Mar with my family for a conference. Upon arrival I tipped the valet as well as the bellman.We also left money for the maids during our stay ,imagine our shock when we got our bill that tips are added without telling you at check in. Explaines why our housekeeping service was "challenged". Get to the towel shack early by 7 AM wait in line and you may get the towels you deserve although I was told twice that we only had 2 people in our room( we had four ) I could only get two towels. Be Carful when dealing with some staff members as they can be very surly. I got yelled at by a disgruntled chef when I returned a raw hamburger. We maybe heard a good morining or a few hellos ,but overall they did'nt seem to happy there. Overall ,over priced under friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Golf Courses are Horrible...”
Reviews.Author: BAllenGolf
Reviews.Content: The golf courses are in horrible condition and no one told me or my family about the conditions that the golf courses were in. Do not waste your money going to Rio Mar's golf courses. They obviously do not invest any money back into their golf courses. Go to El Conquistador or Trump International. El Conquistador is probably the best golf course I have played in many years. The staff over there is tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery, good experience, but where is the authentic Hispanic food?”
Reviews.Author: MilesandSmiles11
Reviews.Content: I took a week long solo trip here, which I booked through an agent The Positives: Fantastic location! Beach views, mountain views, the grounds are beautifully landscaped and it is very clean! My room was sizable with 2 queen beds, and I loved having a balcony facing the beach and listening to the ocean waves. The adult pool is a nice to have as the other pool is filled with kids, but if you don't claim a spot there before 8:30 AM you are out of luck. Its a smaller area and it fills up quickly. I actually spent more time on the beach - they provide towels, lounge chairs and umbrellas at no cost if you want one. The beach front is spacious and its easy to find a quiet spot under a palm tree. I loved it. As a solo female traveler, I felt very safe here and found everyone to be very nice - from the bellman, to the waiters and waitresses...and not to mention some very cute male bartenders at the Tiki area (yes I had to toss that in there for the ladies) The lobby lounge is a great spot to mingle with other travelers and have a drink and/or lite bite. If you want a more quiet setting check out Boleros on the 1st floor east wing, they have big comfy chairs, a pianist and a nice selection of appetizers. The calamari here is the best and at $10 you can't go wrong. If you are a runner the resort has 2 jogger paths - one right along the beach, the other with beautiful view of the mountains/ rain forest. This was a favorite of mine. Even if you don't run, its worth the walk. The have a tour service on site and offer a multitude of 1/2 day and full day trips at a reasonable price. I really enjoyed the history and little known facts our tour guides shared...something you wouldn't get if you rented a car and went out on your own. Our tour guide even stopped at a local restaurant so we could enjoy an authentic Hispanic meal, which you cannot get at the hotel, which brings me to the negatives The Negatives: Lack of authentic Hispanic foods on site. One would think since we're in Puerto Rico they would offer a variety of Hispanic meals - but this isn't the case. In fact, the food is over priced and in many cases, not all that good. I ate many of my meals on site and was only happy with three of them - Burger at the lobby bar, lunch at Marbella's and the calamari at Boleros. Also, from day one I had problems with the lock on my door and my key cards wouldn't always work - each day I reported this to the front desk and each day they told me they would send someone to check the battery in the door lock , but this never happened. And on day 3 of me complaining to the front desk - a lady finally told me that until they can replace the battery to turn the handle UP after passing my card through... not down and I can gain access to my room. Worked like a charm, but wish they told me this earlier as it was frustrating to constantly be locked out of my room. Regarding the Tiki and Seabreeze (our door restaurants) - GREAT ATMOSPHERE...but I was a bit disappointed they either stopped serving food by 4 or 5PM and/or closed down by 6/7PM most nights - it would have been nice to eat dinner outside by the beach. Couple that with the fact the 3 main restaurants always requiring reservations for dinner so you don't have many options left if you like to just go with the flow and not plan ahead. Either Lobby lounge with limited menu or Marbellas - which probably has the best food in my opinion, but can be boring to dine at every morning, noon and night. I'm a gym rat and have to say for such a large and beautiful resort the fitness facility was shameful. Small, stuffy with old worn out equipment. Maybe I'm spoiled, since my home gym is a country club setting - but I honestly expected more since the rest of the resort is quite lavish. But since most people don't go on vacation to workout I can see why they don't bother putting any money into improving this area. Also, my bed wasn't that comfortable - no pillow top mattresses and the bed was a bit firm for me - so I tossed and turned the first few nights Not a negative - but it would also have been nice if they had more of a nightlife..all they offered was karaoke from 6-10Pm at the Shimas restaurant. Overall I had a great experience here for my money - that's key. I got a great deal through the company I booked with ($1200 for flight, round trip transfer and 6 nights) and I believe that is what it comes down to ... experience/quality + cost = value and I felt I got my money's worth. If I had spent more, I would have felt differently -I will return if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach for walking”
Reviews.Author: detraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a nice view of the ocean but the balcony was really loud because of the a/c unit on the roof. It was not close to our room but I guess it was an echo. The beach and pool were really crowded on the weekend but rather quite during the week. There is plenty of beach for walking. The beds are comfortable and the room is of reasonable size. We paid for a refrigerator so we could have drinks in the room. Our dinner at Palio was great and we enjoyed the fish sandwiches at the beach bar for lunch. The bartenders recommended Richie's which we thought was really overpriced for the quality. We were much happier paying less at the hotel for better food. The fitness center is dirty with old equipment. Overall the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: PedroJP
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful and relaxing resortâ€¦ awesome food, pools, amenities and beach. I like the two pool setup... one for families with children and another just for adults. I also liked that childcare was available throughout the entire day and evening up to midnight. My favorite thing was that the outdoor pools and hot tubes were open late at night... very romantic and relaxing. The restaurants within the resort were all very high-class and beautifully designed. The food was very good, with some regional variations. I'd read some reviews prior to going that said the food was poor, but that was not my experience at all. I though the food was excellent. Now granted, a few dishes were made differently then how they are made in the North-Eastern US, but that's to be expected (and appreciated) when you're visiting a totally different region of the world. For example, my wife didnâ€™t like the coffee (she thought it was extremely weak) but she learned thatâ€™s how the locals liked it. You have to specifically ask for Coffee Americano to get the same type of Coffee you would expect in the US. I've read some reviews that said the food, drinks, and amenities were pricy, but I didn't think so. The prices are pretty much the same as you would expect to pay at a resort of this caliber in the US and Hawaii. This is to be expected since Puerto Rico is a US territory. Average food prices were ~25 dollars per meal per person, drinks ~9 dollars, and childcare/kids-club ~11 dollars per hour. I thought this was very reasonable for what is essentially a US-based resort (of this caliber). If you're on a tight vacation budget though, this wonâ€™t be the resort for youâ€¦ neither would any other resort in Puerto Rico for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach and pool, big resort personal touch is lacking”
Reviews.Author: pinetamare
Reviews.Content: I traveled during New England school vacation week with my husband and two sons ages 15 and 11. I have traveled throughout Asia, Europe and the Carribean so I have seen a lot of properties. My objective was to rest a bit but also to keep everyone in the family happy by participating in all of the adventure that is available. We stayed for 5 nights. Arrival: We arrived around 4:30PM, luggage came within 20 minutes and we were on the car rental shuttle. We rented a car with GPS which was VERY helpful as we did a lot of exploring during our stay. The drive to the hotel was about 40 minutes, we went the "alternative" route which apparently helps you avoid downtown San Juan traffic. The drive was just fine. Once we arrived at the hotel we used the valet service and went to check in. We never self parked the entire time. The room we arrived in overlooked the garage and ramp. We had payed for an ocean view room. If someone swung me to the left of the balcony by my ankles I could see the ocean. It was the EXACT picture someone had posted on this site that I prayed we would not get. Anyway, enough said. I went to the front desk the next morning and asked to be moved. After a bit of hemming and hawing (they claimed they were overbooked by two rooms) they agreed to move us to another room which was just as we had paid for, ocean view. By the way, I did become a Wyndham resort member as some had suggested on this site, It made no impact during my stay. If you book through Expedia or any other outlet they do not care if you are a Wyndham member when you check in. The room was large,clean, and very comfortable for 4 people. We never ate at the resort. We picked up breakfast at Isomar which is a little bakery at the entrance of the hotel. (On the right as you enter the road to the hotel). The breakfast sandwiches and pastries were great. We went to Walmart in Fajardo, picked up a styrofoam cooler, beer, sodas and snacks. This was a huge cost savings. I do not advocate shopping at Walmart while on vacation but let's face it, most of us are trying to work within a budget. After purchasing 4 pina coladas for $34.00 (2 virgin, 2 alcohol) I was done with buying drinks at the hotel. I picked up a bottle of wine for $15.00 at the little grocery on the left side of the street as you enter the hotel road. Activities: The concierge was wonderful with suggestions. We booked everything ourselves though. We went ATV'ing, hiked to Mina falls and the very top of the rainforest, spent an afternoon in Old San Juan, went horseback riding, and did the Bio Bay kayak tour. By the way, the toured the rain forest on our own as many have suggested. The kayak tour is great, we used the ECO tour group and I booked it before we left the U.S. The ocean part is a little choppy and overall it is a little daunting going through the narrow channel. We boat in Maine all summer (canoe,sail and motorboat) so we are used to boats. My 11 year old was a bit nervous when we started out but came around once we got out to the lagoon and saw the glowing plankton. The tour guide gave excellent science info which was really cool. The ocean was really warm and the waves were large. I did not let my son go out far since I could feel the undertow. We had a great time taking in the waves. My 15 year old noticed that some of the kids were making s'mores at a fire pit one late afternoon. He went to get one for his younger brother and the man that was handing out the sticks/marshmallows asked him for $5.00. There are absolutely NO give aways, or deals at this hotel. Not a problem for me because I expected that but I think it is shocking if you are used to all-inclusives. My husband brought his laptop there is no free WIFI in the room. There is a bank of about 6 computers in the lobby you can use but we never did. Bottom line, the pool and slide for the kids is great. The iguanas are cool, the beach is beautiful. If you can venture out and eat outside the resort you will enjoy it. The room is comfortable. Overall I think Puerto Rico is just great. I was not at all disappointed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a quick weekend”
Reviews.Author: wapatula
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I needed a quick break so we decided to go to this resort for a long weekend. They were running incredible deals. From Houston, the flight is direct and easy. Traffic in San Juan is horrible, so don't be fooled that the resort is quick to get to (only 19 miles) if you have to deal with rush hour traffic. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a ocean front suite. The rooms are nice, but not luxurious. The shower leaked into the tub but who goes to an ocean front property to stay in the bathroom! The ocean was very rough, which we loved. We played in the waves. Not good if you have small children. The sand is a dark brown, very fine and soft. No bugs! Food is pricey, but one would expect that from a resort. Because it was Valentine's day weekend, we couldn't get a reservation at Palio, but you can order from their menu at the adjacent Tapas bar. The meal was very good. Our server Lisa was friendly and excellent. Overall we found the staff to be very courteous. We also ate at the Country Club Grill and that was not a good meal. The sushi place was good and prices were reasonable. We ate a "quick lunch" by the pool one day and had a chicken kebob that was under cooked and awful. We got smart and went to ERL for lunch the next day (great sandwiches). Also, you can buy beer and small bottles of liquor there so we did so and had happy hour in our room. Cheaper then $10 drinks at the bar! Also grabbed breakfast from ERL so we could avoid the chaos at the family restaurant. Overall, it was a good relaxing trip, which is exactly what we wanted. If we hadn't of gotten such a good deal on the trip, it would have been a bit disappointing. But, our package of airfare and room was a steal, so we came out happy customers!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: Themaninthemack
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this property and I would say that while it does not match up with the best resorts that I have experienced, it is quite a good deal at its price point. The staff was friendly and relatively efficient and all were good English speakers, and no, this is not the case everywhere in PR. Even though I bought the cheapest room available, it was large with a very comfortable bed, nice linens, great water pressure, nice big bathroom, great A/C that was very quiet, very nice big flat screen TV with free HBO. The only thing that was annoying about the room was that there was absolutely no sound deadening between my room and the adjoining room. I could hear everything that went on in there... everything. The furnishings are showing some wear, but nothing terrible. The carpets in the hallways are not great, but again, what do you expect at a resort with a beach and two great big pools. The pools were very nice, very big, very clean. The bigger pool has a water slide and kids were really having fun. The smaller pool is adults only, and very relaxing, quieter, and surrounded by palm trees. Both pools had hot tubs attached. There is a nice big gas open air fireplace between the pools and the beach where adults gathered and socialized at night. The food was hit and miss. The food quality averaged 2 out of 5, but cost was 4/5. The sushi place was decent. I got a Cuban pork sandwich for $15 that was not nearly as good as I can get in Cleveland for $8. The $15 burger would have been good for $8. Overall, a good experience, and I would go back and recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Expensive. Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: NatiCzar
Reviews.Content: Spent the first week of February at this lovely resort with a large group. The group organizers are the most generous, good hearted people you could ever meet. The Rio Mar is a first class resort and is beautiful. Fantastic beach, nice grounds, very comfortable and nice pools, excellent meeting facilities and pretty good food. Service was outstanding with the exception of the lobby bar. Be prepared to be "invisible" to one of the bartenders as he gleems starry-eyed into eyes of his lover. Who happened to be a manger. Yes. I said it. And it was true on more than two occasions. Anyhoo.... I had the BEST seafood gumbo I ever had at this resort. Breakfast buffet is typical fair and pricey. The burgers at the outdoor snack bar are top notch yet again very pricey. The casino is not bad. Two 3 Card Poker tables, blackjack, roulette, Texas Hold 'Em, and a slew of slots. Surprised there was no Caribbean Stud. Regardless, we gave our nightly donation to the casino and won it all back the last day! Hurray! Do yourself a favor and eat nearby at La Padilla in Luquillo. I am not a huge seafood fan but I eat it regularly because of my wife's fancy. La Padilla had THE BEST lobster I EVER had in my life. It's a beautiful little seaside restaurant that Guy Fieri from Food Network really ought to visit for Diners, Drive Ins and Dives! I hate to keep harping on price but there's a reason for this. It keeps riff raff out. If you cannot afford it you will NOT be staying here. Are wealthy people better than everyone else? No. But it goes a long way when you pay out the "wazoo" to have relaxation without the hoots and hollers from an "all-inclusive' drinkfest. If you are coming here to party, don't bother. Stay somewhere else. Please.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - value/cost is relative”
Reviews.Author: Rob_from_MA
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just stayed for a week at the Rio Mar along with two other families. The other reviews are fairly accurate - we each had a bit of difficulty checking in (though the staff was friendly). The prices are high (meals, drinks, etc.) - however we compared the cost of the room plus all our restaurant + bar bills this year to the Iberostar Lindo (all-inclusive, which I also highly recommend) last year during the same vacation week. Interestingly the two costs (not including airfare) were within $300 of each other, so I figure you're going to pay roughly the same either way - just how you want to do it. We did not rent a car, as we like to spend most of our time at the resort (as opposed to really experiencing the entire island), but I can see where it would be helpful. We ate one night at La Parrilla, a great restaurant which is a $15 cab ride from the hotel. Great food, fun time - and they sat all 13 of us with no reservation! We also ate at the Hacienda one night, which provides free transportation. This was also a very enjoyable night. We also ate a Palio's, and Italian restaurant at the resort. The prices were somewhat high, but the food was tremendous. We signed up for the $59 Rain Forest Tour and were very pleased. It combined a nice tour bus ride with some hiking along with a swim in one of the waterfall pools. Definitely recommend it if you don't have a rental car - the rain forest is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Golf Villa”
Reviews.Author: Dian
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at a villa rented thru resortvillarentals.com. A few years ago we rented a 1 bedroom ocean villa, this time didn't want to pay the price for a 2 bedroom, so went for a golf villa. To say the villa was wonderful is an understatement. Villa Luz is a 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath golf villa in Rio Mar Village section. The villa was beautiful, roomy, clean and came with a golf cart. There was a very nice balcony off the livingroom and a small balcony off the master bedroom. The master bath was amazing and far larger than ours at home. Everything was in good working order and it's obvious the owner takes much pride in her unit. I also need to note that my son woke up with an ear problem one morning and the concierge at resortvilla rentals was wonderful. We had a name of a dr within 5 minutes and phone #. My son chose not to go, and his problem did get better (thanks to trip advisor members that helped with this, also) This was a relaxing vacation for us,so we just hung out at the Rio Mar beach everyday. Each night we went out for dinner, since we had a rental car from Charlie's. Restaurants : BRASS CACTUS - pretty much the same as a few years ago, good food , plus they make great drinks. Ordered ribs based on prior trip advisor reviews and they didn't dissapoint. LA ESTACION - absolutely delic and enjoyed feeding one of the cats (so cute). Husband and son had skirt steak and I had grilled snapper. LOLITTAS - everyone enjoyed their meal, their nachos with beef and cheese were so good. EL JEFE BURGER - I will start by saying it was not crowded when we got there (filled up as we were waiting for our meal). We just ordered burgers and it took well over an hour (close to 1.5 hours) to receive our meal. Yes the white sangria was good, but it was gone well before our meal arrived. The burgers and fies were good, but I was so hungry at that point anything would have been tasty. I could see waiting this long if El Jefe was crowded when we arrived, but it wasn't. I honestly don't know what the problem was. LA PARILLA - We visited 2 times. The first time I liked the food better, but it took 2 hours to get our meal. But I must admit, it was worth it. We visited our last night in PR, hardly waited, but I thought the food was better on our prior visit (my son ordered the same thing both times). Still I wouldn't hesitate to return. BEBO'S CAFE - ate lunch on our way to returning our rental. It was good and reasonable. I tasted my husband's omlette and it was amazing. Weather was perfect all week.

Reviews.Title: “Resorty but great value”
Reviews.Author: NKhurana
Reviews.Content: So I always use trip advisor so I thought I would finally commit to giving back to all the great advice I get! My husband and I stayed 4 nights in Feb 2010. Day 1: Arrived late so concierge recommended going to Restaurant Hacienda. Shuttle from restaurant picks you up directly from hotel - nice for the 1st night if arriving in the dark so you don't have to think about directions. Great fish and Mofongo (ask for it moist). Spent about 80 including drinks. 2. Day 2: Breakfast at Ishmaels (Bakery before you hit Highway 3). Great breakfast sandwiches (~$3) and Amazing Guava/cheese pastries and The best pastrami sandwich (get it with all the fixings) - ~$5. Hikeed the rainforest - only a couple miles from the hotel. We hiked Mina Falls and then drove all the way to the top and hiked to the look point point - definitely worth the hike - all up hill but worth it for the view. A MUST. Bio Bay Tour thru East Wind Adventures. if you're interested in doing the bio bay thru this company (i think it's the only 1 that allows you to swim in water - best to experience it) make sure you call a couple days in advance - weekends are usually booked. Drinks and Dinner included in tour - ~110. 3 - Day 3: Antojitos Breakfast - again next door to Ishmaels Bakery - more of a sit down but still cheap - only $5-6 for greasy omelets - good after a night of mojitos. Sat around pool - get there early if you want a chair under umbrella. Adult and kid pool separate. we were there when 2 big corporate groups were there so the hotel was crazy. not sure if it's like that all the time but for the rate we got for a mountain view room we didn't care. we didn't eat at the hotel restaurants though because of that reason - it was very loud every night because of big groups. the beach off the resort is also very nice and the water temp is perfect. waves were crazy big though - sometimes we weren't allowed in the water. 4 - Day 4: Hiked again! rain forest is free if you just want to hike (closed at 6pm). we did do the info center/video ($4/person) but you don't need to. definitely don't bother with tours - wouldn't want to wait for everyone to take pictures at every stop. nice to hike at your own leisure - that's why you need to rent a car. also loved wydham because you were so close to the rainforest. grabbed breakfast sandwiches at Palmer bakery (on way to rainforest) - not as good as ishmaels and they were rude. but you can share one of their sandwiches they are big. rainforest has a couple restaurants on your way to different hikes as well - so don't feel like you need to bring anything. that night we did the kiosks (west on highway 3) - El Jefe Burger Shack - best mojitos i've EVER had and really good sangria. burger and atmosphere were great - $10 for burger and fries. all restaurants are open air. the owner is from the states (Even shared his mojito recipe) so he knows a good burger and waitstaff were awesome. Tried Ceviche Hut as well - not so good. didn't seem fresh to me and really expensive - almost $20! Only stayed 4 nights at Rio Mar and then moved to Condado (Miamish). I think that was enough because the resort was so secluded - i didn't like that you couldn't walk anywhere to grab a drink or food away from the hotel - so definitely need a car. $20/day for valet though - but you do have in/out privileges (but get's to be $25 after tipping). Tips: Must rent car (pays for itself so you're not paying for the "day-trips") Grab breakfast at Ishmael's Bring bug spray (I've never had so many bites - definitely ruined some of the trip) Drive to top of Rainforest and Hike the Trail to the Britton Lookout Tower Have Mojitos at El Jefe!!!!

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: dancerone
Reviews.Content: we just got home today, spent 6 nights at Rio Mar - trip was primarily in honor of my approaching 60th birthday -resort had been recommended by a coworker who had gone last year during the Feb. school vacation week - I am a beach lover, my husband somewhat less so, but he is the one who voiced the sentiment I used to title this review - we ate at every restaurant except the Asian one (not his cup of tea) and were very happy with everything - had dinner on Valentine's Day at Palio and loved the extra touch of the rose and champagne - went to San Juan one night to go to Il Mulino at the Ritz and it was excellent - did not want to bother to rent a car so used a taxi, worth it for us - it has been over ten years since we traveled to a warm place during the winter and my expectations and hopes were really high and I was not looking much at the cost of things - have to say we were totally delighted - some things I liked: resort is beautiful but not stuffy or pretentious; some people dress up just a bit at night and that gave me a chance to wear some of my nice summer dresses; long long beach to walk on which I did every morning between 7 and 8; lovely spa (had a great seaweed wrap treatment) - of course what was especially nice (and basically good luck) was that the weather was absolutely gorgeous (only one overcast morning) and my husband won $1800 on a slot machine in the casino on our last night! Only things I would have wished for - someplace to dance (this may have been more available had we stayed in San Juan but we don't exactly fit in with the club crowd at our age anyway), a bigger casino (but then again it's not Vegas) and an upgrade from an "ocean view" to an ocean front room (we are both Wyndham Rewards Members but even though we checked in mid-day, we were told the hotel was overbooked and an upgrade wasn't available) - our room, on the first floor, was extremely convenient, however, even if you really could not see the ocean well due to the angle and the palm trees - we would definitely go back and I am hoping that it is sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “great family vacation that met expectations based on earlier reviews”
Reviews.Author: sky3000
Reviews.Content: I am at the airport traveling home as I write this. When I was booking this trip I was torn between the Rio Mar and the El Conquistador. Based on price, we decided to give the RIo Mar a try. First off, the entire family had a great time. I guess I need to temper our experience with the actual quality of the resort. If I could, I would probably give the resort 3.5 stars, not 4. My experience reflects most of the feedback from prior posts. Some of the pros include an excellent pool complex for little ones, stones throw from the beach, and several food and activities options. We spent a week split between hanging at the pool and relaxing on the beach. As noted in prior posts, the beach was nice but watch the undertoe, it can easily knock small children over. Most days we were there, the surf was pretty intense which was actually a lot of fun if you keep a close eye on the kids. There was the typical third party company running the motor sports on the beach and we paid the $100 for a dual jetski for a half hour. It was fun. There were poolside cabanas available for $150/per day. A bit excessive considering you get a glorified umbrella with some fruit and water. The chair situation at the pool and beach was challenging if you get a late start but manageable. We were there for February school vacation so the resort was at capacity. If you enjoy playing the game where you throw a hat or flip flops on chairs first thing in the morning, then you can guarantee a choice spot at the pool. If you get a late start you might have to throw one of the beach attendants a few bucks to scrounge up some seating. I was used to this since I normally travel during school vacations when resorts are at capacity. Despite this, the resort didn't seem over crowded. The resort grounds are very nice and expansive if you need to get away from the crowds. The main pool complex was very large and had a small water slide, decent for small children. And yes, there are the iguanas. For most of the week they were everywhere. Some of the kids would chase them all over the pool complex while other children were extremely apprehensive around them. To be honest, you sort of get used to their presence after the first day. I could personally take or leave them but one did crawl up on my 4 year old while my back was turned to grab a bite of her hot dog bun. That was interesting. The pool bar and grill was well staffed and was a great spot to hang out or sit and have a drink on the water. The rooms were nice enough with the usual amenities and flat screen tvs. Yes, the air conditioning was a bit loud but that didn't bother anyone. I did agree with some of the prior posts that the interior spaces were a little worn and dated but the rooms were decent. The service was a bit inconsistent but was good overall. We requested towels on a couple of occasions and the first time they arrived within 10 minutes and the second time took hours. Room service was about the same. Sometimes it was prompt and the order was correct and other times it was a long wait and the order was incorrect. The staff was usually very helpful and courteous if not overly friendly. I think having a car is the way to go. The excursions through the tour desk seemed a bit pricey for what you get and you can easily take yourself far cheaper. We drove to Old San Juan and took a ride thru the rainforest. I would recommend both if you have a car. Not sure I would do either with 3 young children if I had to pay for a tour. The forts at Old San Juan were cool, and there was lots of quaint shops and restaurants. The rainforest was definitely worth the drive thru but we didn't do any of the trail hikes. I wanted to take my nephew on a zip line but they were booked up. The food as mentioned extensively in other posts is pricey but I was prepared for that. I didn't find the prices much worse then other caribbean resorts. The food at the "upscale" dining was good, though not gourmet. The casual restaurant was just ok. The things you really feel like you are getting nickel and dimed on are things like parking (20$/day for valet) and wireless (15/per day), and refrigerators ($10/day). The location of the resort was ideal. Just far enough outside of San Juan to feel like you were at a secluded resort without being far from the airport. !0 minutes from the rain forest and a short drive to the ferry in Fajardo made it a can't beat location. The casino was really small but was never crowded and had slots and most of the table games were covered. If you are looking for an Atlantis style casino ambience, this certainly isn't the place but it was there if gambling is your thing. Overall, the family had a blast and the resort was nice despite a few short comings. We had a 4.5 star experience at a 3.5 star resort. I booked the trip pretty late, and comparable resorts during this week were nearly double for an ocean front room. I paid around $200/night during school vacation week and would definitely recommend this resort if you get a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: DorothyT3
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort if you only want relaxation and golf. If you plan on sightseeing in puerto rico or looking for night life this is not the place. Its a 40 minute drive from old san juan and transportation is very expensive. Oh almost forgot, there are NO refridgerators in the rooms, get a foam one from the local supermarket on your way fro the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but very pricey if you stay/eat/drink on property”
Reviews.Author: susanlst
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two day stay at Rio Mar. We were delighted to be upgraded to beach front. Our room was comfortable enough, however the computer modem did not work, so no internet service in the room, and it would not have been free. The bathroom had a very old, small, stall shower that I refused to use due to poor condition. Fortunately the bathtub also had a shower head. Water pressure was low, but tolerable. The beach is gorgeous and clean. The waves were great and we enjoyed time in the surf. We rented a cabana for the day at the adult pool, $150 for the day, it came with a cooler of soft drinks and assorted snacks. We were happy to have a place to escape the hot sun, if we hadn't rented the cabana we would have to have claimed a shaded chaises by 8:00 AM, as others did with towels. Who wants to be bothered doing that on vacation? Started off our vacation with an outdoor lunch on site, each adult had two mixed drinks and a sandwich lunch - imagine our surprise when each couple had spent $100+ for lunch! That's a lot of money for lunch! Drinks were $10 or higher. Dinner at the Golf Course Grill was also very high, entrees were $28 or more, all ala carte. Service was fair, but we were last customers to leave, our reservation was for 8:30 PM, we felt like we were keeping the staff from going home. Overall we thought the menu was overpriced for a golf course 'grill'. Ate at the Italian restaurant on site last night. It was superb! Food quality was excellent and everyone at the table had plenty to eat and enjoyed the variety of the menu. We experienced an error by a dealer in the casino and his performance to rectify the situation was awful. He paid out the wrong number at roulette and then made the patrons feel bad for his mistake. One couple who complained about being shorted was paid off and then told they could not return again that evening. The dealer made the mistake, not the patrons. Overall, we had a great vacation! We loved the property, however felt that the food and drinks were VERY expensive. The room was fine, but not necessarily typical Wyndham quality. We enjoyed ourselves, but others should be warned how pricey it is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort; fantastic beach, water, amenities, pools. food, and service.”
Reviews.Author: JustinTodd
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort. Better beaches, water, food and service than Mexico, and without the constant, annoying vendors on the beach. Even though the property was completely sold out while we were there, they were still offering a Vacation Stimulus Package; essentially four nights accomodation for the price of two, plus we were upgraded to ocean front with balcony and king bed rooms, plus a $100 food and beverage credit, and a free cabana day rental. The cabana's are highly recommended, and include great service, a cooler filled with water and soft drinks, and some munchies. The food served from the resort pool bar is outstanding. Highly recommend the mahi mahi sandwich, or the burgers. They are 5 star quality. Even if we had had to pay the cabana daily rate of $150, it would be worth every penny. A cabana is a great way to treat yourself to luxury. There are many reviews herein that complain about the price of the food in the resort restaurants, but few of those reviews talk about the quality that you get. We are very picky, and real foodies, and can tell you that the food is outstanding, and worth every penny; especially the asian fusion restaurant. The breakfast buffet is outstanding. Prices for dinner are $25-$35 per entre', which some reviews dis, but IT IS A RESORT, not just some shleppie hotel, and the same meals would cost the same prices anywere in the US. Many reviews rave about a "food kiosk" that is about two miles away (taxi $8), and those quaint, local food type restaurants are fantastic, and well worth going to, but the pricing is the same as the hotel for entre's. You get what you pay for. The only disappointment for us was the food at a restaurant near the entrance of the resort, Richie's, which is recommended by the resort, and even offers a shuttle to it. I have been travelling extensively for 30 years, have probably eaten more than 1,000 restaurant dinners, and this was one of the worst ever. Terrible american type food, poor service, well over priced; a huge disappointment. Stay away if you are a foodie. Only one other minor complaint; some of the reviews talk about having an adjoining room, and that is was noisy. That's true. adjoining room doors are a bit thin, and have a wide space at the bottom. Request that you are not put in one of these rooms. Other than that, I can't say enough about the Rio Mar, and we are definately going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JeMar06
Reviews.Content: The resort was very nice, but over priced. My biggest complaint (besides cost) was that they had those fancy showerheads that provide very little water pressure. The staff was always friendly & helpful. They had all the amenities one could ask for: golf, spa, fitness, beach, pools, casino, restaurants, & bars. There is no free internet in the room, but they do have computers located near the front desk. They offer a "Kids Club" that provides activities for kids. The kiddie pool area was nice & there is a large family pool, too. One of the bartenders at the pool bar even delivered our lunch to our pool chairs. Most of the restaurants are not what I'd call kid friendly, though. There are no microwaves or refrigerators in the room, but you can rent a frige for an extra charge. Parking is $15 per day extra as well. We really enjoyed the place & location, but we got a great deal on the cost & bought snacks and drinks at the local grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location to see NE PR”
Reviews.Author: Metalox
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty standard for its star rating. Pretty grounds, pool, nice Hot hot tubs, a pretty and wide stretch of beach. Staff is friendly and helpful except the daytime front desk. Rec Ritchies up the hill for the view, and Antojito's Down the hill( near the intersection with rt3) for the whole Red Snapper in the criollo sauce :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: yggep1
Reviews.Content: If you want Four Seasons consistency and quality, this is not your resort. If you want a nice resort on a great long stretch of beach, this is your resort. How we got there: We weren't renting a car since we were staying for just three nights, and wanted beach beach beach, so we used Julien's Transportation (cell [--] office [--] ) For a party of five, it was $80 one way (without tip) and he stopped at the Wal Mart on the way for us for about 15 minutes while we stocked up on waters, juices, snacks. Highly recommend Julian. The check-in staff was very helpful, and gave us rooms near each other, and upgraded us to ocean view since I had joined the Wyndham Member program. I had told them we were there for my mother's 65th birthday, and they sent a tray with red wine and fruits to her room. There is inconsistent beach service. One day, a girl came around to take our orders, another, no beach service. The young men who put out the umbrellas were helpful in getting us a cushion for my 78 year old aunt, because the beach chairs are VERY uncomfortable. I wanted a resort on a long stretch of beach, and this is perfect for that. You can walk miles. The beach staff needs to 'get on line' and pick up the garbage on the beach in front of the resort though. No excuse for wrappers and cups being there every day. They rake the sand, but don't pick up the litter. The water was pretty and a perfect temperature, no big breaking waves when we were there but definitely a pretty strong undertow one day, and my sister and I, both former lifeguards, where getting ready to head in to help one mother whose son was having trouble with the undertow. The other days, especially in the morning, it looked calm enough for little kids. There was a neat little sandbar out about 1/2 mile that strong swimmers could swim to. Restaurants were just ok-if you are a foodie, probably not going to be overwhelmed. Spa: my mother had a wonderful balinese body polish and massage. This is a nice, unpretentious, somewhat dated resort on a great beach, and if your expectations are set correctly, you can have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ljmac22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checking into the Rio Mar on Thursday, February 4th. Check in was fast and our bags arrived in our room shortly thereafter. First of all, let me talk about the beauty of the resort. When we turned into the resort grounds I was so happy. There was a beautiful lush golf course. In the distance you can see the azure waters of the ocean and lovely beach. To your right there are the mountains of the El Yunque rainforest. The grounds are so beautiful, lush and tropical. The inside the hotel didn't disappoint either. Upscale without being overly opulent. The colors and motif make you feel relaxed immediately. We lucked out with the location of our room. If you are booking a trip and you want to have the easiest access to the adult pool/ocean and breakfast buffett then ask for rooms numbered from around 1030 down to 1000. We were right in the center of this hallway and the location was perfect. We were on the first floor but the balcony still sits up off the ground due to sub-basement underneath. The view from our room was beautiful-you looked out onto the pool through the trees to the ocean. The green and brown from the lawn,trees and pool furniture mixed with all the different shades of blue from the pool, ocean and even the beach umbrellas was so lovely to look at. I don't think there could have been a better view in the entire resort. To reach the pool we simply took a right out of our room, another quick right through the double doors and we were right down the path from the beach towel shack. This was very convenient since this was our first stop every day anyway. Plus it wasn't a big hassle to run back to the room if needed. We were also as close to the beach as anyone else in the hotel. Our room was very nice. IT wasn't dated or the least bit shabby. I wish they had a few throw rugs but every hotel I've stayed at in the Caribbean has tile floors. The air conditioner was mac daddy! Almost too cold for me but my hubby was in heaven. The bed was extremely comfortable. Down comforter (not too heavy), down pillows and quality sheets contributed to some of the best sleep I've had in awhile. The bathroom was fairly roomy for a resort with nice fixtures and products from Bath & Body works provided. (shampoo,conditioner, lotion, "cool it" for sunburn) The breakfast buffet at Marbella was wonderful. My husband did complain that his scrambled eggs were cold one morning. I always got a made to order omelet followed by a large plate of tropical fruit. My husband ordered the Belgium waffle every morning which is cooked in front of you as well. Get one of these two things and you can't go wrong. Luisa makes the best omelets I've ever eaten. The buffet includes pretty much everything you can think of for breakfast, muffins, toast, yogurt, fruit, the usual eggs, bacon etc. They even had smoked salmon. The fresh cut up fruit was wonderful. The price is expensive however. We were on a companies dime so perhaps the food tasted even sweeter since we didn't pay for it out of pocket. The price for the breakfast buffet is over $20/person. I still would have eaten there if we had paid ourselves because it was so convenient to just wake up, walk straight down the hall and into the restaurant with hot coffee in front of you before you knew it. It was a wonderful way to start the day. Like others have said, drink prices are high. Pina Colada was almost $11 and wasn't even that big. We were coming back from an excursion and asked the shuttle driver to stop at a convenience store for us to buy beer. I would definitely recommend doing this. A six pack is $33 at the hotel. For two days we ordered lunch from Seabreeze at the beach. It was good. My husband got a hamburger and I got a curry chicken salad sandwich both days. The waitress gave me fries instead of chips the second day and seemed more than happy to bring me the chips right away. Actually we received cheerful, good service the entire time we were there. Someone else said the iguanas were a huge nuisance. We had a huge group and none of us had any problems with them. Yes, you see them everywhere, but I Tried to feed them and could hardly get one to come to me. I did see one fall (or jump) out of the tree at the pool, but it was more interesting than scary. As for being around the pool I only saw one or two and they were both lying on one of the big boulders that rim the pool just soaking up the sun. I Never saw them harass anyone. I would guess that if you had small children that were always wanting to chase them it could get annoying. To me they were way cool. Go around back of the hotel to the iguana pond if you really want to see them. Ask the attendant at the towel shack and they will point the way. I was able to feel a couple over there and it was cool. Things I would do again or differently: *If we went back I would rent a car at the airport and keep it for the entire trip. *Eat at Richies again- this restaurant is close to the hotel. It is open air and sits high on a hill with a spectacular view. The food was really good-the best meal we had while we were in Puerto Rico. Richie himself came over and hung out with us. Ambiance is great. Priced around $25-$40 for entree. *Bio-Bay Tour-this is a once in a lifetime, magical excursion. I could do this tour over and over! We booked through the hotel and paid extra which I wouldn't do again. Call around and set this up yourself-but definitely do it. *El Yunque visit-a group of us called for a shuttle to take us over the rainforest. He took us to all the sites that the tour you can book through the hotel does-but we paid the driver a total of $150 (split between 4 couples) as opposed to the $90/person charged through the resort. Our driver told us all about the flora and fauna and history too. This is the way to go if you ask me. If you rent a car just drive yourself. The welcome center has the nicest elderly man sitting at the information desk. He will explain everything you need to know to see what you want to see. It is a straight shot in and out so you can't get lost. BIG TIP: If you are going to hike to Mina Falls start at the higher (further into the forest) point and hike DOWN to the falls. If you are in a rental car then it won't be too bad to start of the nearest entry and walk to and from that way. Unless you are in Great shape and are looking for a workout-you don't want to get caught having to hike UP from the falls back to the pickup point. (You will understand all this as soon as you see the map they will give you at the visitors center-El Portal) Old San Juan-go into the city for dinner one night. If you have a group of people you can take a shuttle (around $130) ( If you are there with just your family or spouse I would suggest renting a car for the whole trip). Our group also went to San Juan during the day as well and toured the fort, which was beautiful and interesting. Be Very careful if you have kids with you because there are dangerously open areas high up on those fort walls that a person could easily fall over. The walls at these points are low and there is a drop off right before you get to them. We almost lost a guy in our group! *ATV tour- this tour was a lot of fun. I wouldn't make it a huge priority to do again...but I thoroughly enjoyed it while we doing it. Again, we booked through the hotel and probably paid extra. We were working with a group so this was just easier at the time. If I did it again I would call ahead and book it myself. The ATV tour was just FUN. We saw a HUGE iguana..probably 6 feet long. I had no idea they grew that large. We got to drive fairly fast and went through some pretty landscape. The tour claims to be "in the rainforest" but I would say it was more at the foothills. But still beautiful. We drove through some streams and ended up at a clear river where we got to swim and jump off semi-high rocks into the pool. This tour wasn't as education-but I had fun every second. Have Fun in beautiful Puerto Rico at the beautiful Rio Mar! I hope your vacation is as wonderful as ours was. I would definitely go back-to the island and to the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: dgcg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar at the end of January. We had such a great time! The grounds were clean and very well kept. The rooms were very nice. We had an ocean view room on the second floor. One day they did not clean our room until that evening, but we were ok with that. The beach was very nice, warm water, plenty of chairs and umbrellas. The pool area was very nice and not crowded as well. The tiki bar was a great place to hang out. We would usually go there at happy hour for medella light beer buy one get one free. The food was very good but a bit pricey. At night we usually hung out in the casino. They had a live band on Friday and Saturday, we had so much fun. We rented a car from Avis for two days. We went to El Yunque one day, then we checked out El Conquistador and the Gran Melia hotels. This hotel is much better in my opinion. Overall a great hotel, beach, and atmosphere. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations with overpriced extras”
Reviews.Author: CWoerp
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar is a beautiful resort with a mile long ocean beach. It is a short drive to the rain forest, Luquillo, and Fajardo. We experienced friendly staff that weren't afraid to recommend restaurants outside the resort. If you have an endless supply of money, you could spend your entire stay at the resort. They have several restaurants and bars, a spa, a casino, a fitness center, family and adult pools and hot tubs, and their own beach with rentals available. Since we don't have an endless supply of money, we did read reviews before going and were aware of the items they charge extra for but some items were still a shock. Parking for hotel guests is $15/day to park yourself or $20/day for valet parking. When we checked out there were fees and taxes added to it that added another $1.50/day. The pool side cabanas are $150/day. A six pack of beer in an ice bucket is $33 (the beers are 10 oz.). Mixed drinks are $10.50. The breakfast buffet is $22/person. A personal sized pizza is $14. A refrigerator in you room is $10/day. Kayak rentals are $33/hour. As soon as you leave the resort prices are reasonable. We drove to Wal-Mart and bought a styrofoam cooler and stocked it with Bacardi and beer. We also picked up food to keep in our room. Almost daily you could find us drinking coffee on our balcony overlooking the mountains. We would then go for a walk on the beach looking for shells and crabs. We would then drive down the road and eat breakfast at Antoine's (sp?) for about $4 each. We then headed off on our excursion for the day. Don't be fooled by the concierge desk tour prices: - a visit to the rain forest is FREE, unless you pay the $3 to enter the visitors center or the $5 for a guided tour. - the Bacardi distillery tour is FREE - the beach in Luquillo is FREE - snorkeling tours and the bio luminescent bay tours are about half the price if you book them yourself -

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked hotel plus bad service”
Reviews.Author: toteMiami
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel to attend a convention. I arrived in a shuttle with 9 more people who were also attending the same convention. At the check-in, the ten of us were informed that since we arrived "late" (5 pm), they didn't have any more standard rooms, so all of us will be receiving a different room with murphy beds (the ones you take out of the wall). A collegue who arrived later (around 7 pm) received a worse room: he got a huge living room, with a SOFA BED. We complained about this situation, specially since they have a 7 day cancellation policy and they even charge you for the first night before arriving to the hotel. I booked my room 3 MONTHS in advance and their excuse was that the hotel was overbooked. I spend more than 50 nights a year in hotels and this is the first time ever I heard an hotel was overbooked. When you make a reservation, they tell you right away if they have rooms available or not. When I went to my "different room", it was the living room of a suite. I had a huge living room, dining room and office, but no bed. I had to pull the bed out of the wall. It did not have any pillows nor blanket. When I call the maid service and ask the bed to be prepared, she asked my what did I want, as is the bed was ok. I requested for the pillow and the blanket and she just put them on the bed with a very bad attitude. The bed was awful (it wasn't a real bed after all). It was very hard for me to work in this room, since the internet cable was glued on top of the TV drawer and it wasn't long enough to take it to any place. In the small office you have a desk, but no internet. The bathroom was old and very small. Even for me (I'm petite), it was difficult to take a shower (see picture). But the worst part, was the service. They treat you as they are doing you a favor, even though this an expensive hotel. It's a shame because the location is nice, the beach is beautiful. I rather go to The Conquistador (I stayed there a few years ago).

Reviews.Title: “Iguanas”
Reviews.Author: soi012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay but the iguanas are a real nuisance. When to try to eat at the pool they will come all over you for food. Some of the Iguanas are very big and they scare your little ones. The staff is not helpful at all in this area, the largest of the iguanas jumped to the pool from the top of one of the tree palms and almost fell on top of my 4 year old child. Iguanas are not indigenous to Puerto Rico, so they have no real predators. Tourist are intrigued by them in the beggining but after your third day you fell harrased by them. The management of the hotel really needs to deal with this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in PR”
Reviews.Author: saymanmitch
Reviews.Content: I most certainly read the other reviews before I stayed at the Rio Mar in Puerto Rico. Some of them came in very handy and others seemed a bit ridiculous. Here are the facts. The hotel is beautiful and of course it is expensive, it's a Wyndam property. Some of the pricing we were not willing to pay ($33 for a 6-pack of Heineken on ice) others were just what you pay for a nice hotel on vacation ($22/person for full buffet which includes anything on the menu PLUS drinks such as mimosas). We arrived well before check in and thankfully our room was available. We were on the 7th floor with a view of the mountains and the rain forest; it was breathtaking! Our room was not dated; it was comfortable and had a terrace. We did rent a car but we did not go through the hotel's Avis rental. Instead, there is a place about 10 minutes down the road called "Cabrerra" that will pick you up at Rio Mar and drop you back off. The hotel pricing for the car rental was about $80/day which included insurance and Cabrerra car rental place was $55/day including insurance. We rented a Toyota Yaris and drove all over the island. We only needed $10 to replace the gas we used before we returned it. As indicated by others, it is best if you do things directly rather than going through the hotel. One day we went on a Catamaran Excursion. Through the hotel it was $115/person, directly through East Island Excursions in Puerto Del Mar (25 min from hotel) it was $147 for 2 people. We walked through the rain forest another day; through the hotel it was $65 per person for the tour, if you went directly they charge $5 (cash only) for the tour or you can walk through the rain forest with a map for free...we hiked through the rain forest to see the waterfall. It was beautiful. One afternoon we drove to the Kiosces in Loquillo beach (10 minutes from hotel) and had authentic Puerto Rican food for 1/8 of what you would pay at the hotel. For breakfast the second day we went to Antejolitos which is on the same road as the hotel near the bottom of the hill. As you can imagine, the pricing was far more reasonable about 1/4 of the price at the hotel. For dinner we went to Don Pepe. If you can eat outside of the hotel for most of your meals you should! We wound up paying the $10/day for the refrigerator in our room and went to Amigo Supermarket to stock up on beer and liquor - it proved to be the better choice. We did splurge on one dinner for our last night at Palio and it was excellent. We did not experience anyone being nasty to us and we never waited for more than 30 seconds when we went to the front desk to ask a question. All of the staff at the hotel was patient and accommodating. We did experience some issues - I forgot about the room key being demagnetized when it touches other credit cards, so at one point we could not get in the room, but again it was a quick fix. We had an issue with our safe as the screen seemingly froze on "open" but they quickly came and fixed it. People warned about the Iguanas and we certainly saw them, but they stayed on the grass - away from people. The reviews made it sound like the place was infested. We saw 3 the entire time we were there and the property is huge. All in all we thought it was a wonderful trip and were sad to return to the frigid weather of New York after being in 83 degree weather.

Reviews.Title: “Decent with gaps in service”
Reviews.Author: RicardoCabanaboy
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel that commands top dollar ,but, there were things amiss. One of the seaside restaurants was closed the entire time we were there. There used to beach service, and at times there were bars that were closed at peak times. One bar would be overstaffed and another struggling to make frozen drinks. They also would rotate staff from one bar to the next. The people that were working were very friendly and nice. Beach is groomed, clean, and good.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, great customer service, but beware of wet floors in room”
Reviews.Author: LAGlobeTrottr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is BEAUTIFUL, grand entrance, two pools, plus one just for little children (which our 1 year old loved). Our first room seemed clean & well appointed, but when I woke in the morning I quickly found that I had been bitten by bed bugs! Hotel staff were great, moved us into another room (with better view). I wished they told would have us about wetness on the floor due to condensation when the warn air comes into contact with AC-room--we used pool towels as rugs throughout our stay. Good food in hotel restaurants, but pricey. Antojitos down the road is FANTASTIC, so is the pizza spot down the street by the gas station/laundry mart.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: susieq3333
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 7 day stay at the Rio Mar and had a much better experience than I had expected based on the reviews. I used the Dragonfly airport transfers and this was the most economical way for a solo traveller although two or more vacationers may want a taxi since a taxi could stop and pick up supplies. I did feel bad for a group of four who had a small child and could not be provided with the child seat that was requested- Dragonfly had a booster seat designed for a much older child which could not be used for a 1-2 year old.
