Check in went smoothly and I was offered a basic room either on the first floor facing the pool/ocean or a 7th floor room facing the mountains- I picked the mountain view and believe that was the best choice. The view really was beautiful especially in the misty mornings and evenings. I found some travellers binoculors in my suitcase from a previous trip and enjoyed watching the tropical birdlife. I wasn't sure what to expect about the restaurant situation considering other reviews citing overpricing and poor quality and I was pleased not to agree with other reviewers. I found almost all of my meals to be reasonably priced and of high quality. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet a couple of times but went for the 'cold buffet' , $16 I think, which included fruit juice, a full carafe of coffee, fresh fruit buffet, pastries, cereal, and breads. It was worth my dollar because it also provided bagels that could be toasted with cream cheese, smoked salmon, capers, and chopped onions which added a tasty sandwich to my breakfast. Pretty much all basic meals cost me about $20-22 with taxes and tip and the quality was very good and I thought that was reasonably priced. I was offered free refills on my soda during each meal that added to the value. I also ate about one meal a day from the ERL cafe next to the casino and this allowed me to save some $. I got a large morning coffee and a tasty carrot muffin some mornings, $8, and took them down to the beach or pool and was very content. They also have wraps, including caesar chicken salad and others, for about $8.50 that made a light lunch or dinner. I think two smaller children could comfortably share one wrap. I really enjoyed the roasted rosemary chicken and the greek chicken wrap at Marbella's for dinners at Marbella's. I also enjoyed the grilled swordfish at Palio's. The resort has good television stations including the major networks, HBO and HBO2, discovery, history channel, MTV, VH1, and 3-4 childrens channels. They had free fitness videos on demand including a number of yoga choices. I was super pleased that they allowed me to check out a yoga mat from the fitness center so I do the yoga in the room. I also enjoyed the fitness center which had 5-6 treadmills, 2-3 stair climbers, 3 bikes, free weights, and the standard weight machines. Most of the treadmills and stairclimbers had televisions that you could plug your earphones into. The fitness center definitely got crowded in the early morning hours but I had it to myself when I went during prime sun hours from 1-2pm. I was dissapointed that the resort advertised complimentary bicycle (outdoor) on the wyndham website but actually didn't offer that amenity. The housekeeping was great and timely and I appreciated the two small water bottles that were left in my room each day. There is an ice-machine on each floor and I filled my bucket each morning and then left it on the balcony table and could come back in the afternoon and refill my water bottles with tasty, icy cold water to take back to the pool. I somehow forgot to bring one of my toiletry bags with brushes, other hair stuff, etc. and appreciated that they offered the basic supplies at the resort store for very reasonable prices and they actually had a large, well thought out selection of all basic items. The resort store also offered cold sodas ($1.38), beer (2.99 per can plus tax), and wine. I bought a chilean shiraz for $23 which was not the highest quality but appreciated. I can understand the comments that alcoholic beverages were pretty pricey at the bars- do take advantage of the happy hour at the Tiki Bar from 4-6pm where you could get two for one drinks (only one selection of the day I think) or two PR beers for $5. The Seabreeze restaurant also offered a discounted drink of the day with lunch. The staff were uniformly professional and friendly and I thought the service was of very high quality. If you have a late return flight, be sure to join Wyndham Rewards and bring your number with you- I got a late 4pm check out which was really great. I would definitely recommend the resort and return. I am especially appreciative of the fact that they lent me the yoga mat, the reasonably priced resort store, the ERL cafe, and the great staff. I suggest they remove the inaccurate reference to complimentary bicycles on the website and suggest they rethink the 'fire-cracker' bread appetizer- it's a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us and a fair review”
Reviews.Author: Chuck415
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Wyndham Rio Mar and let me say that my review of the Wyndham Rio Mar would have been much more critical if we hadn't got the deal from Travelocity that we did. If we had spent the most commonly listed amount I would have been very dissatisfied. Ultimately do your research as you're doing it now and make sure you find something comfortable for your budget. It is true the Wyndham Rio Mar is roughly 40 minutes away from Old San Juan, but it is 20 minutes away from Fajardo to catch a ferry to Culebra or Vieques. Ask the concierge for the most current ferry schedule. You must rent a car if you want to experience Puerto Rico based on the Wyndham's location. Let's talk prices since I know this interests a lot of you. $15.00 for self parking, but the ticket validation process is inconvenient. $20.00 for valet parking which might be worth it to some people considering the 5 minute walk to the parking garage depending on where your room is at the resort. $10 mixed drinks except for happy hour which has 2 for 1 151 rum punch and 2 for 1 beer specials. Ask the front desk for specific times of the happy hours and bar locations because the happy hour is short and earlier than usual. Room Service tacks on an additional $3.00 delivery charge and a percentage tax. I used room service to order 2 cokes, a pineapple juice, a strawberry daiquiri (no alcohol), and a Shrimp cocktail for $60.00. The shrimp cocktail was $14.00 for 5 shrimp and a tarter sauce. That is almost $3.00 per shrimp, but to there credit the shrimp were big. We ate at their sushi restaurant Shimas and walked out with a $130.00 bill easy, but we left very full of sushi between two of us. Desert was really the highlight. They also had karaoke at night there starting at 10:00 PM. The pros: *Most of the staff was nice. The location is close to El Yunque Rain Forest and to Fajardo ferry station. The pool is open ALL the time. The water slide is open from 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Huge jacuzzi The beach isn't spectacular in comparison to other beaches on the island, but makes for a lot of fun. Most importantly it was clean! True, we found plenty of live sand dollars at our feet. You can walk out 150 feet and still be at chest high deep water. 11:00AM iguana feeding! If you go for their timeshare pitch you get a $75.00 room credit and "continental" breakfast (only juice, a prepackaged pastry, coffee, and a apple or banana). We were close to signing, but didn't want to make a hasty decision. They have a casino with free drinks, but they only come around every 30-40 minutes for a drink request. The cons: Upon arrival we were greeted by a nice young gentleman at the front desk, but after a rewards question we were interrupted and told by his manager that our Wyndham Rewards membership was no good because we used a 3rd party (i.e. Travelocity, Expedia, Orbitz, etc) to book our stay. Fine we weren't interested in the reward points, but what about the benefits (i.e. free internet, fruits, and other welcoming gifts)? The answer from the young bald managerial type behind the front desk was "no." He was less courteous than the initial gentleman checking us in. I wanted to ask what kind of membership is this? I assume this young bald gentleman had an inferiority complex. I was on vacation so whatever and I'm happy he isn't my boss, but watch out for him. Other people here have mentioned him as well. Other cons worth note: The brown spot on our blanket (it was there on arrival) was obvious, but the cleaning staff never changed it. Stains on the tile. Yes bugs will appear in your room if you leave the patio open. Apparently the tile is mopped, but a dried worm was on the floor in the same spot for days. Sure I could complain about those things, but I'm not the type to care, well the blanket was disturbing, but I shouldn't have to waste my time calling in the obvious to hotel services. Bloody Marys were decent, but apparently the hotel ran out of celery. I used room service at 2:30 AM and it took an hour to get a soda, canned pineapple juice, a daiquiri, and shrimp cocktail. I almost fell back asleep before it came. Ultimately the rooms are so so. We got a ocean front room, but it was hard to see on the 3rd floor. The palm trees really blocked the view. I suggest something above the 3rd floor. I'll put it plainly. If you can get this resort for a great price like I did fine, but if you're spending the hotel direct prices it is a gamble. Go in with medium expectations. Then again I was here for 8 nights so somethings may not be as obvious to those staying for a couple days. Honestly Puerto Rico is beautiful. The Wyndham didn't do it for me, rather the island did. 3 stars for the Wyndham. If the price is right again maybe I'd come back. 5 BIG stars for Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Better then we ever expected!”
Reviews.Author: tshirtPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day 4 night vacation with my whole family - ages 9 -72. We had one of the most memorable vacations ever.When we checked inon Friday we were told that the 7 ocean front rooms we had reserved were spread out on both windgs on the hotel. The resort was 98% full so they were not too accomodating in switching us so we coulddall be a bit closer, however when we talk to the manager within 15 minutes we were all within 2 floors on the same wing. The rooms are what you would expect - nothing over the top but be were only in them to sleep. The views of the ocean and pool were beautiful. FOOD: we ate at Marabella - buffett at breakfast is great and you can choose from continental or hot ( you can also order off the menu) it's priced as most resorts are. There is a coffee shop right outside the casino but be prepared to wait - 20 minutes for 2 cups of coffee - they just need more help. We also ate at the japanese restaurant - delicious! and they accomodated 23 people with no problem. The pool restaurant had a grouper salad that was awesome. We went to Richie's (expensive) but we had so much fun and Richie was there and couldn't have been any nicer! We went to the grocery store for water soda and snack and rented refrigerators ($10/night- we should have only rented 4) ACTIVITIES - there is a volley ball net in the pool and various lawn games set out each morning - croquet, bocce and shuffleboard - watch out for the roaming and swimming iguanas! the beach was nice. EXCURSIONS: 13 of us went ATVing thru the rain forest -- soooo much fun! worth every penny especially for the teens. 7 of us went horsback riding and we loved it. 19 of us did the zipline tour through the rainforest --- experience this! it's 8 zips through the rainforest a bit of hiking and rapelling. All of the excursions were set up by the concierge - we may have paid a bit more but they included travel and we felt it was well worth it. My only complaint would be the keys to the room - after may trips to the front desk for rekeying --- we were told the keys demagnatize if you put them by your cell phone or other credit cards - we felt they demagnitized no matter were you put them. by the end of our trip we must have gone through at least 100 keys between all of the rooms - SO FRUSTRATING!!! we had security up to see if it was the doors but it was the keys (good chance there was some "user error" too) All in all if the only complaint I have is the keys.....I must have had an incredible time!

Reviews.Title: “Average Rooms, Great Location and Solid Service”
Reviews.Author: rideboards
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Rio Mar. The ride from San Juan takes a little over a half hour on route 3. If you are looking for a little better scenery, take route 187 because it hugs the coast for most of the way. When you arrive at the main entrance to the hotel you travel down a road with views of the ocean, golf course, and El Yunge National Forest. The grounds are well kept, the bell service and front desk are courteous and the lobby is very nice. Upon entering the room, you immediately notice that they are dated. The air conditioning unit was loud, the noise from the hotel was louder, and the noise coming from the door separating our room from our neighbors was loudest. Since we didn't spend too much time in our room these problems were acceptable. The beach was very nice. There are plenty of chairs to lounge on and the pool was also very nice if you got sick of the beach. All in all, this is a good choice if you can get a good price. The location, beach, and courteous staff make for a solid value. However, the place is a bit dated and everything is expensive (15.00 for a burger by the pool) so I suggest renting a car and eating at the kiosks and bakeries around the area. Plus, you will have your own transportation to the national forest and bio bay tours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: Jax617
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the resort. It was a beautiful hotel and the staff were all very nice and accomodating. We stayed there for a week the Mon-Wed the place was not busy AT all but once Thursday came around the place really filled up. It did rain for 2 1/2 days.......There were six of us ranging from ages (59-1 yr old) overall everyone had a very nice time. 3 1/2 stars :) The hotel is not too far from San Juan (30 min) and a easy drive. RENT A CAR, there is not a ton to do at the resort, and fun adventures nearby. Outside of the resort we went on a great Catermaran snorkling boat trip with the SALTY DOG. Great fun staff was super friendly, the lunch was prefect (small buffet of salads, breads, fruit, and drinks included) and it was fun. Snorklling wasnt the best, but still a really fun day for all (maybe wouldnt be so greaat for people who are really into snokling). Easy top get to. On a rainy day, when we couldn't go to the beach to drove up to the rain forest. It was beautiful and a fun adventure, though it was pouring! Do not waste money on a rainforest excursion....drive yourself, they have infomation both at the Rio Mar and there is a tourist center at the beginning of the rain forest. FOOD- Food at the Rio Mar was a little pricy ($22.00) for a breakfast buffet...but although way too much for breakfast, we splurged since we were on vacation and it was fabulous....everything u could think of to eat!!!!! Outside the resort there is a public beach Luquillo. It was nice for a change, Umbrellas and chairs to rent but still be arounf the locals. Honestly, Rio Mar's beach is better and the chair and umbrella is included. :). The kiouses (sp) at the beach are a great place to eat for lunch even if you dont go to the beach. For a quick snack #1 has TRUE PR food. SOOOO good. There is a good chance you might be the only tourist at this spot, but people are nice down at the end there is another resturant La Pallara I think it called(it will stick out becasue it is the only one with a nice sign) has GREAT food. Richies was nice but the food was over priced. A GREAT place was Haciendas the Bamboo Lounge Resturant. Get passed the car when you first get out of the car because it is on a hourse ranch, and the place is GREAT! Food is great and so is the servce and there is a free shuttle to get there....also lots of stuff to do at the ranch. Take a trip to Old San Juan, again you can drive there, lots a garages to park i and the hotle will give you typed out directions. Lots of shops, bars and resturants and you have to go to the BLESSED CAFE. A reggage bar that makes you think you are in JAmaica and an owner, Anothy is a really nice and friendly guy. Rooms were nice and clean....they provided a nice clean crib for my daughter. The biggest compliant is the lack of nightlight........according to my 24 y/o brother and his gf they didnt need a club but the only outisde bar closes at 6PM. So at night you are either drinking in the lobby or wasteing your money at the casino. Some steal drums and outside drinking would have been nice. Pool area was great both a kiddie pool that was perfect for my 15 month old, family pool and an adult pool were all nice and clean. Beach was beautiful. Went to the Spa for a massage.......it was wonderful and Jose, did a great job but it was $160...again vacation so I splurged Over all great stay!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!! Read...read...read the reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Cookhouse61
Reviews.Content: This Wyndham resort is located off Hwy 3...while you are on your way you will be wondering..."where am I??" But as you climb up the winding road to the entrance, you will be amazed at the beautiful grounds and golf course. We arrived at the resort and decided to valet park the car ($20). The next day we self parked the car for the ridiculous price of $15 a DAY! RIPOFF... Check in was easy but they immediately were pressuring us to schedule a meeting to show us the resort and do a walk through. (We never went) We checked into our room which had a balcony with a view of the ramp to the valet. No beach view...just palm trees full of iguanas. (MAKE SURE YOU REQUEST AN OCEANVIEW ROOM) We went down to the beach and were not very happy to see brown sand and water that wasn't clear blue. We got a pina colada and a coke ($13). We decided to go out for dinner instead of eating at the overpriced restaurants at the Rio Mar and were so glad we did. The reviews are very true. Make sure you go to METROPOL towards Fajardo on Hwy 3 (left out of the resort for about 10 miles). Amazing Cuban food. Eat out as much as you can. If you want to experience one of the most beautiful beaches in the world go to Fajardo and take the ferry $2.25 each way to Culebra Island. When you get off the ferry there are a bunch of cabs you can hop in to Flamenco Beach. ($5.00 r/t) ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL!! We did it twice. Take a day and visit Old San Juan and go to the rainforest. Rent a car! Don't pay for overpriced tours through Wyndham. The rooms are clean. We didn't enjoy the clammy floors. And don't forget...they not only charge you $15 a day to self park your car....but they will charge you per day if you want a mini refrig in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Come back, Westin!”
Reviews.Author: WWK
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Wyndham. This could be a decent place for a long weekend or family retreat. It's got a decent beach, it's close to El Junque ( the rain forest), and not far from San Juan Airport. However, it needs a big infusion of cash or failing that, a new management that CARES to take over. Rooms vary widely in quality. We had two nothing special rooms that were supposed to have "stunning views of the Atlantic", but most of that was obscured by palm trees. While the beds were very comfortable, the room was showing signs of wear and tear, from the cracked tiling in the bathroom to the stained curtains. On the plus side, the room was cleaned thoroughly every day, and it was very quiet. The beach in front of the hotel could be very nice if the staff would ever clean it. I don't mean to sound like a princess, but is it that hard to post signs for guests to pick up their trash, and/or have the hotel staff clean up? We found the sand littered with everything from cigarette butts to plastic cutlery left over from lunch. Really a shame. Hotel services varied widely according to which staff member was helping you. The main phone sometimes went unanswered, and when we called about a short-lived plumbing issue in our room, the staff member sounded annoyed. Public rooms and the casino are nice ( though the casino's a bit on the small side), but the gym is poorly maintained. I nearly slid off a treadmill because it wasn't grounded properly, and other equipment was not working at all. And now for the worst part.... THE RESTAURANTS! As I said earlier, either management doesn't care, or they think their guests won't notice because they've had too much sun. But are they serious?! The food reminded us of what you might get ( if you were lucky) at an elementary school cafeteria.While I'm not suggesting that they need to bring in a celebrity chef ( although maybe not such a bad idea to draw people to the hotel in such a remote area), they need to completely re-think their menus and food choices at all the restaurants. Pricing too, is insanely expensive. Nearly $8.00 for two very small black coffees at the under-staffed lobby coffee shop. Also- in fairness- it would be nice to let guests know that in slow times, only a few restaurants are open each day. If we had known this, we probably would have booked elsewhere, although we did OK, by going off-property to RITCHIE'S, a local Puerto- Rican restaurants, where the owner actually seemed to care about the quality of the food and the care of his guests. In summation, Wyndham bought this hotel from Westin. WHY??? Come back, Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly overpriced for a nice beach and so-so room”
Reviews.Author: HKMomNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here right after Christmas with my family. Everything is overpriced -- the food, the kids club, (especially as they plant the kids in front of the TV way too often) the spa, the (bad) internet service. The staff is personally pleasant but seems to assume that everyone has been there before and understands what is available and where things are. Food is particularly overpriced given the low quality, and the resort pushes you into eating at buffets which, especially if you have children for whom they charge full price, are a rip-off. There were never enough beach/pool chairs and they often ran out of towels, I assume this was because the hotel was full. I also think the staff should do something about guests "reserving" chairs for the entire day. The rooms have unpleasantly clammy tile floors, but are well-appointed. Upsides - the pools and beach are lovely. The staff are helpful if you know what help to ask for. Very good spa services. The grounds and public spaces are also nice. If you want a resort with a lot of activity, constant music, etc., itâ€™s a good fit for you. Many extended family groups seemed to be well-served. The non-buffet restaurants had better food and generally more focused staff.

Reviews.Title: “It's not worth it!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lraygo2
Reviews.Content: The resort is extremely expensive and the front clerk Carroll is extremely rude. He looked at me as if I couldn't afford the hotel and got a laugh at my clothes as well. Guest pay too much money for such service. The casino is tiny and the food is not worth it's price 70.00 + for an average dinner for two. It doesn't offer the authentic Puerto Rican feeling as well. I also recommend that you personally call the businesses for sightseeing events, if you purchase it through the Wyndham Resort, they are ripping you off. They do the same with the cab service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, but Food Services is a "Train Wreck"”
Reviews.Author: rj_traveler_58
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, great beach, pools, golf courses are beautiful. And the staff was absolutely wonderful! Excellent service! Friendly, energetic, happy, we love them. We would give this hotel a full five stars, except that their Food Services was an absolute "TRAIN WRECK"!! WAY Overpriced. Marginal quality. They really need to make some changes in their food planning. The Concierge and Front Staff spend an incredible amount of time and effort helping guests go off-site to find good, local Puerto Rican restaurants. Several of them even have free shuttles to the hotel. They are great restaurants, good food, service, very reasonable. The hotel is losing lots of $$$ by so many of their guests going off-site! We ate off-site all the time after our first 2 days and the disasters. For example, our arrival Sunday evening Dec 27, all the casual restaurant had to offer was a "Mexican Buffet"! Tacos, beans, fajitas, etc. This is NOT MEXICO!! And it was so expensive. We also ate at the Grille Room (golf clubhouse) one night, way overpriced, tried to be a "Ruth Chris" but at 2x the price and 1/2 the quality. The hotel really needs to get some reasonable, local PR food on-site, 24/7, or they are going to start losing tourists. All the guests we talked with, were all going off-site to eat, get groceries, etc. The pool bar and lunch hut was good, and reasonable. Once again, it's a wonderful place to stay, we would go back anytime, highly recommend it to our friends, with a wonderful, energetic staff. But don't plan on eating meals on the hotel grounds!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a total Chill vacation but must have a car at this place”
Reviews.Author: Seiderbug
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at Rio Mar. Staff was quite accommodating for changing a room, putting in a refrigerator and responses to inquiries. Beach and pools are wonderful.. lots of chairs, umbrellas, towels etc.. no hoarding or problems like in other resorts. Only problem is you need to have a rental car here due to the food.. it totally sucks... a tomato soup was spaghetti sauce from a jar, and a dip with toasted pita was totally crap. We avoided all meals like the plague and felt sorry for all those people who were eating and constantly complaining. (Keep reading .. there is plenty more below..) We shopped at Amigos the first day and got all we needed for making our own breakfasts and lunches (took cereal in baggies with plastic utensils and bowls, plates, etc. from home and just bought the milk and fruit etc.). For dinners we high tailed it out to the Kioskos down east of the property around 5-10 minutes on Route 3. Lots of shacks with good cheap and fresh food. Really got the flavor of Puerto Rico for the food and people. Great grilled chicken, meats, ceviches etc. Don't bother with any PR salads because all they are is lettuce with a tiny tomato and raw onion.. pretty bad for the price.... It also is pretty obnoxious that the hotel charges $15/day for parking in their garage...rip off city! Nothing to do but gamble in their casino.. no entertainment at all.. so if you like that it is fine, otherwise, get out of there and try to find something else to do... There are movie theaters around 15 minutes west of the property in a mall (called outlets)... Definitely go see El Yunque- rain forest only about 10 minutes from the resort.. well worth a day or less of hiking and exhibits... we didn't hike much because it was so slippery and wet afraid of falling but if you have the right gear go for it... Spending a day in Old San Juan was fun too when it rained (about 45 min to 1 hour west)... Park a few blocks away on the street and you won't have to pay for parking.. It is pretty touristy but there is on Turkish Restaurant that ROCKS!! It is called Istanbul Turkish Restaurant with Turkish and Mediterranean Authentic Food.. on 325 Recinto Sur, .. [--].. we were so impressed by the food that we told them we'd mention them on trip advisor.. we got the mixed grill, hummus appetizer and homemade baklava.. some of the best food we've ever had.. and we are unbelievably picky and are typically never satisfied... so don't eat anywhere else! We did try the Parrot Club restaurant and it was about a 6/10.. nothing extra. Stuff is pretty expensive overall but we found the people quite nice and accommodating even if you don't know Spanish. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, poor and inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: TheOneWhoLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: Great beach, poor and inconsistent service The resort is situated on gorgeous beach of good length and width with soft sand. It would be a perfect location for something like Four Seasons. Unfortunately, it is not one. In fact, it lacks some services of 2-star resorts. Let me elaborate. First, on positive, besides excellent beach, the hotel is close to El Yunque rain forest, which is great for those enjoying nature. It also has plenty of places to eat from breakfast-buffet/casual dining restaurant, a bar on the beach, a lobby bar, and a coffee shop to formal dining and sushi restaurant to 24-hour in-room dining. The food price is moderate-to-expensive. The resort has a lot of activities, children club, and four free Internet station (Internet access on your computer is available otherwise for a fee.) We also liked the valet service, as it was very efficient. As for the rooms, they look good with exception of a broken off trim, which nobody from the maintenance had seemed to notice. The bed is soft and comfortable. The room had a small balcony with ocean view. On not so positive note, there are the following. Internet access is charged per computer, not per room. Thus if you have a laptop and iPod Touch, you would need to pay twice (even for by Request members). The hotel is not well prepared for business travelers because their business center is only opened 9-5, so if you want to print something at other times, you are out of luck. The concierge desk, which is not aware that the hotel has a business center (seriously), can only print your boarding passes till 10pm. Dining at the restaurants: breakfast selection is ok (they used to have more berries, pastries, and meats last year, as well as better eggs). I do agree with another post early that the hotel restaurant reservation may not be recorded, so when you arrive at the restaurant, you might realize that you are not on the list. We did not learn that they did not have the reservation until 20 minutes after we had arrived. Their restaurant manager, who looked like a kid, was very rude. He did not believe us that we had made the reservation and literally told us to wait â€˜as everyone elseâ€™ if we wanted to eat. Wow. The room: we had a table lamp missing, so we called for it. The maintenance man arrived and brought us one, but without working bulb, so he had to go to bring it. The bathroomâ€™s mirror looked unclean and they forgot to replace almost empty shampoo bottle. The door to outside would not easily unlock with the keycard, you have to pull the door, and then swipe it a few times. When closing the door, you had to push it hard to close; otherwise, it would not lock securely. The activities: despite hefty 14% resort fee, there is nothing included. It is basically disguised extra room rate. You have to pay for all and every sport activity, internet, phone, parking, etc. The Ritz Carlton in San Juan has free internet, free phone calls, 24-hour business center, and non-motorized water sports included into resort fee charge. The spa: we did not experience one because they wanted to charge us 20% Mandatory! Tips (The Ritz will let you choose the percentage). I do believe that tips should be based on service, not forced upon, especially outside of the restaurants, and certainly not at 20% rate. Medical: if you get a headache, you are in trouble because the front desk would not give you any meds (which is understandable) and they do not have a place to buy Tylenol late in the evening. They also do not have a cardiac defibrillator, so if somebody gets a heart attack or chokes and his/her heart stops beating properly, they would be as good as dead at the hotel. The front desk informed me that they did not have any CPR training, only security guards, and they would call a hospital to send in an emergency team. Well, irrespective of the hospital location (which is 17 miles away), it would take a car at least 2.5 minutes to get from the gates to the hotel. Please do remember that brain death occurs in 5 minutes, and defibrillator is the most efficient in the first 3 minutes, while CPR without the defibrillation is only effective in few cases.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to our week in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: pepperbluemd
Reviews.Content: We were here for two days beginning New Year's Day. Not as crowded as others have described, and we had a car. Our first room overlooked the roof of the casino, and when we went down for dinner, we asked Joshua at the front desk if there were another garden view room. He gave us a room on the 7th floor overlooking El Yunque! Later, he also let me join the Wyndham frequent guest program so my kids could use the internet in the room. (they took it off the bill at checkout) Everyone was helpful in trying to get us what we needed, and giving us dinner recommendations when we wanted to go off the resort. We had AAA discount, so that helped with the room cost, but no breakfast was included. The grounds were well maintained and the staff was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas week in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: GNOdelaware
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico: This is an easy trip from Phila. Direct flt about 3 Â½ hrs. They are ahead of us by 1 hr. Although you need your passport there are no customs inspections. Puerto Rico is a US territory. Everyone here speaks English although Spanish amongnst themselves. People are friendly, helpful but sometimes on island time. The island is clean with many things to see and do. Having been to many Caribbean islands and Mexico I would rank it high based on ease of travel and beauty of island and many attractions. Rio Mar resort thoughts: This is a large resort 600 rooms and 72 suites. Its about 45-60 minutes from San Juan airport ($75 if take a cab). Hotel is shaped in a large U with center a nice courtyard. Legs of U extend to ocean. One side faces the ocean the other side the mountains. The hotel has nice architectural design of high decorated ceilings, large marble columns, stone stairs, iron railings and ornate colorful tile floors. Everything is painted in warm earth tones. There are plenty of common areas to hang-out at on main floor (lobby area). It is clean and very well maintained. Our room (6034) was considered an oceanview room. It definelty had a good view of the ocean but was not classic â€œoceanfrontâ€�. You will of course pay more for this view but we thought it worth it. Room was decorated in earth tones with tile floor, nice flat screen TV, granite bathroom sink. Not A++ but very nice. Beds are incredible comfortable. Bars/Lounges: There are 4 bars on property, lobby bar fairly lg with seating around it and 3 large TV screens around the bar showing ESPN. Bolero is a smaller bar on ground level (1 floor below the lobby). Last is Tiki bar directly on the beach adjacent to large family pool bar food is also available here. Also is sm bar in the casino. Is sm room with 4 computers for internet useage in lobby area, no cost here however 15/dy in your room or anywhere else on your own computer. There are 3 main restaurants directly in Hotel, a coffee shop and 2 in nearby golf clubhouse (1mi). Shimas-serves asian food including sushi-food and service is very good Palio-italian restaurant again v good food Marabella-main dining area where buffets are served bkfst, lunch and dinner (themed dinners nightly) In golf club is Iguanas pub (very good pub food) and the Grille Room a steakhouse with slow service but overall very good food. Coffee shop has good coffee, muffins, bagels and wraps. We found all of food to be reasonably good. Be aware that everything is expensive. $22 brkst buffet, $4 cups of coffee and $10 mixed drinks. Dinners are all ala carte and range in price from 18-48 dollars. Many restaurants, small grocery store and bakery are close to the resort but must have a car to get there. I would suggest several dinners in and several off resort. The concierge staff is v. good at helping with recommendations and reservations. Beach is wide with brown sand and ample space to lay out. Ocean water was very warm with big waves this week. Many chairs but as usu not enuf during x-mass week. Need to get up early to get a chair and umbrella. Exclusive poolside cabanas are available for $150/day private service and nice treats. There is a large kids pool with a neat waterslide and an adjacent adult only pool. Both pools have nice hot tubs adjacent to them. Watersports including diving, kayaks, waverunners etc are available to rent. Waitress service is available on the beach with a Tiki bar close to both pools and the beach. A full service spa is available along with a small casino (no $5 blackjack tables but lg enuf to enjoy). We did not use the spa. Two golf courses are available Ocean and River Courses. I played them both. Florida- like with fairway lined palm trees and man-made lakes. Itâ€™s a touch expensive at $150+tx (x-mass week). Nice layouts and in decent shape. Grass is groomed but not real dense. Hardly anyone playing. Very attentive staff. Tennis is also available. A shuttle runs thru the property every 10 min (not nec unless golfing, tennis or eating at golf clubhouse). There is a well staffed concierge desk to help schedule dinners and excursions. Need to plan in-house dinners day or two in advance. Excursions are well organized but expensive mostly about 100/person. Many trips can be done alone by car (Culebra, rain forest, drive into San Juan). However if choose this need to research before you get here for details. Overall thoughts: We spent the week after Christmas at this resort. Weather is predicabtably warm (mid 80â€™s) but it rained 3 of 7 days. This is a nice resort in a good location (but far from town of San Juan). Intersting architecture and large grounds. It was busy x-mass week and loaded with young children (a fare amt of noise). Staff are neat, attentive and eager to please however this is not a JW or 4 seasons category resort. Food was generally very good but expensive. Also expensive is room rate, 700+/night for typical hotel room (x-mass week). A car would be very helpful to eat out and sight see. I would probably not return (my kids are older) but would recommend it for families that can manage the costs and have young children. Most people here from US very few Europeans. Puerto people all speak English and are very pleasant and helpful. Remember if go Christmas week it is there busiest time and everything especially food preparation takes more time than you are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoyamd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the last week of Dec 09. We arrived christmas day. The hotel was very busy and the atmosphere at the front desk was hectic. I had called a few times before arriving to request a room not on the ground floor based on previous recs from TA. However on arrival, the lady at the front desk appeared very stressed and was not friendly at all and we ended up with a room on the ground floor. She asked us to check again on Sunday and we did to no avail. The hotel grounds were beautiful. The pools and the beach were great. It was almost impossible to find beach/pool lounge chairs after 10AM. We appreciated that the pool was open 24 hrs so night swims were amazing as the pools were usually empty. There are many restaurants on the hotel property and the prices is what you would expect for a US resort. My biggest gripe is that the hotel charges 25 dollars per day for resort fee but the parking and the internet are still extra. I do not know what the resort fee is for. The hotel used to be Westin. In Westin Maui, you pay the same resort fee but that covers internet and parking. The way the parking works is 15dollars per day (20 for valet) but you have to validate the parking ticket every time you leave. The hotel is about 30 minutes outside San Juan so you need a car if you are staying here. We ate at Ismmar bakery at the bottom of the hill. Their Pastrami sandwich and pastries were to die for. We also ate at the Ceviche hut at the Kiosks about 5 minute drive west of the hotel on road 3 and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a great location with poor service”
Reviews.Author: jegelewicz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip in Puerto Rico, however, we found this hotel to be less than stellar. Our first night we arrived late and ordered room service. Although we called when we were done to have the tray removed, it remained in the hall for another 24 hours. The free internet service in the lobby was down for a day and we were offered no option except to pay the fee for use of the service in our room - shouldn't it have been free since the free service was down? The last straw was when out Christmas eve dinner reservations were not correct and rather than help us with options - it was the hotel's mistake, we were left to fend for ourselves. Only repeated calls to the reservations desk resulted in help finding an open restaurant nearby. We should not have had to hunt down help in this case!

Reviews.Title: “Started badly, got progressively more disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: travelotsity
Reviews.Content: Started badly, got worse each day. Our party and another group were prevented from booking into our rooms until nearly 6:30 pm on day of arrival because the hotel had overbooked, hadn't finished cleaning the few vacant rooms, and had us booked into the wrong class of room. Rooms are broom-clean at best (or not cleaned at all which happened to us), and staff is positively rude across all areas of the resort. (I actually witnessed staff yelling loudly at guests or reprimanding their children on more than one occasion.) Watch out for Carrol V at the front desk who really seems to enjoy making guests miserable. At best, staff are slow, deliberately unaccommodating, or just completely absent. Most posts are under- or unstaffed (how can a family resort not employ a single lifeguard?) to the point where guests are waiting in long lines for *everything,* including beach umbrellas. One guest stood in line for more than an hour -- for a beach umbrella!) Even the telephone is awful, with guests sitting on recorded hold *every time* they call for anything, whether housekeeping, room service, or a bellhop. There may be a guest mutiny in the near future, Not worth the price if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach; Nice Rooms; Great location”
Reviews.Author: bgbg11
Reviews.Content: My report is a bit late in coming, but here it is. Purpose: Beach and Relaxation Beach - was lovely! Water wasn't blue as one would expect, but lots of waves. Beach is expansive. You can walk and walk. Beach is wide enough to hold a lot of people. The hotel wasn't not even half full; so getting lounge chairs wasn't difficult. Shade is mandatory for me - We were able to get umbrellas every day, but it was a pain. I can't even imagine what a horrendous experience it would have been if the hotel was full. Sometimes the umbrella guys get there at 9, sometimes 10, who knows. I am willing to get up early, but then having to wait 1 hour for the umbrella guys to show up is really annoying - could have slept in! Then you have to wait in a makeshift line for an umbrella. Yet you see people sitting down and paying a bribe not to have to wait in line and getting an umbrella immediately. That was unpleasant. You had to wait 15-20 min for an umbrella. Remember, hotel is not even full yet. You could get beach service or walk up to the bar/grill. Drinks: Pricey and average. I had tropical drinks and they were ok. They are made out of bottled fruit concoctions not fresh fruit. Food: Breakfast was good. But very slooooooooow. All I wanted was corned beef hash in the morning and it took over 20 min to get. So if you are not doing the buffet, but ordering off the menu, allow pleny of time - espicailly for families or large groups. Lunch - the outdoor places on the premises were ok but pricey. Dinner - We opted to have dinners outside of the resort. Highly recommend you try local spots in neighboring towns. Room: The room was really nice on the 7th floor. I have high hurdles to meet; so my comment here can be trusted. Our room had a balcony with a kind of ocean view. We paid for the cheapest room but the balconies are at an angle where most rooms have a 30% view of the ocean/beach. The room felt fresh and updated. The bathroom was not as nice. It was clean and the sink area was fine but the bathtub looked a worn and didn't drain well towards the mid to end of your shower. The maid did a good job of cleaning the sand everyday. The room is comparable to high-end Marriott. It is not luxury. Internet - Free interet use by the receptionist. Kids are ALWAYS on them. Just ask nicely to use and they scamper out. Nightline: Be prepared to make your own nightlife. Casino was never happening and the bar areas had scattered numbers of people. I didn't ding them on the ratings for this because I didn't cate about a happening nightlife. Service: Was not good. We should have received complimentary wine and cheese the 1st night. We had to keep calling and finally received the 3rd night. When I checked in, check-in was the normal slow pace (20 min). I prepared myself for this; so did not blow a gasket, but why does it take so long - it's all computerized!! When I went to my room, key didn't work, went back down. They gave me a new key. Went back up - still not working. Called them from a hall phone - they said someone would be right over. No one came up - had to call again. I think it took them 20-30 min to come up. That's in addition to the above 20 min. Then they had to fix the door lock, which took more time. So from the time it took when I entered the lobby to the time it took to get down to the beach was an 1hr 20. Service with the umbrella guys were patchy. Service at the receptionist with the whole parking and paying for it took a while. SUMMARY: the little contact we had with staff was slow. BUT they were always polite. I didn't ding the hotel on the rating for poor service because the service that we required was minimal. If you require a lot of attention, prepare yourselft for slow fixes, etc. Location: PERFECT. Hotel is 5 min from the rainforest. Does not cost a cent to hike up or down. 30 min to san juan. 20 min to get to smaller towns on the other side. Car: For a great vacation, a car is a must. Try dinners in the smaller neighboring towns. Hiking. Going all the way to the end of the island - opposite direction of going to san juan. Do stop by the roadside fruit mkts - very good. Summary: Go for the lovely beach; nice rooms. Don't go for food, drinks, nightlife or great service. Do leave the resort and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DTailer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar Resort the week before Christmas. We had our 17 year old niece with us who likes adventure and chose this hotel for the location. The hotel is within 5 minutes of El Yunque National Forest, a 25 minute drive to Fajardo and nearby marina (Puerto Del Ray Marina), a 10 minute drive to a Zip Line tour called Yunke Zip Line Adventure, and a 5 minute drive to horseback riding on the beach. We did all of these over a 3-day period and it was phenomenal. More about these tours later. The resort itself is beautiful with "Hyatt" like grounds, a great pool area, and a close to perfect beach area. The beach is not rocky, it is very expansive for long walks, it has plenty of beach area and chairs/umbrellas, and it also has shady areas under trees if you prefer to get out of the sun. There are not any large resorts next door so it has a secluded feel to it. One of the calm days, we were able to swim out quite far and still be in chest high water where we picked up sand dollars off the ocean floor with our feet. This is not a snorkel beach, however, as there is not any coral close enough in-shore. There is a reef off shore that you can see and you might be able to rent one of the kayaks they offer on the beach, but we did not try that. Our last day, it was very rough with high waves because a storm was coming in. Rooms: We reserved two ocean view rooms and they put us on the 4th floor where the palm trees blocked our view. You really cannot get a good "ocean view" type room until you go up to the highest floor, which is the 7th floor. Ocean "front" rooms had better views at lower floor levels. The pool, ocean, pool bar, and water sport facilities were all very close and convenient, no matter where your room was. You did not have to walk a mile to get out to the beach area. The staff and service overall was incredible....they were all very nice and accomodating. The rooms we were in were more like Marriott Courtyard quality, not luxury resort quality, but the rest of the resort (lobby, restaurants, pool, grounds, etc) were high-end. I think if they would repaint the guest rooms a different color and have a more tropical decor, it would help. One warning is that the concierge staff are timeshare solicitors and not really very helpful in giving advice about the local area. We asked them about a snorkel beach and after the timeshare push, they told us to go to a beach in Fajardo that was supposedly a great snorkel beach, but it was not. They seemed to be trained in timeshare sales, and the hotel-sponsored tours and that's about it. We got our best local advice from Jose, the bellman who greeted us our first day. He was awesome! We researched and set up all our tours ourselves. Free wireless in the lobby if you have your laptop with you and it worked really well. We drove to El Yunque, paid the $3.00 per person entrance fee, stopped by the visitors center and got a map and directions. You can drive thru the Tropical Rainforest and they have parking areas along the way. From there you can hike to different areas. The trails were very well maintained and the parking was easy to find and convenient. The second tour we did was the Biobay tour with East Winds. It is the only biobay tour that does not require you to kayak. You meet at the Marina Puerto Del Ray in Fajardo at 4:30pm and they go over to Vieques on a high spped catamaran. You have dinner on Vieques, then they take you to the bay (via a schoolbus...crazy drive) where you board an electric boat to go swim in the bay. It is something you HAVE to do. Absolutely unbelievable. Phone:[--]. The zip line tour we chose was with Yunke Zipline Adventure. This is within a 10 minute drive of the resort. Super professional, top notch instructors who love the environment and prepare you for a safe and once in a lifetime adventure (8 ziplines, 3 rappels in the tropical rainforest). You will love these guys! Plus, because they are so close, they offer half day tours (morning and afternoon) so you can fit it into your schedule. You need to do this zipline if you are staying anywhere in the northeast section of the island. Phone: [--]. We saw a sign posted on a building that said "Horseback Riding on the Beach" and called them. They were right down the road from the resort. Their official name is Catch a Dream. Phone: [--]. It was only $50.00 per person if you called them direct. You horseback ride through the woods until you get to the beach. Then you ride on the beach for about 45 minutes. The entire ride is 1.5 hours and it is spectacular. When you arrive at the ranch, it looks kinda run down and not very impressive, but the ride and experience is great. On a scale of 1-10, we are only about 3 in our experience and had a great time. Again, this is a morning or afternoon event and you can fit it in after your zipline tour (like we did :). Lastly, the resort does have 24 hour room service....it is a limited menu after 10:00pm but at least you can get something late if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort deserves the price”
Reviews.Author: lovecookingBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Rio Mar Beach resort for 4 nights, relaxed and had fun! It was a little bit expensive in resort, but reasonable. And the food was not bad--some of them were awesome in fact. We recommend the beach bar's pincho at weekend and the crispy port in bar on the 3rd floor! You can also ask the front desk to reserve a restaurant outside. They will pick you up--for free. No car rental needed if you are going there relax!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous stay at the Wyndham!”
Reviews.Author: igottagowhereitswarm
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Wyndham Rio Mar Grand Resort Dec. 7-11 and loved everything about this resort! There are beautiful views in every direction and the grounds are well maintained. We found each and every staff member that we encountered to be exceptionally attentive and courteous. Zandra at the front desk checked us in and was awesome! Eduardo from the bell stand was also great. The hotel was 1/4 full and we were upgraded to ocean view. We had two aoining rooms, one of which was ADA accessible. Both rooms were clean, with upgraded bathrooms and Bath and Body Works amenities. In room Puerto Rican coffee was delicious. Nice beds and pillows. Our rooms were really quite nice! Our third floor view of the ocean was partially blocked by palm trees next to our balcony, but this turned out to be great because of the birds, iguanas and geckos to watch! The kids loved this. As a brand new Wyndam Rewards member, I received a fruit plate and wine as a welcome gift. The grounds were beautiful and pools well-maintained. There are a few iguanas around the pool and we attended the iguana feeding in the back of the hotel which was very cool. The staff member provided a very educational talk and answered everyone's questions. We did not enroll our children (12 yrs. and 9 yrs.) in the kids club but we checked it out and there are plenty of activities. The staff at the kids club and around the pool were really friendly towards our children. The public beach in front of the hotel is raked each morning and we saw no trash around. Only a few restaurants were open but I wouldn't expect them all to be except during peak season. Marbellas is the casual restaurant and the meals were tasty. My server did not charge me for my pina colada since it too awhile to bring it. Great service. My husband only checked his emails once (yey!) and found the internet to be super slow, but it was free and as leisure travelers it was adequate for our needs. We used self-parking ($15/day) and it was fine. There is a small casino and there is a nice gift shop. A word about the prices...this is a "Full Service Resort." Yes, the prices are high but they are in line with any resort on the island, the US, Mexico, Canada, Caribbean. Please understand that while room rates might be discounted, you are booking a resort stay and prices will reflect that. We took the advice of other reviewers and rented a car, stocked up on drinks and snacks at Wal-mart and ate most of our meals outside of the resort. The Isamar panaderia and Palmer bakery across Rt. 3 had delicious $3 breakfast sandwiches. Richies was a nice spot to have a drink but we did not eat there. We ate at the luquillo kioskos down the road. El efe was really good, the others were ok. As far as the hotel property itself, the location is perfect if you want to get out and see the island. We found the rain forest, snorkeling, bio bay excursions, horseback riding, tennis, the ferry to Culebra and Vieques and beautiful beaches are all less than 25 minutes away. Bring a portable GPS with you if you have one, as this made the roads easy to navigate. We zipped around in our rental car and my husband was driving like a local by the second day! I planned our excursions before we left so we did not use the hotel concierge to book tours. I would highly recommend this hotel and we would definitely choose to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence is a great name for this resort”
Reviews.Author: Shari 266
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excellence from Nov 29- Dec 5. Easy to get to the resort from the airport, maybe 20-25 minute ride, which is nothing comparitively speaking. It was a 40th birthday trip so we splurged on an Excellence Club Rooftop Terrace Room...definitely worth it. A note of caution, get your room in building 9 on the 4th floor, otherwise everyone else has a view of you on your rooftop terrace. The room and the view from our room were outstanding. Having two balcony choices was very nice, and each one comes with a variety of seating options. The splash pool on the rooftop is not heated in any way shape or form, and took a bit to get used to. Temps were in the mid 80's during our week so we were never so hot that it required a splash. Still used it though, just understand it is not a hot tub! Very relaxing. The bathrooms could be an issue unless you are very familiar with your travel companion, the bathroom doesn't have a solid wall between it and the bedroom, so when using the potty it is kind of like you are right there...weird, but you get over it. The Excellence Club is a great options, easy check-in/check-out, upgraded toiletries, concierge, but the best part was the actual Excellence Club. Tucked into building 8 is the actual private Excellence club, that only club members can utilize. It had concierge service, 3 computers with internet, TV/lounge, bar, and a buffet at all times it was open. We actually ate breakfast there one morning. Very nice to have a place you could go to have issues addressed, and to check in with home if you needed to. Worth the upgrade in our opinion. The pool was fine for our needs, but could seem a bit crowded later in the morning. It isn't very big and with everyone on their rafts it could seem a bit stacked up. At this time of year only the main pool with the swim up bar was heated so the lazy river side was a bit shocking when you first got it, but tolerable. We never had a problem finding a spot at the pool. Bars around every corner, not all of them open all the time, but we never had a problem finding a drink or finding somone to get us one. Mango Margaritas/Daquiris were really good. Live music around the pool and Cafe Kafe bar was nice. There were activities and the resort has a newsletter that you get everyday to advise you of them, and other resort information, but after that it was up to you. No one ever announced activites that were happening right at the pool, a lot of things we just happened to stumble upon. We only went to one of the evening shows, and it was pretty good. Didn't spend a lot of time on the beach, but it was sandy, no big rocks in the water like other parts of Cancun. Lots of seating options and towels. The food was really good in our opinion. We are not fussy food people, but found the options great, and the taste super. Barcelona was the only place we ate breakfast, and they had plenty of options at the buffet. For Lunch we went to Chop House. We went to Agave (Mexican) twice (try the Lobster Burrito and Sopa Azteca), Spice (Asian), Lobster House, Chop House for dinner and found them all to be outstanding. The dress code a little more relaxed here than other all inclusives which was nice, and not having to make reservations for dinner was so great. We could just decide right as we were walking out the door where we wanted to go. Only waited for seating one time (we ate closer to 7:30 that night) and that was only a 10 minute wait. Staff was very friendly and very helpful, we tipped accordingly. Used the spa, it was a beautiful facility--did the couples Vitality Massage and it was really nice. Any massage and you get a complimentary Hydrotherapy circut which my husband enjoyed. The resort is compact so it is easy to get from one place to another, but it never seemed crowded. We booked two excursions through Olympus Tours...Selvetica Corona Rally and BOB (see my reviews for those). BOB was a water excursion and visibility was an issue do to offshore moving of sand into the beaches, the tour gave us free t-shirts because it was something they couldn't predict was happening at the time we went out. Selvetica was awesome and we would recommend, combo of ziplines, buggy rides, and cenote. The staff there made it so much fun. Definitely would recommend and would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but EVERYTHING costs extra”
Reviews.Author: sleepy_shrimp
Reviews.Content: The amenities and the staff were excellent. The hotel has nice clean rooms, two beautiful pools, hot tubs, a nice beach, etc.. However, despite the high room prices, the guests have to pay extra for a lot of services that are normally included in the price. For example, parking is $15/day. Valet parking is $20/day. (In addition, they can't even guarantee a spot in the garage, which can be a problem on busy casino nights.) To have a fridge in your room is around $10/day. Service fees are around $25/day. In-room Internet access is also extra charge. The Internet access in the lobby is available, but is EXTREMELY slow and almost unusable. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but the extra charges caused some consternation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss Culebra!”
Reviews.Author: LoriBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 days at the Wyndham Rio Mar Beach Resort and Spa. The resort was absolutely beautiful! I canâ€™t say enough about it. The staff was friendly and helpful. A lot of the restaurants were closed with it being the slow season, but we ate at Marbella several times and it was excellent and very reasonably priced. We tried the Kiosks that everyone talked about. I thought they were just o.k. It was the typical rice and beans and fried food. Unless you plan on just lying near the pool or on the beach or playing golf (they have great golf courses!), you will definitely need a car to get anywhere. The resort is located right across from El Yunque Rainforest. As others have said, thereâ€™s no need to take a tour. If you have a car, just drive over. Take the time to see the video in the welcome center. Even my husband, who hates those videos, said it was enjoyable and worth watching. Do not miss visiting the island of Culebra when youâ€™re there. Youâ€™ll need to drive to Fajardo (about a 30 minute drive) and catch the ferry over to Culebra. Parking for the ferry is $5 and the ferry is $5.00 round trip. Itâ€™s about a 1 Â½ hour ferry ride to the island where youâ€™ll catch a bus ($3) to the most beautiful beach Iâ€™ve ever seen. The water there is gorgeous and you can snorkel right off the beach. Thereâ€™s also a camp ground right off the beach for anyone who wants to spend more than a day. If you go, go during the week. I heard the week-ends can be quite crowded on the ferry and boarding is very slow. You can also catch a ferry there to Vieques which I was told is another really nice island. On Saturdays you can get a two-hour ferry to St. Thomas. The only down side (which wasnâ€™t one for me because Iâ€™m an early to bed person) is that there is not a lot of night life at the resort. The resort has a casino and a bar, but otherwise, thereâ€™s really was nothing to do at night. All and all, it was a great time, a great hotel, and I would highly recommend it. Lori, Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sunshine_needed_28
Reviews.Content: beautiful resort with a gorgeous view. the staff was friendly, be prepared to pay for valet, $20/day. Recommend renting a vehicle and visit the rain forest while there. We did the night kayaking hotel excursion, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneMichele
Reviews.Content: PROS: Beautiful facility. Attentive staff. Excellent concierge services. First class treatment and amenities - opulent rooms. Live music in bar, fantastic food, lovely decor, meticulously maintained. Decorated elaborately for Christmas! Gorgeous beach that goes on and on.... CONS: Couldn't think of any. Wouldn't change a thing. COMMENT: While there are amenities for children, this is a more "grown up" resort. Great for honeymoon couples, romantic get-aways, and reconnecting with your partner in beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Puerto Rico Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: DiverDaddy
Reviews.Content: Easy drive from San Juan Airport. Travelled with wife, kids and in-laws during Thanksgiving week. Extremely friendly and helpful staff and up-grades on arrival. We had obtained a great nightly rate, but food was expensive. Excellent restaurants can be found with rental car and recommendations. Many of the staff have lived in the Continental U.S. and will give you advice regarding restaurants, services and things to do. Trips booked through the hotel (scuba, sailing/snorkeling and horseback riding) were expensive but convenient and well run. Kids (10 and 7) loved the pool and beach. Thanksgiving buffet on the beach was a special experience and food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “BEST RESORT IN PUERTO RICO”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Carmen
Reviews.Content: MY wife and i visited for the second time in two years the BEAUTIFUL AND LOVELY Rio Mar Beach resort in rio grande . As there were MO DISSAPOINTMENTS as the staff was very friendly, as we were upgraded to an ocean suite on the top floor with a beautiful and large room . We were enen to see our friend Edwin fron brooklyn the bell hop who is very friendly and will give you all the info you need to know to make your trip an enjoyable one. the only downside of the trip thast we did not stay long enough , as 4nites is not enough. a must to eat breakfast is the bnakery on route 3 where the sign says GRAN MEIJA as the coffe egghs and hot bread were awesome breakfast for two was under 10 dollars, The best kiosk as everyone goes to is number 12 PADRILLA eat the steak mofongo as it was the BEST.we even got a 100 credit from the hotel which we used at the TIKI bar, a must is the ziggy madness frozen drink with the chicken wings and blue cheese , By the way if all the peop;e actually just some wrote bad things about the place why would the NEW YORK YANKEES every year in november stay at this resort as other people of fame and fortune stay hear so PLEASE DO NOT LISTEN TO THEM , also as stated a cvar rebtal is A MUST so enjoy see ya at the berach

Reviews.Title: “far from san juan, but great for golf and romance”
Reviews.Author: razzzmatazzz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for Christmas 2007. This resort is HUGE and offers great golf (although the courses were mostly under water when we visited). The compound is large and has a great span of beach attached. We ate the Italian restaurant for xmas eve dinner and it was wonderful. The beach bar closes too early, for my taste, but the lobby bar stays open for hours. If you stay here, you must rent a car. We rented a Wrangler, and It was great to drive around to the El Yunque or to the pier to take the ferry to Culebra/Vieques. Staying here means you also have to make sure you create an itinerary for things to do away from the resort. The rooms are spacious, the suites are even more spacious. Room service is wonderful! If you want to be here during the November/December, the best time to come is for New Years (pr from Dec 24 until Jan 2) as there are more guests to be merry with--the resort was nearly dead from Dec 20 - Dec 25). I can't stress enough that this resort is a golfer's dream. There is a casino, but we never ventured inside to check it out. p.s. Cute Iguanas roam freely around the resort... and you can even feed and pet them!

Reviews.Title: “Meh - Mediocre, over priced. Rent a car !!!”
Reviews.Author: teresita21
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand all of the gleaming reviews - but vive la difference. Overall I felt ridiculously price gouged at this resort. $4 stale 3 inch cookies. $20 two egg breakfast. $5 for 10 oz. glass of Tropicana orange juice. Seriously? I don't mind paying for quality food but honestly, the quality I experienced here was no better than a Denny's. If you're going to charge Ritz Carlton prices the quality should be there and is seriously lacking at this resort. I was served a $12 bowl of tomato bisque at their high end restaurant that was laughable for two reasons: #1 it wasn't a bisque (there was no cream in the soup and shame on any Chef working a "high end" restaurant who doesn't know this) #2 I suppose they thought I wouldn't notice that they were serving me the marinara sauce used in the pasta and pizza as soup. Grounds were lovely and well kept. Rooms were comfortable in a mid-price range kind of way. Ocean view rooms are worth the additional costs. We looked at suites and besides having a sofa, we did not feel they were much different from the standard ocean view room. Service was always friendly. DO RENT A CAR !!! Driving was not much different from driving in the states and the savings in food, tour costs etc will more than make up for the parking costs. Don't even waste your money on a $70 tour of El Yunque. It's a 15 minute drive from the resort and admission to the information center (well worth it) is $3 per person. The resort is about a 45 min drive from the action of Condado and San Juan, 10 minutes from the lovely beaches of Luquillo and a Safeway-esque grocery store (Amigos?). We did splurge on $60 historical tours to Old San Juan which we felt were worth the costs given the driving distance, congestion and parking challenges of Old San Juan. Many travel agencies provide 10% off coupons for tours and Dragonfly had no issues giving us the discount though we didnâ€™t have a coupon in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Quiet, Central to what we wanted to do.”
Reviews.Author: onecountryatatime
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Would not want to pay full price during high season. We went the last week of October and the hotel was very quiet. Temperature was about 87 degrees and partly cloudy. If it did rain, only for a minute and cleared up again. The hotel is at the base of the rainforest and the cloud formations that come across are amazing. That time of year it gets dark at 6pm. Location: Secluded. Comfortable. So close to the rainforest. The pools are wonderful. Adult pool was very relaxing. At night we would slip into the pool after dinner and had the pool to ourselves. No one said a thing to us. In the morning before breakfast you can take long walks on the beach!! The ocean was enjoyable too.. get out beyond the crash of wave and the water was not crystal clear.. but clear enough. At your feet are tons and tons of live sand dollars! Food: Our stay came with breakfast buffet. Mon - Wed they didn't have enough people to have the buffet but you could order what you wanted off the menu instead. It wasn't exactly perfect as you couldn't choose a little of this or that.. but they made it work. Otherwise food and drinks were expensive. We stopped off at the grocery on the way in to purchase alcohol, wine, soda's, water and plastic glasses. Bring a collapsible cooler on the top of your suitcase and you have everything you need. Rooms. Beds are very comfortable. Floors are tile and clean. Towels are nice white and fluffy. Keep your sliding glass door closed or the rooms get super humid. Rooms are quiet. You don't hear any noise from your neighbors. Restaurants. The hotel has lots of options for nearby restuarants who will come and pick you up at the hotel and bring you back. Richey's and the Hacienda were just 2. Richey's has an amazing view overlooking the hotel from the mountains. The Hacienda has the best flank steak by far! Prices were pretty reasonable for eating out in a "nicer" Puerto Rican restaurant. We were a mix of locals and tourists. Certainly LaParilla at the Loquido Kiosks was by far our favorite. Get the coconut shrimp! Yum!! I ate them twice!! Get a car and a good map. We used the Map, GPS and the concierge provides fabulous typed up directions to anywhere you may want to go! Driving was fine if one person is good at navigating. We loved Culebra and managed to take the ferry ourselves. It was super easy. The ferry is a nice hour ride on the water and the cove on Culebra is breath taking. Rio Camuy caves by far everyone's favorite. Amazing. They operate on Puerto Rico time so don't be in a rush. We waited over an hour for the tour to start (10 min they said) and it was worth it. Arciebo Observatory can be done on the way to the caves. It was interesting but the telescope part was a little disappointing. It was not as shiny as one would guess. Overall the visit was worthwhile. Tip. If you have someone that cannot walk up the hill, they will send a car down to get you and save you the hike up and down a bunch of stairs in the heat. Ponce. We drove over to the dry forest. It was interesting to see the contrast to the tropical side. This drive confirmed that we picked the right place to stay! El Yunque. We had a great tour of the rainforest. Ideal is to hike DOWN to the waterfall. Seriously. They tell you to hike up from Big Tree. It is so much easier to hike DOWN from La Mina. Guavate. We wanted to eat roasted pork so we headed here after a morning tour of the Barcardi factory. Yum I'm not even a fan of roasted pig and found the food really good. We went during the week and we can only imagine how crazy all the road stalls would be during the weekend. Barcardi. You get 2 free drink tickets. The prices are not too bad at the factory. The tour.. yeah. take it or leave it. they do teach you about the drinks, how to mix them, the history. But don't be silly and think you actually get to go into the factory. They show you videos. If you are done with the beach and want a change of pace... do the tour. You'll learn something new. Other comments: Loquillo Kiosks are good choices for dinner or a fried snack. They have penny slots in the casino. Join the Wyndham club - on the third night they will provide a welcome wine or beer and snacks. After joining the wyndham club the internet was free but super super slow. You have to pay for it and they will credit the daily charge to the room. Parking. Go for the valet. They are very fast with the car. Yes it is $20.00 for the day... but why pay $15 to self park? Concierge is full of information, details and very helpful. At the base of the street when you turn in to go to the hotel, there is an amazing little pastery shop tucked into the corner next to the chinese restaurant. Iguana's are harder to spot than you think. Go to one of the daily feedings at the front pond. They love their lettuce. Ice Machine... will the ice machine on either side of the 6th floor ever get fixed? Check your bill... make sure all charges are correct. We too had a charge they left on but then they removed it immediately. If you enjoy being away from the action and like a slower pace... hanging out in the part of town where tourists are harder to spot... Stay in Rio Grande! Overall we had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: LoriBNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Rio del Mar was a fine hotel, but needs renovations to make it look sleek, modern and pretty, so based on the physical appearence, I would not recommend it. Everything else was fine (and the spa was decorated nicely and the services were good). The ocean has nice calm waves that you can ride, if you like. The resort and beach were clean. Please note that it is a 45 minute, $65 cab ride from the airport. I recommend taking a trip to see the bio luminessence in the lagoons either on Viequez or near Fajardo. I also recommend eating at the food kiosks that are not too far away from the hotel (ask the concierge).

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Greg12275
Reviews.Content: I am a Wyndham timeshare member, this was my first time staying at the resort, the property is very beautiful. I was orginally suppose to get a Mountian view room, but asked if they had a Ocean view and was given one. We stayed from Nov. 8th to the 13th. We rented a car from USave rental car, after checking back a few times we ended up getting an Economy car for $92 for the 5 days. The car was newer, but the inside had stained seats, oh well i only had to drive it for 5 days! Paying for parking in the resort garage for guest really bothered me. Since there is not another business within a mile plus of the place, so the only people using the garage are people either using the casino or hotel guests. Yes, you need to take your parking ticket to get "validated" at the bellmans desk just out front the hotel. Your asked to write your name and room number on the back in front of them. Some days they made a note of the name and some they didn't. I say this because everytime i left that desk i changed my name and room number to something that completely does not make sense (changing the letter into competely different letter making a foriegn looking name), so not only would i be billed, neither would another person in another room get billed because the name made no sense. They only made note on there sheet at the Parking desk twice out of the five days. So i was charges for only 2 out of 5 days. Parking is $15 + $1.05 tax a day. The girlfriend and i picked up a styrofoam cooler $3.99 used their ice machine, bought pop ($1) and rum ($13) from the store. We ended up picking up a blender ($15) and margarita mix ($7) from Walmart with a couple insulated mugs ($7) and made are own frozen margaritas in the room. Don't tell Walmart, but we returned the blender when we were done with it, lol. The total cost was about what 2 drinks at the bar would run ($10.13) a piece for a frozen margarita. The rainforest in less than 10 minutes away ok more like 5 minutes if you drive like the locals. Beware the shoulder is a lane in Puerto Rico, and motorcycles will drive down in between the vehicles. We did the Yunke zip line tour which was only 5-10 minutes away for $98 a person, it was awesome. The beach did get trashy at times, but the resort used their beach cleaning machine to clean it almost daily. At times the waves were large but fun to play in. Staff was very pleasant to its guests. Casino was small, but large enough to have fun in. Taking road 66 from the airport was worth the $1.50 toll verse taking 3 all the way across, 66 saves so much time. Ok, i am going to stop typing, lol. Oh one last thing, i would have loved to have golfed, but the prices were to much at the Resort courses, they entire 5 days i did not see one golfer one the courses as we drove in and out of the Resort. Hey Wyndham lower your green fees!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: momandem
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who suggested renting a car. Yes, a must have. The hotel is a way from the airport. It will save you alot of money. A hotel or private tour to the rainforest would have been approx .$ 100.00. We spent $ 9.00. On returning the car I needed to put $14.00 in gas. Our stay was 4 nights. Upon checking in we were given a room immediately and upgraded from Garden View to Ocean View Room 3016. From our balcony we were above adult pool and ocean beyond it. There are tiled floors in the room so use caution. There was a musty smell. We opened the balcony door and put a towel on the floor by the bed. No big deal. As we live in Florida I can understand why there are tile floors. As far as the thermostat, when it got cold at night I would turn up the temperature. The 2 king sized beds were so cozy. The provided toiletries were top notch quality brand. I had coffee every morning and left 1.00 for housekeeping and was stocked with plenty of coffee and Twinings Tea. We arrived to 2 bottles of complimentary water. We first ate at the Tiki Bar and my adult daughter and I were able to share a burger and fries and still be full. Prices are comparable to any city prices. We were joined by an orange young tom-cat that seems to "live" on property. We fed him but he was not annoying in any way and happy to go about his business.
