There are alot of activities at the hotel, no charge. We were there on a weekend. Friday and Saturday nights there is "Drive In Movie" night by the pool, rated G and they offer popcorn fresh popped from a cart. There is always something at night in the Ballroom, dancing, music, comedy, etc. We were there for a Mardi Gras costume night anyone could attend. There is a wine bar with live piano music. During the day they offer bingo, water aerobics, dance lessons, etc. Every moring there is feeding the Iguanas time where you can feed them lettuce. The kids club looks great. All activites are posted on a board by the pool and in the lobby. It is a shame that more people don't attend these events. The dealers at the casino were great at helping new players learn the games. If you are a "seasoned" player don't expect everyone on your table to know the "book". We met some nice people and joined them each evening. The hotel tour desk staff were very accommedating with print out directions to resturants and attractions. The beach was clean, but the water is a bit rough. We had a late departing flight and we were welcomed to leave our bags with valet for no charge and use all the ammenities for the day. We did eat at the resturant down the hill from the hotel to the light and make a right. The host was very cordial and helped us with the menu. And the food was good. We also stopped at the bottom of the hill at the market. It was a Friday night and there was live music and dancing in front. We got some snacks and drinks, the only fruit was bananas though. They were delicious, so much sweeter. We took road trips. One was to El Yuque Rainforest and stopped at the Guest Center first and watched the free movie. Worth it. Drove up to the first waterfall and got out and took some photos. Continued to the observation tower and walked up. Took the trail to the falls you can swim at. We were told 35 min. walk each way but never timed it. Parts of the trail slope steeply up and down. We must have arrived with a tour because the fall was full of people unfortunately very loud with music and picnics in the water. We were at first disappointed. We went under the wooden bridge and used a private pool. After they left we went under the falls. Clear, exhillarating and cold! On the drive back down we ate at the El Yuque outdoor cafe. There we sampled. That was the best food we had. We drove to Luquillo Beach and rented 2 beach lounges for the day at $5.00 each. Skipped the umbrella and sat under the palm trees. Very nice beach. My daughter was serenaded by a cute older gentleman who strolled the beach with a gutiar and sang. I was more than delighted to give him $3.00. Parking for the day is $3.00. There was a gift shop and snack shop. We tried a really good lobster and crab "taco". Empanada and taquitos. Beer, water and margarita. Very reasonable. Last outing was San Juan. We had been there before and skipped the fort. Walked around side streets. Then decided to stay near the cruise ship port because there were more shops and activity. There was a Starbucks, for the homesick. We ate at the staple Senor Frog's. Food's not good, but fun atmosphere. Passed a local bakery. Picked up 2 pasteries everything was $1.00 each. Very good. Since the streets are so narrow it is hot in the city. Dress comfortable and walking shoes. We are already planning to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Employees ..5stars..and wow the discounts!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: suzukiracer
Reviews.Content: Well after reading all of the reviews before I went ..I said "hey there's always a first for everything". The resort is sensational .. unbelievable how Rio Mar has such a great property. When we arrived .. we were checked in by Carrol V. This guy is 5 star...meaning he went above and beyond . I asked about an upgrade and he saved me alot ($900.00) on a Junior Suite , facing the ocean.. ! He gave it to me for $100.00 a night + taxes.. and it was AWESOME.. my wife was so happy . I just want to say thanks to Carrol V and the staff at Rio Mar for the great stay. You all truly made my stay wonderful and I will be back! My advice: read the reviews .. bits and pieces are true . Some are not . Rent a car and definitely ask for Carrol and get a great discount ! I did.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: TakishaLE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there to renew our vows. The service was excellent, and the resort was very relaxing. The only down fall was the prices, but you have to expect that when you are at a tourist location. The breakfast buffet at the Maribella was excellent, The food at the Iguana Pub was good, the Palio was excelent and the Tiki bar was good for sandwiches and drinks. We will definitely be going back. I even liked that they had an adult pool and kiddie pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Admiral Ron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar Oct. 26-31 and based on most of the reviews here the Rio Mar was just what I expected so I thank you all. On recommendations here we rented a car from Thrifty for $20/day and it was a nice car. Just to get 2 and from the resort would have cost us over $100 so this was the way to go and I did not notice any difference in driving from the states. Parking is also $15/day but since we used the car to drive everywhere it really paid for itself. Upon arrival I had an easy check-in and requested a room on a higher floor with an ocean view and there was no hesitation to change my room. We booked Cheap Caribbean and part of the deal was a $100 Visa gift card from the dept of tourism. The Rio Mar did not have any on hand but had no trouble giving us a $100 credit instead and showed on the closing bill without any problems as some other posters mentioned. The room was very nice and the bed very comfortable, better than most resorts I have stayed at in the Caribbean. Be warned that food and drink is expensive at the resort so if you have a car drive to the Amigo market which is the 3rd light (193 right) East of the resort on RT 3 in Luquillo (5 min drive). Driving there you pass the Kioskos on the left just past the 2nd light and I would recommend going to La Parilla #2, The Burger Shack #12 or The Lighthouse #20. All have excellent food and inexpensive except La Parilla but still half the price as the Rio Mar. By a cooler at Amigo and stock it with drinks; we also bought some lunch meat and cheese for quick lunches on the go and didn't feel the need to rent the fridge which is $10/day. All staff members encountered where very friendly and very helpful. The grounds were well kept and the beach very clean. The pools were nice and water warm and the chairs at the adult pool were cushioned. The only complaint is the pool collected debris during the day and was not cleaned so the afternoons there were some floating things. The casino is nice and we actually won, the gym is small but free and parking was not as far as some reviews made it out to be. Since we never ate at the resort we ate out at most of the places that were recommended in previous reviews and all were good. I mentioned the Kioskos area above, El Jefe Burger Shack is all hand made from their own ground chuck and the guys at the Lighthouse made me 3 different types of Mofungo not on the menu to try and was it good. I also ate at the Brass Cactus in Luquillo (193 left) then another left at the split and down 4 blocks (park on the street) This was great for all kinds of food including for kids. One afternoon we drove into Old San Juan (not a lot of traffic considering it was 4 pm) and had dinner at Old Harbor Brewery, Steak & Seafood. They make their own beer and I tried several and their food was excellent. Dinner for 2 was only $75 with tip so not too bad. We ate breakfast almost every morning at Ismala Bakery which is located at rt 3 and rt 968 where you turn to go up the hill to the Rio Mar. Since you are so close to El Yunque it is a must that you go and at least drive through if not take the trails. I took the Big Tree trail at KM 10 which leads to La Mina Falls and hike the La Mina trail out to the Palo Colorado Info Center at KM11.7. We also took the ferry out of Fajardo to Culebra Island ($5 round trip) and went to Flamenco Beach ($5 round trip with the Willy buses). Very beautiful and they just finished adding Kioskos for food and drink and prices are very reasonable so I would highly recommend it. If you are bringing a cooler just make sure no glass items, only cans. There is surfing in PR besides Rincon the West Coast and it's right in Luquillo. Go see Juan at the Luquillo Surf Shop and he will set you up. A little tough to find, just turn left on 193 off rt 3 then right at the split and follow to the town square. Since the square is all 1 way go right first the 2 lefts and take a quick jog right at the hardware store then left and the coast will be in front of you. Go to the end and turn left then park and the surf shop is across the street which also will soon be a restaurant and bar. That about wraps it up and I hope you find this helpful. I included a lot of directions since I had thought it would have been helpful to me if others would have done the same.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing and enjoyable vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Charles149
Reviews.Content: From point of arrival the staff was very helpful and cordial. The rooms were big and clean, with a patio and view of the mountains and ocean. The visit to Old San Juan was most enjoyable and is a must see. The historical combined with the modern is a spectacular experience. The beach and the pool are only a few steps from the front door of the resort. I liked the whole experience. what I liked the least is that I didn't have more time to spend.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: KySunflower1978
Reviews.Content: We booked this on our own not knowing what to expect & our expectations were exceeded upon arrival! Beautiful resort, secluded, private beach, quiet, AWESOME! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Resort except for the location”
Reviews.Author: bradpitt11
Reviews.Content: The resort has amazing location. 5 mins to Luqillo beach where locals eat and its a must to eat there at the kiosks. It is 15 mins from Fajardo where Bio bay kayak tours originate and ferry to Vieques and Culebra originates. The pool is really good and they have iguanas roam around freely on the resort. They have a night fire going on by the pool and pools are 24 hours. Water sports is outsourced but they'll have someone by the beach. The beach is really good outside the resort. We ran into a number of problems though. 1. Shower pressure - it literally stops while you are all soaped up. Then super cold then super hot. All randomly. 2. Elevator to self park wasn't working..so had to carry bags through stairs. 3. They dont have a person to validate your parking outside of self park, so you have to go outside the main entrance and then to the garage..and its $15/day. 4. No Nightly Entertainment. 5. Internet in the common computers area is slower than dial up. 6. Restaurants aren't that good except for Palio and the Bakery food really sucks. 7. The bar in the center serves really good snacks like Paninis. Order from the bar..and their drinks are good too. 8. Service is ok. People aren't that friendly. 9. Resort is more like a hotel, you pay, we give you the pool and the beach access and you go and enjoy yourself. We aren't involved in anyway. 10. If you get an ocean view..make sure its floors 5 or higher or the trees would block your view. 11. Make sure to sign up for Wyndham By Request online before your get there to get free internet and if your reservation is through a third party site like Expedia, you don't get any Wyndham reward points or Wyndham By Request free internet access. 12. Bathrooms are dirty, we found two hairs..which were definitely not ours and housekeeping doesn't clean the bathroom include toilet bowls every day. We also stayed at Gran Melia for a day..and trust me Gran Melia is much better in appearance, service and their Wet Bar has awesome drinks to go along with their beautiful pool. It if weren't the proximity to Fajardo..i dont think i'd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Take a chance”
Reviews.Author: tropical-gal39
Reviews.Content: I booked the Rio Mar BEFORE I discovered Trip Advisor website, so I was a little nervous based on about 50% of the reviews. Here is my review: Hotel is very pretty. The grounds are kept very clean.The first night there we ate at the casual rest. in front of the waterfall (can't remember name)- I had the pasta bar. It was amazing- the chef cooked everything right in front of you. Yes, it was a little pricey (4 adults= $81). The waves on the beach were beautiful to watch and it was fun to body surf, but yes it was a little rough. I would not have let young children go out very far. The best part about the beach was the thousands (yes I am telling the truth) of sand dollars in the water. They are everywhere! The drinks were definitely expensive, so we went to the local Wal Mart (like everyone else), bought a cooler, stocked up on beer and wine coolers and snacks, and spent our money on evening meals. Definitely rent a car!!! It's a must. There were a total of 4 adults in my party. We rented through Enterprise (on line) and got the "standard" car for $134 for a week. We ended up only putting $10 of gas in it the whole week and we drove the entire island. So, instead of having to book excursions with the hotel or travel company we were able to tour the El Yunque Rainforest for a total of $9, go to the Arecebo Observatory for $12, and the Camuy Caves for $24. All of those trips can be booked thorough the hotel for well over $100 per person. And the best part was that we were able to take our time if we wanted. Now, for places to eat: We ate at Richie's one night. Very good food, but very expensive. 4 adults, 4 meals, 2 waters, and 2 margaritas totaled $160 (they add the tip to the bill). The next night we ate at the Hacienda. The BEST food on the island! Again, 4 adults, 4 meals, 2 teas, 4 margaritas totaled $120, including the tip. The best part was that both places will come pick you up at the hotel and bring you back so you don't have to search after dark for their places. Then one night we went down the hill to Don Pepe's. Small place, nice people, very good food! 2 people really can share a meal there is so much food. Again, 4 people, 4 meals, 6 margaritas totaled $100 including the tip. The Kioskos in Loquilla were neat. Eat it fresh if possible. We ate chicken Pinchos (shish-ka-bobs) right off the grill and they were great. That night all 4 of us had rice, beans, Pinchos, sodas for about $20 total. Visited Old San Juan for the day. Find a place to park for the day and ride the trolley. We parked at the Normandy hotel parking, took the bus to Old San Juan and rode the free trolley all day. Parking at the Normandy was $4. The streets are extremely tight and you are asking for a wreck if you attempt to drive those tiny streets. Was able to get off the trolley at El Morro and tour on our own for about $6. We went diving in Fajardo and in San Juan. Not as clear as Cancun or Cozumel, Mexico but a neat experience. Overall, the trip was a great one. Stay positive and friendly and you are not likely to encounter negativity. A smile and a thank you went a long way for us every single day. We will definitely be returning to see everything we missed on this trip (Culebra, Visquez, Agadilla, bio bay, Ponce, and more diving).

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Down!”
Reviews.Author: westva
Reviews.Content: Upon entering my room for the first time I found a live ROACH who crawled out from under the phone and beside the bed were empty peanut shells which took the maid 5 days to discover. The pool water was filthy and never improved during my seven day stay. The food was horrible and the service worse. Food and beverages are overpriiced. (I have no problem paying for a great meal, but was unable to find one). Trust me, I tried all of thier resturants. The Grill Room resturant ran out of 4 types of steaks by our arrival, 7 P.M. It took 20 minutes to seat us and the resturant was half empty. Nice beach and ocean water. The jewelery store in the hotel was robbed at gunpoing the week prior to our arrival and that was confirmed by the staff. The world is a big place. Find some other place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “I will not be back”
Reviews.Author: cjsmithnj
Reviews.Content: The resort seems nice, on the surface. The first day was fine as our group was happy to be in the warm sun of PR. But as the week progressed I noticed some problems that would prevent me from returning. My bathroom had no ceramic items in it that were not damaged. The sink had a large starburst crack of about 8 inches that looked like someone had thrown a bowling ball in it- not possible to miss. The bathtub had 5 large areas of damage that had a rough repair on it- the repair looked like spackle and had the same rough surface. The bathroom floors were dirty, and the tub had mildew on the grout. The caulk between the tub and wall was falling out (Exterior walls of the hotel had green mold on them- also not possible to miss). The bedroom was OK- but had major issues with the cooling system. Alaska or Haiti, nothing in-between. Out to the tiki bar. Again- first day was fine. Drink (beer in my case) prices were reasonable. Return the next day.... more than double the price. When I asked why- "they made a mistake". All day, 3 bartenders?? That was the last drink we bought there, they lost a ton. On closer look the area around the bar wasn't very clean; I wore flip-flops after the first day even though it was directly adjacent to the pool and beach. Only order food at the outdoor pool if you are related to a dentist; dry and tasteless. Wear boots if you go into the bathroom adjacent to the pool- standing water on the floors, mold on ceilings and walls. The pools themselves were very nice- I would say the high-point of the resort. Service here, again, left a lot to be desired. Indoor restaurants werenâ€™t much better. The food at Palio was good, the Ossobuco was really good. Service was OK.... nothing to write home about. The food at Shimas (Sushi/Asian) was very good- too bad they closed it down for the last night I was there. When I asked the front desk manager why she told me it was due to the "mass checkout". I guess they didn't expect all those people to leave when they said they would. I was then informed the "grill" was also closed for the same reason- our option was Marbella. Way too few servers, and they were all completely overwhelmed. After 3 hours to get our meal the restaurant manager began an argument with our table over the bill. She offered to comp us, and then changed her mind. Not the model of professionalism. Back up to the front desk manager... situation resolved. At least we had live entertainment- we watched every other table in the restaurant get up and leave without being served, throwing a few shots at the manager on the way out. When you go for the breakfast buffet bring a straw if you want scrambled eggs-they must be from a box. The golf course was nice- the food there was also not to a very high standard. Overall, this facility needs to have some serious attention paid to it. It does have a fantastic location and could be great, but the lack of maintenance and professionalism from staff brings it to a 1 star in my book. If going make sure there is a place to eat- I asked the manager what they do when occupancy is low- they send you off-site in a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: myopinoncounts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the entire family! The staff was friendly and so were the other guest. The property is very clean and very well maintained. Great entertainmet, just a overall great place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: smiller051
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at the Wyndham Rio Mar in June. Our stay was part of an excellent package deal that I found online. The hotel is beautiful and the stay was excellent. Upon arrival, as a shot in the dark, I told the front desk that we were there for our anniversary celebration. The hotel happened to have a junior suite available for the entire 4-night stay and upgraded us for competely FREE! I thought this said a lot about their standard of customer care. The restaurants were quite pricey and the food is really not that good. I would recommend renting a car as the resort is pretty far from everything. We rented one as part of our package and was grateful we did as there is not a ton to do on the resort itself. Overall, we got a great deal for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: prbi4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Wyndham Rio Mar. The resort was beautiful, the room was comfortable, and the staff was friendly. The service was a little slow (it took over an hour to get towels - two different times), but overall it was a great experience. The pool area was great, with three separate sections (a toddler pool, a family pool with waterslide, and an adults-only pool). Iguanas roamed around the pool, and there was a daily feeding scheduled, which was fun for the kids. The beach at the resort was okay, but not perfect. The sand was a little rocky, and the water wasn't very clear. We took a ferry ride to Culebra to visit Flamenco beach...and that was AMAZING! The sand was white, and the water was calm and turquoise...absolutely worth the effort to get there! The restaurants at the resort were a little pricey, but there was a cafe on site (next to the casino) that had very reasonably priced snacks, coffee, sandwiches, and sweets. The Rio Mar is located very close to El Yunque rainforest, so you should plan a visit there too...so beautiful! Overall, we had a great experience at the Rio Mar, and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but some staff was lacking.”
Reviews.Author: blondie5427
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar was a beautiful hotel. It was very clean and wonderfully decorated. The food was excellent, but there was no local cuisine on the menu. The small sandwich cafe near the casino had a nice selection for a a light lunch or breakfast and the restaurants all had well prepared fare. I did find the food a bit pricey, but since I was on vacation I splurged. The adults only pool was perfect for relaxing without alot of noise and the beach was very nice, even though it was messy from the recent flooding. There was free wireless internet in the lobby with plenty of seats so I was able to check my email and work without paying the daily rate. My only complaint would be in regards to the concierge staff. Whenever I asked them questions they made me feel as if I was interrupting them and bothering them. I found that if I wanted to know anything about the area asking the cleaning staff or the bellhops was my best choice. They were extremely helpful in helping me decide what to do. The only other thing that might bother some people, but I loved, was that the hotel is aways from anything else. Without a car it would be impossible to leave the resort to sightsee or go to a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Conquistador!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PipergirlKerry
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start.....The rediculous prices ($11 drink-mostly ice), the dirty no-climate control-rooms, absolutely tiny casino, room keys that never work, showers that stop mid way through..... At first glance it looks really pretty, but it has to because there is nothing for you to do. When we got there they didn't have the room we reserved so we had to wait till the next day to get it (no compensation for this either!) Thank goodness because the room we were in was about 40 degrees even thought the thermostat was set for 80. The safe was locked and the floor was filthy. We tried to call to the front desk but the phone didn't work! We were told someone would look at it right away. Never happened! Dinner...$150 for the two of us and it was just OK. I do not mind paying that much for a nice dinner, but had it not been for the company I am sure we would have been much more disappointed. Poolside....depending on who brought you your drink the prices fluctuated. We were there with 500 people and everyone had the same complaint. $8 from one guy $10 from another I got socked with an $11!!! DO NOT eat the food at the BBQ hut! Totally dried out hockey puck for a burger and $13. That includes nothing. No fries, chips, nothing! Beach....brown dirt-like "sand" your feet are actually dirty from walking on it. We stayed at the pool. Rooms....I would say half of the people were complaing that mid-way through your shower....drip drip drip. It would just stop. There you are full of soap and no water! And about a third of the peoople were complaining that the room was either too hot even thought the thermostat was set at 50 and the rest wre complaining it was freezing no matter how high you set the thermostat. That was our problem in two different rooms. And when we opened the door to let some warmer air in, it was just humidity that came in. Our room was soaked when we got back from dinner!!!!! Casino....the reason this resort was chosen was because of it's on-site casino. If you want to call it that. 1 roulette wheel, 3 blackjack tables 2 3-card poker tables NO craps and even though the blackjack tabes were 3 deep waiting to sit, they would not open another table. Even thought there was an extra dealer "hanging out" just talking int the "pit" and we repeatedly asked ot open a table. I must say I did thank the pit boss at the end of the trip because he saved me probably a TON of money! Dinner buffet was a joke...an expensive on at that! AND WATCH YOUR BILL!!!!! one of our friends got a muffin at the little muffiin place and mixed in her charges was a charge for $66. Even for this place that is high!!! She went to the desk and they took $100 off her bill which to me ays they knew they were wrong and just wanted to move her along and hope she wouldn't tip tooo many people off to their scam. We were warned by someone on our tour (not from the hotel) to "watch your bill at that place" I tend to think this happens a lot. I will say that the staff for the most part was friendly, but then they should be because we were talking to one waitress who told us that theweek before they were so dead that most of them weren't even working! If you go, no matter where you stay.....take the tour of Bio Bay kyacking. It was the absolute highlight of the trip. You are in a lagoon that lights up whenever you touch the water! Totally something to see! All in all, I could not recomend this place to anyone, and beware...if the price is right, there is probably a reason for it!!! For the most part, in life, you get what you pay for!! I would say spend the extra annd got to the Conquistador. They ferry you to their private island beach with white sand, have great amenities and things to do on site. Thumbs down on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort--don't go in low season though!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashlovesthesun
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is very nice. However, it's huuuuuge and isolating. I am a girl who likes nice luxurious things, but its a major downfall when you get there and all the food and drinks are way overpriced and not that great, but its hard to get out of the resort. Also, we went on our honeymoon in May, which is their rainiest month of the year. Poor last-minute planning on our part, but that meant half the restaurants were closed and the place was pretty much dead. And, it really did rain pretty much constantly. We only lasted a day and then we hopped a plane to Miami where we finished out our honeymoon basking in the warm sun :) Also, did not enjoy being hounded by the employees about time share presentations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, gotta rent a car!”
Reviews.Author: RoxyRMR
Reviews.Content: Overall, the resort is nice. Rooms were clean and fairly spacious. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they gave us lots of info on where to go out for drinks at night. Which was necessary, unless you don't mind paying over $8 for a beer or $12 for a mixed drink. The pools are ok, the beach is nice and private. There isn't much to do at the resort during the day, and it's far from any good attractions, so you have to rent a car (unless you want to stay at the resort and spend tons of money on everything from food to drinks to any extras). The closest attraction is the rainforest but you also have to rent a car to go there, the "tour packages" the resort offers are far too expensive and not worth it at all. The parking is expensive but you can probably find a good deal on a rental and make up for it. I'd recommend it more for families or couples, not singles and friends. There's more to do if you just want to relax and stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar Beach and Golf Resort - Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: pigspatrol
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the front doors it is nothing but elegance and customer service. The rooms are spacious and bright but comforting. The food is impecable and reasonably priced. Everyone in the resort from start to finish was extremely helpful from food selections to activities. I would highly recommed this resort for anyone that wants to feel like they are in the carribean without leaving the USA.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful beach, very good restaurants, rooms are clean but vary in care that has been taken”
Reviews.Author: gilmanlbg
Reviews.Content: if you get a room with an ocean view, ask for one that the windows have not been blocked by trees that are overgrown. get to the beach early if you want chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyFinn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Wyndham Rio Mar for 6 days too many. I wouldn't recommend this resort. I read all the reviews on tripadvisor prior to our departure and I went with an open mind. However, I found all the negative reviews here to be very accurate. Pros: Housekeeping staff very good. Beautiful room views. Palio restaurant very good (The rest of the restaurants mediocre at best). Grounds well kept, clean. Bellhops very nice, efficient. Cons: Ridiculous drink and food prices. (Two small Pina Coladas and a disgusting raw hamburger $39 with tip). Onsite tour/travel agency a big rip off. Casino very small. Beach chocolate brown paste and rough surf. Also, you get kicked off the beach at 4:30pm because of migrating sea turtles. I'm all about respecting the sea turtles, however, the staff grade the beach the next morning so any sea turtle eggs would probably be destroyed. Very little to do at this resort other than lay by the pool and be harassed by the pool manager. Pool manager stalks the guests and if you have a cooler you have to remove it. However, if you rent their $75 Cabana, they provide you with one of their coolers. Or you can buy their overpriced paper buckets of beer or drinks, but just don't try to bring your own can "Beer". If you don't order from the waiters around the pool you will be stalked to make sure you aren't carrying any alcoholic contraband. The pool manager was rude and very unprofessional. We've never encountered this at any other resort we've stayed at. Overall, we did not find this resort to be a good value. The pool drinks/food scam was too much of a ripoff for us. We would rather go back for a third time to Atlantis, which is still expensive, but a better value for the money with professional staff and plenty of resort activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if food and drinks were pricey”
Reviews.Author: lizbulldog
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying overall, I would stay here again. I would just make better provisions the next time. I knew we were traveling on the offseason, but there was no mention of all but one restraunt and one beach bar being open. That also being said food and drinks were exorbinant. Be prepared to pay $8.00 for a beer, $10.50 for a liqour drink and $3.00 for a can of Coke. There are 2 places to eat that I know of that will come pick you up from the hotel and drive you back after you eat. We heard Richie's was expensive with just ok food. We ate at the other place and it was good. Dinner for 2 with drinks was about $30.00, compared to at least $60.00 at the hotel. Save yourself the money and rent a car and get all of your bottled water, sodas, alcohol off of the resort. This will also make it cheaper if you are trying to do the excursions as those can get pricey too. We did the rainforest hike and it was worth the $60 a person as it is guided. The rooms were clean and efficient. Nothing fancy. There was a great view from the 7th floor. We had an ocean view room and I would recommend it for the noise of the ocean and the frogs. all of the staff we encountered were very nice and accomodating. All in all it was worth it, but I would suggest renting a car, even though parking is $15.00 a day. There is the option of reserving with Avis(which is onsite, but do the rental online and it will be $20.00 less a day), and then you could only have the car for a few days when you planned on getting out of the resort. Oh! and check your bill before you leave! There was an erroneous $20.00 meal charge that wasn't us. They quickly corrected it, but that still would be a concern if you are the type to charge meals etc. to the room and then settle up when you leave. You might not notice it if that was the case. Luckily we paid cash for all our meals etc. so I saw it right away.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from everything, expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: SaritaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because a very helpful friend let us use her timeshare. Our first night in, we ordered room-service: one hamburger with fries and 2 drinks to share; the bill was over $45!! $25 a day for parking, and a rental car was a MUST as the resort is so far away from San Juan or Luquillo. In-room internet access was another $15 a day. Half the restaurants were closed and there was no mini fridge in our room. Next time, we would stay in San Juan, or better yet, Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, far from everything...”
Reviews.Author: sharebear1234
Reviews.Content: This resort is really pretty. Nestled on the beach right across from the rain forest, you are surrounded by vegatation and amazing mountain/ocean views. The hotel itself was nice and the rooms were comfortable and clean. The lobby of the hotel is also beautiful and very "tropical".The only complaints I would have would be for more entertainment and things to do at night. You are pretty far from the city of San Juan, so unless you rent a car, you are pretty much stuck on the grounds for your stay. Car rental is cheap, but the trip to get up to the city is about 30 min, and you cant exactly get lost on this island because it really isnt safe in some areas....especially at night. You have to know where you are going. We would have loved to have seen more nightly "action" on the resort. Maybe a "Puerto Rican" Luau on the beach one night....or a comedian show in one of the lounges, or some sort of a night club or salsa band? Their is a casino..but if you dont gamble... its not really exciting. I would have just liked to see more things to do at night. We got kinda bored after dinner. During the day you have a lot of options...pool, beach, boogie board, rain forest tours, snorkeling, golf...etc...but at night I feel the resort lacks "pizazz"... And the only other complaint I have is the price of things on the resort. Be prepared to spend. The drinks are $8-12 dollars each plus tip, and the main restaurant is very exspensive. Entree's are $20-40 dollars each. The breakfast buffet in the morning is huge....but VERY exspensive as well... $30 bucks a person!!!!!!! FOR BREAKFAST!! We were also charged quite a large resort fee at the end of the stay...which tacked on another 200 bucks at the end of our stay. Beautiful grounds, nice workers and people, just pricey. Also, if your looking for privacy and a secluded resort far from the hustle and bustle of San Juan...this place has it!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: Fresca1
Reviews.Content: Stay was from 9/17 to 9/21. Overall had a great time on a girls' escapade (next time I will take my sweetie---it is also perfect for a romantic getaway). The spa was wonderful! If you get a facial ask for Lynette as her hands are magical. I also recommend renting a car and self parking to get the most enjoyment. We ate at Marbella's our first morning for breakfast and it was pretty good albeit expensive at 22.00. On recommendation from another poster, we decided to try Anojitos, a quaint restaurant down the street. For five bucks and change I enjoyed a delightfully tasty breakfast that stuck with me until supper! Another good restaurant is Ritchies. They send a shuttle to the hotel to pick you up. Try the stuffed tostones for apps and the stuffed grouper for entree. However, be warned, you may need to share as the portions are generous. So much to enjoy from El Yunque, Bacardi distillery and Old/New San Juan to feeding the iguanas. I'm looking forward to returning as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Even on a Budget We Would Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: cpscm2
Reviews.Content: I've read some negative reviews of this hotel however I loved the Rio Mar. We just got back today from a week long stay there today and would definited go back. The beach was beautiful. The only trash on the beach we saw was further down in Luquillo. The water is a bit rough but still ok to take a dip in. If you don't want to swim in the ocean there are two swimming pools. Both pools were clean and since school is in session very few children were using them. Like so many other's who have posted we rented a car at the airport. Believe me, you will not regret doing that. You will have to pay 15.00 per day to park but it's worth it. I really didn't like the way they handle validating the parking ticket. You have to go to the valet parking area, have your ticket stamped, then have your car out of the garage within 15 minutes. If your car isn't out of the garage within 15 minutes you have to go right back up there and have your ticket validated a second time. Whew, that's a lot of trouble. Ok, back to the budget, to keep from spending so much on food we drove to Amigos grocery store and bought snacks. There's an Amigos in both directions approximately 5 to 10 minutes away. We were going to rent a refrigerator but were told that the price to rent one is now, get this, 10.00 per day. They've went up from 25.00 to the 10.00 per day fee. So, if you're on a budget like we were, just get a cooler. There's also fast food close by like Subway, Burger King, and KFC. Driving around San Juan is an experience in itself because drivers there are more aggressive than they are in the states. Hotel staff, however, will give you very good directions to get to wherever you want to go. Just ask, be brave, and hit the road. Take the same tours they offer but do it yourself. They're very helpful with directions. Since we seldom drink, we only purchased two drinks during happy hour. Happy Hour is between 6 and 9:00 PM. See Eli at the lobby bar during happy hour for a drink called "Happy Monkey". I'm unsure what's in it but I can tell you that Eli will not skimp on the rum. Be prepared for the hotel to put a "hold" on your credit of debit card. We weren't aware of this before we went and this may cause you problems if you aren't prepared for it. The hold is 400.00 but they lowered ours to 200.00 and said they'd call us if they saw we were getting close to our limit. When we checked out the only thing we owed was our parking. It would be my guess that not too many people can say that. Another IMPORTANT thing...if having a ocean view room is beyond your budget, go on-line and join Wyndam By-Request. I did so and they up-graded our room to ocean view. I think besides renting the car that was the one thing that made our stay even better and joining is, can I hear you say, "free"? It's free. Because I joined Wyndam By-Request, we were given a room overlooking the ocean and pool, but only had to pay for a mountain view room. Remember sometimes the best things in life are free. You can catch some beautiful sunsets at the Rio Mar. I missed some good pictures 'cause I didn't have my camera with me so make sure you do at sunset. About the cabana's, we were able to use a cabana overlooking the ocean in the shade. No one said anything to us about paying for it even though I had read posts that there was a charge to rent them. Overall, I loved the place, and would give it a five star rating. Staff was helpful, room, beach, pools, ground were clean, view was beautiful, and we had a wonderful time even traveling on our tight budget. You can too.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: devilish_patsy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our glorious vacation in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico, 8/20-8/24/09. We stayed at the Rio Mar, A Wyndham Resort in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico. The resort exceeded our expectations. It was top of the line the whole way. Our suite overlooked the pool area and beyond that the beautiful blue ocean. Service at the hotel was exceptional. Although most of the restaurants were closed, the two that were open, were a fabulous deal. Drink prices were a little steep, but not too bad. The one minor issue was the attentiveness of the bar staff, they could have hustled a little more in the area of drinks around the bar and pool areas. Room upgraded to a suite - amazing spacious room, well worth it. The weather was fantasticâ€¦we did not want to come home! Thank you for a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, rooms, pools and golf, but bad restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: liviwest
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in this hotel, definetely rent a car. The resort is by itself, so cab rides will be a neccisity and they are expensive. Calculate the cost of hotel valet into your budget, it is $20 a day, but still worth it if you plan to go kayaking, rainforest, Old San Juan, Island Excursions, etc. Also, the food at the hotel is overpriced and really awful. The upscale Italian restaurant was horrible and was close to $150 for two people. Old San Juan and the city have nice restaurants if you are a diner/foodie. We booked on Cheapcarribean and got a great deal on the rooms. We were very happy with the hotel overall; the pools are great, beach bar is nice, beach is great and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: dwass1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 1 week stay. Great resort and excellent beach. I'd give 4.5 stars, but I guess that rounds up to 5. It is a quiet resort. So, renting a car is a must. But Old San Juan is 40 minutes away. That's no big whup and we were there several times. Bring a GPS if you have one. it's priceless in PR. Also, spring for the Loss Damage Waiver with the car rental. The drivers in PR are just as good/bad as drivers in most urban centers. However, once off the highway, local roads are not what you might be used to on the mainland. Parking spots are tight everywhere. Restaurants at the Rio Mar are ok, nothing more - though we liked the Marbella breakfast. We traveled to local Rio Grande/Luquillo haunts as well, and were equally underwhelmed. Best meal was at the Parrot Club in Old San Juan. Also enjoyed the Aguaviva in Old San Juan. . We went during prime hurricane season and the weather was just awesome. Frankly, the mainland received the brunt of 1 hurricane and 1 tropical storrn whch both sidestepped PR. It rained all but 1 day, but the rain consisted of 10 minute cloudbursts. Best times: 1. Beach! Beach! Beach! 2. El Yunque 3. Taking a harbor stroll to the San Juan Gate/El Morro at sunset; a must!!! (Paseo de la Princesa) Most Disappointing: 1. Snorkeling adventure -- great party trip and enjoyable sailing - but few if any fish! The coral also seemed bleached to me. Lots of seaweed and green plantlife - but little color.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vals1
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in Rio Mar. Main reason was the lack of resort provided transportation to main town area. If you don't rent a car, then you are basically stuck on the resort unless you do one of the pricey tours. Food prices were ridiculous...$14 for a Hamburger & Fries. Room service was very poor...we ordered a Burger & Fries at 1am and it took an hour for us to get it, then it was cooked rare when we ordered it well done. We rented a car and were overcharged for rental time and gas. Upon checking out and taking their shuttle to the airport, they did not put my luggage on the shuttle and had to send it via a 2nd shuttle and we almost missed our flight to Miami. They did do a nice job of getting us the passport that we left in the room...reacted quickly by securing a taxi to expedite it to airport (At our cost of course). We were very disappointed in the lack of appliances in the room. There was an area where a frig was suppose to go but they were charging $25 to add it to the room...no microwaves or access to one anywhere at the resort. We will be returning to Puerto Rico (It's beautiful), However will not be staying at Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel: Lovely but Checking Out: A Mess”
Reviews.Author: frngardner
Reviews.Content: The rooms, grounds, building and beach were all wonderful. Employees were helpful. All went fine,other than discovering a daily charge for parking we hadn't expected nor known of. We enjoyed the radio on the TV. We would Caution all to review your bill at check out. We were charged about $60 for listening to the radio for 4 days, for the parking AND $100 charged because we didn't use the $100 food/bev. allowance. We didn't know it was a 'use or lose' proposition. With some debating, the resort did omit most of those bills. We recommend the resort-but read your bill before paying.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, good value”
Reviews.Author: treeskinner
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Rio Mar. It is a very nice relaxing resort. The beach, pools, gardens and landscaping are all beutiful. The 2 golf courses are very nice and reasonable with an after 2:00 round being only $69. The food and drinks are a bit pricey, although Palio is very good and worth the money IMO. For the Air-Hotel deals being offered on travelocity for this resort it is really a no brainer to vacation here. If staying more than a couple days I highly recommend renting a car. They can be rented for less than $20 a day if combined with the package.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: liss314
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great amenities. Even though we didn't book tours or activities through the hotel (we rented a car), there aren't many nice places to stay on the east side of the island. Rio Mar was gorgeous, comfortable, and the staff were very friendly. The only drawback was paying $15/day to park in a garage with very tight spaces. Valet parking is $20/day but with tips for every time you pick up your car...ouch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Detailed Review and Tips...Aug 09”
Reviews.Author: wineanddineinde
Reviews.Content: Get ready...here's your VERY detailed review for the Rio Mar (Aug 09)...the Good and the Bad. The resort is about 40 minutes east of San Juan. The ride is quick and very nice. The hotel is more of an old world tuscan feel then a Caribbean...gorgeous....tile, stone, black iron, and dark hardwoods. The the interior around the lobby, restaurants, and grounds are stunning. Check in was somewhat quick and the staff were all very nice and helpful. Our room overlooked the pool and ocean and was very nice...tile floors, dark wood, stone counters, flat screen TV, internet in room, huge rooms with high ceilings, and radio with mp3 hookups. The pool area is divided into two areas...one for families and one for adults. The childrens side has a water slide, playground, and young child area. The adult side waterfalls, hot tubs, etc. The pool areas are VERY clean and well kept...The beach is basically palm lined, copper color, and clear water. The surf is heavier here but the water is still clear and suitable for body surfing and children...but keep an eye on them. Be cautious of some undertoe...also sometimes a bee or two on the beach. The hotel provides beach chairs, umbrellas, and towels. You can also rent poolside or beachfront cabanas for the day. The concierge desk was helpful and can arrange all your tours and dinners for you. The hotel has numerous restaurants on site, coffee bar, tiki bar, casino, and gym. Old san juan...about 45 minutes away....el yunke...maybe 20. For dinner...their intalian restaurant was VERY nice. (more refined and dress up)..ritchies is also great..local food and a stunning view. Hacienda Carabole is our favorite of the trip though ....free shuttle service to the restaurant (5 minutes away)...more rustic on farm...don't get dressed up for here or expect a 5 star restaurant...but if you want an amazing meal prepared in local style...THIS IS THE PLACE....and one of the best steaks I have ever had (churasco flank)...they also offer rain forest horseback rides and atv trips....The hotels coffee bar has great coffees and their buffet breakfast is great..with omlette service and all. The resort has everything and I will visit again...probably this year. The hotel is very well kept and clean...not looking worn at all.....looks almost new. Now the bad....some trash one beach....not bad or a lot by any means...but you may notice cigarette buts and a few empty cups laying around. Hotel could fix this easy by just sending an employee out once a day for 15 minutes. Prices are VERY HIGH for food and drinks. I've been to a lot of resorts and these prices are quite a bit higher...$8 for a corona and $11 mixed drinks....dinners can easily run you $100 plus and lunches in the $50-$60 range....even a breakfast (all you can eat) wil be an easy $50. That said the food is very high quality and you do get what you pay for. Best thing you can do is pay for the taxi ride to wallmart (10 minutes away - $40 or so...and they wait for you).....grab a foam cooler, your supplies, drink cups, lotion, a case of beer, bottle opener, snacks, breakfast bars, case of water, and a few bottles of rum and a gallon of guava juice (guava juice and coconut rum is amazing....also...predone mojitos over ice are great)....that will set you for the week and you will probably save $200-$400 in drinks and snacks for the week. Get your suntan lotion there as well...hotel charges like $25 for it......$6 at walmart....if I were this hotel the only thing I would do is lower the food and drink prices....maybe 20%....$6 beers and $8 mixed drinks would be fine with me....drop menu prices maybe 10%. Also, I'd send someone out to the beach twice a day just to do a quick clean up or trash. Other then this it was a GREAT resort....and evrythign was very, very nice. I will go back again, very soon! Just there...so any questions just ask.....

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: thenail1
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews and it always seems people harp on everything. My wife and kids went here for a week at Rio Mar. It was exactly what I expected because I did my homework. So I will do it quick. The goods: location , beach , pools , hot tub ,dive-in movies , casino , rooms , service , activities ,local restaurants , hair braiding , horseback riding , San Juan , snorkeling , iguanas , upgraded to Junior Suite , manicure , pedicure , massage , waterfalls ,and staff. The bads: very pricey ( we rented a fridge and went to the 123 market at bottom of hill for compensating meals ) , $15 a day parking , food decent but not for extreme prices, expensive excursions ( did them myself ) ,

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: salndeb1990
Reviews.Content: The kids had a blast. Very accomodating to kids. Pool was warm & UN-Refreshing. Kid friendly though. This vaca, proves again why ALL-INCLUSIVE resorts win everytime. Drinks & food are ridiculously priced, even outside hotels. Beach was clean, but rough for kids. We took a cab ride to LOQUILLO beach it's Clean, Calm, & CLEAR. It's a public beach, beware the weekend. Go during the week. Renting a car cancels itself out when you pay 20$ a day for parking, use the cabs. With tips, they turn out to be the same as car rental, but you won't get lost! (Bellmen- A+ Use their advice! AVOID the CONCIERGE) (Housekeeping- A) (Cleanliness- A) (Restaurants- C+ Palio was their best. Marbella's bkfast was o.k. but overpriced) (Local Restaurants- Don Pepe had great local cuisine. Hacienda Carabali-Don't go,terrible wait for food, and was cold. King Seafood-was an o.k. restaurant, terrible service) Book excursions by yourself, not through the hotel. For example; Horseback Riding the rain forest- $328. We went directly to the stables and paid $142 including cab fare & tips to the guides and cabbie. Overall it's a B minus. Don't listen to the poor reviews. You get what you pay for. Join the Wyndham By request, they'll upgrade your room, if space is available. We booked ocean view & got Ocean front. Pick a High floor for the better view. Share a drink at tiki bar... 11.50 w/ tip ask for another cup. Cheapest lunch was at tiki bar.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient views; accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: Conquertheworld
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Rio Mar the same time as the previous reviewer from St. Louis. I read many, many of the reviews here and I have to say that everything is relative. Whether you love this place depends on your background and travel experience. This is our 3rd time to the Caribbean; the first time in Puerto Rico. The grounds, lobby, and restaurants of the Rio Mar are beautiful. The valet that greeted us gave us a brief orientation of where everything was in the resort and offered helpful tips such as be sure get to the towel hut before 6:00 p.m. for towels. (They allow you to take towels offsite for snorkeling or the rainforest as long as you return them). Yes, the hallways and some furniture are showing some wear, but our oceanfront room was immaculately cleaned with no plumbing problems. Beds are comfortable. Our room was quiet. The resort was responsive to previous complaints about iguanas and their poop near the pool; the iguanas have since been relocated to a fresh water pond behind the resort. We saw only 2 iguanas near the pool during our stay. They are harmless and fun to watch. The beach is pretty. Although the sand is brown, its grain is fine and the water, while a bit murky, is warm. Compared to the beaches in the mid-Atlantic U.S. region, it is a treat! I agree with the other reviewer that the beach isn't cleared of trash often enough. The nearby Tiki Hut provides drinks and snacks, so plastic cups and containers get left behind by careless guests. This resort is an environmental nightmare with the plastic, bottles, and cans it churns out. I did not see any visible signs of recycling. Yes, restaurants, bars, and incidentals are expensive. We ate at Marabellas twice. They fully explained the pricing of the buffets to us. Great variety! We purchased breakfast and snack foods at the local Amigo market and stored them in portable coolers to avoid the $25 refrigerator fee. There are plenty of restaurants within a 10-min drive that offer authentic PR food at reasonable prices. We enjoyed exploring and many places offered a kids menu with familiar items like chicken nuggets and mac and cheese. We loved the mofongo at Don Pepes. One thing that was a pleasant surprise was that the resort offers activities all day long. If you're not into golf or tennis, you can participate in things like aqua aerobics, dive-in movies, Spanish lessons, Latin dancing, iguana feedings, bingo, and island braiding. They have an Iguana Kids Club, where they offer "camps" for the kids for full or half days, leaving you to relax or take advantage of the spa. With two kids, the Kid Club was too costly for us though ($75/child). The concierge staff was extremely knowledgeable and provided us with driving directions and suggestions on fun things to do. All the tours they offer can be sought on your own at MUCH cheaper prices, so that's what we did. We are mildly adventurous and had no problem finding our way around the island and found that most people spoke English. El Yunque was fabulous and cost us only $6. Old San Juan is a real treat. Yes, it is a 45-min ride, but a pleasant one on the Rt. 66 highway, where you get to see more of the island. Loquillo Beach is 20 min. away and you can take a ferry to Culebra or Vieques for world-class beaches, the Bio Bay, and snorkeling. There are only a few resorts in the Rio Grande and Fajardo area, and the Rio Mar is one of the nicer ones. Keep in mind that the general economy in PR is poor, and it is reflected in the community. Almost all the houses we saw are shabby stucco, all with barred windows and porches. Abandoned cars are everywhere. But we found that the people of Puerto Rico are so friendly, welcoming, and proud of their rich heritage. Their history, art, food, and music are incredible. In closing, the Rio Mar is a great place to stay for the area. Had this resort been in the Bahamas or somewhere on the mainland, I would say that it's not a great value. But this is Puerto Rico. While we were there, the staff was extremely accommodating. The housekeeping was very good and unobtrusive. The location is nicely tucked away. You are not stranded. Rent a car at the airport or onsite Avis. The main road is 3 min. away and you have quick access to stores, gas stations, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, no reason to go back”
Reviews.Author: lisa_mchenry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 days at the Rio Mar. It is a beautiful resort. Our ocean view room was clean. My only complaint about the room was the inconsistent water pressure in the shower. Sometimes it was so weak that I had to turn the shower off and stick my head under the faucet in order to wash my hair. The beach was nice, waves weren't too rough, and the water was nice and warm. That being said, I was amazed to see the same trash on the beach day after day. We stayed at the resort Wednesday - Monday and not once did we see any staff cleaning up the beach. As for the pool - the adult pool is very small. It was cloudy the entire time we were there. We saw a pool maintenance person only once, and all he did was scoop a few pieces of floating debris. There was actually a glob of white foamy "stuff" floating in the pool for at least 3 days. It looked like maybe drink had been spilled in the pool - at least I hope that's what it was! Very gross. The thing I disliked most about our stay was the lack of information, most of which I think should have been provided at check-in. No one mentioned that several restaurants were closed for the season, no one explained the ridiculous procedure you have to go through with the self parking / ticket validation. It shouldn't be so complicated. We had a rental car, we were staying for 5 days, just charge us for 5 days of registered guest parking - duh! And the signs - some say parking is $15 per day, some signs say $20, some say valet is $20, others say valet is $25! When we checked in, they didn't even tell us how or where to self park, so the valet just parked it with no explanation. After leaving the resort for dinner that first evening, we came back and parked in the self park garage, but the still charged us for 2 days of valet parking. We only ate at the resort twice, both times for breakfast. The hostess asked if we wanted the buffet, but never mentioned that we had a choice of the full buffet ($22) or continental ($16). At the end of the meal, the waiter asked which buffet we had so it could be charged to the room. As it turns out, I didn't have any hot food so my meal was $16. It would have been nice to know that up front. Had I decided to eat a strip of bacon and left a visible morsel on my plate, I'm sure I would have paid full price. The experience really left me feeling indifferent - no reason to ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service experienced as a Wyndham timeshare owner”
Reviews.Author: schreiber
Reviews.Content: I have to say that as Wyndham owners this was the worst resort we EVER stayed at. We read the reviews just like everyone else and thought not bad lets try it. I would never come back here again. Our first room the temperature wouldn't go below 77 degrees. With the humidity in PR this was not reasonable. We also got unpacked and gave our children popcorn well within 10 minutes ants were all over 1 piece of popcorn. The room they gave us was supposed to be a rainforest view and we were looking at an emergency door and a air conditioning vent. After having a tech come out to fix the temperature and fumugate the room for the ant infestation. We ended up complaining again and they gave us a new room. Much better this time with the beach view. The straw that broke the back was the very last night of our stay. We left the room at 10:30 am and came back at 1pm the room had not been cleaned. We left again to go swimming and came back at 4pm and the room still had not been cleaned. I told them we had no clean towels. We called and complained and they said that the next staff of housekeeping would come in at 5:30pm and would clean it first thing, priority they said. yeah right! Went to dinner at the resort came back at 8pm with a sick child that needed to go to bed right away. NO BED! Called down to the front desk demanded that a manager call back and send housekeeping right away. Housekeeping came in 15 minutes and I helped the housekeeping woman to make both double beds for my kids who were exhausted. One of my kids had a 103 temp on Motrin with no where to sleep and had to be moved twice once the beds got done. I'm not above making a bed but come on! Is it my job to go behind their staff to make sure what they said would be done???? Never got a call or an apology from the manager at this resort. As a mother of 2 children I cannot recommend this resort with a clear conscious. Go to Florida if you are looking for a beautiful beach and pool. No need to come to Rio Mar!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This resort is not a place for vegetarians.”
Reviews.Author: ech
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham resort is 45 minutes from San Juan, PR. If you are visiting San Juan and you want to do more than lay around the beach and relax, then this resort is not the place to spend your vacation. It is a very beautiful resort in the middle of nowhere. The food choices for vegetarians were simply awful and nonexistent. The staff however were very accommodating. The hotel had several different restaurants, all of which were overpriced. Each dining experience at the resort involved consultation with the staff and modifications of meals, and still the meal wound up not being very enjoyable. You would think that in 2009 that a resort the size of the Wyndham Resort, and its worldwide reputation would make an attempt to accommodate all guest. Not so. The menu had lots of options for those who ate fish, beef, or chicken. But not even a vegeburger with fries, or pasta with stir fry vegetables was available. The Wyndham with its limited food selections has missed an ever growing portion of the vacationing public. The menu stated that the chickens and cows were fed a vegetarian diet. What about a vegetarian diet for guest of the resort? What about a chef to create a menu that would appeal to vegetarians? Is that to much to ask? The other criticism of the Wyndham location had to do with the out of the way location to vacationers who wanted to see or do anything in Puerto Rico, other than lay around the beach. Old San Juan is again 45 minutes away. A cab ride is $80 one way. A tour to Old San Juan is $55.00 per person. It is a must to rent a car to see and experience the island, and get an opportunity to truly experience the island. My wife and I found Puerto Rico quite beautiful, with never ending rolling hills with gorgeous stucco homes where ever you looked.

Reviews.Title: “Near El Yunque Rainforest; Good for short stays”
Reviews.Author: lexasmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is isolated so it's definitely a good idea to rent a car. Taxis are expensive and you are going to need to one every time you want to go outside of the resort if you don't have a car. From the airport to the hotel is about a 45 minutes ride. And going to San Juan from the hotel is over an hour. El Yunque is near by and it's free and you can drive in on your own. The tours are expensive and especially so if you have young kids as they are being charged the same price. The hotel charges $15 for parking (every time you leave the site I think). The hotel has an airport shuttle but charges $75 per person roundtrip I think. I paid less than $150 for a weekly car rental (we needed for only 4 days). El Yunque was a nice day trip but down to El Mina Falls was a bit of a hike - not too difficult but a good 45 minutes on narrow rocky hill side roads. Only 2 (out of 5) resort restaurants were open when we were there in June (low season)- 1 of which were formal and expensive rmal and was not a good fit as we have 2 toddlers. The buffet dinners at Marcello restaurant ($15 weeknights and more on weekends) were great for us as young kids are free. We ended up eating there every night. There weren't alot of options outside and nearby. Antojitos PuertorriqueÃ±os right outside of the main road coming into the resort serves good Puerto Rican food (lunch about $20 per person). The few other restaurant on the main road looked like a hole in the wall and they close early (6pm I think). The hotel rooms, pool and beach are all nice. Services are fine. We spent 4 nights at the resort which was just right. Any longer I would be bored. Day 1 arrival, day 2 El Yunque, day 3 San Juan, Day 4 mostly hung out on resort pool and beach. The kids also went ponyback riding near Hacienda Carabali (offers great horseback riding on the beach).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DonandJohn
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rio Mar on 7/02/09 late in the afternoon due to a 3 hour delay on Continental out of Newark. Picked up a rental car at Alamo at the airport upon arrival. I would highly recommend the service and pricing we received at Alamo. We were in rush-hour traffic leaving the airport so the trip to the resort took close to 60 minutes. Fine highway driving to the resort. Resort is very easy to find off of Route 3. One thing I find with other Rio Mar reviews that bothers me is the fact that other guests complain about the distance the hotel is from San Juan and then don't rent a car. When you see that the average one-way fare to the Rio Mar from the airport is around $70.00, it just seems that it would be much more advantageous than depending on costly cabs or as others state "being stranded at the hotel". Upon arrival at the hotel, check-in was done in a smooth manner. We had booked an oceanview room. Upon arriving at the room, we felt that this room was not quite the one we really expected due to a lack of the oceanview. We then met, in our opinion, probably one of Wyndham's BEST worldwide employees, that being Zandra who is Head of Guest Services. After a wonderful conversion with Zandra (who by the way is from the Rio Grande area and SO knowledgable), she re-assigned us to Ocean Suite 5046. Upon arrival in that room.....WOW....great accomodations, terrific view of the ocean, bathroom amenities galore.......just a great room! We did rent a refrigerator for the room. This is a great way to keep extra beverages, fruit, cheese, etc. for snacking. After unpacking, etc., it was time to tour the hotel. MAGNIFICENT GROUNDS, beautifully kept pools (both activity and adults only pool) and yes many "observant iguanas"! Absolutely nothing to be afraid of. In our next 10 days at the Rio Mar, we discovered fine dining abounds there at especially three restaurants that we dined at: Palio, Shimas, and Marbella. Very different menues among all three restaurants. Please realize that this is a resort and and resort prices are charged. To be honest, we ate breakfast every morning in the suite on the balcony with food we puchased at Amigo Market (approx. 3 miles away Rte. 3, Wal-Mart about 8 miles away on Rte. 3 in Fajardo), as well as the Ishmar Bakery and Palmer Bakery, both within a 5-7 minute ride from the resort. EXCELLENT baked goods at both bakeries. When dining out of the resort, DO NOT MISS THE KIOSKS in Loquillo. Some people really turn their noses up when they see this area...DON' T BE FOOLED!!! We dined there for 4 evenings....La Parilla (#2)....Osso Bucco (#29).....and twice at El Jefe Burger Shack (#12). Great prices, great variety, and the best service. If you go to El Jefe, please tell Tim, the owner, that Don and John from Westwood, MA say "hello". Also sign his autograph wall...we did!!!!! Another fine restaurant very close to the resort is Dom Pepe serving delicious Puerto Rican/Mexican cuisine...we had some of both. Liquor, beer and wine are easily bought at Amigo and Wal-mart...great prices. Pick up some mixers to complement your selections and stash them in your fridge. Beverages at the resort can run from $6.00 to $10.00 and can certainly "pack a punch"!!! Don't miss happy hour poolside at the Tiki Bar from 5-7pm...certain drinks are 2 for 1. The casino is decorated lovely...great selection of machines as well as tables....and it's NON SMOKING! Such an enjoyment not to inhale second-hand smoke. The casino staff was very friendly every night while serving complimentary beverages and snacks. Very clean casino....just like the entire resort. The ERL Cafe, beside the casino, open early to late, serves some great wraps and other goodies. Coffeemakers are available in your room with the most delicious packets of Puerto Rican coffee. Pick up some half and half at the store and keep it in your room. We did hear people rave about the breakfast buffet served at Marbella, but it's a bit too much food to start our mornings. And yes.....the beach has brown sand. I guess that bothers some people. We spent 9 terrific days on that beach in the most beautiful ocean water (great waves), sitting on nice lounges on the brown sand. Beach crew is very accomodating when you need a lounge or umbrella. Hung out only at adult pool once during stay (we really love the beach). I really appreciate the fact that the adult pool is what it says it is...we did see children niceley escorted back to the family pool. Don't miss out on a fun daily activity...iguana feeding. Meet at the towel booth at about 10:45AM and then be guided to where all the iguanas hang out. You feed them lettuce (that's a treat for them). Don't forget the camera!!!! Oh by the way, they do not have teeth but razor-sharp tongues. You'll catch on to their habits real fast. Great for kids. Please, as being so close in proximity, spend at least half-a-day at El Yunque Rain Forest. Stop at the visitors' center...$3.00 admission...take a short tour...don't miss the 17-minute film on the history of El Yunque....it is fascinating. Then decide if you want to walk up to the rain forest or drive. Being limited that last afternoon on time, we drove. Thoroughly enjoyed all the sights. Climbed a tower, some great vegetation (bamboo, etc) and great waterfalls. Don't miss it! On an overcast day, we journeyed to Old San Juan for a few hours. Great buys on jewelry, artwork, gifts, etc. Great historical viewings also (San Juan Fort, San Juan Cathedral oh and Pigeon Park......you gotta check that one out!!!!!) I cannot say enough about the staff at The Rio Mar...namely Bianca and Yalitze at the concierge desk, Rebekah and Ana from Marbella and Shimas and all so so many more that really made us feel "important" in this hustling world of travel as "true guests". I hope if you travel to the Rio Mar, you meet these people we've mentioned and especially Zandra who just seems to be the greatest "team leader at this Wyndham or any other in the world". We are planning a return trip to the Rio Mar in January, 2010. Already booked our flights and car....great rates are available ....so check them out. This is one destination, not only area but resort,,,,that will make you want to come back for more. Hope we didn't go on too much, but this place deserves every recommendation it good be given. P.S. On certain evenings in the lobby beside the casino, certain vendors from the Rio Grande area exhibit beautiful crafts and artwork. Please look for Artesano Vincent Huertas and his breath-taking artwork which is quite affordable. Please tell him you read Don and John's review...he's a great person.....Thanks

Reviews.Title: “If you want a quiet getaway, keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: xxpalmer
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Rio Mar hoping that being out of San Juan would give us a restful weekend getaway. We were completely wrong. On the weekends this hotel seems to turn into a getaway for the locals. It seems as if the parents come and gamble and just let the kids entertain themselves by whatever means possible. To the tune of running up and down the hallways yelling and singing and banging on room doors before jumping on elevators. It took the hotel 2 hours to deal with this issue. When I went down to the front desk there were teenagers everywhere. It was like an amusement park. This was my only major complaint with the hotel. They seem to turn a blind eye to behavior you dont anticipate seeing in a resort lobby. The minor stuff... When we walked in to our room the maintanence guy was there fixing the AC. As soon as he left, it stopped working. We went and told the front desk and they relocated us, no questions asked. However, the room they gave us was occupied, which we awkwardly discovered after opening the door to the room. After going back down to the front desk the put is in a room I would call a junior suite, which was nice. A little bigger t han a standard room and had a fullsize coucher and a bigger bathroom. Over all the Front desk staff was very helpful. The room was clean and was as expected for a Wyndham reseort. However at certain times of day you would completely lose water and when it came back it would be brown sludge for the first minute or so. Also the cleaning staff never came until about 6pm. Made it kind of a pain to come back from being out all day to clean up for dinner and have the room just start being cleaned. The restauraunts, Palio and The Grill Room were nice. A bit pricey but the food was good as well as the service. The tour desk is useless unles you want to pay rediculous amounts of money for excursions you can book yourself. Get a rental car if you stay at this hotel. Also do the valet. Its $5 more a day and no hassles. We booked a helmet diving tour with them only to find out late that he booked us a regular snuba tour. Not what we wanted and we were very clear that we did not want a snuba tour, only the hemlet diving. He lied flat out to us just to book the tour. Then tried to give us a hard time about canceling when we verified with the tour guide (who was super nice about everything). The Casino is a waste of time. On saturday night they had 1 blackjack table open with about 30 people standing around wanting to play. Same deal with roulette. Open another table already. The slots were decent for a small table but that was the only thing you could really play. Overall I have to give the hotel average at best. The hotel is on a beatuful beach and seems to have potential to be great but needs a lot of work to get there. Pretty sure we wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Lonewolf15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in need of a relaxing vacation. We typically stay at rental properties to avoid the hassle of crowds, but this time we chose to hit a resort to be pampered. Normally used to taking care of ourselves, we were resort newbies and thought Rio Mar was a nice change. The staff were always helpful and accomodating. We upgraded to a junior suite with an ocean view. The room was nice and comfortable. When my wife noticed there was no hair dryer in the bathroom, a quick call to the desk took care of the problem. The beach is wonderful! Mostly clean (when guests would pick up their trash!) and spaceous, the beach was a great morning activity. The constant breeze blowing in kept the heat and humidity at bay, creating a very relaxing soak in the sun. For the afternoon, we moved to the adult pool (very nice concept - family pool with the kids can enjoy the freedom of play while adults looking for more of a quiet escape can enjoy their own pool). The Tiki Bar attendants would pass by occasionally giving you an opportunity to partake in a cool beverage. The pool has both sunny spots as well as comfortable shaded areas with very comfortable lounge chairs in which to fall asleep in :) The restaurants were not bad, if a bit pricey..but hey, whaddya expect, its a resort. Palio, the italian restaurant was very tasty. The Tiki Bar had some nice selections of bar food. We are not picky eaters, so we were content with the food. Gift shop came in handy for drinks and snacks as well as the standard trinkets to take home for friends and family. Got some great bargins on clothing. All in all, had a great time and will look to return in the future with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: lammyoo
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was supposed to be oceanfront, however it was a view of the parking lot. The sheets and pillow cases also smelled of mildew, there was dust and hair all over the place, and there was water all over the floor because the a/c was not functioning properly. For a family of four the room was way too small. I went down to the front desk and addressed the situation and they said they would give us a call. When thye didn't, I went down again and met with the room controller and he was kind enough to give us an upgrade to a junior suite. Although it still didn't meet our expectations, considering its description from Costco travel, it was much much better than the "ocean-view" room. Overall, the beach was the best part but the water was brown for the last two days. Old San Juan had horrible traffic and really narrow streets and it was extremely difficult to find anything but the fort was amazing. It is definitely best to rent a car, however there are not many local restaurants in the area and it is difficult to find anything. There was also no surfboard rentals which was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the resort!”
Reviews.Author: Travellover085
Reviews.Content: I have read several negative reviews of this resort, but our family had a great time there. We have three children, ages 6, 11, and 14. We found that the resort accomodated the needs of all three. Our ocean view room was nice, but small. Fortunately, the hotel provided us with a roll-away in order to accomodate us. The grounds were beautiful and added to our enjoyment of the resort. To those who complain that the food and transport was expensive--it's the carribbean and you are staying at a big resort. I found the prices consistent with other resorts. My advice--rent a car, eat off property, and enjoy the local restaurants and sights.
