The pool is great for children and the beach was not crowded at all. The staff was very friendly . We booked a snorkeling trip through Dragonfly and realized that we could have saved money if we had booked it directly. But we did LOVE the snorkeling trip. I would recommond this hotel for the beauty of the resort and the value of the room. But don't just stay on the resort--the island has a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous”
Reviews.Author: thedelitefulone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Wyndham Owners and we were offered a free stay at Rio Mar. We had the BEST TIME!!! All hotel staff went out of their way too assure excellence!! We definitely plan on visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy concierge and front desk”
Reviews.Author: JtravelerDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: The stay started with a rude front desk attendant (Carol V.) who was hostile toward us for asking simple questions. The rooms are old and obviously patched together with some paint. They are clean though. The housekeepers were stars among the other staff. The valets were the friendliest and most helpful folks there. We tried three times to get the concierge to schedule (or even get information about) mountain bike tours. They never bothered to call us back, despite their promises to do so and our personal visits to the desk. On another occasion we requested information about an attraction and the concierge took the next 10 minutes to pull information from the internet and hand me the printed informaiton without any explanation. To add insult to injury the last two days of the trip I suffered from massive amounts of sand flea bites from the beach. Overall, I would say stay in Old San Juan and you will enjoy Puerto Rico. A day trip to the rainforest (El Yunqe) is a great idea, too.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelKingIllinos
Reviews.Content: After having a horrible experience on Spirit Airlines and the $150 transportation cost, it was refreshing to see such a beautiful view of the Ocean when we first entered the lobby of the resort. During check-in we were shocked to find the resort holds $100 per night on your card. Lucky to find out you can charge meals and drinks to your room and it would subtracted from the amount held at check out. The view from the room was very beautiful as well thanks to Caroll at the front desk for upgrading our room. The one thing we did not like about the room was the bathroom had the last guests hair all over the floor. DISGUSTING!! Which did not get cleaned up after each day. We found the restaurants were very pricey. Marabella was one of the restaurant that was disappointing. We had a fantastics breakfast buffet that cost us $45 and attempted to have lunch there and was greatly disappoint with the food portions and quallity. We explained to the server why the food was not good and he brought out the manager and the head chef and wanted us to explain why we did not like our meal which we were brutally honest. We were not charged and went to the Tiki Bar for great burgers and six drinks which cost us $47. Marabella would have cost us $50 PLUS with no drinks and we would have still been hungry. Our 10 tips to maximize your fun would be 1. Rent a car, 2. Check your room for cleanliness, 3. Be prepared for your $100 per night hold on your bank card during check-in, 4. Rent a frig to keep down your costs, 5. Only eat at Marabella for breakfast, 6. Eat at Richie's, Casino cafe has great pepperoni pizza $12 and Tiki Bar. 7. Ask for drink specials. 8. If you get a $100 debit card cash it at the casino instead of the ATM. 9. Use the beach as often as possible because pools are nasty and crowded. 10. Seek a tour that is cheaper than ones offered by the hotel. Overall we had a great time and we are looking forward to our next vacation now that we know the tricks of the trade. By the way the SanJuan airport will not allow you to purchase liquor when you arrive only when you are leaving. Have fun pick up drinks and snack and have a blast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go Here!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAZTeacher
Reviews.Content: I have a five page draft roughed out for this review but let me give it to you in just a few words. $232 per night for a room that was supposed to be 50% off. No amenities for this amount. Internet $15/ day. $22 per person for breakfast. Have a rental car, $15/day parking fees. Scum on the adult pool. Kids in the Adult Pool. Five eating establishments with three closed. The least expensive meals in these would cost the three of us (Me, wife, child) over $100. Trash in the halls which sat for days even after we had notified the desk. It appeared the halls and grounds were only cleaned one day a week (Thursday) in preparation for the weekend. Other things of interest; Electricity went out the first night we were there and came backon after a few seconds. Water went off with no warning in middle of our stay for almost 4 hours with no one able to give any information. Isolated, 3/4 mile from main road to gate, 3/4 mile from gate to hotel. Gate is the highest point of a steep hike in or out. On the plus side; staff was as courteous as they were allowed to be. IF you are trapped here, the best value is happy hour at the Tiki Bar. Drinks for $4.25 and you can get a foot long dog for $8 which will feed three people. The ocean was nice. But don't touch the beach lounges as the attendants will come and tell you to not touch them. They have to set them up. I have been a Wyndham's Trip Rewards member for a few years, but I will NEVER stay at a Wyndham Resort again. My calls to Customer Service have so far resulted in a case number and a representative telling me to 'enjoy' what was left of my vacation. When I called after I had returned, I was only able to leave a voice mail. Needless to say, I have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelhappenz
Reviews.Content: Let me give you a snapshot of my overall experience. Upon checkin, the door man would not open the door all the way for me--told me to come through one bag at a time. Seemed that everyone was changing rooms--including us. No functioning lock on the balcony door. Shower did not drain properly. The self service parking is a nightmare--have to bring your ticket each day to main entrance to be stamped. Today I was given a "gesture" to walk around--which I thought was extremely rude. Pool area did not have towels one day!!! All but one restaurant was closed during our stay--yet they promote their great restaurants. Also, be careful of the concierge desk. They are a separate company---Dragonfly--and seem to "push" certain restaurants. Also, the concierge charges much more for trips than if you book them yourself. The best restaurant we ate at was Ritchie's--very close to the hotel--yet they do not seem to endorse. Be careful of La Parrilla--they really pushed this one but food subpar and service horrific--located in crummy area. Overall, this hotel needs a BIG facelift and not worth the aggravation. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “I got married here and couldn't have dreamed it would've been more perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust83103
Reviews.Content: We sought out a place that would be a beautiful, memorable wedding because it was just the two of us. The only thing more perfect would've been to have had family and friends with us. The spa was AMAZING. The room was exquisite - we actually bought a Westin Heavenly bed after the experience. The view was beautiful. The food was great in each place we went. The people were SOOOO nice. Aileen Puerto, my wedding coordinator was wonderful and she and her husband were our witnesses. We got married at sunset on the beach. The gym was great. Our room wasn't quite ready when we got there, and the service people were so accomodating and great to us. My husband won $300 at the casino. I can't wait to go back and bring my daughter. We intend to renew our vows at 10 years. Thanks so much for making my dream wedding come true.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation 2 Years In A Row”
Reviews.Author: baboosmom
Reviews.Content: It seems as if when a lot of people write reviews, it is after a negative experience. I am happy to say that this is not one of them. We stayed at the Rio Mar in March for the last two years. It is a very nice resort and the people are quite nice and very accomodating. We enjoyed an ocean view room both times and the peacefulness and serenity each morning was amazing. I do recommend renting a car to get around easy. If you ask the staff for some good local places to eat, they will send you in the right direction. As with any resort, the food and drinks are pricey so we had a refrigerator brought up to our room for a mere 25.00 for the whole stay. The grocery stores are very nice and we purchased sandwich stuff, snacks and bererages to help keep our expenses down. Because the resort is directly on the beach, it makes it easy to go to your room whenver you want. There are 2 nice pools for both the family environment as well as the adult pool for those who just want to relax. They also have the best lifeguards around who pay the best attention to swimmers both in the ocean and at the pool. When you look out one side of the resort you gaze into the ocean, the other side a beautiful view of the rain forrest. We had such a good time the first year, we encouraged some friends to come along as well. They too had a great time and enjoyed the beautiful scenery as well as the relaxation we all wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, refreshing, a good place to unwind.”
Reviews.Author: WhyAmIStillworking
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights looking out on a beautiful ocean setting...wonderful. The hotel had positive and negative factors associated with any hotel when being subjective. It had a very nice beach with waves easy to handle. The grounds were very well kept as where the rooms. The employees were helpful and easy going. The location is what we preferred, that is being away from the San Juan congestion. We rented a car, which I do suggest to get around some in some of the best highways I have encountered away from the U,S, As for the negatives, the parking cost $25.00 daily, which greatly offsets the low cost rental of a vehicle. I thought this was out of control. The drinks were close to twice what is charged at most other locations, an adjustment is needed in this area. Finally, the menu for breakfast and lunch could use enhancement. However, it was not bad. Overall, keep in mind that travel is an adventure. There will be bumps to overcome where they are smooth out after one day at this hotel...I would recommend this location to a friend without reservation. A nice place when taken as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: pmbailey
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible! I didn't have hot water in my room the first day there. The hot tub was, is, and will remain broken. They kept me in a room for 5 HR trying to sell me a property that will never be built! A reliable resource told me their "future" resort that will be built next year is and has been frozen because of LAWSUITS agains Wyndham! All the food on the resort was sub par. The rooms were dirty and out-of-date. Another couple I met there said their toilet was BROKE for 3 DAYS until they finally demanded to be switched to another room! They try to charge you for everything! They were allowing kids to roast marshmallows at a fire pit for free, but now that charge $5 for 3 marshmallows, 2 graham crackers, and some chocolate, they nickle and dime you to death! They have tons of iguanas that scavange for food at the pools. They actually jumped in our food while we were having a picnic. The pool was also saturated with iguana poo! Oh, and I guess the hotel has a hard time keeping the pool at correct chemical levels! They drenched it with chlorine in the middle of the day! It was so bad that the smell made my nose burn! There are so many other options to stay in PR. Go to a B&B in the rainforest, go to El San Juan Hotel, go anywhere else. There is nothing surrounding this hotel. You have to rent a car to go 30 min in either direction to go anywhere, then the hotel charges you $20/day for parking. You should check out Fajardo's hotels also, there's tons of activities there! This was not a resort! This was a mid-grade hotel! Just stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative whiners, Rio Mar Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: gowanus
Reviews.Content: After reading 30 or so reviews, mostly negative, I planned my trip to this amazing resort. I did not rent a car, rather I took several tours that i booked privately ( less expensive than the hotel bookings). I also chose not to eat at the premier restaurants at the resort. Instead, I ate at the beach side burger bar and at the lobby coffee shop neat the casino, both were reasonable and the food was enjoyable. This is a resort, of course they aim to make money, wisely choose how you will spend your money. The resort is in the mountains, it is not in San Juan, this I knew when I booked and researched the trip, therefore, it is rediculous to complain that is is not near anything, it is also untrue, it is near the rainforest and reasonably close to Fajardo where boats leave for amazing snorkling and other aquatic trips. Renting a car is advisable for those wishing to explore more of the Island. The roads are wide, multi lanes and the driving usually doesn't exceed 55 mph. If you don't rent, you must plan carefully or you will spend a lot to see the sights away from the resort.The onsite spa was amazing, I actually will return to this resort in part for more of the excellent spa treatment. This resort is well maintained and customer friendly. I found the staff professional, curteous and helpful, I suppose if you approach the staff with respect it will be returned, unfortunately, many travelers have a colonial mentality that usually results in rebuke. Before you travel, join the Wyndham club ( its free), you wil be eligible for free room upgrades if available. I got an amazing Ocean View room that really made the expierience that much more refreshing. The beach was ok, the water was warm and reasonably clear, some sea weed and organic matter due to close proximity to the rain forest, the snorkling trip led to clearer water, I used The Fun Cat company, and Caprain Jim provided good information about the island for meals etc. Ri0 Mar is a great place to relax, unwind and enjoy. It is not club Med and it is not Manhattan.It is a first rate resort tucked away in the mountains. Please do not believe those who found this resort to be a rip off, it is what you make it, I didnt want to pay for a $40 meal so I went into town and got an $18 meal. Plan this trip and you will enjoy it immensely. MDM, Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: ksuvixen
Reviews.Content: this was the worst hotel ever and almost ruined our vacation. they over charge so watch your bill closely and its not near anything. the worst customer service ever.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience all round- with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: LifeinOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 days in February. On the whole we had a very pleasant experience and would recommend the hotel to others. For a complete description of the hotel and its pros and cons please see my extended review at http://bit.ly/1Nc4N

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: PeggyP49
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience in Puerto Rico. We rented a car at the San Juan airport and the hotel was easy to find off of Route 3. Check in was fast and the staff was wonderful. We found everyone to be very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and we had a wonderful view. There were 9 iguanas on the lawn below our patio one morning and I got some good pics. We only ate at the hotel once and that was the breakfast buffet ($20 pp) and it was awesome. Other places we ate that we really liked were Don Pepe's in Palmer, the little town on Rte. 3 at the end of the road from Rio Mar. Their flank steak was really good (we ate here twice) and the coconut flan was to die for. We had breakfast at a little bakery in Palmer (can't remember the name) that had really good pastries, donuts and you could also get other breakfast items like omelets. We ate at a really good seafood restaurant at the marina in Fajardo that was really good too. We tried a lot of native PR dishes and loved the food. We spent a day shopping in old San Juan and touring the forts. Our favorite trips were to El Yunque Rainforest where we took the trail to La Mina falls (a lot of steps down the mountain and back up but it wasn't too difficult). My daughter was 4 months pregnant and was able to make the hike just fine. Also, the higher you go up the mountain, the cooler the breezes are so it wasn't that hot. We also went on a kayak trip from the Fajardo marina to the big bioluminescent lagoon. This is something everyone who visits PR shoud not miss. One of the coolest things we have ever done. The beach at the hotel was really nice and clean and not crowded at all. The swimming pool was huge and very pretty but we were so busy doing everything else, we didn't have time to try it out. My husband loved the golf course he played but was rained out the second time he wanted to play.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bethcl
Reviews.Content: Nice resort. Clean, quiet and relaxing. Adult pool very peaceful. The beach was fabulous. We rented a car at the airport. Stop at walmart on the way to the hotel to pick up a styrofoam cooler, water and soda/snack. There is a lot of traffic on route 3. The food and drinks are expensive at the hotel, but so are all nice resorts. The restaurant Palio is great! Expensive, $350 for 5 people but food great. Breakfast buffet nice also. Along rt 3 toward Loquillo there are rows of little restaurants. #2 La Parilla is fabulous- the best lobster we ever had. #60(the shops are numbered) was reccomended as well but we didnt go there. Dont let the appearance fool you- the food is great. Bakery at RT 3 & 968 highly rated! Rain Forest trip was wonderful. Wear sneakers and be weary if you're out of shape or elderly- alot of uphill walking but definitely a positive adventure. Parking for guests is $15.00 but is worth it in the end to have freedom and try other places. We had a great time and would return, but overall feel all inclusives are just easier.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Mrsbarbiedoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the ocean suite of the rio mar for my honeymoon.It was super delightful.This resort gives you the feel of a classic hotel,not contemporary,and it was super classy. THE ROOM The ocean suite had a living area with a couch (turns into a bed)and lounge chair,a business area (for computer usage),and a huge bed.It has lots of floor space,and a nice size flat screen.The bathroom had his/her sinks and my husband and I fell in love with the products (courtesy of bath and body works THE RESORT We took part in late night walks on the beach,kayaking to a nearby island ($55),snorkeling (rentals eq available in dive center,and the iguana feeding (11am daily).The resort is huge and well secured (guest access only).It is very close to "El Yunque Rainforest" (only the best place on earth) and I recommend taking a ferry/or private plane ride to culebra island to enjoy the 3rd most beautiful beach in the world,ferry/airport just 15 minutes away from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort.”
Reviews.Author: eightleggedtravelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Puerto Rico (Jun 16-21, 2009). We spent 5 nights at the Rio Mar resort and we had a wonderful time. The resort was clean and beautiful. The staff was warm and friendly. We booked our trip through CheapCaribbean.com and were upgraded to an oceanfront room even though our reservation was for an ocean view room and were checked in immediately when we arrived a few minutes after 3pm (check-in is 3pm). We had no trouble with our keys, our room was clean and stocked with wonderful toiletries, bottled water, and comfortable bedding. The pool area is lovely and there were plenty of chairs and umbrellas for everyone. The service at the pool is a little slow but we didn't mind since we were on vacation. The drinks and food are priced high as others have stated but it is a resort so I did expect to pay more. It's all about what the hotel can offer you so you don't have to go out so they charge accordingly. We went to the liquor store down the street and bought snacks at the Amigo (owned by WalMart) grocery store. We didn't have a bad meal but wouldn't say any of the restaurants really "wow"ed us either. We ate out a lot and it enabled us to see more of the island and experience the local culture. We would definitely go back to Puerto Rico and would definitely stay at the Wyndham Rio Mar again. I do recommend going to Old San Juan and seeing the forts (go to San Cristobal first for free parking and ride the free trolley to El Morro) - the best food is in the food court next to San Cristobal -it's where all the locals were eating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but be prepared to pay $$”
Reviews.Author: djfoster
Reviews.Content: The resort was stunning and beautiful but the resturaunts and activities are priced too high! We spent 57 bucks on lunch that included 1 hamburger, 1 hotdog, 1 salad and 3 soda's. Price for a bucket of beer is 30.00 - our recommendation is to rent a car, go to the local market (there's a super Walmart close) and buy soda, water, snacks. Having the car will save you big bucks on a taxi. We did the snorkel day trip through the on site dive shop and it was one of the best things we did while visiting. We found a local tour guide and hired him for the day. He picked us up at 9 and returned at 7:00 PM and was our local tour guide stopping anywhere we wanted. Don't be afraid to stop and the kiosks and do try the Lechon Asada (local spit roasted pork) and have a fresh fruit smoothie at any of the fruit kiosks. His charge was 120. for the entire day!! The hotel wanted 240. and that was only a 4 hour tour. He took us to Old San Juan and El Morro and some local places he grew up going to. We even stopped at one kiosks and had some fried fish and played a game of pool. The resort doesn't tell you that you can use outside tours. Our was Nicky Tours and our driver was Fransisco [--]. He is a very honest family man and is very informative. He was even willing to buy us dinner and deliver it to our hotel...Highly recommended. Tell him Jim, Deb and Jacob said Hello.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort but extras were too expensive”
Reviews.Author: TomToPrepare
Reviews.Content: The room and resort were excellent. Only problems were 1) three requests until the fridge arrived 2) Hot water disappeared a few times during our stay 3) played in the casino for over an hour and never offered a drink 4) Drinks at the pool were way over priced - $9.50 for a rum/coke. Ask for the drink of the day ~$6. They would have had much more of my money if food/drink were only expensive instead of unreasonable. We had most of our meals outside the resort. This would be an issue if you don't have a vehicle. Housekeeping was nice and came by every night to see if we needed anything. The hotel was no where near full. The staff was very nice and helpful. Great place to stay by the pool or on the beach. I didn't think the IsaMar Bakery was all that impressive but there is a small store at the intersection of Rt3 to pick up food and drinks. We kept milk/OJ in the fridge and had cereal on the balconey in the morning and had cold beer ready all day long. Palmers bakery (across route 3, right after the gas station, then on your left) is a very quick drive and was a better bakery (and lunch place) than IsaMar. There is a shopping area (Walgreen, etc) if you make a left onto 3 and go down about 10 minutes. On the way (about a minute away from the light at 3) there is a fruit stand on the right that will cut open a fresh coconut and stick a straw in it for $1.50. We did the Bio-Bay tour and it was OK but since you can't swim it wasn't as much fun. Make sure you get good to/from directions. El Yunque is a quick drive from the hotel but do it early to beat the tours. We only saw one other car at 8:30am but on our way out we saw many tours vans coming in. Much easier to get pictures, etc if you are the only one there. At the hotel, if you face the ocean, go right about 1/3 mile and there is a river that flows into the ocean. We weren't looking for nightlife, just a relaxing vacation on the beach and a few sights. Great relaxing resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great staff”
Reviews.Author: hd1352
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Rio Mar. I found the resort to be top notch. The staff were always very helpful and friendly, especially the restaurant staff who were friendly, funny, and very responsive. The adult pool is great ~ very relaxing and the chairs are very comfortable. The downside is that it rains and the cushions get and stay wet but it keeps you cool while laying out. Do keep an eye out for the igauna ~ they are a little pesky but entertaining to watch. Many have complained about restaurant prices. I guess it depends on where you are from and what you are expecting. Coming from a big city and having been to several resorts, I found the prices to be completely reasonable and the food to be very delicious and presented beautifuly. However, several of the restaurants were closed, which was a tad disappointing. We ventured to Kings Seafood one night and I wasn't really impressed. My dinner cost almost as much as a similar dinner at the resort and was no where near as tasty. Also, we did stop at a Wal-Mart about 5-10 miles from the resort to get some water, snacks & sunscreen. Great trip at a beautiful resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Amax99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick 5 night vacation for my wife's 30th. A friend was the GM here, but unbeknown to me, had actually left the hotel a month ago. It made no difference, we had a great time. Our only complaint would be that the staff was indeed hit or miss at times. The beach staff was pretty much non existent. The staff at the Palio's was PHENOMENAL. Per the hotel itself, it is very good, not great, but keep in mind this is not billed as a 5 Star, Ritz type property. Yes, the beach is not white sand, and yes the ocean can get murky, and outright brown after a bad rain storm, but this all comes with staying right next to the rain forest,and literally a quarter mile from where the river runs into the ocean. If it rained, it would only last an hour or so then usually clear out to sun the rest of the day. The pools were great. I was absolutely blown away by the food at this resort. 5 star quality, especially at Palio's. Just amazing amazing food. We brought a case of wine down, and the most we were ever charged for a corkage fee was $20, and frequently there was no charge at all. Our room was very comfortable, beds were 5 star quality, housekeeping did a great job. The balcony's on every room are a major plus. When it rained, we ordered a bottle of champagne sat outside and watched the storm.

Reviews.Title: “Service is awful”
Reviews.Author: madhupurwala
Reviews.Content: I and my wife went for Wyndam conference being held at this hotel from May 27 thru May 29th. We had requested for aroom with a view, but were offered a room without a view. On our insistence for a view room the manager said rooms were assigned by the conference organizers. We got hold of the organizer but the denied having to do any thing with room assignment. Finally, they assigned room No. 1107, which was on the side of the building facing the beach, but no view. On 28th hot water stopped, inspite of our complaints nothing was done. We passed the day with cold showers. The room was in disrepair. Safety door latch to balcony was not working, clock was not working. This hotel cannot be called a luxury resort. I will never recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: tapinatl
Reviews.Content: the grounds were beautiful and the staff outside was excellent. Staff inside was hit or miss. Long waits at front desk. Also, there were 2 concierge and a tour guide chatting for over 10 min's before I finally gave up and walked away. I observed the 3rd concierge providing excellent service to other guests. Shimo's was very good for dinner - tender calamari with a nice spicey kick and the shrimp ceviche with excellent .. very light with delicious fresh flavors. The Flan served through room service was excellent. I would also highly recommend Glenda at the spa. Her deep tissue massage was fabulous and wonderfully relaxing. (make your reservations asap..not a lot of staff for multiple appointments)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suts22
Reviews.Content: Great Resort..wonderful view..helpful and polite staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Poodles65
Reviews.Content: Checked it very late but there were several cheerful staff waiting to check me in as well as a supervisor who took care of notifying the bell desk the next morning regarding my missing checked luggage which was going to be delivered to the hotel the next day. Quickly checked me in and advised that the ERL cafe (next to casino) was open until 11:30pm so if I was hungry I could go there for a snack or order room service. The room was on the 6th floor, facing the ocean. Large room with two beds, large closet area with secure safe, iron, 2 robes, desk with wired internet, flat screen TV with loads of channels. There wasn't a fridge but an area to put a fridge (rent one), 2 bottles of water (replaced every day, but leave a tip with a polite note and they will leave you 3-4 bottles). Coffee and tea (Wolfgang Puc) and the bathroom was large, with everything you need including Bath and Body works amenities (shampoo, conditioner, shower lotion, shower cap, cotton balls, q-tips, moisturizer, mouthwash and cooling gel for after the sun). This is the most amenities I have seen at a hotel in quite a while. Including a bath soap and face soap. Our room had a balcony with two chairs and a table, in the early morning we had sun and shade after 11:00am. Restaurants we visited was Mirabella's and the ERL cafe - both where reasonably priced for a resort (not sure what others are comparing it to, calling it expensive - I'm guessing they haven't stayed in 4 or 5 star hotels) Room service was quick and food was hot. Also ate at the Tiki bar, again, good service and great quality food - reasonably priced. They have drink specials - ask concierge when everything is. I had a $10 drink, but there must have been 4-5 oz of alcohol in it, one was enough for me! The beach was gorgeous! I spent some time in the pool, both adult and the regular pools, but only in the evenings, during the day, I was at the beach. Tide is on the stronger side, but the water was like bath water - so warm! Was it crystal clear, no, mostly due to the tide, but the sand was soft and not a sharp rock in sight! There were beach attendants who would bring you a chair (s), umbrella's and drinks! By 5:00pm they started to "shut down" the beach due to the Turtles nesting season. I really don't understand what others have complained about. Have travelled alot and this resort is one of my best hotel experiences. Service was wonderful and sincere. There was no need to leave the resort, but so much to do - beach, pool, casino, spa, golf, water sports, tours, etc. Can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful, Reasonable Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dumdum0729
Reviews.Content: My husband and I debated our vacation for months before we decided to book our trip to Puerto Rico. We found an amazing deal on CheapCaribbean.com and booked our trip to the Rio Mar. The resort itself was beautiful although it did have some wear and tear. We also had issues with our room keys but as you find out as the vacation goes on, you either need to wiggle the handle or pull the door in. It took anywhere from 1 - 10 scans to get it open. It doesn't pay to call anyone as it take the staff a while to respond to requests. Better just to keep scanning! Even though the beach wasn't white sand, it was still gorgeous. The weather was gorgeous although we had more waves than the other side of the island due to the time of year. But we were still able to swim unlike our last trip to Mexico. The spa was nice as well and I highly recommend a stone massage - Juan was fantastic! We decided to rent a car which was one of the best decisions we made. It allowed us to tour the island at leisure and gave us more freedom from the resort. The downside is that in order to park at the resort, there is a $15/day charge for the parking. It also required you to get a validated ticket at the front enterance every time you wanted to leave which was a small pain but easy to get around. The food at the resort is what I expected - not amazing but good. The Italian restaurant was our favorite. We also split the wraps that were served at the cafe next to the casino - they were good and helped to keep costs down some. There was also the Isomar Bakery on the left side of the road as you turn onto the road to the resort. They had really good & very large breakfast sandwiches and pastries. They also have pizza and lunch sandwiches - they never disappointed and the cost was extremely reasonable. Antonillos was also good for more local cuisine. A lot of people mention Richie's but the only thing great about it was the view. Food prices were the same, if not more, than the resort itself. We also located a liquor store at the corner on the right hand side which helped keep our drinking costs down. As a side note, my husband went on 2 dive trips while at the resort. The dive master was great and extremely helpful. He had a lot of recommendations for restaurants too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ric0suave
Reviews.Content: I was at this resort from 5/20 to 5/25. We had a great time (4 of us) even though we were there for a short time. I do agree that the drinks and food are expensive, but what should people expect when they are in vacation. I hear too much complaining about the prices, staff, parking, and rooms at this resort. I had reserved 2 different rooms and check in was a breeze even though we were given 2 full size beds in each room. We were escorted by the very polite and informative bell boy who voluntarily went down stairs to the front desk for us to have our rooms changed because we wanted a king size bed for both rooms. After about 10 minutes the bell boy returned with our new room # and keys. the view was horrible but we as long as we had a nice comfortable room we were happy, unlike other people complaining in here about their room view. The resort plays live music on Friday and Saturday nights at the bar in the main lobby. A good amount of people usually gather up there to enjoy the music and drinks. All the staff was very polite except for one parking attendant who seemed stressed out every time we went to have our parking ticket validated. You do need to rent a car since the resort is isolated from night life and restaurants. Parking is $15 per day and I do wish it would have been free it is no big deal to pay $15 a day for it. The pool was nice and warm throughout the day. The pool is open 24hrs, yet no staff will be present around the pool until around 8AM to 6PM. The drinks at the pool bar are water down and somewhat expensive but like I stated before what do you expect while on vacation? Do visit Old San Juan since there are good shops there to buy souvenirs and good restaurants. I do recommend going to "Raices", which has amazing PR food there and located right in the middle of the shopping stores in Old San Juan. If you are going to visit "El Morro" in San Juan there are 2 different forts that look the same. One is called the castle of San Cristobal, you can park there for free and pay $3pp to see the castle of San Cristobal or pay $5pp to see the "castle of San Cristobal" and "El Morro" which is about 1/2 mile from each other. There is a free trolley that takes you from San Cristobal to El Morro. That same trolley pretty much takes you all around Old San Juan and is totally free. We took the trolley while shopping and went around trying to see which restaurant to eat. NOTE: if you do park in the castle of "San Cristobal" and go shopping in the nearby shops they do close the parking lot at 6PM and you will get towed and pay a fine of $125. So make sure you get your car out the "San Cristobal" parking before 6PM. Do go to the Bacardi Rum Distillery since they give you a tour of their place and even provide a few free good drinks at their bar. Any questions or directions you might have regarding directions ask the Wyndham activity desk located in the main lobby (located across the check in desk in main lobby). I recommend going to "El Yunque" rain forest since there are amazing views of the rain forest and waterfalls. Make sure your car is fueled up before you go into the rain forest since the uphill drive up the mountain drains your gas tank very quickly. Make sure you have your gym shoes while in the rainforest. Another good restaurant which is located towards Fajardo is called "Todo Coco" which all there drinks and pretty much all their food is made of coconut. Amazing restaurant and good desserts. Another good restaurant is called "Don Pepe" which is not to far from the resort about 1 1/2 miles going towards San Juan which was also very good. If you rent a car w/ a GPS be careful since those GPS devices are outdated and might not show all the current restaurants of attractions one is seeking. Overall, The trip was very good and the resort very clean and staff is very polite if they are approached in a human way instead of kicking and screaming demanding to have it your way. And I saw a lot of grown ups acting like babies for simple reasons of not having enough towels in the room. By the way, room service is daily if you choose to have your sheets and towels replaced. I recommend leaving a nice little tip for the room service people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Fabulous Trip!”
Reviews.Author: dozias
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews on here and I'm a little shocked. I stayed here at the beginning of May with a friend and we had a wonderful time. The reviews about it being costly is correct. You can't eat any meal for less than $50 for 2 people and the drinks are a bit high but the service and employees were wonderful and we expected the pricing being at a nice resort. You could certainly take a short taxi or rent a car to get some wonderful local food for very cheap. We booked our trip through Cheapcarribean.com and had no issues with that. Our transfer from the airport was included and the driver was very friendly. When we arrived at the hotel at 9am, we asked if we could possibly check in early. They had no problem with this and sent us to our room. However, when we got back from breakfast they were cleaning it - apparently it wasn't ready when we threw our things in there - so we went down to get another room. That room wasn't ready either so finally on the third try we did get a wonderful room on the 7th floor. They gave us free breakfast and a credit of $100. They were very friendly and we were fine with it since we were checking in 6 hours early. The rooms were nice, we had a lovely view of the rainforest and the beds were extremely comfy! The resort is just gorgeous. We loved the pool areas and the bar outside. The adult pool was very relaxing and quiet with very comfortable lounge chairs and the other pool was fun if you wanted a change of scenery. They have a water slide, volleyball net in the water and fun things happening throughout the day. Watch out for all of the iguanas around the pool. We thought they were very sweet and even fed them one day, however, some people were so mean and would chase the poor things. They didn't bother you if you left them alone though. We loved Xavier's special cocktails at the bar outside! The spa was nice as well, although we have had better massages but it was nice to relax and be pampered. We also tried most of the restaurants and had wonderful meals every time. We also took a couple tours through the hotel. We did the rainforest tour as well as the Bacardi tour and had a great time on both. The tour guides were both entertaining and very informative. Everyone we came across was very friendly and helpful. We also rented a car for the day from the hotel. I would definitely reccommend renting one ahead of time from the airport. We paid $90 for only one day! Old San Juan was beautiful, we definitely recommend going there for dinner or to shop. Definitely go to Riaces for authentic Puerto Rican food - it was amazing! All in all our trip was fantastic! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: cmjames3
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Rio Mar. The view was amazing, right on the beach! The beach in this area was really clean and their pool areas were big and also very nice. Drinks & food were very expensive. But otherwise, we were very happy with everything. The staff was very helpful and the resort is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Weather, Beach & Water Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Krich4
Reviews.Content: We (11 of us...just returned), trust me when I tell you.....this was by far the worst vacation ever!!!! Plain & simple, if you are looking for a beautiful beach it's not here. The sand is brown, the water is MURKY, because the resort is soo close to the Rainforest. In addition to that, yes it's true what everyone has written about food & drinks, the average meal at Marbella ($19 pp---buffet, $8 for a beer & $12 for a cocktail....you must rent a car to purchase your snacks & cocktails. By the way, there is no night life what-so-ever. As you drive around, you will notice BARS on all windows of home & businesses. Oh, let's not forget the TINY CASINO...what a joke!!!! If it wasn't for the company that I was traveling with, I would not have made it. I am sooooo glad to be home, and I will do my research prior to the next trip. Glad to be home, Columbia, MD

Reviews.Title: “After a rough beginning, this resort exceeded our expecations!”
Reviews.Author: timrobb1
Reviews.Content: After reading through many, many reviews on this website, we decided to stay positive and we booked this trip through COSTCO travel and got a really great deal for four nights in an ocean front junior suite. We wanted a long weekend with no worries! We arrived, via JETBLUE, on Thursday, May 21st at 2:30 am. Yes, am! Upon check in, we were greeted by a lovely woman at the front desk. Very nice and check in was a snap. We were directed to our ocean front junior suite. Upon entering the room, we were impressed. It was big and very clean. However, once we openned the curtains to reveal our ocean front view, our mood changed. We were on the ground floor and you could barely make out anything in front of us (yes, it was dark - but you could see a building and a lot of garbage). It seems our room was next to the service entrance. I called the front desk and the woman was very nice. We walked back to the desk and she called her manager. He spent a good 30 minutes trying to get us a different room. Two attempts later (the other two rooms we looked out were not acceptable and he even agreed), we accepted a $200 resort credit and headed back to our original junior suite. It was 4:20 am by the time we got to "bed". The next four days were fantastic! The resort is BEAUTIFUL! Very, very clean and we found every single staff member wonderful. The resort was not very crowded the first two days (Thursday/Friday) but did pick up as the weekend arrived. Also, the room ended up being great - as you can see from the pictures - the view wasn't that bad. Yes, the service entrance wasn't ideal, but they did give us $200 in credit and we already had a $100 credit as part of our package. We found the adult pool perfect. It was great not worrying about kids splashing around. The seat cushions were very comfortable too. We are morning people so we would be out by the pool by 8 am each morning. The adult pool did fill up by around 10 am. But, everybody was great and no "fights" for a spot occured. The one thing that is annoying are the cabanas. YOu need to pay $150 a day for them - you get drinks and snacks - but $150 is just not worth it. They should charge $50 a day and they would rent them all! Just my opinion of course. The only annoying part about the adult pool was that the jacuzzi wasn't working. They were waiting for a part to come in. Oh yeah, watch for falling iguana. (see pictures) They would drop randomly into the pool. Also, they are EVERY place! It is really cool. The food at the resort is typical resort food. I am not sure why so many people found it soo expensive. Was it cheap? NO - but you are on vacation and you should expect to pay more. We averages $100 a night for dinner (salads, entrees, two drinks each). For breakfast/lunch there is a very inexpensive shop by the casino.. You can get a huge wrap for $8! They also have great coffee :)! Also there has been a lot of fuss about drink prices. We didn't think $10 for a frozen drink was crazy. Any other resort we have been to charges that much if not more. Also, each day they run a drink special for $6.50. There is happy hour each night at the outside bar too. The $30 for a six pack of beer is pretty reasonable too. Where else do you pay $5 for a beer? We did not enjoy the casino - very small and the people working the tables weren't the nicest. We lost $60 bucks and decided this casino wasn't for us. But others loved it. Cannot speak of an tours - we didn't do any. This trip was all about relaxation. We were at the pool from 8 am - 4 pm each day and it was great. I think this hotel was wonderful! They were painting the foyers and exterior during our stay so they are mainting it. I would happily go back! Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: 1geo
Reviews.Content: Flew in to San Juan and enjoyed a lovely long weekend at the Wyndham Rio Mar. The resort is beautiful, as was our room. In short, we experienced none of the problems noted by some reviewers: we booked a third party package (through CheapCaribbean) and our airport transfer and check-in were trouble-free. As for the resort itself, the high points are its size and the beauty of the grounds, the palm-lined pools (complete with a giant hot tub), the charming casino, proximity to El Yunque rain forest park, and the privacy of the beach. The resort borders a stretch of undeveloped forest so you can stroll along the beach for a quarter mile and feel like you're on a remote island. Perhaps because we arrived in the off-season, the resort had a quiet and spacious feel. The potential drawbacks are the distance from the city and nightlife, and the relatively high cost of the on-site restaurants. We booked a day excursion into Old San Juan for $60 each which was delightful - it's a 45 minute, comfortable ride each way. In short, if you're looking for a weekend getaway away from the city lights, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: JackieW1983
Reviews.Content: This is our third night here at Rio Mar, it's 3:30AM, me and my husband our at the "business cente," which is a tiny closet with 5 computers in it. The reason? In three nights, we are about to make a fourth move. The first room flooded when we took a shower, I called down to the desk and we waited about 30 to 40 minutes, then my husband called back for them to tell him that I told them that he was just showering with the curtain open. Then the maintenance finally arrived but there was so much standing water that he wanted house keeping to come and help clean it so he could tell where the problem was. We waited over an hour for someone to show up. All in all I stayed in the room almost 3 hours dealing with this. That afternoon, we went to see the Wyndam people(Wyndham has not fully taken over) thinking because we are owners that they might be able to do something. They did, they called down and had our room upgraded. Next step get help moving to the 5th floor, want to guess how long it took the bellman? 45 min to an hour. For that they compted our breakfast the following morning(remember that part for the next day). Finally on the fifth floor, we went to sleep that night, when we woke up the next morning there was standing water on the floor again! How? I'm not sure. My husband then went to complain and since we had already scheduled our excursion to the rain forest we didn't have time to sit around and deal with that. The front desk assured us that upon our return that afternoon, we would be given a new room and maintenance would check out our other one. Guess what? None of that happened. I had to go back to Wyndham and they had to call the front desk to make anything happen. The manager on duty told my husband, "We have already compted off your breakfast this morning, what else do you want?" Really? BTW, if you eat at the hotel for two, expect to spend a minimum of about $150 a day, she saved us a whopping $50 off of that. Wyndham did get our room moved to down the hall. Room #3-So far no flooding with this one, but we did learn an interesting tid bit fromt the maintenance man, only about 60% of the hotel is operational, the rest of the rooms have problems. So getting back to why we are leaving. The room they put us in has a connecting door with an inch and a half space underneath. Our "roommates next door," came in about an hour ago, along with the bellsman, he gave them a full run down on the room and then they unpacked. My honeymoon is officially over at this point, I get more rest relaxation at work. The location and view is the only positive thing I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Serves us right for being disloyal to Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lilac11wine
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I have been Hilton loyalists for a few years. However, we were looking for a quick, inexpensive, quiet beach weekend and chose the Wyndham over Hilton's El Con on a significant price difference and better proximity to the beach. The good: - Proximity to the beach; it's right there, with beach chairs and almost no local visitors - Hotel building and grounds were lovely - Some of the bar staff were exceptional - Room was comfortable and clean - Location -- 30 mi from the city and on the beach -- met our needs - On-site car rental was convenient for a quick trip to the rainforest The horror: - Because we booked through our airline's travel agency and not Wyndham, we were treated like second-class citizens. Here's how: * Airport transfers were included in our package, however, Wyndham refused to honor them and we spent several hours between repeat visits to the front desk and the tour desk and calls to the travel agency to get it straightened out. Not the best use of our time for a three-night stay. The Wyndham staff was unhelpful, rude and unapologetic during this process. * Our first room assignment was on the 7th floor. The bell cap who brought our luggage was unable to unlock the door. We waited in the hallway for nearly a half-hour until the bell cap came back, was still unable to unlock the door and had us re-assigned to a room on the 5th floor. One would think that following the inconvenience, Wyndham would have upgraded our room and, at minimum, apologized. If you thought that, you would be wrong. The 5th floor was more run-down than the 7th floor. Our room was on the same level as the roof of the casino. The mechanical noise and exhaust smell were awful. And, the room felt unsecured; on our third day, we saw people walking on the roof. See photo for awful view from the room. During our second visit to the front desk to address the airport transfer issue, I mentioned our dissatisfaction with our room and received a blank stare in response. * Because we booked through an agency, we were charged $40, yes $40, for internet service. Although we had called the front desk in advance of using the service and "confirmed" that there would be no charge, and although the signs at the front desk advertised that Wyndham rewards members receive free internet, we were charged $40. The front desk staff at checkout refused to remove the charge and told us that it was because we booked through an agency. * Like other reviewers have said, the food is expensive (meals ranged from $50 - $125 for 2) and the quality does not match the cost. Again, we were told that because we booked through an agency, we would not earn any Wyndham points for our out-of-pocket expenses or our hotel nights. The front desk refused to even take down our Wyndham number. * And, when we spoke with the concierge desk about booking a tour, their first question was had we booked through Wyndham. Then, coincidence?, none of the tours we requested were available or being offered. Would we go back? Maybe -- the adult pool and beach were *that* nice and the total cost was good -- but, we're more likely to stay brand-loyal to Hilton and not be nickled and dimed and treated like second-class citizens at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Mhogg
Reviews.Content: Luckily I went to priceline and got the room for $120. Itâ€™s a Very fancy hotel resort with lots of restaurants, big pools, and a casino, All right on the ocean. The problem is the restaurant are way too pricey and the food not that good. You have to be very careful when you swim in the ocean because of the currents. The hotel does not give you anything more than the motel 6. If you want a fridg you pay $25. If you want internet you pay $14/day and its not wireless. In fact the hotel does not have wireless internet. They do have free internet access in the lobby in a hot closet with 5 or 6 computers with the slowest connection ever. If you do decide to stay here anyway make sure you rent a car so you can book your excursions on you own. This resort is some what isolated. So if you want to get away it is difficult unless you have your own transportation. If you do book your excursions with the hotel you will pay about $100 more. Oh yea you have to pay $15/day to park . You also have to pay another $15/ day hospitality no mater how you book your stay. In conclusion go to priceline, book you own excursions and eat at the many good local restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Food”
Reviews.Author: fatcat50
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, but as others has posted, the cost of food and drinks were outrageous. Tip: you can rent a small refrigerator for $25 for your stay. You must rent a car; we didn't and had to take a taxi (expensive). We took a taxi to the local store and bought beer and soda's and put them in the fridge that we rented. The buffet for breakfast was 19.00 per person and the dinner buffet was 27.00 per person. To eat at one of the sit down restaurants it cost us over $100.00 per night. A frozen drink was 12.00 , $8.00 for a single beer and a diet coke was 2.68 for an 8oz glass. The really stick it to you on food.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we went, but not planning to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Girl7575
Reviews.Content: Overall: The resort was beautiful, and the grounds were gorgeous. I can't say that any of us would recommend this hotel, as it did not leave an impression that would bring us back. One thing we were disappointed on was there was no essence of Puerto Rico anywhere in the resort. We expected to see local artwork, or even local cuisine (trying local food on the buffet for a tourist would have been perfect), but there was nothing. They also had limited activities at the resort, or the activities were too expensive. Overall we all enjoyed ourselves in Puerto Rico, but none of us plan to go back. Service: Hotel has good service. The weekday staff are extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive. But the weekend crew was just the opposite. We noticed a drastic difference between the two shifts. One morning at the buffet we had the best waiter ever, and then for dinner at the Tiki Bar we were ignored for over a half an hour. It was never consistent. Also, the hours for some of the restaurants were not very "user friendly" for a resort. Price: Everything at the resort is overpriced. Breakfast buffet was $20 per person. A burger/fries were $13. Drinks were expensive for the amount you get, highly recommend buying alcohol at a grocery store and making drinks in your room, also might want to pick up disposable cooler as most rooms don't have fridges. We saw many coolers outsides rooms after everyoneâ€™s stay. Load up on snacks/beverages/etc as there is nothing close by except the kiosks, we went to one but most looked like they were about to collapse (very run down looking) and we didn't feel comfortable. Room: We had two rooms for two couples. The rooms were nice looking, but one room was cleaned very well everyday and the other was not. Because the rooms are not carpeted you will have sand in your room for your entire stay, they tried to mop it up on our second to last day of our trip, which wasn't helpful. Our view from the room was less than desirable (view of childrenâ€™s park and road to parking lot). Hotel was not fully booked so we thought that was pretty lousy to give us such a crappy view when obviously so many rooms were available. We can only imagine that it is because we booked through Hotwire and our rooms were "discounted", but this did leave us with bad impression of the resort. Note: Do not waste your time on their rewards card if you book through Hotwire, they told us at check-in that it is only valid if you book through the hotel direct, would be nice to say that somewhere when you open the card wouldn't it? Location: After visiting San Juan, we all wished we had stayed closer to the city. Rio Mar is out in the middle of nowhere. It was not very convenient. Highly recommend renting a car. The cost of the rental more than pays for itself when you add up all the additional costs of taking all the separate tours that the resort can set you up with. Misc: The casino is quite small and gets very crowded on Friday and Saturday. The adult pool was perfect, loved the no kids rule. The beach is very nice and quiet, only bummer was we had high wave advisories the whole time so not much swimming or water activities. If you rent a car PLEASE watch out for Puerto Rican drivers!! Most do not have fully functioning lights so braking is quite the experience. Think about the insurance for a rental car as most Puerto Ricans do not have car insurance or pay very close attention when you drive. Also, buy the full tank of gas from the rental place. MUCH easier and gas is cheaper when dropping off unless you do not use the full tank during your vacation. If you are limited on time, definitely don't waste your precious time on the timeshare presentation for a free something or other Tours: We highly recommend going to the El Yunque Rainforest â€“ we loved it. We really had a good time in Old San Juan. If you are limited on time, definitely don't waste your precious time on the timeshare presentation for a free something or other. Get out there and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Dino56
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the current state of the ecomomy has impacted travel as a whole and the resorts are feeling it badly. This resort was only 40% occupied during our visit. This resulted in the resort closing some of its restaurants. So with that being said, its almost a must to rent a car to enjoy some of the local flavor outside of the resort. PRO's - The resort staff are overly friendly, curtious and accomodating. I felt they went above and beyond to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. - The rooms, resort grounds and golf courses are clean and immaculate. - Avis car rental is on-site at the resort, so if you didnt rent a car and decide to ..... its an option which is what we did. CON's - As previous reviews stated "Food and Drinks are Pricey", but we expected it. - Guests are required to pay for parking when renting a car. The first 24 hours are free. I can see local visitors paying for parking, but not guests. - Pool cabana's - These need to be rented in order to use. Not one person rented a Cabana during our stay. Probably due to the high cost. As a result, they were empty. - Night life - Unless your a gambler there is absolutely nothing to do at night. - Casino - No Craps tables. - Excercise Gym - Very small, limited machines and free weights for the size of the resort. If the resort was at full capacity i feel that it may have been a problem to work out. We are beach and sun people and werent a fan of the beach and ocean. If your looking for the white beaches and caribbean water this is not the place for you. The sand is dark brown and the water is murky where the waves break. I do recommend seeing the Rain Forest which is 10-15 min away from the resort. The views are breathtaking. Also, the 45 - 60 min ride to Old San Juan is worth the trip. Make sure you wear walking shoes as the streets are cobble stone. Overall, the resort is beautiful and would probably go back primarily to play golf and site see. Secondary for beach and sun.

Reviews.Title: “A full service resort”
Reviews.Author: Seewalls
Reviews.Content: As Wyhdham time share owners, the Rio Mar Resort lived up to our expectations. The service experienced form all employees was attentive to our needs and quite genuine which was a huge plus for us. Our room was a standard hotel room, but we will say both of the queen beds were very comfortable. Flat screen TV was nice even though we didn't use it much (a good thing..we're on vacation, right?) Bathroom was very acceptable, good water pressure. All rooms appeared to also have a small balcony with a table and two chairs. We were oceanfront with a great view of the pool area with the ocean in the background beyond that. The location of the resort is ~45-60 minutes outside of San Juan Airport....We rented a car which would be our recommendation to other travelers as Taxi service to and from the airport alone is ~$80 each way.....Avis also has a car rental service on site at the resort, so you could taxi it to/from the airport, then rent a car for any daily excursions outside the resort. The resort is quite secluded and literally within minutes of the Rainforest which you have great views of right from the Resort itself. While the weather pattern was a bit stubborn throughout our stay, it really didn't have a major impact on our experience. It was raining at the Rainforest (not a surprise I guess...It's a "rain" forest after all), but not at the resort....So, we didn't have full sun throughout any day during our stay, but 80-85 degrees and periodic sun allowed for great relaxation throughout the day....Evenings at the resort can be spent walking the expansive grounds, hanging out in the outdoor jacuzzi's, at the bar or in the on-site casino... Would recommend a day trip to either Culebra or Vieques islands (ferry from Fajardo), the Rainforest, Old San Juan.... While we did most breakfast and lunch at the resort, we chose to dine away from the Resort. We did 2 nights at Richie's Restaurant just up the hill with shuttles service to/from. It's complete open-air dining with spectacular views overlooking the resort and Atlantic....One of the nights we dined with two other couples which made for a fun evening to say the least. The other mentionable dining was just past Richie's at the Terasco Monte Mar (Terrace on the Mountain overlooking the Sea)...Good food, reasonable priced, yet service was not quite Richie's.......We also had a lunch at one of the Kiosk's (#57) at Luquillo Beach.....Luquillo Beach is ~5 miles from the resort and a very nice beach at that...... Bottom line, enjoyed everything !! ....Maybe a little more sun would have been better, yet no complaints at all..... Will return !!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing... for such a pretty place”
Reviews.Author: divinedesire06
Reviews.Content: The cons: -VERY PRICEY!!! the food was extremely expensive and tasted average... nothing spectacular...some of the wraps were down right wrong.....even the puerto rican dishes were not any better than the ones in new york.....maybe except for the churrasco... definitely not worth the price... the room service will drain your wallet... do not order room service... For example: a can of sprite cost $3.50... they will charge you $3.50 for the delivery charge... and expect gratuity... lets say $1.00... which totals to $8.00 for a can of soda..... -drinks: from a mudslide to a beer... its $10 to $12 each .... a glass of orange juice is $4.50 -if you want a can of soda in the middle of the night, they DO NOT have a vending machine in the hotel -The hotel room does not include a refrigerator...you have to rent it for 25$/day -very limited service.... I wanted a massage out doors.... in order to do that... you HAVE TO rent a cabana which cost $150.00/day and a 50 min massage cost $120 -The $150.00 cabana will provide you some chips and a cooler with a few cans of soda and water.... NOT WORTH IT! -its about $50-$90 dollars to take a taxi anywhere.... -NO NIGHT LIFE, except for the small casino that is open until 2 am -it is completely far and secluded from the city, very boring for singles -it was very windy when we went the first week of may PROS: - the place is beautiful and clean - our hotel room is pretty, the mattress is soft and the sheets are silky smooth - very romantic for couples - the pool is nice, with a fun little waterslide - the palio (italian) restaurant is very romantic with live piano music - the beach is torquoise blue and the waves are strong, good for boogie boarding - the service is average, some more friendly than others - as for the excursions, we only visited the bioluminescent bay.... well it was cool for the first 5 mins you see the water glow when you disturb it... wasn't as exciting as I thought it was going to be.... definitely bring BUG SPRAY because you had to kayak through a dark rainforest to get to the lagoon.... it was ok.... definitely a new experience So I'm 50/50 with my trip.... but was really disappointed with how much they take advantage of your money.... if the prices were at least reasonable... My boyfriend and I would have had a fabulous time Here are some helpful hints: 1) Rent a car.... its worth it.... although parking is $20/day -rent the car at the airport, it cost 65$ one way to the hotel (with a taxi at the airport) and the hotel charges 37.50$/per person one way to the airport 2) Buy food and liquor at the grocery for your snacks and drinks during the day 3) buy a disposable cooler for your drinks If you rent a car, the excursions are 50% cheaper because you have your own transportation for example the bioluminescent bay is $54/per person vs $99 Plus, you get to eat outside of the hotel and SAVE SO MUCH MONEY! If I ever go back.... I'll definitely do things differently.... or not go back at all...

Reviews.Title: “Very well worth the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: TxVaction09
Reviews.Content: The resort was a true vacation for us. We did not know what to expect when we arrived. But when we walked in the resort sold its self. The food and drinks were expensive, but the service was wonderful. The location of the resort is 45 minutes from the airport but it is a true get-a-way. We recomment you take advantage of the onsite rent a car service. Money well saved. We would like to visit again because the first impression was a great one.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag....”
Reviews.Author: positanoinsept
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with our two small children (2 and 4) to the resort for 4 nights/5 days at the end of April. We rented a car so we could have them in car seats. It was an easy ride from the airport (although over an hour for the car rental process at Enterprise!). Also, I had read about how expensive the food was on site so we wanted options. Good thing, as the one nice dinner at the hotel with the kids was $175 -- and they shared a dish! Upon arriving we quickly discovered that our sink was stopped up. We told them right away and then left the room. When we returned a couple of hours later, it was still broken. We went back to the desk and told them again. They promised to fix it while we were out. Still not fixed when we got back from dinner so we were washing our hands and brushing our teeth in the tub. Annoying. The next morning we went out for breakfast for 3 hours and returned to find the maid in our room with towels covering the bathroom floor. The sink was still broken and we told the desk AGAIN (this time a little aggravated). We left again to go to the pool and returned 3 hours later for my youngest to take a nap. As soon as she laid down, in come the work crew to fix it. There goes the nap. At this point we were highly irritated and went back to the desk. I ended up sitting in the lobby with my 2 year old who was beyond exhausted at this point. She fell asleep on me, while I sat on a couch, for 3 hours. Needless to say, she slept well but it was extremely uncomfortable and totally inconvenient. I have a very busy job and needed to work on my laptop in my room, but was unable. While I was sitting there, a very nice manager came over and told me she had spoken to my husband. She was very, very apologetic and wanted to make it right. I told her I would talk to my husband and get back to her. Later, we found her and told her we felt a $200 credit to our account would make up for the entire day that was spent dealing with that. She was in total agreement that it was a fair amount and gave us her card, telling us to call if we needed ANYTHING. That woman knows how to smooth things over! The rest of the trip was much more enjoyable. Although a bit worn down in spots, the hotel is nice and seems clean. The pools were great and my kids loved the water slide and the beach. The landscaping is nice. We parked in the garage for $15 a day (the car rental was $100) but what we saved in being able to eat off site made it worth the cost. The one dinner we had (courtesy of that credit!) on site was very, very nice. We left other nights to eat at La Parilla at the kioskos (less than 10 minutes away) and another night at....I think it was called King Seafood (or something like that) in Luquillo, which was about 15 minutes. Both were fantastic meals and the restaurants were well suited for kids -- not to mention much less expensive. Not sure I would return but if someone I knew was going I would say overall, the price was right, as the four of us traveled, including air, hotel, car and all food for under $3000. Not bad for a family of four. I booked on Wyndham Vacations which was cheaper than the quote I got from a travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: S2H2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice stay at the Rio Mar. I will start by saying that I read several reviews on TripAdvisor before booking and was aware of the 'negatives' that other people highlighted in their reviews. I stayed for a week and was very impressed with the cleanliness of the resort and the outstanding service. All of the employees were extremely friendly and courteous. The staff at concierge were very professional and, for the most part, right on about their recommendations and directions to area attractions. The housekeeping staff were very attentive to the rooms - it seemed like every time we went somewhere (beach, casino, dinner, etc.) we would come back and our room was cleaned, towels replaced, and bed made. Yes, the walls are a bit thin but my recommendation is to let them know if you are not satisfied and see if they can switch your room. I was originally on the sixth floor facing the ocean and they had some renovation work going on near my room which became a bit noisy. I simply requested a different room and they were happy to accommodate my request. The change only took 30 min because they had someone come up and help us move luggage and bags. Others have mentioned that the drinks are expensive and I noticed this as well. We went to the local grocery store (Amigo at 3rd light east on hwy 3 or there's a wal mart and another grocery store at 5th light to east on hwy 3) to buy drinks that we could pack in a bag and take with us to the beach which was more cost effective. The local restaurants we visited and enjoyed were as follows: La Parilla (kioscos), El Jefe (kioscos), Isamar Bakery (at hwy 3 intersection - breakfast), Brass Cactus (Luquillo), Pasion Por El Fogon (Fajardo), and La Estacion (Fajardo). All very good. If you're headed to San Juan we ate at Parrot Club one night and Barrachina another night, both on Fortaleza St. and were very good. We didn't eat at the resort except for the last day when we had the buffet breakfast. A little pricy but it was very tasty and a good way to end the trip. We did a self-guided rainforest adventure in a half day. El Yunque is very unique and close to the resort so you should check it out. No need to plan more than half day though. We went to the casino twice during our stay and were there for 1 hr each time. The staff were professional and polite and the waiters offered to serve drinks. We went on a catamaran sailing and snorkeling excursion to a local island off Fajardo. This was a very well-organized trip - we had a great time snorkeling and swimming in the aqua blue waters. They also provide a nice lunch aboard and several fruits to much on later in the day. We tried out the bioluminescent lagoon kayaking with kayaking puerto rico. This was a great time and well worth the $45 per person. Tip: book direct rather than going through the hotel, they were selling the same trip for $99. The hotel pools were very nice and well-kept. The adult pool lounge chairs get used so you may want to get down there by 10 or 11am to get a seat. I don't have kids but it seemed like there was plenty for young ones to do between the iguanas, beach, activity pool, kids club, etc. They also have a decent exercise facility and a jogging path so bring your shoes if you'd like a workout. Very nice spa also but didn't try it out. Overall this was a great trip and we enjoyed the hotel amenities. If you are expecting a four seasons or some other palace environment then maybe you should look elsewhere. We were looking for a great vacation spot close to the adventure (rain forest, kayaking, snorkeling) with a clean room, nice pool area, good service, reasonably priced and we were pleased with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “A little remodeling and this place would be special”
Reviews.Author: OilIsle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location for someone interested in a more natural Puerto Rican experience. The location on the coast is beautiful, with views of the ocean on one side and the mountains on the other. El Yunque is just minutes up the road, and watersports are readily available. The resort doesn't offer much in the way of nightlife - just the casino and a lobby bar, which closes a bit early. It's well outside San Juan, so someone interested in a more urban experience may not enjoy it as much. The grounds of the hotel are immaculate, and the public areas are very nice. The rooms aren't bad, but are clearly in need of renovation. They show their age and are not up to the same standard as the public areas. The spa is nice, but a little too small - plan ahead, because everything gets booked quickly. The Italian restaurant, Palio, was quite nice, especially for a romantic evening; the beach restaurant and the atrium restaurant (Marbella) are highly overpriced and nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sergnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wyndham Rio Mar in early March. It is a nice property. We had a very nice oceanview room. I found the staff at this hotel to be extremely helpful and friendly. The amenities are good. The spa is good. The grounds and pools are well maintained. This was our second trip to P.R. so we did not leave the property. We spent our days swimming in the ocean and relaxing on the beach. The waves were pretty big, but we enjoyed it. The casino is not large, but a lot of fun. The restaurants are pretty good. The only complaint I have about the food was with the rice (white and yellow) which was not good (some grains were not fully cooked). However, the cilantro rice (green) is absolutely delicious. Shimas Restaurant serves a very good filet mignon in a ginger sauce. Overall, this is a great place to spend a few days, if all you are looking for is R&R. Getting around without a car would be expensive as the hotel is somewhat isolated. We did go to Rickâ€™s cafÃ©. The view is awesome, but the food was disappointing. Rick, however, makes up for it â€“ he is a very friendly guy with a warm personality. The only other hotel I can compare the Rio Mar with in PR is with El Conquistador, which was a Wyndham when we stayed there in 2000. El Con is a nicer hotel, but the staff at Rio Mar are, by far, more courteous. I rate Rio Mar a solid 4 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: living101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from Lake Charles, LA and we stayed six days at the Rio Mar and loved it. Our room was over looking the ocean with the most beautiful view. The beach was beautiful, staff was friendly and very helpful and the trip to the rain forest was unbeliveable, we hiked approximately 2 1/2 miles through the rain forest stopping at a water fall for a squick swim. Our over all stay was pleasant the food was a bit exspensive but over all we had a great time! If possible rent a car we found that getting around was better in a car.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, can't understand why anyone would ever go back!”
Reviews.Author: butlerdidit75
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my vacation from this resort and found the facilities completely disappointing. The overall feel when you first walk in is amazing, the facility is absolutely beautiful. After that is when the problems arise. First the check in to the resort isn't until 4pm, but in my case the room wasn't ready until 6pm. We had arrived at the resort at 1pm and had to wait 5 hours until we had a room that was ready for us. Second, they lured us to the resort with "special accommodations, still averaging well over $300 per night, to present us with a time share opportunity on properties that haven't even been started. We went to the sales presentation and salesperson Wilfredo informed us that the only people who don't buy are either stupid or too broke to actually afford the timeshare. I don't fall into either category. I found that when my spouse started asking pretty straight forward answers to obvious questions like can we see them, when does the construction start, and what is the cost we got generic poster board type answers. The only way they would give you any real information was if you committed to buying one and then they ran a credit approval on you. Sorry, that crap doesn't fly with me. Give me the answers that I want then, if I'm interested I'll allow you to look at my credit. Third issue, there was a total lack of quality staff the entire time we were at this resort.
