We watched as the waiters at the Tiki bar were very quick to wait on the single women in the bikini's while leaving the rest of us to fend for ourselves for drinks. This didn't just happen once, several times. We sat on the beach one day watching the waiter bring drinks to the girls next to us several times. We finally got him to get us one, after that he purposely walked to the other side of the girls as not to have to wait on us. Also, there is a sign by the cafe next to the casino that states buy one get one free on frozen drinks and mojitos at the Tiki from 5-7, but when you try and order them they tell you no those drinks are full price, over $10 a piece. The last day we actually took a picture and brought it down to the bar and showed them, they just shrugged there shoulders and said no. We got the bar manager to come over, we showed him the picture and he asked us not to tell the other guests of the resort and we could have the drinks at that price. I asked if we could get credit on all the drinks we had to pay full price on and he said no. This customer service was horrible at that bar. Forth, the casino was way understaffed. Don't hold your breath to get a drink in there as I think the cocktail waitress goes to Tahiti and back to bring your drinks. Over the course of the week we went to the casino 4 nights for between 2 and 5 hours a night. Twice we saw absolutely no waitress and the other two we actually gave the pit boss a hard time until he got one to serve us. The other issue in the casino was the lack of staff on the gaming tables themselves. At one point there were over 20 people waiting to play blackjack and the only thing the pit boss did was decide favorites on who would actually get on the one table when someone got up, not open another table. The worst part was they let people in when spots opened up at there discretion, not based on who was waiting the longest. Why not just open more tables up? Fifth, on the last day of our stay as we are on our way out of the resort to explore old San Juan, the front desk decided they wanted us to move our room. This wouldn't have been a problem except the basically wanted us to check out and then they wouldn't have another room ready for us until 4pm, which we already new at that point meant closer to 6pm. We were getting on a plane at 4 am, so it made no sense to get a room at this posh place for less than 10 hours. When we said that if they wanted that, to just cancel our last night of reservation they decided to let us keep our room for that last night and take our money. Positives of the resort are few, but include, Palio for dinner, the rooms are very small but clean, and the views are breathtaking. The negatives are overpriced, rude staffing, and poor advertising of what you actually get. My advice would be to stay away from this hotel, if you already booked, get food and beverages outside of the resort and bring them with you. Palmers bakery is right across route 3 and right at the gas station. Utilize the convenient store at the corner for as much as possible. Pick up a $6 Styrofoam cooler from there and pack it with ice for your beverages as sodas and water on resort are between $3.50 and $5.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - had it's hiccups”
Reviews.Author: bigmak05
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great: Good views, beautiful beach, nice pools, friendly staff, and all around good atmosphere. The hotel and resort really lends itself to people with children - there were tons! It was okay for adults only groups. Watch out for the food! This was our biggest expense of the trip. For the most part we ate at the resort. The Grill Room was okay but super expensive! They get you because instead of ordering and getting a full meal you have to piece together a meal (entrees, sides, salads, etc. were all seperate). Sushami was by far the best, pretty resonable sushi and great desserts. The Tiki bar for lunch as okay but still pretty pricey plus there wasn't that many tables to eat at. Marbella's was okay, much better food than The Grill Room but still about the same price point. Best suggestion would be to load up on munchies off site (get a cheap cooler if you want to refridgerate anything). Make sure you also try Richie's which is off site but they have a van that comes and picks you up and takes you back free of charge. I would recommend the Mofungo! Airport Transfer - we got burned on this one! - The website states that they provide transportation and when we called to confirm assured us they would be there, end of story. Well, happy to say they came through and someone was there to meet us for the shuttle. However, when we went to check-in for the shuttle they asked if we had a travel voucher. Being the first time we heard of this we said no and were told that if would cost $37.50 per person per way for the shuttle to the airport. So for two people round trip it cost $150!!! I found this to be outrageous considering gas was $0.50 per gallon. It wasn't like there was one or two people they had to pick up either, the van was always packed. Towel: The hotel is really great in that it provides free towels for pool use - the only problem was they were never any available. Out of the four days we were there we were only able to get towels once and even then we had to wait a good 20 minutes before we ever got them. The hotel was a great way to get introduced to island but I think I would go else were if I was to go back (unless I had several children).

Reviews.Title: “Private, yet vibrant resort”
Reviews.Author: janer188
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here during Spring Break and really loved the beach location and atmosphere. We found the best price by joining the Wyndham club(for free) and booking directly. When we arrived our room was upgraded and check-in went quickly. There are daily activities and iguana feedings. The beach is gorgeous and the 2 pools are beautiful(there's a slide in the non-adult pool.) It is apparent that the hotel is slightly older, but has been updated nicely. We were aptly and fairly warned about the extra expenses for everything from parking to room refrigerators and the high cost of food. We bought a styrofoam cooler at a nearby Walgreens for our room to keep our perishables in. We had a not so great dinner at the overpriced on-sight Palo restaurant. The Mirabela had much better offerings for a nice brunch spread. We used the cute Tiki hut for tropical smoothies and quick lunches by the beach/pool. Having a car will really enable you to experience more. The Rainforst is a mere 10 min. drive from the hotel- which is very easy to do on your own. The hotel charges a lot for their various tours. You can save a lot by doing a little research and booking directly a couple days in advance. We set up our own evening kayak trip with Akuadventures in glass bottom kayaks to see the bio-luminescent tour-highly recommended . We did a catamaran snorkelling trip with "Traveler"-they had the best price and offer snacks and lunch on board with a slightly smaller boat than the others tours. This makes the experience more personal and is a great family activity with children that can swim. Even those who do not wish to snorkel can enjoy the boat, the views or walk along the island beaches. This was my family's favorite part of our trip! Our favorite eats were:Las Vegas(5 min. away) where you can here the tree frogs chirping at night; and Dragonfly in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden fees!”
Reviews.Author: jjstudio
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Puerto Rico consisted of the airport losing our luggage the first day, then thankfully finding it 6 hours later, the hotel charged us an additional $30 a day for services! I love we found this hotel for an amazing price! The hotel is beautiful, and is in a great spot on the beach. However, when you first find out you have to pay $15 a day for self parking it is upsetting, then when you check out you find out there is also a 14% resort fee they charge per day depending on how much your room was for your trip! They say this charge is for the towels, room clean up, etc. The basic stuff a hotel does and never charges extra for. Absolutely ridiculous, and of course, no one tells you this in advance! Plus if you want to use the internet in your room, it is an additional $15 a day. Would I visit Puerto Rico again? Despite many of the rude people in the area, yes, but I may find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lush and Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Eric1955
Reviews.Content: The Rio Mar was our 2 day warm up for our 14 day cruise leaving out of San Juan. The hotel was booked without knowing anything about it and what a treat it was. The Rio Mar is located in the rain forest region on the North Eastern part of Puerto Rico and the builders carved out and landscaped a piece of heaven from a lush tropical rain forest. The dark sand originally threw me, but it just seams to attract those saught after says of February sun even more. The ponding surf on that corneer of the island was great fun to swim in and the 2 freeform pools beautifully refreshing. The local wildlife, (the iguanas) get pretty friendly especially when you have food in your lounger by poolside, Their claws are sharp and in their enthusiasm for your burger, might scratch you fairly badly. A little common sense goes a long way. They love lettuce so tannning with a piece of lettuce on your leg or 2 cucumber slices on your eyes isn't they best idea! (duh) Their are 3 excellent restaraunts on premises, (not the cheapest), with fantastic food and plenty of variety. You don't go to the Rio Mar for a cheap holiday, but you do go for a memorable one. Our room was very nice, but being on the first floor, our view of the ocean was obstructed by the lush vegetation; a second floor or above room would be preferable. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Period.”
Reviews.Author: Natalie R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Rio Mar and what a fabulous place. Only being about 20 minutes from San Juan and minutes to other towns, Rio Mar sits in a nice location. The resort is beach front and has enough chairs for lounging on the beach. Pool area gets filled quickly so make it out there early to get a chair! Staff is very nice and helpful. We asked for a fridge for our room and in no time the nice man was dropping it off and hooking it up. Room service and housekeeping does an excellent job to make sure your stay is perfect. Room was always clean! I'm a picky person and I will definitely return to the Rio Mar. Home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - good escape from San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: byro
Reviews.Content: Most of what I read before going to Rio Mar Beach Resort was accurate, so read a few reivews. Also, consider becoming a Wyndham By Request member and booking DIRECTLY through hotel to get benefts such as free high speed internet, welcome snack/beverage, airline points, free upgrade if available, etc etc. 1) Restaurants/Food - expensive for what it is. Bring some of your own food and/or buy it at local shops. 2) Renting a car is a good idea or you are pretty much stuck at the resort. Many stores to get basic things are not far (in Rio Grande) like Walgreens, Walmart, etc. Also close to El Yunque Rainforest and Luquillo beachfront restaurants (nice Puerto Rican experience). 3) People seemed generally quite friendly everywhere I went. 4) If you golf, definitely a good place to stay. Nice courses and driving range! 5) Beach is very nice though not perfectly crystal clear water like some Carribean beaches and could use a cleaning up of the sand. 6) Some staff were excellent, some mediocre at best. 7) Hotel is not immaculate or spotless (mostly speaking of rooms), but it is definitely decent and clean. 8) They do nickel and dime you on many things. Be careful. 9) The casino is a nice alternative in the evenings. 10) The outdoor areas and gardens are very nice. 11) Watch out for the overly frienldy Iguana's around the pool and gardens - they bite! (Just kidding!) Feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property, but don't spend all your time there”
Reviews.Author: JEG633
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Rio Mar is a wonderful property on a very nice stretch of beach. The hotel is located about 45 minutes east of San Juan, the perfect location for all the eastern Puerto Rico sites - El Yunque, Bio Bay tours, Fajardo snorkel and dive trips, etc. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly. The faciltiy and grounds are spotless and the guestrooms are larger than average. Our family of 4 (with 2 teenagers) was quite comfortable. The ocean view balcony is a nice touch. The beach is very big with some fun waves, but it is a little rough for smaller children. This is the Atlantic Ocean, NOT the Caribbean so you will have waves and some seaweed, not the crystal clear calm water you get in the Caribbean. If you want calm, head east toward Fajardo - you can find it you just need to know where to look. I would echo the other reviews encouraging you to book your own tours and excursions. For example the Bio Bay tour was $95 booked thorugh the hotel, and we only paid $45 booked directly with the tour company. A car is a must if you plan to spend time at all the the wonderful spots located near the hotel. The proximity to El Yunque allows you to get to the park before the tour buses from San Juan. We spend two great days hiking there, starting about 9AM and rarely saw a soul. But on our way out the crowds and tour groups were pouring in. The only negative aspect of the hotel was the island resort food prices. Typical of what you would pay at similar properties, but quite expensive. Drinks $10, lunch $20/person, etc. The hotel charges you to install a refrigerator in your room - this seems a bit much at a hotel of this class. Go into town and buy your own beverages, snacks, muffins, etc. Ice them all down for the day - I saw a number of people with styrofoam coolers at the beach. There are a number of good restaurant choices withing 10-15 minutes of the hotel. They have a list at the concierge desk if you ask - everything we tried from the list was good. It is nice to get out of the resort and spend some time in the real Puerto Rico for part of your trip. Without exception, the people in Puerto Rico are very friendly - not just in tourist locations. Gas station attenedants, Walgreens clerks, etc. Puerto Rico is a wonderful place to visit, offering things to do beyond the beach that many other tropical locations cannot. To top it off, the currency is US dollars - who wants to do math on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Adored 4 days at Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisNona
Reviews.Content: Recent reviews stated all the things we loved during our stay. The resort setting is gorgeous, with a long, curving beach, two beautiful pools (one for adults), many lounges on the beach itself--where the waves pound and foam--good lunch food served at the Tiki Bar, a very friendly and helpful staff, lovely rooms and balconies, plus choices of many sports. It is not inexpensive (add 25% to room rates for taxes), but we are returning much more relaxed with hopes of going back. Unlike some islands, the people here are friendly and welcoming. We liked the fact that we could leave the resort to easily visit El Yunque (a 15 minute drive) or eat at the wonderful kiosks at Luqillo Beach (also a 15 minute drive.) At El Yunque, there is a two hour or one hour hike that anyone can enjoy. The cost of food is a little high, but people find their own compromises. We purchased a few things for breakfast before we arrived and paid $25 for a room refrigerator. The lunch sandwiches are large and can be shared. If you know in advance that lunch sandwiches will be $9-12, you'll be prepared. Nearby you can find reasonable restaurants. If you do not have a car, the hotel can phone Richie's for you, and they send a van to bring you up the hill to their beautiful overlook. We found the portions so large that we preferred sharing entrees. Our friends also recommended the hotel restaurants. If you've read the poor reviews of this hotel from past years, you should know that the present management is doing a fine job--providing a very friendly staff and a well-cared-for property. The physical beauty of the grounds is enough reason for wanting to return there--a beautiful pool area with plenty of seating around the pools and on the attractive beach-front. We walked each day for a full hour down the beach and back without crowds or peddlers, and that is an advantage for me. I hope to return more than once!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a family friendly resort!”
Reviews.Author: 1in8
Reviews.Content: With a slight bit of unknown, my wife and I landed in San Juan and made our way immediately to the Rio Mar Resort after picking up our car at Hertz. We actually had booked the resort based off reviews on Tripadvisor and had forgotten to even look at pictures of the resort! Much to our delight, the resort was picture perfect with friendly staff greeting us and a good feeling of safety tucked deep in its own plot of land far away from the road leading to the resort itself. Booking into the hotel was easy and quick. The staff was very nice and even made and upgrade to our booking which we made through Priceline. To breakdown the resort: Appearance/Cleanliness - Can't complain at all. The resort had a semi-luxurious feel without being ostentatious nor ridiculously opulent. Everything was clean, but there were some signs of wear. We never encountered any dirty towels, cups or anything of that sort. Overall the resort was pretty close to spotless though slightly aging. Staff Friendliness/Helpfulness - The staff was always pleasant and courteous in the resort itself. The concierges were somewhat helpful, but we asked for some fairly standard things (e.g. seeing El Yunque, going to Fajardo and San Juan, etc). I have the feeling that if you were to ask the concierges for something a bit more off the beaten path or for places that aren't on the resort's list of places or tours to sell that you wouldn't get as much help. The only thing which we didn't like was that the Rio Mar's staff kept insisting that we attend a sales seminar for some future investment property. We're on a vacation, who wants to waste a few hours of their vacation for a lousy $75 credit in the resort? Dining - Restaurants were as expected in a resort. Overpriced, average in quality and average in service. We didn't expect anything stellar and were certainly weren't pleasantly surprised or disappointed. Amenities - The pools were great that there was a separate adult pool. The hot tub was far too small and always crowded, mostly with teenagers hanging out with their friends and parents. The beach is right in front of the hotel, you can't ask for a better location nor a nicer beach! The casino was small and kind of useless to be honest and we didn't partake in golfing so... well we can't comment. The nightlife was susprisingly alive with live music, karaoke and dancing. The computer room was a nice touch, but also too busy, mostly with kids of adults who forget that children should be supervised not just shoved in front of a computer when on vacation. Parents... it's 11pm do you know where your kids are? Location - Perfectly close if you have a car to almost everything you should see in Puerto Rico. El Yunque is only 10 minutes away, Luquillo is 15 minutes away, San Juan and Fajardo are both 30 minutes away. Value - The resort was well priced, but we did book through Priceline. The restaurants were overpriced, but inline with resort pricing. Don't bother buying water or snacks there, it's also way overpriced. The parking fees were a bit ridiculous, $15/day just for parking? If you can avoid all the extra fees the resort is well worth it, but watch out for all the phone charges, food and all the little services that will add up. In summary, the Rio Mar is a great place to relax and still have all the wonders of Puerto Rico close to you but you have to have a car, the tours are a bit overpriced from the resort itself. As expected, the price for amenities isn't really worth it, but if you can avoid all the extra charges you'll probably be happy with the overall price of your stay. The nightlife doesn't really exist and you're too far from San Juan to go clubbing or bar hopping, so party-goers you may want to stay closer to metropolitan San Juan. But if you're looking for a nice vacation with your significant other or family, this is the perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: ksinging
Reviews.Content: First, let me put this review in context. I travel OFTEN for work. I generally stay in middle to upper end hotel chains such as Marriott, Renaissance, Hilton, Wyndham, Westin. My fiance and I booked this trip through CheapCarribean and were satisfied with the booking process and the deal that we got (which included airfare and hotel). The Rio Mar is a beautiful property, the prices are comparable to other hotels in this category and we found the service to be excellent. Experiences we enjoyed: 1) Dancing under the stars on our first evening out by the Tiki Bar and firepit. We started a small trend because two other couples joined in the dancing. 2) Dining at La Parilla (one of the kioskas on the way to Luquillo). The grilled seafood platter was excellent. 3) Hiking in El Yunque 4) Dining at the Las Vegas Restaurant (on the way back from El Yunque). Lovely interior, good service and GREAT bread pudding! 5) Kayaking in the bioluminescent bay (booked through the concierge with Enchanged Island Eco Tours) 6) Dining at Antojitos (down the road from the hotel property--at the intersection of Rte. #3. I highly recommend the fried whole red snapper. 7) Sitting by the adult pool and on the beach. Walking on the beach. If you face the ocean, turn left and walk about 1/3 of a mile, there is a great view of a river that goes in to the ocean with El Yunque in the background. Great photo op. 8) Mimosas on the balcony, gazing at the rain forest Our room was just fine--quite a bit more spacious than the Courtyard Marriott we stayed at by the airport the night before we left Baltimore. We did rent a fridge ($25) and filled it with water purchased at the Wal-Mart in Fajardo. Buy some wine at the grocery located in the same shopping center. We took turns going down to the coffee shop to purchase pastries and coffee in the morning. Ate two dinners and two lunches at the hotel. Overall, the hotel was just what we expected, hoping for a relaxing get away.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAURIELLN
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided to get away from the cold Boston weather and take a trip to a warm place. We decided on PR. We also decided to stay at the "Rio Mar" because we were looking for a resort with a big pool and a beach. We did not rent a car, for the sole purpose of this trip was relaxation. The "Rio Mar" is about a 40-45 minutes drive from the San Juan Airport. We took a private shuttle, "Travel With Padin" (www.enchanted-isle.com/padin/) that cost us $32.50 per person, one way. The hotel itself has a shuttle service also, but they charge $37.50 per person, one way. We opted for the private shuttle, for they are waiting for you right outside the airport & no waiting for other passengers, for the "Rio" picks up several people at the same time. So, we were able to get to the hotel way before the "Rio's" shuttle even left the airport! Like other reviews have said, the "Rio Mar" is far away from anything. We did not rent a car, and expected to pay big money for food on the resort. You should expect such things in any resort or any island, Im thinking. A Hambuger was $12.00, and frozen drink was $10.00. Lunch for my husband and I was always in the vicinity of around $50.00.....for lunch! But, the resort was beautiful, the grounds beautiful, and all the pictures posted are true & accurate. The beach isn't great. It is VERY windy, the sand is hard-packed and brown and the water not that crystal-clear aqua color that the carribbean is most famous for. But, the water was warm, warmer, at times, than the outside air. I even went into the water to warm up! But, because it is VERY windy, the waves were hugh. Great for adults, not so great if you have little ones. Very dangerous! A Rip Tide carried a little girl out! She had to be rescued by her father and a lifeguard. They do have iguana feedings everyday at 11am. Definitely do that! The iguana's are free to roam (wild), and will eat lettuce right from your hand. They have even been known to "fall" from a palm tree into the pool below. Watch your heads! They will also walk under your chaise lounge, but not bother you unless you bother them. The restaurants on site are expensive and proper attire must be warm. No shorts! Pants only. There is a casual, sit yourself, open-air restaurant (Richie's cafe) up the street from the "Rio Mar" that offers a free shuttle service to their restaurant and back. The food is ok, and just as expensive. It is atop of a mountain, so if going at night, bring a sweater for the breeze brings down the temp quite a bit. But the view is amazing! The pool area is great. Never had a problem finding a chaise lounge. But, if you want a prime spot by the pool with an umbrella, then get out there by 9-10am. But, if you dont care about sitting close to the pool, and don't care about getting an umbrella, then sleep in! Also, there is a "Adult Only" pool. Those loungers fill up quickly, for it is smaller than the "Activity" Pool. It is also much quieter at the "Adult Pool". But, my husband & I still sat out by the "activity Pool" to people watch. At the "Adult" pool, everyone kept to themselves and it was like I was in a library or a church! But, at the bigger "Activity" pool, the kids talked to you, the adults drank and talked. The pools are right next to one another so you can technically swim at either pool, as long as your 18+. But, I opted to sit by the activity pool, and swam at the "Adult Pool". I cannot say anything about San Juan or anything outside the resort, for, again, we stayed for (4) days and did not leave the resort, Would I stay here again? ABSOLUTELY! Without question.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveAnimalsAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you get a good deal on the net. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent beach and facilities. Renting a car is important as you can be mobile and do your own sightseeing and save a lot of money. Please feed Stray dogs and cats outside the resort wherever you can see them. They are not cared for by locals and I see Americans feeding them including me. Hope every tourist going there does their bit in helping these helpless, homeless animals.

Reviews.Title: “A 13-year-old's review of the Rio Mar beach resort and spa in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: LuckEDog
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am a thirteen year old kid who recently travelled to Puerto Rico with my family and stayed at the Rio Mar beach resort and spa. Overall, this hotel should be rated a 5-star hotel. This is because of the clenliness of the hotel, the quality of their beach, and the overall location of this hotel. I will start with the good things. First, the hotel is in a great location. It is just a short drive away to the el yuncay rainforest (a great time if you hapen to go and it is worth it.) When you go to the front desk of the hotel, they will give you a map if you ask and this will be a map of the rain forest. you want to get to the rainforest early and drive up the road( do not wait until 9:00 when the visitor center opens and all of the tourist busses leave, the big tree trail is the best and make sure to pack a bag with a bathingsuit because you can swim in the waterfall at the end of the trail. the actuall rainforest opens at 7:30). Also, the hotel is right on the beach, and relatively close to the ferry you take to the biolumanessent bay. It is also close to snokling and many other fun activities. Next, on the good list is the pool and outdoor activities at the actuall resort. They offer many great things to do and the beach has great body surfing waves. There is also a sandbar within kayaking distance and you can rent kayaks there. You will want to reserve a day to stay at the hotel's beach and pool place. Also, The rooms have a great view. Now the bad. The hotel's beach is on an underwater sandbar, wich makes for a STRONG riptide in the marked areas. This however, also makes for big waves on the rest of the beach. Other than that, the pool deck is a little slippery I guess. Overall, the hotel is a great value for your manoey and i guarantee that you il be satisfied. My family and I loved this hotel and are planning to go back next year. MAKE SURE TO BRING LOTS OF SUNSCREEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: MicaBArg
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Rio Mar and had a good experience. The grounds, pool area and beach are beautiful. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The food is appaling and expensive. I scheduled tennis lessons in the morning and in the afternoon. The morning lessos was cancelled because it had rained and the court was wet. Well, it rains every morning, so they could have told me I shouldn't schedule it at that time. The lesson in the afternoon was cancelled because the instructor was in the hospital. The spa was very acommodating. I explained my lessons were cancelled and they were able to squeeze me in for a massage and facial. The room was clean and confortable. The bed was huge, and the seating area very nice. The toiletries were good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: DeltaP
Reviews.Content: Very nice Resort and excellent walking trails due to golf course. Beach was beautiful but was rough most of day. Weather for us remained mostly cloudy with periods of rain. Car rental is a must if you want to get around as there is many places you can see in PR like old San Juan or the Rain Forest just few minutes from hotel. Bring your GPS if you got one.Taxis can get very expensive. Of course there is a $15/day parking fee at hotel and Rental companies take forever to process at airport so give yourself more time. Rooms are very clean and comfortable but walls are thin especially if you get noisy neghbors. Expect to pay taxes for everything but this same for most countries. Overall we enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Juliimel
Reviews.Content: Here are a few tips that will make your stay at the Rio Mar more pleasant and economical: 1. Get a Wyndam Rewards card and get upgraded. We booked a regular room but were upgraded to a suite (ocean view). 2. Split an entree at the restaurants. My husband and I ate for under 30 bucks for dinner by splitting an entree. Plenty of food for both of us. 3. If you are staying a few days, go to a local supermarket and buy breakfast foods. We only ate out once a day (dinner) and snacked in our room. Get a fridge for 25 bucks (one time fee). 4. Rent a car at the airport. There is so much to see but the resort is fairly isolated and it is costly to get taxi's etc. 5. Use valet parking. It costs a little more but is worth the price. 6. Book your excursions directly. We went diving directly out of Fajardo and saved money. 7. Don't be afraid of roadside food stands. Great food for little money. 8. Put yourself in an "island" state of mind. Puerto Ricans have a relaxed pace of life. Enjoy the waiting, don't stress about it. 9. Understand that islanders "drive with their horns". Honking at you is not malicious or personal..they are just saying "I am here!". ...and last, kindness and courtesy is rewarded with similar behavior. Be kind, patient and tip well. Don't sweat the small stuff! Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, relaxing atmosphere, definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFoodieTraveler
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful in just about every way imaginable. While it is slightly less luxe than a true 5 star resort, it probably has everything you want. The resort itself is beautiful, set on a very large private expanse of land, inside a guarded gate. The golf course is right there, and there are rental villas surrounding it. The hotel itself is down at the bottom of the hill, directly on the ocean, set amidst very pretty grounds. We were upgraded to an ocean-front room on checking in, which had a beautiful view, but the mountain view rooms are great, too, because the rainforest is pretty. The resort is a solid 35 minute drive east of San Juan. I definitely recommend renting a car, or else you will truly be stuck at the resort. Pay the $15 parking fee, and eat out for a few meals - you'll still end up saving money, plus you can get around the island so easily. The rainforest is a 10 minute drive and parking is free. Going back into Old San Juan is easy and parking there is easy and cheap. We also went horseback riding at Hacienda Caribaldi - $90 per person through the hotel, $30 per person if you just go there on your own! The room was a bit small, but has a good-sized balcony and a nice bathroom. The Wyndham beds are great - soft linens, nice comforters and pillows. Plenty of room for 2 people in a room, although 4 in a standard double room would be crowded. The rooms have coffee makers and each morning you'll get coffee, tea bags, and 2 bottles of water. The pools at the hotel are so nice you may not make it to the beach. There are two pools, both large and freeform, with palm trees surrounding and plenty of lounge chairs. The activity pool is for families, and they have some occasional resort activities here (water aerobics, water volleyball.) We spent most of our time at the adult pool, which has really luxurious teak loungers with thick blue cushions. You can rent cabanas for $125 a day, but who needs one - finding chairs under the partial shade of a swaying palm tree is easy enough. The beach, when you do get there, is lovely. It is wide and long - you can walk for about a mile in both directions along a quiet, peaceful stretch of sand. There are no other hotels within walking distance here. The water can be rough, and when we were there the undercurrent was strong, and there were no water sports during those days. But the moment you walk onto the beach, the friendly staff will set up lounge chairs and an umbrella wherever you like. Waitresses patrol the beach and pool all day to bring you drinks and lunch. The food at the resort was generally very good, although pricey. Lunch prices at the Seabreeze or Tiki Bar aren't so bad, about $8-12 for a sandwich or salad. We ate at Palio, the Italian restaurant, and thought it was a bit formal and stuffy for a tropical island (and a young couple). The food was good, but pricey. We also ate at Marbella for dinner, the International restaurant, and the food was good and more reasonably priced. You can see all the restaurant menus on the Wyndham's own website, if you want to browse. The breakfast buffet is way overpriced at $20. Go to the bakery up the street (Isamar, I think) and get coffee and delicious pastries for about $1.50 each Best resort tip: Every day there is a drink special from the Tiki Bar - a special cocktail at $6.50 each, instead of the $10 that all other cocktails are. Make sure to ask for it!! The casino is small and unimpressive, if you're used to Vegas or even Mohegan Sun. There is live music at the bar every night, which is lovely, but subdued. Our only complaint was that, as a young couple, we were a bit bored in the evenings. Otherwise, we had a really great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun & Pretty Place”
Reviews.Author: vegetarianmom
Reviews.Content: We rented a Golf Villa from a private owner so this review pertains only to the common areas. We used the hotel facilities every day. The Staff at Rio Mar was just fabulous. We loved the pool area with great activities for children of all ages. The Iguanas and the water slide were a huge hit. We ate several meals at the hotel and thought the service was pretty good and the food was a good value. Loved the beach - we often go to SanDestin, FL where they charge you $50 and up for a chair rental for the day - they are free here & they haul it out to the beach and set it up wherever you like. Looking for a cheap lunch? - Grab a pizza to go from the coffee shop near the casino ($12.00) it was more then enough for three of us. We did have an issue with the tap water (at the villa - I don't know about the hotel) my daughter drank a little, by accident, and was violently sick for hours. She is fine - but it was scary - trying to figure out what might have been in the water. I would just stick with bottle water if possible. Very convenient to El Yunque. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but be prepared to spend some $$!!”
Reviews.Author: kwilson702
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar for three nights, for a little get-away for Spring Break. I will say, the Resort itself is BEAUTIFUL but they truley do "nickle and dime" you for everything you've got. The food is WAY overpriced! It was over $40 for roomservice where they tack on a delivery fee as well as include gratutity. The valet is $20 a day, but when you get your bill, there is a "city tax" and "state tax" added on. Also , they charge a 14% resort fee per day as well as another "city tax". At bar it was $12 for a Martini, and at the bar upstairs it was $15...? We got icecream one night and the charged us .50 for sprinkles! Come on!! The location of this resort is not the greatest. You do have to travel an hour to Old San Juan. We asked repeatably to the Concirer for shopping, and all the reccommended was Old San Juan or the Factory Outlests (we have those here)..it took a local working at El Jefes Burger Shavk (The best food IN THE WORLD!! PLEASE GO!) to really fill us in on where to go. All in all, as stated before, the resort is absolutley beautiful! It really is, it just seems everything you do is taxed and they really try to get you for everything you've got. That's annoying. I just want to relax, not spend $14 on a hamburger and $30 for a six pack of beer (really, $30!!). If you go here, be prepared to spend some moola. There are some great places to go that are reasonable (one of them IS NOT Richies at the top of the hill, if you go, you can't miss his 500 signs on the way up..it was $25 for a crappy appitizer and even worse service!)..Besides all the nickle and diming, Rio Mar is great. We called it "Wyndham Island" because you did'nt really need to leave. Just be prepared to spend $19.00 a person for a breakfast buffet. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the Villas next door...it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Gagirl67
Reviews.Content: We loved the resort!! Staying at the villas was great it exceeded our expectations! We had a 2 bedroom ocean front villa the villa was very clean and comfortable and the view was great! The villas had 2 pools, a baby pool and hot tub. It was very quiet. When we wanted action we would take the short walk to the hotel pool where the kids loved the water slide and the virgin pina coladas!! The food at the resort was very good and not very expensive. We did venture out to La Parilla and Richie's the food was fair at both places but very expensive!! The bakery at the intersection with Route 3, Isamar, was great..the kids loved the pancakes for breakfast and the sandwiches were good. The children took surfing lessons and had a blast! We also enjoyed the rainforest. All in all it was a great vacation! I highly recommend staying in the villas. We booked through one of the rental companies, but most of the people we talked to who were staying there went directly to the owners through VRBO and got much better deals. Also, the parking is free!!

Reviews.Title: “Relatively Inexpensive for Gorgeous place”
Reviews.Author: AfromNJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel was spotless, Beautiful views when walking into lobby. Booked tours from the hotel concierge- very helpful and not overpriced. We were surprised to find our room was ocean front, and had not even requested that. Great to have two pools- one for adults, one for families, but mainly stayed on the beach. Hotel across the street form the Rainforest, great location. Casino was closed for renovation during time of stay, which we knew about, so got a cheaper price, but did not miss the hustle and bustle of a casino- not needed! Hotel was busy as is. Would def. come here again for a short getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: canada10196
Reviews.Content: We stayed over at the wyndham over the holidays the service was excellent, great location ,great deal on priceline for 88$ We even got a corner room, on the top floor beachfront with a large veranda. Cant complain everything was great !!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in a room with a connecting door!”
Reviews.Author: lduv
Reviews.Content: Our first day we had a room with a connecting door and when the people next door checked in, we heard EVERYTHING they said, and they weren't speaking loudly. There is absolutely no soundproofing on rooms with connecting doors. We immediately packed up and requested a different room. So unless you are traveling with someone that you WANT to have a connecting room with - make sure yours isn't! Other than that, the resort is beautiful. Restaurants are pricy, but it seemed everything in Puerto Rico was pricy. February was a little cool (70's) and too windy to sit on the beach. Took a tour of rainforest (a lot of walking downhill and slippery), our tour guide Devin was great. We were supposed to take a catamaran sail, but it was cancelled because of bad weather. Puerto Rico (the island) did not impress me too much - lots of stray dogs (which was just sad). If you look at houses along the roads, they all had bars on windows, doors, and balconies. So it seemed obvious to me that there must be a lot of crime. But if you're going to stay in the resort - you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 2nd Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: outdoorsman72
Reviews.Content: Service was absolutely awesome. Every single person from valets, to check in, to concierge service was extremely friendly and helpful. Yes food and drinks were expensive, but not unreasonable for this type of resort. If you are on a tight budget, look elswhere. You don't realize how nice this resort is, until you travel around the island and see how bad most of Puerto Rico really is.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place for family”
Reviews.Author: kittens5001
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Wyndham. We were there for 8 days with our 7 month old son. We had a great stay. The hotel is very family oriented. We spent most of our days at the baby pool and met many great families. The overall pool area was not overly crowded and there were plenty of chairs and shade for everyone. The grounds of the hotel were beautifully manicured. The staff of the hotel were wonderful. Every call to the front desk was answered promptly. We ordered room service and it was delivered quickly. We had a few other requests during the week and the conceirge was at our door immediately. Everyone was super friendly and goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The food is definitely expensive. Expect to pay $20 per person for breakfast. There is only one main breakfast restaurant which has a $20 buffet. However, you can order from their menu and get the same stuff for less money. But yeah, expect to pay a lot of money for lunch and dinner. The food isn't great but it isn't horrible either. There are a couple of restaurants near the hotel that aren't quite as pricey. Give Ritchies a try for a great view (free shuttle from the hotel) and Don Pepe's for for authentic food ($20 cab ride.) Parking is $15 per day. There is an Avis car rental in the hotel if you want to rent a car for the day. Call your reservation in though as you will get a better rate than going to the desk. The internet cafe in the hotel was very convenient and there was never a wait. We got a good rate on the room thru Hotwire. But be warned, there are more than one 4 star hotels in Rio Grande so you aren't guaranteed to get this hotel. And just FYI, the mountain view rooms have gorgeous views!!! Overall we had a great trip and would absolutely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS MAJOR UPDATING and DECENT RESTURANTS!”
Reviews.Author: jossiesgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very tired looking. The physical grounds are beautiful, but everything needs updating. The rooms have holes in the walls and the bathrooms need a major facelift. Shower door didnt close properly. The furniture is shabby and needs replacing. The best part of the hotel is the housekeeping staff who seriously cater to all needs. We went on an extended family vacation with kids and grandkids. There were 2 pools- adult pool and kids pool. The adult pool had comfortable chaises but we couldnt sit there as it was for adults only. We wanted to be with our grandkids, so we sat by the kids pool. Unfortunately, the chaises there were woven wood- they defied you to sit on them for any period of time! The hotel would not allow cushions on the chaises at the kids pool, so adults there spent the time being uncomfortable. RIDICULOUS! If they were afraid cushions would be ruined, they certainly could have given cushions to the adults, and towels for the children! The chaises were butt numbing and back breaking without cushions. Since one spends most of the time by the pool, this was a major turn off! The manager of the hotel did nothing when told that one of the grandparents was in such pain from the chaises that they had to remain in the hotel room. The manager refused to allow a cushioned chaise by the kids pool, despite the obvious disomfort and pain the wood chaise caused a guest of the hotel! We had several suites, but the hotel was not accommodating, when it came to making us comfortable by the pool. In fact, the first time I went to complain about this, the manager didnt even come out to speak with me. When I went back again, and demanded to speak with her, she offered a vinyl blow up mattress that one uses in the pool, to place on the chaise! Unless one is in the water, a vinyl pool mattress is NOT a solution! We would never consider going back to a hotel that wasnt into guest comfort! The food, sadly, was awful :( Dont even think about going to the Italian Restaurant at the hotel- inedible is a major understatement!) The hotel is really not close to anything, so food in an area like this is important. They need to replace all their chefs, and start again as there is no such thing as a good dinner, at this hotel. Since the various restuarants at the hotel share the same kitchen, service is extremely slow! We had a suite, which had a phenomonal layout, and the view was honestly nothing short of spectaular. The balcony was a nice size, as well! The setting is one of the most beautiful settings I have been to, in Puerto Rico, but they seriously need to do some major redecorating and get those bathrooms updated. If they really want people to come to this hotel, they need to update, provide COMFORTABLE chaises by the kids pool (adults do not leave kids to swim by themselves, without watching them) and do something about the awful food and service. Properly redone, this hotel would blow the Ritz out of the water. The beach is nicer, and the suites actually have a very very beautiful ocean view, where as the Ritz suites only overlook the pool, unless one is willing to shell out over $3000 a night for an ocean view suite (and there are only 3 of them, there). If I am going to vacation, I would like to be able to see the oean! IMHO, Wyndham has grasped defeat from the jaws of victory :( Hotel has the possibility of being a 5 star +, but is only, at best, a 3, at the present time. Disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Resort, But a Major Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: pimping4life
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Rio Mar is a semi-good resort hotel located in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico. The hotel features a large beach next to a part of the Ocean that is relatively calm and good to swim in. This property has 2 medium-sized swimming pools and a sad excuse for a water side. The smaller of the 2 pools is reserved for adults only and is hardly ever swam in. The regular rooms at this resort are about the size of a room at a typical Motel 6, however, the rooms have 2 comfortable queen-sized beds, a balcony, and a flat-screen TV with a 35 cable channels. The service at the Rio Mar is not particularly good nor particularly bad. Food at the Rio Mar is some of the best resort fare around, but it comes at a ridiculous price. This hotel is good, exept for one MASSIVE drawback. This drawback is the fact that EVERYTHING at this hotel is hugely overpriced. A bowl of cereal is $6! A skirt steak $47! It's not just the overpricing that makes this hotel a 2 out of 5, it's the feeling that the hotel is trying to squeeze every penny out of the guests. For example, to pay for parking, instead of letting guests pay at the parking lot exit, like any other resort would do, guests must walk for over 5 minutes to a in-hotel paystation. There are 2 reasons why the hotel does this: 1. To engourage guests to not bother with the hassel of leaving and paying their parking fee, thus allowing the hotel to continue making money on the parked car, and forcing the guest to spend their money at the hotel and not elsewhere. 2. To encouarage guests to valet park their car at a rate of a whopping $30 per day! This money-snatching attitude is what makes this hotel a 2 out of 5. The rest of this resort is really quite good. If the Wyndham Rio Mar were more fairly priced and didn't have such a money grabbing attitude, I would rate it a 4 out of 5, but this problem is such a huge drawback that really sours this resort. So, in the end, the Wyndham Rio Mar gets a 2 out of 5 and nothing more. Be smart, don't go here, and spend that $6 on something better than a bowl of cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the Rio Mar Casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: worlldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rio Mar and had a terrible experience at the casino. After using the facility for 2 days and getting parking validated with no difficulty, the 4th morning I asked for validation I was treated so rudely by staff that I will never return. I was there with a large group and told at least 20 other collegues about the experience and we decided to spend the rest of our casino time and money at the El Con. We had a wonderful experience at that resort and even though we returned in the evenings to the Rio Mar and participated in the conference activities, we spent every moment we could at the El Con where the staff at the casino, cafes, restaurants, shops and general staff were the most helpful and friendly we have ever experienced. They happily validated our parking, provided the attention and service that was above exceptional. Consequently, word traveled fast through our group and found the rest of our group spent tons of money and time at their casino, shops and restaurants. Great time by all, next time we visit this island we will avoid the rude, customer "unfriendly" staff at the Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the pictures - beatufiul beach front luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: Wixomhead
Reviews.Content: This resort delivered exactly what was advertised on the JetBlue getaway vacations page - and that's saying something, these days. As we live in Boston and only had 3 nights, Puerto Rico offered the shortest hop / greatest chance for 85 degree beach days with non-stops from Logan airport. I've stayed at Ritz Carlton beach resorts in the carribbean and Hawaii, and if those come it at five stars clearly this resort comes it at four - especially for the price ($900 each 3 nights incl airfare - during highest season/school vaca). Good: Beautiful pools. Gorgeous grounds. Extremely friendly staff. Lots of lizards running around. Clean, good sized rooms. The beach is RIGHT THERE. The hotel's beach bar is RIGHT THERE, too. Plenty of activities. (Tiny) Casino was fun. We were looking for 4 days of sun and surf and some unique experiences and this place delivered over and over again. Richie's and Parilla restaurants (around corner) gave us great local cooking in fun environment outside of resort experience. Great Spanish restaurant in old san juan (Mirabueno) - walk up the hill away from the shops corner of Luna and Tanca. Bad: Meals/coffee/transportation = extremely expensive ($3.75 for large, weak coffee in 15 minute line at 8AM). $70 round trip van to downtown/siteseeing - $150 round trip if you take a cab (apparently). Room keys for consistently failed for not just us but seemingly everyone in front and back of me in line at check out. Also - the (expensive) restaurants all served the same food we can get at home - steaks, pasta, chicken fingers - where's the adventure, people!? BORING!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation for Young Couple”
Reviews.Author: kevlar11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful trip to Puerto Rico where we stayed at the Wyndham Rio Mar. The hotel was in a perfect location for what we wanted to do. We aren't really into the night life scene, so this worked out perfect for us. The room was very nice and had a very comfortable bed. We did rent a fridge for $25 from the front desk, which was plenty big. We ate out for dinner each night, but it was nice to have a fridge for breakfast and lunch. There were 2 pools (one for adults only) and 2 hot tubs. There was also a tiki bar near the pool with food and beverages. The hotel is right on the beach, and the view from our room was amazing. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful. Nathaniel and Noel were our two favorites. Whatever you need to know, they can help assist you. They even ordered pizza for us from a local pizzeria because neither of us spoke spanish. While we were there, we did take the timeshare tour. Even though we did not purchase, it is definitely worth hearing what they had to say. We weren't in a position to buy yet, but they give you a gift for taking the tour and they are not into pressuring you! We would definitely recommend renting a car while you are there. You do have to pay $15/day to park (or $20/day valet) but it was nice to come and go as you please. We rented through enterprise on hotwire.com and they were awesome. Very organized! We paid $130/6 days. Good deal! As far as what to do...there is plenty. While we were there, we hiked the rainforest (5 min drive from hotel); went to Luquillo Beach (10 min drive from hotel); toured Old San Juan (30-40 min drive from hotel depending on traffic); went to Fajardo (East on hotel on Rt 3) and did the bioluminescent bay tour with Kayaking Puerto Rico (www.kayakingpuertorico.com) which was awesome!! (25 min drive from hotel); and obviously just relaxed at the Wyndham. One thing about the rainforest, the signs will tell you how far the hike is, but my husband and I usually could do it in about half the amount of time, and we are not experienced hikers. As for food, the first night we ate at Marbella at the Wyndham. The food was good and it wasn't terribly expensive. All the other restaurants in the hotel are a bit more expensive and they have a dress code. We took advantage of the Kioscos right off Route 3. There are a 30+ to choose from. As you leave the resort, go east (left) on route 3. They will be on the left hand side. Great prices and great food. Definitely go to El Jefe #12 and La Parilla #2. We also ate at Richie's up the hill. The service and food was good, but a little over priced. All is all, we had a wonderful trip. The Wyndham was definitely a great place to stay, and we would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: LESIUS_LENHADUS
Reviews.Content: This was a big deal we have made trough Hotwire. This resort is simply wonderful. We stayed only in the hotel area; did not used the golf and other facilities they offer. The pool is great; they even have an adult exclusive pool. The beach in front of the hotel is nice. It is not that BRAZILIAN BEACH, but we can have some fun. The room is one of the most beautiful we have been in. The hotel is an old bulding but totally conserved and modern. The room is wide and cosy. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The only thing you must be advised is that you have to pay to park you car (U$20,00 vallet and U$15,00 self per day) and that the food is a little bit expensive, but it is good. If you want to stay there, I recommend. It is a tranquil place to spend a couple of days. Now... it is just memories...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Puerto Rico but only liked the Rio Mar (Long Review)”
Reviews.Author: BVI17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week stay at the Rio mar. When we landed we picked up our rental car and drove to the hotel. The ride is only about 40 minutes (however if you take the toll road 66 you will probably bypass a lot of the lights on Rte 3). We are By Request Members so upon check in we were upgraded to a junior suite. The room itself was nice. It was large with a seating area, very clean, and had a nice bathroom. Of course some things could have been nicer - large crack in the ceiling of the bathroom, mini fridge should have been cleaned better etc. The grounds of the hotel are very nice. The grounds staff really works hard on the property. The pools are a bit small compared to other resorts we have stayed at but we are more ocean people so it didn't bother us too much. We did rent a cabana one day on along the pool. Definitely worth the $150 comfy chairs, plenty of towels, cooler with water, snacks, fruit plate, and designated waitstaff. The beach was great. Very clean, lots of chairs, warm water, and plenty of room. The ocean did have some strong waves while we were there but that just kind of made it more fun. You could stay in the shallow area, or body surf in the big waves, or just hang out in between. After reading other reviews we decided we didn't want to eat at the restaurants on property we wanted to experience Puerto Rico's food. The only exceptions to that was our breakfasts we went to the ERL next to the casino for coffee and pastries and we tried the appetizers at Boleros lounge and the lobby bar. We ate dinners at Antojitos (on the road to the rio mar) - they have delicious food and great staff. We also tried La Parilla (Kiosk #2 at luquillo beach) - great food as well. For lunch one day we tried Richies - the food was good but you could tell it was a little more touristy. We did try a non Puerto Rican meal one night because it was so recommended. We went to the Sushi Boat in Fajardo. A must try is the Tempura Shrimp Roll - delicious! A must do is driving to San Juan for a day of sightseeing or shopping but take the scenic route. Take Rte 3 west to Rte 187. The road takes you through Rio Grande but then you head along the coast through Loiza, and Pinones. There are some great small beaches, sand dunes, and picture perfect stops along the way. In San Juan we had tapas at el picoteo in the El Convento hotel (our favorite San Juan hotel) - the tapas were our favorite meal - simple and delicious! We did encounter a few problems with the hotel. The first is the drink prices. I know it's a resort and I have no problem with marked up drinks but I will say the Wyndham is definitely at the top of the higher prices. $10 for a mojito or a capirinha is definitely over priced considering the only alcohol in it is rum or cachaca and it was not premium liquor (I don't qualify Bacardi as premium especially when it's local). The next problem is the pool side restaurant. We stopped in twice and everytime it was closing. One day it had literally been open for an hour and a half. On the last day of our vacation we finally received a document detailing when restaurants should be open and what activities should be happening - would have been nice to get this the first day of our stay though. I know that Wyndham really wants to sell their vacation property so okay they have sales people at the towel hut so every time you go there they ask you if you're interested. That was fine with us didn't bother us at all. Then we tried to use the conceirge - big problem! We originally booked with EGBH sailing but the Captain was sick and in the hospital so they had to cancel. We tell the conceirge our problem and ask them to help us with finding a private sailing tour. First thing they say is probably not a private one - is this not a resort, do you not have contacts on the island? The second thing they say is have you been asked about joining our breakfast to learn more about our property. I finally give them my name and room number and ask them to contact us with the information about tours (even with other people) - not once did they contact us all week. Overall we had a nice vacation. The hotel is nice and located near anything you need but (with the exception of the Bell Service Staff ) the service at the Rio Mar is inconsistent. When we go back to Puerto Rico we decided we would try another resort.

Reviews.Title: “On par with Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: j2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rio Mar the last week in January. Overall, we were impressed with the accommodations and staff. Hotel â€“ very lush grounds, pleasingly remote from â€˜touristâ€™ areas (except the El Yunque â€“ the Rainforest), staff very pleasant and accommodating, had a few issues with the keys but the staff took care of them with lots of apologies and remediation. They replenish the coffee every morning and you can get a fridge for $25 for the week. The Iguanas can't climb down so they fall from the palm trees into the pool, freaks you out unless you know. Casino â€“ smaller than we thought. No craps, but they do have blackjack($5 minimum), roulette, slots, etc. Check the website. Everyone in our group won one good slot play for the week. Golf â€“ the course looks beautiful, but we did not play as it was $200 per round. Too steep for us. Restaurants â€“ As mentioned, they are on the expensive side, but this is a resort, not the Holiday Inn. The Grill Pub was fun, casual, and less expensive than the Grill Room. Drinks are about $10 each and beer $6. - Isamar Bakery, just down the street on 3, is great for breakfast. Try the oatmeal â€“ it is not yo mamaâ€™s oatmeal. Very creamy and sweet. The breakfast sandwiches are $4 and two people can share one. You can also get a cup of coffee for 65 cents. - Brass Cactus, Luquillo â€“ OK if you like US restaurants. The food was good, but it looked like Bostons in Delray Beach. - Lolitas â€“ OK for Mexican. I have had better, but it is close and you can depend on a good meal. Get your Margarita with ice on the side. They have a Valet, but you can park yourself. - King Seafood, Luquillo â€“ Local no nonsense place. Locals will get served ahead of the gringos. But the food is decent. - Richies â€“ Right up the hill from the resort. Hey, he is a friendly guy, but his prices reflect the resort. Very cool(literally) place to have a drink. - Faccios Pizza â€“ close to the airport, but worth the trip. Make sure you get specific directions. It is across the street (Hwy 3) from Costco. Great place to hit on your way home from Old San Juan. - Palio â€“ The food and service is pretty good and a bit high on costs. Especially if you have a few cocktails/wine/beer. Surrounding Area â€“ We rented a car from Charlies. Brand new mini-van at a good price. If you do not want to stay at the resort entirely, you will need a car. There is not much local flavor that you can patronize without a sense of why am I here. The whole island is sadly very poor with lots of wrought iron on everything. The police wear their flack jackets on the outside and they cruise the streets with their flashing lights on. We found most of the locals polite but if they didnâ€™t like mainlanders, they claimed â€˜no speaka da englishâ€™. - Walmart â€“ hated to go there but had to. It is a few miles east towards Fajardo â€“ worth a trip on your first day for water, snacks, beer, pop, etc. Not a full grocery, but there is a grocery store in the same mall. Do not be shocked to see the guard tower in the middle of the parking lot. Try the mini donuts outside. - Condom World (yes, that is the name)â€“ next to Lolitas. Open till midnight except on Sundays. - Culebra Island - $5 round trip 1 Â½ hour ferry ride. Great beaches and OK snorkeling. Bring everything you can with you. Snorkel gear - $12.50 a set at the port. Jeep on the island - $45 for the day â€“ you will need one or get stuck at one beach. The dogs that keep the birds out of the ferry terminal were fun to watch. - Palmas Del Mar â€“ drove by there. Looked fab but did not go into the area. - El Yunque â€“ the rainforest. Lots to see, the falls are great, but no wildlife. Saw a few geckos, and a few butterflies, but nothing else. Great views of the east side of the island. - Old San Juan â€“ lots to see and do. The forts are pretty cool. Shopping is just like everywhere. Get in a checker game by the ports. - El Conquistador â€“ looked like a top notch resort. Had a chicken sandwich and two beers for $40 with tip. All in all, we probably would not return to Puerto Rico. The price through Hotwire was too good to pass up and I am glad we went. I just wonder how much of our tax dollars go there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PEaches4o
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at hotel last week, very nice resort but far away from everything. If you rent a car you must pay parking. If you go by taxi, very expansive. For breakfast an average of $50 for two. Very expensive. The only good restraunt is the steak house at the country club with a fantastic manager that pays real close attention to detail. We were there to celebrate my birthday and he (Mario) made it very special. Mario even called us on our departure day to make sure we were okay. Outstanding service from all the staff at the steak house. Room was very clean but needed to call for cleanning service twice. But ladies very nice. I would recommend this hotel. Nice beach and pool area too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: shorebilly69
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort on a great beach. Our room was spotless, beds were very comfy, coffe maker in the room, bath and body works blue line. The food on property is very expensive but good, if I go back I would probably bring at least a few snacks for the room to cut costs a bit. There is no inroom refrigerator so you are limited. What really made this resort stand out was the employees, so friendly and caring, going out of their way to please. This applies to the front desk, the concierge, the bellboys, maids, bartenders, wait staff, I mean everyone here excellent! It was the perfect place to wind down for a few days after an intense cruise!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: klmaxx
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at the resort during the third week of January, 2009. We booked this trip through Costco travel, and bought a package including daily breakfast, airport transfers, and 25% discount on resort activities. The primary benefit of going through Costco was their knowledge of the vacation packages offered by the hotel. Costco, Expedia and other large travel agencies use Elegant Steering for their airport transfers. Elegant uses late model nine passenger vans, however we were the only passengers going to and from the airport. Elegant's personnel were all very professional, and helped us at the airport in San Juan when Northwest Airlines lost one of our checked bags. ( The bag was delivered the next morning to the hotel.) ACCOMODATIONS We had a room on the 5th floor of the West wing of the hotel with a beautiful ocean view. The room was nicely appointed (flat screen TV, etc.) and the king bed was very comfortable. There were some stains on the carpet in the hallway leading to our room, but fortunately this general condition was not duplicated in the hotel room. What was disconcerting, however, were the paper thin walls separating the rooms, allowing us to hear every word emanating from the family with young children staying in the room adjacent to us. Rather than complaining, I simply turned up the volume on the television which masked much of the noise coming from next door. DINING The Breakfast buffet in the Marbella restaurant was included in our rate plan, and it was well worth it. The buffet has most the foods one would expect to see, including a station for eggs and waffles. The food quality and preparation and service was good. Although on two or three days I was charged for the buffet even though it was included in my rate plan. So check your bill! For lunch, we ordered from the Tiki Bar at the pool. We found the chicken and fish grilled sandwiches to be of tasteful and well prepared. Sandwiches run $12 to $16 and mixed drinks $10, exclusive of tax and tips. There were only two full service restaurants at the resort open during our stay, other than Marbella which we did not go to. Palio is a very good Italian restaurant where we dined twice. Expect to spend $120 for two. I would specailly recommend the caprese salad. We also dinner at the Grille Room, an upscale steak restaurant. The food and the service were good, but be prepared to spend $80 per person. If you choose to leave the resort to eat, and you don't have your own transportation, expect to pay $30 for a taxi to the closest town, Luqiillo. Richies is a restaurant on a hill overlooking the ocean about 5 minutes form the hotel. If you call them, they will send a complimentary van to pick you up and return you to the hotel. The food at Richies is good, especially the skirt steak, and less expensive than the hotel. We would also recommend La Parrilla in Luquillo. AMENITIES and RECREATION The adult pool is a great place to spend a relaxing afternoon. Iguanas hang out there, and occasional dive bomb into the pool! Don't worry, they are not aggressive. We had no problem getting good lounge chairs, but the hotel was not even remotely full. Cabanas can be rented, but cost a whopping $125 per day. If you like to be on the beach, I don't think you'll be disappointed. The sand is nice and soft, and the surf is great for body surfing. The tennis facility is excellent, and if you ask, the manger will attempt to arrange a game for you. I played golf one day on the River course. The course was in good condition, although it played very soft due to recent rains. The Ocean course was closed on the day I played because of water. Tee times after 2:00pm cost $125, as opposed to $199 before then, and you can play until the sun goes down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but far away”
Reviews.Author: Lois318
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Hotwire and the resort was very nice, although since I arrived late there was not much to do. The grounds are lovely and I would recommend it for those who would be staying there for a longer length of time. My room was nice and the Italian Restaurant on site was excellent but be aware it is quite expensive. The beach is right outside and they have more multiple pools. One for adults only, which is nice. They also have a casino but I never went in there to see it. The price was right but next time I will go back to Old San Juan...there is more to do in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and service at the Wyndham Rio iMar”
Reviews.Author: zanzuz
Reviews.Content: Hotel: We liked the location of the hotel because of itâ€™s proximity to the Fajardo Port to Culebra, Las Croabas for bio-bay kayaking, and El Yunque Rainforest. We didnâ€™t venture into San Juan at all. We were basically looking for a hotel with a nice beach/pool that was close to the east coast. The hotel was about a 45 minute drive east of the airport. Check-in: We had a room for Jan 18-21. I didnâ€™t book the room directly through Wyndham, but I called ahead of time to see if I could get an upgrade and they put a note on my reservation. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were upgraded to a junior suite facing the rainforest. I told the front desk I was a Wyndham rewards member (I signed up for this on the advice of other reviewers) and was upgraded to an oceanfront suite. Parking: Self-parking was $15/day. Before exiting the parking garage, take the parking ticket to the valet in the front of the hotel to get it validated so that you can exit the garage. Looking at another review it looks like you may be able to get free parking if you go to the casino and get it validated. Room: The oceanfront suite was very spacious with a king bed and sofa bed. Everything was very clean. The bathroom however had a very funny smell, almost like the ocean, but a little dirtier. It was bearable and we were hardly in the hotel room, so we didnâ€™t bother complaining about the smell. The toilet also clogged but they promptly unclogged it after we reported it. We also got a service follow-up call from the hotel to make sure the toilet issue was taken care of. Wyndham rewards also sent up a drinks and candy the day the toilet was fixed. The toiletries were the Bath and Body Works Blue line. The only real complaint we had was the humidity that made it very difficult to air dry swimsuits. There was also nightly turndown service and they left chocolates on our bed. In-room Phone: Some phone numbers with area code 787 are considered long distance. We didnâ€™t know this since the phone says to dial long distance you need to dial a 1 first. So when we received our bill, they charged us $2/min for phone calls totaling $18. Itâ€™s cheaper to call on your cellphone if you have Verizon. Upon checkout, I told them I disagreed with the charge and explained why and they were very accommodating and removed the charges. Resort Fee: We were charged a resort fee of ~$18 per day. The auction site we booked through didnâ€™t cover this charge. Beach/ Pool/Hot tub: The waves were pretty rough. We didnâ€™t really go in the water at all except to dip our feet. We saw kite surfers jumping around though. The pool was a little on the cold side, but it was still nice to go in and it was clean. The hot tub was a little dirty as it didnâ€™t seem to have a working filter. You can get towels at the cabana free of charge, just tell them your room number. Itâ€™s also a good idea to get towels here if youâ€™re planning on doing any water activities outside of the hotel. Hotel Internet: There are 5 or 6 computer hubs on the lobby floor with free internet. Some computers even have skype on them so you can call long distance if you bring your headphones. No printers though. Thereâ€™s also free internet in-room if you sign up for Wyndham rewards. Food: We didnâ€™t eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel. We had a car and went to Isamar bakery almost every day, we tried Antojitos one night, and La Parilla in the Luquillo kiosks. Thereâ€™s also a Walgreens on Route 3 east not too far from the hotel where you can get water and snacks for cheap. We also saw lot of fast food places like Mc Donalds, Burger King, KFC, Subway. See my reviews on the food for more info. Car Rental: We reserved a car through Enterprise for about $20/day so that we could do all the activities/excursions we wanted to. We also added on the loss damage waiver for an extra $19/day and we were glad we did since a lot of the drivers came about an inch from hitting us and potholes were everywhere. Thereâ€™s a place near Enterprise that has great empanadas if you are looking for good food once you land. Excursions: El Yunque was very close to our hotel and we only stayed there for less than two hours. We actually drove up further than we needed to and walked the trail south toward la Mina falls. We also did the Bio-bay kayaking with Akuaadventures. It was $45/pp plus tax. It was fairly easy to get to Las Croabas Park (the meeting site for kayaking) from the hotel using the directions from another kayaking company called kayaking puerto rico. You may want to bring a flash light as it can come in handy if you kayak into a mangrove. Flamenco Beach on Culebra Island was probably the best beach Iâ€™ve been to. Iâ€™ve only been to the beaches in San Diego, and one in Aruba and one in the Bahamas, and this one was by far the best. It was definitely worth the trip, with clear calm waters and white sand. It was also very clean and it wasnâ€™t very crowded the day we went. The food stands also sold water and tasty empanadas for a dollar or two. The drive from the hotel to the Fajardo port took about 35 minutes and we arrived early around 820. We caught the 9am ferry and had seats outside in the back. The ride took about 1.5 hrs. We then took the Flamenco beach bus shuttle for $3 pp to get to Flamenco beach. It's $2 pp return trip. I would have given the hotel a 5 if it didn't have that horrible bathroom smell. I know I should have said something about it, but I dont think a hotel that books you in a room with that kind of smell deserves a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 4 Families and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: -Buzz_77
Reviews.Content: OK, This is my first resort review and I have to get this off my chest. Folks, why don't you just write what you liked about a resort? Enough whining nonsense about what you didn't like. Who cares about your negative opinion. Focus on the positive and keep it as factual as you can, and if there is nothing positive you have to say, then shut-up and don't write anything. If one person liked the food and another ated it, well the information is totally and unequivocally useless because and therefore, I will have to find out myself. But, if I read a review and only one person commented positively about the food, well that explains more than 5 people saying food is good and 5 people saying it is bad. For example: Do write---Food was fresh and full of flavor. Do not write---Food was terrible. WTF is "terrible". Do not write---service was poor or slow. WTF is "poor or slow." Did your freakin bags come off the plane "fast"? Was everything else "slow", like how long it takes to cook a burger? Did the sun rise too "slow" for you?Get a clue on reality and base-line your experience on the way of life in that coutry/location. OK, onto my review... I booked a private villa for a fraction of the cost as a room. Look into it. With a family of 5, it was perfect and there was a full kitchen and laundry machines - packed light and did few loads of laundry. However, we spent most of our time at the resor. Pool is warm and clean. Beach is warm, small waves, and the sand is clean. Plenty of chairs. The food at the outdoor pool grill is fresh, tasteful, and well porportioned for price. The casino is pleasant and I do not gamble, but got free parking if I got my ticket stamped at casino. Heck, I wone $40 on roulet by accident - had no clue what I was doing, but a monkey can figure it out by casual observation. We rented a jeep from Dollar at the airport - that is a must if you want to get out and see the beautiful island. El Yunque is a must and provides an indication that the PR's gives a [--] about their environment. The rain forest is totally free, so money is not their incentive to preserve their treasure. Went to public beach - Luquillo. The water was the warmest, waves were almost non-existent, and the sand clean. We rented chairs and umbrella fr $10.
