One thing I noticed was the PR people are so nice, polite, and courtious. NO ONE bothered us on the beach to hustle us for anything-never. Went to Fajardo to go on Salty Dog catamaran - Nice pleasant crew, the food was cold cuts and very fresh. Snorkeling on the island was easy enough for my 6 yr old. They gave lessons. Another convenient thing about the area of PR I went to, was they have all the big box stores like Walmart and Walgreens to fullfill any needs. We also bought from local vendors as well. I will definitely go back to PR and the kids are still whining about going back this year 2009 (I wrote this late). But, we will try Punta Cana this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Caters to the Locals!”
Reviews.Author: LADB
Reviews.Content: Nice property, but is is on the North Coast of Puerto Rico, so the most is has to offer is a pretty beach. The surf is too rough for water activities. Obviously, then, resort activities should be all-important to the management here. They weren't. We arrived on Thanksgiving, and the Lobby was lavishly decorated, and a nice Buffet was in full swing. Everything went downhill from there. We were never given the Casino coupons all other registered guestes got upon arrival. We had to pay for the in-room internet that had been advertised as free in the online resort ads. There was a $100 credit that we were supposed to get at check-in, but we had to fight for it at check-out. We booked through Cheap Caribbean, who gave us a 24 hour number to call in case of problems. Forget about that! They don't ever answer, and don't respond to emails. Why say it caters only to locals? Because , after Thanksgiving was over, they closed all of the restaurants except one! Without ANY notice to guests. They would not prepare any items from any of the other menus. The management could have cared less about all of the rest of us staying there: they advertise a full array of amenities, but have few available for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach Resort Minutes from El Yunque / San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mpone
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort as part of a package available from [--]. Air from Chicago and 7 nights for $2100 and change. Fantastic deal and the hotel provided us with still more value. We were upgraded for free to a Junior Suite overlooking the ocean. We figure we saved about $5000 over retail booking. Here's a summary of our experience: - The resort is beautiful, the people friendly, the concierge will do just about anything for you, .... It is also quite empty right now so you have the place to yourself. Maybe more service staff than customers. No lines, great service. - Join the Wyndham Club and tell them you if you are celebrating a special event. I believe that was what got us the free upgrade when some others have not been successful. - The trade winds make the beach a sometimes very windy place. Move to the pool area or better yet plan for beaching it at Luquillo beach, just minutes away and in a protected cove. You can buy tropical drinks and rent two lounge chairs and an umbrella for the day for $20. - The hotel is nicely centered for active people who want to see some of the beautiful natural areas and also visit cities and towns. San Juan is 45 minutes west, a nature reserve is 30 minutes east, and a tropical rainforest (El Yunque) and large national park is 20 minutes south. - Rent a car. If you plan accordingly, you can miss the main traffic hours and get around pretty easily. We did not find driving that bad and you save a lot of money over taxis and hotel tours. Alternatively, the resort offers many bus tours to San Juan and the other local attractions. These are pricey though when compared to driving yourself. - It rains sporadically here. The resort is near El Yunque (a sizable mountain range and tropical rainforest). Come to grips with it or don't stay there. - Plan to eat at some of the fabulous local restaurants and eat local food. The resort food was ordinary. El Bohio near Cabezas de San Juan, and Antojitos and Don Pepe near the hotel were excellent. We hear the Parrot Club in Old San Juan is a "must do", though we did not get a chance to try it. - Remember: You are 45 minutes from San Juan. This resort is not in a city. You are pretty remotely located (though with amenities such as a spa and golf). The beach is windy. I suggest planning for transportation (a car or budgeting for side trips). - The resort will nickel and dime you, but this should not be an issue if you book through a discount agency like we did. Parking is $15-20 per day, wireless internet was (if I recall) $20 a day in your room, a fridge for the Junior Suite was a one-time $25 charge, and drinks were $10+ dollars each. You can access the internet from free desktops in the lobby. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Rent a car from the Airport so you can escape from this Money Pit”
Reviews.Author: charliemilllliken
Reviews.Content: On the short... The beach was nice. A mixed drink is $10.50. Don't trust the concierges. There's a free shuttle to Richie's restaurant. The TP is institutionally rough.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Opinion”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl1003
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick 4 day get away at The Rio Mar and the people can't do enough to make your stay comfortable. While the economy could be partly to blame, not all the restaurants were open but given the limited choices the restaurants were all good. You should have dinner at the Grille Room, the food was excellent. The spa treatments were competively priced and the services again were very good. If you have a massage, ask for Omar....he was great! It is a bit far from the airport (about 45 minutes) and you should probably rent a car if you do not want to be confined to the resort because it is in a non-taxi zone so taxis are VERY expensive. We paid $45 PER PERSON each way to get to and from the airport. If you have a car, you can also go out and explore what's around. My only real negative experience on this trip was that the walls are paper thin and you can hear every single thing in the next room and unfortunately at 2:30 in the morning we were awakened by alot of noise, which turned out to be a leak in their room. I must say even without all of the loud talking in that room, I suspect all the walls are paper thin. Without sounding crazy, we could actually hear the fizz sound when they were opening cans. When I inquired in the morning, the manager was apologetic and later that evening sent a bottle of wine and platter of fruit with a letter apologizing for the inconvenience. It is something little like that that goes a long way....it was just nice to see management so on top of things. Overall, it was a good place to stay for a short visit. ps Enjoy the igunas that roam around poolside!!

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff: You have to be out of your mind”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerCT59
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit over the past 10 years to the Rio Mar. The first two under Westin management and most recently under Wyndham management. First problem: terrible value for money. We were 6 people: my wife and I, our three kids (20, 18 and 15) and my oldest son's girlfriend. We needed three rooms and the cost for 5 nights was $15,000. Yes. Rooms were $559 per night (we were promised an upgrade but never received it. To add inslulst to injury, there is a 14% service charge which we were never told about when we checked in. Breakfast was included for some but not us even though our reservation said "best rate plan available".We booked through the Wyndam 800 number. Second problem was service. Although many people were very helpful, staff was inconsistent. For example, when we checked in the room was very damp. We waited almost one hour for house keeping to come to the room. When the supervisor came he expressed suprise that we were in the room as the front desk knew the room had problems. Two nights at dinner it took 60 minutes for appetizers to come. (although Palio is very good). The rooms are quite run down for the price. If you are a member of myWyndham, you get free internet. I signed up just after registering and was told by the manager that it is was too late to get the free internet. Add another $20 per night. Third, the rooms are definitely run down as is the golf course. Golf is $200 dollars and the course condition does not come close to making this worthwhile. The pro shop does not tell you about the wet course conditions. Finally, when checking out I asked how to get a better rate. They said if you call the hotel directly you get a better rate. Thanks, Wyndham Westin, please come back

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Wyndam”
Reviews.Author: barbjchris
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 12/18 through 12/26. We really enjoyed the property. I have a disability. The proximity to the rainforest allowed my boyfriend to go hiking, while I relaxed on the beach. The surf was rough, and I spent a great deal of time bodysurfing. The staff was great. We had a few minor problems, poor water pressure and air conditioning that was erratic. Those minor annoyances did nothing to diminish the experience. I read reviews before travelling. Much was made about the "expensive" food. At Maribella, the food was great at around $25 a plate. I thought it was a great value. Staying this far from San Juan, a car was very handy. We drove down to the bottom of the hill (rt 3) and the little bakery there sells HUGE breakfast sandwiches for $4. They also served subs, pizza, very reasonable. We did rent a 'frig, and got beverages at Walmart. That saved us a bunch. The local beer (Modella) is very good, and costs $1.25 at the gas stations. Pick some up, it is, I believe $6 at the resort. We loved the view, the beach, it really felt like a resort, away from everything. The coqui frogs sang, the iguanas roamed around. Great time. There is, however, no night life at the resort, if that is what you are looking for, you won't find it. GREAT TIME, great excursions, do not miss the biolumenescent bay. We got a great deal on Priceline, and even if we did not, this place was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean villas are quiet and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mominny
Reviews.Content: Looking for a quiet, family villa, try the Ocean Villas. Ocean 16 is the newest property. We booked thru www.wheretostay.com (ask for Andrew). They took great care of us. Concierge on property is just okay. You'll need a rental car and help with restaurants since there are only a few on the property. Try Pasion...(near El Conquistador Hotel) and Aguaviva & Pikayo (in Art Museum) in San Juan. Be sure to go to El Yungue Rain Forest and do bioluminenscent kayak tour. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Awesome! Awesome”
Reviews.Author: LEllen12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a two bedroom condo on the grounds of the Rio Mar Resort. It was in a gated community called Cluster 3. It was a fabulous condo filled with every amenity. It had 2 and 1/2 baths, large terrace, living room, family room, dining room, open kitchen, master bedroom with huge his and her closets and a second bedroom with two double beds and a double futon couch. We had 3 t.v.'s and all the laundry facilities. The condo was fully stocked with all the necessary laundry and cleaning supplies as well as a kitchen stocked with all the supplies you could need to cook a gourmet meal. It was super clean and quiet! We rented a car which is a total necessity. The condo came with a golf cart which was a convenient way to get to the beach. The beach and pools of the hotel are 3/4 mile away from the condo but it is a lovely walk or an easy golf cart ride. There is so much to do on the island of Puerto Rico. We hiked up to the clouds in the rain forest and then down to La Mina Falls. We were gone all day, we had a blast! We tried Snuba (highly recommend). We rented bicycles and cycled on the boardwalk in Pinones. We saw a professional Puerto Rican baseball game in Carolinas. We kayaked in the Bio Bay in Fajardo. We spent a day on Luquillo Beach. Everything exceeded our expectations! We can't wait to go back. The grocery store is just down the street. It has exotic choices as well as our recognized brands. We felt very safe. We never had anyone approach us to buy anything. The weather was awesome! We have 3 kids age 10 -15. We all had a marvelous time.

Reviews.Title: “A great family get away!”
Reviews.Author: JulDL
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (all adults) recently enjoyed 5 wonderful nights at the Rio Mar Wyndham resort. We travel quite a bit and have a lot of hotels/resorts to compare it to and although the rooms themselves could use some updating, we all agreed that the Rio Mar is great and would recommend it to anyone. The resort is located in a gated community with nice grounds, which allowed for a nice areas to roam around outside (which is especially nice if you like to walk/run like we do). From check-in to check-out we experienced the wonderful service that the Rio Mar has to offer. I will say, you do pay for it as there is a 14% service fee tacked on to the bill at the end of your stay, but at least we felt like we got what we paid for. Every staff person we walked by greeted us, employees (especially Angel) were always available at the beach to help us get chairs or set up an umbrella, the towel hut staff gladly switched our our damp towels for fresh ones when needed, and the valet provided us with cold water at the front door when we got back from our morning walks/runs. We did eat most of our meals on site at the resort and very much enjoyed both of our dinners at Palios (exceptional service too!) and Shimas. The breakfast buffet at Marbella was a treat one morning as well. We enjoyed the convenience of being able to get a quick bagel or muffin at ERL (near the lobby) and both Seabreeze and the Tiki Bar provided delicious lunches while overlooking the beach or pool as well as good service. As far as price, we didn't find the prices particularly high, especially since we were at a resort, but as I said, we do travel a lot and perhaps are used to resort prices. The area that the resort is in itself is perfect. A short 35-45 min car ride to Old San Juan and less than 15 minutes to the El Yunque rain forest. My recommendation would be to rent a car because you can easily drive and navigate yourself around the rain forst. The staff at the rain forest visitor center was most helpful in pointing us in the right direction of trails and waterfalls. A visit to Old San Juan is also worth the trip - the streets are nice to walk through as well as a visit to the fort. If you are looking for a wonderful meal - try DragonFly! The Rio Mar is a perfect place for families, or couples too! It is not overwhelmingly big but big enough. There were many families with kids there, however there is also an adult pool if you want to relax without a lot of kids running around. I also have never been to a beach with so many chairs! Overall the Rio Mar is a wonderful place for a vacation and Puerto Rico is the perfect spot for a mix of relaxation and activity in nice weather!

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure I Would Go Again ...”
Reviews.Author: ReadytoGoNyc
Reviews.Content: I have never been so happy to return from holiday -ever ! We just returned yesterday, Jan 3, 2009 stayed from Dec 30, 2008. We went on holiday break, many teens and young children were there. Wyndham/ Rio Mar had a game room but closed it on Friday, 01.01.09. Plenty of kids around -bored...There is nothing for them to do after dark. The pool and beach is pitch black and the bats start flying above as soon as the night hits. An indoor pool would solve that issue. The food/taxi was too expensive (same food as in states) and the staff aloof at times but still pleasant. Maybe Wyndham should make this an all inclusive resort or lower the prices. The locals/staff mentioned that many items are overpriced. The beach was nice although it could have been a bit cleaner. I am a Wyndham owner and have frequent many resorts and this one was not one its best. I was told by Wyndham/ Rio Mar sales it will mirror Bonnett Creek, where I hold my deed. It will offer more ammenties (indoor pool ) and activities on the property. However, my son did enjoy the pool and beach as did other families. I had a ok time...Will probably go again, but when there are improvements that mirror other Wyndam Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the rain forest”
Reviews.Author: msneedle
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to El Yunque, this hotel is perfect as it has a beach and it's not too far from the rain forest. Staff was very professional and friendly. The lobby is gorgeous. There are two pools -- a smaller adult lap pool and another larger pool with a small water slide. Lounge chairs there are very comfortable. Grounds are beautiful. Our room was decorated very tastefully and the beds were probably one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. You can definitely tell that this hotel has been around for a while, but things are well maintained. I guess when Wyndam took over, they only renovated the lobbies and not the rooms. But they were still comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Go Back Here--Visible Signs of Mold!”
Reviews.Author: freckledash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our entire family over our Christmas vacation...we were less than happy about our stay. We should have known on the first day we arrived, that our stay was going to go downhill from there. Our room smelled like mildew/mold from the get-go. We thought that it would go away, since the maid had just mopped the floors and such, but it stayed the entire time...so bad that we looked under our carpet in the room and saw visible signs of nasty mold! The caulking around the tub in our bathroom was also mildew-ridden...something that could be easily taken care of if the facility cared about getting rid of it. The staff was less than accomodating, here's why: Dinners took at least 2 hours to get through because of the slowness; the waiters were flat-out rude to us...gave us attitude when we needed to split the bill up a couple of different ways; I ordered a steak cooked medium-well and it came back raw with red meat dripping out the inside (the waitress was so scarce to come back to the table after the food came, that I ate what I could of the steak and left the rest...the waitress asked how our meal was and I told her how raw my steak was and she looked like she could care less...never even offered to right the matter!!!); One of the first nights we were there, we went to the casino around 1:30 AM to play blackjack...we asked for a couple of drinks since it was advertised to be open until at least 2 AM...they starting rambling off in Spanish to each other and then refused to give us drinks...we took our money chips off the table and got up to leave since they seemed to not care about our business and they flat out MOCKED us as we walked out of the casino!!! They were making fun of us so bad, that we refused to spend any money in their casino for the whole rest of the trip. After that incident we went to the front desk to complain and they said that they could not help us at all because the casino was under different management than the rest of the hotel...we told them that the manager was the one mocking us in the first place!!! The front desk promised to call us to settle the matter and NEVER DID!; On the beach they have some umbrellas set up for guests to use, but you have to stay in the middle of everyone and cannot take your umbrella past a certain palm tree (we tried to use an umbrella where our family was set up, which, mind you, was still DIRECTLY in front of the resort!!! and they were quick to come and snatch it up); every day on the beach it would rain for about 10-15 minutes and people would scurry for cover...while most people scurried, we usually ended up staying put...which gave us ample times to see the hotel beach crew shaking out towels to see what people had left behind...we saw them take someone's sunglasses, and who knows what else...they looked like they were scavenging for items that people left behind!!!; The prices of drinks were OUTRAGEOUS! So expensive that we took a $20 cab ride down the street to buy beer because at the resort they were $6 per beer, mixed drinks were $10+ and if you asked for an extra shot, they charged an extra $5; The lunch menus at all the restaurants only carried the same things, so we ended up eating turkey clubs and chicken fajitas the whole week for lunch because they were the only things on the menu we could find that we liked; Overall, the staff was un-accomodating, and for the money that we spent there, we expected 5-Star service, which was nothing close to what we got. DO NOT STAY HERE! We will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 bedroom villa”
Reviews.Author: MLK76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa within the grounds of the Rio Mar Beach Resort. It was not connected to the hotel so we were away from the noise and clutter of the casino! If you are looking for a great relaxing get away, it is perfect. Good for a small family or for a couple. The apartment was lovely and we could fit our pack 'n' play into the open closet so it was out of the way. The 2 couches in the living room can easily be used as beds for small kids too. The apartment is within a small cluster and while we were there (over Christmas for 1 week), it was really quiet. There is a pool right there (a little cool!) and it is close to one of the best local beaches (Loquillo Beach). Definitely rent a car. You will need it and there are some great places to go and see (Old San Juan, El Yunque Rain Forest, etc). There is free parking outside the villa - a huge bonus to the large hotel where they charge at least $20 a day. We found 2 fantastic local restaurants. Antojito's, down the bottom of the street (of the main hotel entrance) and a fantastic local terrace restaurant at up the top of the same street. This one has great views! Te only downside of the villa we were in was the mosquitoes, but I guess you get them anywhere. Bring insect repellant! Richard co-ordinated our stay and he was easy going and very helpful. Margie owns the apartment and she is wonderful too. Both were a great source of knowledge about the area and offered great advice. When we left, we felt like we were leaving our Puerto Rican family!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: theperfectplace77
Reviews.Content: We were having a family vacation--16 in all. The grounds and the oceanfront were beautiful. I enjoyed the Sea Breeze Restaurant for lunch--would be great if it was open for dinner. They were open for dinner some nights but with a mediocre buffet--and high prices for what you got. There was mold that had a terrible smell in my son and daughter in laws room. This resort is in the hospitality business and I don't think they really get it. I don't mind paying high prices if you get what you pay for. i.e. Caneel Bay, Galley Bay, Jumby Bay, Cap Juluca but I feel I was taken big time. We ate at the Grille. Food was good. But it took a painfully long time to get since our dinner reservation was at 8:30. After that we were to take the shuttle back (runs every 10 minutes). An hour latter it arrived. The group on the bus went en masse to the manager to complain . The manager on call that night was combative and wanted us to talk to the shuttle company--passing it off. The next day another manager comped the shuttle group 20% off their dinner and a free transfer back to the airport. I was never so glad to get back from a vacation. A little entertainment--they have three to four "beach sweepers" the hotel has hired to clean the beach. They are looking for your valuables. They go around shaking out towels (not there job) hoping some valuables will fall to the sand where a big, fat guy sweeps it up.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, but not that great.”
Reviews.Author: HeathW
Reviews.Content: Booked in May 2008 through CheapCarribbean.com: $1200 for 2 of us, airfare included from NYC. Upgraded from standard room to "Ocean View" for extra $50 per person. The deal was the best part. The most annoying part of the trip was the constant sales pitch by people throughout the resort to buy into their "Vacation Experiences Packages"... essentially time shares with Wyndham. If it was once at check in, fine. But getting towels at the pool, asking the concierge for assistance with local shopping, and even a trip to the spa all required conversations about why we didn't want to go listen to the formal sales pitch, even if it meant getting a free night's stay or spa credit. We would rather have done without the need to justify why we don't want to buy time shares once a day. Resort seemed OK, but not that luxurious at all. Maybe it was better when Westin ran the property. We were "honeymooners" so they gave us a nice little upgrade to a "junior suite" from the "ocean view" we had booked as well as a complimentary bottle of decent, but cheap white wine in our room. Nice little touch, I'll admit. Our first room smelled too musky / mildewy to even stay. We transfered to another before even getting our bags delivered. The furniture smelled, even in our second room, of mildew. I guess the humidity just settles into everything. Also, I would have thought that an upgrade from Ocean View to Junior Suite would have still had an Ocean view, but our room couldn't see past the palm trees and pathways just adjacent to the building. The resort was half empty our first few days, but got busy with families toward the end, the week before Christmas. No complaints, just identifying the crowd. Thank god though for the adult only pool. No, not that kind of adult (fortunately, given the crowd). We ate at the Italian restaurant in the hotel, Palio's, on our first night. Food was OK. Pricey, but reasonable for a resort. They clearly made the effort with the food to justify the prices. Nice presentations, good selection to choose from. Being that we're from NYC though, we're used to better food for the prices they charged here. Not a big deal. Key Point! RENT A CAR Better than anything at the resort are the local restaurants you can go to either by cab or by rental car. For the price of the shuttle R/T from the airport, you can rent a car for the week and have lots more freedom. The concierge recommended King Fish (pretty good) and La Parilla (AWESOME!). There are these little roadside strips of restaurants the locals eat at. You may not be adventurous enough to try them, but it's so worth it. For lunch, you can pretty much pick any one and get good cheap Caribbean, Puerto Rican, or Mexican food. We stopped our first day on the way to the resort to one of these little places (a light or two past the resort on Rt 3) for lunch... $20 for 2 Burritos, 2 Beers, and a fried/stuffed plaintain appatizer, just to try it. Mmm... Back to La Parilla for a second... worth the second mention. Go there for dinner. We're a couple of foodies from NYC, and would venture back there, even though we don't plan on going back to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NittanyTravel
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Family vacation with two children, great location, great amenities. Received Wyndham Rewards upgrade to ocean front room overlooking the pool, but because the room was booked through a third party, AmEx, was not comped the internet and wasn't told this until check-out. Food was good, as stated in other reviews, it was expensive, but you are at a resort. Snacks, drinks, etc can be purchased at a small grocery at turn from route 3 into the property. Also a bakery there with great breakfast sandwiches. Rented a car, self parking was slightly inconvenient in an attempt to get you to use the valet service. The rental car was great, took side trips to the rain forest and old San Juan. Also went to several restraunts off property, Richies and Kiosk #2. Both were fun for atmosphere and the food was good but also not cheap. Pool was well maintained, clean, towels were plentyful and comfy. Beach was clean and staff always available to help with chairs, drinks, food etc. All staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Big Problems With Wyndham Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: mrc1222
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night vaation booked through Cheap Caribbean. This resort is in real trouble. The resort is very pretty and well maintained. But here are the criticisms: 1: We booked a 2 bed room. Upon arrival we were told that they were out of them. Upon my refusal to accept one bed, Miraculously, they found a 2 bedded room. 2: Other than the breakfasts, which were pricey but good, the food was a big disappointment. One major restaurant, Shimas, was closed during the entire stay. The major italian restaurant, Palio was a big disappointment. They charge through the roof for really ordinary food - and at times lousy food. For example, I ordered an Osso Bucco over Risotto. My culinary experience tells me that Risotto should be soft and creamy. This rice was crunchy like nuts. When I complained the waiter infomed me that the chef said the Risotto was properly prepared, crunchy. The other restaurant offered just, average over priced hot dogs, burgers, dry chicken breast concoctions, etc. 3: Shops. I needed some over the counter medicine. And I needed it badly. The sign on the convenience shop listed the hours as 9Am to 11PM. I went down at 9:30 PM and it was locked shut. I went to the desk to complain. They told me that the shop closed at 7PM. When I told them about the sign, at first they did not believe me. I had to go over to the shop and snap a digital photo of it and show it to them. Their answer was that good old shrug of the shoulders. Since I needed the medication, I asked them to shuttle me to the drug store in town. They refused and I had to pay $15.00 for a round trip taxi. 4: Last but not least was the rip-off I discovered upon check out. The night before check out I went to the desk to check my bill. The bill included 5 days parking charges and taxes. I did not have a car. It also included round trip airport shuttle, even though I had prepaid it through Cheap Caribbean. The clerk removed them from the bill. The morning of check out I received an "Express Checkout" packet on the floor of my room. I checked it and there again was the $240.00+ charge for parking and airport shuttle. Now I was fortunate that I read the express checkout rather than allow them to just put it through my credit card. There was a large crowd there attending a meeting. The costs were obviously picked up by the expense accounts. I wonder how many of them left with express checkout with those extra charges not checked. Obviously, we will never return to that place. Morton Covitz

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service...but...”
Reviews.Author: zoocq
Reviews.Content: Dec. 5-9 The trip was a great price through Hotwire..which was a great trip organizer! The resort was beautiful! I cannot say enough about the cleanliness of the grounds, the pools, the rooms...everywhere there was someone working inside and out. The food was outstanding in Palios, as was the service...Hector, our waiter, was superb and we enjoyed our evening with him! The only complaint was the meager wine list, of which from four choices they were out of all four...but graciously made up for it with an expensive wine at the lower price. The Grille was another matter...poor service, poor atmosphere, the meat was good, i.e steak and chicken, but little else to commend it for the price. A BIG complaint was on our third night. At 2AM there were a group of drunken partiers outside our room in the kiddie pool. We called security and they did chase them away. Alas, they came back and after 3AM we called security again. They did not show up again to remove the drunken young adults. At 4:45AM, my husband went down to the pool himself, I called security. My husband ended doing security's job...but we lost a night's sleep. We were reimbursed, but the sad story was that the young adults said security only showed up once and security claimed they were there twice?? Bottom line...the prices are outrageous for food, services and the spa. Next time I will do an all inclusive as the over $1000 extra I spent would have been better served. There were positive things that I mentioned. But I would not return...too far out of the way of anything to do.

Reviews.Title: “great stay...”
Reviews.Author: mlvhess
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Rio Mar is great!!! Good food, beautiful beach and pool area, excellent service. We just got back on this weekend from a week long stay, and we have no complaints about the resort. I was expecting some problems after reading sme reviews, but I have to say that the people with any bad experiences with the hotel must have extremely high expectations!!! If you want a great meal with an amazing view, take the shuttle to Richies. We also took a cab to Don Pepe's (AMAZING food...also you get 2 complemetry drinks with a pass from the conceirge desk, but the cab will run you $20 roundtrip). Definetly buy some beer on the way from the hotel, as drinks are a bit pricey at the resort. We had alot of fun at the casino, and actually won some money. Also, ask if there are any spa specials. We ended up sitting though a 2 hr sales presentation for time shares, but the 30 minutes massage we got as a gift was well worth it. If you want a relaxing vacation, this is the place to go. Would go back again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: After a 45 minute drive from SJU airport, checking in at Wyndham Rio Mar we (as Wyndham ByRequest Members) were upgraded from a Junior Oceanview Suite to a Full Oceanview Suite looking over the well maintained grounds and pool area towards the Atlantic Ocean. Our preferred ByRequest drink and snack awaited us, our room preferences were met, so we were very satisfied with the arrival experience. This is a very large resort with numerous pools, restaurants, bars, a casino, a golf course and a very nice beach. In contrast to other reviewers, we did not find food and drink overly expensive, given this is a 4-5 star resort. What's the point of staying at such a standard and then drive 5 minutes to a local bakery to save some bucks instead of having the lavish 19.99 USD full breakfast buffet at "Marbella" restaurant? You should have booked Hampton Inn right away! Dinner at "Palio" on both nights was delicious and is highly recommended. The Maitre d's at both "Marbella" and "Palio" were not overly friendly, but those were the only people we met who had an attitude. As others recommended, we did the Wyndham Vacation promotion, which brought us a 75 USD credit to our room account, but cost us two hours of (attempted) brainwash by a sales representative. The free two nights offered are by the way not good for Wyndham, but for a very limited number of lower standard chain hotels (Choice, Days Inn). My advice: if you're not very, very needy, spend those two hours elsewhere! Furthermore they tell you to bring your camera as there would be wonderful photo opportunities touring the property. In fact, you stay the full two hours in a 7th floor lounge with no photo opportunities at all. That said, the Wyndham is a great beach resort and we would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: MAA2008
Reviews.Content: What a great resort. We just returned from a 1 week stay during Thanksgiving week, went with my husband and 2 small children (ages 5 and 2). This is an excellent resort for families, especially with small children. There is so much for kids to do, from the water slide (which is a huge hit with all of the kids!) to the iguana feeding to the hourly kid-oriented activities (lawn games, relay races, bingo, etc) to the kids club (where you can even just sign out games and balls and beach toys without having to utilize or pay for any of the camp). The beach is right next to the pool area and is very nice (although the sand is a darker color than I'm used to). There are multiple restaurants to choose from, several of which are very family oriented with extensive children's menus ($6 for child entree). But what I think sets this resort apart is the service. This was 5-star service, the type of service I have only encountered once when we stayed at a Four Seasons in Miami. The staff is just exceptional: friendly, helpful, attentive, and just plain nice. I strongly recommend joining the Wyndham By Request Program before you arrive- it's easy to sign up on line, just make sure that you call the hotel ahead of time and let them know to put your BY Request information on your hotel reservation, so they know when you check in. This definitely personalized the service- we received a free room upgrade to an ocean-view (without asking), had our own personal concierge calling us several times during the week to check in and see if we needed anything, and were brought wine and snacks to our room after check-in and the night before check-out. Nice perks. I can't say enough wonderful things about Jesus at the Concierge Desk and his very nice colleague Angel. Both went out of their way to help me with my requests, they are great at making their guests feel special. I also recommend the golf course if you have kids- we took our kids to the driving range and the pitch and putt and got to ride around in golf carts for a while, which was fun! The rooms are very nice, the hotel itself is beautiful, the food is decent (expensive, but nothing out of the ordinary for a 4-star island resort, and you can find more reasonable priced items at Marbella and the Iguana Pub). My only complaint for the whole week was that I could hear the people in the adjoining room just carrying on a normal conversation, but I never complained about it to the front desk, I'm sure they would have moved us if we had. Overall, this was a great vacation, I would definitely recommend it (esp if you have young children), and we would definitely go back. I think my 5 year old summed it up best when he asked me if we could move to Puerto Rico and live at the Rio Mar forever. What more can you say?

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: coolshot
Reviews.Content: I would rate this as one of the nicest places I have stayed. We got an excellent deal @ $130/night (bookinhotels.com) when the average listed price is somewhere around ($250-$350/night) - well worth the price-tag. 30 minute drive from San Juan airport, located right on beach with excellent grounds and gardens. Check-in was quick and pleasant; staff was gracious to upgrade us to a ocean-view room for the same price, however the view of the ocean was at an angle (we didn't mind that). Rooms are large, had a flat-screen tv (hardly watched tv), internet-connection, large well-lit, clean and nice bathroom, large balcony with a chairs and table. (We personally like the bath & body works toileteries that Wyndham provides, better than the ones in Hilton). The Wyndham's mantra is "service" and service we recieved was excellent. Unlike other hotels, beach towels were really soft, you could even take them to you room and not necessarily need to drop it off the @ the towel hut before going to your hotel room. Pools are great, separate one for adults, 2nd pool even had a small water-slide - how cool! We liked the breakfast, you do not necessarily have to eat buffet - b/f from menu was equally good, filling and cheaper. Conceirge desk is helpful but avoid getting talked into a timeshare presentation, which would eat up your day. Richie's cafe which seems to be very popular with staff and others, is overpriced and average, view from the cafe is good though. Downside of staying @ Rio Mar is that your eating choices outside of the hotel are limited unless you are ready to drive 30 minutes to either San Juan or Fajardo. Would recommend having a rental car unless you plan on staying @ the resort at all times. Do the tours yourself - El Yunque, Bacardi etc.. you will save a bunch of money.

Reviews.Title: “clean friendly but expensive food/drinks”
Reviews.Author: virginiahoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days. The staff was VERY attentive, rooms were clean, housekeeping delivered items quicker than anywhere I've stayed. We went with our 2 kids (12 & 9) the adult pool is great to get away from little ones splashing. My kids LOVED the pool / slide/ iguanas roaming around. The views are lovely. The beach had plenty of chairs, umbrellas and they had sand toys for the kids. The surf was great 5 /7 days we swam. It got rough the last 2 days. We rented a car, went to San Juan, Fajardo, and several other places. Taxi's are very expensive and there is SO much to do here. Just the 2 way trip to /from the airport for 4 people would have been $240. Our rental for the week was less than that. Because of the car we went out to eat every night. LaPerilla #2 kioskos is great, Richies, several others close by but not walkable. We rented a fridge for the room ($25) week) went to Amigos & Walmart to stock up and saved a TON of money on beer, rum, OJ, cereal, ect...) the breakfast buffet in the hotel is $20 day. A bowl of cold cereal is $7. Beer is $7, rum drinks $10+ each... We went horseback riding, took a snorkle trip through East Wind Adventures (awesome crew/ food/ snorkle trip to Little Palmino) went to the rain forest, Old San Juan for a day and generally just drove around the eastern part of Puerto Rico. A few things: take cash for gasoline, cash for the rain forest, people drive a bit aggressive - not one person used a blinkerthat I saw. Most people speak english. Be at the airport AT LEAST 1 hr prior to your departure, trust me...we got stuck in a bit of traffic and got to the airport with 50 minutes to spare...the flight had closed BUT we still made it on. It was a real hassle :-) Do not be afraid of the roadside food! It is some of the BEST on the island. When you see a broken down bus on the side of the road, pop up tent and grill - STOP or you'll miss some great food! Also have a coco frio while you are there! We have traveled extensively, with and without our kids, we never stay in the same place twice if we revisit a place, I'd stay here again... enough planned stuff for the kids at the family pool, hair braiding, sand castle building, organized volleyball, dance lessons and a dive in movie.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive resort”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights as part of a large conference group. The resort was very pleasant and well maintained and close to El Yunque in our rental car. Although the people without rental cars were a little stuck as the only way out is taxis or shuttle to the airport if you have no car. We drove to Fajardo one day to take the ferry to Vieques and the hotel is only about a 30 to 40 minute drive from there. I'd highly recommend Vieques. The hotel was a little on the pricey side - especially when they add on resort fees and even a bellboy charge whether you use the bellboy or not. The air conditioning in the public areas meant that the place was a bit chilly to say the least. And when we checked in our keys didn't work and we were given another room eventually. But apart from those little niggles, we had a lovely time here. The food isn't cheap but you can order pizza in the bar for $13 if you don't want a full meal. Though if you have a hire car there are other cheaper places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surpised”
Reviews.Author: w0rking_2_travel
Reviews.Content: Very nice 4 star hotel with your typical sized hotel room, rooms are nothing special but sufficient. The grounds, pools, and beach are very well kept. Beach chairs and pool chairs were overly abundant but it was November and the hotel was maybe 75% full. Some reviews talked down the beach, donâ€™t expect crystal blue water with white sand, itâ€™s more of a fine brown sand but kept very clean by the staff. You will find â€˜stuffâ€™ in the water but itâ€™s typical seaweed, no signs of jellyfish or other offensive items in the water and I did spend a lot of time body surfing. I definitely recommend a rental car, the money spent on the car will be easily made up in food and excursion savings. Save the $70/person rain forest bus trip and drive yourself. Stop at the El Yunque welcome center for $3/person and get the maps to all the rain forest attractions there. We did the trail to the waterfall with a 7 and 4 year old, took about 30 minutes to get there. We beat the bus trip people by 20 minutes to the water fall and had the area to ourselves with about 5 other people. Once they showed up it got very crowded. If you hike to the water fall take a bathing suit, a towel to dry off, and water. You will not find anything to drink on the way, you must take everything. Rocks are very slippery and I would recommend sandals in the water but you donâ€™t want to have to hike back with wet sandals. I recommend sneakers for the hike and not a cheap sandal. The Fort San Felipe del Morro in old San Juan was worth the trip, kids thought it was a castle and found it interesting, again save the bus trip and drive there, entry fee was $6/person. IF YOU HAVE A GPS WITH US MAPS, MOST LIKELY PEURTO RICO WILL BE IN THERE !!! We took our Garmin Nuvi 200 and it had everything in it, Rain Forest, del Morro, etc. Food â€“ we typically donâ€™t eat dinner at hotels because the food is blah and overpriced. We ate out every night with the kids at local restaurants and saved a lot of money. Richieâ€™s at the top of the hill near the entrance to Rio Mar was good but didnâ€™t have a kids menu, they kids ended up splitting a $30 rib plate. Dinners were good and the view was nice. Puerto Rican restaurant where 968 meets route 3 had good food but was very slow, waited about 1 hour for food after we ordered, they operate on local time. Kiosk #2 â€“ if you take route 3 east towards Luquillo about 2 miles east on the left hand side of the route 3 youâ€™ll see what looks like a long row of shacks and bars. Each one has a number and on a recommendation we ate at kiosk #2, had two fish dishes that were very good with too much food that we couldnâ€™t finish our plates. Donâ€™t be scared by some of the shacks, some look very rough and shady, just drive by and park in front of the one you want. We found #2 to be clean, friendly and noticed about 4 other families from Rio Mar there. If you like Mexican you must try Lolitaâ€™s, it was so good we went back a second time. Food is authentic Mexican and cheap. For example tacos are $1.75 and the 2 burrito plate was $8. Maps and GPS didnâ€™t have the location correct, if you head east on route 3, you must go about 2 miles past downtown Luquillo, itâ€™s in a little strip mall next to Condom World. Parking, donâ€™t waste your time with valet parking, itâ€™s $30/day and it takes forever to get your car. Do the self park for $15/day. The rooms have the mini bar fridge left in the room but empty. Ours worked so we stocked up at the super market on route 3 and it kept everything cold. Sign up for Wyndham Rewards online before you go. You get free in room internet and a few other perks but make sure they take off the 14.95 daily internet charge when you check out. They try to slip it in to see if you arenâ€™t paying attention.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jandr04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Rio Mar. We are generally very adventurous, independent travelers and prefer someplace smaller with more charm, but decided to book at the Rio Mar because our top priority on this trip was to unwind and we wanted someplace both on the beach and with a spa. After 4 nights at the Rio Mar, we definitely felt relaxed! PRO: Great location (10 minutes from the El Yunque Rainforest), right on the beach, two pools (one is adults only), friendly and helpful staff, on-site spa, very family friendly. CON: Very expensive. We got discounted rooms through Priceline, otherwise, we would never have stayed here. Prices in the restaurants, bars, and spa are outrageous, especially after taxes and resort fees are added. A buffet breakfast for two, with taxes and tip came out to $50. And 50 minute massages, with taxes and tip, were $150. We ate virtually all our meals at local restaurants (the concierge had menus and printed directions for almost every local eatery). Overall, a great vacation. I would recommend the resort to anyone looking to relax or traveling with kids. Definitely become a Wyndham Rewards member. Even though the resort can't give you Reward points if you book through a third party, they still honored the room upgrade and put a fruit plate in the room at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel- Drinks were expensive”
Reviews.Author: rjolie123
Reviews.Content: We got there and they upgraded our room to a suite which was fantastic! The drinks were super expensive, $8 for a beer that was 10 oz. We got beer from a gas station and put it in the fridge or in a ice bucket and we saved tons of money. There is a small restuarant right when you turn to go into the hotel and the food was excellent and better priced. The pool was fantastic and the beach was great. There are many sand dollars in the water which are neat to find. The casino has decent tables and there was a couple of things to do at night. I would suggest this hotel for couples more than singles. It was a very nice and relaxing vacation. If you want to go to Calabra go early (at least 2 hours)...we missed the ferry because we arrived 45 minutes before take off.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but dissapointed with concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: hooventood7
Reviews.Content: I have worked as a concierge in many 5 star hotels so I know what is going on behind the scenes at the concierge desk and I was not impressed at how they were operating. We were there only one day and night and my wife and I wanted to take a bioluminescent kayak tour that evening, but the concierge staff said their tour did not run on that particular day. Now I know for a fact that there are many tours that operate not just the one they use, (probably gives them the most commission, I know this as I am a concierge) but they flat out refused to book another one, or call another one on my behalf, or even provide me with the numbers. They acted like they were not aware of any others but any 5 star hotel concierge would know this. I paid to use the internet myself and paid to call from the room. Even though they would not get any commission they still have to help me find another tour. Worthless and upsetting. However the hotel was beautiful and my room was lovely and large despite paying very little. And the Front desk staff was nice as well. Doorman were lazy

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: mikeamy
Reviews.Content: We booked this using points with wyndham vacations we were going to stay one night but didn't want to leave and stayed for two Dont know how anyone can give a negative review At check in we were upgraded from garden view to ocean view at no cost Room had 2 queens, large flat panel cable tv and well decorated beds were very comf. the view was unbeleivable Resort was well staffed and was A+ very polite Live intertainment at beach bar even on a Wed. night Hardly anyone at beach, lounge chairs aval. we even laid out in the hammocks at the beach edge Pools were very nice and clean A+ Even the pool towels were top notch We felt very safe at resort We didn't eat at resort mainly because of other reviews stating very $ but resturants were packed So many places to dine within 10-20 min casino was fun,didn't lose much shops were very expensive go into old san juan to shop This was our 5th year going to PR and plan on staying next year at rio mar Again I dont know how anyone can give a bad review to rio mar I'm glad we didn't lisen to them

Reviews.Title: “Bad experiance during and after checkout”
Reviews.Author: djaganna
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from october 17-23, 2008. I was attending a scientific meeting and had booked my stay using office credit card. Initially I had given my personal credit card for booking the room. During the check out I requested them to charge the lodging to my office credit card which they did. However, when I received my statement from my personal credit card, I found they had charged 2 days of lodging my personal credit card too. I tried to call Wydham Rio Mar but the people from accounting never bother to answer. I called my credit card company to place that charge as disputed and am still waiting for Wyndham Rio Mar to call me back. So far they have not responded. It is shame that such a big hotel has problem responding to real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “nothing to bring us back”
Reviews.Author: swim1Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We were glad we read the reviews before we went to PR and signed up for the Wyndham rewards. The outside grounds and pool areas were beautiful and clean at all times. The inside of the hotel was sooo cold and the rooms were average. We had an ocean view. Many people had trouble with their room cards and trying to unlock their doors.One time we made 3 trips down to front desk until it worked. Then later in the week, the cards failed again. The cappucino colored sand beach was semi-clean ( a lot of straws and buried cups) right in front of the main entrance to the beach but a short distance (yards away) it was very dirty with vegetative debris, broken glass, washed up pots and pans, a guitar, a snorkel and mask and latex gloves. The hotel rented water sports equipment in this area.There is a sign as you enter the sand that you are off hotel property and there are no lifeguards on duty. A local man, 29 yrs old,drowned in that area as we arrived. His pregnant fiance was saved but some people we talked to who were there said there was not much effort made to save him. Be careful in the water. It is the Atlantic Ocean and there are jellyfish, also. The rainforest is gorgeous. Depending on how you walk to the falls, the path is very narrow (16-18"). It is paved but if you walk down the river trail, it is steep and slippery with moisture and moss. Our guide told us he has fallen in every type of shoe he has worn. Leaving the falls and going the same direction, the path was dry and uphill. We had more time to look around and not worry about our footing. Book your kayak trip to the bioluminescent bay through the concierge. The price is the same as doing it on your own and you have very reliable guides(5 of them) and they are very concerned with your safety. Water is not deep most of the way but it really is dark. The experience is wonderful. The food we had was very average. Chicken pot pie and meatloaf on a menu at the hotel left us scratching our heads. Were we in PR? Our meal at the Italian restaurant at the hotel was 5 star. All other food, including our meal at Richie's was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax, unwind and have fun!”
Reviews.Author: hookedonvacation
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to Puerto Rico on a last minute trip with my wife and son. We went to the Wyndham and had a super time! The beach is the best - one mile long. all we did was sit and relax on the beach - the water was 85 degrees and the waves were not too rough but rough enough to enjoy! I have been to may paces and the staff is extremely warm and friendly. Service at the beach and in all of the restaurants was excellent. Lunch at the Tikki bar was great every day - they have the best grilled corn on the cob. We had dinner one night in Marbella and one night in Palio's. Palio's was fantastic! The lobby bar had nightly entertainment and the resort was busy so we had fun meeting people at the bar. The casino is also very nice. The weather was really good - 4 days of full sunshine. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. Beds are great! Flat screen TV's with HD! I would definitely recommend this resort - our 15 year old son also loved it. He is a avid skim boarder and said the sand was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Buzztravel
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Rio Mar this past week, during Teachers Convention break, when the kids were home from school. It was a quick three-day break - Thurs - Sat. - with my 11-year old daughter and 9-year old son. My husband and I were delighted with the accomodations (perfect for a family); the activities (great family pool, adult pool and beach); and great restaurants (the right cuisine for adults and picky-eater kids). Most importantly, the service levels for this type of resort was outstanding! We were delighted with the can-do attitude of everyone from the waiters and housekeepers, to the managers who checked that everything was satisfactory. "How can we make your stay more enjoyable," was a phrase I heard often. Although we were looking foward to a little rest and relaxation (I finished two books in three days - and enjoyed a hike through the Rain Forest), we were pleasantly surprised with how pampered we felt. The rooms were clean and well-appointed with amenities, and we never came back to an unmade room. Our room always had fresh towels for all four of us, and the sheets were crisp, comfortable and clean. The view of the ocean was delightful, as was falling asleep to crashing waves. It was pouring rain on our last evening, and I was afraid that a packed hotel restaurant would mean uneven service - but again I was delighted to find our dinner excellant and the service prompt and reliable. The Puerto Rican specialties for my husband and myself was delicious, and our kids delighted in juicy hamburgers and mac n cheese. The breakfast buffet was robust, and well-priced. ($6 for the kids' breakfast buffet - I hate paying full price when my 9-year old only wants a bagel, cereal, orange juice and chocolate milk!). I would strongly recommend the Rio Mar to our friends. Quite frankly, I was surprised at the mixed review that this resort has earned. We travel as a family at least 6 times each year (mini-vacations and weekends), and this was among the best experiences we have had this year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: LAGIRL74
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay at the Rio Mar Resort and we had an amazing experience. Service was excellent, the beach was fun, clean with all of the ammenities, the pools are grand with a waterfall and hot tubs. We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival and greeted with a gift of drinks, fresh fruit and cheese and crackers, the night before we left we were once again treated to a thank you gift. The spa was beautiful and service was great, and the grounds were immaculate, the concierge desks is huge and they give you perfect driving direction to all of the attractions. We had an amazing time and would certainly recommend this beautiful hacienda style resort to all.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: go4word
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to go with my family but left very disappointed and vowing to avoid any Wyndham Hotel ever again. There are cobwebs on the lamps at the Concierge desk, 80% of the hotel staff were downright rude, the beach was pointless and dirty, the hotel room and bathroom lighting were TERRIBLE so I had to do my makeup each morning on the porch with the sunlight, room noise was bad, there are ZERO vending machines so you can't get a coke/snack, light fixtures in our room were missing light bulbs, we requested a rollaway (never got it), and the shower has NO water pressure. Not to mention that the maid didn't actually clean the bathroom very well. Carpets within the hotel were dirty and stained and the food was average, if not plain boring. Whoever heard of mac and cheese with no cheese? The surrounding foliage is beautiful and the Iguana feedings are definitely a highlight! I know Wyndham and Super 8 Motels are owned by the same people and I have to say, it was just a dressed up Super 8. Spend your money at the Mariott or Hyatt where you and your family will be treated like a guest, not a herd of cattle.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding is the word!”
Reviews.Author: AliceinOttawa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 days at the Rio Mar resort. It was truly exceptional. The resort itself is stunning and the staff take great pride in it. The many common areas, lounges, bars, pool areas etc are well cared for, the gardens are stunning and the service is wonderful. We found the staff helpful, knowledgeable and incredibly friendly and welcoming--from the front desk crew and shuffle drivers,to the cleaning staff and the servers. Our room looked out over the mountains and in the evening it is exquisite to sit on the balcony and listen to the coqui (the local tree frogs) and birds singing as they settle for the night. Food is expensive but there are other options if you look for them. There is a sandwich bar at the resort that makes for an easy lunch or light supper option. There is also a convenience store and bakery if you are willing to take a good walk out to the highway. The beach is lovely and the water is warm. The surf conditions are well indicated --high surf is NOT recommended for non-swimmers or small kids) and a tractor comes by in the morning to clean up the seaweed and coconuts and other debris from the night waves. The weather, even in hurricane season, was superb. Small rain stroms come in but quickly blow over. The resort can organize an excursion to El Yunque rain forest for you that is highly recommended. Our guide was Manuel and he was terrific--a Puerto Rican with a great sense of humour and strong knowledge of the rain forest and its wildlife. Would we go back? Yes--in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful island - great food off of the resort”
Reviews.Author: threegraces7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in NYC and came here on our honeymoon. It was just what we needed as we are not typically beach people. If you are bored on the beach-- definitely take the tours! We found the casual restaurants to be a lot better than the more expensive ones. It makes little sense to have an upscale Italian restaurant in a touristy resort in Puerto Rico. These are not the most beautiful beaches- but it was quiet in the off season- and we enjoyed the iguanas. If you want good food (it's not especially cheap) then go to Richie's! The food and views are awesome! Mmm Mofongo!! The service was very good at the resort-- but the food- bleh! They need more carribean cuisine! Even Mexican would be much better than Italian!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: CLBK
Reviews.Content: I would have to say our time at Rio Mar was pretty decent overall. After reading some of the reviews on here, I knew where to go and what not to do. Since our package included airport transfers, this was great so we didnâ€™t have to scramble or pay the ridiculous 30/trip/person. The van provided by the hotel was nice and clean, but smelled a bit funky. A/C was on full blast and the drive was about 35 minutes to the hotel around midnight. We did sign up from the Wyndham Rewards before we departed and this is a must! They are able to offer you free in-room internet, a welcome package of Babybel cheese, crackers, two sodas, and bottled water the first night. The Internet is removed when you check out, so make sure to have them do it. Unfortunately our package did not include continental breakfast, but when we checked in, they said we did, so it was annoying having to dispute this at the end. As far as the fridge goes, they informed us they used to have minibars, but they removed them recently. Having heard this, we opted for the fridge for $25 for our whole stay. They failed to mention the fridge of the minibar was still in the room, so we had this charge removed at the end of our stay as well. Unfortunately, they were not too friendly when we were checking out since we had a few charges to dispute. Itâ€™s not like itâ€™s coming out of their pockets! We realized their concierge staff was hit or miss. One didnâ€™t even speak English that well and directed us to go to Seven Seas beach in Fajardo when it was closed on Monday. It seems most beaches are closed on this day in PR. Luquillo beach right east of Rio Grande was closed as well, but we parked at the kiosks and walked on over after our meal at kiosk #60. Kiosk #60 had some really good super-sized empandas filled with beef or chicken. We also purchased a dollar of braised pork chunks, and a side of rice and beans. Pretty good overall! The hotel did suggest going to La Parilla, but we thought it was going to be tourist-laden, so we opted for #60 per our employee at Enterprise Rental. Rio Mar is a good drive from San Juan, but we booked our rental car via Enterprise in Fajardo online. We were picked up from our hotel since they offer â€œWeâ€™ll pick you up serviceâ€� and this was great since it ended up being only $60 for five days! Rio Mar offers Avis on site, but they of course were not able to beat our price quoted by Enterprise. After we dropped off our rental on the last day, they drove us back to the hotel, so we could catch our shuttle to the airport. This is what I call service! We drove to Old San Juan on our first day and the driving community in PR is a bit crazy, but not what I expected. Imagine bad drivers in the US not signaling. I drive in NYC, so this wasnâ€™t too bad. We found FREE parking off Paseo de la Princesa next to a their main parking lot all the way in the back next to some office buildings. FREE is great! We took a walk around and got some great shots! One of our other days was devoted to driving to Ponce and this was a super scenic route! Once we got to Ponce, it was kind of a disappointed so most of the city reminds me of a bad Grand Theft Auto game. Okay, but I wonâ€™t be going back again. We had some ice cream at King Cream and guanabana was great. Back to the hotel. There were tiny little spider looking bugs, which crawled throughout our room and bathroom. Gross, but this didnâ€™t bother us too much. The food is ridiculous and if you want a cappuccino from the ERL CafÃ©, they are slow as hell! We saw numerous people leaving the line since they could not get it going. I will have to say the coffee here was much better than Marbellaâ€™s. Palio was our last dinner and I ordered the scallop risotto in pesto. I wished they wouldâ€™ve cooked the scallops less since they ended up being a bit chewy. The clams and mussels in their tomato sauce was great! Overall food was crazy expensive here at the hotel and I wish there were other restaurants in the area. As for other restaurants, Richieâ€™s was not great. The view was great, but thatâ€™s about it. We had a server who was not very smart and they must have had the worst coffee in the history of coffee. I ordered a monstrous churrasca, which was way too much food and kind of bland. We got bit up by mosquitoes and left with a dozen bites on my back and legs. I would suggest only coming here for a drink and taking pictures. Our server also propped his leg up on one of our chairs to watch football while we were dining and picked his nose, then checked to see if he had and debris on his finger afterwards. GROSS. The beach was kind of littered with debris from a previous storm, but they offer FREE umbrellas when you make your trek to your beach chairs. Highly suggested if you donâ€™t want a sunburn since youâ€™re pretty close to the equator. We took a trek out 20 minutes west off Rio Mar and found a really nice secluded beach with showers which branched off of these condo buildings, but we forgot water, so we drank from the shower! Hey, itâ€™s not Mexico and I have a stomach of steel. Pool and hot tub are open 24 hours, so it was nice to maximize on the cabanas at night and watch the stars. Donâ€™t go by the shore at night because youâ€™ll be bit up! We brought OFF with us so douse it! Itâ€™s not a bad hotel overall, but not the best. It was nice our room was upgraded to ocean front vs. ocean view per our ByRequest membership!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Eliza_P
Reviews.Content: The main reason I chose this particular resort was the kids club, due to the activities they promote online, although the $75 per day per child (additional children are $65 per day) seemed high. When the reality is that other than 15 minutes spent feeding iguanaâ€™s, the children are kept inside making bead bracelets and painting picture framers while their adult supervisors surf the internet, this was a poor choice. The rooms were clean, and the staff very friendly, but balancing that off was an unchanging menu (over a 10 day stay), $10.50 drinks (we went to a grocery store and bought a bottle for $12, which lasted the remaining 8 days), and spa rates were double what I happily pay in comparable resorts in Mexico - $90 for a pedicure, and $140 for a massage. I was horribly disappointed and obviously, will NOT be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico 2008”
Reviews.Author: kateebeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar from 10/11-10/18. I followed the advice of a previous review and became a Wyndham Rewards Member, this was very helpful. They upgraded my room to ocean view, we were able to see the ocean from our balcony and listened to it every night. It was very nice. They also sent up cheese, crackers, bottled water, and juice twice. Once when we first arrived and again the day before we left. The parking was $15.00 a day for the self park, and fairly easy to use. When we first arrived the elevator from the parking garage was broke so we had to drag our bags through the convention center, very frustrating, but by the 3rd day we were there it was working again. The resort fee was only $11.00 and some change a day, that was a nice surprise, since we had been told it was going to be $30.00 a day. The restaurants at the resort are fairly pricey, and room service was pretty expensive as well. Lots of hidden fees. We did partake in two pina colada's and some bbq chicken wings at the bar by the pool and ocean, which was a $24.00, but the drinks were delicious and the bbq wings were amazing! We had a little fridge in our room, and we were able to make it cooler by adjusting the gage in the very back of it, but it still wasn't that cold, cold enough though. The staff was very gracious and helpful, and any request were quickly handled. The room was decent. I kept my flip flops on the whole time in the room because the floor was very dirty, but I think that just comes with the territory, with as humid as it is, stuff just sticks to the tile. Everything else was clean. The beach was pretty dirty, lots of cigarette butts, and ocean debris, but they provided lounge chairs for beach use which was nice. The towel service for the beach and pool area was great too! If you plan on traveling outside the resort you don't have to know spanish, but it is extremely helpful. We went to Isabella to snorkel, the Playa de Shacks, and were a bit disappointed, the current was really strong, so it made it hard to look at anything. But the water was very clear. We snorkeled on Culebra, which was better. Take the 20 minute hike they tell you about, it is worth it, but make sure that you go to the bay, not the open ocean area. It is rough and strong currents there as well, but the bay is amazing. Very calm and clear! We saw octopus, conche, blow fish, and other cool fish. There are lots of sea turtles there, but we didn't have the pleasure of seeing them. There is a guy named wiley on the island who offers transportation to Playa de Flamanco, he is really cool, and also offers boat tours out to some really cool snorkel places, we didn't have time for this, but it sounds like something worth looking into. One of the best beaches we found was in Liquillo, about 5 minutes from the resort. Also, the rain forest was beautiful and right by the resort. If I would have paid full price for this hotel I might be a little upset, but we got a really good deal, so it was adequate. It was quiet and realaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JasonMartin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an amazing stay! I have to admit that I was very skeptical based on the price that we paid off of a discount travel website ($399 per person for 4 nights including direct airfare from Atlanta). Needless to say I was blown away. This hotel is awesome- beautiful grounds, nice clean rooms, directly on the ocean. A couple of tips (1) sign up for Wyndham Rewards before hand so that you get the freebies (wine, fruit, etc.) (2) Take the "vacation club" tour - it is 2 hours usually offered by the employees handing out towels at the pool and it is basically a time share pitch, but not high pressure and we got a free couples massage in the hotel spa and a free 4 night vacation to another Wyndham resort and did not buy anything (3) rent a car, you will save big money on the taxi shuttle fairs from the airport and to all the sights and restaurants around the island. (4) Old San Juan, El Yunque Rain Forest, and the local cuisine are musts (try Antojitos Restaurant (sp.) â€“ make a left out of the resort and it is on your left before you get back to Rt. 3 excellent beans and rice, awesome service, and cheap compared to Richieâ€™s Restaurant at the top of the hill which is an absolute rip off! (5) Feed the iguanas at the resort at 11AM everydayâ€¦so cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach resort in Rio Grande / El Yunque area.”
Reviews.Author: MisterNO_NYC
Reviews.Content: Initally we were going to stay at the El Conquistador resort in Fajardo but reading so many negative reviews we changed our reservation to the Wyndham Rio Mar. This resort has great restaurants, pools and beach. We enjoyed our upgraded "Ocean Suite" with a terrace overlooking the beach. Room was spacious, clean and well arranged. Our room even had an air filter which seems like a new experiement at some of the Wyndham locations. Everyone at the resort tried to makes us feel comfortable and helped enjoy our stay in Puerto Rico. All of the staff members were helpful and courteous. There is a good selection of restaurants even though some a bit pricey for the area but convenient if you just want to stay in and relax. We had few drinks at the beach-front Tiki Bar and had an excellent dinner at the Boleros tapas lounge. Resort also offers daily activities such as Iguana Feeding, Spanish Lessons, Aqua Aerobics, Dance Lessons as well as water activities and organized trips. Overall we enjoyed our stay and we will plan to stay at Rio Mar again. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 6 days 5 nights at the Rio Mar in October 2008. We had a great time and weather was fantastic. The grounds of the Rio Mar are spectacular. Booked deal through a discount website and for the price well worth the money (flight, room and transfers for total of $1,500). We both feel that Puerto Rico gets a bum rap in the States. The island is beautiful and the people were very friendly and just a 3.5 hour flight from the New York area. A great alternative in the Caribbean. We rented a car for two days and toured the south (Drive the coast road to Ponce) of the island and Old San Juan, not to be missed. The Rio Mar is not a 5 star property but it is not a 3 star. However, the food and drinks at the Rio Mar are at five star prices: $20 for two drinks; $45 for lunch for two. Not outrageous because we read other reviews and knew what to expect. The front desk staff was great. Asked for an upgrade at check in and was given an ocean front suite at no charge. Go to Richie's Cafe one night, prior to sunset, for the view, WOW. They will pick up and drop off. The food was OK. Bring bug spray. We highly recommend the Rio Mar and plan on returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice but not paradise.”
Reviews.Author: cvilledmr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, both 40-ish, recently stayed 3 nights at the Rio Mar, as part of a multi venue tour of PR. We targeted Rio Mar because of it's proximity to the Carribean National Forest (El Yunque). Positives: Beautiful grounds surrounding the hotel. Nice pools, one for adults only. Very nice common areas in hotel with pretty views out the huge beach-side windows. The in-hotel restaurants, Shimas and one Italian place (cannot remember name, but starts with a P, Palia?), were surprisingly very good. Great location for El Yunque exploration! All staff we encountered were wonderfully friendly and helpful, eager to assist and please. Negatives: The food at the tiki bar is terrible! This opinion was unanimous among all the guests we befriended, actually a humourous "bonding topic". The tiki bar drinks are very week and over priced. The terrible tiki phenomenon is particularly bothersome to folks who would like to take full advantage of the outdoors, day and night. We fealt like we were forced in doors for good food and drink. The rooms are pretty small, but are nice enough, many having ocean views. For those expecting a postcard tropical beach, you'll be disapointed that the sand is brown and the water is not the "carribean ocean turqouis" that you fantasize about, it's variable but often green-brown, much like the east coast of the US above Florida (I grew up in Virginia Beach). Finally, and this may be the case with all large hotels, this place seems to cater to conventions (there were three professional groups there during our stay, in large numbers).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: soxfanChicago
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Rio Mar. It was wonderful. We had an ocean view room on the 7th floor. At first our bell man opened the door, we realized there was only one bed when we had requested two. Within minutes our room was changed. Due to reading several posts here, we opted to have our driver stop at a grocery store where we purchased rum, beer and snacks. This saved us alot of money. We took a cooler to the pool everyday and noone bothered us about it. We practically had the resort to ourselves as it was at only 33 percent capacity. We stayed Mon thru Sat. By Friday it a was at over 70 percent. We did not rent a car but hired drivers recommended to us by some of the staff at the tiki bar. Thank you Scenia and Edward! We went to the Rain Forest, which I highly recommend, and to Loquillo beach where you can walk to the infamous kiosks. Speaking of kiosks, this review would not be complete without mentioning the two that we visited. La Parilla, #2 and El Jefe's, #12. La Parilla is a bit more on the finer dining side, but well worth it with it's authentic food. I can not say enough wonderful things about #12. Fresh ground Burgers, Fresh baked buns, hand cut fries with El Jefe cheese sauce, beautfully decorated, reasonably priced, and the nicest owners you will ever meet besides Richie, the owner of Richie's. He deserves a review of his own! Our last night we saved for a dinner at Richies at the top of the hill. They provide a free shuttle from Rio Mar, which was very nice. The view was beautiful. The food was delicious. I recommend the flank steak. Since I am from Chicago and the Sox were in the playoffs, we decided to move and sit at the bar and have dinner, that's where we met Richie. What a character! He made us feel so special and welcome that had I gone there the first night, I probably would have spent every evening up there. We had a blast. All in all, i would highly recommend this hotel for travelers who want sun, surf and chillaxing!
