The restaurants exceeded our expectations by far, especially Palio and The Grille Room. The cuisine and presentations were amazing. Breakfast was inconsistent and rather costly, however. Overall the service throughout the hotel property was above par. However, the housekeeping staff left quite a bit to be desired. When the staff cleaned our room, it did an adequate job. However, the staff was able to actually address our guest room between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. less than 50% of the time. Most days when we returned from the beach or other daytime activities (no earlier than 4:30 p.m. for 10 consecutive days) to prepare for the evening, the housekeeping staff had not made up our room and we were constrained to settle for fresh towels and toiletries. This was very disappointing, especially for a hotel at this price point and star rating. One caveatâ€¦if you plan to stay any longer than three or four days, you really should rent a car. Unless, you are the very antithesis of an adventurer, you will want off the Rio Mar island at some point. Then you will be at the mercy of the Avis desk on site and its exorbitant rental rates or, even worse, the hotelâ€™s shuttle service. So, take this advice and rent a car to pick up from the airport (which by the way is over 20 miles away) when you plan your stay. Would I return? Perhaps not on my next visit to Puerto Rico because I liked the off-property offerings in the Isla Verde and San Juan areas much more. Nonetheless, for a theoretically all inclusive type of vacation experience in Puerto Rico, I highly recommend the Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Hodgey1027
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Rio Mar. The grounds are spacious, very pretty, and lots of places to sit comfortably and observe, or join the the visiting populace. The hotel and facilities are equally attractive, well-maintained, and the staff is efficient, polite, willing, and friendly. Everyone makes an effort to enable your enjoyment of the facility. The beach is a well maintained gorgious stretch of brown sand and the water is obligingly warm. Likewise the several pools and thankfully, no hassle to obtain seating at any point during the day. We rented an ocean view suite which was spacious and comfortable. The balcony was a definite plus. Suggestions: everyone likes to escape paradise, even if temporarily. The resort should provide transport into San Juan. It's a $60 cab ride into town, or rent a car. Do so at the airport for a more reasonable rate. Rio Mar should also update to either satellite TV or at least supply the usual premium cable stations...at no additional cost to guests. In the absence of transport, they should also provide movies and nightly entertainment instead of only on the weekends. And, only on the weekends means a combo playing in that beautiful lounge off the lobby for a coulpe of hours; Friday and Saturday nights only. The one movie shown was a kiddie flic and that was an additional $5.00 per person. They have a lovely large gazebo where a band/trio could perform and a bar can fit into any space. Would like to see more variety on the restaurant menus. And where is the Puerto Rican cuisine???!!! The food was fine --didn't try the Italian place--but the menus were disturbingly familiar. Until the above are "fixed", probably would choose another hotel in P.R. With identified conditions improved, would eagerly return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Costumer service”
Reviews.Author: mcruzdvm
Reviews.Content: I had reservations since june, they never told me that the CASINO IS CLOSED UNTIL OCTOBER, they way they wanted to accommodate us was sending my kids on a bus to another hotel, that was crazy, I will never stay on that hotel again , it was my regular hotel for many years. I went to the Ritz Carlton- that is a hotel and they treat you like a king , the best service I ever had , best rating AAAAA,

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Taps1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the hotel. We were upgraded to a nice Ocean facing Junior Suite. I do have to agree with so many of the other reviewers on the hotel food. I really was disappointing with the choices and quality. I don't mind paying high prices for food but they should really do something about the quality and variety. The hotel staff were pretty good. Our requests were taken care of. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and kids had a good time in the pool and the water slide. One of my biggest compliant against the hotel was the ridiculous resort fee that they imposed on my stay. I was not told of this fee when I booked my trip through Wyndham. I was charged $35 a day for the resort fee. Plus the room fee is charged based on a percentage of your room charge. Never head of such a thing. I called the hotel to complain about and so far no resolution to this matter. They told me it was for towels and the spa. I don't believe $35 a day for towels is justified. If it was not for this petty nickel and diming I would given it a higher rating. I will have to be vary of this type of charges going forward at other Wyndham properties.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Villas - Worth Paying Extra”
Reviews.Author: BFRMaryland
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Ocean Villas on the grounds of the Rio Mar Beach Resort. We thought paying extra for ocean front was worth it (as opposed to the Golf Villas, a long way from the beach). The villas had 2 nice pools, one a lap pool for your swimmers out there. The main hotel was a short walk so the kids could come and go as they pleased. One drawback: the resort was very quiet and did not have much to do for our kids. Except for a movie night, there were no other planned activities for kids. Also, the lifeguards at the beach in front of the resort were rarely on duty, and when they were they often had their backs to the ocean. Before booking, we looked into other nearby "oceanfront" properties. From what we saw during our walks on the beach, these places off the resort grounds looked horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Great Relazation!”
Reviews.Author: Costanzas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week-long vacation at the Rio Mar and had an absolutely awesome time in Puerto Rico! I would highly suggest to anyone that is going to plan lots of excursions because there is much to experience in Puerto Rico. The Rio Mar itself is a beautiful hotel with a great location between the beach and the Rain Forest. May I offer the following few humble tips/suggestions to make the most of your stay: 1. Rent a car from the airport as the overall cost of renting one will be much cheaper than paying the taxis/shuttles to and from the hotel. Also park in the employee parking lot next to the underground self-parking as it will save you the $15-20 a day the hotel tries to charge for parking. No one ever bothered us when we parked there as hotel/convention guests park there as well, and it is simply a few extra steps from the parking garage. 2. Know before you go that, as with all resorts, food and drinks will be very expensive at the hotel. Realize it is a vacation and that is just the way it goes. If you want to save some money, request a mini-fridge for your room and stock up on a few snacks/drinks at the nearby grocery store/Walgreens on Route 3 near the hotel. Also, feel free to drive down the street and eat at Antojitos which is cheaper and has great local food. 3. When you check in, note that the hotel only has 20% of rooms with king beds. Also, make sure you explore all your options for rooms. We got put in a corner room with two small windows without a balcony in order to get a king bed. After I very humbly and politely went back down to talk to the front desk, they moved us to a better Ocean Front room with a balcony overlooking the garden and Quiet Pool which was beautiful (two twin beds though, but overall a ten times better room). 4. Request the highest floor room you can get and try to get a view near the Adult/Quiet Pool. 5. For families, the kids seemed to love the kid/activity pool. As my wife and I went to relax without kids, we were quiet happy with the seperate adult/quiet pool which was very relaxing and quiet. Also, it seemed like you could always find available chairs pretty much anytime of the day. 6. When reserving your hotel, try booking directly through the hotel (Wyndham by request) as opposed to a travel site. While we got a fairly good deal (air/hotel/car rental) through orbitz, most of the people we talked to booked directly though Wyndham and received free breakfast buffets and other discounts on spa services/tours, etc. Keep in mind at $25 per person for the buffet, getting that thrown in is quiet a money saver! 7. The concierge at the Rio Mar are little help unless you want to go to a restaraunt onsite or take one of the hotel tours. We went to Old San Juan, snorkeling, and the Rain Forest on our own and had great times at all three excursions. Plus, the cost to us for going on our own was F-R-E-E! Plus, from some other folks we talked to, the hotel pretty much charges a $50 per person mark up on all tours - once again, if you rent a car you will come out on top. 8. On your way out to the pool/beach for the day, stop by the fitness center as you can grab free water bottles there. If you grab the ones from your room, you will get charged like $4 for each bottle! In conclusion, the hotel is a beautiful place to relax and enjoy the pool, beach, and ocean, and the great location. The only downside is the high cost for everything, but if you just know that going in and plan accordingly to how much you might want to spend, or take some of the tips noted above, you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Nothing To Do”
Reviews.Author: akn64
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Beautiful pool. Beautiful beach. There is nothing negative about this hotel except perhaps its location. It is too far away from everything. You are tied into their restaurants (expensive) and drinks (expensive) and entertainment (non-existent). We went to this hotel two years in a row, and both times came back thinking that while it was a beautiful place, it really lacked after hours entertainment. I would never bring a family here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: doodlebug13
Reviews.Content: We recently just returned from our stay at the Wyndham for a week - 8/2 - 8/9. This was a family trip that included myself, my spouse, my 17 yr old son and 12 yr old daughter. From a true resort perspective, I thought the resort was great - beautiful grounds, facilities and service! The employees were all friendly and helpful and very accomodating (although the only "issue" we had was that we waited quite a while for check in as we arrived around 1 pm and was told our room was not ready and each time we called to check they said it was too soon and when pressed for a time it was first 4, 4:30 and then 5 and stated that all times are approximate). Unlike some other reviews, we had an oceanview room that was quiet and cleaned on a timely basis (the only "noise" issue we had was that when the doors close they are heavy and very loud but other than that there was no other noise that was even remotely detectable. I will agree that it was quite pricey for in house amenities and we did not rent a car as my husband does not like to drive so we were pretty confined to the in house dining options. But, I also will say that all of the meals were very good. We tried a variety of the restaurants and I can say we were not disappointed with the quality of the food. And, I will say that all of the servers were excellent!! The real downside that we found was that there was really nothing for our 17 yr old to do. Thank goodness he brought his laptop to use each evening in the lobby - it saved our sanity. Additionally, even though our 12 yr old was pretty much tired every evening after playing in the ocean (truly beautiful) all day - there was not a lot for her either other than the water slide and hair braiding. The "dive-in" movie on Friday and Saturday was great and you may want to consider offering that on more evenings as it is helpful with the younger ones!! Suggestion - may want to consider offering a more reasonable all-inclusive option, especially for families who appeared to be the majority of your visitors. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and I would come back again but without children. The beach was beautiful and the service was great!!

Reviews.Title: “The Views Are Amazing...Be prepared to spend”
Reviews.Author: GCutter
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positives: The place is absolutely beautiful. Exactly as advertised. The grounds are amazing and suprisingly the photos of the pools are exactly what is there. The pools are clean...the place is just incredibly well kept. Contrary to the reviews early on, since the Wyndam has taken over perhaps, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The people behind the desk (Jessica) and the concierge were great help and there was absolutely no problem with the bill. It was easy to check in and check out. The drinks at the pool were great. We recommend the ziggy zaggy drink. They were a bit pricey but like any resort they were about ten bucks for a 8 oz cup. Its about right but they were great. I would advise you to rent a car. Rent a car at the airport if you are smart since the cabs out to Rio Grande are 65 dollars to begin with and the hotel offers a shuttle but charge per person. Plus, the restaurants on site are incredibly pricey and quite ridiculous as they do not offer a midrange restuarant for the average joe. We chose to rent a car and drove down the road to Antojitos Restaurant whih has moderately priced meals and were fantastic. Plus, Fajarado is about ten minutes away and there are a ton of restaurants down there. The parking is only 15 bucks on site for self parking which I recommend since you often got your car before the valet parkers did. Anyway, the place was a great resort. There are a ton a children there but there are areas of privacy. My advice is to also get a mountain view room as its away from the noise of the pool. There were some negatives. The first thing and this may come off in a weird way but you never feel as though the hotel is giving you anything. You pay all this money for a resort and you would think, you may get a free drink or some attention from the staff, perhaps some organized fun perhaps but there is nothing. Once you check in and give your credit card, there is this feeling of you against the hotel financially. There are drinks that cost a fortune and they charge you for everything. For example, I had complimentary golf tickets from the American Cancer Society and the course was gorgeous. Really nice. But, they charged the two of us $110 for club rentals and refused to take it off our bill. Now, thats understandable but lets get real as this was something we got for charity. It's little things like that including the 15 dollars for parking, the 4 dollars for a muffins or even using the expensive spa, there is not this sense that the resort will grant anything to you. Maybe I am asking too much but they charge for everything. There is one place called Davids cookies for breakfast which is decent as its somewhat cheaper and quick but the line is about a half hour. That is frustrating. Overall, we are a patient couple who enjoyed the trip overall. the resort is gorgeous and to sit by the pool is great. We actually bought a twelve pack of beer at a local supermarket and some wine and brought it out to the pool and had an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort! Very Relaxing Stay.”
Reviews.Author: dbm82705
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week in Puerto Rico. We stayed for 3 nights (7/29 - 8/1) at the Wyndham (formally Westin) Rio Mar. First off, I would really recommend renting a car if you're going to stay here. As others have mentioned, it's about an hour from SJU airport depending on how many signals you hit along the way. (Take the Hwy 66 toll road to cut about 20 min off your trip.) Taxis can be very spendy and in order to see anything outside the resort, you'll need to have a car - unless you're ok paying the marked up rates the hotel charges for their tours of Old San Juan, El Yunque Rain Forest, etc. As for the hotel itself, the grounds were absolutely beautiful. Upon entering, you're taken away from the drab city of Rio Grande and transported into an oasis. After passing the guard house, drive slowly down road (to make sure you don't run over any iguanas!) We chose to self-park for $15/day instead of paying the $25/day for valet. I think self-park was actually quicker than valet as there was constantly a line at least 4 to 5 deep of people waiting for their cars. Upon checking in, we were given a room with 2 beds (even though we requested a king bed). We told the manager and he quickly hooked us up with the correct room (and said it was our lucky day). According to him, only 20% of the rooms at the resort have king bedsâ€¦so if you really want one, it might be best to call ahead and confirm. If you want a quiet room, pay less and go for the rooms with the rain forest/resort view (like we did). The ocean view rooms are above the pool â€“ which can be noisy until late in the night. Aside from the bagels and cookies from the bakery, we only dined once in the hotel at Marbellaâ€™s. It was on the expensive side, but thatâ€™s to be expected in any resort. The food was decent, but itâ€™s hard to screw up a club sandwich. If youâ€™re looking for great (authentic) Puerto Rican food, just drive down the hill to Antojitos PuertorriqueÃ±os. Our best meal in P.R. was at this place. Try the tostones stuffed with crab. They were awesome! The hotel was just recently purchased by Wyndham, so Iâ€™m not sure if theyâ€™re planning any remodeling besides the casino (which was temporarily closed). The only real flaw we spotted was the worn out carpet in the hallways. Lots of stains. Also, as others have mentioned, the walls are pretty thin â€“ so you can hear the TV and people next door, as well as the constant running/yelling/crying of children in the hallway. Our neighbor checked in at 3am and promptly woke us up by trying to open the door that connected our two rooms. Not sure why, but seriouslyâ€¦have you never been in a hotel room before??? Other than that, our room was perfect â€“ spacious, well appointed, and clean. When we werenâ€™t in the room, we were at the â€œquietâ€� pool â€“ which if you get down there early is just that. Get there before 8am and youâ€™ll likely have the whole pool to yourself. Later in the day, it can get a bit crowded. A previous reviewer found the pool to be not so clean. We found the contrary during our stay. We saw the crew out there cleaning every morning and constantly washing/sweeping the pool deck during the day (as iguanas would tend to â€œleave their markâ€�). Overall, we found the Wyndham Rio Mar Resort to be a very relaxing and wonderful place to stay. Highly recommended! (Next time Iâ€™ll bring my golf clubs and review the courses.)

Reviews.Title: “Typical Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lord Fauntleroy
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for a week attending a conference and found the hotel to be not as bad as some of the reviews suggested. The food was pricey, but no more so than at other resorts we have stayed at. The same goes for the quality of the food - not great but acceptable. The pool and beach areas are very nice, but it was difficult to get a chair in the shade by the pool We joined Wyndham by Request before we went (thanks to the review on this site that suggested it) and so we received a couple of drinks and a plate of fruit and cheese when we arrived. We were given an ocean view room, I think because of the upgrade that goes with membership, but I'm not sure. The room and the view were beautiful and kept clean. The price of the room was deceptive, with all of the added mandatory charges (for the conference rate they add on charges for bellman (which we did not use), and maid gratuity and resort charges. They also charged us for valet parking, but removed that when we complained that we did not have a car. We can confirm the advice in the previous reviews to definitely check your bill carefully at check out. They offer complementary internet access in the lobby, but this was not working for a lot of the time we were there - some one else at the conference wondered if this was so that we would pay the extra to have internet access in our room! In summary, this is a typical resort hotel with lots of choices of restaurants, a golf course, pools and activities. The grounds are large but there is not much outside the grounds that it would be worth renting a car to get to and nothing you could walk to. To be honest, we didn't much like Puerto Rico - it was too dirty and crowded - but if you just want the Caribbean resort experience this would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - Very nice”
Reviews.Author: GGent16
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Puerto Rico and we stayed the last three nights at the Rio Mar. I thought the place was great and worth the price ($159 through Travelocity - they upgraded me to an Ocean View Room). The room was huge and very well taken care of. The pools were great and very relaxing. The service was top notch. It was on semi private beach, so it felt very safe. I would say that it wasn't the best beach on the island, as there was some small waves and it was filled with live sand dollars that my wife did not like stepping on, but the water was warm and they had two great pools anyway. Also, I would say that the restaurants are very expensive and not very authentic, but we had a car, and there is a great restaurant 5 minutes away at the bottom of the hill (cheap & authentic - Antohitos, or something like that). I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Payne722
Reviews.Content: The Good: the resort was in better condition than I expected based on some of the reviews on this site. Beautiful grounds, nice ammenities, food at the restaurants better than expected, satisfactory rooms, big bathrooms, wonderful beach area, lots of activity, excellent valet service. The Bad: though there are many pool areas, they need to be cleaned more often. The water was oily feeling and murky. Maid service was erratic, room service food not that great. It's also a loud hotel and the room walls are paper thin. Lots of loud partying going on in other rooms and at the pools. I hate to say this but many of the hotel guests seemed sleazy. The Ugly: management at this hotel is nonexistant. We were initially given a room with one bed when we had requested two doubles. Downstairs desk said they'd be up to the room with new card keys for another room. They never came, even after 7 more calls down to the front desk, and even after another couple showed up at our room saying the room we were in had been given to them. So basically, we were roomless for another hour before the hotel finally corrected the situation. No apologies and when we asked to speak to the manager, he never contacted us. Overall: not a bad place to stay but not a great one either. Truthfully, I wasn't that impressed with this resort or Puerto Rico in general. I'd suggest going to the Dominican Republic instead.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Paradise”
Reviews.Author: iguana_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio Mar with my boyfriend from 7.11 to 7.14 and thought it was, overall, a fantastic place to stay. The resort is approximately an hour's drive from Old San Juan (taxi cost $70 without tip), a journey that offers views of everything from KFC to the mountains. Rio Mar is a few miles off the highway, and the resort itself (including the clubhouse and golf course) is so large that you "need" to board a shuttle to get to the more distant spots. The inside of the hotel is stunning: beautiful/spacious lobby, breathtaking views and well-appointed decor. Check-in was relatively easy, though I noticed at least 10 employees standing behind the row of desks and only one actively working with guests. (This was true of check-out, too, and I recommend checking out from your room by phone. You can leave your name and room number on a machine, and they check you out. The final bill is left under your door on the morning of your departure.) The room we had overlooked a lagoon-ish area with about 20 iguanas, lots of fish and a few turtles. I'd not wanted to pay extra for the ocean view, and I have to say that this vista was fabulous. We sat on the balcony each morning/evening and enjoyed watching those prehistoric creatures. (One small annoyance: other guests on balconies felt it was appropriate to throw food down to the iguanas all day.) I loved our room; every bit about it felt perfect. They did a fabulous job with the interior. There are, officially, two pools, but they are so close together that it seems like one large one. Though the pools look unbelievable in the hotel's photos, you should know that it is a maximum of 4 feet in places - and usually 3.5. Also, while the hotel was not terribly crowded when we were there, I imagine there would be significant congestion in the pools in the winter months. The beach is close to perfection: good waves (neither too big nor too small), attentive waiters, fine sand, lots of space, excellent temperature. I recommend taking a walk to the right, which can take you quite far away from the hotel if you'd like. Every entry I'd read on tripadvisor before I left emphasized the priciness of the food. I was still willing to go b/c we'd gotten the room for $120/night (before the nightly $30 resort fee - their way of pretending the hotel doesn't cost $150/night). Unfortunately, the food is NOT anything above average; for the price, it is definitely sub-par. We ate at the Italian restaurant and the main restaurant, and we would not have ordered our dishes a second time. I would not have grumbled if the food had been excellent, but to pay $30 for one dinner plate and then taste something bland...well, it made me cranky. We did not eat at the seafood restaurant or the clubhouse, and the asian steakhouse was closed. (Note: the casino is also closed right now, but the resort offers a complimentary shuttle to another resort, the Gran Melia, very frequently.) Some price examples in the gift shop: $2.85 for a 1 liter bottle of soda, $1.50 for a can of soda, $3.75 for the weekday New York Times, $2.00 for a candy bar. There is a coffee shop/bakery that serves excellent treats (and stays open late) where the prices are a bit more palatable ($7 sandwiches), but there are still some items that will make your head spin (cereal is close to $4 from what I remember - and more if you add fruit). The hotel website and in-house materials mentions a "nominal fee" for transportation to San Juan airport; this fee turns out to be $35/person. If you are not by yourself, a taxi is probably the better way to go. (After all, the cost for a family - despite the claim to nominality - would be exorbitant.) We were content to sit by the pool/beach and decided not to do much by way of sightseeing, but for those eager to get out and see more of the island, Rio Mar is quite isolated. You would certainly need a taxi ride to get to the nearest grocery store, and there is no "town" area nearby: just a stretch of highway that looks like the ugly parts of NJ (with much nicer views). Overall, the Rio Mar was a beautiful place to be for a few days. They should raise their standards when it comes to food, but in every other way...it was a nice slide of beachfront paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsAdie
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews so I knew what to expect, although the prices still shocked us! The Lobby and hotel grounds are gorgeous. Our room was a nice size and the bathroom was not cramped like many hotels. They gave us the wrong room initially but corrected the problem right away. I went on this vacation with my husband and parents, all adults no kids and I think this hotel is geared towards families. I am glad the pool was large enough that we could stay on one side which was more quiet, while the other side with the slide stayed packed with little ones, and large familes. There are two complaints that I do have, 1) The prices of food, spa services, and transportation were rediculous. 2) The concierge desk were not helpful and many times rude. The advice I would give you is to defintely plan on renting a car and do your research of what you want to do before you arrive. You can drive into Old San Juan and San Juan and eat at some wonderful restaurants, or some of the smaller restaurants that are in Rio Grande. You can also save money by eating a muffin, or bagel at the cafe rather than the $23/person buffet for breakfast. Get your beer and liquor from the corner store rather than the $10 drinks in a small dixie cup the hotel offers! Eat at Shimas, the asian restaurant in the hotel it is worth the price!!! Overall it was a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: The_Mambo_King
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a great 5 day stay at the Rio Mar. When we arrived, there was a guest complaining very loudly about his bill, and we were starting to get worried. However, the concierge noticed this and upgraded our room to an Ocean suite (Gracias Luis!) for us. Overall, the resort was great, very beautiful grounds, we went to a lot of beaches and the Rio's was great. We had zero issues with our bill and the staff was great. It is a expensive hotel, so be prepared if you plan on eating there, activities, etc. We rented a car and only ate there once. We like to explore etc, and I have to admit it would not have been the same without a rental car. That is a must. We spent a whole day in the rainforest, hiking, exploring, swimming in the waterfalls. We also booked a sailing/snorkeling trip with East Island Excursions.. it was excellent. Highly reccomend them. Overall, we loved our stay. Unfortunately, we got had a lot of cloudy days and rain at first, but it helped that we were at such a nice hotel. Definitely reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED RIO MAR!!! STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Vacation07
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my vacation in Puerto Rico. June 29th through July 8. We stayed at 3 different hotels so we could explore the whole island and ALL 3 hotels were great because of using trip advisor. ALWAYS use trip advisor even if hotels.com gives it 5 star. My sister, friends and I stayed at Lazy Parrot, Wyndhem Rio Mar Resort (formerly the westin rio mar) and Coral Princess. We stayed at this hotel for one night since we want to go to the rainforest and do some things on the east side of Puerto Rico. We got a nice room for $129 a night since we are an "Entertainment" member. Its a book called The Entertainment Book with coupons for hotels and car rentals. We could have gotten a suite for the same price but they were all booked (july 4th). Alot of the reviews said that place is secluded. They made it seem it was in the middle of nowhere. Its off the busy highway and there are some restuarants that are 5 minutes away. Though you do have to travel up a road where there are nothing but trees and some houses but there are so much to do at Rio Mar, you really wouldn't want to leave anyway. There are shops that sell name brand stuff like clothes, jeans swimsuits, Guess purses. There was a casino but its being remodeled and will open up in Oct 2007. I peeked inside and its gonna be nice. There is a game room/arcade for the kids that stays opened either all night or til 2am. The rooms you gotta know are excellent. Absolutely great and the BEACH.....we didn't want to leave. In puerto rico the sun is up at 5:30am. The water was so calm and BLUE!!!!!! This was the first hotel I've been to where the internet pix was an exact replica of how the hotel really was. That resort looked so FAKE! Everything was so BEAUTIFUL and green and blue...we were impressed. You will think that my pictures were from the hotels website. The food is pricey. I only had breakfast there. They have this card in the room where they will bring breakfast to your room. You just circle what you want and what time you want it. I don't recommend doing this because, they charge for delivery and plus these taxes and stuff. I almost did it but I went to the restuarant downtairs and it was the same food and a dollar or two cheaper. Breakfast, I had 2 eggs, toast, sausage and orange juice and my total was about $15. It was good though. I definitely would like to come back here. The staff was very nice and some were cute too =)!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please with Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: skhb74
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very pleased with the Wyndham Rio Mar. I was part of a larger group. It was my husband's family reunion. There were 23 of us in total including children, two of which were under 2 years old. We all rented three of the 3-bedroom golf villas. I read many of the reviews on this site and because I got to see three different villas I do understand why there are different opinions. Of the three villas our group rented, one was fabulous (luckily, this was the one I was in), one was very nice, and one was not nice. I understand that each is owned privately so each is decorated and cared for differently. However, these were not cheap and the one villa was unacceptable for the price we paid. That one was Villa Naranja. It really needs to be nicer. It was practically bare and there were light bulbs without any fixtures. Just bare light bulbs. Not worth the price. However, Villa Chaly and Villa Rio were fantastic. Villa Rio was the best. If you go try to request it. I rented the villas through The Clusters.com. They were great. Totally helpful. Especially Xavier. He's awesome. Ok, now for the resort. It was very nice though we didn't spend a whole lot of time inside the main building. There was a bunch of construction going on past the main building. I guess just past where the ocean villas were. It was unattractive but the only reason we drove by it was because we drove past the main building by accident. You can't see it from the pool or beach as far as I know. Maybe from the Ocean VIllas though. We ate in the casual restaurant one night and were pleased. But I have to say I don't think Puerto Rican food is all that great to begin with so I wasn't expecting much. The golf villas are quite a ways away from the resort pool and beach. But each villa had use of a golf cart which made it fine. Especially for the kids. They loved the carts. We even found a free place to park a car (near the playground at the pool). The beach was nice though we spent most of our time at the pool. It was pretty windy most of the time we were there so they wouldn't allow umbrellas on the beach and we needed them for the babies. The food and drinks at the pool are ridiculously expensive. Bring a small cooler and bring your own. So that's it. Would I go back? Only if we did another family reunion there - my husband's family is Puerto Rican. Though this has nothing to do with the resort. I just think there are much nicer places than Puerto Rico. Aside from the resorts and more affluent areas near the resorts it seems to be all strip malls and high rise condos. With the exception of Old San Juan which should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our 5 days at the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: pauls153
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio Mar for five days/four nights over the 4th of July (weâ€™re both 35 years old). After reading many reviews I was a little nervous but every hotel has good and bad experiences. First and very important... rent a car! It was a very easy ride using the toll road and only took about 30 minutes. Once we arrived the front desk up-graded us from a Resort View room to a Jr. Ocean View Suite. It was very nice and in a great location at the end of the hall. Beautiful sunrise while drinking coffee on the lani and picture perfect sunsets each evening. When we vacation I need golf and my wife needs a beach/pool. The resort has two pools; one of them is considered a "quiet" pool and is designed for adults only. That wasn't always the case during our many hours poolside but it still was very relaxing. The beach is just beyond the pools and although it was windy and waves were cranking... it was also very pleasant. The staff will help you with your lounge chairs, umbrellas and towels. Wait staff is there for your drink and food needs. Definitely rent the jet skis and have a fun 30 minutes on the open ocean! When it comes to the restaurants - yes they are very expensive, but all resorts are. The food is very good and their steak house The Grille Room is located at the golf course and the steaks were on par with Ruthâ€™s Chris. Only go if you are OK with paying $40 for a steak. A few nights we went off site just to check out the area. Las Vegas was probably the best local restaurant we experience. As for the golf, I played the Greg Norman River Course. A wonderful lay-out that requires you to be accurate off the tee. If you find the fairway on your tee shot then you can score well. Once again, like the restaurants on-site, the green fees are expensive so only play if youâ€™re willing to hand over $100. It amazes me how some of the reviews on this site knock this resort because of the overall expense. If great food, great golf and beautiful ocean activities at a premium price does not meet your budget then DONâ€™T book a vacation at a resortâ€¦ go camping! In all I give this resort an above-average rating. If it was a high school report card it would equal a Bâ€¦ almost a B+ but they still have some studying to do in order to get that grade.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: SDM08
Reviews.Content: My wife, 5 kids (age 11 to 1) and I recently spent 10 days at the Wyndhamd Rio Mar in Puerto Rico, in a 2 bedroom ocean villa. We booked through [--]. Good price and great people to deal with. When we arrived, the found the villa to be spacious and very nicely decorated (3 fifty inch flat panel televisions, grantie countertops, tile floors) with two ocean front balconies. The beds were heavenly. We had the place virtually to ourselves. Outside the villa, the grounds and pools areas were very well kept (almost immaculate). The villas had two pools (a free form infinity edge pool and a separate olympic type pool). Both were very nice, but quiet. For more excitement, the main pool at the hotel was just down the beach path (approx. 200 yards). Tiki bar, water slide, kids program. The kids also loved the iguanas that wandered the grounds. The beach was fantastic, made of the softest brown/orange sand and edged by numerous palm trees. The villas also had a good number of permanent tiki type shade shelters on the beach. After reading other reviews, we chose not to eat at the resort restaurants, opting instead for local dining establishments. Our favorites were the Brass Cactus in Luqiullo and Lolitas just outside of Rio Mar (toward Fajardo). Overall, it was a very nice resort and we would not hesitate to return. We loved Puerto Rico, especially the Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “A Old Time Resort with No Management”
Reviews.Author: Alltone
Reviews.Content: This is older, but comfortable resort. It's also in the middle of no-where, except entering north side of the rain forest. The trips to old San Juan are long and a tiring drive, likewise visiting the prettier east side of the islaind is 3-5 hours each way. The hotel's management is entirely absent, for example: 4 hours of 2-stroke leaf blowers Monday around the pools, concrete drills starting at 8am on the relandscaping project Thursday morning, half dozen kids screaming in the pool at 1-2 am in the morning two different nights, (really), they lost our car, the staff directed us to hotel restaurants that were closed, the casino is closed - for months, the beach and pool equipment isn't cleaned, PA system blasting music all night into the courtyeard because someone "forgot" to turn it off when the bar closed, and on and on. You can have a very comfortable and enjoyable stay, but it is one of the worst run resorts I've visited. Watch out if your room is by the pools, although the signs say they close at 8pm, they are 24/7 and that means big fun between 11-3am to alot of people. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: acnj
Reviews.Content: The wyndham Rio Mar is located on a lush tropical setting. Although the beach in front of the hotel is choppy you can walk to the west of the hotel and find spots where the beach is very nice. Overall we had a very nice relaxed stay and would definitely go back. We had lunch at Richie's restaurant, very close to the hotel, and enjoyed a spectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: anti-stress
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar for 4 days during the 4th of July week 2007. We had a fantastic stay. The hotel, swimming pool, beach, amenities were great. The staff was very helpful esp. the concierge. They had printed out directions to everything. Pity I didn't take my dog along, since it's pet friendly, and I saw several dogs out for a walk with the guests. Food at Shimas was great. As with any resort, its expensive. Vegetarians beware, throughout our stay we had a tough time finding food options, in the hotel as well as outside. There aren't many restaurants nearby - so the only one we tried was Don Pepe on Rte 3. Its very close to the hotel, and had authentic Puerto Rican food. Loved the Malfungo (mashed plaintains). Stay here if you want to be close to beaches, water sports & activities. Its close to Fajardo which is where most of the island adventure trips such as snorkelling, scuba, kayaking etc are located. Also steps away from El Yunque which is a must see to get a flavor for a rainforest. We booked ourselves on East Island Adventures for snorkelling in Culebra, Eco Action Tours for Kayaking (Bio Bay). Both were good. There are several options and most are priced pretty much the same. I think the hotel charges a lot more than if you book directly with the tour company. The hotel has a great dive center, and rents out all kinds of equipments including water bikes. Towels & umbrellas on the beach are complimentary. Self Parking is $15 & Valet is $25 a day. The casino was closed, but they have shuttles to take to you another casino.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort by the beach”
Reviews.Author: kjscap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our stay in PR with four nights here. I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews, but we had no problems and really enjoyed the resort. We rented a car upon arriving at the airport and drove from SJU to the Rio Mar with no troubles. We were able to stop along the way at Walgreens to stock up on sunscreen and some other items we couldn't pack due to the restrictions. Check-in was easy and we were upgraded to a beautiful ocean front room. The room was well appointed, clean, and quiet. We ate at the golf course's steakhouse the first night, which was really expensive, but did have good food. The food and drink prices are a bit higher than typical for a resort. We also at ate Marbella one night and at the casual out door restaurant for lunch. We took the shuttle that comes to the resort to the Bamboo Lounge one evening. That was a fun dinner. I wouldn't have wanted to drive there myself. Great view, okay food. I tried the mofongo. We also went to Don Pepe's which is just a short way from the hotel. It was pretty good and we liked seeing the dogs living on the roof next door. We drove to the ferry station at Fajardo and parked the car overnight while we spent two days in Vieques. That island was truly the highlight of the trip. It was absolutely beautiul and the bio-bay was amazing. I wish we would've spent more time there. Not to be missed!! We also went to El Yunque with our car-definitely skip the visitor center. The hotel will give the same map. We hiked to the waterfall, which was pretty. We left Rio Mar and stayed in SJ for our last three nights. I was really glad we had the time in RIo Mar first. The beach there is beautiful and you can walk forever down it. We had a great time

Reviews.Title: “helpful hints and review”
Reviews.Author: HAZ67
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel on a change of names was a little uneasy at first. Westin has a good reputation and wyndham does also, but it was taking over as we were there. Impressed when we arrived, nice hotel and friendly staff. Ded,Eli, and Rey at the lobby bar get thumbs up for service, and staff. Jose at coqui lounge, thanks for your hospitality. Angel at the tiki bar, never an empty glass. Check in and get a refrigerator when you get to the room. Stock it with whatever you drink. I'm not cheap but when you're in you're room it's worth it. Go to the gift shop if you don't get a car. They sell some beer and liquor, or go down a mile or so to the deli. Housekeeping was outstanding, room was perfect each day and night for turn down service. If you're lucky go to top floor on west side and see nice sunsets on balcony/patio. It might be changed after take over.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool area, but serious drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: lmhendrix
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Rio Mar with my fiancee. The grounds and the pool area are beautiful, but we were disappointed with a lot of things. As can be expected, the prices at the hotel restaurants are outrageous, and the food is nothing special. They know that you're 1 hour from San Juan and 30 minutes from other restaurants, so the prices are very high. The most disappointing part of our stay was the golf. We saved up and had our one big splurge on a round of golf at the Ocean Course (there is also a River Course, but there was a tournament going on when we were there). First of all, there is only one par 3 hole that is on the ocean - and it's surrounded by construction as they are building new condos all around it. The other 17 holes are no where near the ocean. And they didn't even tell us that they were seeding all of the greens, so we paid $150 per person for "green" fees even though the greens were perfectly brown and sandy with seed. It was very disappointing. Though the course may have been special back in the '80s when Greg Norman designed it, it is very run down and is not worth such a high green fee. In conclusion, if you want to lay by a nice pool and be on a nice beach, you will enjoy this hotel, but for anything besides that, I highly recommend that you rent a car and go explore the "real" Puerto Rico outside of the hotel compound.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Iwiltellall
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, a bit expensive but if you catch a good sale -its worth it. The restaurants, bars and spa on site are pricey, but you can save lots of money on the tours by renting a car! The rainforest (El Yunique) is a free tour but the hotel charges $38 per person to take you there. El Yunique is directely up the "long mountain road" from the hotel. The hotel also offers a tour to Old San Juan which is $45 per person but they dont take you to the El Morro fort, it only goes to the forts by the shopping area. If you rent a car you can go throughout the entire tourist area and just pay for parking (much cheaper). Also, there's a great outlet mall about 20 minutes away from the hotel. The conceirge is very helpful with maps and directions so if you decide to rent a car - getting around shouldnt be a problem. I suggest you rent from the Avis car rental located at the resort because they'll give you free parking, otherwise parking is $15 a day for outside rentals. Also there's 2 really good spanish restaurants at the corner of highway #3 where the resort entrance is (Don Pepe & Antoniette's) their prices are way cheaper than anything in the resort. Also there's KFC's, Burger King's and other fast food places you can get to (if you have a car).Be sure to keep all your receipts charged to your room and review your bill before paying room charges. If your traveling with kids - the hotel feeds the iguanna's at 11am everyday for free - join in! The kids club is a bit a rip off, unless u really need a babysitter. Find a local liquor store and add alcohol to ur drinks at the beach. The spa was ok - but I've had better for cheaper. Sign up for" Wyndam By Request" and get extra perks such as late check out, free room upgrades, discounts to use at the resort, free snacks upon check in etc. Overall the hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The grounds were well kept, the pool and beach were great. I would definately stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: eaf625
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a five day vacation at Rio Mar and had a wonderful time. The staff was friendly and quick to respond to requests. The food was very good, but a little expensive. Rooms and grounds were clean and well maintained. The casino was closed for renovation, but we did not hear any noise from the construction. I traveled with my two children (ages 21 and 16) and all of us had a great time and would go back. The beach was beautiful and they have lounge chairs set up. The guys at the enterance to "East Beach" will set up unbrellas for you. They dug them in so deep that no matter how breezy it became I never saw one umbrella fly down the beach. The pool consists of two sections, the quiet section with the padded lounge chairs and the children's section without the padding on the chairs. I am not sure why only one section has padding but we did not spend much time at the pool. There was a cat that walked around the pool and I am not fond of cats. We did rent a car, but Rio Mar was programed into the GPS system incorrectly and we end up two hours away from the hotel. We called Rio Mar, and through a series of calls to Jose at the front desk we were lead to the hotel. Jose took each call personally and was a life saver. Since the hotel was programed incorrectly we only used the car for one run to the grocery store, but if you want to leave the hotel it is necessary to have a car. We booked our trip through Expedia and received a confirmation. But when I got to the airport I found that my kids had confirmed reservations, but I did not. I have no idea how this happened but I am glad that it was not a sign of how the vacation was going to progress. I will remember this as a great vacation even after I had to purchase another ticket at the airport and spent five hours in the car trying to get to Rio Mar. There are a few things I would do differently next time, but I would stay the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With the Rio Mar!”
Reviews.Author: atlmorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar June 19th - 24th and had a great time! No matter how many reviews you read, you can never be sure how your trip will turn out, but we found Puerto Rico to have the friendliest people of all the islands we have visited and we thought the Wyndham was very nice. We found the resort, pools and beaches to be clean and not too crowded. We really didn't have a problem finding chairs at the pool or beach. Rooms have been recently updated and were comfortable. Everyone who worked at Rio Mar was friendly and very helpful, from front desk staff to maids to room service. Carlos at the concierge was great with arranging our snorkeling trip, providing recommendations to local restaurants, and directions. Recommendations: Rent a car - it's less expensive than the shuttle (we had a family of 4 with "tween age kids") and you can go where you want when you want. Take a trip to WalMart or Amigos to stock up on bottled water/snacks/drinks. Go to El Yunque. We skipped the overpriced tour and went to the visitor's center and drove through the park stopping at the things we wanted to do and see. We did book a snorkeling day trip on a catamaran that went to a reef and then to Flamenco Beach on Culebra - it was one of the highlights of the trip! Eat at the local restaurants. The hotel restaurants are good enough as was room service, but we really enjoyed trying the local cuisine in the nearby restaurants. Take part in the iguana feeding at the Rio Mar - fun for all ages. Try to speak Spanish (even though it seems almost everyone in P.R. also speaks English) and ask lots of questions - everyone we met was so friendly and enjoyed telling us about Puerto Rico. What we'll do next time: might try to stay on Vieques or the caribbean side of the island - white sand, calmer water. We will try to visit Old San Juan and maybe take the Bacardi tour. If you are looking for lots of nightlife and shopping, this probably isn't the place for you - but if you want to relax a little and be near both the beach and El Yunque, I would recommend staying here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Well Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: shida_girlBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel with 3 other girlfriends from June 20-22. This was my 3rd trip to Puerto Rico. I think this resort is a testament to Wyndham responding to the outcry re: level of service when this hotel was a Westin because the reviews since they have controlled it are like night and day! Our check-in was a breeze, though the fron't desk wasn't the most pleasant but they got better througout our stay. Our rooms were on the 6th floor, right next to each other which was what we requested and we could see the water from our room. We ate dinner 2 nights and breakfast one morning on the grounds and thought that it was much more reasonable than I expected. For dinner, we ate at Marbella and had a turkey burger with all the fixins for $13.00. Breakfast was $10 for eggs, toast, bacon and home fries. The buffet was $23. In addition, the waitstaff was EXCELLENT! We had the same waiter (Waldy) each night and he was very accomodating to whatever we needed. The resort is HUGE and it can be a little confusing getting around (I got lost in the hallway trying to get back to my room from the car!) but they have many convenient features: a coffee shop that sells breakfast breads, coffee, ice cream and David's Cookies; stores and carts within the resort; live music in the lobby bar every night. The beach was not very crowded and we had no problem getting assistance from the staff is setting up chairs and umbrellas for us. The pool was very nice - they have a "quiet pool" for those who don't want kids doing cannonballs in the water while you are reading - a nice feature. We went to the rainforest, which is a must since it is literally across the highway from the resort! It was very nice. We ate at one of the places within the rainforest and the prices were reasonable and the food was yummy. And you are only 20-30 minutes from San Juan. All in all, a great choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: jae529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar for 6 days and 5 nights and had a great time. The moment that we checked in we were upgraded to an ocean suite. The beach was alot of fun because it had waves but it was never rough. There were always plenty of beach chairs and it was never crowded. You have beach side service where we ordered numerous drinks and lunch each day. The pool was also very nice with a small slide and a volleyball net for the kids and kids at heart. The golf course also looked very inviting although we didnt play. The entire staff at the hotel were friendly - we never experienced any rudeness as some of the reviewers mentioned. Each time we asked for suggestions on local eateries they were always very helpful. We found that almost EVERYONE spoke english to the point where it was a bit disappointing because we wanted to feel like we were very far away from home. The Food at the Grille Restaurant in the hotel was our favorite - Best Prime RIb Ever and we are from New York which makes us big critics when it comes to food and service. If you are from a large city in the US like we are, prices will be more or less the same at all the restaurants. We thought all the restaurants in the hotel were very good. But renting a car is a must so you can go to the local eatieries and get a taste of real Puerto Rican Fare at inexpensive prices. The Yunque Rain Forest trip is a must do and it will give you a sense of accomplishment after hiking a mile up or down to the waterfalls and help rid some of the guilt from the thousands of calories that you have taken in so far with the Pina Coladas and Puerto Rican empanadas. The casino is closed until October and there wasnt any nightlife except the lobby bar which had live music. Dont bother going to the casino that they shuttle you to. Take a drive to El San Juan Hotel in San Juan..it is well worth the trip. The drive is about 30 minutes on rt 66 to 26 and it is a great place to go for gambling, lounging and dancing...all right in the lobby! It was action packed and a great place to visit and win some money but we were glad to return to our hotel at 430 am to serenity and relaxation. I dont recommend this resort for kids unless you plan on spending every waking moment with them! We chose not to take our kids and that was the best decision. I would recommend the Club Med in Punta Cana for that which have many more organized activities. But if you want a relaxing vacation with your significant other and enjoy a resort with all the comfort that you need, the Rio Mar is a great place to visit. My only complaint is that the drive to the resort when you enter the compound is a bit confusing. They have two signs, one that says turn left to the country club/condos and one that tells you to turn left to the resort when you should actually drive straight forward. We turned left towards some other area under construction and wasted time trying to figure out where we needed to go. But once we got there, the view to the rainforest in the front of the registration entrance was breathtaking. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Boop09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 14-18th and had a relaxing time. Be prepared to put $100 down per day on a major credit card. Use the safe in the hotel room, or have luggage with a lock. The weather was wonderful, and it only rained for 15 minutes the last morning before we left. The food at the hotel is very expensive ($50 for two people) but very good. Food is expected to be high because you can either rent a car, use the hotel shuttle with a tour ($55/pp) or taxi ($45). We opted to rent a car for 2 days and it was well worth it, highly recommend. It's impossible to get lost, the major road is Route 3 and all the resturants, shops and grocery stores run on it. The rain forest is directly across the intersection leading into the Rio Mar..a MUST do! The hike is about a mile from parking to the rainfall, and it is beautiful. Also the Barcardi Factory tour is great to do, it is $55 per person for transportation, admission is free. Almost half of the things to do in PR is free, it's transportation to worry about if you don't rent a car. The pool is open 24/7, if you go during the early am or late at night, it will be very empty. The beach is pretty, but not clear. The clear water is 2 lights down on the left from the hotel..locals go there but not too crowded during the week. Watch out for the iguanas, they kinda wonder on the grounds, harmless. You can feed them at the hotel free at a certain time. There were a lot of children at the hotel, from infants to teenagers..who takes their kids? why? There is not night life at the hotel, the casino was closed and the hotel had to shuttle you to another hotel for their casino. 3 words, waste of time. And I was winning. More than 1/2 of the slots were not working and the casino was about as small as the office you are sitting in now. You can go to San Juan, however, it is highly advised, from a traveler and the locals...go before dark. It's easy to get lost and there is a lot of crime. There are no fridges in the hotel room, so request one and go to the grocery store Amigos (off route 3) and stack up on water, drinks and snacks. Most of the resturants in the hotel close at 10pm, except for a bakery that closes at 12am (good prices). The locals either don't speak english well, or just can't say "thank you" some are very rude. Don PePe...great! great! food. If you are driving, it's right outside the main hotel light on the right. A meal is about $8-10 per person and great atmosphere. We ate there everyday. Of course you have your McDonalds, Burger King, Taco Bell and KFC combo. I would go there again if I wanted to relax, but not to dance, shop or experience all an island had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: WhereRWeGoingNext
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place. Fairly new, clean, classy place. Service also seemed good. The rooms are good size and well-maintained. The grounds, beach, and pools are beautiful. The beach is well-maintained. The other great thing about this place is that it is right outside the rain forest. Rt. 191 is right near the resort and it takes you right into the rain forest and you HAVE to go there. The rainforest is beautiful. Mak sure you go to at least Mt. Britton if not the peak and also go to the waterfalls. You can swim right underneath the waterfalls. There always seems to be a lot of people in the main waterfall, but if you go to the falls just above the main one, you will have a nice secluded area to swim in all to yourselves. The only two negatives about the Wyndham are the food and noise by the pools. We enjoyed going to the local restaurants, but we did order food in the room one night because we were in a hurry to be somewhere. The food they delivered was not very good. Also, if you get a room facing the pool, make sure it is on the fourth or fifth floors. The views are beautiful because you can also see the ocean. However, the pools are open 24/7. Generally there weren't many people in the pools at night and the ones that were there were quiet, but on one night we did hear some ignorant parents letting there screaming and yelling kid play in the pool late at night. We did not have much of a problem because we were on the fifth floor. It did not bother us but we could still hear this vocal child a little. I can only imagine what it must of sounded like on the lower floors. Make sure you eat at Richie's, which is just up the road from the resort. This place is close and has great food and a beautiful view of the ocean and surrounding area from the hilltop.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: carrkate
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews of the Westin that are pretty poor, and I just don't get it. I had the most glorious time at the Westin (now the Wyndham). My new husband and I planned our wedding at the Rio Mar. I do not have a single complaint. I had to admit that after reading some reviews, I was concerned about how the customer service would be. The customer service was a 10!!!! I was asked if I needed help whenever I wasn't even looking for help. The rooms are comfortable. And, if you do not have an ocean view or would rather save your pennies, the next best thing is the view of the Rain Forest. Every part of the resort property was absolutely breathtaking. The pictures on its website do not do the place justice. The beach and ocean are beautiful. The pool area is clean and relaxing. We had 80 friends and family at the hotel with us, and everyone had a glorious time. Yes, it is expensive, but it is expected at a vacation resort. Frozen drinks are $10, but you can get the local Medalla beer for $4. Dinners range from $14 to $50. You can do it pretty cheap if you wanted to. Rent a car for the day, go to the grocery and stock up on snacks, sandwiches, water and liqour. Save your money for dinner. For breakfast you can go to the coffee shop for $4 ham and cheese croissants. For lunch grab a foot long hot dog for $7. For dinner you can sit at the Bistro bar and have a pizza for $14. Depending on how adventerous you are, a rental car would be advisable, but not necessary. We only rented a car one day and went to the rain forest and Old San Juan. We were content the rest of the time just hanging out at the beach and relaxing. The iguanas add entertainment. Word of warning, the casino closed the day we left. Rumor is that it will be closed until October for rennovations. I do not have a bad thing to say about the Westin. iIcould not have asked for a more perfect vacation with family and friends, wedding or honeymoon. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds....not much activity”
Reviews.Author: fbg_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Mar from May 31st thru June 2nd. The property is immense and for as large as it is there is actually very little to do other than golfing and swimming. The casino was closed for renovations and during the week it seemed that the place closed down at 9:00pm. We went out on the grounds (poolside) after dinner to take a stroll with our infant and we felt very 'alone'. There usually wasn't a soul out near the pool after 7:00 pm. No nightly entertainment, which we are used to in most Caribbean resorts. Definitely rent a car. The hotel is out of the way and without a car you would be stuck eating at the expensive hotel restaurants. Breakfast for 2, around $50. Dinner at Palio for 2 (only 1 glass of wine each) $150. Instead, try Richie's, Antonojitos or Don Pepe. Also, if you drive south on Rte 3 there are many fast food and Sizzler type restaurants. Drink's at the hotel are almost prohibitive, so we asked for a fridge in our room and bought beer and wine and the local supermarket! Beach was ok, not too clean. Pool area was nice. Grounds were well maintained. The rooms were ok, beds and pillows were horrendous, service was ok and slow...staff was not too friendly. Had to complain to front desk more than once, not something I like to do while I'm on vacation. All in all this was an okay vacation with a high pricetag! Also, take note of your bill because we had erroneous bar charges on ours and had to have them investigated before we left. Would probably not go again! Too many other places where I can spend my vacation and get a better value!

Reviews.Title: “Inept management and service”
Reviews.Author: guest1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is staffed by incompetents and personel who will promise anything to get you to go away but deliver nothing. Long lines at the front desk always. At check in the clerk will promise anything about the room. Of course I wanted a room with a water view. That was unavailable to me. I did state that I did not want a room overlooking a garge or parking lot and that is what I received. I did complain, and my room was changed to a slightly better room overlooking the cars pulling into the Hotel Entrance. Housekeeping did not deliver towels as promised twice. The pools were not filtered enough and there were floating small pieces of debris in the water. A shame because the place is truly beautiful. It is just not run properly.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: allmel
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1-beautiful beach with plenty of sun beds and umbrellas (you have to ask the waiters to put one up for you) 2-nicely sized rooms 3-staff seemed very pleasant 4-lobby bar stays open late with band or dj for latin dancing 5- great spa ($140 for 50 min hot stone massage) Cons: 1- everything was so expensive at the hotel. Just to give you an idea on prices: $10 for a smallish mojito, pina coladas, etc & $6 for a can of beer, breafast buffet was about $30 per person; tuna salad wrap with tortillas chips at the pool restaurant was $13. I didn't even try to eat dinner at the hotel restaurants because the menus seemed so pricey ( between $25-$35 per entree). I think that's just too expensive even if you are on vacation. 2-you need a car or get a taxi if you want to eat a mid priced meal. We ate at a restaurant called Antojitos that was moderately priced and had good puerto rican food. It's at the end of the road just before rt 3. I was disappointed that there wasn't alot of puerto rican food served at the hotel during the day. I ate alot of american food. 3-you need to look at your bill carefully when you check out. I was charged a bellman's fee of $14 though I had never used any of the bellman's services. And a mini bar charge appeared on my bill and i han't had anything from it. overall the rio mar was just ok. from what i hear, if you want to stay in this part of the island, the rio mar is the best you can do. don't forget to rent a car. The hotel shuttle to and from the airport is $60 per person. for that amount, you'll have a car to eat at restaurants outside the hotel and sight see.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for familes; enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: fg2704
Reviews.Content: What a great place for families! Great pool, great beach. Good service pretty much everywhere at the hotel with only small issues here and there. Biggest drawback was the closed casino. The hotel will shuttle you to the nearby Gran Meila (15 to 20 minutes) but we're talking small "kill some time" casinos, not Las Vegas destinations, so even though I did this a couple of nights, it wasn't worth it. Especially not a good idea when the shuttle bus is full getting back to the Wyndham and I had to wait an hour for the next one. Just plan on skipping the casino experience (which was a big drawback because this was a factor in selecting this hotel in March and I never got any notice that it would close the day we arrived). As I write this review and rate this hotel, I have to look past this factor because it made me very angry. When we first arrived, food prices blew us away, but food anywhere in PR isn't really cheap. When you figure in the convenience and extra safety factor, I would say this goes with the territory. Reasonably priced kids menu, but it's limited. That said, we didn't eat or drink ($10 a drink) at the hotel much as a result. We got a small fridge for our room and bought some drinks to keep around. Hard to figure that this was something they would do, but I have to not knock them for high drink prices if they make it easier to have my own. Strange business practice, but works for families. Staff was very nice to us almost all the time. Front desk and Concierge were pretty busy most of the time and didn't move quickly, but that was a result of staff working to take care of each person. They had printed directions to almost everything ready to hand out--very helpful. Valet parking was a little slow at peak times, but that should be expected. We learned to call ahead and they always had it ready to go. This was the nicest (most expensive) resort in which we have ever stayed, so we weren't the big tippers. We focused on being nice to the staff, even when we were tired, and tipping modestly. We were treated well in return. In terms of places to eat, we are apparently just too darn Americanized. Our favorite family places were Wing Hut (next to Pep Boys and North of Hwy 3 at the same turn where Walmart is to the south). Go figure, the standard Hibachi Grill which did a great job and entertained too; Don Pepe: combo mexican and local dishes just west of the turn on Hwy 3 into the resort and Antojitos, a local food menu right on the road from Hwy 3 to the resort. We also stopped quite a few times at the bakery on Hwy 3 which we found to be good food and excellent baked goods and sandwiches. Service was difficult and not well organized, but we still enjoyed it and met one of the owners who was a very nice lady. We organized most of our own off-resort activites to save a little money or tailor it to our needs. You do save money, but you also have a little more stress. All of our activities went well, but don't hesitate to ask for referrals, you'll probably get a good one and that's more reliable than a web site. Other than the casino, we didn't really have anything to complain about and the hotel was full during our stay including some business groups and graduations. Occasionally you might have to wait a little, but if you can check your attitude and recognize when you are tired, you will realize that most of the people there want to help you enjoy your stay. Frankly, I think most of the negative posts on this site are by people you couldn't make happy in a million years. They want a $500 room for $100 and everything to revolve around them. Just know you're going to have to pay up to stay here even if you get a good room rate--this is a great resort and its staff and owners deserve to make a living. All things considered, this was a great resort we could enjoy year after year. And the closed casino probably saved me money and got me more sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: global321
Reviews.Content: Although housed in a nice building and grounds, there were major problems at the Westin Rio Mar. First, you are in the middle of nowhere! That would be fine as they advertise that they have several on site restaurants. Most were not open on weekdays though and that left us with few eating options. One night we were forced to eat peanut butter sandwiches in our room. Our second problem with the Rio Mar is the lack of cleanliness inside and out including the beach which always had a ton of garbage along the shoreline. Our room was only given a quick "once over" each day and were not clean on arrival or any day that we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Bubba_Who_Now
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the hotel and grounds very much. The wait staff could not have been friendlier, they went our of their was to help you, but later on I found out why. Almost everything at the Resort has a fee attached to it. The fees add up every quickly. Keep an eye on your biill because they have no issues in helping you out in some way and then charging your room. If someone asks your room number, you will be charged. I would not have been able to afford this trip, but my wife's company sent a group of us there as a "thank you". Very nice of them I might add... The grounds are 25 miles from the airport, we had the hotel shuttle pick us up. I have no idea of the cost to have this done, but it is not free. The driver was nice enough to stop at the store at the top of the street so we could all get bottles of liquor & mixers for our rooms because I had read reviews that said mix drinks were $10, well it's true. If you are going to be sitting by the pool or on the beach all day and you don't want to ring up $200 a day tabs for just drinks, hit the store.The hotel charges $120 for the same bottle of Grey Goose you can get for $19 at the store. When we got to the hotel, we were early, I was not expecting to get in to a room. Half of our group were able to get in to their rooms right away, the rest of us hit the Tiki Bar (more on the Tiki Bar later). Because our room was not ready, the desk comped us $40 to use any way we wanted. I thought that was very nice of them because they did not need to give us anything since we were three hours early. The room was nice. Great view of the mountains. Two larger than full size beds, nice clean bathroom, wet bar with a small fridge, TV, tile floor with a rug around the bed area, safe in the closet, small deck with table and chairs. The standard hotel room+. Ocean view would have been nice but I would have dreaded a room anywhere near the pools with all the activities going on during the day. The lobby is on the third floor, so when we stayed on the sixth floor we were only three floors from the roof, and the A/C units. It made sitting on the deck a little loud, but I live in the city, I'm used to hearing a/c cranking when I'm on roof decks. The food was ok. Prices ranged from a $3.50 ham & cheese croissant from David's Cookies (really a coffee shop) to $120 Surf & Turf. We ate at most of the restaurants at the hotel and they were all ok. Nothing was significantly outstanding, just ok. The prices they charged were expensive for the quality of the food received. The best meal we had was at the Asian/Sushi restaurant. Never expected to find good sushi in Puerto Rico! Most of the time we ate at the Tiki Bar. They had a limited menu of burgers and chicken sandwiches. Not bad, at busy times you could wait about 20 mins for your food. The Tiki bar is a small beach front bar with live music somedays. It's right in the middle of the action so you wont miss much. The view was great! Some info you might need: The Tiki Bar does NOT take cash, only room charges. I saw many people get upset with this, I think they were over reacting my self. All the other bars and restaurants do take cash. Just another note, when you order a beer, the cans are all 10oz!!!!! They charge you $6 for this little beer too. If you go to the lobby bar, and ask for a bottle you can get a real 12oz beer for the same price. Overall the hotel was nice, but expensive. I did not come across the rude help that I have read about in other reviews, the staff bent over backwards for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: bronxkid9
Reviews.Content: This hotel left alot to be desired. When we arrived, the valet did not want to take the car. I pulled the suitcases from the car and watched as my daughter (9 years old) struggled to carry her bag up the steps while 3 bellhops watched her and continued their conversation. We arrived to check in to find our rooms were not ready. We were told to change into bathing suits in the bathrooms next to the check-in desk. We went to the pool to find it had film floating on top of the water and vomit. When we were allowed into the room, it was nice. The next day we enjoyed some of the facilities. At 4pm, we returned to the room to find that it was still not made up. We called to have it prepared and an hour later someone came up. The pool still had the same issues as before even after several people complained. The next day we used the cabana, since it was included in the package. Someone dropped off the sodas and water in the morning and we never saw him again. The pool still had the mysterious film. We had lunch at a beachside bar. It took 1 hour to bring a $13.50 chicken salad sandwich. Later that day, we went to the room to find it was not ready at 5pm and when I called, the operator asked, "what do you want me to do?" Then they cleaned the room and did not bring toiletries. I called again but no one dropped of the shampoo. I had to drive to a store to get shampoo. To get the car out of the valet was an experience. It took on average 15-30 minutes to get the car and the valet gave me a dirty look as I handed him the key. The next day we complained to the manager who did try to help. She agreed the service was so bad, the offered us 20000 starwood points and wipe out all room charges. We left. While leaving, the bell staff made sure the service was good. This angered me more because this showed that the hotel was not properly supervising its employees. The kids camp was good, the casino was good, but they could not make up for what was the worst experience my family ever had on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in paradise”
Reviews.Author: allsmiles8
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two boys (6 and 12) stayed at the Westin Rio mar from May 11-15 2007.
