Reviews.Title: “A Happy New Year at the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: travelbugs5
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this review by saying I might be a bit more critical had I been paying $800 per night for my room! As it was we paid half that for one day (coupon) and the other nights were on Starwood points, so we didn't have too much to complain about from the get go. The Westin Rio Mar is set on a beautiful beach northeast of San Juan. The property is lovely, and the landscape is beautiful. I never grew tired of looking at a lagoon pool with palm trees and a stretch of beach in the background! The staff was friendly, and efficiency kind of depended on the luck of the draw. I agree Caribbean time is very laaaaaaaaiiiiddddddd baaaaaccccckkkkkk! If you're in a hurry, go to a large bustling city. We wanted to leave that behind so the big slowdown was not a problem. Our worst service was at a local restaurant that was highly recommended on this website (La Parilla). We waited over an hour for our food! But I have to say, it was worth the wait...more flavorful and a much better value than anything we ate at the hotel. You really must rent a car if you go to this property. It made all the difference for us. For one thing, it sounds like (and was the case for us) most of the restaurants go on some kind of hiatus throughout the year. There were a mere 5 restaurants open during the busy New Year's week. That's out of 12! Oh, but David's Cookies was a lifesaver, with bagels in the morning and ice cream at night....I would imagine that's a staple there, and doesn't close seasonally. We ate at Shimas. It was pretty good. I would say our sushi at home is much better but they had a dessert that was the best thing we ate in Puerto Rico....a banana crepe with vanilla/macadamia nut ice cream. Maybe skip the sushi, get their entree, and GET DESSERT THERE! Marbella is a restaurant right off the lobby serving your basic family fare. A salad was $14 to $16 and sparse to say the least. As you might expect from a resort hotel, you will pay up on food and drinks. Tropical drinks poolside are $9 so plan ahead to pay up because they are frozen and fabulous and you can order from your chaise on the beach, at the pool or in the hot tub. It's quite the treat! The Club Coqui, the restaurant that's poolside was a huge ripoff. We paid $82 for lunch there one day for the five of us...and not for any feast, either! The trouble is, there aren't a lot of options for lunch and we wanted to stay on the grounds. So in a sense, they've gotcha! Definitely hit the bakery at the corner of Rt. 3 where you turn in for the resort. They have great sandwiches and are super friendly there. Wish we had discovered that earlier in the trip. Seeing the rainforest on our own was great. It's very close to the resort. I don't think I would have wanted to pay the hotel tour fee times five. We did fine on our own and hiked to the waterfall--gorgeous. The path was clearly marked. It WAS NOT muggy and buggy like I'd imagined, but cool and comfy. But wear gym shoes! Leave plenty of time for Old San Juan. We cut it too close to our return flight, ran into traffic, and had a hard time parking, which was disappointing because it looked really fun. Plan a half day at least for Old San Juan. But the thing is, you'll find it hard to leave this nice resort. We loved the climate, too, where you never broke a sweat, but were always comfy and warm. Shade was plentiful so staying outside all day between the pool and beach was no problem. The lounge chairs at the quiet pool are especially nice and if you have a great book, you may never want to leave! One funny thing...I was disappointed that our ocean front view (which is extra $$ as well as higher points) was blocked by a huge palm tree. We decided to live with it, but the third day they trimmed all of the palm trees and our view improved 100%. You'd think we had requested that! It was like night and day and the latter part of the week we felt we had the best view in the place. We really enjoyed our stay. No, this Westin wasn't a perfectly oiled machine like some we've stayed at. We travel a lot, but critique our vacations by how much fun we have as a family. We were so happy to be away and in a warm climate that I think nothing bothered us too much. We had a blast. I recommend it for pure relaxation and family time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a great trip”
Reviews.Author: BaltoBalto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Puerto Rico with my brother and his girlfriend in August 2006. We LOVED it. We are all avid travelers and have quite a few data points to compare with. The service at this hotel was incredible, even during the first half of our stay when they were hosting a business convention and the hotel was clearly fully booked. The man who checked us in at the front desk was exceptionally helpful, ensuring that we got rooms close to each other and upgrading us to ocean view rooms. Another person who stood out was one of the concierges, who spent quite some time going over the area's attractions with us. The restaurant and housekeeping staff were also very helpful. The hotel itself is quite nice too (rooms, golf course and restaurants) and the beach is absolutely wonderful. It's also in a pretty good location (with a car) for excursions to Fajardo (where we did a lot of diving out of) and is right outside the El Yunque forest. We had a great time and would definitely go back to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdvacationer007
Reviews.Content: Wow.. after reading some of the reviews, I wondered if some of them were for the same Westin, we stayed. We had a great time. Our room was great - had a nice ocean view from balcony. House keeping was excellent - we actually tipped our house keeper. The staff could not have been more helpful. The gym adjacent to the spa was well kept... bottled water and towel on each piece of equipment . Equipment was state of the art with TV and head phones on each and no charge to use facilities. Spa treatments were top notch... massages, manicures, and pedicures. Beach was great... we sat out on the West beach entrance area - it was very peaceful and uncrowded. My husband enjoyed the waves for body surfing. Service on the beach was great as well. Casino was alot of fun... dealers were helpful with the rookie gamblers. Great food and drinks... fresh!! My husband and I traveled with our 2 daughters age 21 and 22. They enjoyed it as well. We would defintely go back. From the other reviews.. it appears that Christmas week is not the week to go... probably too many guest and not enough staff. We are planning to return next year for the same week... Relaxing after the holiday rush and a great way to start off the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but probably not returning any day soon”
Reviews.Author: californiamom
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that we stayed on Westin points. If I would have paid the regular rate of almost $700/night, maybe not. Read on and judge for yourself... POSITIVES: 1. The beach is absolutely beautiful. It is a soft, brown sand. Did like the idea that the beach is not that large so the walking is minimized. In fact, the entire hotel is compact, not spread out. You can go way out into the ocean and only have the water come up to your waist. Was not completely impressed with the water though. Could not see to the bottom, but the colors were pretty. Have been in much prettier waters elsewhere. We were there at the end of December and ventured into the water every day. The beach would be the only reason to return. The hotel provides complimentary lounge chairs and umbrellas, but go early to get one during busy season. 2. The main pool has a slow curvy waterslide. (Been to Nick hotel so every other waterslide is slow compared to that place. Unfair? Yes, but oh well.) The other pool is for quiet relaxation. There was also a bouncer, a small selection of kids activities, a playground and a tiny ferris wheel. 3. We did not experience any of the staff problems as other writers did, but maybe because we speak some Spanish? Not sure. Overall the service in the Caribbean runs on its own time, so we're used to things being a bit slower. We had some requests and everything was taken care of to our satisfaction. We actually found the people to be very sweet, helpful, always smiling and kind. 4. Took the rainforest tour offered through the hotel. Was just going to rent a car and go because we're not the "touring" type, but massively happy we didn't. Take the tour. It is so incredibly worth it. Our driver was Harry, amazing guy. He told us he's "Neurican - Puerto Rican born in New York." 5. Our room was large, but not luxurious per se. We were upgraded to an ocean view - not a full straight on view, but we could definitely see the ocean. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom spacious, but not luxurious. Larger balcony with table and two chairs. 6. Free wi-fi in the lobby, but not in the room. I think it was 14 something per day. 7. Small casino on premises. 8. Iguanas - they are everywhere. Truly a sight to see. Some of them are really, really big. 9. Did like the idea that the food areas are mostly indoors and air-conditioned, unlike other caribbean properties that are open air. NEGATIVES: 1. Food. YIKES! We met a man who said he's been going to the property every single year at the same time for the last seven years. He said the food is absolutely some of the worst he's had at any Westin. Other people in the jacuzzi were laughing and telling rotten food stories... Shimas is the only restaurant that was edible. This restaurant offers a combo of Asian fare. Not the best, but compared to everything else it's great. Make restaurant reservations when you make hotel reservations. Every night we were there, the only time available was 9:30. The main restaurant downstairs had a buffet and regular menu. We ordered plain pasta. It came to the table uncooked! The selection at the buffet was of 5 hot items. And the prices are typical Westin rates for yucky food. We heard room service was better, but didn't get a chance to try that. They also have this quick serve coffee shop with cookies and breads. One night they ran out of decaf coffee. That was kind of interesting.... 2. Kids arcade - way too small and extremely loud. 3. Shopping - One hotel gift shop - cannot charge to your room without a picture id. Bothersome policy that should be told to guests upon check in. Small selection of beachwear and of all things, sandals. You would think that in a place like this that sandals would be plentiful, but not at this Westin. There was also a very small kiosk selling some kind of painted things. The only other place to shop on property is a dive shop by the pool. That's it. Hotel definitely needs to add some sort of shopping area. 4. Hotel location - about an hour from Old San Juan. Pretty inconvenient unless you're planning to go to the rainforest. Once you turn off the main road, you still have to head up another road and then go over a multitude of speed bumps, etc. Once you get to the hotel, you really can't leave unless you have transport. No drugstore or market anywhere in walking distance. In fact, I do not recall seeing a drugstore within at least 30 mins of the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for a few days after a cruise. Next time would probably just stay closer to Old San Juan. We don't believe we'd just decide to vacation in Puerto Rico for a week or something like that. The flight there from Los Angeles is LONG!

Reviews.Title: “Westin RIo Mar Golf Villa”
Reviews.Author: mamanooch
Reviews.Content: We recently rented a golf villa for a week on the grounds of the Westin Rio Mar. We were nervous about renting through an individual owner, so we went through Rio Mar Realty, which is apparently the only "official" company that is approved by the Westin. The condo itself was really lovely - - spacious, modern, nicely furnished, beautiful views. The only problem was the service which, frankly, is something we have found each time we have gone to Puerto Rico. We arrived late, and were told by Rio Mar Realty to check-in at the main hotel where there would be an envelope waiting for us with keys, etc. But when we got there, nobody seemed to know what was going on. We waited for over 1/2 hour while people searched for it before we finally happened to notice an envelope with our name on it sitting right in front of the person at the registration desk! Then, nobody seemed to know where our golf villa was. There are several "clusters" of them, it was dark, it was our first time there - - and noone could tell us how to get to our villa. Truly unbelievable. We ended up just driving around until we luckily stumbled upon the entrance to our cluster! Good thing we had a car, especially since the villas are a good distance from the main hotel and there is no shuttle! We finally found our unit, unpacked, and got into bed - - only to find that the AC in the bedrooms had some sort of rattle and was so loud each time it cycled on that we were up all night. We also found that the internet was not working, as promised. This was a problem since my husband had work that he had to do for his office. We contacted Rio Mar Real Estate first thing the next morning and told them of the two problems. Nothing was done. We called them twice a day for our entire stay. Each time we were told that they would take care of it - - and then did absolutely nothing! We ended up keeping the AC in the bedrooms off, and blasting the one in the LR so we could keep cool, and going to the lobby of the Westin to use the internet. Not exactly what we had anticipated for the price we were paying for the condo! Also had a problem receiving an important UPS package that was sent to my husband. Again, after noone could locate it, we found it ourselves at the hotel! Despite these issues with the realty company, we were glad to be in a condo and not in the Westin itself, which was absolutely packed with people! True, it was vacation week, but the Westin didn't have enough restaurants, beach chairs, etc., to accomodate the enormous numbers of people. The other problem with the Westin is that there is inadequate drainage on the golf courses. Since it rains a LOT in that area (it is right next to the rainforest, after all), you would think that they would have planned for this. No such luck. Even when the sun was shining, the courses were so water-logged that they were completely unplayable. So, those who chose the Westin in order to golf were sorely disappointed. These problems aside, the area around the Westin is beautiful and has a lot to offer. But if you go, do make sure you have rented a car so that you can take advantage of restaurants and activities outside of the resort. We went to Luquillo beach, which was lovely and uncrowded. We also went horseback riding and hiking in the Rain Forest. If you try to arrange these things through the hotel, the mark-up is ridiculous (for example, a two hour horseback ride is $60 per person if you book it and get there yourself and $93 per person if you book through the Westin. If you are a family of four that really adds up! ) Also, the food at the resort is, predictably, very over-priced and with the exception of the Italian place, not that good. We had wonderful meals in restaurants in the nearby towns of Luquillo and Fajardo (La Parilla, Lolitas and Pasion por el Fogon were especially good), and they were a fraction of the price. So, if you want a warm location that is not too far, not as expensive as most, and in a beautiful place with a lot to do and see, this may still be a good choice - - just don't go expecting great service!

Reviews.Title: “They must pay for their 4-5 star rating - This is NOT a high service hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl_TRIP
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews and being familiar with Westin properties we ventured to think for the price we were paying ($800/night) we would be staying at a high quality hotel away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan. Boy were we wrong. Customer service is an area that requires much improvement. We booked our dinner reservations in advance and reconfirmed on the day of our arrival. We showed up at the Grill Room for dinner to be told we did not have a reservation and they could not help me. I requested they call the reservation system, which again confirmed I had a reservation. The snotty hostess still told me I dd not have a reservation even after their own folks confirmed it. This issue was not resolved until the manager stepped in. The management here must be very limited with towels, toilet paper and soap. We needed to call each evening for towels for the four of us in the room. As we had no plans to share the two towels provided amongest us. Toilet paper rolls with a few pices were left on the roll and not replaced. There was one day we needed to call to remind them to clean our room at 4:30pm!!! The crowning blow to this very poor customer service orientated hotel was on our return to the airport the driver never bothered to tell us we needed to clear US Agriculture scanning before waiting in the airline check in. This mistake added another half hour to our wait at the airport. Based on this experience I am very leary of any hotel ratings...I will rely more on the customer inputs like this because they live the nightmares and probably stay clear of Westins in the future. I

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time and money”
Reviews.Author: lauramg119
Reviews.Content: Take every bad thing you've read on here about this hotel and put it all together and that would equal the week I just spent at the Westin Rio Mar with my family. Yes we had read the reviews, but because the hotel was free (we were orginally staying at the Hyatt but because it's being renovated they paid for us to stay here, we should have just stayed home) we decided to go through with it. Bad idea. The beach /pool is nice and well kept, as well as the rooms. However, 4 of 7 days we didn't have maid service before 5pm and had to call for it. I understand that this was their busiest week of the year, but it's not like it's the first time it's been the busiest week of the year. We had called in advance for Christmas Eve and Christmas dinner reservations, not being told that we needed to book for the rest of the week, we were out of luck at eating at the resort because everything was booked. We were sent to Don Pepe's one night...DONT GO. Not only was the service and food awful, the place is a dump, and to top it off we were attacked by dogs and ally cats on the way out. The hotel staff while at first seems helpful, they will stop mid conversation and begin to go do something else before finishing up with you. The weather last week wasn't great, which is obviously not anything that can be controlled, but I believe because of where it is on the island that is why we experienced so much rain. We met a young man on the plane on the way home who had actually stayed at the Hyatt Villas and said they had 1 hour of rain the whole week, I've traveled all over Europe, the Carribean, and the US and this is the one place I can say I will NEVER return. The hotel is not the equivalent of many Westins I have stayed in, mediocre at best. Please feel free to contact me if you'd like specific questions answered before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lied too the whole trip”
Reviews.Author: walterbme
Reviews.Content: first arrived on 12/27/06. was put over the matientenance garage with absolutely no view. i booked 2 oceanfront rooms. was told not to unpack they would move us in the morning, that they were overbooked and sorry. would fix the propblem and move us next day. went back next day only to be told the rooms werent ready untill 3:00 pm we would have our rooms then. at that time we went back to front dest to be moved and was told we did not have oceanfront but oceanview rooms booked. we fought with them showing them the confirmation stating oceanfront and we didn't appreciated being called liers. the only ones that had been lieying was them. went back to room and called orbitz they said they had confirmation from hotel for oceanfront. and called while we were on the phone with them. the manager would not come to the phone for orbitz.. this is our third night over the maintenance garage and my whole trip thus far has been ruined with fighting with hotel to be moved from the basement watching the work trucks park next to our room. i have 7 more nights here and am miserable. would not come back here if thet paid me too. this if fraudulent. i paid for 2 expensive rooms and here i set watching the work trucks, we are not the only people here trying to get the rooms we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location: Average Foood”
Reviews.Author: jasonnnn
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is nestled in 500 acres of Prestine Beach and Rainforest. Aside from the large destruction of rainforest to build the two golf courses, I really loved the location of this Hotel. Westin, who runs the Hotel was average at best. The dinner restaurants at the hotel were seriously overpriced and the food was average at best. I don't mind paying for food so long as the food tastes good and is fresh. Anyway, we ate at some of the local restaurants in the area, and they were great and a quarter the price, lolitas and don pepe's both served fresh and authentic food. This Hotel charges you for everthing, breakfast not included, if you want internet, if you lose towels, parking, 165 for golf (not that i played), 185 for snorkeling, rent a boat, nothing given for free at this hotel, if you look at them the wrong way they may put it on your room bill. The rooms were nice, but the bed sheets were rough like the management used too much clorex when washing the sheets. Otherwise, the bed was average, bathroom was nice and large, shower had good water pressure, air conditioning was fine. All in all, I did have an excellent RELAXIng time.

Reviews.Title: “A Different Experience”
Reviews.Author: islandbreeze62
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely stunning but it was different than any hotel experience I had ever had. I have been to many Sheraton Resorts in my lifetime but this was the first time I was ever virtually forced to stay at the resort almost my entire trip. With the exception of a few restaurants and the rainforest (a must see) there was VIRTUALLY NOTHING else around the hotel. The other nearby beaches were gross in comparrision to the stunning beach at the hotel. Although we had to stay at the resort the whole time, the resort was such a great one that the trip was still wonderful. The staff at the beach was so nice and friendly and helped us find chairs and umbrellas without us even asking. There are cabanas available for a charge but the free padded chairs are equally wonderful. The two pools were also awesome. There was a fun pool with a water volley ball court, water slide, and huge jacuzzis. There was also a quiet pool for those who chose to lounge. Lots of free pool activities went on such as FREE HAIRBRAIDING and FREE WATER AEROBICS. Everynight they start a bonfire and have free s'amore making and they have dive-in-movies at the pool. There were also lots of iguanas around the property which was a neat experience and there were daily iguana feedings as well. We ate breakfast daily at their buffet. It was pricy but extremly delicious. We also tried their Italian restaurant one night and I had the best fettichini alfredo I had ever had in my life! I'm a tennis player and I must say, the courts were VERY impressive. They were clay courts and they had a very nice complex. However, tennis charges were very pricy so I didn't play as often as I would have liked to. The casino looked fun but we didn't spend any time there. But if you're going to be traveling with a family, don't worry about it. We were in a room right by the casino and we didn't hear a thing. The lobby is full of parrots and other exotic animals which is also intereseting. Overall, an amazing resort, and would definetly reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: smrnj
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay and had a great time. Every member of the staff that we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge desk and the chambermaids. The beach is nice, but there are a limited number of umbrellas, so if shade is important to you, you should claim one early. I had dinner at the Grille Room, which was excellent and worth the money. I also had dinner at Shimas which i thought was overpriced and the portions small. The food, at least, was good. I was upgraded to a junior suite, which was big and clean, but overlooked the roof and was next to the elevator. Despite, continuous efforts, I was unable to get a room change during my stay. They claimed that only 20% of the rooms have a king bed, which was why they were unable to find me another room. The location is great, nice and secluded. Renting a car was a breeze from the airport and the drive to the hotel was no problem. I would strongly consider returning. Pros: Friendly Staff, Good Food, clean property/rooms, plenty of activities (water sports, basketball, casino, spa, gym, etc), secluded Cons: Hard to get a room change, limited cabanas/umbrellas on the beach, steam room did not work during stay

Reviews.Title: “Just back from the Westin Rio Mar....”
Reviews.Author: butter
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at the Westin Rio Mar. There had been some mixed reviews here, so I was ready to see for myself. Overall we had a great time. I'll caveat that by saying we got upgraded to a huge suite, which of course made the trip even better. Not sure how big the standard rooms are. The staff who checked us in did a great job and were very nice. The staff at the poolside were not as good, and one time I placed a beverage order which never showed up so I went to the poolside bar myself to get it. It wasn't a big deal, but that's not great service. There are 2 pools + a kiddy pool. The first day we sat at the adult quiet pool but then the other days we sat by the activity pool. Even though we liked the quiet of the adult pool, the activity pool got more sun. We had no problem getting seats by the pool. In terms of food, our package included breakfast, which is served buffet style and had made-to-order omelets as well as many other selections. The hotel restaurants are average for dinner. Expensive and mediocre (but not terrible) food. We ate at The Grille Room, Palio and Shimas and I'd say you can skip Shimas. We also ate one night "off campus" at Don Pepe, a local restaurant recommended by the concierge, and it was terrific! Go there! We enjoyed the spa. They were always running late, but you atill got the full-time of your service. We didn't bring our kids, but it seems to be a very kid-friendly place.... it was packed with families. The casino is small but on a busy night, it did open up some additional blackjack tables. We chose the Westin over the Ritz Carlton mostly because the Ritz Carlton rooms do not all have balconies, and I love to read outside on the balcony in the AM while my husband sleeps late. I ddin't price out the Ritz this time, but my guess is that the Westin is also more reasonably priced. There is the downside of it being further from the airport, but that only took about 45 minutes and I don't feel like I lost out on so much time because of it. Overall, I would go back again, especially if with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “just got back”
Reviews.Author: ob3
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 4 day stay. My husband won the trip thru work so the price was right. Our room was 6131 which overlooked the roof so stay away from this area of the hotel when booking your rooms. The resort was very nice and the staff was friendly. The beach honeslty wasn"t that great but the ocean was nice and the pool area was great. Food was not overly expensive but drinks were very costly. There is a Davids cookies onsite were you can get a ice cream,cookies muffins at a very good price. All in all is was a nice place but I was glad I didn't pay for it. Don't know if I would go back might try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bueno”
Reviews.Author: Who'sBetterThanUs
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently returned from a wedding hosted at the Rio Mar. I hadn't done any research on the hotel prior because we had no choice in the matter, but I am pleased to say that our four-day stay was very pleasant. The resort is a well-rounded hotel which tends to cater well to large groups (corporate events, weddings, etc.). The property is nice and the food very good. The drinks are on the steep side ($9.50 pina coladas & $7 beers), but the staff is very friendly...some of the nicest people I've met. The sand is the softest I've ever touched and the views are wonderful from all angles. I would probably stay at another hotel next time just to get a different experience, but wouldn't be disappointed to return to the Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WORTH the Money!”
Reviews.Author: matthew1
Reviews.Content: I had been doing research on this hotel for a few months and had been going back and forth between this property and the Paradisus--wasn't sure if I should go all inclusive or a la carte. I made the RIGHT decision. Reading some of the reviews on here for the Westin, I was kind of worried. Many of them were negative and I cannot understand why. The Westin was gorgeous. The food was amazing. The room was clean--no bugs, dirt, etc. The grounds were well-kept, the concierge was more personable than any other I have come in contact with. They went out of there way EVERYTIME my boyfriend and I approached. Coming into the front entrance, I was asked by the bellhop on more than one occasion if I needed water or something else to drink---it was awesome!!!!! The beach was great---the people just sooo nic--not snobby at all! The only issue we had was the weather--not in the Westin's control at all. Even with the rainy weather we had, the concierge was able to recommend an alternative to the snorkeling trip we had and we ended up having a fabulous time with the old san juan tour. Ed is great tour guide! The restaurants were great! Yes, they are expensive, but we expected it since we did our research--I really think it's funny that people complain a lot about costs--the website has all their menus on it, along with prices--so if you are reading this review right now, you obviously have access to a computer---DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFOREHAND!! Number 1 rule of travel :) If you don't want to pay a lot of money for great meals, then stay somewhere cheaper. The people are very nice and the cabs are great. We did eat at Don Pepe our last night and the portions are huge! Very good food. Marbella was awesome--exactly what you would expect. Grille room--gorgeous, great steak, Palio--very good risotto and dessert! We ate at Shimas--good food--nothing "stellar" but worth the money. Definitely go with the appetizers/sushio vs. the lo mein (not worth the $20) Check-in was quick, check-out even quicker. DEFINITELY WOULD GO AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamita99
Reviews.Content: Is a good big hotel, very clean and the employees are friendly. Have a beach but I don't like it because in other parts of the Island we have better. I like the pools, they have one for families that have a water slide and two others for adults that want quiet time. Have two golf courses, tennis courts, gym, spa, pubs, good restaurants specially the japanese restaurant. The only thing I donÂ´t like is the location. This Hotel is in Rio Grande, very far from San Juan. The only "recreation" is a visit to "El Yunque" Tropical Forest. If you are the kind of person that likeÂ´s partying, this is not youÂ´re hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: KH8th
Reviews.Content: Heed the reviews of others to get a feeling for what to expect at the Westin. Overall, it was 'average', and we likely would not return. We are both serious golfers and booked the 'unlimited golf package' because of the two highly rated courses on the property. This pkg. included breakfast daily, no other meals. We did not rent a car, so stayed within the property. FYI..If you have a rental car you will have to pay $15/day to self-park, or $20/day for valet parking. Beware that many of the "12 restaurants" are closed, so choices are limited. Food is more expensive than expected even for a resort property. Make dinner reservations as soon as you arrive and scope out what is or will be open during your stay. I recommend the Iguana Pub at the golf course for lunch and dinner, more reasonably priced and good choices available. The people/ employees are very nice, and service was good, which made it a more pleasant experience. the grounds are impeccably clean and well maintained. Beach was beautiful, sandy and warm, no rocks, easy to enjoy. Rooms were clean and neat. We booked an 'ocean view' room and were given a room with the tiniest balcony. Golf course catered to members and not resort guests. The nicer of the two courses, The Ocean, we were only allowed to play on twice. You may be disappointed that on "the ocean" course you will only be near the ocean very briefly on hole #16. Blink and you will miss it. River course was nice, runs along a noisy highway, but still a challenge. Hotel seems to be primarily focused on convention business and professional meetings. Pool area was closed off at certain times for their private receptions. On a good note, they smartly have a "quiet pool" and another pool for children and families. Management is interested in feedback and held a small cocktail reception one evening asking guests what they liked and disliked about the stay. Overall, for a Westin property I was expecting it to be "a notch up" from what we experienced. Go and enjoy but be aware of the drawbacks. Also, allow time to straighten out your bill on day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: We spent one night pre-cruise at the Westin Rio Mar. We rented a car from Hertz at the San Juan airport and drove to the Westin. Here is a tip: the Hertz trip computers at the desk will route you to the Westin via Route 23 (I think that is it), but Route 66 is MUCH faster. 23 is a busy street with stop light on almost every corner while 66 appears to be just recently opened and is more of a freeway with at least one toll booth ($1.50). However using 66 will save you at least 15-20 minutes I think. If using Hertz ask the front desk people about 66 - if you donâ€™t they just wave you over to the computer terminal to print out the map. Other companies may tell you about 66 on their maps. Back to the hotel. I am surprised by some of the negative reviews posted here. We found the hotel to be quite nice, with beautiful grounds, great pools and hot tubs, and a very, very nice beach. The public areas were extremely nice and our room was large and roomy and of course had the Westin Heavenly Bed. The bathroom was large, there was adequate closet and storage space, an in room safe, and coffee and tea equipment and supplies. The room was spotless in every respect. Every staff member we dealt with was polite and helpful. As we wanted to visit El Yunque (just a few minutes away) the morning before we checked out to return to San Juan to board our cruise ship I enquired about a later check out time than the normal noon. They gladly extended the check out time to 3 pm which was ideal for us, giving us time to shower and clean up before returning to San Juan. That was very generous of them. We did not eat in any of the dining areas but did use the David Cookies for bagels and cream cheese in the morning. Things at David were priced reasonably. The posted menus at the various dining venues indicated that the prices were typical for a big hotel/resort. We had dinner at a small local place just outside the gate down the road before reaching the main highway. The food was excellent, the owner was extremely friendly and the prices were reasonable. This was Antojitos PuertorriqueÃ±os Carr. 968 #160, Bo. Las Coles Rio Grande, PR 00745 (787) 888-7378 Puerto Rican Food We visited El Yunque the morning prior to returning to San Juan and it was extremely interesting. There are several places where one can hike into the forest and see waterfalls, the trees, etc, or one can just drive around, pulling off at vista points here and there. Either way it is well worth seeing. One hint â€“ get there early. Since we were staying close we were there before 9am. Before we left (about noon) the place was packed with tour busses, probably from San Juan and cruise ships. We returned to the Westin, showered, packed, checked out and returned to San Juan to turn in the car and board the cruise ship. Here is another big hint. We reserved the car for airport pickup and downtown San Juan return to the Hertz office. We had a difficult and frustrating time finding the downtown office, and since we drove right past the airport to get downtown it seemed that maybe an airport turn in would have been better. However, unless Hertz offers courtesy shuttles from the airport to the docks then a cab ride would have been needed. The downtown office did provide free transfers to the cruise dock. Overall we would rate the Westin Rio Mar highly and would stay there again. We found it to be much more relaxing than staying in San Juan and being able to see El Yunque easily was a real plus. One thing to note is that the parking is not included and the rate is $15 a day for self parking - a bit of a rip but not much you can do about it.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky And Forced All Inclusive Hell”
Reviews.Author: DestinationGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for people that like over air conditioned all inclusive resorts that look like cruise ships that don't float. Not only are the food and the rooms overpriced and underwhelming -- they cater to every bad American traveler stereotype. This hotel is the equivalent to fast food: generic with mediocre service. And worst of all, they place the resort 30 miles from San Juan so unless you have a car you are basically serving out a jail term at the resort. HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Byron'sGirl
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the more recent reviews, we really wondered what to expect from this hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised. The property was beautifully landscaped and sat on a very nice beach. The room was clean and comfortable. We cannot imagine someone complaining about bed bugs here! There were noseeums around the pool in the evening, and we wondered if the traveller got bit by those, and only THOUGHT it was bed bugs. Another complaint we read was about the staff being unfriendly. Our experience was just the opposite. Everyone was warm and friendly to us. The restaurants were a bit on the pricey side, but we expected that from a resort this size. The food was wonderfully prepared and served. We ate at three of the restaurants and had room service one evening. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Margo113
Reviews.Content: Overall, a pretty decent resort. The grounds and main area of the hotel were meticulously maintained, but honestly the rooms were mediocre. Our family travels a lot, so we may expect more, but I still think the rooms were not that clean and were sparsely decorated. Aside from that, and on a positive note, you'll enjoy the pool and beach. So if you're looking for a vacation filled with sun and water, this is a pretty good place to go... just get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, secluded, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Nikkikub
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from September 16-21, 2006. We were on a vaction that was provided by my husband's work. This is a VERY nice hotel. The rooms all have a balcony. We had requested an ocean view when the reservations were made and received an ocean view, we were not disappointed in the slightest, the mountain view is beautiful. The heavenly bed is more comfortable than most hotel beds we've slept on. The pool area is beautiful, they have a water slide, waterfall and volleyball area, also fountains for kids to play in. There is a resident cat that seems to live in the pool area, very friendly. The beach is very nice, watch out for glass. I didn't find many shells but there were lots of sand dollars. There are lounge chairs and shade on the beach to use. We ate at Club Coqui once, good but nothing special really, high prices for what we got ($30 for 2 bowls of ordinary fruit, small cup of yogurt, thin slice of banana bread). The pastry place near the casino was good too. A rum punch in the lobby bar was $9, good but too expensive. Other than that meals were provided for us banquet/buffet style so we didn't eat at any other restaurants (though some of them were closed for remodelling). We were not overly impressed by the award winning dessert they provided at the banquet...spice cake with vanilla ice cream, chocolate sauce & guava sauce. It looks and sounds much more impressive than it is. It was difficult to go anywhere other than the property, nothing is close and it is expensive to go on your own. The hotel is isolated, they have just about everything you would need though it is overpriced. Bug repellant is a necessity at night if you go outside. It was VERY hot and humid while we were there. We turned the air conditioning in our room to 60 F. We're not likely to stay there again because of the expense, would not have a problem going there again with somebody else paying. Staff was very friendly and bilingual.

Reviews.Title: “Two Girls Travel”
Reviews.Author: jt86739
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on staying at the Westin in Puerto Rico, we highly recommend renting a car. It will allow you to go any where to sight see and eat cheap/authentic Puerto Rican food. Otherwise you are trapped at the Resort. One irritation when renting a car - you will not be able to find your way to the hotel once you find the resort. There are no signs to the hotel after you make the turn into the Resort. Another irritation if you rent a car is you have to pay for parking even though you are staying at the hotel - doesn't make much sense - Am I not giving them enough money already? Also, be careful - those PR people are crazy on the road. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are really nice too. The beach is private and just a walk from your room. There are tiki huts, towel service, two pools (one for adults only and one for kids), drink staff, lounge chairs, etc... The Club Coque' by the pool is not worth the money, but is your only option for food at the beach or pool. The hotel also includes a casino (fun), PR bar in the lobby and it is ONLY 10 minutes from the Rain Forest! There is a golf club restaurant, Iguana Pub, which is much cheaper, but you will have to drive there. It is towards the front of the resort. Although there were minor irritations staying with the hotel - for example, bad directions that got two young women lost for two hours in a foreign land - it was a nice place to stay for a long weekend. We are planning on going back next again in June.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Westin Rio Mar (mid September 2006)”
Reviews.Author: TDandJD
Reviews.Content: We traveled in mid september 2006 for 5nights and 6 days and had wonderful weather everyday. We lucked out as we booked on CheapCaribbean.com and they included free insurance for hurricanes, etc. Since it was low season and they threw in the insurance, we had nothing to loose. It was 85 degrees everyday with an ocean breeze. The hotel and grounds are immaculate. We don't understand why anyone would say anything negative. The staff was nice and we were upgraded at no charge to an ocean view and we asked for a refreigerator and received it complimentary. Since it was low season, not all of the restaruants were opened. But we knew this when we booked. We prefer no lines and the run of the place and this is what we had. On the weekend, they had a convention and when the groups came, they added music at the lobby bar and more restaurants opened. So we had the best of both worlds--no lines, our pick of lounge chairs at the pool with umbrella's and then it became more crowded and we had more resturant selections. The conceirge was fine and they have an entire 3 ring binder with menus of area resturants. We went to Bamboo lounge, a resturant outside of the hotel and they provided complimentary transportation. We read about this restaurant in the 3 ring binder. Go there for dinner, reasonable and fun and they pick up at hotel for free. There is a little store at the bottom of our hotel, down the road about 1 mile, so we picked up the local beer--medallah light, which was perfect for our room and some snacks. They also have wine and other items. We did not rent a car since we had already been to San Juan on a previous trip and didn't feel the need to do Old San Juan. We did the rain forest tour and booked at the hotel. It was $38pp and included transportation. We hiked in the rain forest, I wore sneakers and had a bathing suit on under my shorts. You can stop at the falls and swim if you choose. We were with a group of about 8-10 people, it was amazing. Do the rainforest--it was incredible! We also choose to snorkel and we were a little disppointed that the hotel dive shop charged $95 pp, but if you drive to the marina in Fajardo, about 20 minutes away, it was only $59. But since we choose not to rent the car, we were ok with paying extra to book with the hotel. I offst the cost of renting a car. It was a catamaran boat with open bar all day and sandwiches for lunch. It was a full day and we stopped to swim first before we went to the reef. We choose to grab a toasted bagel or nice selction of pastries at the little coffee shop near the casino in the hotel--David's Cookies. It was reasonable as opposed to splurging at the hotel restuarants. We also ate lunch at the tiki bar near the pool or the outside restaurant near the pool. This was on the reasonable side. We choose to take a cab for dinner 2 additional nights and we stayed close to the hotel and it was $14 round trip. The location and distance to restaurants is at the concerige. There are about 15 plus outside resturants. We went to this 1 near the hotel, it was called Rich's or something close to that, it was were the local's go and it was on the side on the mountain. Beautiful view. Nice meal and very reasonable. We also ate at the hotel. The Westin is 5 star, so naturally, the restaurants are 5 star. So break it up, go to the local places near by and the prices are more reasonable and enjoy your vacation and the hotel and all its ammenities too. We woud defintiely go back. Check websites for good deals. We also received a $200 Discovery Gift Card. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: bmfree
Reviews.Content: Hubbie won a trip to the Westin Rio Mar though work so we were able to spend a couple of nights here. It is a beautiful spot! Our room was very large and super clean. We had mountain view room with a little balcony. The beach was really nice. We didn't spend too much time at the pool but it was a great set up with a pool only for adults, one for games with a water slide and several hot tubs. The food was nothing to write home about but it was more than acceptable. The best part was every evening they make a bonfire and you can make smores.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kelleysezwoh
Reviews.Content: We were extremely excited from the moment we walked in our room. The Westin has a great eye for detail in making their rooms look modern, yet comfy and beautifully classy. They have their own line of bedding, which is FABULOUSLY comfortable. It was BY FAR the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. The beach was GORGEOUS! Very clean! There was a lot of room to have your own space and hang out on the beach for awhile. Great swimming, great relaxation. The pools were very nice as well....and we appreciated the fact that they had water spouts to rinse off your feet after leaving the beach, and also showers to rinse off the salt water....very convenient. The grounds were maticulously kept.....a BEAUTIFUL courtyard faces the ocean...and even their standard rooms (which we stayed in) had ocean views from the balcony. Wonderful. They have a parrot that they keep in a cage in the lobby area named Coco, and he is fun to converse with if you have any spare time. He has quite the attitude and is very sociable! Fun! By the way, the lobby area is gorgeous....spiral staircase, piano playing......beautiful. We enjoyed our stay at this resort VERY much! We rented a car for our entire vacation (10 days) and toured the entire island, staying at three different hotels, and I would say that is definitely the way to go. You want to be able to see all sides of the island - from San Juan and El Morro/San Cristobal and Bacardi --to Fajardo and El Yunque Rainforest and Las Croabas Biolumenescent Bay -- to Ponce and Castillo de Sorrales and the Ponce Firehouse, and La Monserratte Sea Port Diner. :-) What a wonderful vacation!!!! The Westin Rio Mar definitely played a part in our good memories that we took home with us! (oh, and if you're staying at the Westin - make sure to drive into Fajardo and catch the ferry at 8am to Culebra Island...it is unimaginable)--

Reviews.Title: “THIS WAS THE BEST VACATION OF MY LIFE ...SERIOUSLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: evanfchurch
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading reviews on this hotel I was somewhat skeptical about staying at the Westin Rio Mar, BUT I MUST TELL YOU we HAD THE TIME OF our LIVES!!! My girlfriend and I were there for 5 days and DIDNT WANT TO LEAVE. The service was 5 STAR. My room was upgraded from the beginning. ALL services from the bellman to check in to houskeeping to room service was AMAZING, FRIENDLY, CURTEOUS, AND METICULOUS. The beaches and grounds are 5 star. The pools are beautful. If you go to Puerto Rico, dont waste you time in San Juan @ the Ritz, Stay at the Westin RIo Mar. You will not be dissappointed. No i dont work for Westin, I sell real estate in New York. Thank you Westin for the beautiful vacation, we will surely come back again. It was our 1st vaction in 2 years. It WAS WELL WORTH THE WAIT. Thank you, Evan Church evanfchurch@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Can NOT understand the negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Kinsa
Reviews.Content: This resort was fabulous, we were there for 5 nights and had a great time. The staff were incredibly friendly, the rooms were great, and overall it was a great experience. It was just as nice, if not nicer, than any other Westin I have stayed in, and I have stayed in a lot of Westins. If you read the complainers complaints closely you will notice one common thread - it doesn't seem that they did their research before they arrived at the Westin at all. Most complain that it is far away from San Juan, that they needed to rent a car, that the food was expensive, etc. So what? The location is right near the rainforest in a beautiful location. It is about a 30-45 minute drive from San Juan, depending on traffic. The beach is a beautiful beach, no, it is not the white sand, crystal clear turqouise water of the Caribbean, but that is because it is located on the Atlantic side of the ocean. Duh. Look at a map and look at the pictures of the resort before you book the trip there!! The rooms were great. The standard room is large, with a nice sitting area. It was very clean, I have no idea what a previous poster was talking about dirty rooms. We were upgraded to a junior suite after one night (once the hotel cleared out a convention, and with a $20 tip to the reception - TIP - in ANY hotel, if you want to be upgraded to a better room, be prepared to tip the person who can put you in that better room!) and it was beautiful. But even the standard room was great. We didn't really eat in the hotel's restaurants because we were on the go so much. We did eat at the coffee place next to the casino every morning, which was a good, cheap alternative to spending a lot of money on the hotel food. I did check out the food prices and thery did not seem any higher than at any other Westin, and in fact, I thought the room serive prices were quite reasonable for a large hotel (I have seen double the prices charged at other hotels). We did order room service one night and it was quick and good food. Also, rent a car and explore the restaurants around the resort, there are plenty - I highly recommend Kiosk #2 at Loquillo beach, very close to the resort. The service at the hotel is fabulous - we wanted a fridge for our room, and one was there within 10 minutes. The safe didn't work in out first room (the person prior to us didn't leave it open), and someone was there in a matter of minutes to fix it. My husband got food poisioning, and the concierge helped out immensly, getting a dr to our room immediately, and even sending someone to go get the prescription from a local pharmacy. The staff could not have done more, they are truly great and extremly friendly and care about their jobs and their customers. Overall we had a great time at the Westin and would not hesitate to return or recommend it for a great vacation. Don't listen to the whiners and complainers - honestly, if they didn't like this hotel, I cannot imagine that any hotel would live up to their expectations (I have traveled all over the world and stayed at numerous 5 star resorts - the Westin Rio Mar lived up to its 4 star rating) Here's another tip - you can book this hotel through Hotwire or Priceline for a substantial savings, which makes it an even better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mco1018
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week with our 4 year old and we all loved it. Yes, some of the restaurants were not open when we were there. Yes, the area is not the nicest in Puerto Rico. But all things considered, we still had a great time. The hotel itself is beautiful and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. I've read some of the other reviews about the Westin having a terrible staff and my response to that is, well, maybe if you are not nice to the staff they won't be nice to you. We got a fridge in the room and stocked up from a local grocer. And we reserved a car as soon as we booked the hotel room which was great. The hotel is 25 minutes from Fajardo, which is worth going to for the different day trips - a catamaran sailing trip - I recommend the Spread Eagle II for the friendly staff, great lunch, and beautiful views, and the nighttime bioluminescent bay tour. Both of these were very kid-friendly and accomadating. The only thing is that I would book these separately from the hotel as the hotel trips were pricey. It's only 5 minutes from El Yunque - definitely worth while, and about 35 minutes to San Juan, which left my daughter a little bit bored but had some great restaurants if you want authentic puerto rican food. all in all a great trip. great views. great service. great atmosphere. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 32 had a blast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lamob
Reviews.Content: We went with a very large group-18 kids(ages 1-16) and 14 adults. We all had a great time. I have to say the hotel/restaurant staff was very nice to us. Very friendly and helpful. Accommodating that many people can be difficult, but they did their best and we all had such a fabulous time. Our rooms all had oceanviews.The beach was great as were the pools. The bar at the beach was a great convenience-food and drinks right there! The shuttle bus worked out very well. Never had to wait long. My only complaint was the rainforest. It was not what we expected. The fact that too many of us went together didn't help though. The waterfall was the only decent part. I thought we'd see some pretty birds or something. All in all we thought it was great and would go back in a heartbeat! Miss those afternoon ziggy zaggies and bush wackers at the beach. You must try them if you go. Very refreshing!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had fun at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Primustravel
Reviews.Content: Just visited Puerto Rico and stayed at the Westin Rio Mar hotel. The hotel was very nice. Our room was large and spacious, we had a corner balcony with views of the ocean and forest. Our room was located on a preferred guest floor. We were able to take advantage of local restaurants located on nearby Highway 3. I enjoyed the beach and the pool. While the hotel's beach was located on the Atlantic Ocean, the hotel was not very far from the Caribbean side of the island which we visited on one day of our stay. The hotel is located right across the street from the El Yunque Rain Forest. We didn't rely on the hotel shuttle bus, but had a rental car so it was very easy to drive across to the rain forest. The trails are clearly marked. We hiked down to La Minna Falls. It was beautiful. I greatly enjoyed Puerto Rico and hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: sweetjen2685
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Westin Rio Mar Beach in Puerto Rico with my boyfriend. I would not return again. In fact, I would not go to Puerto Rico again. SAN JUAN: For one, our resort was 45 min away from ANYTHING. The city of San Juan was where all the nightlife, shopping, and history was. The taxi ride from our hotel would've cost us $80.. both ways! So we rented a car for the day (only $60) and drove ourselves to the city. It only took us about 30 min to get there but it took us an hour and a half just to find a parking spot! We found that the locals in San Juan were not too fond of Americans and were rude to us. The shopping in Old San Juan was pretty nice; it had nice little souvenir shops like we were looking for. STAFF: On the resort, we found the people (fellow-vacationers and staff) to be friendly and helpful with any problems/complaints that we had. EXCURSIONS: There is not much to do at the resort besides eat and lay by the pool/beach. If you want to do a tour/excursion it is very expensive. Through the resort, snorkeling costs $90/person. We thought that this was absolutely ridiculous. When we complained to the concierge about the price, she gave us a number to call a snorkeling company directly. Through the company Spread Eagle it only cost us $65/person. This was for an all day trip. They picked us up from the resort at 9:30am and we returned around 4:30pm. They provided us with lunch (make your own sandwiches and fresh fruit, all delicous) plus pina coladas, water, and soda. Instead of going to one reef like you would've if you've gone on the trip through the resort at $90/person, Spread Eagle took us to TWO reefs. It was a very very nice trip. After we ate lunch, we went to the 2nd reef where we fed the leftover bread to the fish. This was so fantastic! We also went on the rainforest tour which happens to be the least expensive tour (only $38/person). I was very excited about this tour. There is a lot of walking through the rainforest, not much to see except trees. Don't expect to see any animals at all except maybe a bird. I was very disappointed to find that there are no animals in their rainforest. Swimming in the waterfall is cool though. ROOM: Our view from our room was beautiful. We got the mountain/rainforest view. The bed was extremely comfortable but there was no fridge in the room which I found to be very inconvenient. Also, we had food stolen from our room by the maids one morning. I was very [----] about this. The manager reimbursed us for our stolen food. CASINO: The casino is extremely small and definetly shady. My boyfriend played in the Texas-Holdem poker tournament one night and ended up leaving the table very frustrated. As soon as you sit down the dealer tells you "no talking at the table". This is no problem, very understandable. Unfortunately, almost immediately the spanish-speaking people start talking to each other. My boyfriend complained to the dealer about it saying, "I thought there was no talking at the table?!" The dealer completely ignored him. For all he knew, they were telling each other what they had! Also, after my boyfriend went "all-in" on a hand, one of the players folded, but then showed everyone his cards! You can't do that. The rules are not followed in this casino. Also, at the Roulette table, the dealer made a mistake on the pay-out. I would not recommend going to this casino, which is a shame because it's all there is to do at night! RESTAURANTS: We were very upset about the restaurant situation. The hotel advertised that there were 12 restaurants on the resort. When we were there, there were only 3 open, and 2 of them we couldn't get into because you needed to wear dress slacks which my boyfriend did not bring. You could not wear shorts OR jeans. This was NEVER told to us when we booked our vacation. Luckily, when we complained to the concierge about this situation, she set us up for a shuttle to the Bamboo Lounge which is located on the mountain-side. The food is very nice there, much cheaper than on the resort, and the view is wonderful. The food on the resort was ridiculously expensive, and not that good. At the Coqui Restaurant by the pool, a hamburger costs $13 and a plate of fruit w/yogurt cost me $12! There was one restaurant about 3 min outside of the resort that was just wonderful. It was a small local restaurant called Don Pepe's. The food was fantastic and cheap, the alcohol was cheap ($2 a bottle instead of $8 like on the resort) and the people there were very very friendly. I definetly recommend this restaurant if you end up staying here. We got 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 5 alcoholic drinks and it only cost us $54. BEACH/POOL: The beach was no different than any Atlantic Ocean beach back home. This was very very disappointing. The pools were nice, they were a good size. The "activity pool" was generally full of little kids but the "quiet pool" was usually pretty empty when we went in. Also, the pools are open 24 hours which we found to be useful since there wasn't much to do at night. FITNESS CENTER: I found the fitness center to be quite nice. Each cardio machine has it's own tv on it so you can watch whatever you want while working out. Also, they provide you with a bottle of water (warm though), headphones, and a towel on each machine. There were also weight machines, and stability balls which was nice. In conclusion: the best part of our trip was the snorkeling trip, and the restaurant Don Pepe's. If you're looking for a lot to do, especially at night, this is not the place for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: klegov
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. We've always had great stays at all Starwood Hotels and this particular hotel did not let us down. The room was really nice though I think it had a bit of a mold problem (smelled a bit funky) and like all island resorts, did notice a couple of small bugs...nothing horrible. The pools were nice--not horribly large but nice enough and the beach is incredible. The staff at the hotel is pretty good--lots of activities going on all of the time. The casino is kind of [-----]there--most of the slot machines refused to take my $$ so that was a bummer. Overall, I'd recommend it to any traveler if they can get a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- awful staff”
Reviews.Author: googro
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my wife- we've stayed at several Island Westins (Maui, St John) and while we realized this was a category lower - we didn't expect it to be so poorly run. We considered checking out earlier to go to the Westin St John sooner... All in all- we won't return to PR - the hotel has potential- but is poorly run and staffed Check in went fine- got a nice upgrade. Rooms don't have fridges, but they promptly put on in for us. An Amigo supermarket is nearby - we stocked up Concierge- was clear they had little interest is doing anything more than pushing a book on menus in front of you. Every response was, "every restaurant is good." Gee thanks. Generally one person working the desk- on the phone a lot - no help with local area. Complained to front desk and next day they were great - very helpful. Pools - activity pool nice- full of kids as it should be. Quiet pool is anything but quiet. What was more troubling was the water condition- see the picture. The water level was consistently low- not allowing the filters to clean the water- a gross film and assorted garbage was easily seen. Several people complained and the next day - the pool was in great shape- seeing a pattern? beach- OK- nothing special- neat island you can swim or kayak out to. Grounds - trash in the trees and bushes. Restaurants - Palios- pricey but very good- great service. Coqui pool side restaurant - pricey but huge shareable portions - nachos were awesome. Food was the highlight of the hotel Casino- small- 4 tables when they're all open- but fun- tons of slots Local area- we rented a car and I'd suggest it- the drive from the airport is easy. Dinner - Antojitto's right off of route 3 was very good- as was Richies (right out of the westin- top of the hill- park past the restaurant on the left) King seafood- our best meal. Bamboo lounge- not bad- nice views- wasn't busy. Loquillo kiosks- people rave about them- we went- #2 - not that great- typical fried food. Try some of the other fast food non sit down places maybe for better food. We drove to old san juan - visited the fort- but honestly- we could have skipped the trip- typical junky stores- one street of nicer stores- not much to do or see.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: CigarPaul
Reviews.Content: The Westin Rio Mar is a beautiful resort and we enjoyed the stay very much. The grounds are very well kept and the service was better than expected. A rental mini van from Alamo at the Airport was just what the six of us needed to get around, take trips to dinner and S/J. We also drove to the Rain Forest and took the hike down to the Mina Falls. Parking in the garage was $15 a day but worth it for the convenience to park inside under the hotel. The 3 rooms were nice enough for us, a mini bar, safe and coffee maker included. The hotel is now smoke free inside so you must use the outside balcony off the lobby if you want to sit down with a drink and smoke. The breakfast buffet reminded me of a cruise except it was $19, but eggs and waffles were available off the menu for $11, coffee, juice and toast included with the price. Lunches were also good inside and out by the pool with David's Cookies outside of the casino for a snack all day. The casino was very busy one night and they refused to open up more tables that made some people mad. I also caught the roulette dealer making a mistake on a payout. Overall we did OK and played every night because there was not much else to do. The beach is great for a morning walk, then sit around the pool and soak in the sun and the sights. Everyone was nice to us, maybe because it was not busy as usual, a convention was coming as we left, so we had a good time and would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: asd1
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a very nice hotel. I recently went with my wife and 2 children. Lots to do with the kids- kids club, pool, beach, free hair braiding (my daughters loved), water slide, and various activities by the pool. Also the "Dive in Movies" were great to spend by the pool with the kids- just relax and watch a good movie. I do recommend going to at least one if you are traveling with kids. Restaurants- well they were expensive, but what do you expect for a high class resort? I highly recommend the restaurant Shimas. This asian cuisine restaurant was outstanding. The restaurant Marbella (the breakfast buffet is also served there) is a good restaurant to get an easy bite with the kids. They have a good priced menu and often they have dinner buffets. If you plan on eating Italian at the resort you have to bring slacks. There is a "no shorts. no jeans. fancy attire" rule. Although for the noise- there is a lot of events and fundraisers that happen at the hotel. Near our room, there was a "Gillete Family Day" going on. They played loud music that wasnt so relaxing. But you will never know when planning a trip if there will be anything. i highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: travelcat1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful huge resort. Would def. recommend this place to couples, families or singles. The only downfall is that many dont leave the resort- if you stay on the grounds meals add up- for 4 nights just lunch and dinner it cost us over $500. CheapCaribbean has been having great package deals for this resort including airfare you may want to check it out before booking

Reviews.Title: “It is as its billed”
Reviews.Author: W'sinGA
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 night stay with my wife and 3 children. They are ages 1,4 and 9. The hotel was fine it is not as nice as some in the states but we had no complaints. The service at check in and out was great everyone was nice and helpful. We had the "Kids for free package" which worked for us. The kids really enjoyed the pool , the beach, and the kids club. The food was good a bit pricey but its a resort so it's to be expected. We rented a car from the airport on priceline and ended up with avis. It turned out to be a super idea because the direction to the hotel were clear and it only took about 40 minutes. The shuttle cost about $27.50 per person one way. The Hotel does charges $15.00 per day for parking but because we had an avis car and they have an avis office on site we only paid $5.00 per day. Having the car also let's you get off the property to eat at local restaurants. The conciegere will suggest off property dinning places.The beach was nice and lots of room great jet skiing. They have a casino and game room for the kids both were useable but Vegas it's not. The rooms were clean and decent size. I didn't play golf but the course looked well taken care of and laid out. If you have kids it's great. If you don't it's great too. Renting a car will help you get to night life if that's what you're looking for. Atlanta, Ga.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: trees923
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a nice and clean hotel. The rooms were spacious and housekeeping did a nice job keeping them clean all week. There were two pools and one was designated for adults only although kids swam in it all week. The activity pool or the kids pool was very crowded everyday and it wasn't cleaned very well each day. The beach was nice and there weren't a lot of people on it. There are great waves if you like an ocean like that. There are six resturants in the hotel and they all have good food but the cost of a meal is very expensive. The hotel knows that there aren't many options for food besides staying in the hotel because it costs so much money to rent a car or shuttle to leave the resort. We went to Old San Juan and had a nice day. We went to an amazing pizzera right up the block from the center square. We truely enjoyed our stay but if you are looking for a hotel with action and things to do at night I wouldn't reccommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Rio Grande not up to par with other Westins”
Reviews.Author: LBashir
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 day stay at the Westin. Check-in was good, we got upgraded to an ocean suite, but the room was ok. The bathrooms not up to typical Westin standards, very old, not very modern, and they didn't even have the double showerhead. The next morning, we were woken up at 6:00 AM by construction on the roof which was directly above us. We called front desk several times, and no one could explain what happened. Finally later in the afternoon, I called the manager who found out they had construction right above us. We were satisfied after he comped the night, but I still don't understand why they would give us a room underneath construction when there was so much availability in the hotel or why they would start constriction so early, people are on vacation and the last thing they want to do is wake up at 6 AM. The Food was drab, service at Marbella worse. It took me 25 minutes each day to get coffee by the wait staff. One day a gentleman next to me offered his pot after i asked the waitress 5 times for coffee to no avail (she finally brought it over right when they closed for breakfast). The Italian restaurant however, was fairly good with top notch service. The hotel grounds are somewhat old and tired. The pool area is somewhat nice, but i noticed a lot of mold on the cushions. Also, although one pool is the "adult pool", there were tons of small children running around, jumping in, and causing a lot of noise, this was definitely not enforced. The beach is ok, the ocean very rough and the sand is a dark yellow (not the soft sand found in the Caribbean or on other parts of the island) The location is not that great either. yes it is across the rain forest, but There really i nothing else in the area, and you are pretty much forced to stay at the resort if u don't have a car (fyi, if u have a car other than the one u can rent from the hotel, they charge u $18/day). We were pretty bored in the evenings, even thought we did go to the restaurants and casino (seemed very empty) As a side not, i am still having problems with the hotel bill. I was charged a different amount that the one i got at check out. i think i have gotten double charged for breakfast but we are still trying to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was an average place”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru4u
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay. I too was there during the political convention. I must say that this convention was a nightmare!!! The hotel stay during the convention was very loud and crowded. The hotel was taken over by drunk, rude and mindless locals. The Westin staff had no controll over their hotel. As I said I stayed 7 nights, the nights in which there was no convention present were nice. I found the room-Ocean suite 7054 to be wonderful. The only thing lacking was the Westin Heavenly Shower. The grounds were pretty. The maid service was standard. The pool area was relaxing, as well was the beach. The beach had a constant breeze that kept you cool. The food at the hotel was fine. I found the prices to be comprable to any other resort I have visited. Ridgefield, NJ

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: icunurse
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Westin. Unfortunately, our stay was hampered by the political convention that weekend at the hotel. It was very noisy at night with tons of people everywhere. We thought the Westin was just ok, nothing special. The pool areas were very crowded. The loungers had old, (mildewy in some) cushions on them. Have definitely stayed in much nicer hotels for less money. Restaurants were mediocre at best. Went to a nice restaurant called Richie's (recommended by waiter at hotel) that is 2 minutes from the hotel. Great views! The beach was nice, but we've found that Mexico beaches were so much prettier. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the rainforest. Definitely worth visiting. Would not return to this hotel, nor would I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation with some problems”
Reviews.Author: karbase8
Reviews.Content: Hi, My son and I stayed at the Westin for four days at the end of June. As most have written it's a beautiful resort! We had no problem at check-in, the shuttle service greeted us at the airport and we were upgraded to an Ocean View Room for no apparent reason. The rooms were clean and beautiful and no bed bugs! I was disappointed with the evening conceirge service and general things to do in the evening for my son and I. There didn't seem to be much going on and the conceirge wasn't very helpful. I tried to sign up for the Rainforest and it was book, my advice is to definitely rent a car, use the local grocery store for snacks and lunch and to see the sights of Puerto Rico. We went on a catarman snorkeling trip (you don't have to snorkel if you don't want) that was wonderful, but it was 35 dollars more per person through the hotel. The food was ok, nothnig spectacular and I didnt think there was much variety. A word of caution if you get a package/kids package, the waiters and restaurants are supposed to not charge you for the kids meals, but for some reason they tell you that the front desk will take care of it and reimburse you, luckily I saved all of my receipts, otherwise they would have not taken the charges off of the room. Overall, it was a beautiful and relaxing vacation. I would definitely to the the east wind boat trip, rent a car, bring snacks since some of the food is costly, but if you do decide to book trips through the hotel do so before your stay especially the Rainforest trip in which they only offer on Tuesdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Westin Rio Mar!”
Reviews.Author: marchb4
Reviews.Content: So we all know how much we like reading the reviews in Trip Advisor about the places we are planning to visit on vacation, hoping to figure out the best place stay, eat, etc. Well, we just got back from a 6-night stay at the Westin Rio Mar and would highly recommend it! We traveled from San Juan in a rental car. We chose Alamo - low prices, convinient to airport, and we were in and out in less than 10 minutes. Make sure to take the new toll road, Highway 66, from San Juan to just outside Rio Grande, that cuts your travel time by about 20-25 minutes. It only costs $1.50 and is really worth it as an alternative to the congested Route 3. It is so new that you won't find it on most maps yet. We arrived at the Westin in the late afternoon and were upgraded (without asking) to an oceanview room. Summer is the off season and there may be more flexibility. ROOM: Average size, attractive furniture, great beds, spotless, quiet POOLS/BEACH:There are two pools, one is the quiet pool with CUSHIONED lounge chairs, our choice. The beach is adjacent and great for boogie boarding. There are cabana for rent at $90 per day (comes with sodas, fruit, chips and ice chest). We just went down by 9ish and picked our spot under an umbrella. (Discounted with the Escape Package - see below) RESTAURANTS: The nice restaurants are somewhat expensive ($25-40 per entree) so we ate local cafes (for authentic Puerto Rican food) including Don Pepe's, Restaurante Terraza Montemar, and in San Juan. The Marbella in the Westin, has a morning full b-fast buffet ($19) but you can also order off the menu. It is also open for dinner with fair prices. TIP: We reserved the "Escape Package" online for which included 2 free b-fast buffets each day, 25% discount on all services, and included the resort/room tax which comes to almost 25% more. We would highly recommend this option if you can reserve it. LOCATION: The Westin Rio Mar is about 40 minutes from San Juan, very close to the entrance of El Junque Rainforest and the Fajardo Biobay (The bioluminencence was stunning-just go on the darkest night possible, by kayak, and use insect repellent!). DO NOT reserve tours thru the hotel as prices are very inflated. You will hear the chorus of the cute "Coqui" (frogs) at night.
