Don't forget to explore further south for some great beaches and scenic drives. AMENITIES: Nice bar areas with tropical flowers, tiny casino, terraces, golf, weekend outdoor movies, bakery called Mike's Cookies which is another option for b-fast) Live piano music in the lounge downstairs. In the evenings, candles are lit. We have travelled all over the tropics and would definitely return the Puerto Rico and this hotel in particular in the future. Everyone was friendly and helpful, as were all of the locals we met. Our teenage daughters did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation at the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a week long stay at the Westin Rio Mar from July 1 - 8. I cannot think of one negative thing to say about the place. First off, the place is stunningly beautiful, with an over a mile long sandy beach. The beach is wonderful: no rocks, seaweed or shells. It's very easy to swim in. The pool area is equally nice and kept immacutely clean. We had a stunning room on the top floor with an ocean view, and the Westin beds live up to their heavenly name. The food at the restaurants wasn't cheap, but it wasn't that expensive either ( we're from New York). The quality was fine. Every person we encountered, from the front desk to housekeeping to the shops to the restaurants could not do enough to help you. I seriously did not encounter anyone who wasn't friendly. The kids' program is great, too. They have hair braiding most mornings at 9:00 near the pool. My daughter got 4 braids on each side and when I asked to have it charged to the room, I was shocked to find out it was free. We have travelled extensively in the Caribbean and been to Puerto Rico 4 times, and this has to have been one of our best vacations. Based on the sheer beauty of the place and the friendly staff, I recommend it highly. One final note: if you rent a car (we didn't, but our Rain Forest tour stopped there), do try the grocery store on the corner of Rt. 3 and the Rio Mar entrance. It's cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: thefunpolice
Reviews.Content: After reading how awful this resort was, we were skeptical about our trip, but still went for 5 days at the end of June. The negative reviews must be from the miserable lot of vacationers that complain about anything they can. The Westin shuttle met us at the airport and 40 minutes later we arrived. Despite being upgraded to an Ocean Suite for no reason at all, our room was not ready at 2:30 pm, so we ate lunch at Marbella. Good burgers and chicken sandwich, what's to complain. The front desk was more than accomodating when our room was still occupied at 3:30 pm. At 4:00pm, we checked into a different Ocean Suite with a view of the pool and ocean. The furniture is a little bit retro 1970's, but no bed bugs after a quick check (learn how to check before you go if you are worried), and we moved in. The beach is beautiful, a long stretch of coastline, lots of chairs, waiters and staff, always clean towels, and no problems at the pools either. We had the buffet each morning at Mirabella, who cares about a 5 minute wait when you are on a trip, and the food was good as was the service. Dinners were at Shima's, (sushi and Asian), the Grille Room (filet and sea bass) and Aqua Luna (excellent tuna steaks). Meals were EXCELLENT, averaging between 80-125, with tips, (2-3 appetizers, 2 dinners, 2 desserts, just obviously no booze). The staff was very quick with service and very friendly. We even won in the casino. Only bad thing with no control by the Westin was that it rained each day, some days, it was a sun shower, others were torrential downpours throughout the afternoons. Golf courses were great, but very HOT.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: hli66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights. We had a great time. We did not know what to expect after reading many mixed reviews about the resort, but the room was nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. We ate breakfast and lunch at Marbella. The food was okay, but service was shoddy. We also had dinner at Aqua Luna. The food was just warm not hot at all and the service was also shoddy. Luckily, we got great restaurant recommendations from Raquel, one of the concierges. We had great meals at Antojito's right before hitting Rt 3 from the resort, Mojitos in Old San Juan, Pikayo in the museum of PR, Lolita on Rt 3 towards Fajardo, and Pasion Por El Fogon in Fajardo. We suggest renting a car if you are planning to stay at this resort because restaurants and attractions are far away. If you plan on self parking, it is best to rent from Avis b/c there is discounted parking for Avis cars (keep all your parking receipts, they may accidentally charge the parking to your room). Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few helpful hints...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: June 19th - June 24th We have just returned home after a five night stay at the Westin Rio Mar in Rio Grande. The resort is absolutely gorgeous but I do believe that they have a bed bug problem. Each morning my husband and I and our three children (ages 15,18 and 23) woke up with bites all over our bodies. I had read other people's reviews before we went but didn't believe the "bed bug" concerns. They are true!! If you do stay at the Westin Rio Mar, please take a shuttle from the airport and rent an Avis car from the hotel. It will make the trek to and from the airport sooooo much easier. Do not book tours through the hotel-do it yourself. We went through Eco-tours for a snorkeling outing and saved $35 dollars on each of our tickets. In fact, we followed the Westin's shuttle bus to and from the snorkeling site. With a family of five, we saved a bunch. We also did the Bioluminescent Lagoon tour with BIO BAY Ride, with Captain Miguel Suarez. He has been doing these tours for over thirty years and has great stories and information to share. He makes the experience exceptional. The traffic in San Juan and further to the east is outrageous!!! It takes forever to get to even a location 5 or ten miles away. Please drive defensively because no one uses their signals and people constantly go through red lights. It's really dangerous. There is no need to go to Luquillo beach if you stay at the Westin. The Westin has the most gorgeous beach ever! The Puerto Rican people were very kind and friendly. The service in restaurants and the many roadside stands was extremely slow-even the fast food places took forever. Just be prepared to wait. Old San Juan is really beautiful and a must!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Travel87
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I was a little scared of what we would find at the Westin. Not to worry, everything was great. Yes, food is expensive and hotel is secluded from other restaurants, but you're on vacation. The concierge named Pebbles was a big help to us and answered all our questions. We ate at Don Pepe's for PR food and it was great. Loved the grounds, the beach and the quiet pool. All we wanted was 3 days of sun, food and fun, we got it! Never did see any bed bugs or employees unwilling to help us. Our spacious room faced the mountains, was clean and made up every day. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Suruchi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Rio Mar for 5 days. We had an excellent time. However, we did go during off-peak season. You will need to rent a car. (cost for parking is $10 per day and $5 if you rent an Avis car) There really isn't much within walking distance. We only had one meal at the restaurant which was way over-priced. There is a wonderful bakery as you are making the left from Route 3 to the road that leads to the hotel. They make fantastic breakfast sandwiches. There is also a good restaurant called Las Vegas wich you will pass on your way to El Yunque rainforest. Bring lots of bug spray. Oh, and the staff were all very nice, polite, friendly. The hotel bake shop does great Tres Leches cake.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: funpr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a four day stay at the the Westin Rio Mar. We were overall pleased with the resort and the properties. When we checked in we requested an upgrade to a suite, and it was granted with a smile. Nice room with a great view no bed bugs to be found anywhere. The only negative was the congierge, every time we asked for advice on what to do, once we mentioned that we had our own car they lost interest in talking to us. I got the feeling that they were working on commision for these tours. Overall it was a great trip. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler-6
Reviews.Content: Me and my two friends (all women, mid-twenties) went to Puerto Rico in the middle of May. After reading previous reviews, I was very hesitant about staying at the Westin. But it ended up being GREAT!!! We ran into some bad weather, scattered thunderstorms, but we managed to get some sun. As recommended, we did not eat at the hotel (for the most part). We at the pool bar once and that was decent. Generally, we went into San Juan to eat. The Oof Restaurants are excellent! We visited the Parrot Club, Aqua Viva and Dragonfly. They were all wonderful, and I would consider myself a "foodie" from NYC. Both the service and the food were of high standards and I would highly recommend going there. We also went to the Puerto Rico Cafe, where we had seafood gumbo, which was YUMMY! Like others, I recommend renting a car. It's very easy getting around the island and we never missed a step in our travel plans. Parking was very easy at the hotel and in Old San Juan (park in garages). We visited the El Yunque Rainforest and loved it! If you enjoy hiking and being outdoors, this is the perfect place for you. They have quite a few trails for you to pick and is very easy to walk through. If you do enough research before you go, there is no need to go to the visitors center (you have to pay). We chose to go right to the trails and explored the area ourselves. On one of our days, we went snorkeling on the "Spread Eagle II." The group provided snorkeling gear, lunch and complimentary drinks (alcholic and non-alcoholic) for $65. We had such a great time! The staff was very nice and we didn't run into any problems. Our room at the Westin was very comfortable and was kept very clean throughout our stay. The concierge was very helpful in recommending local restaurants and was accomodating when it came to reserving a shuttle back to the airport for one person in our group. The check-in and check-out process was very easy. I'm not sure why the folks who gave bad reviews had such terrible experiences. I couldn't have asked for a better stay at the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest family vacation at the Westin Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: TravelTops
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 10.5 month old daughter Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Westin Rio Mar with much of our extended family and truly had an absolutely wonderful family vacation. I was nervous after reading many of the reviews...but was very pleased to find that the negative reviews were dead wrong, as was everyone on our trip! The hotel and its grounds are beautiful, the staff was extremely nice and helpful, the beach and pools perfect, our weather excellent, and the food was VERY GOOD! I do not understand the complaints of many on this point...as I thought the food was diverse and high quality. We booked through custom classic vacations and booked the All-Inclusive Option at the Westin Rio Mar, which it sounds from many of the reviews and the complaints about high food and drink prices, that many people do not choose, perhaps because they do not realize that it is available...I'm not sure. Anyway, we found this to be the best decision we made because it allowed everyone to eat and drink as much as they wanted (and we did!) without the stress of high prices adding up! We travelled with 3 children in our group and the all-inclusive option was perfect for those travelling with little ones whose eyes are alway bigger than their stomachs. In short we will return to the Westin and would recommend it without hesitation to anyone especially those with children who want the perfect family caribbean vacation. Rememeber to consider the All-Inclusive Option...it will pay for itself in the end!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, Just returned from a fabulous trip to Puerto Rico and the Westin Rio Mar. I cannot say enough about this resort. We were skeptical about staying here, due to some of the reviews, but are so glad we did. Upon arrival, they upgrated our room to a Ocean Suite, since it was our anniversary and because the shuttle from the hotel never showed up at the airport. We did not wait but 15 minutes and caught a cab. It was $50., but keep in mind this hotel is 19 miles away and we spent more than that from our house in Spring Texas to IAH airport. (15 miles) They took care of our luggage right away and we were given four drink tickets to use during our stay at any of the bars. Since our arrival was late, (8:30pm) there was all kinds of nightlife going on when we arrived. Music and dancing in the Main Lobby bar, a movie at the Pool with popcorn and drinks, a fire pit with Smores near the beach, a piano player in the downstairs bar, and finally a DJ next to the Casino, playing all types of music. I was totally impressed and excited. We stayed here only two nights before our Cruise and wished we had been there a couple of more days. The beach is gorgeous and the staff we so accommodating. As far as the room goes, it was large and the bed indeed was heavenly. My husband is a light sleeper and he had the best rest he has had in a long time. Thanks Westin for the wonderful weekend and for a Anniversary that will be never forgotten. Stay here and enjoy. Cat from Spring, Tx

Reviews.Title: “No reason to be afraid, Excellent stay at Rio Mar, Definitely would go back”
Reviews.Author: retep279
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stint at the Westin Rio Mar. We booked our room for an insanely low rate on hotwire, so we were expecting below average service and a room next to the broom closet. We could'nt have been more mistaken. Check-in was a breeze and our room was excellent (Not ocean front or ocean view, but on the first floor and overlooking a tropical lagoon that was home to the resort's iguana population). The bath was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms have very nice/new in-room safes that easily accomodate Laptop PC's and other valuables. The hotel was not very crowded at all. Perhaps it is because this is Puerto Rico's down season. That was fine with us. It was basically "no line, no waiting" wherever we went. The beach at the Rio Mar is beautiful. The beach is actually adjacent to the well known Luquillo beach that you may read about in travel books, etc. The Rio Mar's beach is just as picturesque. More on Luquillo later. The pools were uncrowded and the kids stayed in the activity pool while we enjoyed a quieter time at the quiet pool. As long as you were poolside by 830-900AM there was no need to fret over getting a lounge chair. Finding chairs on the beach was never a problem. SOME CAUTIONS: As with any other resort and as other reviews have stated, food and drink here are a rip-off. I guess the resort figures that they will make their money back on your stay by assuming you will eat there. Well, we did not. We stopped at the corner grocery (at the corner of PR 3 and 968) and stocked up on Medalla (local light beer), Cokes, and other snacks all for about $25. I kid you not in stating that this would have cost uus at least $150 at the hotel. This tip leads me to the most important tip of all... RENT A CAR! If you don't rent a car, be prepared to be held prisioner at this resort and held subject to their high prices. We rented a car with GPS navigation from a national chain at the San Juan airport and could have not been more glad that we did so. I cannot tell you how many hotel guests we talked to that regretted not renting a car. If you want to go off resort you are subject to the resort's shuttle bus (at a fee of course). Same goes if you want to do any daytripping. Speaking of which, this hotel is a perfect location to day-trip from. El Yunque is literally 2 miles away, Old San Juan is approx. 45 minutes and Fajardo is about the same distance as Old San Juan. We spent a whole day in Old San Juan and had a blast. Parking is a bit difficult to find. My advice is to head straight to El Morro and park there. It may cost a bit more, but the lower cost lots are obscure and hard to find. Some places to stop by and see are El Catedral de San Juan. Not only is this a beautiful church, but Ponce de Leon is buried here. El Morro is really cool, definitely worth the $3 admission (kids get in for free I think). As far as eating goes, stopping by the El Convento Hotel (right across from the cathedral) to eat at El Picoteo is a must. The fare here is Spanish tapas. Their mojitos are excellent as well. El Yunque is a true treasure. We spent two half days here and are glad we split it up. The first day we dedicated to La Mina falls (a must do) and the second day we dedicated to hiking to the summit of El Yunque mtn. ~3600ft. The views up here are spectactular, you can see St. Croix and St. John from up here on a clear day (we had a clear day and did see the USVI). A disclaimer is that if you are moderately physically challenged you might have a hard time hiking these trails. The trails are well kept and actually have paved mini-sidewalks to prevent trail wash out, but they are extremely steep in places. Also do not wear flip-flops or else you will slip and fall. Buy a pair of teva's before you come. The last excursion we took was to Fajardo one evening to take the bio-bay kayaking tour in Las Cabezas de San Juan nature preserve. This experience is not to be missed. It is truly a once in a lifetime expierence. One benefit to doing the trip here is not having to take a ferry to Vieques to the Mosquito bay. See las tortugas adventures for more info. Other companies offer similar trips as well. As far as eating goes, my advice is to be brave. Authentic Puerto Rican cuisine is a wonderful blend of Puerto Rico's cultures. It mixes Creole, with Spanish and Native cuisine to create a truly unique culinary genre. The food of Puerto Rico was the favorite part of our trip. Specifically, Don Pepe's and Antonjito's are both excellent for traditional Puerto Rican Cuisine. Both are also less than a mile from the hotel and would be suitable dinner locations. Kiosk #2 at Luquillo Beach serves tradtional PR cuisine as well and is very good. Kiosk #52 is excellent for a quick bite such as a shrimp, fish, crab or chicken fritter and other traditional PR fast food. If you rent a car, TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE LUQUILLO KIOSKS at lunch time FOR CHEAP AND EXCELLENT FOOD all in an awesome environment. Luquillo beach is right down hwy 3 from the hotel (10min drive) and you can park right in front of the kiosks and walk right up to the kiosk of your choice. So basically, for us, the Rio Mar was a place to lay our heads, lay by the beach and pool and to take a shower. We really did not gamble or shop, but that is not why we came to PR. The casino was very unimpressive, small, etc. as others have mentioned. We came to Puerto Rico to expierence and immerse ourselves in local culture and had an excellent time doing so. The people here are extremely friendly and willing to help just as long as you are not obnoxious. We saw so many demanding an rude Americans who I think forget that they are on vacation. If you are'nt going to chill out why go on vacation at all? Safety was never a concern for us when leaving the resort. The police are literally everywhere. Every half mile we passed a cop. If you do drive in PR, it is not any different than in the US, except the max speed limit is 50mph. Do not speed as I have heard that citations were very costly. Also one more thing, the cops drive around with their light bars on at all times so if a cop comes up behind you with its lights on just let them pass. In closing, have fun in Puerto Rico and experience as much as you can!

Reviews.Title: “Wary at first, but great resort”
Reviews.Author: xqzmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Rio Mar for 5 days. You definitely need to rent a car to get there because transportation by taxi ($60-70) or by shuttle service is too expensive. Getting to the resort was not a problem--go by Rt 66, make a right at Belz Factory Outlet onto Rt 3 and you'll see the sign for the Westin on the left. However, finding the main building in the resort was difficult, especially at night. We saw all the signs telling us, "Caution: Iguana Crossing" but no clear sign directing us to the hotel. Eventually we hit a deadend and a staff member helped us out. Check-in: Very fast, very smooth, and very patient to answer all our questions. We also had a fridge request (no extra charge) and that was brought to our room in 10 min. Self Parking is very efficient but pricey $10/day. Room: The first thing we did was check for bedbugs after all the reviews we read about that. We were in total paranoia, but we were lucky and there were no bugs in our beds. We were on the first floor...very high ceilings. Standard room, no frills, nice balcony...comfortable. Housekeeping wasn't always reliable. There were days when we didn't get face towels, then the next we didn't get new soap. We literally walked up to the cart and picked it up ourselves because they never delivered it to our room even after we called. Grounds: Very beautifully kept. The maintenance starts early and everything is very organized. There were plenty of towels, pool balls, lounge chairs with umbrellas around the pool. The beach is "eh", not the golden sand or clear blue water you imagine of the caribbean but it's still nicely kept. there are cabanas and plenty of lounge chairs there too. They have 2-3 jet skis, kayaks..but all for a price ($60 jet ski for 1/2 hour). they have activities planned everyday that are listed on a bulletin board in the lobby and outside area by the pool (power walk, iguana feeding, dancing). the casino is not very large but it's still fun to just wander around. they have a very large conference room...was not able to see inside, but we did see the outside grounds set up for a wedding. The grass in that area was extremely brown, not exactly pretty. Oh..bugs galore...must wear bug spray everywhere you go. Cannot comment on the restaurants in the hotel except for David's Cookies. We picked up something there for breakfast a couple times before going out. We mostly ate outside of the resort. We went to Las Vegas, which is en route to El Yunque on Rt 191. (El Yunque is literally across the street from Rt 968 and follow the signs to Rt 191). Isamar's bakery on the corner of Rt 968 is very good...their Cuban sandwich is really good. Along the way to Luquillo, we saw all the kiosks numbered but we didn't get to try them. We went to dinner at Sandy's Seafood, really good seafood, large portions of everything. There are plenty of fast food places around especially KFC/Taco Bell and Burger King. We also ate at Antonino's and Taco Maker along Rt 3 (east of resort). If you continue on Rt 3 to Fajardo, you'll hit a shopping plaza with sizzler, metropol, many other restaurants. Concierge: I think this was the best part of the hotel. They have directions to everything, preprinted cards. They were very helpful. However, booking through them, especially tours looks extremely overpriced. Call the tours yourself, it's a better deal. Around the Area: El Yunque is right across the street. Luquillo is a 5 minute Drive and is an overall nice beach. Not sure why it's rated as a great beach but, it is still a nice place to relax..Parking is $3. They have kayaks for rent there and it's only $5 per person...much much cheaper than the resort which was around the range of $45 for 1/2 hour. Check out: bill sent to room with easy check out form. We weren't charged a 13% resort fee--maybe it's a deal they cut out with priceline. I don't know...but i'm not complaining. Overall, this was a very enjoyable resort. It's not a 5 star resort but it was still worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort with a wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are fours days into an eight day vacation at the Westin Rio Mar. So far we have nothing but great things to say about the resort and its staff. I simply can't understand some of the negative or oddly critical comments I've read here. The resort grounds are stunning and meticulously cared for (as with all Westins). The rooms are quite attractive and very clean. The lobby and lounge areas are gorgeous and exude style. The staff is among the most friendly and helpful of any hotel at which we've ever stayed. They've gone out of their way to make us feel at home and extra special. (We also love how they've lavished attention on our two-year old daughter.) If you like golf, then this resort is a little bit of heaven, I imagine. There are two beautifully designed courses right in front of the resort. The beach is very attractive, clean and generally uncrowded. The food, while typically expensive as we've come to expect at upscale resorts, is at least very good and diverse. The Sunday brunch is fantastic and not to be missed. About the only complaint I can make is about the weather. It's pretty humid here and we're experiencing the tailend of the rainy season. I doubt the hotel has much control over this. I'll close this work-in-progress by saying, my wife and I love Westins. We've stayed at close to a dozen of their properties and have always been impressed and extremely pleased. Starwood is a first-class company, totally dedicated to providing an enjoyable experience for its guests. If you have a bad or less-than-superlative experience at a Westin or any other Starwood property, you owe it to yourself to let Starwood know. They aim to please, and will do everything possible to correct an error. Based on my first fours days here at the Westin Rio Mar, I can enthusiastically recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing, hassle-free vacation at a beautiful property run by some of the friendliest people you will ever meet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach setting, but the rooms and amenities are just ok”
Reviews.Author: That'sMyOpinion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set on a picture perfect beach, and thank God for that, because you will want to be out of your room as much as possible. The beds are comfortable, but the room itself is standard motel. Be prepared to either not use the airconditioning or to freeze your buns off. The airconditiong is set to blow cold air, but not to remove humidity. Therefore, all your clothes will be soggy, and I mean soggy. You will have to launder everything in your suitcase (clean or not) when you return home. The staff tries very hard for the most part, but this is not the Four Seasons, so they do what they can. The casino is a joke and the restaurants are only average. This is our second trip to Puerto Rico to attend conferences. It just is not my favorite island. If spending your own money, shop around a bit more!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HudsongrlChicago
Reviews.Content: Just retuned from 5 nites at this property. From checkin to check-out it was disapppinting.. We were told no ocean view rooms were availabe and all we could get was a room overlooking the front entrance with the smell of diesel fuel from the shuttle buses. Also, we felt this hotel looked tired. The rooms needed some updating and weren't as clean as one would expect. On a positive note, the pool area and grounds were beautiful and the staff friendly, though rather slow to serve. Bottom line is, we would not return. This is a 3 star propery at best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort...Mediocre Food...Horrible Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (me + wife + 17 month son) just returned from a one-week stay at the Westin Rio Mar in April 2006. We were booked in a room on the second floor of the east wing of the hotel (the farthest wing from self parking and the conference center) with a reasonable view of El Yunque. The room was clean and of average size, but certainly nothing special. The public areas of the hotel were all very nice but it seemed like many of the restaurants and bars were closed while we were there. In fact, we couldnâ€™t even find Cactus Jacks!?! I guess it closed down. Front desk service at the hotel was absolutely terrible. It took 45 minutes to check in, 30 minutes of which we stood around waiting for the help at the front desk to return after â€œchecking something outâ€�. Room service was also terrible as was the service and food at the Marbella Restaurant. Fortunately, we had a rental car and minimized our time spent eating at the resort. On the plus side, Davidâ€™s Cookies had great desserts and breakfast snacks and mojitos and other mixed drinks were always served up nicely from one bar to the next. The pools and beach are nice (see pictures) although if youâ€™ve ever stayed at the Grand Wailea in Maui youâ€™ll be exceptionally disappointed. There were numerous mistakes on our bill upon checkout, including three sets of charges for parking totaling more than $200! With this kind of service and lack of attention to detail this place will be a regular dump in five to ten years. A visit to El Yunque is essential as it is right across the street from the resort. We also visited Old San Juan a few times and the Bacardi Rum Factory. Here are some suggestions on good restaurants if you donâ€™t feel like being victimized by the junk served at the resort: (1) Tio Dannyâ€™s in Old San Juan for excellent Puerto Rican food, (2) Patio del Nispero at Hotel El Convento in Old San Juan, (3) Brass Cactus in Luquillo or on the way to San Juan for a family friendly bar and grill, and (4) Lolitaâ€™s on Route 3 in Luquillo for amazing Mexican food and strong margaritas. Avoid Victorâ€™s Sea Food Place in Luquillo unless you enjoy fish and seafood deep-fried in month old grease served on a plate with live ants as a garnish. Iâ€™ll be generous and give the Westin Rio Mar four stars since we secured an excellent rate (~$140/night) through my companyâ€™s travel agency. Paying considerably more than this would be a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “thank god”
Reviews.Author: rebeccag52576
Reviews.Content: My two best girlfriends and I had an ALL INCLUSIVE vacation scheduled for the PARADISUS... however we found out that was all about to change....thank god for the Rio Mar. At 5:07pm Thursday April 20th a message was left on my answering machine, from Apple vacations stating the PARADISUS had over booked and we were being moved to the RIO MAR. It stated that if I had any questions, I could call my travel agent... I was irate. Knowing nothing about the RIo Mar, and being that I was on my way to the airport, I hunted my poor travel agent down on his cell phone. He did all he could, but the Paradisus had screwed up so badly that there was nothing he could do. We had paid for an all inclusive vacation and that was what we wanted... not even knowing anything about the Rio Mar. We arrived at the San Juan airport to be greated by someone from the Paradisus... making all sorts of empty promises, that EVERYTHING would be included and not to worry about a thing. The Rio Mar was gorgeous, they had a beaultiful beach, which by the way, the Paradisus does not. The staff was incredible and tried to accomodate us as much as possible.... There were a least 100 people in our situation... all greeted with 4 drink coupons a day and named the 2 restaurants we could eat at per meal... A FAR CRY FROM ALL INCLUSIVE. Regardless, I loved the Rio Mar, would stay there again in a heart beat... my adivise, pay for your meals, drinks and everything else, and stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: pbud10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at the Westin. I was anxious after reading the reviews. Luckily, I listened to a friend that visited the Westin in December, and we rented a car from the airport. We too ate in the hotel, which was pricey, and the food was average. The service was excellent even though the hotel was at capacity. The workers were very helpful getting chairs/umbrellas on the beach. The pool was crowded but I've found that to be the case at every family resort. My 11 yr old liked the s'mores by the pool and feeding the iguanas. We had a rainforest view from the 6th floor which was breathtaking. We wanted to try some different restaurants on the island and found Don Pepe's to be very good. We had excellent service and plenty of food which was inexpensive. It doesn't look appealing on the outside, but the food and environment were wonderful. We tried to visit Antojito's which was highly recommended, but it was either closed or crowded. I recommend getting a reservation for this place. It is just a tiny, outdoor, place at the bottom of the hill from the Westin, on the way to Route 3. Many people we encountered either took taxis or rented a car to visit Old San Juan or just to go outside the hotel for dinner. We went into Old San Juan and dined at the Parrot Club which was very good. The Puerto Rican Cafe, Aquavive and the Dragonfly, were also highly recommended. We stopped in the Hard Rock Cafe too. Our visit to El Yunique was wonderful also. We found the people of Puerto Rico to be extremely pleasant and helpful. Our vacation was excellent and I'd gladly go back again. My advice is to rent a car from the airport as the cost of transfers to and from the hotel will almost pay for it! We found Puerto Rico to be safe and venturing from the resort was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Read this before checking in!”
Reviews.Author: bigspenderllou
Reviews.Content: Our family takes a Caribean Holiday each Spring Break (My husband and my two younger teen-aged kids). This year we thought we'd try something different...a larger hotel (more for my 13-year-old to do than our usual boutique hotels). We are used to very nice hotels. I read the previews on this site the night before we left, and many came in handy (and I knew what to expect) However they left me a bit panicked! It started off pretty bad, after a day of traveling we went to check into our "ocean front" room. We were told that "it was being cleaned" and to go enjoy a complimentary dinner. My husband was smart enough not to leave the desk, as wiithin the hour there were 20 unplaced families like ourselves. Finally at 7:00pm or so, he pulled the manager aside and said "I know no one is checking out at 7:00pm...tell me the truth, you don't have a room for us" The manager reluctantly agreed, no ocean front rooms availiable (probably hadn't been any since noon) Sooooo why did they lie to us? keep us waiting? Aggrevate us from the get-go? We went into an "ocean View room" (perfectly nice). And we spent the next 2 days and several hours trying to get our "ocean view" Finally we gave up, unpacked and started to enjoy vacation. HOWEVER A NEW PROBLEM AROSE...They didn't want to give us an "ocean VIEW" price for our "Ocean view room" It was their error, we were being VERY cool, and three managers kept telling us that our "Ocean front rate was too low, that a mistake must have been made, and that was closer to the "ocean view rate". Fortunately, we adhered to trip-advisor Rio Mar advice #1: Bring everything in writing GET everything in writing. Even though our original check in for the ocean front went un challenged (when it was being "cleaned") 3 days latrer we were asked 4 times by 3 different managers to see the original price in writing. (which we did each time) Now all we wanted was the published difference between the ocean view and ocean front rates. In a hotel with 600 rooms, corporate rates, priceline, hotels etc.... there must be 35 different hotel rates, I can't believe they were surprised at our rate. We were staying 9 nights after easter when typically in the Caribbean seasonal rates go down. Eventually, a great FABULOUS professional named Gabriel, took charge, adjusted the rate to the appropriate level and put it in writing. (plus we got a fruit & wine basket). It all pretty much goes back to what so many have stated on this site, the hotel is Beautiful (as are the grounds) Really as nice as some Four seasons and Ritz'z I've stayed at, AND the PEOPLE were SOOOOOOOO friendly (nicest of any island wev'e stayed at in the Caribean) But orginizationally....they have their heads up their butts. I feel for the front desk people, it has to be more strressful than an air-traffic controller as far as jobs go. There were sooooo many screaming patrons (yet who can blame them). Don't take your frustrations out on the poor desk people, it's not THEIR policy to overbook and bate and switch. The place was family friendly, almost too loud for my taste. Ball- throwing, marco-polo playin, screamin 5 year olds in the "quiet" pool and adult only hot tub. Lot's of parents afraid to say to their 6-year-olds "stop screaming in the hall when people are sleeping" The first 3 days of the trip were over easter weekend, and I was a bit panicked. I think because of the Holiday, local day-trippers made up half of crazed crowd. They were all super nice but it created a strain on the already over booked facilities (getting a chair was impossible, a table for lunch, a drink, bathrooms were trashed etc..) However once Monday came (and it was just the sold-out hotel guests) it was quite nice. Truth is, people shouldn't belly ache about the food. Unless your at the Cuisineart resort in Anguilla, it's as good as carribean hotel food gets. NOW comes wacky problem #2, we were told during the check in process that "NO HOTEL RESTAURANTS HAD AVAILIABLE RESERVATIONS THE ENTIRE 9 NIGHTS!!!) This WAS a recurring complaint on trip advisor. I envisioned a week of trying to "forage for food". The next day we went to the concierge who booked us in four of the nicer hotel restaurants at prime times (7:00 pmi sh) So what was with the previous day? And YUP, be prepared to pay, but not anymore than other comperable hotels in the islands. We were thrilled beacuse after Easter most resorts close all but one of their restaurants, we had 5 at night to choose from. The Coqui grill was really great, pretty fast (beachside for lunch) stay away from the funky-textured burger. Grouper snwich was fab. Loved the newest restaraunt by the beach villas (agua Luna) and ate there twice. Liked Palio too (and I'm Italian), Liked Shima the Asian place but not so much the entrees (fill up on sushi, rolls and fab appetizers like the ribs and spring rolls.) The Grill at the club house was ho-hum but a ncie change of venue. JUST ATAY AWAY FROM THE ALWAYS OPEN, NO RESERVATIONS NEEDED "MARIBEL" , even though it was the location of our "complimentary meal" ....it stunk. Ricks up the hill from the resort had a spectacular view but kinds medicocre food, Antojitos at the junction of the hotel turn off was great and cheap! Loved the lobby bar with latin dancing and mojitos, casino was small but did the job WACKY problem #3 Even though craps tables (my husband's FAV-orite game) are pictured over and over again on the web site and the promotions...there are none. On Saturday night they had 4 wanna-be players for every table spot (not so bad it probably saved us $200 in another nights lost wages). Additional tips: Davids cookies, I wanna buy that particular franchise bust from day until night, Great basketball courts, arcade for kids etc...Cleaning woman was getting stingy with towels and shampoo. There were 4 of us and she'd only leave 3 towels and a mini-bottle every other day. GOOD NEWS, call the service people they come right up with warm towles and a bag full o sundries (mouthwash, bath gel etc...) The heavenly bed thing is just another slightly higher-end hotel chain gimic. They all have their special named beds. It was plenty comfortable, but the bottom 10 inches of the mattressed were not covered with a sheet, day after day the maid literally "short sheeted" the bed, There is no fear of a lack of tip, because of the hefty built in housekeeping fee already charged. No bed bugs, BUT both my husband and son were eaten alive (and at the time they didn't know it) with some kind of No-se-um sand flies. The bites were the result of evenings out, and didn't show up until hours later, with the worst of the itching day two after being bitten. I know they weren't bedbugs as they were only and ankle/calve thing, and other my other kid and I weren't affected. Makes me wonder about the bed bugs...these were mighty nasty and are still itching my husband here at home, but they are definately not bed bugs. BRINGS LOTS OF BUG SPRAY AND CORTIZONE/ANTI ITCH CREAM. Gym was well equipted but crazy small and cramped. It must have been 87 degrees, you'd give into the heat before you'd wear out aerobically. I started going early afternoon to get a timy spot of mirror at the free weights. All in all a nice enough trip for the money, won't go back as it was a bit to loud and the beaches weren't the white-sand, blue waters we love..

Reviews.Title: “Extravagantly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sorry that this review took so long on this marvelous resort. I traveled to the resort with my wife and 3 kids (15,13,10). This resort lived up to all the expectations I had and more. We first arrived on Sunday July 24th at the San Juan Airport. At the baggage claim, we were greeted by a resort representative. We happened to arrive on the day they were working on the highway so a 30 minute drive turned into an hour and 30 minute ride, but the ride was scenic with the mountains and all. We arrived at the resort at 1:00 p.m. We went to check-in and they said our room would be ready in 20 minutes, which was great because standard check-in time was 3:30 p.m. When we arrived in our two bedroom beachfront suite our luggage was already placed nicely in the living room. Our suite was located on the first floor which was convient. It consisted of 2 king sized beds and 2 queens in the living room. The myth about the bug beds is not true the hotel lived up to its heavenly bed with 200 thread egyptian cotton sheets. I recommend the all-inclusive plan which is $100.00 per a person per night because the resorts 6 restaurants might get pricey. Our tripped sadly ended Friday July 29th after 5 fabulous nights. I am a big time business man and have stayed nothing less than the best. I have stayed at the Atlantis Resort in the Bahamas, Sandals, Sun Village Beach Resort and other 5 star resorts in Hawaii, St Thomas, St. Martin, Bermuda , and more this is in the top 3. The only complaint was that you needed to reserve a beach or pool chair by 10:30 because if you didn't you would be out of luck, same with the towels.

Reviews.Title: “Our family Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our 18 month old daughter to the Westin for 7 nights and had a great time! Lots of babies and kids this week. The staff was very friendly and resort always clean. We thought we were getting a mt. view and they gave us the ground floor garden/ocean view which was awesome, easy access to pool area and high ceilings. The heavenly cribs were great compared to other hotel cribs. The food was expensive but good, all resorts have expensive food, when you go to a hotel like this it is expected. The food takes a long time to get to you by the pool but you are on vacation, relax and order a half hour before you want to eat. The beach was wonderful as well as the pools and baby pool. All the kids looked like they were having a great time. Every night there was a bonfire with free smores and bottled water. The only negative about the trip was the 45 minute long bus ride to the hotel but the hotel bus was very comfortable. We didn't leave the hotel all week, if you are looking for a very relaxing vacation at a classy place this is the hotel for you. The resort is gorgeous and we have stayed at some top notch hotels. We will go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort: Great for families but not so good for couples”
Reviews.Author: cwmmh
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Westin (stayed there for 4 nights). The resort was lovely, very well-kept, and clean. I'm happy to report: NO BEDBUGS!! The staff was very helpful and accomodating. After much debate, we decided not to rent a car and pretty much were stuck inside the resort. We tried to walk outside of the resort but I wouldn't recommend it: narrow road with speeding cars, not safe at all. We booked the Old San Juan, El Yunque, and Bio Bay Fajardo trips through the hotel. It was expensive but worth it. If given the choice, I would definitely have rented a car. The resort beach was great but was extremely crowded over the weekend. The pool was always crowded. There were kids everywhere! I think we were the only couple without kids there. I was really impressed by how many activities they provide for the kids. As other people have mentioned, the food is very expensive. We only had sandwhiches at the Coqui club. We went to Old San Juan on our second day and loaded up on snacks and canned food. Ask the housekeeping people for bottled water and they'll readily give you as many as you want. Overall, I was very impressed by how beautiful and well maintained the resort was. It's a great place for families with children but as a young couple looking for a quiet getaway, we would not go back there again. If you go there, definitely visit El Yunque. I think that was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Westin Rio Mar and like many just returning vacationers, I was a little anxious about going after reading the comments. However, we didn't have one bad experience. Since I made the arrangements, I was very nervous since my wife enjoys 4 & 5 star hotels. We've stayed at the Atlantis and the Westin is just a step below. We had an absolute wonderful time. Since we had no intentions of leaving the property, we took the modified meal plan (Breakfast & Dinner). We had the breakfast buffet everyday and was so full that it held us until dinner. Palio and The Grille were our favorite restaurants on the property. My wife loved the spa and my son and I had a blast on the wave runners. It was a very relaxing vacation and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not At This Price”
Reviews.Author: bigalittlee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Westin Rio Mar on Saturday April 15th, we were there a week. The Hotel property itself is very nice and well kept. The staff that was there was very helpful (more on that in a minute). We had a Mountain View room and it was fine. We were there with our two children 4 & 9 and the room was fine for all of us. Now the downside All of the on-site restaurants are priced out of site for dinner and none better then Outback. We went to all of them Palio, The Grille Room, Aqua Luna. Our average dinner bill with one bottle of wine was over $250.00 every night. Please keep in mind the kids are eating a hot dog or macaroni and cheese. I read some of the reviews before I started to write this and some of the reviewers state that the hotel is "Only" 45 minutes from the Airport or Old San Juan. Well, to me that is a pretty long drive. Since the hotel is in the middle of nowhere you pretty much feel like a prisoner of the resort. If it rains while you are down there or if you need a break from the pool, boy are you in trouble. To break up our trip we decided to take a cab ride to Old San Juan..$180.00 round trip. Would have rented a car for the day but the Avis on site had no cars available. All in all there are plenty of places you can spend $4,000 to $5,000 for a weeks vacation and it is my opinion this is not the place. Oh getting back to my above mentioned staffing issues. You could never find a waiter around the pool area and on top of that each restaurant was closed at least 2 nights while we were down there because they did not have the proper staffing levels. I know I may sound a little tough on this place but don't only take my opinion we ended up meeting about 7 couples while we were down there and they all had the same opinion except for the family that golfed. This is what I would call a one and done...but if you can get it for real cheap go for three or four days only. Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place in the Caribbean!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Westin Rio Mar - were there from Apr 1 - 7. Like most, I was hesitant after reading the reviews, but decided to credit the positive ones - especially of late. We were not disappointed. We did not have a single problem. We did check a cooler as carry on luggage (we filled it with our snorkel gear, etc.) which came in handy - as we shopped at the little corner store and purchased pop, liquor, lunch meat, etc. We had most lunches and breakfasts on our beautiful patio. We only ate at Marabella, a couple of dinners and one breakfast - but our food was great, service was perfect. (Rio Mar Burger and Cuban were excellent!) Our check in was uneventful, and although we were staying on Starpoints - the clerk moved us from a ground floor room, to one higher up so we'd have a better view. it was spectacular. The beach was great, the waves were fabuous for boogie boarding (you can buy one for $15 in the gift shop - the day we left, we gave it to a family who was just arriving and they were thrilled!) We spent two 1/2 days in the rainforest and it was great! If you hike down to the La Mina falls, wear your swimsuit - no place to change down there! No kidding about the Sierra Palm concession - the burgers there are to die for. There is a lot of rain, so when it is clear - head to the rainforest. We boogie boarded and snorkeld in the rain. Only when there was a big downpour did it slow us down! We also rented a car, great for running errands, getting around in the rainforest and finding a place to eat outside the hotel if you choose. (I disagree with all the raves about Rosa's in Fajardo - it was mediocre food, hard to find and expensive - but the rolls were good!) The highlight of our trip was the kayak trip through the mangrove swamp to the biolum bay - Mosquito Bay. You meet the guides and kayak right from the marina at Fajardo, it is an easy kayak trip and you get to jump in when you reach the middle of the bay. It is truly awe-inspiring to be swimming in a pitch black bay and be glowing green the whole time! Really - you don't want to miss this. Take the kids - our four year old loved it! The Westin Kids Club was great, staff there was kind and helpful. This is a typical Caribbean resort, drinks and food are expensive. Save where you can and don't sweat the rest... It is a beautiful place, the staff was wonderful, all the time, every where. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: SSA
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just got back from a five day trip to the Westin Rio Mar on April 3rd....we absolutely loved it! The hotel is beautiful, and the pools and the beach were the highlight of our trip. I think the fact that we got an amazing deal on cheapcaribbean also made this vacation even better! We rented a car from Avis at the airport, which def was a smart thing to do, because we were able to go the local Kmart and stock up on things like cereal, and bottled water. Room service for breakfast was coming to about $40 for two people....we ended up saving a lot of money. We also did the ATV tour near the rainforest, which we highly recommend for anyone. Remember, bring sneakers because you will get very muddy! I would say if you have a car, contact the Carballi center directly rather than going through the hotel, who charges you $95 per person to rent the ATV's for 2.5 hours. The place is only a five min drive from the hotel and will give you a better deal if you go through them directly. I think they also do the bio bay tours for a much cheaper price (which we were unable to do because of the weather one night.) Old San Juan is only a 45 min drive from the hotel and is a must see for a one day excursion. The forts are beautiful and we had dinner at a new restaurant called Aguaviva...and the food was fabulous. Usually I am the type of person who would not want to go back to the same place twice (because there are so many places to see in the world) but i absolutely would go back to this resort again! my husband and i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: nycityguy
Reviews.Content: I was another bedbug victim. On the second to last night of my stay I was experiencing the worst itching imaginable. I could not sleep for three consecutive nights. On my return to New York I was diagnosed by a dermatologist as having a severe case of bed bug assault. The management was unapologetic and Starwood was unhelpful despite more than a dozen phone calls to their management. Even my request for a refund was denied (I was offered a 3 night future stay at that hotel - I wouldn't go back if they paid me). As it turns out they have been visited by environmental specialists from the Puerto Rico Department of Health about this problem. I would strongly advise anyone considering a stay at Westin Rio Mar to RECONSIDER.

Reviews.Title: “Was hesitant, but it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Bellesie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were a bit hesitant about our experience at the Westin Rio Mar after reading the reviews here. There was no cause for concern at all. We rented a car and it took us about 45 minutes to get to the hotel from San Juan Airport. We did not wait check in. I booked the room through Hotwire, got it for $128 a night, which was a steal. Because of this (I think) we did not get an ocean or beach front room, but got a room on the first floor over looking a road and some landscaping. (see picture)The room was clean and in good order (see pics of bed/bathroom- sort of!), however the "heavenly" bed wasn't very comfortable. It was rather hard. The concierges were very helpful with pre printed directions to El Yunque, the Fajardo ferry docks, the pier that the bio bay tours left out of (A MUST to do), and to Hacienda Caraballi (horseback riding and 4 wheelers). The concierge was also able to assist with an issue we had. My boyfriend came down with strep throat. We went to the Walgreen's and the laws are different in PR, the pharmacies can not take phoned in or faxed prescriptions. The pharmacist advised us that the Westin has a doctor on call that would be able to assist. The concierge phoned the doctor, he wrote a prescription ($50 for that), they went and picked it up and delivered it to our room within 2 hours. We were kind of anxious about what that bill would be, but it totalled $11 not including the fee for the doctor. Thought this was great, we got to lounge by the pool instead of running all over! The property was immaculately maintained and groomed. The beach sand was golden and there were shells for the picking. There were a lot of lounge chairs available both at the pool and the beach. My only suggestion is- if you plan on strolling the beach at night, wear bug spray! I was devoured by no-seeums. The bonfire was nice, and they have great rum runners there! ($8). The lobby has a great view of the ocean, and at night candles were lit to give it a nice ambiance. There was a piano player too, in one of the lounges on the first floor. I can't comment on the restaurants, we didn't dine at any of them. We did go to the Kiosks in Luqillo (#2 was YUM), Antonijito's which was at the corner of the street you turn on to get to the resort, and at the Brass Cactus. It's a chain restaurant, but it was close and open. Tex Mex food. We did go to Amigo's grocery store to grab breakfast foods- cereal, donuts, rum, etc. to avoid the $19 buffet. We did stop at David's one morning for a ham/cheese croissant, not too bad at $3.50 or so. We did not have to pay a resort fee, only $10/day parking. General recommendation- Bring a good street map. Many of the directions were measured in how many traffic lights to pass than by street names. We spent 3 days at the Westin then changed hotels to the Courtyard Miramar (free with reward points!) While there, we toured Old San Juan, El Morro, and ended up going to Culebra. It was planned earlier in the week, but the ferry broke leaving out of Fajardo. In San Juan, we ate at Senor Frogs, the Parrot place, it was really good- their house frozen drink is out of this world!, and at Picoteo's (Spanish tapas bar). We also dined at the Italian restaurant next to it the night before, because we didn't have reservations and it was pouring rain and we didn't want to search for somewhere else. We didn't have a bad meal there. Also, the pinchos that you can get road side are good too! Kebobs of chicken or pork (some stands had shrimp), with BBQ sauce and a slice of bread- $2 each. Also, had some batidas- fresh fruit blended with a splash of milk, some sugar and ice. Culebra was beautiful- Playa Flamenco has the cleanest water I've ever seen, and the beach is hand cleaned daily. They have vendors that have everything you need- beach chair rentals, ice, water, vendors that sell pinchos, empanadas and more, and it was all reasonable ($1 for a bottle of cold water, $2 pinchos, etc.) I definitely recommend taking the ferry out of Fajardo though. It was $2.50 per person each way and a 45 minute ride. We ended up on the Hi Speed Ferry out of Old San Juan for $68 per person RT, and an almost 2 hour ride on great big swells (8-10 ft). Not good when they pass out bags "just in case". They were used for sure! Dramamine is must if you do this. We wished we stayed at the Westin and made San Juan a day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Scot in America
Reviews.Content: We were very, very pleased with the Westin Rio Mar. It is clearly one of the top two resorts in Puerto Rico -- the other being the El Conquistador -- and I would actually rate the Rio Mar more highly based on location (45 minutes from San Juan, rather than an hour and a half for the El Conquistador) and the ease of getting to the beach (at El Conquistador, one must take a ferry out to an island, which is not at all convenient and requires more forethought than I am capable of on a vacation!). I am a frequent business and leisure traveler who often stays at Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons properties, and I would put the Westin just a slight notch below such resorts. Advantages: Notwithstanding some of the reviews below, the service was outstanding; the staff was uniformly friendly and helpful, and everything went extremely smoothly during our stay. The resort is also very well-kept and clean, especially for a Caribbean property; a huge army of workers is constantly picking up any loose wrapper, empty cup, or unused towel. The rooms are very nice, with generally good views in Oceanfront or Oceanside rooms. The beach is excellent -- a broad span of golden sand without other properties in sight, and perfect waves for those who like to body surf or boogie board. Each night there is a bonfire near the beach at which guests can roast marshmallows and, with friendly staff assistance, construct s'mores, which makes it unnecessary to order dessert at dinner! The two golf courses are very beautiful and well-kept, and surprisingly quick to get around on for a resort. My wife and I played twice at Rio Mar, and it took us about three hours each round. Both courses are quite expensive ($165 per round), but these greens fees are comparable to those on all of the island's other resort courses. (Note to golfers: I thought the River Course (designed by Greg Norman) was a much more interesting and challenging course than the Ocean Course (designed by Tom Fazio), and the ocean is not as prominent on the Ocean Course as the name might suggest.) Disadvantages: As others have noted, on-resort dining at the Rio Mar is an expensive proposition, though we thought the food was uniformly very good. Dinner entrees at Palio (the Italian place), Shimas (the Asian place) and the Grille Room were $27-40, and, while dinner entrees were cheaper at Club Coqui (a more casual outdoor area near the ocean), the menu was pretty limited. Marbella (the centrally located casual dining place looking out over the ocean) is actually a good dinner option, as it has a very extensive menu with something for adults and kids alike, and a nice atmosphere in the evening (while the room seems a little stark during the day for breakfast and lunch, the lights are dimmed at night for a very nice oceanfront atmosphere). While on-resort dining is expensive, the prices are comparable to and perhaps somewhat less than the El Conquistador down the road. Also, of course, one need not restrict oneself to the resort itself, as there are off-resort restaurants within 5 minutes of the resort in Rio Grande, Palmer, and Luquillo. I would strongly recommend visiting the cheaper and more authentic Puerto Rican places, such as Sandy's Seafood, King Seafood, and Victor's Seafood, all in Luquillo, or Don Pepe's, just outside the resort on Route 3. A must is to try a Mofongo, a traditional Puerto Rican dish consisting of a "bowl" made of fried mashed plantains filled with seafood or chicken in Creole sauce, which you can get at any of these places. All of the three aforementioned seafood places also have very inexpensive ($15-20) lobster dishes in which a surprisingly large amount of lobster meat is served in at least 10 different ways, from scampi-style, to Cantonese, to garlic sauce. I would say the principal disadvantage of the Rio Mar is that, like the El Conquistador, it sometimes has groups or conventions, which in my view takes away from the ambience of a place (too many loud alcohol-fueled greetings in the lobby, too many slightly overweight people in tank tops acting like they've never been to a nice hotel before). The groups seem to be more prevalent during the weekend than during the week, so if you are planning only a few day's stay, avoid Saturday and Sunday Tips: 1. Rent a car. You can do El Yunque for free and have the waterfalls to yourself instead of paying an exorbitant amount to take a bus there. We went at 8 in the morning and had the trails and waterfalls to ourselves for three hours. It also allows you to eat off-resort, which can save a bundle, and to go to San Juan and other cities for nothing. Indeed, the rental car virtually pays for itself vis-a-vis the Westin airport bus, which is $27.50 a person each way. 2. Go to a supermarket and buy breakfast stuff on the way into the resort from San Juan. There is free coffee in the room, and a muffin at the onsite coffee place is $3.50 or so. 3. Similarly, consider running out at lunch to buy Subway or BK for the kids rather than paying the high prices at Marbella or the pool. We figure we saved $300 during the week by doing this, which allowed us to focus our spending on alcohol rather than chicken fingers. 3. Definitely spend an afternoon in Old San Juan and have dinner there (we loved the Parrot Club). 4. Don't book excursions through the resort. We went on a Bioluminescent Bay boat trip to Vieques, and it would have cost $140 per peron, with no saving for kids, had we booked through the resort. By booking directly with Island Adventures in Fajardo by telephone, we spent for precisely the same trip, on the same boat, $50 less per adult and $60 less per kid, for a total savings for a family of four of $220. (By the way, I'd highly recommend this trip.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: tbodz
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews daily of the Westin and I can't believe the awful experience some quests have had. I am sorry that they didn't have a good time. My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Westin last year and had the time of our lives. We enjoyed every aspect of the hotel. The car trip there was a bit scary as we rented a car from the airport and drove in the worst rain storm I have ever experienced and it seemed like hours but once we arrived at our hotel we were pleasantly surprised. We waited in line for check-in maybe 10-15 minutes and they held our car and prepared our luggage for delivery to our room we were up-graded to a Jr. Suite with an oceanview and could not be happier. They also took my husband's golf clubs directly the the golf clubhouse and held them there the entire trip and even cleaned his shoes and clubs. He also did not recognize them when they brought them out for his golf round. He played twice and enjoyed each course. The room with huge with a two sick bathroom and large shower. We also had a view of the atrium of the hotel and beautiful grounds with the ocean in the backgroud. We then toured the hotel and found it to be huge. The first night there we enjoyed the most amazing sunset we had ever seen. The next day we enjoyed the breakfast buffet which was included in our package daily and every morning we looked forward to the delicous food and fresh fruit and different specials of the day. We did eat at the hotel a couple times. We enjoyed the sushi restraunt which I cannot remember the name and even went back a couple times for the most delicous dessert. (Cheesecake fried) Yum wish I had some now. We mostly ate off the property at Richie's which is right up the mountain from the Westin and has the most awesome view of the island. You can see everything and you feel on top of the world up there. On clear days you can see other islands. We ate there most every night and even made friends with our waiter. Lionel...if you go he's the best ask him what to do around the island for some local culture. We also visted the Rainforest and Old San Juan. The trip to Old San Juan was long with lots of traffic, def a whole day trip and it was a hot day but we were in Puerto Rico and we figured why not. The city is nice with alot of shopping but I wasn't there to shop but to enjoy the island of sun and sand and fun. The rainforest was also a great experience. It was everything I imagined and more. We swam in the falls and enjoyed the hike there and back. We also visited the another hotel the El Conquistador as that was an option when booking our honeymoon and were very glad we chose the Westin. The view is cliffside from the El Conquistador but the hotel was very crowded and not as warm and inviting as the Westin. Also the hotel was packed with people everywhere and felt run down and dirty and we didn't want to have to take the boat back and forth to access the beach everyday. At the Westin the beach is only a couple feet away from the pools (two pools and a waterslide at the Westin) and the hotel and you can access it anytime day or night. All in all we had the best honeymoon and actually thought about staying a few extra days and the staff was nothing but helpful with this request and offered us a great rate BUT we had to come back to reality. If you are planning on visiting the Westin please take this review into consideration. Remember nothing is perfect but the Westin was a great experience and I would visit again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, absolutely terrible. Worst Westin experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: Magz1105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Rio Mar in Puerto Rico for 5 nights in mid-March. A family of 4, including two young children under 5. It was terrible, absolutely terrible. The rooms were shabby and unkept. We were guaranteed an ocean front room since we are Starwood Preferred. However, when we arrived the hotel was at 100% occupancy and we were relegated to a tiny room with a view of the parking lot. Room service took on average an hour. Not fun with two starving toddlers and parents in desperate need of COFFEE! Housekeeping did not clean our room until we called and complained. The food was an absolute rip-off and not good. We drove to Old San Juan for a day trip. The trip - thanks to the Puerto Rican traffic - took almost 2 hours. From hotel to airport took an hour. Traffic everywhere. The island is dirty. We did enjoy our day in the rainforest. I would not go back. We've stayed at the Westin at Our Lucaya in the Bahamas and would highly recommend that resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in March 2006 at the Westin Rio Mar. After reading some of the reviews here we were expecting poor service, unkept grounds and rooms, and terrible food. We found the negeative comments we had read to be untrue, and exaggerated. We really had an amazing time. SERVICE: Front desk staff were very friendly and professional. Check in was efficient and easy, despite a bit of lineup. Housekeeping: Our maid was absolutely wondeful. Our Junior Ocean Suite was well kept, and clean. We asked for extra towels and bottled water which was provided each day without question. FOOD: Food was OK at the resort. Nothing super spectacular, but nothing atrocious either. GRILLE ROOM was medicore. Steak was not cooked to my specifications and the side of veggies/potatoes were somewhat bland. Waitstaff were very friendly though. PALIO...service was excellent. We had 2 waitstaff who took care of our every need. The manager even circulates on occassion to make sure you are happy with your meal. I had the veal marsala....highly recommend. Palio really was a great meal. MARBELLA: OK, but nothing fancy. A good place to grab an easy lunch. Prices OK. BREAKFAST: If you want to skip the $19 breakfast buffet why not try the following.....we brewed great Puerto Rican coffee in our room each morning, and I ventured to 'Davids Cookies' next to the casino and lobby....great muffins, bagels and croissants. Get the ham and cheese croissant for about $3, and head back to your room for a nice breakfast on the balcony. We also ordered room serice for breakfast....service charge and $2.50 delivery charge, but food came on time, was hot, and close to the price at the restaurants. The food at the Rio Mar is a little pricey, BUT this is a resort, AND you really have to consider that it does cost some extra $ to transport all the meats and produce to the resort. Overall we paid less for meals than we had planned for. Also, if you rent a car, there are an endless number of good restaurants within 15 minutes of the resort. We ate at Yoqui Delights in the rainforest (near km 10)...great burger, great views...$15.00 for both of us. Also at Luquillo beach (10 minute drive) there are 30 or more kiosks serving a variety of foods. I can't recall the name of the place we ate at (it started with P I think, and it was the second kiosk in...can't miss it) and had an amazing meal. We had the Mahi Mahi and flank steak (which was amazingly dressed and spiced). Delicious About $15 a plate. Be sure to try Lolita's just past Luquillo still on the main hwy#3. It's a mexican themed restautant. Extremely clean and modern inside and the food and service was excellent. We had the lunch special when we went...$5.50 a plate....cheap and great. Despite what others have said the Rio Mar is far from isolated if you have a car. Lots of great restuarants to the east (Luquillo and Fajarado), an excellent grocery store Amigo, about 10 minutes to the West. Lots of chain stores and fast food joints too, though we passed by these. DOWNSIDE: OK..it seems all positive so far, but we did have some issues. Before we even arrived my credit card had an unexplained change (many hundreds of dollars). This took many phone calls and almost 5 weeks to finally get a refund. Starwoods financial dept really is a mess, and very slow. The people at the hotel were very friendly about this whenever I called, but really couldn't get the job done. After reading reviews here I figured we were headed for disaster and a disappointing week. Finally got the refund, but it was $40 less than they took out. Hmmmm.....another call to the hotel. Here's where the hotel redeemed itself. I finally spoke to the VP Operations at the hotel, and within 15 minutes we had negotiated a compromise. He agreed to comp us dinner one night ($100) and upgraded our room from resort view to an Ocean Suite which was fantastic. CHEKOUT: They forgot to comp our meal, and actually charged us for the room upgrade that THEY gave us. Another administrative blunder. However, after a couple of minutes at the front desk, all was taken care of, along with an apology, and a further credit to our account for the misundersatnding. Very satisfying service, and response to our concerns. DAYTRIPS: Definitely head to El Yunque rainforest. Some beautiful hikes. I recommend La Mina trail which starts near Palo Colorado visitors center. About 45 minutes in and 45 minutes out (uphill!)...beautiful falls, and trail is pretty well maintained. Take your time though, the path can get a little slippery. Be sure to stop at Yoqui Delights for a great BBQ lunch (it's located 1/2 mile before Palo Colorado.) Horseback riding 15 minutes east of resort (they have 4-wheelers/ATV's as well). We didn't make it to the Bioluminescent Bay but were told it was amazing. 25 minute drive east toward Fajarado if you want. SUMMARY: So we had a few admiministrative/booking glitches, but once we arrived, the staff were incredibly friendly, helpul, and professional, without exception. Room was great, beautiful view. Resort is absolutely beautiful and well manicured. On the beach with great views of the rainforest moutains, a few miles away. Food is a little pricey on the resort perhaps, but you are on vacation. Service was uniformly excellent. I would recommend the Westin Rio Mar without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for 20-30 somethings, but still nice”
Reviews.Author: PennAndUCLAGrad
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal online, just before the X-Mas rush. I think the Ocean Front room was only $145/night. It helps if you have a Starwood account...they upgraded me even though I had very few points. The rooms were fine: clean, sizeable, nice bathrooms. They seemed to have missed a few steps in the "Heavenly Bed" though, because it wasnt nearly as cushy as ones I've slept in in Westins on the mainland. The beach is pretty nice, and lounge chairs are provided by the hotel (some hotels dont own their beachfront and you have to pay a local for a day rental). This was NOT the place for 3 30 year old women who wanted to have fun. We werent looking for wild & crazy, but a little more action would have been nice. On our first night we met some guys close to our age, but they left the next day and it was all families and couples after that. It's also not super easy to go out around the hotel. Local places werent advised, and San Juan is at least a 45 minute drive. We rented a car one evening and went to San Juan (cheaper than a cab ride). I echo the others on the food -- it was totally mediocre and seriously overpriced. Their breakfast buffet is good, but lunch and dinners are pretty bad. The concierge has a bunch of menus for restaurants that are just taxi rides away. However -- things slow down and the taxis are hard to get after 8pm, so you cant take your leisurely time after a day on the beach, if you want to leave the property. Overall we had a great time because we did need a good relaxing trip, but I definitely wouldnt go back to this location. The best thing I've done in 2 trips to PR is visit Flamenco Beach. You have to take a ferry -- ask the concierge. And, go on a weekday!

Reviews.Title: “Westin del Mar-Budget buster.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Watch your Wallett!!. This hotel has an amazing ability to to empty it in a hurry. The room rates you see posted are just the base rates. there are atleast 4 other surchrges attached to it, such as tourist tax, maid tax, service charges(even if you do not need any service), sales tax etc which swell the amount you actually pay by atleast 3o%. The restaurants serve mediocre fare by indiffrent waiters. Indifference is the prevailing attitude everywhere starting at registration. They know that you are stuck with them the moment you arrive and they can get away with treating you badly since you cannot leave and go to the hotel next door since there is nothing next door. The strange system of unloading your bags from the car or the shuttle needlessly delays you at the registration after a tiring journey. The concierge charges you for any transportation he/she arranges such as a local restaurant and if you are not careful, the shuttle driver charges you again for the same service-a shameless act of double dipping. Scrutinize every item on your bill. This hotel is for rich folks who do not mind these attempts at stealing. Tourists on a budget should avoid it in spite of its good location and private beach access.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 nite stay at the Westin Rio Mar and after reading some of the negative reviews I was a little worried how I was going to enjoy my stay. From the minute we arrived at the front door, my wife and I were treated as if we were the most important guest there. The front desk people were very helpful, the support staff were extremely friendly and any questions we had about the resort were answered promptly. Our room was spacious and clean as well as well stocked. I will agree that the food choices early in the day are limited but found if you filled up on the breakfast buffet offered in Marbella's it would hold you til early afternoon when some of the other resort dining areas opened. As far as leaving the resort we found that they did offer shuttles into Old San Juan to shop as well as a nearby outlet mall. I think that for the size of the resort and the amount of guests that they deal with on a daily basis that the Westin does an outstanding job.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant but mixed quality resort”
Reviews.Author: marylandtraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to the Westin with our two children and two friends (all four in early twenties) in early March 2006 for 3 nights. We found that the Westin is beautifully set, with a wonderful beach cooled by ocean breezes, and a collection of excellent pools of various sizes. the westin is pretty isolated. while my wife and i were perfectly happy to hang out at night at the hotel, I do not think the twenty-seomthings were all that thrilled about it. during the day, the resort was fine. we also were a short drive (25 minutes or so) from El Yunque rainforest, where we hiked one afternoon to a beautiful waterfall. We did not find the Westin staff to be uniformly helfpul; some were, and some were not. the concierge was the least helpful concierge I have ever seen in a major hotel--impatient, uninformative and occaisonally brusque. virtually all of the restuarnat wait staff were helfpul and friendly. I do not think I would want to stay there for more than 3 nights. We went off the resort for dinner in San Juan one night, which was great.
