Reviews.Title: “A mixed blessing”
Reviews.Author: cdsimon
Reviews.Content: We just got back after spending a week at this facility. There were some very good things and some very bad things. We booked 2 adjoining club level ocean view rooms in October 2005 for a Febuary 2006 stay. They took my deposit and I received a confimation for ocean view club rooms. About a week before my trip I received a surprise email from the facility confirming my standard mountain view rooms!!! When I called to complain, I was told that they discontinued the club level service but they rebooked us in a similar rooms. Upon check-in, we were given adjoining rooms on the ground floor next to the elevators. I was furious and was told that they tried to accomodate us but the hotel was packed. (so much for booking 4 months in advance!!!) The food, as you can read in many of the other reviews, is sub-par and very expensive for what you are getting. The $19 per person breakfast buffet is just stealing your hard earned money. $80 for breakfast for a family of four adds up after a while. The asian themed restaurant is very bad. Service is very bad and the menu is a joke. If you are a sushi fan and eat at sushi restaurants often, you will die laughing at this menu. The $9 california roll could have come from our local supermarket. On the good side, the place is beautiful. The pools clean. The two hot tubs were fun. The nightly bonfire gave the place an enchanting smell. Housekeeping was very good. Our rooms were clean.The entire facility (except the casino) is very clean. The concierge is very professional and helpful. The best service at this hotel came from the concierge. Snorkeling trips, rainforest tours, and an ATV trip through the jungle were all awesome and were professionally arranged by the concierge. If you come here, rent a car (for access to good food). If you have an Avis car, parking is only $5 per day. I would stay here again as long as I could make sure I was getting the room I requested and ate every meal out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “please read this if you are going”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 and 6 year old just got back from 5 days at the Westin Rio Mar. Things to keep in mind in reading my review: 1. we stayed during school mid-winter break when every other family in the country travels, and 2. my standard of excellence for a Caribbean resort is the Atlantis in the Bahamas, which i think is incredible for children and adults. We have also stayed at the Starfish Trelawny in Jamaica, which i found sub-par. We have not been to any of the top top hotels i.e. Ritz Carltons. ACCOMODATIONS We had an ocean view room which has a side view of the ocean. if you want full on, get ocean front. the room was fine and clean but my son was definitely allergic to something in there, he was coughing all night. if you take a shower around 5pm when everyone else is, having left the beach/pool, the water is warm, not hot. POOL/BEACH The pools are nice and well-maintained but i don't think they were heated. it was fine for my kids but i found it a bit cold. the beach is nice but the water's rough, definitely had to hold my kids' hands to wander in even a little bit. this is key: people get up at 6:45am going to save the key seats by the pool under the umbrellas. it got kind of ugly but if you don't go out early, you'll be far from the pool. around the perimeter of the pools are beautiful cabanas that are covered. if possible, see if you can reserve one in advance. if not, do it the second you get there with the towel clerk outside. the hot tub is the hottest i've ever felt which was fine once i got in but the kids found it too hot. CASINO One small room. Not a casino for real gamblers. FOOD OK, this is where it all falls down. I was assured on the day before I arrived that I could book my dinners once I got there but I was not able to get anything until the third night of my stay. There are three restaurants on the ground floor: Shimas, Palio, and Marbella that all SHARE THE SAME KITCHEN. and therefore, all the food that came out of it was equally MEDIOCRE and the selection extremely limited. And the prices are outrageous. It choked me to pay more for a steak at this hotel than at a top Manhattan restaurant. Marbella is the restaurant where you go if you have no reservations. this is where they have the breakfast buffet. the best thing about it was the fresh oranges, grapefruit, and papaya. everything else was standard fare. they would do well to offer a dinner and lunch buffet a la marketplace at the atlantis where you had a huge selection of foods and desserts. Shimas is the Asian restaurant. the only good thing about it was the fresh noodles they used in the low mein. but everything was sweet. that's not asian as far as i'm concerned. Palio is the upscale Italian joint. the food, was again mediocre. if you can, go to one of the restaurants off-site, which we didn't do because we were too lazy. We were told that Las Vegas is excellent and Don Pepe. SERVICE The service was fine. WE only had one waiter that was memorable. Jose at Shimas. SIGHTSEEING To visit El Yunque, which is the only thing close to the resort, is free, if you rent a car. if you go on the hotel tour, it's $38 per adult with a 10% discount for kids. the rental cars were sold out so we decided to take a cab. We got a 15 pax van and were told it would cost $200! When i went to the concierge she explained that only certain taxis were authorized to enter the rain forest. We got it down to $150 and paid the insane price because we were all packed up and ready to go and the kids were excited. in the end, it was a nice way to go because our driver was a local and took us to places the other tourists didn't go, like a pair of waterfalls that you have to hike a little to get to. the view from the tower is breathtaking. Despite everything I've written above, we had a good time because the kids enjoyed it so much. but if i had my choice, i'd go back to atlantis in a heartbeat. hope that's helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It looks like a Westin, but it doesn't feel like a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Jimibell
Reviews.Content: Beware: If you are used to good service, avoid at all costs! An idea of what we're used to: Aman Resorts, Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton, Grace Bay Club, other Westins We were expecting this level of service and food and decor and we were sorely disappointed on all counts except decor. The natural beauty was lovely and the hotel lobby was nice. Check-in was smooth, but our room was a freezing 65 degrees when we got there and we could not see the ocean from our "ocean-view" room. Service at every restaurant visited was sometimes friendly and consistently bad, with the exception of "The Grill Room", which did have pretty good service but the food was mediocre at best, and was way over-priced. In general, the worst thing about the hotel is that the food is not good and it's not cheap. I suppose the prices are standard for a Westin, but the quality was way sub-par. I want to see healthy sandwiches, fresh innovative salads, warm food at the breakfast buffet, interesting and creative entrees that utilize fresh, local ingredients and that at least taste "decent"..... please, I just got home yesterday and I can't wait to eat my own food, not another mediocre, greasy or overcooked or bland meal!! Poolside....hamburgers and boring sandwiches that come to you in a STYROFOAM BOX! And don't think that food is coming quickly, give yourself 1 to 2 hours to wait!!! Palios.....Bland salads with bottled dressing "on the side"! Greasy and yet somehow tasteless pasta, where a waiter actually recommended KORBEL as their so-called champagne!! I almost ran when I heard that! Shimas.... a joke all-around....over-cooked, again tastes like sauces are from a bottle, a menu that will bore you to tears, ridiculously poor service! Acqua Luna....decent food and fun, nice ambience but we did not know who our waiter was until he gave us the check! And the real treat is Marbella.......worst breakfast buffet I've ever seen....the "hot" food actually comes out COLD! and don't expect anyone to be sympathetic to your plight....you know, cold pancakes with corn syrup, un-ripe fruit, bland bagels, nobody even notices you have been seated, and when they do, they still ignore you....no, no, no management in the restaurant will be quite upset with you if you complain....."well, what was the problem today maam?!" after complaining about these and many other "detail" type things, we received a room upgrade, which made our stay much more pleasant as the view was truly beautiful.....(and I hate to say it, but it was noisy) but the list is ever so long of things that ticked us off: rude management at the pool, unprofessional staff in general, late house-keeping service, embarrasingly bad wine lists, over-crowded, NOISY, NOISY, NOISY, loud-speakers at the pool along with really bad music, dirty public restrooms, rude hostesses, a shower that has low pressure and is often cold, the hotel has that club-med kind of cheezy, trying to be fancy but not quite cutting it feel (and the clientel to go with it)...if the Westin is going in this direction, they better cut the prices and change their name! these may sound like petty complaints but at those prices, I do not wish to feel like I am part of a cattle herd!! If you are looking for serene or elegant, don't bother. If you are looking for fine cuisine and excellent service, do not go to the Westin Rio Mar! If you are expecting to find your needs anticipated and to feel pampered and special, go elsewhere!! In essence, it seems their goal is to herd in as many people as possible and get them to spend as much as possible. It is a "reactive-service" oriented hotel, where complaining gets you upgrades, comped meals, etc but there is no apparent effort whatsoever to make things luxurious or wonderful for the guests without the guests specifically complaining about things! I would never return to the Westin Rio Mar and discerning guests are advised to avoid it if at all possible! With 2 small children, all I wanted was to feel pampered and relaxed and really taken care of (especially when spending thousands and thousands of dollars) but what I got was stress and waiting and insults and chasing pool servers!

Reviews.Title: “Expect Nothing, Receive Nothing”
Reviews.Author: KatwomanWA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a get away before a cruise. ***WARNING ONE***, the hotel is very very far away from the airport, the cruise docks, and Old Town. Don't think that you will stay here and leave the resort to walk around the town - there isn't really anything that you'd want to see you are so far away from everything. We booked several months in advance and paid a large sum to have a club room with breakfast, a balcony, and a ocean view room. ***WARNING TWO*** "Ocean View" rooms are not facing the ocean, they are perpendicular to the ocean. If you want parallel, book an "Ocean Front". We checked in, got to our room and had two small windows, no balcony, and a partial view of the ocean. We asked to be moved. We were told ok, but later. After two more trips to the front desk, we were told we couldn't be moved until the next day. After two more visits to the front desk the next day, we were finally moved, we were moved to a lesser room (1/2 the price) with two double beds (we had booked a king room), peeling paint, and hair in the bathroom. But, we finally had a balcony. Upon checkout, the hotel had charged us for breakfast, which was allegedly included in the rate, and shuttle service, which we had already paid for. ***Warning Three*** The buffet breakfast is $19.00 a person! We were then called a liar about breakfast being included in our room rate and asked to produce proof - on the spot. After threatening to raise a stink, the charges were removed. We checked out, took our cruise, and returned home to find all $200 worth of charges were put back on the bill. A month later, after about 5 e-mails and 3 phone calls, they were finally removed from my charge card. ***Warning Four*** Don't pre-pay for anything!!! We feel that the charges were removed at the hotel to shut me up and then re-charged once we left. At no point did the hotel attempt to make up for their booking error nor did they attempt to compensate us for having spent 1.5-2 hours at the front desk trying to fix the situation. The grounds of the hotel were very nice and if you get a good rate on the other rooms, go for it. But I wouldn't pay over $200 a night for this hotel and I certainly wouldn't book any services or inclusions through them directly. You'll get a huge hassle and headache. The food at the hotel was mediocre for the Marbella restaurant and poor for the Asian themed restaurant. These were the only two places we ate. Not what we espected for a Westin nor for a 4-star location. The restaurants are not Vegetarian friendly if you like good food. The staff ranged from incredibly friendly to incredibly cookie-cutter and uncaring. Poorly trained and with no apparant management, any problems are dealt with less than one expects at the price we paid for our room. Our problem with this hotel was not expecting something for nothing, but was expecting getting what we paid for and when we didn't get it, having a chorus of shoulders shrug at our concerns. We tried to be nice & patient about it from the get go - perhaps throwing a fit would have worked better.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: LynnSunshine
Reviews.Content: We loved the Westin Rio Mar. We went to celebrate my birthday. We had a great rate of $150 per night and at check in we were upgraded to a 3rd floor room overlooking the beach and the pool (best view ever for the price!). My husband mentioned that it was my birthday and they sent a cake and bottle of wine to our room! May is a great time to visit, there weren't many other guests and we had no problem getting a seats at the pool and on the beach. Rent a car its worth it. If traveling with children, stop on the way in and pick up drinks and pool noodles. Found them to be well worth the $1.00!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to spend the week!”
Reviews.Author: lemonjuicer
Reviews.Content: we just returned from 7 nights at the Westin Rio Mar and generally we were very pleased with it. we had an oceanfront king room which was clean and in good order and conveniently located on the mezannine level. we traveled with our 2 small children and were provided a crib upon request. this hotel is very convention driven so our first 6 days, when the conventionists were attending meetings, the pool area was wonderful - empty and quiet. you could sit anywhere and there were no shortages of lounge chairs or umbrellas. on our last day a new group came in for a strictly pleasure trip and the pool area was mobbed leaving no available seating. * the hotel, while quite large, is very conveniently laid out, compared to the Westin St. John. * the beach is great but the surf breaks very close. small children may not like to go in the water. * i found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. the nightly bonfire folks are wonderful! * we ate a few breakfasts at marbella's and a few from david's cookies located near the casino entrance on the lobby floor. * we ate all dinners and all but one lunch out of the hotel. it's a short drive to luquillo for good food. especially good is Lolita's for Mexican food. * my husband found the dive shop personnel to be very unknowledgable. they could not say where the dives would be on any day. * housekeeping was not the best. they tooks our robes and didnt like to give us soap. * my biggest complaint - weak cocktails... we are planning to return to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Depending on your attitude, was a nice few days to relax”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in PR for a few days to get away from the NY winter. We split our week at the Westin and the Ritz in SJ. I saw from some of the reviews that people were unhappy with the service but we did not encounter any problems. The staff we met were friendly. There was a conference when we checked in on the 1st but they had at least 5 people behind the counter so we did not wait long. We had 1 King and 1 double (for my inlaws). The rooms were cleaned each day and turned down at night. Both were oceanfront as I was upgraded since I'm a Gold level for Starwood. I would say that I have been in better Westins but I came for the weather/beach/pool so it didn't bother us. We brought our 18 month old son and he loved the pool and beach. The staff at the pool/beach were helpful. We all enjoyed the pool. It rained in the morning but was beautiful by afternoon. We had the buffet breakfast at Marbella each morning and the food was good, no problems. We had lunch at the outdoor cafe, again basic food, nothing special. We drove out each night for dinner so can't comment on the restaurants. We did hit the hotel bar which was nice. When we checked out they did mess up the bill for the valet parking but otherwise it was quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Not up to Westin Standards- Avoid the Hassle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for two days (I am typing this review from the property). I read the reviews on tripadvisor before I booked, and thought-- hey this is a Westin- can it really be that bad? If you care about service- yes- it really is a hassle. I am a Starwood Gold member who has numerous stays at the Westins in San Fran, Vancouver, and Portland over the last two months. This hotel, however, is inferior compared to those properties. Although the grounds are very nice- nice beach, pools, etc, the service is consistently very poor. When we arrived we received a room with two double beds instead of our requested king- not a big deal to me (I can live with that)- the hotel says they can't guarantee king beds. Next, when we entered the lobby, there were 4 people arguing with a member of management about why they didn't have a room that night. There were three staff members behind the desk- apparently they weren't trained well enough so that they all needed to work together on one reservation even though there was a large line of people. After waiting in line with a few other angry customers, I was told that the key machine was out of service and that I couldn't get a key for my room. A staff member took us, as well as other guests up to their rooms and let us in with his master key. We were told they would bring a key up to us when the machine was fixed (estimated time 10 minutes). About 45 minutes later in our room, I went down to the front desk to inquire- all three staff members were standing around talking amongst themselves; they told me- "oh sure we forgot to bring your key up." After calling the corporate Starwood preferred guest 1-800 number about the poor service, I did receive a call from hotel management offering a discount on the room, which was nice. The hotel was overbooked for the past two days, but again, many of the restaurants on-site were closed. Beware of the service at Shimas it was terrible. My husband requested tea four different times, and he was finally brought the tea at the end of the meal. We were charged for an extra drink, and when we told her she didn't bring it, she tried to argue with us. In fact, she never even checked on us during the entire meal. I overheard conversations at the conceirge desk, and in line at the front desk that others were not happy with the service. The couple in front of me at the conceirge desk had a few of their dinner reservations "lost." I called down to the dive shop at 4:30 p.m. to see when they closed as I wanted to buy some merchandise for the next day. The staff member told me they closed at 6:00 p.m., when we went down at 5:25 p.m. they had already closed. It seems to be the "norm" here, that the service throughout the hotel-- front desk, shops, and restaurant staff-- is consistently poor. Our stay at this property was quite brief as we hiked the rainforest for one entire day, and the next day we were gone from 9-5 for a snorkel trip. It is surprising that even though we spent so little tiime here, we had so many problems. I've never had any problems at other Westins. One positive- they do have a firepit where they roast marshmallows and have smores (free of charge) from 7-10pm. The two staff members here were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Overall, I'd strongly recommend another property and to avoid the hotel's restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Rio Mar Jan 26 - Feb 1. I have read all of the bad reviews, and you would think that we stayed in a different hotel. Most of the staff went out of their way to say hello and deal with any problems we had. The restaurants that are not located in the hotel are just a five minute ride away on the shuttle bus that runs constantly. The food was very good, and so was the service.The only complaint that we would have is it is a little pricy. If you eat at marbellas for breakfast expect to pay about 45.00 for just two people, that includes the tip. try the strawberry daqueries at the bars,they are outstanding.and the grilled lobster tail at the grill room was also very good.my husband and i mostly looking to relax, so we spent most of our time on the beach or by the pool relaxing. when it was raining there was always a comfortable place to sit in the hotel,and look out their many windows. we did take a trip into old san juan that was very nice. we got to see alot of sights,and the guide was very entertaining. I do not recomend going into san juan without a guide. they drive like maniacs. all in all our trip was very relaxing. there is plenty to do if you want to pay the money for the excursion. anything from snorkleing to riding horses in the rainforest.we would definately go back to the westin rio mar!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shir Hayam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here at the end of January following a Caribbean cruise. I'm sure my impressions are colored by the fact that the weather was not very good and we were used to all the activities and dining choices of a Celebrity cruise. Although we had requested a king size bed, we were given two doubles. But this was quickly resolved and we were moved to another room with a king bed. Our biggest complaint is that there was not a lot to do given the bad weather. Only one restaurant (Marbella?) was easily accessible for lunch when we arrived. The food was okay, certainly not outstanding. A couple of the other restaurants near the hotel itself were closed. The casino is very small, but just about the only thing to do in the evening if you don't care for the lobby bar music. We had a rental car and on our one full day there and drove to El Yunque. That was a fantastic experience, despite the rain. (It is the rainforest, after all)! We then drove around the Eastern end of the island and had a very good dinner at a local Puerto Rican restaurant (Metropol) where we appeared to be the only mainlanders there. All in all, the Rio Mar is not a place I would be eager to return to, especially if I were paying for it rather than using Starwood points.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin...minor problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Rio Mar and love it. I wasn't going to write a review but some of the commnets on this site are soo harsh, I had to respond. First of all, you get what you pay for. We purchased the spa package which allowed us a one hour spa treatment daily. (We were there for ten days). The massages were exceptional, though sometimes they forgot about our appointment and we had to wait for another opening. We stayed in the Atlantic Suite. In one word: Outstanding!!!! The view was to die for. Full ocean view with private balcony. We had breakfast on our private terrace every morning. One minor complaint: For such an outstanding suite, the actual bedroom was tiny and dark...tucked in a corner with one small window. They should work on that. We enjoyed the water sports and the service at the beach bar was outstanding. The casino was not!(The casino at Nevada's airport is larger.) Beyond that, the staff was attentive and outstanding.. room service was prompt and one of the attendants sort of became our "private" butler. When my husband forgot his wallet in the suite. (After we checked out and were at the airport preparing to go home.) We called the "butler" directly at the hotel. He located the wallet and mailed it back to us in the U.S. All money and i.d.'s were intact. The concierge was very nice and arranged a charter for us to spend the day in St. Thomas. We did rent a car and drove to Old San Juan to visit the fort. Once again the staff was helpful with directions. Don't miss a trip to the rain forest, it's worth it! We also drove to another local beach in one of Puerto Rico's neighborhoods. It gave us a real chance to see how the natives live. We stayed at the Westin Key Largo for our honeymoon four years ago and fell in love with it. We would love to go back to the Westin. We loved it and highly recommend you go.

Reviews.Title: “A warm December”
Reviews.Author: kantrli
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico: The Westin Rio Mar Date: January 2004 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, NYC, NY After a straight few months of a very hectic work regime, my financee & I stayed at the Westin Rio Mar in Puerto Rico. Much to our dismay, we had several problems with our stay. Upon our check-in at 1AM, the computers were down and they were unable to assign a room to us. I am a platnium Starwood member and never received such unpolite service. The room that the staff were eventually able to give to us smelled of smoke - even after we specifically noted to the front desk manager that my fiancee had allergies to the smell. The hotel had several restaurants on its property. I would highly recommend against going to any of them. While it was during a holiday week, so the property was quite full, but we received terrible service and cold food on each night. We did enjoy the semi-on the water golf course. The green fees were quite high but it was a really nice course. Luckily, we stayed at this property using hotel points so we weren't out much money - outside of meals, beverages and activites - thankfully!! This is not a property I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, But Not Great Either”
Reviews.Author: ewcarter36
Reviews.Content: I definitely think some of the reviews on this site are a little harsh because while we definitely had some complaints the overall experience was not bad and I had a nice time. I recommend visiting the El Yunque forest as well as a local restaurant called the Bamboo Room (I think). The food was excellent, service was delightful and the entertainment was great. Probably easiest to make a list of pluses and minuses: Pluses: - Room was gorgeous, well appointed and clean. Room service was excellent and brought plenty of clean towels, non-allergic pillows and even a light bulb when we noticed one of the lamps was not working. We stayed in a regular garden view room one night and a suite the next two. - Staff was very friendly. - Beach was very nice, especially for swimming. - Pools/hot tubs were gorgeous and clean (definitely not dirty). - The food at the hotel restaurants, while expensive, was very good. - The golf course, although I did not play, was gorgeous. The grounds of this hotel are very well kept and reminded me of South Seas Plantation in Florida. Minuses: - We couldn't get the concierge to either help us in person or return phone calls. A request to make a dinner reservation was forgotten. I don't blame the staff but clearly there are not enough people employed in this capacity to cater to guest needs. - You MUST make reservations every night for dinner or else they'll make you wait until 10 - even if there are available tables. - It is next to impossible to get a drink at the Tiki Bar by the pool, and the waitress service takes forever. - I had a hard time getting drinks at the lobby bars as well. - There isn't much local nightlife. I went with a group of 20-somethings (singles and couples) and there really wasn't much to do aside from the casino. I do think however that it would be a great spot if you have kids. - This is definitely a convention hotel, so there were hoards of people from one company or another milling about the entire time we were there, and the restaurants were clogged with reservations for parties of 30 and 40. Not a lot of attention/sympathy given to individual guests. I probably won't return, but I didn't have nearly as bad an experience as some of the reviewers on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple just came back from a 5 night stay at the Westin Rio Mar. It was the best trip we have ever taken to Puerto Rico. We have stayed at the El San Juan, the Intercontinental and the Marriott - all in the San Juan area and there is no comparison to staying at the Rio. We were so apprehensive after reading many of the reviews, but I realize now that many of the people that have written reviews on this hotel are not accustomed to travel in the carribean and to many of the "so so" accommodations you find there. Having 80 degree weather year round and being on the water takes its toll on many resorts but I must say that this resort does their absolute best to keep the wear and tear to a minimum. The massiveness to the lobby area and relaxation areas around the lobby together with open staircases gives a feeling of carribean luxury. The staff was outstanding. They don't question anything you ask for. Although we could not be upgraded to an oceanview room, we found our rain forest view room to be peaceful and a nice change from the ocean view we normally get when we travel. I found being on my deck in the early morning viewing the mountains and total quietness to be quite wonderful. You must realize that this is a family oriented resort and we were told they only have 20% of their rooms with king size beds. I must say, that the families we saw were quite upscale and with a "quiet pool" and a "family pool" it didn't bother us a bit.....and the hotel was full and all restaurants were open. The service was perfect. Our thermostat didn't seem to work properly and by the time I left the front desk and went to my room, an engineer was knocking at my door to assist us. Each night clean towels were put in our room to replace the ones used in the morning. Also, at breakfast I asked for a small amount of milk to use for the coffee in our room rather than the powdered creamer....before I knew it, a water bottle of milk was handed to me, at no charge, which we refrigerated for our coffee. The staff was quick to give us drink coupons for rum drinks if we were inconvenienced at all for the slightest reason. I found only one truthful complaint out of all the reviews I read and that was the cushions on the chairs being damp or wet most of the time. The winter is their rainy season and you can get a downpour for about an hour being so close to the rainforest but then the sun is out shining again. This tends to keep the cushions wet. My second complaint is that the casino leaves something to be desired if you enjoy gambling...Half the machines are inoperable but I don't think this is a big concern because 75% of the people in the casino are locals not guests. I enjoy playing the machines rather than doing the bar thing at night so I would have liked a bit more variety but we visited the other 2 casinos when we rented the car. Plus, I never plan on big time gambling in the carribbean...I save that for Vegas for Atlantic City. The main thing we found impressive is that no one was looking for a "handout". At other resorts, there are beach personnel constantly wanting to set up your chairs and get your towels or re-arrange your chairs all for a tip of course. Being a private 500 acre resort there was no one to bother to want to braid your hair or sell you trinkets. No one trying to sell a time share or sell you a boat ride or tour. You get absolute privacy. We chose the transfers with our tour operator for $100 and then rented a car for the middle 2 days at the Avis desk right at the hotel for apprx. $120 for the two days. The ride to and from the airport was about 45 minutes. We had no trouble finding the rain forest, or the other two resorts to check them out...and frankly I am so glad we didn't pick Paridisus or the El conquistador. When we visited these places to go to the casinos, all we saw were jitneys running people all over. All in all it was the most enjoyable trip we have taken and I am ready to book again as soon as I see a good special come around. If anyone has any questions just post your questions and we will be more than happy to respond.... Don't be afraid to go there - it is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “good but some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the resort is beautiful but they are lacking in managment. musty smell which caused sinus problems, could be cleaner, make reservations for dinner because it gets booked fast and there are not alot of other options that are good. the tiki huts by the beach are good and the marabella is also good if you dont have a reservation. the parot club in old san juan is excellent clean, good service, and great food! landscaping is gorgeous! rent your own car alot easier to travel than taking the excursions. the rainforest is right across the street and you can pay $3 a person versus the $40 with the excursion. if you go to the rainforest if you stop to eat eat at the resturaunt at the top where the hamburgers are. another plus is you get unlimited amounts of bottled water during your stay. but the conceirge floor needed to be monitered alot more people from all over the resort were in the room. if you ahve teenage children there isnt much to do for their age. they have to be young kids to participate in the activities or 18 to be able to go to the casino or bars. i would take this trip again because it is a good get away but you dont get what you pay for at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: cellarboy03
Reviews.Content: Like many who have written about Rio Mar, I was apprehensive about staying at this resort, almost to the point of eating my plane ticket and canceling my five night stay. This location was recommended by an event planner who works with my wifeâ€™s company, so we went ahead with our travels. The hotel was about an hour drive from the San Juan airport by rental car. We were given an ocean view room on the third floor, which also acts as the main level of the common areas. The room was spacious and clean, comparing well with rooms weâ€™ve recently occupied in the Times Square and Seattle Westins. I usually am not a fan of being stuck in a resort with only the locationâ€™s restaurants to choose from. But, the resortâ€™s four main dining areas were a nice surprise during our trip, and I looked forward to returning to each. You need to get reservations for these, so plan out your stay with consideration of the days each are open. Though the restaurants may have been half full, I heard the hostess tell guests that they were booked. The first evening we dined at the Grille Room. The crab cakes were so delicious; I ordered a second before my filet arrived. My wife was happy with her meal, although I thought her lobster was a bit overcooked. The second night we ate at Palio, and had a wonderful bottle of Italian wine recommended to us by our waiter. The linguine and clams in garlic olive oil was a great find. Later, we tried Shimas, and though Iâ€™m not a big sushi person, the fare was very nice. We later visited both the Grille and Palio again and were not disappointed. Our only lunch at the resort was at the Pub near one of the golf courses. Like the other sites, the service was great and our waitress had nice recommendations for us. The prices were a few dollars higher than weâ€™re accustomed to at home, but are typical for any vacation destination. We ventured to the Old San Juan shopping areas during our first full day in Puerto Rico. While getting a rental car is preferred, the pot holes and liberal driving customs do take a bit getting used to. I hit a chunk of loose asphalt on the freeway and won the chance at changing a flat tire on the shoulder of the freeway near the airport. Also, it is wise to count to three when the traffic light turns green before hitting the gas. San Juan is a cruise ship port and as such, is home to many tourist souvenir shops. One which was a bit better was the Puerto Rico Arts and Craft shop, offering the wares of many local artists. On another day we took a visit to the rain forest, which is just across the highway from the Rio Mar. While visiting the Rain Forestâ€™s Visitors center wasnâ€™t necessary, it did give us a map which pointed out the areaâ€™s hiking trails. The hike to the waterfalls and pools was very refreshing. We also stopped at the small outdoor restaurant located near the 11 km sign and enjoyed the barbequed hamburgers covered with the ownerâ€™s secret sauce. We took a trip to the El Conquistador hotel located 30 minutes east of Rio Mar. It has a nice hill-side location and we enjoyed taking the funicular down the cliffs to the hotelâ€™s small harbor and harbor bar. I noticed that several shops on the outer wing of the hotel had a musty smell from water exposure. During the final day of our trip we had planned to hang out by the pool, but a pending storm changed our plans to visit the El Morro fort in San Juan. While we got wet, it was a very interesting trip in which we learned more about Puerto Ricoâ€™s early history. Unfortunately, the storm wiped out our plans to visit the bio-luminescent bay area of Fajardo later that evening. I was very pleased with the staffâ€™s efforts to make our trip enjoyable. The few shops in the hotel were very nice. I did try out the casino and while a craps table wasnâ€™t present, I enjoyed my time at the blackjack tables. There are many pleasant areas to have a drink and socialize in the bar and outside most of the restaurants. The pool was better than average, even though my wife had to flee from a native iguana. The beach looks very inviting from the pool bar, but the run-off from the rain forest churns up some of the beach sediments making the waters a bit murky. Overall, we had one of our better trips here, and if you plan on going to Puerto Rico, you should enjoy your time at Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is spectacular. Stayed 2 nights in early December 2005. Was immediately struck by the beauty of the location and sheer size of the place. When we checked in we were told that there were no more rooms with king sized beds but they were going to give us a room with two doubles which could be connected to make one super king. When this was done, we had the most enormous and luxurious bed I have ever slept in. Actually, it could have slept an entire family. The room was spotless and had a great view of the ocean and a balcony with nice furniture. The grounds were extremely well kept and green. The staff was very helpful with directions and in fact they have these little cards at the concierge desk which have good instructions for getting to local restaurants and sites. A great base for rain forest exploration. The only complaints I have are: the sand flies on the beach (make sure you use lots of bug spray or prepare to be eaten) and the pool could have been warmer. Otherwise, a great experience and I hope to go back there sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 25th Anniversary..Dec 6-13,2005.Rented car from SJU..easy drive..as you enter Westin thru gates, golf courses on either side as you drive to resort! Beautiful grounds, beautiful beach. Don't listen to negative reviews. Restaurants very good..not overly priced(we're from NY)(However, dont order Lasagna at Palio, Italian food not so good in Caribbean(but we're picky, we know best Italian food in NY)Walked along beach after dinner, very romantic! Staff very friendly, everywhere we went staff greeted us! We brought 3bottles of wine in our carry-on luggage, drove to grocery store bought cheeses & fruit, asked for wine glasses from bartender enjoyed before dinner and also enjoyed our wine & cheese on the beach!!! Enjoyed buffet breakfast a couple of am at Marbella. Also made coffee in our room, picked up pastries from DAVID'S COOKIES enjoyed breakfast on our balcony ocean view 5th floor, little black birds visited us and ate up the crumbs Awesome! MANDARA SPA, 80min MASSAGES, HIGHLY RECOMMMEND WORTH EVERY PENNY!!($155) YOU'LL LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but a few small critiques”
Reviews.Author: jenlara
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive after reading the very mixed reviews of the Westin Rio Mar, but we booked a 3-night getaway here anyway this past weekend, and had a lovely time. First, the positives: the staff were sweet as sugar, and though we didn't have any special needs or requests, I got the sense that we would have been accommodated if we had. Our room, a corner "Ocean Suite" which was really more just a large guest room, was *beautiful* and exceptionally large, clean, and decorated in a modern, comfortable, understated way. We didn't have much of an ocean view - just a glimpse - but we got over that quickly because the room itself was so nice. The grounds are very well-kept and the two pools are large and clean. The Mandara Spa was really wonderful; I had a massage and a Ginger-Lime Body Scrub, and both were awesome! I've been to many spas, and this one, while not massive like the Golden Door at the Conquistador (it has 12 rooms) was lovely, intimate, and super-relaxing. Now the negatives. The main complaint I personally had was a small one, but important to me: the casino had no craps table. It's the only game I like to play (and I really love it!) so the fact that the Westin goes out of its way to advertise craps on literally every single ad for their casino and on their web site, when they actually don't even have one table, was a huge disappointment. The beach at the Westin isn't the greatest; the sand is brown and coarse, not fine and white. We spend a lot of time in Vieques, PR and are spoiled by the beaches with powdered-sugar sand. The restaurant situation was not great; as many others have stated here, one night there were only two restaurants open for dinner, while another night there were four. The one place that's always open, Marbella, is pleasant enough for breakfast or lunch, but we like to get a little dressy and enjoy a nice dinner out; Marbella just doesn't really cut it. The hotel seemed only about 25-30% full, so maybe that was why they chose not to open all restaurants every night. Still, it was disappointing and we ordered room service 2 of our 3 nights. Palio was just slightly above-average Italian food, and way overpriced, though I do expect that at a resort in the Caribbean. All in all, the Westin Rio Mar is a very nice resort. If you come here with managed expectations, and if playing craps isn't important to you, you should enjoy this beautiful spot.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative hype”
Reviews.Author: kw898
Reviews.Content: As with most message boards you must take the postings with a grain of salt and realize everyone's view is truly subjective. With that being said we just returned from the Westin after a 4 day stay and would recommend this resort. Sure, there are things that are not great, but overall it is a very nice resort. Rooms: We had a ocean view on the 6th floor (Starwood floor). The halls leading to the room were quite musty and outdated (floors also need to be vacummed). The room itself could use some updating, but we were not disappointed. It was spacious, had a nice balcony and was relatively quiet (with the exception with a few door slams). The maid service was great - no complaints. Grounds: The interior of the hotel is very nice. The lobby (which has free wi-fi) was spacious, inviting and was decorated very nicely for the holidays. The pool area was very good and we had no problems getting a seat. They have a quiet pool and a family pool that are both relaiively clean and spacious. Some of the chairs were wet (guess what? - it rains in the Caribbean) so check the lounge before you plant yourself. The beach seemed nice (we spend most of our time at the pool) but the sand is not very pretty (brownish) and the waves are rough. Restaurants: The biggest complaint is here, but keep in mind the hotel was not packed so a few were closed. We went to the Golf Club to eat at the Grille Room and the Iguana Pub (you must take a shuttle there - 5 minute ride - runs very often). The food was ok and the ambiance somewhat limited. The Grille Room was pricey (but what do you expect at a resort?) On Friday night Shimas opened up and we had an oustanding meal and as well as service. The Tiki Bar by the pool was open for lunch (limited menu), but was right on the ocean. Several other restaurants were closed but they should open in the high season when the hotel is booked fully. We did not venture off the gounds to eat, but from what we saw and heard, nothing of great consequence was very close. Fitness Center: Small but has everything that one needs (6 treadmills with TVs, weights, some machines). Towels and water are available. Other Observations and Tips: * Rent a Car! - there is an airport shuttle, but we heard of people who took cabs for $75. Also, to leave the grounds a cab will run you $15 just to get to the gate. The car came in handy for the El Yunque forest. WARNING! - Beware of the local drivers - they are nuts. Signaling does not exist and cars pop out of nowhere. Roads are not easy to figure out. Popping in and out of highway 3 was extremely challenging. * El Yunque was well worth it and 15 minutes from the resort. Wear sneakers as it can be slippery when wet. Do NOT eat at the Visitor's Center. We had nachos and pizza and was one of the top 3 worse meals we ever had. HOWEVER, DO stop by the Sierra Palm Food Concession Picnic Area and get yourself a burger. There's a local that BBQ's up burgers and it was by far the best tasting burger we ever had!! * Casino was very small * Golf course looked great (did not play), but is appeared to be empty everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: barbaradixon
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a top notch hotel, and this hotel is no exception. But it's way overpriced. Rooms are great, they're large, very clean, large bathroom, plenty of storage areas, housekeeping is superb. And I love the Heavenly Bed. It's sparkling white, so you can tell how clean it is. And that is a major point for me. But some of the good and the bad ... the casino is small, very dirty, and some of the machines are broken, or keep breaking down with your money in them. The grounds are lovely, but nothing spectacular. They have two swim pools, and both are large. But they are not heated, and they were so cold no one but kids would use them. All the adults complained. They do have plenty of pool lounges, and yes they are wet quite often because it rains a lot. Just take the pad off, and use the wicker chair with a towel. And they are very generous with towels. No limit to how many you want, and they are nice large thick ones too. Our room rate included the buffet breakfast. It was good, with a nice selection, but it cost $42.50 for two. That is just absurd. Since it was included we ate there every morning, but I would never spend that kind of money for an ordinary breakfast. We had a rental car, so each evening we went out. We visited most of the casinos, all of them better than the Westin, we ate in local Puerto Rico restaurants, so didn't try any of the places within the Westin complex. But heard that you will spend an easy $100 for dinner. Because it's Christmas season they had the hotel decorated with just wonderful Christmas decorations and greenery. Much nicer than anyplace I've seen. Traffic on the main road from airport is just awful. It took us over 2 hrs to get to the hotel. And that is normal, to go just 25 miles. Staff at the hotel are way above the norm. We did not encounter anyone that could be called average. They go out of the way to make sure you have a great hotel experience. Our room was freshened twice a day, neverhad that before. Major complaint with parking that cost $10/day. I feel if staying at a hotel parking should be included. It was an underground garage, and very convenient for us. The cost is added to your final bill, you get a parking ticket each time you pull in and out. If anyone wants to contact me for specific information I'll be glad to answer. basha417@yahoo.com. Overall - I don't think this resort is worth the price, and I don't think Puerto Rico is much of a tourist destination. Heavy traffic, expensive, lots of rain, everything spaced pretty far so a car is almost a necessity, beaches are pretty but water is very rough on north side of island (where San JUan and most hotels are located). We did not go in the water. It was a red flag beach most days.

Reviews.Title: “Place is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well,what can i say...the place is beautiful,green everywhere,,yes away from reality,staff is friendly,helpful..yes food is overprice,but what do you expect(it's not a 3rd world country). Place is a NIGHTMARE for its staff,most of the people who stay during our stay ,,where rude,demanding,unrespectful,and not grateful about many things providof hem wed by the Hotel.not goog tippers either..many families had a lot of request,and most of them where taking care and guess what?.staff just received "thank you".. We're from New York and Santo Domingo neither a south or central america..where you get everything you ask for a smile. New Yorkers and fellow Americas LET'S TIP THE STAFF OF EVERY HOTEL WE VISIT,for all favors we get.. I felt sorry for the westin staff mainly the front desk and there concierge desk..very busy with all these people that were very rude..Funny people that arrive to these property some paying top money and others had very cheap rates..cheap rates were the most demaning..cheap rates and wanted top views.ocean views and were paying for garden views..a had a laugh with one guest standing next to me upon check in,the agent try to explain to him about his rate and actually blame his travel agent for booking a cheap rate,,and demanded for the best room,his poor family had to wait for more than two hours bcause the family head paid for cheap rate,,,can't you belived this? IF YU TRAVEL TO WESTIN PUERTO RICO AND WANT THE BEST ROOM,PLEASE PAID FOR IT,DON'T TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE HARD WORKING STAFF AT THIS HOTEL.. I HAD A OCEAN VIEW ROOM WICH WAS VERY NICE.PARTICIAL VIEW,MY FRIEND HAD OCEAN FRONT(LITTLE MORE EXPENSIVE) BUT ALL THE ROOMS ARE NICE,STAFF FRIENDLY,WILLING TO HELP,MEET AND EXCEED EXPECTIONS,PEOPLE WHO GO OUT OF THERE WAYS TO MAKE YOUR STAY MORE PLEASANT..PLEAE TIP THIS PEOPLE... IF YOU VISIT THIS PROPERTY PLEASE TRY TO FIND THE FOLLOWING STAFF WHO MADE OUR STAY A MOST MEMORABLE ONE:Maria,concierge,Lui Lopez,Frontdesk,Edit help line,Janine front desk(checkout),Otto,concierge/front desk(our vacation planner)Jetemar,Raymond restaurants..and finally our tour guides.harry and manny..thanks to all...we'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Glad I visited but do not want to come back.”
Reviews.Author: AMERICAN1231
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from the Westin Rio Mar and our stay was good for the price we paid 150 dollars per night . When we did arive in our rental car it took almost 2 hours because of the busy roads. I was really nervouse in the car the locals have no patients and do not use signals and drive crazy. We were charged 10 dollars per day to park the car and it was a 10 minute walk from the room to the car each time we used it. We loved the decorations and art in the hotel . The grounds were absolutly beautiful and pools very clean but I will have to agree the seat around the pool were always wet. Our room was on the bottom floor facing the garden and that was ok because we could hear the frogs at night and the ocean was not that beautiful green color it was brown. At night I sleep like a baby from the sound of the tree frogs. The rooms were very clean and all the workers make you feel very special. We loved the breakfast buffet it was a great deal and it had a nice selection. However we did not like the dinner at Marabela it tasted like it was prepared at convience store and we did talk to the manager about it and he did not charge us for one of the items that we did not eat. The hotel advertised that it had 4 or 5 resturants do not beleive this one night only Marabellas was open and we could not get reservations in teh Italian resturant that only had 5 tables with customers. I think they were short staffed. I would recomend going to the resturant down the street for local food ( AntoJitos). It was very clean good food and a fare price but lacked mood. There is not too many resturants other than Mc Donalds and Burger King and other fast food places to eat outside the hotel. The beach was nice but I would only give it a 7. One night we gambled in the casino and lost but only 10 dollars I am not into gambling or drinking so they did not make much money off of me. My partner did have a couple drinks that cost 14 dollars for just two and that is about all we spent on that. Lunch was good for the price and quility we had burgers and salads just your standard meal nothing special. We did go to the rain forest and that was the highlight of Peurto Rico. One day we drove into Old San Jaun and had a 80 dollar lunch that should have only cost 40 dollars in my opinion. The drive into San Juan was very slow and I would never do it again.The city did not really have much to offer in the arts mostly cheap junk stores with beautiful streets and buildings and no where to park except for a 5 dollar per hour parking garage. We did go to the fort and thought it was a must for San Juan. The next time I go to the carribean I will go back to the US Virgin Islands and stay at the Carrington inn on St Croix or stay in a villa on ST. John The beaches and people are much nicer and it has what I am looking for rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: sandy78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed and the Westin Rio Mar from 11/19 to 11/26.Before leaving for there, I was really nervous about staying at the hotel after reading all the reviews here . I reconfirmed my room package and airport pickup shuttle atleast twice. I also called the hotel several times to enquire about the facilities and what I would need to take along. Maybe it was because of this, our stay at the Westin went by very very smoothly and pleasantly! As soon as we arrived at San Juan airport, we had a shuttle to pick us up. Since we arrived at about 10pm at the hotel, we had a quick and easy check-in. This was also well before the holiday weekend and hence, the hotel was not too busy. Our Room: Our room was an ocean front room and the view of the hotel pool and the ocean beyond was absolutely stunning.We had a mini refrigerator and a microwave in room just as we requested. The room was also kept quite clean and we had no trouble with the Maid Service (as they called it). And yes, the beds are heavenly!! The Hotel: The hotel property itself is very beautiful just like in the pictures, if not more ! They have 2 pools and 2 hot-tubs. Just beyond the pool area is the beach. The beach is positively gorgeous!! With a view of hammocks and beach chairs nestled among several coconut palms and the blue ocean stretching out before you, it is postcard perfect. It is also very clean and there is almost always a life guard present during the day. On the beach, there are facilities to rent surfboards, tubes, kayaks jet skis etc. Very convenient. In the afternoons , the Tiki Bar right by the beach is open and is perfect to grab a snack and a drink and head back to the pool/beach. We didn't spend much time in the pool but the hot tubs were very relaxing. Restaurants: All the restaurants were open during our stay. They briefly closed the Marbella for a couple days for renovation before the Thanksgiving dinner buffet but the Palio was made available for the breakfast buffet for those 2 days. The breakfast was included in our package and we would have a heavy b'fast each morning and would end up doing something real light for lunch.Yes, the food quality is very average and it is pricey. We read this in the reviews and hence,took some non-perishable food with us. We liked the Grille Room the best. It would have been really nice if they had a Puerto Rican cuisine restaurant on site! Carlos, the Food and Beverage Manager, is an asset to the Westin! He was very hospitable and accomodating and a "must-mention" in our review!! We didn't not see any issues with slow service and everyone was very friendly too! Getting Around: We didn't rent a car as we didn't want to deal with driving and directions esp. since we don't know Spanish. We did about 3 tours from the hotel- Catamaran/Snorkelling, El Yunque Rain Forest and the Bacardi/Old Town San Juan tours. We felt that though they are expensive, it was worth the luxury of being picked up and dropped off at the hotel door without dealing with the terrible traffic.The concierges, Otto and Pebbles, organized our tours and were very helpful and informative. Our tour guides, Harry and Manuel were excellent! Misc: Over the holiday weekend, the hotel did get a LOT busier! The check in lines were LONG and the pool area got much busier and noisier. But the service remained just as good and as a credit to the hotel, they added activites such as live music by the pool and opened up some more hot dog etc stalls in the pool/beach area. Everywhere on the property, you can charge all purchases to your account/room and that gives you an "all inclusive vacation experience".We liked the fact that we didn't have to deal with carrying our wallets around all the time. One bad experience we had was that, we went to the Iguana Pub for lunch and the shuttle never came to pick us up to take us back to the hotel! The golf course personnel gave us a ride back in a golf cart! The golf course is beautiful. We didn't play a round but enjoyed taking photos of the lovely greens! Yes, there isn't a whole lot to do at the hotel in terms of activities in the evening if you don't want to lounge or gamble. Well , that was our experience at the Westin and I hope this helps make your decision of where to stay a little easier! If we went back to Puerto Rico again, we would stay here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Little trip gone bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Puerto Rico quite a few times and have all ways stayed in San Juan. Unfortunately, my friends and I decided to go somewhere different and boy did we regret it. First of all, if you want to stay in an area where there is plenty of night life, you shouldn't be at any hotel in Rio Grande. Every single local business is closed at around 6pm, which means if you didn't rent a car you would be stuck in the hotel in the evenings. Check In: It was horrible, the hotel overbooked due to at least three major business conferences. Those of us who weren't apart of it were told we had to wait for a room for at least an hour. Those of us who wanted an explanation (like me) were either given dinner or cocktail vouchers as an apology. We waited over a hour and half, and finally they gave us a room overlooking the hotel restaurant's exhaust fumes and roof, even when I had reserved an ocean view. It Was a Fortress: The hotel is a gated fortress where if you wanted to walk about the town, you would need to take a bus just to get out of the resort. Don't get me wrong the grounds are very well kept and you can hear the constant song of the native Coqui's. However, nothing is within walking distance. Good thing we rented a car and drove half and hour every day to San Juan for tourist fun. In the End: In the end, I spoke with the day manager and I expressed how unsat this hotel was and that I would never comeback. He was very nice and and apologetic. He even gave me a nice discount which helped the overall bill shrink significantly.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Mar...nice pool and beach but wouldn't do it again...”
Reviews.Author: shelleyr25
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio Mar from 11/22-26 (Thanksgiving week) and found similar problems as had previously been posted in other reviews. To be kind, I will start with the positives. Check-in went smooth on the Tuesday before the holiday but I did see long lines on Wednesday and Thursday. Our room (6126-Oceanview)was kept clean and housekeeping could always be found in the hallway if we needed extra towels etc.. Yes, the beach and pool areas were very nice. Although it was a holiday weekend there seemed to be plenty of lounges available (although the immediate poolside chaises had belongings on them by 8am), I did see staff adding more chaises later in the day so that nobody was without a place to sit. The pool area is very pretty and my kids had a blast on the water slide. There was some construction going on which was a bit annoying (large hoses stretched across the entry area to the beach on Tuesday and Wednesday) they did take a break for the holiday weekend. The beach was nice with plenty of lounges. Because it was a holiday week the hotel was booked solid and with the exception of Tuesday night, all the restaurants were open. There seemed to be plenty of staff whom were all friendly and helpful. All the restaurants have a "kids club" menu which was great for my picky kids. Now, to my issues...the major one being the food. We ate at Shimas(Asian), Palio(Italian) and the Grill Room/Iguana Pub on the golf course. Shimas was by far the best with the sushi being what I am used to eating at home for about the same price. The biggest let down was Palio...very limited menu with high prices for sub-quality food. I am from the NY area and am accustomed to paying a bit more when I am out to eat but for that I expect to get a good meal. At the Rio Mar I did not. Not for a single meal(other than the sushi) did I feel that it was worth the money that they were charging. We never made it to the buffet breakfast because we do not generally eat a large breakfast and for $18 a person it would not have been worth it. We also did not go to the buffet Thanksgiving meal because at $45/adult and $22/child, I could just not justify spending the money since by Thursday I had already learned enough to know that it just wouldn't be worth it. The restaurants on the golf course did have a bit more of a selection but the calamari looked like frozen onion rings and my $30 roast duck tasted like rubber. The saving grace (stretching it) was the David's Cookie bar in the lobby. It served coffee, pastries, ice cream and snacks. That was where we had breakfast in the morning and ice cream for the kids at night. Once again, the prices were incredibly inflated ($3 for a large coffee!!). The rooms were so-so..although as I stated before, they were kept clean but are in severe need of updating. The bathrooms are out of the 80's and the brown wooden furniture looks like it belongs in a childs room. The public bathrooms in the lobby had already been updated and were in much better shape although it seemed that out of all the stalls only one or two in each bathroom had working locks. Not sure why that problem hasnt been addressed yet because it was truly annoying. A few tips if you will be traveling there: rent a car and use the self-park, bring snacks to eat poolside, dont limit yourself to onsite dining you will be greatly disappointed, bring bug spray and use it all the time, make sure to go to the rainforest in your car without a tour..its free!! Despite the problems, we did have a nice time and met many nice people. The kids had a great time at the pool and beach and really loved the iguana feeding every morning at 11 am. We did have alot of clouds and rain but the kids activity director had many things planned to keep the kids busy. I would not return to the Rio Mar strictly due to my issues with the dining. I enjoy quality food and dont like to feel that I am being ripped off each time I eat a meal. Hope you found this review helpful. Shelley

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Westin”
Reviews.Author: buffalotravels02
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Puerto Rico and my family stayed at the villas at Westin Rio Mar resort. The villa itself was nice but it was nothing special. Also, we had a couple of cockroaches throughout our stay, but i guess that comes with the tropical climate. I thought that the grounds were beautiful, and well taken care of. The ocean was very nice, and good to swim in. THE POOLS WERE GORGEOUS!! They had a pool for families and a quiet pool for adults. There was a small waterslide that was not too exciting, but young kids seemed to love it. All of the workers and staff were very friendly. The food was very expensive at the resort and my family did not eat there once. We rented a car and were able to go out for meals at the many local restaurants. All together our experience was great, and I can't wait to come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds...not much else”
Reviews.Author: jaydee414
Reviews.Content: Perhaps generous to give the Rio Mar 3 stars...while the grounds and beach were beautiul, the facility itself was lacking..of the advertised 12 restaurants, only 5 were open, and of those 5, only 3 at the main facility, one of which was the "Tiki Bar", open for lunch only (hot dog, hamburger, chicken sandwich, nachos, buffalo wings...period.) The housekeeping was spotty at best, no service at all the first day, and had to request towels on two others. Perhaps the reason a fee is included in your room tarrif. As has been stated....GET A CAR. There are a couple of good local restaurants nearby, (Antojito's in particular), but you'll pay $15 for a cab to go a 1/2 mile off the Westin Grounds The shuttle from the airport thru the Westin was the same price as a Taxi from the airport...where's the deal in that? The absolute BEST feature of the property is the "Heavenly Beds"...don't know if I've ever slept better in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A so so Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: yona13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Platinum Preferred Starwood Guests and have the good fortune of staying at many beautiful Starwood Properties. This property was not one of our favorites. The room was a bit odd, and not very clean. Housekeeping was less than perfect...many hairs were found on the sheets upon arrival, and on the bathroom floor. This is a tropical environment, however we were greeted by a colony of tiny non-biting ants in our room upon arrival. The food was fair to good. If you can exist on black bean soup than you should be fine. Otherwise, plan to hit the several Burger Kings you pass on the way to the resort. Because, finding good native food remains a mystery to us still. The hotel seems to recognize and capatlize on its guests as captives reality, and offer high priced poor quality food and drinks. Of course, as mentioned, the Black Bean Soup is actually very good, as is the Churassco. The beach is actually quite good, very pretty with plenty of towels and nice lounge chairs. The gym is not good, and super-hot. Plus, the blasing electronica makes working out a possible panic attack. The captive birds as lobby decor are quite depressing, and we were dissapointed to find a Starwood property embracing animal cruelty. Finally, the worst problem with this property is the location, it is truly in the middle of a long depressing road lined with Burger Kings and ramshackle shops. We would explore other option closer to San Juan if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Westin during low season”
Reviews.Author: sacker33
Reviews.Content: The reviewer from Charlotte NC 10/25 and I seem to have had the same Westin experience - from enjoyment of the pool/beach, to the lack of quality food, to the excellent tour guide Harry, to hit or miss housekeeping (avoid eating in the room as they don't sweep and any crumb will result in a swarm of ants). So I will keep this short by saying ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING s/he said is true and far from nitpicky. A couple of additions: 1) I too am a Starwood member. When I arrived I asked for a room on the preferred floor but was told none were available. Instead we were given a room that was nothing short of disgusting...it smelled like a sewer and the bathroom was covered in mold. Upon complaining to the front desk, we were promptly moved to a cleaner, mold and odor free room...surprisingly on the preferred Starwood floor. It turns out the hotel was less than 20% full. Why were not given such a room in the first place is a mystery, and the fact that they had rooms in such bad shape is shocking for a '4-star' hotel. 2) If you rent a car, which is almost a must staying at the Westin, be forewarned that driving in Puerto Rico can be a nightmare. Even the locals told us it is difficult to get around unless you're familiar with the area. We wasted far too much time lost and we had 'the most detailed map' available. Street names are absent or change frequently, or are not found on maps. We finally gave up and started taking the small group tours and found it much more relaxing. 3) Special thanks and commendation to Brenda Lee (waitress at the Iguana Pub), and as mentioned previously, Harry the tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “I agree. DONT Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off..The other negative reviews here are correct...Check In Took forver! I just came back from 4 nights staying there, A business convention was in town and the Hotel completely catered to the convention and forgot all about the small people who actually paid to stay there. The drinks at the bar are expensive! $8 for a 12oz Pina Colada..I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel! Ignore the negative reviews, some will complain about anything!”
Reviews.Author: wheretosayfor3
Reviews.Content: We are returning for our 3rd straight year this March. My husband and I and our now 8 yr old daughter have stayed at the Westin Rio Mar for the last 2 years in February/March. We stay at the Westin for 6 nights and then go down to the Ritz Carlton in San Juan for the last 3 nights. (The Ritz is also spectacular!!!) We've met some great families here and our daughter loves it every time. You are not going to find a better beach or location!!! This is definitely a great family place to be. People in other reviews have complained about the lack of night life but his has not been an issue with us. We still manage to be walking around and having with our daughter and having fun at 10 pm!! We've driven over and visited the Wyndam El Conquistador just to look at it. Yes it is certainly grand and massive but I certainly did not feel like I was missing out on anything at the Westin....especially having to take a ferry everytime you wanted to go to the beach!! The beach and water at the Westin is beautiful and you will be hard pressed to find a better one any where this side of the island. People who complain that the sand isn't white better get over it cause there are no white sand beaches this side of the island starting as far down as San Juan!! It still feels like velvet and they "comb" it every morning. The water and waves are great for swimming. Once it was pretty rough due to the winds but even then it was still fine for swimming. FOOD- Why does everyone act so surprised at the cost of food and drinks? Of course theyre going to be more than what you're use to paying in your local hometown! But you did to chose to vacation at a nice hotel and the nicer the hotel the more you'll pay. The prices are no higher at the Westin than they are at any other 4 star hotel. Your on vacation, just forget all the nickel and diming and enjoy yourself!!!! There will be plenty of fine food to be found here. You can also go to the local resteraunts which are great too! The bartenders in the lobby bar have great recommendations for where to go. ROOMS - Our rooms have been wonderful, and believe me, I'm a snob when it comes to hotel rooms!! Only on our first visit did we experience a problem with our room and it was due to the noise. We had a mountain view ( which is beautiful too) but our room was directly over the front entrance so we had to listen to the hotel shuttle and all the cars and people coming and going all the time. We talked to the Manager and they moved us the next day without any problems to a different room and it was great. Housekeeping was always great and friendly and the rooms and bathrooms were great with hairdryers etc. And the Heavenly Beds, well they are really heavenly!! RENT A CAR!!!!! Rent one at the airport upon arriving and keep it for the trip. You will save an exorbitant amount of money doing it this way. Getting one at the hotel which run around $60 for a day and you still need to pay for transportation to and from the airport. We rented from Thrifty for a week and it was only $180!!!! Getting to the hotel and getting around is actually very easy. The worst thing is the traffic sometimes. There is a $5 daily parking fee at the hotel, but well worth it....come and go as you please. There are gas stations really close to the hotel. Great resteraunts just a short drive away from the hotel and on the way up to the Rain Forest which is literally across the street!! It is impossible to please everyone but I will tell you this is a wonderful hotel!!!! Yes, I'm sure you can always find SOMETHING or SOMEONE that you didn't like, but that would happen no matter where you stayed. We look very forward to coming back in March!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “At best, average”
Reviews.Author: RussellnJulie
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Preferred member, so when my wife and I decided to vacation in Puerto Rico, we decided to take a chance on the Westin Rio Mar, even though we saw mixed reviews here. We had a â€œmixedâ€� experience as well, and probably wonâ€™t return â€“ certainly not during low season. The Good ======= Nearly all of the frontline staff was great. They went out of their way to attempt to make up for the lack of open facilities. While some werenâ€™t overly efficient, they really tried hard and had a good attitude. Nice beach, never crowded Beach chairs are provided at no cost, unlike some other Starwood beach resorts Excellent spa and nice workout facilities Near El Yunque, which made for a great day-trip. Super guide (Harry) provided by the hotel. Great â€œnatureâ€� sounds â€“ We really grew to enjoy the tree frogs singing at night. The Bad ===== Of the eight restaurants advertised at this property, only three were open regularly during our stay. Of these three, two required a shuttle bus ride to the golf club, making it inconvenient to grab a quick bite. If you want to eat off the property, it will cost you $15 each way to any of the nearby restaurants. The lack of eating choices was our single biggest complaint about this resort. Itâ€™s obvious that they do their best to keep you ON the property, so itâ€™s only fair they provide guests with a decent selection of places to eat or give guests advance notice of what to expect. Our housekeeping service was pretty spotty. We stayed here for 8 nights, and didnâ€™t even get maid service for a two day period (midway through our stay) until we called service express. It was also clear that the staff didnâ€™t change our sheets when we placed the â€œchange our sheetsâ€� placard on the bed. Musty hallways and very thin walls -- We jokingly tried to guess what our neighbors were going to order for breakfast each morning because we knew we would hear them the second they discussed it. The property was also renovating some rooms, so between about 9-5, there was constant banging/drilling/hammering coming from somewhere or other. The Average ======== The Casino was nice for a diversion. However, there were not very many table games, and the odds werenâ€™t very favorable for the player. For example, at blackjack, you could only double on 9, 10, & 11, you couldnâ€™t surrender, etc. Even though advertisements for the Casino prominently display people playing craps, we couldnâ€™t find a craps table anywhere. While playing, you will *not* get a drink if youâ€™re polite, period. Table limits were low, though, and we always were able to find a $5 table when we looked for one. The food was unspectacular, even at Palio, the â€œflagshipâ€� restaurant. As one might expect, the quality of the food does not match its price. If you have kids, I think this property is for you. If youâ€™re looking for peace / quiet / romance, Iâ€™m not sure youâ€™ll find it here. For example, the â€œquiet poolâ€� (polite Westin-speak for "no kids") always had 3-4 children running around/screaming, etc. Parents were either oblivious to or ignored the Westinâ€™s effort to set aside an â€œadultâ€� area. No place is perfect 100% of the time, and we generally are very laid back about little mishaps that give a vacation â€œcharacterâ€�. However, this property had way more of them than Iâ€™ve ever experienced at Starwood property

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: ashleyrm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin from 10/11 to 10/15. We are in our mid 40s/early 50s and have vacationed from bargain basement to first class. We both enjoyed the Westin very much with some definite caveats. As others have said, the resort was at very low occupancy, so many of the usual amenities were not available. We had booked an oceanfront room in the Club level using a code that was supposed to have been expired, but which the computer allowed us to get anyway. At check-in we were upgraded to a junior suite. I don't know if this was due to being Starwood Preferred guests or because we had noted that it was our anniversary on our reservation. Also at check-in, we were informed that due to the low occupancy, the Royal Beach Club amenities were not being offered. Instead, we were offered free breakfast buffet at Mirabella'a and $15.00/night from the mini-bar. Not a bad deal as the breakfast for two was $37+tip. This is also when we found out that only Mirabella's and the Grill Room Restaurant were open. This was not too disappointing, as we had planned to eat outside of the restaurant most of the time anyway. Our room was very spacious, and the heavenly bed was indeed heavenly. Some of the furniture had a bit of wear, but overall it was quite nice. Being on the 7th floor, our balcony had no covering so we didn't get to use it too much during our first day and a half of rain. The showers could use a bit of upgrading, and the "turbo" flush toilets were a little lacking in the flush department.
