The only other complaint with the room was that it seemed that part of the HVAC unit was on the roof above our room and we could hear the blowers all the time. I just tried to pretend it was the sound of the ocean! The staff (front desk, concierge, restaurant, spa, etc) was all very friendly, efficient and helpful. The grounds are absolutely lovely even though there was a bit of construction going on around the pool and the fountain in the quiet pool didn't work most of the time we were there. We both had the Swedish massage at the Mandara spa. It wasn't the best massage I've ever had, but it helped pass a rainy day. Note that they added a "service charge including gratuity" to our bill. We also booked a catamaran snorkeling trip through the dive center. It would have been cheaper to drive over to Fajardo and book our own trip, but at that point in our trip, we were happy to let someone else do the driving and logistics. We ended up going out with Travelers. It was a good time. At check-out, they deducted all of the Mirabella breakfast charges and mini-bar charges from our trip. When we got home, I saw that they had been billed to our AMEX. I called the Westin and they said it would be corrected, but I'm still waiting to see the charge removed. We had meals at Lolita's Mexican Restaurant, King's Seafood in Luquillo, and twice at La Parilla (#2 in the Luquillo Food Shacks). La Parilla was by far our favorite. The staff was wonderful and the food was great washed down with ice cold Medalla Light!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false advertising”
Reviews.Author: englshguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8 years ago, and had a great time, however much has changed. Should have known we would be in for a troublesome time, after we booked the airport shuttle, and confirmed it the day before, but they still had no record of us arriving. That was the least of our worries. Although we were upgraded to a Junior Suite, thanks to Amex Centurion, the restaurant situation was a complete mess. Although the hotel freely advertises many restaurants, on two nights of our stay, only Marbella was open. On the other three nights, only three of them were open. We celebrated my wife's 50th birthday under the very brightly lit Marbella restaurant (i.e. breakfast and dinner as there was nowhere else open) eating pizza, which is just a step up from Denny's in the romantic category. Yes, it is overpriced, and they know it, but they have you locked in, as there is nothing else satisfactory in the neighborhood. Had we known about the restaurant situation in advance, we would have gone elsewhere. They have the ability to post details about restaurant openings/closings on their web site, but they chose not to. Every other guest we spoke to during our stay was discontented. If my company sold products that did not work as advertised, we would find ourselves in court. It rained every day, which is not the hotelâ€™s fault, but besides the casino, there is little in the way of entertainment to keep the guests happy. I understand that it may have been low season, but that is not the guests fault. The inability of the hotel to provide its advertised services was "taken out" on the customers. Itâ€™s basically dishonesty and advertising fraud.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but really cut back when low occupancy!!!”
Reviews.Author: jled
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin over Columbus Day weekend. We are in our late 30/early 40's . We travel alot and usually only stay at 4 star and up resorts. The hotel was beautiful We booked the Escape Sale package- right off the hotel website. Very good deal- $ 199 including all taxes, resort fees and breakfast. When we arrived we were supposed to recieve an upgrade if it was available and we were Starwood preferred guest members. The first room we were given was a resort view- there were chunks of plaster ceiling coming down in the bathroom- I am not kidding- a huge section of ceiling was falling down right over the toilet. My husband went down to the desk and we were immediately given a room on the Starwood Preferred guest floor with a beautful ocean view. We were very pleased- my only question is why weren't we given this room to start with??? The hotel was definitely NOT full. We arrived on Saturday night. We ate dinner at that restaurant just as you drive up the hill to the Westin... Antoniopuertoiquenio- or something like that. It was very good- very nice atmosphere, very pretty and prices were very reasonable. Dinner with wine was under $ 50 for the two of us. We walked around the Westin and found that there were only two restaurants open even if we had chosen to have dinner there. Palio and Marabella. The next day- we had breakfast at the buffet in Marabella- it was included in our package- and that was almost the best part of the entire vacation. That breakfast buffet was really amazing!!! Unfortunately it was raining lightly- but we had a car and we hiked in the rain forest anyway.( the hike to the cloud forest- Mt. Britton trail- truly beautiful ) That night, there was nothing open for dinner in the Westin except for Marabella- which had an almost coffee shop atmosphere for dinner. We met a couple who was celebrating an anniversery- and the hotel was sending them to the El Conquistador for dinner in their shuttle bus. I understand that the hotel was only 30 % occupied that night- but its still not fair to the guests who booked a resort expecting 6 restaurants- only to find a single " family diner" experience as their only dining option. Some kind of piano bar- or nightly music would have really been nice- there was NOTHING at night!!! The hotel really seemed to cut back on its services due to the low occupancy. We tried to rent bicycles only to find out that the hotel only had one bike - they said all the other ones had been stolen and that they did not plan on replacing them yet. I felt like I should have been warned when I made my reservations not to expect too much from the hotel. That is my only complaint about the Westin. Although it rained almost the entire time that I was there, I went for a run one morning and saw that the hotel grounds are beautiful. The gym was very well equipped. All the treadmills and elipticals had individual TV screens- they had water bottles and energy bars complementary in the gym. The pools were really pretty the concierge was very imformative. I stayed at the El Conquistador a few years ago and like the Westin better- its closer to San Juan, and not as huge. It also didn't have that same " Nickle and Dime- take advantage feeling" that I got at the El Conquistador. The staff also seemed much more attentive. If you go, defintely rent a car, its easy to get to and gives you so many more options in case of bad weather. I would go back, I just hope for a little better weather.

Reviews.Title: “half and half”
Reviews.Author: pstmstr
Reviews.Content: I was there for a convention and came in 4 days early to see some of PR. My 1st 4 nights were in an oceanview jr suite. Very nice, roomy and clean. The Heavenly bed was wonderful and the housekeeping staff was very prompt and did a good job. When I move to a standard room at the start of convention, it was like I had moved to another planet. The bed was still wonderful, but housekeeping went to the dogs. The room was not cleaned by 6:00pm on three of the 5 nights we stayed. Coffee was not replenished. As for the hotel itself, it is very nice and spacious. Pool area was clean and very kid friendly. Towels are provided,but make sure they clear your room # off when you turn them in. The beach area was great and I never had a problem finding a chair. However, there can be a shortage of cabanas or umbrellas, but hey, I was there for the sun. Most of the staff was very courteous and helpful. The buffets were good but $$$. Other restaraunt food was good also. Try to get off the grounds and eat at some of the small local hole in the walls, yum. Tours were high$$ but the biobay tour was worth it. Hard work manuevering the kayak in the ocean, but it is not a sight you get to see very often. Rental car is a must if you want to go anywhere, they do charge for parking however. San Juan is an hour away, as well as the forest. You can rent directly from the hotel if only want to use a car for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin with my 2 girls ages 14 and 11. We travel quite alot in the Caribbean. This was our first time in Puerto Rico. I looked at the reviews after I had booked the Westin and frankly, I was a little scared. However, I don't think the prior reviews did it justice. We arranged with the hotel to have the shuttle pick us up at the airport. The greeter was waiting for us and was extremely friendly. The shuttle driver acted as our tour guide to the hotel, again extremely friendly. As a matter of fact, everyone from the front desk staff to the waiters and baggage porters could not have been friendlier. The hotel grounds were immaculate. The pool was great although the water could have been kept a little cleaner. We rented the cabana for 1/2 day ($30), well worth it. They give you a cooler of drinks, chips, pretzels and fruit. The rooms were the typical hotel room, however, the beds and pillows are worth the stay. The restaurants again are the typical Caribbean restaurants - high priced and ok food. If you don't expect home cooking and home prices, you will be ok. The down side: Once there, unless you rent a car or pay enormous amounts for the tours (Old San Juan - $50 pp; Rain Forest - $40 pp and the Bio Bay Tour - $130 pp), you are stuck there. There is one store for a little shopping for some souveniers. There are no buses to take you anywhere and if you want to go into San Juan by taxi it will cost $160.00 round trip for up to 4 people. You have a choice for breakfast of either the buffet, room service or a donut at Davids; the outdoor pool restaurant or Marbella for lunch and 5 restaurants for dinner - two off site that you get to by shuttle. If you need to take the shuttle to the hotel from the airport the price is a standard $145.00 round trip for 3 people. If you are looking for a quite place to do nothing but hang out, swim and take long walks on the beach, this is your place. If you have kids who might be looking for a little more action and might get a little stir crazy doing nothing but relaxing, then the Westin will not meet your needs. All and all - the Westin was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Trip”
Reviews.Author: snoopy76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin July 18 - July 22, 2005 and we had a wonderful time. This was our 3rd trip to Puerto Rico; we previously stayed at the Wyndham El San Juan. The Westin is a lot quieter than the El San Juan but we had an enjoyable time. The hotel was very clean and well kept and the grounds were manicured beautifully. The beach was beautiful and clean but the sand isnâ€™t white. We had a Mountain View room, which had a beautiful view of the Rain Forest. We opted for the all-inclusive package, Iâ€™m glad we did because the food and drinks are pricey. The all-inclusive package includes all food (hamburgers, to prime rib and lobster) and premium liquor. I would suggest making dinner reservations as soon as you arrive. Room service is also included with your package without an addition fee. Make sure you receive a brochure of how to fill out your receipt for your food/drinks when you check in, so you will not be charged addition fees. Marbella was good for breakfast; breakfast consists of a buffet and omelets cooked to your taste. Marbella was good for lunch, you can choose from the buffet or from the a la carte menu (burgers, sandwiches, salads, ect). You can also enjoy lunch poolside at Club Coqui. Our favorite restaurants for dinner were The Grill Room at the country club, the prime rib, lobster, and shrimp were delicious. Palio had good Italian food and an excellent Caesar salad, which is made at your table. Nightly entertainment consist of a Casino and a good one man band in the lobby area, where people can dance. Downstairs outside Palio is a piano bar which is nice and relaxing. I would suggest renting a car for about $60 a day or a driver/taxi for tours. The Old San Juan tour is $48 per person from 9-3. It was 4 of us so we got a driver/taxi and it was $160 to Old San Juan. We also had the same driver to take us around Rio Grand. Our drive name was Louie, be sure and ask for him, tell him the Texas gang said hello.

Reviews.Title: “Beach was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin - we are not well traveled 4star hotel goers, however, we were not overly impressed. The hotel was beautiful, as well as the surrounding grounds. The restaurants were nice - and the food was okay. We did enjoy Marbellas - even though the least expensive bottle of wine was $52.00! Upon arriving we were placed in a room with a parking lot view and the room reeked of cigarette smoke. We called down to the front desk - and within 5 minutes we were switched to a mountain view room - very nice. The breakfast buffet was great and the beach was wonderful - very relaxing - as long as you set up a little further down the beach. The pool was very disappointing. Extremely crowded, kids everywhere, the pool water was sickeningly warm and there was tons of hair floating around. Needless to say we stayed at the beach every day that we were there. Overall the Westin was average - nothing great - nothing terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Heavenly Beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with my two children and my mother. The previous years we have stayed at El Conquistador in Fajardo. Although we love El Conquistador, the kids liked The Westin better because it is closer from the Metropolitan area/Airport. Also, they really enjoyed having the beach within walking distance from the room--you must take a ferry to a private beach at El Conquistador. The kids had a great time body surfing and they enjoyed playing in the main pool. The pool in front of our building was closed for renovations. The grounds are beautiful. We LOVED the "Heavenly" beds! Dinner at Marbella was OK. The food is over priced and the service is slow. My son's burger came out without his fixings and even though we told them--they never delivered the fixings/condiments. There was no follow-up by the waiter immediately after the food was delivered. We have experienced the same service in other local restaurants--but we thought it was not going to be the norm at The Westin.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Having No Choice in Food or Fun, This is Your Place”
Reviews.Author: kln9597
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the Westin Rio Mar in the beginning of August as a last hurrah for summer. Upon arriving, we had to wait approximately 3 hours for a room (which offered a view of the air conditioning unit for the hotel). We asked the bellman to help, and he did. We were then given an ocean-view room on the 6th floor, supposedly newly renovated. There was a large mildew spot above the toilet (on the ceiling), there were NUMEROUS stains on the duvet (looked like blood- totally disgusting) and the bathroom smelled like it needed a good cleaning with some actual cleaners. Okay, not a great start. My husband and I decided to go to dinner at Club Coqui. Typical summer/poolside fare. Wasn't too bad. Breakfast buffet was much better. Dinner the next day was at Marbella- I was sick the rest of the night. There were fruit flies attacking our food, but we didn't have a choice. Nothing else seemed to be open. What else was disappointing: One outside pool was closed all but one day we were there, one of the restaurants has closed (the only one with authentic Puerto Rican food) but the hotel lobby still advertises for it, you can't get anywhere outside of the resort unless you want to pay big bucks. $30 to go to the nearest grocery store. The poolside grill is closed and they were bulldozing the area and the beach around it. Just what I wanted to hear: bulldozers at the beach! All in all, I didn't like the vacation and wouldn't go back. My husband just wanted to snorkel, and did enjoy some of that. WARNING: people who rent the wave runners will play chicken with the swimmers and not care how close they are to the shore. The water was bath-water warm and the constant breeze made the weather totally enjoyable. I, for one, like to be able to explore where I vacation, and here the only thing you can explore is the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “rio mar pr”
Reviews.Author: marvo
Reviews.Content: just got back from rio mar, it was not good, they lost our reservation and we had called three days before, food very expensive and not worth the price, mildew in the a/c vent as well as the bathroom vent and on the shower curtain and window curtains. excursons very expensive and the trip to old san juan was just a shuttle that cost $50 pp. all else was expensive as well, do not recommend this hotel and if any one has a staroowd membershop using pints, watch out, they charged us for the room and this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel and the room was listed an $62.0. not exactly 4 star rpice, ( this they took off),

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort- no need to leave premises”
Reviews.Author: SheilaRSB
Reviews.Content: Situated halfway between Fajardo and San Juan, it's the perfect resort for those who crave the tropics, without the hustle and bustle of the city. We stayed at the Westin Rio Mar (-) for 2 nights on June 27th, before flying to Vieques and Culebra from the nearby Fajardo airport. The Westin Rio Mar is perched above a cliff (much like the Wyndham Conquistador) and overlooks the ocean. It was beautiful, immaculately well-kept, and full of amenities that made leaving the premises unnecessary. The pools are nice, one with a water slide for kids and adults, and another pool has a waterfall you can stand up under in the heat. Most importantly, it had excellent restaurants to choose from (you can order in room for the same price), and had a Kids Club so that adults could enjoy water sports and/or gambling while the kids were entertained. (I believe it's $5 an hour for Kids Club and is open from 9am-5pm then from 9pm to midnight. Very family friendly. The local restaurants off site left MUCH to be desired for, so don't bother renting a car and paying for parking as you'll probably spend most of your time at the resort. I'm Puerto Rican, and the Puerto Rican food outside the hotel was terrible. They have tennis courts and golf courses as well. We paid $199 for an Ocean View but found out upon arrival that it is really a PARTIAL Ocean View, which mainly overlooked the pool. Be sure to specify FULL Ocean View as opposed to Partial when booking your reservations. The grounds were amazingly beautiful, with cabanas on the beachfront to hide in the shade. When driving into the resort, we noticed there were private villas that tourists can rent and still share the Westin's amenities. The website Theclusters offers more information, although the hotel was excellent. Still not quite as impressive as the Wyndham Conquistador which is a MUST for any first time tourists... but close enough. Since they are the same price, admittedly, I'll probably just stay at the Wyndham since they have their own remote island and even more magnificent views.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, luxurious, Italian marble & stone, lush groomed landsc!”
Reviews.Author: harrington
Reviews.Content: A perfect trip for our family. My children are ages 6 & 8 years old. Combined education in the rainforest, which is a U.S. National Park by the way, relaxation in comfort, and shopping & dining in Old Town. Plus this was a perfect time of year to visit! Don't be scared off if rain is forcast. We were dissappointed to see the forcast on weather. It was rain for our entire stay. What we found was that there was typically, a very brief and refreshing shower (less than 1/2 hour) on some days. Although the hotel was bustling, we could always find an umbrella on the beach and shade at the pool. The beach is expansive and deep. The pool photos on the hotel website is exactly what you get. We have stayed in 4 & 5 star hotels in Thailand, Greece, Paris, Hawaii... The beach cannot be compared to Hanalei Bay on Kauai, but, that's the best there is. As you enter the hotel grounds, you know you have arrived in an oasis of manicured gardens, flowering shrubs, the whole bit. The restaurants were overpriced for mediocre food. We had expected local fruit, but, it seemed to be more standard Westin cuisine to me. But, we did eat most meals there for convenience, unless we happened to be in Old Town. We rented a full size car from National for a week and were lucky enough to get one with only 5 miles on it. Perfect for driving from the Westin to Rincon for a two night stay in a Parador. The highways were much like the ones here. The Parador (Casa Islena) was highly rated on travel sites, but, we found it a relief to be back in that Heavenly Bed at the Westin! Service was about average and fine. As in any foreign country, I've found that if you treat the staff without arrogance, you will pleasantly surprise them!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: anne0925
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took our 13yr and 14 yr old children to the Westin and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to an ocean-front room (which we didn't even ask for). The food was pricey but we expected that when we planned the trip. There was only one restaurant that served breakfast so it was very busy on the weekends. The kids enjoyed the pools but there is limited activities for kids their age. The beach was beautiful but the sand is brown and not the white sand that most people expect, but it is clean and well kept. We took many walks on it!!! We negotiated with ground transportation at the airport for the cab ride to the hotel which is about a 45 minute drive. This definitely saves on what you would normally pay for a taxi. There was entertainment nightly and though we don't gamble, there is a casino for those who do. Overall it was an enjoyable trip that we will always remember!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice- but depends on how much you pay”
Reviews.Author: MOP19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for a long weekend after booking the room on Priceline. The first thing I would say is that when you book on Priceline, I always wonder if you get the worst room in the house. In this case, it was true. Our room was worn with zero view. The resort itself is nice, the landscaping is really pretty. The service needs some help though, both at poolside and in general, the staff does not have a great amount of attention to detail. Example- when we self-parked, we were not told that we'd have to walk 3 flights up to return to the lobby b/c the elevator was broken. The valet just directed us to the parking lot without saying a word. It's a great family place, so much so that noone minds when not so quiet children swim in the "quiet pool" or better yet, make a kiddy pool out of the jacuzzi. The few meals we had there as well were no that great, very average but not as expensive as other reviewers indicated. When you are in a resort- this is what one should expect to pay. All in all, worth the trip but not if you spend $200+/night...we paid half of that and felt fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel. Upon arrival I was impressed by the staff of people to help us with fiendly smiles. The lobby is very clean spacious and impressive with modern/spanish influence. The floors gleamed and all was very clean, with nice sitting areas to enjoy a quiet talk or just enjoy the view. We had a nice room facing the water, it was a junior suite and I found it very clean. The only problem was that one day we were still sleeping when maid service knocked....and our room was still not cleaned at 4:00pm when we returned from the pool area. The pool area was very clean also and we had no problem with finding chairs although we opted for the free tiki huts on the beach, instead of the pool area. We had a wonderful lunch and yes it was on the pricey side.....but it was brought to us with a smile with very good and attentive service. I did not find this resort any more expensive than any other resort prices. We rented a car, which is the only way to go if you want to take excursions on your own. I found the location farther from the city to be perfect for our needs. I did not want the hustle and bustle noise of city and preferred the quiet lush surrounding rain forest exceptional in beauty. I can only rate the lunch we had so it is hard to judge......but what we ordered was very good. There are many places near the hotel if you venture out to eat local food that are great for adventurous tourists. It is nice to taste and enjoy local food. The casino was small and quiet but seemed quite busy on Saturday night with the adjoined ouside bar very busy with live music. I did not see any other "clubs" but this was not our interest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved My Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin with two other friends, we had a great time ..The Staff was Wonderful. I think we had like over 15 towels in the bathroom at once. It's nicer if you tip them once you check in,, also the lobby bar, what a party we had there,, once again tipping is a wonderful thing. and if you speak the spanish tongue is even better .. our bartender was great,, I didnt want a regular drink, so we just made up drinks as the night went by. with 151 Run.. what a party,, we did rent a car,, which is a very good idea. we drove to other parts of PR. went to Culebra Island with out the resort price, we took a ferry ride (once again its better if you know spanish). we also took to the rain forest (and food on the side of the road ), we didn't eat in the Hotel. We went to local places,, We didnt go to PR to eat American food .. that would be a waste. I met the most amazing people, o, yes, thier was a wedding the weekend i went. met about every one from,, Chicago. that was at the wedding,, John, I had a great time :).. All in all, I will go back,, the night life is ok,, but then again I do the club thing in NY,, didnt want to do it away .. samething, just different place. The guys at the lobby bar, where to nice,, we went out and came back with flowers for them..we stayed out in the beach one night and woke up to the most beautiful sunrise. walked the length of the beach .. 2 mile walk,, with out anyone bothering you ,, i was a little disappointed with the whole adult pool, and kiddy pool.. if its adults,, then please keep your kids in the kiddy pool. I am a mom, but when i go away I dont need to listen to your kid yelling at the top of his lungs .. so i did the best thing, and moved to the beach. So,, Kudos to The Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay depending on what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: gs3
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice, swimmable, clean beach (but don't expect white sand); gorgeous grounds; close to El Yunque, bio bay excursions and ferries to Culebra; overall helpful service; nice tennis center with great tennis instructor (Fabio); big swimming pools and jacuzzi (but better upkeep needed). Cons: Not close to San Juan (1 hr away) and pretty much no restaurants or nightlife nearby (if you're not renting a car, I would not recommend staying here if you want to see more of Puerto Rico); spotty check-in/registration service -- i.e., not accommodating about room upgrades; seems like it is more likely to rain here than in other parts of Puerto Rico because of the proximity to the rainforest; not much evening entertainment and whatever they did have was too Americanized. Overall food was pretty good and rooms were clean simple nice Westin rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay at hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed at . The staff was rude! The pool staff was actually selling the pool chairs with the managers knowledge. I even complained to Starwood the management of the westins and they would not do anything to change thesituation either.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!!”
Reviews.Author: carib4fun
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in March with two 15 y/o's. Resort was beautiful and very clean. There was plenty for the kids to do ...gameroom, swimming,ping pong, etc. It was very safe. Everything is within the resort. Shuttles will take you to various restaurants. I could take some time to gamble alone and knew that they were okay. It was very crowded at the tme of our visit, but it was great because the teens met friends. If my husband and I were to go alone, it would probably be at a less crowded time, not spring break.

Reviews.Title: “great potential terrible service”
Reviews.Author: scuba_MN
Reviews.Content: The westin has unbelievable potential, but the service was terrible. The Good: the beach, the views and the pool were wonderful. The proximity to the beach/pool was great. The pools were clean. The Bad: The service was consistently terrible. Do not eat at the hotel restaurants. They are over priced and underquality. Specifically do not eat at maribelles or pool side. We spent $120 for four people (one drink per person) with unedible food. If you must eat at the hotel go to the iguana pub (at the golf course). The rooms are well worn with water stained walls and ceilings but clean. The concierge service was inconsistant. You will pay a 50% premium on horseback riding. Avoid the dive shop $135 for scuba and $75 for snorkelling. The service was substandard and the captain was downright mean and nasty. Tips try the condos at the westin Rent a car to get off the property try lolita's for mexcian food some of best King's seafood not to far from the resort avoid las vegas restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: sfauci
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a 5 night stay at the Westin Rio Mar. It was lovely. I really think some of the reviews are unfair. The rooms were nice, hotel grounds beautiful and the beach is nice too. The staff can't control what the sand looks like! Food a little pricey, some meals great others OK. Staff very helpful and friendly. Very relaxing trip.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not really sure where to begin. I have to admit that I went into this vacation with my eyes wide open after reading a number of reviews from this website. It started with the fact that they gave our room away. Never a good way to start off. They put us in what I belive use to be a utility closet and said they would move us the next day. What is really frustrating is that, knowing our flight got in late I called the day before to confirm our resevation and to ensure that all was in order. The next day we were moved and the room "looked" better and although we booked ocean-front this was still a stretch. We could barely see the ocean from the fourth floor. After a terribly unfullfilling dinner at one of the property rest. I returned to my room only to realize that they placed us directly over the lobby bar. At 12:30 I was still listening to a very bad version of Gloria Gainer's "I will survive". I looked at my husband and said, "I don't think I will survive." I called down to the front desk and told them about the problem, indicating that I was sure my file has a red flag next to it, but there was no way I could stay in my room. We were moved, AGAIN, the next day to a room we should have been in from day one. The only redeeming quality of this resort was the pool cabanas. You can reserve a pool cabana for $90 a day. This inlcudes 8 drinks (pop and water) and some snacks and fruit each day. Quite honestly, this was my lunch while there. The cabanas also provide the kids with shade and allowed me to sleep in, knowing that I would otherwise be up at 7:00 to secure chairs. Food was terrile except for Palio. They ran out of everything. (like coffee) There were two jet skis for a resort that accomdates 2500. We signed up to reserve a spot 5 days away and when that day came they had given our reservations away. Honestly, if you are making this your one trip away for the year, DO NOT book at this Westin. Go to St. John or the Caymans. This property no more represented the Westin Starwood Properties than my local Howard Johnsons. I am a long standing starwood preferred member, and they are getting an similar e-mail. I cannot believe that they want this property out there representing them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and i have just returned from a five night stay at the Westin Rio Mar Beach Resort & Golf Club. The Westin was a beautiful place to stay for familys with kids! The staff were all friendly!The resort was amazing as were the pools and beach. I prefered to sit at the quiet pool most of the time since it was less crowded even though the activity pool is much bigger it always seemed to be jammed you would be lucky to find any place to sit there! You can always wake up a little earlier to find a good spot...same thing with the beach. As for the beach yes it did have some waves but we found them very enjoyable since where they were it's still knee length. The sand was the softest sand i have ever felt and was not rocky at all!As for the restaurants- Shimas-not worth the money! The food was pretty bad although the ribs were the best ive tasted! Palio-Really nice place pretty good food! Cactus Jacks-one of the best places there of what we thought based on our order. Marbella-Fits the price range! Club Coqui-ok but to expencive for lunch i would recomend the iguana pub next to the Grille Room at the golf cource same type of food and more for half the price! The resort also had a teens clup great for the older ones instead of the game room. The rooms were all really nice and clean but as for the view keep in mind when you don't get ocean view they don't give you ANY where close to a view of the ocean or pool. Are balcony was overlooking a roof! Still the room was nice but be careful of the electronic safe ares got jammed but the staff fixed it right away and it was fine for the rest of our stay! Over all the resort was an excellent place to stay and we wish to be returning! I hope this review helped!:)

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good vacation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-night stay with my husband and 7-year-old son. We did have a very nice vacation, but the irritations we had were hotelrelated. The Up Side: Beautiful location, gorgeous water and beach, friendly (albeit mostly ill-informed) staff, nice pools, wonderful beds, nice large room. The rain forest and snorkeling excursions we took were great! It is a quiet place...not much in the way of hopping nightlife, but we don't care about that, so it worked for us. The Downside: Our buffet breakfasts (which were quite nice) were included with our package, HOWEVER, all of the other food and drinks were grossly overpriced and unexceptional in terms of preparation/taste. $50 for a no-alcohol-or-desserts poolside sandwich lunch for two adults and a hotdog-eating kid? $10 for three cookies from the snack shop? $8.50 for an 8-oz margarita in a plastic cup? Our solution was to take a $30 ride to the nearest grocery store and buy a couple of six-packs of Fosters, bottled water, sodas and some snacks. Given the money we saved on just the beer ($14 for 12 bottles versus $82--tip included-- had we bought them at the hotel, we came out way ahead, even after the $30, 10-minutes-each-way cab ride) One evening, we went to Cactus Jack's (Tex Mex) for dinner and could only be seated at the bar, which was okay by us since we hadn't made reservations. During our meal, there was the intermittent smell of "sewer gas" which the waitresses told us came from the tennis club bathrooms situated below the bar. To combat the stench, they were spraying air freshener in the bar area while people were eating! When we returned to the main hotel, I spoke with the manager in charge who simply said "Sorry." Given the cost to stay at the Westin, I expected more in terms of responsiveness from the management (maybe a free drink?) The grounds are lovely, but the hotel seems to have maintenance issues..for example, we were on a "Starwood Preferred Floor" and noticed many big spots of paint missing from hotel room doors, even on the "Ocean Suite" doors. In our bathroom, the showerhead dripped heartily when we ran the tub for a bath, tub faucets and temp control hardware appeared to be unsecured/ uncaulked...they moved around on the wall when we turned the handles. And the curved shower curtain rod sagged downward. Also, the hotel was full when we visited and this caused problems in trying to find on-site places to eat at reasonable times (i.e., not 10 pm). Understandable. We went to Marbella at 6pm and were told "no tables 'til 10pm", we then went to the pool restaurant and were told by the manager "how about 9:45, or you could try Ajili Mojili..you won't need a reservation." We then went to the concierge who called ahead to Ajili Mojili for us and found out that they were, in fact, closed on Friday night. Then the concierge recommended Antojitos Puertoriquennos (a restaurant off the property, where we had eaten previously). We went to the head doorman (Juan...who was great) and he told us Antojitos had closed at 5pm, but he sent us to another restaurant (Richie's) which was great AND they sent a car to pick us up (no charge) because they knew that the Westin had no "car-service" vehicles available. Also, we did not rent a car and ended up feeling like Westin prisoners. Whenever I asked for "a taxi" at the front door, I was given a car-service type vehicle (i.e., had "an arrangement" with the hotel) and every trip cost $15 each way...even a 10-minute drive! It was nuts! Given that bus service outside of San Juan seems to be nearly non-existent and there were no sidewalks, we felt stuck. If we were to return, we would definitely rent a car and suck-up the $15/day parking fee (on a 480-acre property, please, it's not like they have limited space). Finally, the early-morning-chaise-lounge-reserving by people who never showed up was extremely annoying...the hotel should do something about this. It is obnoxious and unfair to the other guests. Other resorts I have stayed in have had no problem in posting signs and removing people's towels from lounges that go unused. WOULD WE GO BACK TO THE WESTIN??? Maybe, but we would definitely rent a car and consider renting a condo on the property so we would still have access to the casino/beach/pool/spa/restaurant amenities but more control over what/where/when we ate. I really do not mind spending money to eat while on vacation, but I would prefer to spend money to help the local economy rather than the Westin economy! Everything seemed very calculated to generate the maximum amount of money for the Westin as possible...as an example, no happy hour or drink specials at the beach bar and $2 for a tiny bag of popcorn next to the hotel playground, tiny ice buckets that made it hard to chill anything that did not come from the mini bar. It is a beautiful location...there is no denying that. And we came back relaxed, which was the objective.

Reviews.Title: “Great kids' vacation”
Reviews.Author: billcat
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2005 spring break at the Westin in Puerto Rico and it was a great vacation. While this Westin was not as nice as most in the continental United States, after reading other reviews I had expected this to be a 3 to 3.5 star resort. My expectations were confirmed by the quality of the rooms. The resort offered plenty for my 3 and 6 year olds to do. The beach was nice and clean and probably 50 yards from the door of the hotel. The water slide was fun and because it was in the about 3'6" part of the pool my six year old was not afraid. The food at the restaurants were above average but pricey and so were the drinks. I would recommend renting a car from Avis at the airport because it only costs $5 as opposed to $10 daily to park an Avis car in the hotel parking. The rooms were clean and had a nice heavenly bed. The staff were nice and warmed up to the kids. Overall I thought it was a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: TravelerArlington_VA
Reviews.Content: Usually love Westins (had a great experience at their St. John one a few years back), and was very much looking forward to this visit (January 05). But Rio Mar was not up to their standards. The rooms are in need of some upkeep and hallways were often dirty. You would think that you can't go wrong with good golf course and beaches, but the location at the foot of a rain forest mountain means lots of rain and not as much sun as would like. Very few area attractions other than a visit to the rain forest (which was catually fairly overdeveloped for a national park). Food on site was decent, but exceptionally overpriced. Very much a 'take advantage of the isolation' attitude by jacking up the prices. Similar approach to other things like huge tag-ons for parking and groceries (my favorite was charging $16 for small bottle of contact lens solution; we drove 2 miles to a grocery store and got it for $3). In short, an underwhelming experience and we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Rio Mar - Awesome Resort! - March 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Westin Rio Mar for 4 nights. Rooms - we were upgraded and got a room that was a good size. The rooms were very clean and the room came equip with Westin's Signature Heavenly beds - very comfortable! Restaurants - food worked out better than we expected. There was this little place called "David's Cookies" where we were able to grab coffee, bagels, muffins, etc in the mornings. As for the restaurants, the food was good - you pay for what you get at this resort. If you wanted to dine well... then you'd pay for it. Otherwise, there were many "reasonably" priced restaurants. Staff - the staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Golf - golf was a bit expensive, but the courses were nice. They had twilight rates at $105 which were more reasonable to pay. For more affordable golf, you can drive Berwind (a local country club) that is open to the public on certain days. The green fees at Berwind were only $65 and included the golf cart. Beautiful course! Pool â€“ the pool area was beautiful. There are two pools, one for adults only and a common pool. There is a waterslide attached to the common pool (which looked like a bunch of fun). Beaches â€“ the beaches were nice. I have seen nicer beaches, but the golden sand in PR was still beautiful and nothing to complain about. I would highly recommend this resort; it was in a great location (away from the city) close to the rainforest and great golf courses. I would also recommend that you rent a car should you stay here. The resort is about 30 minutes away from the airport and taxi fare is apparently $70 + $20 for each additional person. We also found the car handy to drive to the rainforest, drive to the marina to do the bioluminescent bay excursion, travel to golf courses, and dining in the area. All in all.. a great experience at the Westin Rio Mar

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: katOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very beautiful- the rooms are nice, the beach, the pools, and the restaurants. The beach is right off the pools which is convenient and there are plenty of chairs. Service is great anywhere in the hotel. I would make reservations at the restaurants before you go because they fill up. We have 14 in our group and we liked the Grill Room Restaurant the best. I would stay in the ocean view. pool view, or the ocean front rooms only. The mountain view is pretty but I preferred the ocean. The casino is small and packed every night. The clothing shop is fair. The beds are so comfortable. Overall, the food is pretty good. We had a large group and it was the perfect place to stay- not too large. I heard the EL Conquistor hotel down the street is very nice but the beach is not right off the pool and the hotel is spread out. Everyone in our group really liked the Westin. One day, we went snokeling on Captain Mingo's boat- very dissappointing. The water was too rough and we didn't see much!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from 4 wonderful days at the Westin. After reading some of the reviews on this site, I wondered if I should take some food with me... but, we were both extremely pleased with the food at all of the restaurants, and we tried them all but Cactus Jack's. Yes, it's pricey, you knew that before you went. We especially enjoyed lunch at the outside restaurant near the pool. The food was wonderful. The rooms were great. The beds were AMAZING. I miss that bed!! We were there with a group, and the accomodations were excellent. From the moment we got off the plane until they made us leave! I cant express enough how great everything was. I would highly recommend the Westin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Bucks- adequate service”
Reviews.Author: Ravel39
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice over last six months because it was in close proximity to my aunt who is in a nursing home. Room rates are what I believe expensive. About $200 per night the first time and $400 per night the second time. (went with my wife and got continental breakfast, a small buffet dinner and a top floor room included) Both time I complained to Westin about minor service items. They included a room safe that didn't work, room info book not up to date, continuously broken elevator between lobby and garage as well as other small problems. Normally this would not bother me but at the price per night it did. Now what's nice. The location is very good, the grounds are great especially if you play golf. The first time I used some of the resturants and they were fine. The second time we only puchased one lunch by the pool and it was okay. Bottom line if it were not for the convienenced regarding my aunt I'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, needs more pool lounges!!!”
Reviews.Author: JudyB35
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Westin Rio Mar and would probably stay there again. Nice beach, pool, casino, but ... impossible to get a lounge chair by the pool during busy weeks (we were there Christmas week). People pay hotel employees to "reserve" lounges. When we went down to the pool at 9 a.m., every lounge had a towel on it. Something needs to be done about this system. We ended up on the beach every day instead since we couldn't get near the pool. The food is average, casino is small, but nice. There should be more things for teens to do at night ... many of them found their way into the casino (illegally). But, our rooms were very comfortable, the staff was very helpful and overall we had a very relaxing week (once we stopped looking for pool lounge chairs!).

Reviews.Title: “Overall - impressed. A lovely upscale resort.”
Reviews.Author: wise2374
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from a quick three night jaunt to the Westin. We came away impressed, and if we're to return to Puerto Rico, it's likely we'd stay here again. THE GOOD: The property and hotel are lovely. The public spaces are all tastefully done and attractive - a large lobby area has a number of cool seating areas and a bar and overlooks some of the restaurants on the level below. The casino is relatively small but very lively. We were happy with the rooms, which are standard Westin, and therefore a touch nicer than the average Caribbean room in resorts of similar caliber - they're nice sized, have an outdoor balcony with a table and chairs, and have all the fixings you'd expect from a Westin - including a couch, handsome desk and the heavenly bed. The bathrooms are really very nice, with a great shower and separate room for the toilet. The outoor areas are nicely done as well, with landscaping that's very pretty but not overdone. There are essentially two large pool sections - one right next to an outdoor bar/lunch restaurant and the (annoying) music that comes with it, and another further away that's much quieter. The pools are very nice, with plentiful chairs bordering it. The exterior of the hotel was attractive as well - it looks like the upscale resort you're paying for. By far, the reason to come here is the beach, which, compared to the beaches we've been to in San Juan, is the nicest we've seen in Puerto Rico. As it's 45 minutes from San Juan, the hotel is in a relatively secluded area and its beach stretches for a mile or so - and it's beautiful. Puerto Rican beaches aren't white sand, but the water is beautiful, there are plenty of chairs, and it's deep enough that you can easily find a spot without people right on top of you. Great, great beach (complete with wait service, should you want it). Finally, there are a number of bars to choose from located in different parts of the resort - plenty of different places to sit an enjoy a drink or cigar. THE BAD: The hotel is something of a trek from the airport: 35 min - 1 hour, depending on traffic - which could be longer if you're taking one of the shuttles included in your package. We chose instead to take a taxi for the speed of it, and that costs roughly $65 each way with tip. (If you do this, make sure you ask your travel professional to take out the airport transfers from your package - which cost extra $$.) The road there looks more like you're on the outskirts of Miami than somewhere Caribbean. The service is hit or miss. It ranged from very friendly and accommodating to "I'm annoyed that you're asking this of me". Overall, more good service than bad, though. Finally, once you're there, it's likely you're staying there. Other than being adjacent to El Yunque (the rainforest), there isn't anything worth seeing or doing in the immediate area. Other restaurants are a cab ride away minimum, and there aren't many options. THE UGLY: As you've no doubt read by now, the restaurants do leave something to be desired. Don't get me wrong - none of the food is inedible or scary, and some of it is pretty good stuff. But more often than not, it's completely generic and expectedly very pricey. Worst of all, none of the seafood at the resort is locally caught - all of it is flown in, we learned, and therefore more expensive and not as fresh as you'd like. There are a number of restaurants to choose from - which is nice - and they're located all around the sprawling resort (some of which you'll access by a trolley). But the biggest disappointment was Palio - their "destination" Italian restaurant. The room itself is really fun and attractive, but it pretty much ends there. The tomatoes in my wife's $16 pomodoro were incredibly mealy - to the point where we actually sent it back. We ordered room service one night (from their full service Marbella restaurant) and the hamburger was of surprisingly poor quality. The lunch menu is pretty spartan, with no good salads and sandwiches that were so-so at best. We did enjoy Ajili Mojili - a Puerto Rican restaurant that is an outpost of the original in San Juan. We've eaten at the original, which is better than this watered down version, but it was still the best and most interesting meal we had while there. There is also a Tex-Mex and an Asian restaurant there, but we didn't try either. The $20 lo mein wasn't calling us. A hint: either load up on their adequate buffet breakfast ($18) in the Marbella restaurant and skip the marginal lunch options, or hit the David's Cookies adjacent to the casino, which has hot breakfast sandwiches, yogurts, muffins, coffee, etc. for a lot less. If we'd stayed longer than three nights, the restaurants would have been more of a problem. OVERALL: Due to the lack of interesting food at the resort and the inaccessibility of other places, a seven night stay can get a little long. But the good in this resort outweighs the bad, in our opinion, and if you're looking for a very nice resort with a great beach in Puerto Rico, you'll be hard pressed to find a nicer spot than the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: biora
Reviews.Content: I very nice property. Don't be alarmed by - reviews. Service can be a bit slow if your from a USA city area but in PR this is the way. No need to rush your on vacation. Rooms are fine but not as nice as most Westin hotels in USA. The staff is very friendly my cousin has lived in Westin Rio Mar 3 months out of the year for the last 6 years & he is from NYC & happy with things. Rent a car from airport or at Avis in hotel. Food is not great so leave off to a place like Brass Cactus down Rt 3. Not perfect but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, ultra expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long stay at the Westin Rio Mar Beach Resort in Puerto Rico. I had stayed at other Westin properties and was pleased in the past. The rooms are nice and roomy, but once you step out of the nice room -- watch out and be sure to bring your credit card. Everything from breakfast to lunch to dinner is sky-high in price. All meals are ridiculous. Lunch by the pool for my husband and I with two kids under seven was $50. a day. Dinner was outrageous. At the oriental-style restaurant a bowl of lo mein noodles was $20 per bowl, per child. My impression was that most people there on business don't fret about expensing such meals, but for a family, you feel the impact, and it adds up. The service at the hotel is nice. People are friendly, and helpful. Sometimes they speak Spanish in front of you and you're not sure if they are mocking your questions or being rude. Overall, the pool is beautiful, the beach is clean and the staff is courteous. My only gripe is price, price, price. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Convention Hotel, Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All in one hotel for golfers, couples with name tags on company trips, and busy pool scene. Beach is very long and becomes private at the edges of the resort. Don't valet your car, it's a pain waiting for it and tipping all the time. The garage is $10 per day and fine. The River Course is tricky. The Ocean Course is boring compared to famous ocean side courses. It's a 50 minute drive from the airport and an hour from San Juan, not a pretty drive. Food was pretty good, nothing great. Staff was very friendly and they attend to your room three times a day. Very clean hotel. A mountain view room overlooking the roof at $345 was a disappointing view. Oceanfront is nice but pricey as well. Breakfast and lunch without alcohol is $20 apiece and twice that for dinner. Casino is small but functional. We became bored with the complex after a few days and there is nothing to do that isn't at least 1/2 hour away. If we ever go back to PR, we'll try the Carribean side (Horned Dorsett in Rincon sounds great). Overall, the Westin is an above average hotel, great for a corporate outing, but not a preferred getaway for these snowbirds.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you've got money to blow”
Reviews.Author: bobgrover79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (2/9-2/12, 2005) only because we were attending a conference. The hotel, grounds, pool, beach, etc. is beautiful, but not worth the price. We paid $250 a night which was the conference rate but that was before all the fees. A 22% resort fee, a $15 bellman fee, a $2 per day housekeeping fee, a $10 self parking fee. For 3 nights we spent over $1,000. We arrived at 11:00pm and after confirming our reservation earlier in the day, we didn't have a room assigned. It took 10 minutes all while we received much appology. We had requested a king bed but none was available. They said they were going to upgrade us to ocean view but it never happened. They were great at appologizing and promising, but not coming through. Several others in our conference had problems as well. The Westin needs to work on this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay at the Westin Rio Mar, Jan. 31st thru Feb. 5th. Having read past reviews we were a little bit wary, but I must say on the whole we were pleasantly surprised. We rented a car at the airport and drove to the hotel. It is about a 45 minute drive through alot of traffic but coming from New York we are used to it. Check-in was fine and were upgraded to an ocean view room, though, the view was partially obstructed by palm trees. The room was large enough, and the bathroom was fine. The pool area was quite large and there were plenty of chairs. The beach area is vast. We walked a few hundred feet down the beach every day and we had that part of the beach to ourselves. The fitness room is small but well equipped, and most of the other facilites are fine, The restaurants are very pricey. We only ate a few meals at the hotel. If You have a car there are a number of restaurants in the area you can drive to. We found the staff at the concierge desk to be very helpful with dining recommendations. Just down the road from the hotel we ate a charming little restaurant named Antojitos Puertorriquenos. We had a red snapper dinner there for $10, and it was quite good. We would definitely return to the Rio Mar but would recommend, that you rent a car so you could sample the restaurants in the area, and take advantage of the hotel's proximity to the Rain Forest.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Westin Rio Mar. I'll start with the best part of the hotel - Cactus Jack's Restaurant. The staff was VERY friendly and accomadating and the food was EXCELLENT (escpeciially the ribs and quesadillas). The service at the Tiki Bar was fast and friendly - the food was ok. The hotel was very crowded with conventions and conferences. I think that for a company meeting or for a family trip this is an ok hotel. There were lots of kids and plenty of activities. I would not recommend this hotel for couples. Now for the BAD - My boyfriend and I booked our room through American Express and our package included an upgraded room (based on availiability), free buffett breakfast for 2 each day and a $100 credit at the Spa. When we arrived the woman at the front desk told us our room had alreday been upgraded and we were pleased - however, when we got to our room we clearly had NOT been upgraded. We called down to the front desk and were told that a junior suite was not available for the first night, but we could switch to one to following day for the remainder of our stay. We were disappointed, but understanding since the hotel seemed to have a few different conventions/conferences going on. The next morning we checked in with the front desk and were told (quite nastily) that our new room was not available yet and to come back later. When we went back to the front desk again at 3pm we were then todl by another person that there were NO junior suites available. We were obviously upset and confused since we had been told by 2 different people that a junior suite was available. It wasn't the fact that an upgrade was not available that upset us, it was the manner in which we were treated and questioned in a way as if we made the whole thing up!!!! Also, when we received our bill on teh last day - we found that we were charged for breakfast every day and charged the $40 my boyfriend spent at the spa for a haircut - So, check your bill VERY carefully when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Would Find a New Hotel Next Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a week at the Westin Rio Mar. I will start with the positives: -The staff was very friendly, (even if they had no idea what they were talking about) - The beach and pool area were very nice, and you can take long walks on the beach if you are willing to leave the hotel area -The golf course was well maintained and the clubhouse is quite nice - The ice cream at David's was really good It goes without saying that resorts overcharge for food, drinks and services so I'm not basing my negative comments on pricing. The negatives: -The hotel restaurants were very average. The fish at Shimas (Japanese) was extremely fishy and therefore (most likely) not fresh. Coqui (Pool bar) uses fake crab in their lobster sandwich. etc. Palio, The Grille and Cactus Jack's were all fine but not memorable. Unfortunately, the local restaurants left a lot to be desired. We rented a car and made the one hour trip to San Juan for good food. The Parrot and Pamela's in San Juan were truly wonderful! -The rooms seemed dirty. The tile floors needed to be washed. The bathrooms were certainly not on the same "heavenly" level as the Westin in Boston or Chicago. -My husband mistakenly left several poker chips in the room one morning. When we returned a few hours later they were gone. We did not make a big deal out of this but reported it to security for their records. They launched into an initial CSI investigation mode, but we never heard from them again. Use the safe. -The Concierge desk was friendly but full of misinformation. They do not have a clue about where to dine outside of the resort. Their literature claims that the rainforest is 10-19 miles away. It is 2 miles away. They told us that a cab to the airport would cost $70 + $15 per person. It cost $60. Again, not a big deal, but doing your own research is worth the time. - The hotel had 2 conventions going on at all times, which adds an institutional feel to your experience. When we arrived the first night, the bar overlooking the ocean was closed for a private party, and the afternoon we left, the pool area closed at 2 PM for another private party. For a big, convention type hotel, the experience was perfectly fine. If we choose to return to Puerto Rico, we would stay in a smaller hotel with a nice beach, closer to San Juan. Does anyone know of one? OR, go to Culebra.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: cks44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend and we really enjoyed it. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff was excellent. The golf course was very pretty, as was the beach. However, as many other people have said, the food was TERRIBLE!! The only meals that we somewhat enjoyed were the ones we ordered from room service. I definitely wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone looking for a great dining experience, but it is a nice hotel with good service and we enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, overpriced, poor service. Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had booked for 4 nights but were glad to get away after 3. The price of everything was high and the service was poor. We had a Caribbean suite right in front of an outside portico/bar with loud music and a very noisy group that stayed noisy late into the evening. When I explained to the desk agent that I'd like to arrange for another room the following night, she angrily told me "this is a resort, all of our rooms are noisy". Friends in our group had a junior suite near the casino and got little sleep at all until they down-graded to a standard hotel room. The food in the restaurants was poor, the service surly, and the prices high ($100 total for overcooked/oversalted pasta and a bottle of very average wine). My advice to groups who might be planning to book a meeting there--->go to Jamaica instead!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkBoysmom
Reviews.Content: As many others, I was very hesitant to book the Westin Rio Mar. We arrived on a Sunday evening (the Sunday before Thanksgiving) and check-in was a breeze. We received a warm and friendly greeting. The children were given Kids Club hats and cups. We fully utilized the resort, from the game room to the casino. The rooms were kept extremely clean and neat. Housekeeping was very responsive to any requests. The pool area was always clean and pool service was prompt. The buffet breakfast was more than sufficient for a morning breakfast. Hotel staff was always friendly. The ONLY negative about this hotel was the beach area which was unkept. Being from Long Island, we are used to lovely beaches. The Rio Mar beach was often full of used cups, straws etc...The hotel should pay more attention to the beach area. This did not impact our vacation significantly as our children only wanted to swim in the pool. A child friendly resort.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a wonderful weekend celebrating my in-laws 50th wedding anniversary. After reading some rather terrible reviews I was a bit afraid of what we would find. Rest assured, it is a terrific resort with lovely people, delicious food and a most beautiful grounds. We loved Palio and the sushi place especially. Every restaurant made a fuss over the in-laws with either a special dessert or serinade. The grounds are immaculate. The staff was very attentive (although there is a bit of a language problem in some places). We have been to many many resorts and consider ourselves pretty picky. We would return to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “They need help”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Why do we bother with the transfers? We sat on the bus for 45 minutes waiting for other flights to arrive. There is no saving when taking transfer options. I'll take a cab next time and avoid the extra wait time and crowding. Changed rooms twice, didn't care for the garage view. The rooms definitely need an overhaul, especially the bathrooms. I'm all for conservation (leave the card on the bed, if you would like your sheets changed) OK, I don't change my sheets at home everyday. By day three I was ready (air conditioning was not great). Left card on bed for the next few nights. Maybe someone should explain the card to maid service. Restaurant Reviews: Palio - Italian wannabe (but at least the service was good) They really enjoy making special coffees. Shima - Asian fare - food was good, probably our favorite at the resort Marbella - never tried it for dinner since we had breakfast there once Cactus Jack - Tex Mex - just ok Club Coqui - for lunch was fine, they should be commended for having the best wait staff Ajili Mojili - cute place but the food was terrible The Grille - Steak and seafood - over priced but that's what you expect on vacation. Food was ok, but service was impossible. Service was also limited in the pool area and at the one and only lounge. The waiters and waitresses were clearly visible, but i'm not sure what they were doing. The casino was typical for a caribbean resort. Could be a great place because the hotel is beautiful. Maybe new chefs and restaurant managers?

Reviews.Title: “Good for Groups”
Reviews.Author: brevets
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Westin Rio Mar with my girlfriend. Overall, despite cloudy / rainy weather, we had an ok time, but I doubt we'll go back. Here are my observed pros and cons: Pros: -Beautifully maintained grounds and facilities -Golf - Ocean Course (nice course, but only 1 hole is on ocean) -Comfortable beds -Big bathrooms -Nice beach (for Northern PR standards) -Grille Room (Steakhouse) and Shimas (Asian / Sushi) Cons: -Marginal service -Remote (45+ minutes from San Juan) -Marbella, and Aijili Mojili restaurants (Poor food) -No outdoor dining options after 4:00 (not even bar food!) -Casino is small (only 1 blackjack table was open on most nights) -Golf - River Course (hopelessly muddy and unplayable while I was there) -Golf - Cost (Even Ocean course isn't worth $165 a round) -Lots of conference groups It seems this place is really focused on conferences, and not the individual traveler. Seems like a good option for families as well. Unless you want to golf several times, I would recommend couples or singles stay at one of the Isla Verde hotels instead (Ritz, El San Juan, Intercontinental).

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Rio Mar on Nov. 26 -28, 2004 prior to taking a cruise out of San Juan. The resort is okay, but definitely not worth the $300/night price tag. We took the shuttle from the airport, which was wonderful. Check-in went very smooth and the person at the check-in counter was very helpful. We were stuck eating at the resort restaurants since we did not have a car. The only good meal that we had was our dinner at Palio. While it is very expensive, we found the meal to be excellent. For the remainder of the meals, we ate at Marbella. The service was awful, and the food was even worse. On the day of checkout, we went in there to see if we could get lunch, and were rudely informed that they were closed. We ended up getting a salad and hot dog from the beach cabana restaurant. The room was okay - the view was blocked by palm trees. Despite the fact that we requested a King bed, we were given two double beds. We were informed at check-in that no King beds were available. Furthermore, we did not find the beds to be so "heavenly." If you are a couple looking for a romantic getaway, this is not the place to come as it was overrun with kids. On the positive side, the resort is gorgeous, but in the middle of nowhere. The beach is okay - I'm not used to dirt beaches. It was an okay place for a couple of days before our cruise, but we would never return to this resort or Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: scatsm
Reviews.Content: We spent a week from December 19 to 26 at the Westin and all in all were quite pleased with the hotel. Yes, the food is overpriced and lousy and there is nowhere to go but the resort to eat. However, the beach is lovely and the rooms are adequte and the staff is pleasant and the casino is fun. The resort is easy to get to and everyone in our group of 8 enjoyed the week. Everything that people have written negatively is true. But the positive things are true as well. The iguanas are great and the grounds are nice. Would we return? Heck no, but it was a fine vacation nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRamani
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Rio Mar and here is the skinny on our experience. At this hotel the whole is less than the sum of its parts. But it is not a bad place to spend a week. The rooms: Standard, smallish, nothing special - and if you want a fridge it will cost you $65 a week (mini bar in the room though). The staff: By and large we found the STAFF to be warm, helpful, and welcoming - particular kudos to Shelly Ann and Erich who are part of the pool staff/kids activities groups. Wait staff, particularly at breakfast was warm and welcoming. Security: I had $200 taken from my wallet in my room on our first night there - the safe was not working and we had not had time to get it fixed so there was no secure place to stash our valuables. I reported it to security and management, and response was very slow. After 3 days we found out that they refunded me the $200 to my room account, but the only reason we figured it out was because we were scrolling through our room account on the TV menu - otherwise they would have never informed us of this. New computerized safes were installed a few days before we left so that may address this problem. Management: See my comment under security! Food: Ok but not great and very expensive. Our best meal was had at Cactus Jacks which is on the property. If you can get a deal with the breakfast buffet included - do it. We would gorge at breakfast and then only need to purchase dinner. Spa: Really quite beautiful and brand new. The therapists and aestheticians were excellent. however, the reception staff is woefully uninformed about the services, and could never answer my questions about services. Also - some of the services listed in the brochure are not available. Pool: Excellent and big - really nice water slide too. Lots of fun watching iguanas around the pool area, and the kiddie pool is great for kids -(between 130 and 230 they have organized games there). There is also a "quiet" adult pool - nice for those who don't want kids. The spa tub was not working properly on some days - but when it was - it was nice and large! Ocean is a few steps away , but a little choppy for small children. Casino: Small - less than desirable blackjack rules (can only double 8,9,10,11), dealer does not check for blackjack first so you may play out a hand and waste doubles and splits. Other fun stuff here - iguana feeding at 11, rainforest a few minutes away, bioluminescent bay near by (consider booking excursions on your own - very expensive when done through hotel), consider Old San Juan day trip - try and do it on a weekend as traffic stinks on weekdays. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, full-service resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed six nights over the Thanksgiving weekend, with the hotel occupancy 98% on some nights, we liked the view from our upgraded top floor (7th) corner room. All rooms have balconies, those on the 7th floor are recently redecorated. Rooms on South/West side face extensive resort grounds, with the rainforest mountains in the background. Only from the top floor, however, the ocean view is unobstructed. Mostly, the view is partial ocean and swimming pools. Although that is pleasant, it does not stand up to the "oceanfront" description. One can hardly see any ocean through the palm trees from lower floors. We were first upgraded to a 5th floor Ocean Suite that was not impressive - fairly dark, and not much of the view from the balcony. The hotel is big - over 700 rooms, but we had no problem finding empty beach chairs, enjoying the sea. Staff are really friendly, helpful, willing to listen and help. Room service was offered twice daily, parking rate was 10$, and 50$ return airport shuttle was available too. Food was expensive for Puerto Rico, but not for an isolated, major hotel chain resort. For better value, try a popular Mexican restaurant Lolita - 5 miles towards Fajardo right on Highway 3. The resort seemed ideal for families with children. There were always lifeguards at the beach and pools. For the romantic experience a private dinner is offered on the beach; we saw a table one night with candles among the palm trees on our way to the garage.... For a honemoon, that seems like a good option. San Juan should not be missed, however, and the hotel is not convenient for the city. It is at least 45 minutes drive on a road that gets jammed occasionally. Hotel also offers day trips at somewhat inflated prices. Free breakfast for Platinum Starwood guests with drinks and appetizers in the evening is a nice perk. The gym is free for all and is modern, has elipticals, treadmills, free weights, and around 8 weight machines. Hotel grounds are ideal for jogging and perhaps a bike ride. Overall, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return”
Reviews.Author: cderomedi
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th trip to Puerto Rico--our 2nd stay at the Westin. Our first stay about 5 years ago was excellent--room upgrade, etc. This trip (and now we are Gold level Starwood card holders) was terrible. When booking we told our travel agent we did not want a mountain view room--so she booked us a resort view which would be pool/partial ocean view with a king bed. When we arrived we were assigned a mountain view room with two beds. We very nicely contacted the front desk, and they tried to explain that this was the resort view room even though the view was of the mountains!! They, however, did move us to a different room with a king bed still overlooking the mountains and also the roof of the parking garage. We stayed there one night. The entire night there was a whistling sound that went on and off all day and night. We explained our situation and after standing at the desk for 2 hours were moved to a room with a view of a service road and again two beds. Being a Starwood Gold Level member meant nothing to anyone at the hotel. We spent the remaining days in this room with no wash cloths most of the days--no coffee all days--had to call down for a hair dryer, etc. We usually satisfy very easily, but this resort only cares for large groups coming in for conferences, etc. We will never return to this property again. Any good features of the resort, and there are good features, are not worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Easy stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: ELK45
Reviews.Content: We just got back from five nights at the Westin Rio Mar. We were a group of 3 couples with 6 kids. Ranging in age from 10 months to 10 years. It is a great and easy environment with kids. They could enjoy the pool with slide, the waves in the ocean and the jacuzzi. It felt very safe and the staff was helpful. For lunch there was all kid friendly meals served in boxes that cost only 6 dollars. The room was comfortable and the proximity of the hotel to the rain forest made for a fun day. This is not a 5 star destination for honey mooners.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Smart_Traveler_333
Reviews.Content: We got back from Puerto Rico earlier this week. We had a great time there. It was nice and sunny and warm. Our resort was quite nice too. Itâ€™s a huge property with the sea on one side and the view of the rainforest on the other. Our room faced there. Nice sized room with a balcony where we used to have breakfast and lunch sometimes. The property is very well maintened. Check in was long and also found that the reception staff were not that great. The concierge (Maria) and Palio restaurant manager (Juan) were excellent. We had a nice outdoor dinner @ Coqui the 1st night at the lounge. It was set by the pool and had live music - good food but slightly overpriced. I also have to note that the staff is always happy to modify dishes on the menu at all the restaurants as I did at a lot of them. Next day we went to San Juan and just roamed around the city. We came back and relaxed by the sea and went for a long walk on the beach. At night we had dinner at the Mexican restaurant which was good too. On Friday it rained so we went to the pool and beach in the evening and just relaxed. The pool was a free form pool and they had 2 of them. One with a slide and the other with a waterfall. Both had cabanas around them and the sea was right next door. The hotel had good arrangements for the pool and all the restaurants. We had a great Asian dinner that night at Shimas. Next day we went back to San Juan to see the outlets for shopping. They were ok but I got to take some great pictures while my wife was shopping. That night after some boogie boarding in the sea, my wife had organized a drink at the lounge and dinner at the 4 diamond Italian restaurant. After the drink the manager took us for a walk and we were shown to our table on the beach under palm trees with a full moon.
