The setting was perfect â€“ a cool breeze, private waiter, full moon reflecting on the sea, candlelight and tiki torches and no one else in sight. I'm not sure what my wife paid for it as it was part of my 5 year anniversary gift, but it was worth every penny and if you do this - ask for Vladimar as your waiter. We had a great 4 course meal for 3.5 hours with an accordion player during dessert! It was fantastic. The following day we drove through the rainforest and had a pizza for lunch which was quite good. I had read about this place in some other review and it didnt dissapoint. We had a great relaxed resort vacation with plenty of pool and sea times! We almost missed our flight on the way back as we got late with returning the rental car and lunch. BTW dont rent from thrifty there they are awfully slow and have terrible cars, our was all smashed up and old Thatâ€™s our Puerto Rico update!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect long weekend vacation hotel. It has the heavenly beds. My husband and I have been visiting every year for the past five years. We stayed here for our honeymoon and we fell in love with this property. I could go on and on. But the best thing about this hotel is that it has the calm ocean and the pool just steps from each other. The Ritz is fabo but the ocean is not as beautiful. The Wyndham Conquistador is fine but does not have an ocean that you can walk to, you have to take the ferry to their "private island". No Thanks. We like the Westin-everything about it. The pools, casino, restaurants, and the rooms. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a long weekend at the Rio Mar and we had a great time. We are not seasoned travelers and were apprehensive as to the logistics of the trip but we were immediately put at ease. When we arrived at the airport, we were greeted by a representative from the hotel's transportation service who directed us to the shuttle van. In fact the Rio Mar is the only hotel on the island with its own transporation service. The driver was friendly, informative and avoided the traffic jam on the highway. Our check in was quick and our room was located on the main floor (3rd) which was very convenient to the restaurants, pools and spa. The guest room was very clean and the beds were "heavenly". Every room has a balcony which was wonderful as in the evening it was nice to sit and listen to the sea and feel the warm tropical breeze. We found that the pool and beaches were not crowded and very clean. The restaurants were enjoyable. From Club Coqui to Aliji Mojili, the food and service was excellent. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet with the wide variety of food including omelets and the daily specials. The food was priced on the high end but it was expected. The resorts has tours available to the rainforest and many other activities which are arranged at the conceirge's desk. We took the catamaran/snorking and we had a wonderful trip. All in all we had a memorable stay at the Rio Mar and would not hestitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service was hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice resort, overpriced food. Some of the grub was excellent some of the grub I wouldn't give to my dog. Some of the resort staff were very helpful some of the staff were useless. The first day we were there, it took three phone calls to get maid service. They finally came at 7pm. If I had to go back to PR, I would stay here again. But, hopefully, I won't ever have to go back to PR.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin saved our weekend!”
Reviews.Author: O0gierules
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a short stay at the Westin. Had always wanted to go here but through several mishaps ended up here. Original plans were to take us to the El San Juan. As fate would have it TS Jeanne hit the island several days before our arrival. Upon calling the ESJ hotel, I was told everyting was operational. Arrived at 9 PM on Sept. 17th to find no power!!! Nothing like the tropics with no AC, shower, etc., etc.,. The Westin gave us a rate of $139/nite and we quickly moved there. The facility is breathtaking. The pool is quite large, plenty of room for all. The drinks we thought were fair-priced for a resort and so was the food. We had the lobster wrap at Club Coqui. It was ONLY $16 and was loaded with lobster. Also ate at Ajili Mojili and Shimas. Both excellent. We found the staff to be courteous and more than willing to be helpful. They allowed me to use the Concierge's computer (business center was closed) at NO CHARGE! This might seem trivial, but no where else have I been where a computer charge was waived. The ride to the hotel is about 40 min. from SJU, but well worth the trip. Roundtrip transportation is offerd by the hotel so it is a stress free transition. We are now awaiting the package prices for 2005. We can't wait for our return.

Reviews.Title: “A few minor issues, but overall not too bad”
Reviews.Author: gafaith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually stayed four nights in mid-July for a getaway trip. We did not know this fell on the Puerto Rican holiday "Independence Day", so needless to say the hotel was packed with locals. We got a decent deal from Travelocity. The bad: We could not find a chair at the pool the entire trip, but luckily there is a large beautiful beach that was not as crowded. Kids were everywhere (also in the hotel...running up and down the hallways every morning). They did run out of towels at the pool one day for an hour or so. Things are expensive, but it is going to be like that at any Westin. Maid svc completely forgot to supply clean room towels one day and we called for them and they never arrived. One popular restaurant on the property was closed for a few mths and the others close earlier each night than most hotels. The hotel shuttle svc to the airport only runs at specific times when 6+ book it, so our flight was at 3:30 and they said we would have to leave on the 11:00 shuttle. It ended up working it out, but after alot of stress. The Good: The service! The bartenders and waitstaff were wonderful. Everyone was extremely nice and welcoming. The bar in the hotel had bands/dancing nightly-the locals were very friendly and alot of fun. The restaurants were great and the rooms were clean. Casino was small, but you could always find a table. Close to the rainforest, which is a must! Rent a car!! All in all it was not a bad place. Would possibly return to this hotel, but it may not be for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better then the reviews I read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was scared after reading some of the reviews about staying here, but am glad I did not change to another hotel. The service in the restaurant does suck, and actually I think that the food pretty much does too...but I didnt come to puerto rico to eat resort food. There are a lot of good restaurants nearby. Cabs are expensive so rent a car. Ocean is awesome, pools are awesome, wasnt very busy no need to fight over beech chairs, or towels. we went through expedia and got a mountain view room for $100. I guess if I was paying $300 a night or so I would be a little upset. All in all its fun, clean and surrounded by great views, dont be scared by all the ------ reviews everyone who is not uptight should have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip before reading all of the reviews at this site. Thank goodness I did! I have to admit, I was very wary once reading the mixed reviews that this hotel has received over the years. Frequently, the reviews alternate radically from one to the next. I very nearly called to cancel the trip and stay somewhere else. I am so incredibly happy that I didn't. Upon arrival at the airport, we were greeted by a Westin representative and once our bags were procured, we were taken to their air-conditioned bus and offered bottles of cold water. After waiting for a few minutes for some more guests to arrive, we made the 40-minute trip to the hotel. The place was gorgeous. First, I'll start with the hotel itself. The furnishings, and the general ambiance was great. Everything had a very tropical, elegant feeling to it. We waited for about five minutes on line to check in, and it went very smoothly. We, along with our bags (all of the luggage, except for the golf clubs which were immediately taken to the clubhouse), rode up in the elevator with a bellman who was incredibly nice and informative. Our room was great. It wasn't huge, wasn't incredibly luxurious -- but it was clean and comfortable (not to mention the infamous Heavenly Beds -- definitely worthy of their name). Our view was amazing. A straight view of the grounds and the ocean beyond. The balcony was adequate and had two comfortable chairs and a matching table. One of my traveling companions (the golfer) was interested in getting in a round before dinner, so he called the clubhouse. This is where we ran into a snag. They were having a tournament that day, and he was unable to get on the course -- either course. Here's a tip: If you are a golfer, when making your reservations, call the hotel to find out if there are any events at either of the courses during your stay (there are two -- the river course, and the ocean course). Since neither of the golf courses are owned by the hotel (they have a share in them that allows golfers from the Westin access), you have to make sure that there are no events scheduled. He went downstairs to speak with the manager. She was polite and apologized for the inconvenience, giving us two free lunches the next day. Should she have given him a free round of golf? Yeah, she should have. But she didn't. Hence the four-star rating rather than a five. Once getting over that hurdle, we went downstairs to a restaurant called Marbella. Marbella is the casual dining, everyday place. It's pricey, yes. But you have to expect that when going away. If you go to a resort thinking that you can be frugal, your naivete is going to get you into trouble. These places are expensive. The food was great, the service impeccable. If you do decide to go, ask to sit in Juan's area -- he's there for breakfast and lunch. The grounds were amazing. Meticulously cared for, and absolutely stunning. We're normally beach people, but we weren't big fans of the sand quality (it's a little muddy), so we spent most of our time under a cabana tent by the quiet pool. Here's another tip: Get down there early if you want one of the two available cabana tents. We're early risers, so it was great. There are umbrellas that you can sit under, but the tent was pretty awesome. A previous reviewer mentioned that the iguanas were like dogs, and they were right. It was pretty amazing to see these dinosaur like creatures waddle out from the surrounding greens and walk along the pool area. We even saw a few of them take a dip in the pool! They don't bother you -- much preferring to nibble at some of the grass than take a bite out of a tourist. They're so used to having people around that it almost seems that they stop to pose for pictures, of which many were taken. At the pool area, waiters and waitresses frequently stop by to ask if you want a drink, or some food from the Coqui bar (named for the famed Coqui frogs). They even carry laminated menus with them for those not familiar with the food selection. If you go during the summer, you have to realize that it is the off-season. This is when hotels do repairs. It's the price you pay for lowered rates and a less crowded atmosphere. We were a bit disappointed that the italian place, Palio, was closed. But we did go to the Asian restaurant, Shimas, and had some amazing food. We're generally casual diners, so we spent most of our nights at Marbella. They have buffets on several evenings, and did have a selection from Palio available. We got some amazing Italian food. If you go when it's open, I highly recommend it. Before I finish my rambling, I would like to say that we had a great time. We are definitely going back next year, and I highly recommend this resort. If you find that the service isn't to your liking, try to smile. Be extra friendly. I work in the customer service industry, and I'll tell ya -- a smile goes a really long way towards improved service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyFoot
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned last night from a week at the Westin Rio Mar (August 8 - 14). This resort is wonderful. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. It's a great place to go if you enjoy golfing. However, even if you aren't there to golf (like us) you will have a great time. There are two very nice pools with plenty of lounge chairs and towels to go around. Althought the pools officially close at 8:00, we made a habit of taking a dip after dinner each night, as did others. In addition to the pools, there is easy access to the beach which is in very good condition. The water was a little rough a few days while we were there (strong rip tides) but definitely swimable and enjoyable. We had absolutely no problems with service. In fact, it was great. We had a broken t.v. when we arrived and it was exchanged with a new one within 15 minutes. We had room service daily and it always arrived before the estimated time. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. Our room was "resort view" and we had a very nice view of the pool area and the ocean in the background. We ate at all of the restaurants except for Palio's (which was no opened) and Ajili Mohili. All of the food was very good. My favorite was the Asian/Sushi restaurant. We also enjoyed the Grille Room. The food, however, was very pricey at all of the food establishments. This is the only complaint that I've read on Trip Advisor that I agree with. My boyfriend and I decided to pay the extra money and do the All Inclusive meal plan. It was more money but it was well worth the extra cost. We both loved the resort and had a great vacation. If you go make sure you visit the RainForest and I highly recommend the snorkeling trip on the catamaran. We had a wonderful time. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start & End, OK Middle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four days and three nights at the Westin, having shortened our luxurious stay at El Convento in order to find more kid-friendly activities for our 2 year old. The beginning and ending were real problems because of the poor management and the quality of the facility; however, the middle of our stay was pleasant. All in all, we canâ€™t recommend the Westin unless you pay less than $150 a night and leave your expectations about quality management at home. Before our bellboy could bring our luggage fully into the room, my wife touched the AC controls and walked away toward our daughter. Behind her, a heavy steel venting door detached from the wall and came crashing down on her leg, narrowly missing our child and seriously bruising my wifeâ€™s leg in two places. The managementâ€™s immediate response? They moved us to a similar room but in a construction zone, offered her a doctor to see and left us an ice pack and bandage. That would have been the end of it from their standpoint if we hadnâ€™t called the manager, Cliff Hernandez, and asked him if the hotel had a policy of doing anything more for the guests they injured. Cliff wanted to get back to us with a response. For days we waited. Upon check-out we called again only to learn that Cliff was out that day but left word to relieve our bill of two of the miserable and high-priced meals we were trapped into at two of the Westinâ€™s three restaurants. We read the note he left on the screen for the subordinate: â€œGive them two free meals and, if necessary, something else.â€� The subordinate quickly closed the screen and she deemed nothing else necessary. We could wait to see someone else, she said, but weâ€™d already enjoyed enough insult for one injury. Big deal? For the money and the supposed 4-star Westin fanfare, yes. (Youâ€™re bombarded with Westin commercials for their world-reknowned greatness.) The beach is long and lovely. The pools are what youâ€™d expect. The casino is small and ordinary. The food is below average andâ€”as youâ€™d expect in an isolated resort where price-gauging is possibleâ€”very expensive (e.g., $25 entrees at the mid-priced restaurant). The service is generally spotty and occasionally rough. The front desk workers are slow and few. The single beach bar closes at 5. Lifeguards come on and off at odd times, literally raising red flags to cover their absences. The fitness center and spa wereâ€”again like so many places that just have to say they offer them nowâ€”remote, unappealing or being renovated. And for such a huge, self-contained location, there is almost no music, no festivity, no dancing and no soul. The issue usually comes down to the price of these look-alike vacations and the caliber of the management, particularly when something goes wrong. The Westin had no policy, no answer, inadequate courtesy and, ultimately, no class. We were simply put off, which is not what we paid a small fortune for. You can do better at Fajardo not much farther away with the same amenities or seek the same rates closer to the city at more reputable chains such as The Ritz or The Wyndham hotels.

Reviews.Title: “a nice end to our trip”
Reviews.Author: mcguillicudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last 5 nights of our 2 week vacation in PR. We were a little leary of a big resort as we stayed in small places all of this trip and on our previous trip, but we were VERY impressed. Upon check-in, we asked if there was any way to get an upgrade and were given an upgrade to a "pool view" room, which, to our suprise was actually also a beach view. We were travelling with 2 small children, but that was no problem, as this resort was full of families with children and was very family friendly. We requested a crib for our 3 month old and it was brought to our room very promptly. The pool was great- our son fell in love with the pool slide and exhausted us daily by going down it multiple times. One very nice thing is you have the option to go to either the pool or the beach- they are right by each other. The other thing that is very cool about this place is the local iguana population. They are like dogs. You will be sitting reading a book by the pool and next thing you know, an iguana is hanging out by you. They are quite large and are unfazed by people. They have an iguana feeding at 1100 several times per week, so make sure to catch it, especially if traveling with children. One thing to watch out for is that the food is VERY expensive. Our family (2 adults and our toddler) plus a friend of ours ate a very bland mexican food dinner- not very big at all and the bill came to $100. This was entrees (no seafood- taco salads) for all and one beer each for the adults. Ouch!!!!! There is plenty of good local food right outside the gate. Our favorite was a pizza place- we can't remember the name, but it was just off the main highway, on the right hand side as you turn on the street to the resort- there is a candy shop right next to it. The bonus is that they deliver to the resort. We still crave this pizza!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A BIG Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: "4-Star Resort with Zero Star Service" says it all. We stayed at the Rio Mar from 8/1 to 8/4 and experienced many of the same frustrations mentioned in previous reviews. The facility and the grounds are absolutely beautiful -- no denying that. For the prices they charge, one would expect top-notch service as well, but they simply do not deliver and leave you with the distinct impression that they could care less. We reserved and paid for ocean-view rooms. Although the rooms faced the ocean, it was barely visible through the large palm trees in front of our balcony. We had reserved 2 rooms, but one of them was not ready yet since we had arrived prior to the 3:00 p.m. check-in time. We were told that we could get into one of the rooms to relax and store our luggage and they would bring up the keys to the second room when it was finished. Finally, about 3:30 p.m. we returned to the front desk to retrieve the keys to our other room. We also had no key to the safe in our room. We contacted the front desk. Four hours later, still no key. We visited the front desk again who called security. Security said they were never called about the problem the first time. The desk attendant said that if they didn't deliver a key to our room within 20 minutes or so that we should try contacting security OURSELVES. There must have been a shortage of washcloths because houskeeping would pick up the dirty ones, but not replace them with clean ones. I called housekeeping and requested 2 washcloths, but the next day following service to our room, no more washcloths! We ate breakfast at Marbella twice and both times had to catch the waiter's attention to please bring us the check. Once he brought our coffee and juice, we were totally ignored -- no follow-up whatsoever to see if everything was okay or if we needed anything else. Upon leaving the restaurant and passing by the hostess stand I am accustomed to a "Thank you! Have a nice day!" or other acknowledgement of our patronage. Not here. One of my kids had a newly-opened bag of Starbursts candy laying on the desk and upon returning from dinner found it nearly empty. (Housekeeping had apparently helped themselves during their evening visit.) Parasailing was unavailable because the boat was broken and they didn't know when it would be fixed. Three of the four waverunners were also out of commission. No apologies from any of the watersports staff. We have stayed at various other Starwood properties and have always been impressed with how well we were treated. The Westin Rio Mar is a bad apple in need of some serious upgrades in their hospitality and customer service. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Resort with Zero Star Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Rio Mar is a 4 Star Resort with Zero Star service. The Hotel itself was beautiful but the majority of the staff was extremely rude. The valets, the woman that checked us in and the servers at the Mirabella restaurant were the only pleasant people we found. We had a smooth check-in but from that point it was downhill full speed. We checked in at the "Starwood Preferred Guest" counter. Which was pleasant. Once we got to our room the trouble began. We had to call down to house keeping to change our feather pillows to foam pillows (even though we requested that ahead of time due to allergies) and waited for about 1/2 hour for them to come. Then we only had 4 hangers in our closet, so we called house keeping, who brought up flimsy wire hangers...We were almost finished unpacking when I realized that the safe was missing it's key. So my husband made another call to have that taken care of. We were told they would be up within an hour to replace the lock. So instead of waiting in the room, we headed to the pool with our valuables and cash. After finishing at the pool, we headed to the concierge and proceeded to wait on line for 15 minutes as there was only ONE. After asking for suggestions for local restaurants we were given a binder (the only binder) of menus for the hotel's restaurants and were brushed aside before we were finished. After 2 1/2 hours we returned to our room to discover that the safe was not fixed. My husband called down to the desk again...no answer.....called a second time....no answer. So we went downstairs and stood at the "Starwood Preferred Guest" counter to be helped. There were a few people waiting on the "regular line" and they were being helped, which is fine with me, I didn't mind that. But once the people that arrived after we did started to be helped before us we got upset. I'm not really sure what the "Starwood Preferred Guest" gets, but I intend to cut up my card and mail it back to The Westin since it seems to be useless. My husband then left me on that line to get on the "regular line" and was finally helped. All the while the counter people saw me standing there waiting. We stated that our safe was still not fixed and our other issues. They basically shrugged their shoulders at us and offered to let us keep our things in their safe. I'm sorry, but at this point there was no way I would trust them with anything. We asked to speak to the manager and she was down right nasty. My husband politely asked if they could do something for us for our inconveniences. With disgust she said she could give us breakfast the next day. My husband then politely asked if they could do something for us for dinner since by this time it was 7:30pm and we still had no idea where to eat since the one and only concierge was no help. She very rudely replied "I said I can give you breakfast". We are very tolerant people, but that was the last straw. When we returned to our room my husband called the Westin headquarters to speak to someone about our issues, which after only being there a few hours were many. After he got off the phone the hotel manager called and rudely told us we would be getting 2500 Starwood points, then she hung up. Apparently she was not happy that we called The Westin customer service to complain. I decided to take a shower to relax and there were 2 towels, no wash cloths and no soap...yet another call to house keeping. The bartenders at the pool bar were nasty as well. If you order a drink and you get the wrong thing...watch out if you question it....they'll take your drink back and walk away mumbling something in Spanish (lucky for us but un-lucky for the bartender my husband speaks Spanish and understood what he said...and it wasn't nice). The self parking lots were always full since non-hotel guests can park in the closer lot and hang out at the casino, beach and pool there while the paying guests have to walk a mile from their cars because all the spots in the garage are taken. This is after they charge you $10 a day to self park. The pool area was always crowded and the so called "Quiet Pool" was nothing of the sort. There were kids jumping around yelling and screaming, leaving food all over the ground, throwing balls and jumping off floats and not once did anyone from the hotel enforce the "quiet pool" rules. And be sure to get to the towel hut early, those run out fast. I could go on forever, but you get the idea. I went on TripAdvisor before the trip and saw alot of bad reviews but I thought 'it can't be that bad'! The next time I read multiple bad reviews I will take the advise. We gave the Westin the benefit of the doubt and am I ever sorry. I can without a doubt say this was the worst hotel experience we've ever had. After taking our own "survey" of other hotel guests during our stay, we found out that we were not the only ones who felt this way. We were told that someone from Westin Executive offices would be contacting us.....we're still waiting. Our advise.....STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “A one week stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: JBat_6
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-week stay at the Westin -- a family vacation. I had read all the reviews extensively, about this hotel before leaving. The flavor that you get from reading these reviews is accurate. The hotel grounds and beach are first class. The beach privacy is perhaps its best feature. The beach is well-maintained, groomed every morning, and there were adequate chairs and beach umbrellas. The pools were beautiful, and very nice. The rooms are just average--not fancy by any stretch of the imagination. They are well soundproofed. They served well the only function that we could request of them -- a place to sleep. We found the staff to be friendly and polite and attentive. I was continually amazed at the check-in line at the front desk, every day. They are truly long waits regarding check-in. The price of drinks is unfortunately and unnecessarily ridiculous -- a glass of wine costs $10 and beach drinks --8.50. We did like the breakfast buffet (did that twice) which is served in the main facility-- at a price of $18 for adult and nine dollars for children (once my 19 and 16 year olds were childern--the other time adults; go figure). What we did for most breakfasts however was to buy boxes of dry cereal, local fruit, plastic bowls, plastic spoons, and purchase a large glass of fresh milk at the snack bar every morning. Much cheaper. They do have a nice outdoor lunch facility near the end of the larger pool for very nice sandwiches and french fries. Soft drink refills are free. The lunch menu items are about 10-12 dollars each, and splitting a sandwich provides ample portions. Cactus Jack's was only average, and expensive. The Grill was supposedly our fancy dinner for the vacation -- our last night. It was very stiff and formal. Entrees averaged about $40-- a total of $250 for four people and less than average quality. There is a nice shopping plaza in Fijardo--about a 15 minute drive further east from the Hotel, which has several choices for restaruants/dining/theaters at a much more affordable cost. I would definately rent a car from the airport (Hotwire), which we were able to get for 26$ a day. The additional $10 per day parking fee at the hotel is somewhat insulting, but seems to be standard these days. There is quite a great distance between parking and the hotel -- more than a five-minute walk. The hotel is directly across from the road that goes to the rain forest--which is free if you don't stop at the visitors center. We were able to drive into San Juan/Old San Juan without too much difficulty and is a definate must do-- it is approximately 30 minute drive. In Fijardo we were able to do a Bio Bay Kiak tour(you can bargin to get to a price of 25-30$ per person), and a separate cataraman snorkel excursion (Eastwind--59$ per person--lunch, drinks and gear provided--a 6 hour adventure). The concierge desk will give written directions about how to reach these places, and be sure that you get these directions. We found driving to be very confusing. The roads are narrow and often in poor condition. There is no such thing as a street sign anywhere, and we encountered difficulties in this respect on numerous occasions. The directions from the concierge desk will be very beneficial in that they are given in terms of stoplights and landmarks to allow you to get to your destination. Driving by yourself will save you substantial amounts of money in terms of the price that would cost if you arranged these functions through the hotel and their transportation. I have no regrets about this choice for lodging, and would stay there again. I would be happy to reply to questions/advice such as I am able to provide.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews are correct..this is a great resort, very beautiful, great golf, and a great pool & beach area. The food is excellent but, like other resorts, is expensive. We particularly enjoyed the Italian restaurant and the restaurant on the top floor of the golf shop. The service is inconsistent.. sometimes it was excellent and sometimes it was slow. If you mentally tell yourself before you go, as we did after reading other reviews, that the service may not be great, you won't be disappointed (as we weren't). Other than this inconsistent service, the place is OUTSTANDING and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the 7th floor facing the graden view. The room had an incredible view of the rainforest and the greenery. The beach is great, with good waves (even though it is more mucky then the incredible beaches of St Thomas). It not lit at night. Westin screwed up our airport pickup, but made up for it with free airport transfers both ways. The resort is truly breathtaking, and is worth a visit. I'd stay there again if I was in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and wonderfully maintained hotel in a great location. There was 9 of us. The hotel was able to put 3 rooms together with a great view of the rain forest. Rooms are clean and spacious with individual balconies. The staff was extremely friendly (other than the tikki bar staff), the housekeeping was exceptional and highly attentive and the concierge and front desk personnel were some of the best we've ever seen. The beach is very nice and we spent most of our time there. The golf courses are tight and fun to play. Complaints: -food is expensive. Quality is good, but be prepared to pay for it. -lack of organized sporting activities. The activity desk would list the activities for the day but it was up to us to follow-up or initiate. The only organized activity that we could take advantage of was water aerobics. I would recommend this hotel and we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Horrible service, especially at the hotel restaurants. This is a beautiful property which disappoints with its staff. As a Platinum guest, I expected courtesy at a minimum, and was met with brusque, rude service at the front desk and long, long waits at the restaurant, especially at Mirabella, where I was virtually ignored!! I for one will never stay at this resort again. Other Starwood properties have done much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip (7/10-14). Service was awesome - from check-in, to the restaurants, to concierge, housekeeping, security, and bell staff - everyone was attentive to our requests. We had dinner in 4 different restaurants, all were good - the Asian was our favorite. Had an oceanview room on the 7th floor, with a beautiful view of ocean, courtyard and pool. Since this time of year is considered low season, lounge chairs and towels (up to 4 per room) are available around the pool and on the beach - without having to stake out a spot at 8 AM. The beach was clean, the water was warm and there was always a cool breeze. As expected, resort was pricey. Drinks at approx. $6-8 each, depending on type. Soda at the Tiki Bar was 2.50 for a cup, you don't get the whole can. Bike rental was $8/person/hour. The overall experience was great, relaxing and stress-free. There isn't anything we would change about our experience. Can't wait to go back and listen to the Coqui frogs singing at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Great Beach and Pool, but..”
Reviews.Author: troyboy
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the Westin. The weather was awesome, so it made our stay much more pleasant than it really was. The resort itself is very scenic and beautiful (nestled between the beach and the rainforest), the architecture of the hotel, the landscaping, and the surrounding grounds...were always meticulious and clean! The beach is nice and if you get a upper level room facing the ocean, the vista is stunning. Now for the bad, we waited over an hour in line to check-in (and I am an SPG member!). The room was clean but a bit small compared to other Starwood properties we've stayed at. Be prepared on weekends (especially on Sundays!!) to share the resort with many of the locals who go there to use the facilities (i.e. beaches, pools etc). Seems the hotels allows the locals to use the facilities as long as they pay for parking and pool passes. FYI, The hotel is out of the way, so if you are looking for rest and relaxation by the beach or pool (as we were), this good hotel is a good choice. But, if you are looking for nite life, rent a car, or be prepared to pay alot for taxi service, because there is nothing near by. Also, the service at some of the restaurants, could use improvements. Seems as if many of the waiters (especially at Mirabella for dinner) weren't too concerned about your dining experience. Also, not all restaurants are open all week, so if you have a preference to a certain restaurant, make sure you check when it is open when you arrive! Overall, we did not find this property on level of other Starwood properties we have stayed at. But we did enjoy the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Price was right, but not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: mdcrim
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the price was right ($99 per night), so I can't complaint too much. A little about the hotel. It's 7 stories w/ the lobby on the 3rd floor. Very weird layout. We were originally given a 1st floor room and to get to the parking lot had to either go to the 3rd floor, pass through the lobby, pass the casino and arcade, then to an elevator back down to the 1st floor to the parking garage OR we would have to walk around the outside of the hotel. In regard to being a "4-star", there's just no way. Checked in as a member of Starwood Preferred. Requested possibility of an upgrade and was told it would be $50 per night. Was given a 1st floor room with the view of the top of a palm tree, literally-we might as well have had no window-we couldn't see anything. There was no hair dryer in the room which surprised me due to the humid climate. On day 3, finally decided it would be worth the extra $50 per night to have some sort of view. Went to the front desk, and was given an upgrade to a partial ocean view room for free-go figure. In the 2nd room, the safe did not have a locking mechanism, but the room DID have a hairdryer. The pools were nice. We actually had more r&r at the larger, kid-friendly pool. because the "quiet" pool was full of kids. The beach was great-good bodysurfing waves and barely crowded. But a warning about the beach. We found 2 jagged peices of broken bottles in the water, where the swimming beach was. Lucky for us we found them before we stepped on them. We also saw that someone else had put peices of broken bottles on a lounge chair by the beach-just assuming they had found them while swimming, too. So, watch your feet. The Tiki bar charges $8.50 for a little Pina Colada-to be expected at a resort, but wanted to warn you. Had a good time regardless of the irritations, but would not go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: toverstreet3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the WESTIN RIO MAR and I can say that we had a pleasurable visit. The hotel was very nice and the service was okay. When we firsty got there, our room weren't ready (ALONG WITH ABOUT 10 OTHERS) so we had to wait an hour and half after traveling for almost 12 hours to get there. We had a problem with our bathroom and after calling 4 times and dealing with a nasty house maid we were moved The food was GREAT but very expensive.There is not much to do on the resort expecially at night. It's best to rent a car and tour the island yourself. Cab fare is absolutely ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, the Westin Rio Mar Beach in Rio Grande, San Juan was just breath taking! The atmoshphere was outstanding. I just came back from Puerto Rico today 7/12/2004. The only misfortune was when they initially took my credit card they billed me for $500.00 rather then $200.00. Need to check you credit card statement carefully. I called customer service and they are looking into this urgent matter. I would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in P.R. and stay at least 5 times a year in different hotels of the island just for pleasure. Best hotel in the island; good beach, good pools, excellent rooms, excellent golf club, excellent restaurants, very good casino. Food is expensive but very good, try to get an offer with breakfast included($19.00 per person). Nobody beats Westin beds. If you want to party late in the night, its not the place for you, is better for a romantic getaway or to be with your family and kids. Needs to have a good nightclub. use to have one but was closed. Excellent for golf and tennis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Not for Cheapskates”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirlglobtrotting
Reviews.Content: The Rio Grand is a wonderful hotel. We had wonderful experiences with the staff. The hotel is in a remote location but it is ideal for rest and relaxation. The food at the hotel is not cheap but this is not the place for the budget traveler or the party animal. If you want to see Puerto Rico it is suggested that you rent a car, and expect traffic. It is truely a family resort so there are children everywhere, unlike other resorts they are not contained, so if you don't like looking at children this isn't the hotel for you. My only complaint is that for the hotel to be in such a remote location where guest are secluded they are in desterate need of a activity planner, so that there is always fun to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited the Westin on June 20 to 24th. Checked in quickly , found that we had a smoking room and had to change rooms. Placed us on the 6th floor overlooking the ocean. Excellent view. the pools were in good shape, the site was not too crowded as well. Some of the resturants were closed during our stay and some had dress codes. Cactus jacks was very good. Our buffet at Maribella was very good as well. the beach itself could use some clean up, but not too bad. the ocean was warm and many 2 to 3 foot waves. the casino is small, but has many of the slots and table games. golf was excellent, I was able to play by myself and really relax and take my time, no one else playing at 7:30am. prices go down after 2pm. All in all it was a very good trip, Just took the schuttle to eat and golf. no driving at all. I would go back again..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 7-day stay at the Westin Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Westin Rio Mar where we spent 7 wonderful days. The property is beautiful, located between the mountains of the Yunque rain forest and the sea. We had a large room on the ocean with an open view and the continuous soothing sound of the waves. The amenities are excellent and the service is first class. After reading some of the previous reviews, I was a little concerned but our personal impression was totally the opposite. The staff was always smiling and dedicated to offer the best service. Speaking Spanish may have helped a little but they are all bi-lingual and ready to assist you upon request. The food was excellent (I enjoyed a wonderful snapper one eveningâ€¦. cooked to perfection) even if a little expensive (but this is what you expect in a hotel of this category.) Definitely a place that I would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort; some complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Westin. The hotel itself, the beach and the grounds are superior, absolutely gorgeous and immaculate. The beach especially is extremely well-maintained. They have ample chairs, some are cushioned, both alongside the beautiful pools and on the beach itself. But for a high-priced resort we were disappointed with a few points. The rooms are a bit sub-standard for a resort and the housekeeping is so-so (our maid forgot face towels entirely one day). The bathrooms were not spotless as you'd expect from a Westin. As well, this is a picky point, the hotel says that they deliver a newspaper to your room every morning, but none ever came. When I called to inquire, the concierge rudely said they had discontinued this service. I've never stayed in a Starwood or a comprable hotel where they didn't deliver a paper to your door every morning. The hotel literature provided, as well, is sadly out of date. The restaurants were ridiculously overpriced. The Grill Room was well-worth it as the food was excellent, but the other restaurants had below-average food. The Tiki Bar prices were insulting as well. We rented a car at the hotel and were forced to pay for hotel parking, which is just silly. At such a resort, to be "nickel and dimed" is just insulting. Also, avoid the tours the hotel offers. They are beyond ridiculous in terms of their prices. They charge $75 for a tour of the rainforest, when you can rent a car for that money, tour it leisurely on your own for free, and drive someplace else for dinner. As well, as the hotel is on a country club golf and tennis club, I suspect that many of the pool and beach occupants were club members' families. It is a kid friendly (albeit very expensive) place, but if you don't have kids and you don't like loud children in your "quiet pool", avoid avoid avoid. There was never any "quiet pool" and the hottubs were constantly filled with children splashing about. We would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gramir
Reviews.Content: Don't trust all of the negative comments made by some travelers.....My husband and I recently stayed at the Westin and I want to provide you with an honest opinion - I highly recommend the Westin RioMar Resort. It is a large, beautifully landscaped property with all amenities one would desire for a great getaway. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed every moment - the only advice I can give is to bring some "Off" spray if you're prone to insect bites. The first night we walked out to the beach at approx. 6pm, sort of a humid evening, and I was surrounded by sea gnats. My husband did not get bit, but I managed to get over 100 bites on my legs and arms. Had no clue or would have prepared. I did make it out again the following day and there weren't any so depends on weather, but just be careful. Other than having a slow check-in, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this wonderful resort. The rooms are very nice and clean/comfortable, no outside noises were audible. The food was very good and adequately priced, although we did go outside of the resort as well (by the highway) to a Puerto Rican restaurant called "Antojitos" which was fantastic (try the fried Red Snapper). We also went to El Yunque Rainforest (great day trip!!). Then it was off to a great time in Old San Juan. You will be very pleased with your stay at the Westin RioMar - it is well worth it - I'm already planning a return trip there during the harsh winter here in Michigan!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time, Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: sangoofy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 3 days prior to our cruise. This resort was absolutely gorgeous. The beach was clean with plenty of chairs to lay out on. The pool areas (2) were just as beautiful as the website shows. Our room was overlooking the ocean so we had a beautiful view. Service was impeccable. Food was great although a bit pricey. We at meals at Cobitos (outside pool area), Cactus Jack's (Tex-Mex), and The Grille Room (fancy evening restaurant). Breakfast each day was at Marbella's with a full buffet to choose from. Rented a couple of wave runners for the first time and had a ball. We traveled with 2 other families and all agreed the resort was a great choice to stay. Had 2 12 yrs old , 1 15 yr old and 1 18 yr old with our party and they too had a ball. Adults tried casino onsite, slot machines a bit tight compared to Vegas, but won a few dollars on Roulette table so happy with that too. If you have a chance to spend some time at this resort, do so, you won't be sorry. My son was enthralled with all the iguanas and geckos running around just like we have squirrels back home. Wonderful start to a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty spot, service poor when crowded”
Reviews.Author: cousteau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter weekend. Hotel at max capacity, which was expected. Waited 45 min at check-in to find out my room wasn't ready, so we went to beach for 3 hours. Came back at 6 pm, ready to blow my top when they said they had upgraded us to the 7th floor (free breakfast & happy hour). After we saw our large ocean-view room (had reserved non ocean-view), we were happy - was well worth the wait and they took care of us w/o asking. Restaurants are very, very expensive - even my my kids said we should go off-site. Beach and pool chairs are really all taken by mid-morning while we were there. Also, they rarely had fresh towels which I had never heard of before. Facility is new and very pretty. Grounds beautiful. Has seperate kid & adult pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great time! great facilities! Great Graduation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was attending my sister's graduation ceremony at this hotel. Spent 3 days and everything was great. Service was great, the view, the beach, the pool, the hammocks, the weather great great great. Other reviewers complain about expesive food at the resort, there are plenty of retaurants nearby (ask the concierge). I have never stayed at the resort were they have bargain food. Westin's heavenly beds are super, initially there was a musty smell in the room but it goes away as soon you open the sliding door into the balcony. The check in line was moving slow but they have a Starwood preferred guest desk (if you join Starwood club it's FREE! you can zoom by non members) which I used and it saved me 15 minutes. Checked in and immediately went to the beach aaah that's life!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the resort the last week of April as a corporate award. Conveniently, we also celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary. The concierge staff was most helpful in helping us decide the best excursions for us on the budget we had (By the way the horseback riding was the best I've been on and the catamaran snorkeling was excellent!) and the flower shop did an awesome job at decorating our room for our special evening. We enjoyed playing in the Atlantic Ocean, collecting shells and the Iguanas were a pleasant treat to watch. If you can afford a flight over to the other nearby Islands we suggest it highly. We made arrangements through the concierge to fly over to St. Thomas and had an excellent time. The ocean was soo beautiful over there! Overall the staff, accomodations and resort grounds made for a very pleasant and fun trip for the both of us. If we ever make it back to Puerto Rico we would definitely like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: DivaDivinaNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Rio Mar during the Memorial day holiday and we had a great time overall. I thought we were going to start off on a bad foot because we got two double beds instead of one king size, but to our surprise they made every effort to accomodate us. The hotel was at capacity so we couldn't get another room, but a few minute later someone came to our room and created a "super king size" bed, which was just as good or even beter so the bed situation was no longer a problem. The weather was beautiful so we took full advantage of their two pools and of course the beach. There were a lot of children there, but they were very well behaved and were fun to be around them. The hotel food is expensive, but I would like to know of a 4 star hotel that has inexpensive food, there isn't one and we were prepared. The breakfast buffet was excellent, we ate there every morning. The hotel is about 40 min from SJU airport because of the heavy traffic. I would recommend renting a car before you arrive because in the long run it is cheaper...the hotel charges $50 roundtrip per person for transfers and the tours are expensive. If you rent a car you can get directions to anywhere from the hotel conceirge desk...they were really pleasant and helpful. Overall we had a wonderful time and did not have a single unpleasant moment. I would highly recommend this hotel....it's gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Musty rooms, my balcony was not covered. Rained 3 days straight and my sliding door leaked. Was met in the pool by Iquanas who jumped in and did god knows what..Overpriced bars with 8 dollar beers. Did not take long to rack up 1000 there. Small casino with unfriendly dealers. Overall rated poor,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, poor service, over priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well let me start by saying the resort was absolutely beautiful as far as the grounds are concerned.The rooms needed to be redone, old and outdated looking. We stayed in an oceanfront junior suite, which by no means met up to my standards of a four star room. The biggest problem we encoutered was being nickel and dimed to death, charges for eveything. Nothing, and I do mean nothing is given complimentary at this resort. Non-motorized water sports, more money, parking, more money, resort service fee daily more money.....etc. You get the picture, The food was mediocre at best and definately not worth the money. We checked out the Paradisus, which is the newest all inclusive resort, definately by far best for the dollar. Overall we had a great time, but with no credit to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed April 21-25, had a wonderful vacation! The resort is beautiful, golf course is very nice, and the beach is wonderful - great for long walks, nice soft sand (yes, it's brown - but you're on the Atlantic Ocean side!), and the water is great - clear & a sand bottom great for playing & swimming. Our room was nice - we reserved a standard mountain view, but upon check-in we simply asked if there were any ocean views available and got upgraded for free! It never hurts to ask! Our room was very clean. It did smell a little musty - but hey, your in a tropical (Warm & Wet) climate - expect it! The fitness room needs some improvement - it is small and some of the equipment didn't work, but I got along ok as there weren't too many others in there at the same time. The casino is very small and cheesy - ok for the casual gambler. Service we had around the hotel at the front desk, consierge, bars, around the pool & beach, etc was very friendly and helpful. Service at the restaraunts, however, was slow so just expect to have dinner take a while. Our food was always very good. Arrange reservations for dinner w/ the consierge desk early in advance to get good times! There were always plenty of chairs on the beach, and more than enough towels available. Food & drinks aren't any more than any other Caribbean resort you'll go to - so just expect to pay for it!! If you are price sensitive on those things, maybe the Caribbean is not for you - go to Mexico. Overall we had an outstanding stay - the beach alone was well worth it! I've been all over the world, and this was a very nice place for the money. I've read many comments on several hotels - my advice to anyone is to slow down, relax (afterall, you're on vacation), and be nice. If you are nice and relaxed, you will get great service in return! Oh yeah, gratuity for the bell man and maids will be added to your bill automatically, so don't tip them each day unless you want to pay double. Anytime you want to avoid any surprises like that, when you check in just ask what you can expect to see on the bill at the end as far as hidden charges, etc. I will return to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel- poor service”
Reviews.Author: gkb1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very beautiful, both the lobby and the grounds. The beach is fabulous. There is an excellent transportation service to take you around the vast grounds such as to the tennis center, the golf course and some of the restaurants. The meals were quite expensive with some restaurants charging almost 40 $ for an entree alone. Food quality was only fair and therefore the food was severely overpriced. The golf and tennis were great./ The service was however severely lacking. Not one person helped carry or find for that matter a beach chair in an entire week. Towels and chairs were in short supply even early in the morning. It is unclear how you get chairs on the beach. Noone there knew either. The golf is very good but also overpriced at 165$ per round. For that price, you should be able to eat off the fairways and you cannot. One bright spot, a junior rate of 50$ which was very reasonable. All in all, a very beautiful resort; just a shame the people don't try very hard. Oh and one more thing.- you pay 10% service charge on your room charge for this lousy service as well. I complained, and had mine removed. If you have poor service, I suggest you do the same

Reviews.Title: “Had a great week at the Westin Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Westin Rio Mar and loved it! The entire service staff was very polite and everyone did their best to make sure we were comfortable. Rooms were fine with maid service twice a day. The restaurants were generally good with a nice assortment although somewhat pricey, but portions are big. The casino is small and there is not much to do at night, which keeps things quiet, which we liked. The pool area was very clean, with plenty of towels, and having a quiet pool and an activity pool is great. There were plenty of beach chairs but there could have been more umbrellas. Drinks are expensive but as far as I am concerned, that keeps people from getting drunk and loud. The beach was very clean and the lifeguards make sure you are safe. It is just a few steps away from the pool. Although checkout is at noon, we were not leaving until 4PM so they allowed us to move into another unoccupied room for the day which made our last day extremely pleasant. The only drawback was that there were two corporate conventions the week we were there each with about 300 people and each had a dinner and loud band outside on the main grass area right under the ocean front rooms. Although the music stopped by 10:30PM it was annoying and very loud until it ended. Not sure why they had to have the music in this area when there is another location farther away from the rooms where they were having activities during the day. Otherwise I would recommend the Westin Rio Mar - it was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “the lovely Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely place. Classy, elegant. The staff were very courteous and solicitous. Access to the beach at anytime day or night was very nice - made you feel like you lived there. The on-site restaurants were excellent but pricey ($20-$30 for entrees). Buy your own wine and beer; wine from the bar was $10.00 per glass, beer was $5.00 - at least for the brands we bought. The pools were great, the ocean was great. One added attraction was the iguanas lazily grazing everywhere - harmless and quite interesting. I'd go back in a heartbeat. The woman who runs the Villas, Bebe, is a total professional and very, very helpful. San Juan is only about 30 miles away, but it's a good 45 min or hour trip. El Yunque (the rainforest) is about ten minutes away and a great side trip.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week at the Westin with our 5 and 8 year old. We had a terrific week. It is the first time we were at the Westin, we had been to the El San Juan and the Conquistador before, this was the best by far. We were on the family plan which included many things for us, most importantly the kids club and all the kids meals. We were on the concierge floor which was great. We enjoyed the variety of the restaurants and did not find it overpriced. It's a resort, you are going to pay for dining!! The beach was immaculate, as was the entire hotel for that matter. The staff was incredibly attentive and we never had rude service. We had no issue with bugs. My kids loved the kids program, even though at times they were the only two there. They were very attentive to them and kept them very well occupied. We have all the projects to prove it. We would definitely return, although I was told to avoid peak vacation weeks. We pulled the kids out of school and found that worked quite well.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights All Inclusive (3/13-3/20)....After reading all of the negative reviews posted on this sight, my wife and I were very nervous about what to expect. We stayed for a week, under the All Inclusive Package, and had a wonderful, relaxing vacation(feel like I gained 10 pounds). The staff was pleasant and accomodating not once was the word "No" uttered when we had a request. Check in was smooth, we were given a free upgrade to a full ocean view, so be sure to ask. Room service took no more than 35 minutes. Juan at the breakfast buffet (Marbella) treated my family like we were part of his family (so much so that my 8 year old son was in tears the day we said goodbye). Henry and Ivan made sure that we always had a cold beverage at the Tikki Bar. They also made sure that our lunch was prepared in quick fashion. Dinner at Palio was wonderful...be sure to have Jesus as your waiter. Joelle tends bar right outside Palio, best bartender at the resort...I taught him how to make a great espresso martini, be sure to ask him for one. He noticed that my wife and I had reservations for a second night at Palio, he had my cigar and champagne ready for us ahead of time for that pre dinner cocktail. Cactus Jacks was disappointing, food was average at best, and our waiter there was definately a rookie. The pool area was delightful...The activity pool was perfect for the kids (14 and 8 years of age). Yet during peak time of year we thought the pool seemed quiet. There were plenty of chairs pool side. The pool deck is definately in need of repair/upgrade, and they could use a few more umbrellas as well as replacing some of the damaged ones. The beach was also fantastic. This is the Atlantic, not the Carribean Sea...yes there are waves, no the sand is not the white powder, yet still soft. Plenty of lounge chairs and Tikki Huts on the beach. Not once during our stay did I hear a complaint about not having a place to sit outdoors. What was also nice was the fact that the hotel/beach/pool area were very close to one another. We have stayed at other resorts where to get from point A to point B was sometimes quite a journey. This was very convenient...again especially for the kids. Restaurants....Palio thumbs way up; Shimas so/so; Cactus Jacks not worth the shuttle ride; Coqui just opened for dinner...very nice at night (poolside) with torches lit...still need to work out the kinks (dirty martini served as straight vodka no olives in a martini glass) but my porterhouse was terrific as was my wife's lobster. Marbella Buffet, surprisingly good for breakfast and lunch, two thumbs up again; room service also recd two thumbs up. other items mentioned in reviews....Bugs, never saw them....Wife got a few bites on the beach at night; towels, never a problem to get a fresh/dry towel, we would end up with 8 towels by the end of the day..no prob; prices, it's a resort wht do you expect to pay? Go with the All Inclusive....The exclusions are minimal, we certainly got our moneys worth and then some...Staff, no complaints see above; room, not musty, love the Westin beds, rooms do need a little updating, they do seem a bit old. No HBO? Missed the Sopranos. Lobby/Restaurants/Public areas were beautiful. Casino, dont make that the deciding factor. I dont gamble, but that casino was pretty comical. Definately for the small time/casual player. Food, better than Iberostar and other resorts that we have experienced. Night life, except for a couple of corny lounge/wedding singers there is nothing. many frustrated March Madness Fans could not find a place to watch the games. Nightlife = Eat + Drink + Gamble + Drink.....FYI, No free internet access...pay the $15.00 for high speed, dial up is considered a long distance call. OUCH!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the westin”
Reviews.Author: DukeFlyer
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Westin. It was an incredible stay. Being a Starwood Platinum member, got upgraded to an oceanview suite. Beautiful room, amazing views. Checked in at 2am, and even at that insane hour, the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel has two pools...an activity pool which is a little louder, and an adult pool which is a lot more peaceful. Poolside service was a bit slow, but well worth it when it showed up. It had your usual high priced drinks, but that's expected. Keep an eye out for the huge iguanas that like to come and hang out on the pool deck. Only complaint with the property was the scuba shop on the premises. The people were extremely rude and unhelpful, and their prices are outrageous. Much better to go directly through the scuba operators in Fajardo. I have stayed at the Westin in the Grand Caymans as well as the one in St. John and this property is definitely better than the Caymans and almost as good as the St. John Westin which is my favourite Starwood property so far.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick stay at the Westin Rio Mar (March 12, 2004). Loved the resort! Beautiful surroundings, great pool with water slide, basketball and volleyball nets, adult pool, baby pool, poolside basketball court and a large beach with great waves for boogy boarding and a lifeguard! Great family resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in PR”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Westin RioMar in Beautiful PR. I read some of the reviews here before leaving and agree with some of what was said but would like to set the record straight on a number of things. First our room was very nice(not musty), pool and ocean view and the maid service was excellent. The food depending on the restaurant was good to excellent(I can't understand how people have complained about the food here), I highly recommend the Sea Bass at Ajili Mojili(authentic PR dishes) in the Ocean Villas and the Porterhouse steak at the GrilleRoom(located above the golf clubhouse, great views). KEY TIP: Find out early the days each restaurant is open during your stay and make reservations, it is very hard to walk-up and get a table even if the restaurant doesn't look full. The views of the rainforest were incredible, and there was lots of great nature sounds in the evening(The Coqui frogs!) One of the primary reasons we chose this resort was for the golf, and both courses are very nice but not spectacular, they charge $165 to play earlier in the day(way overpriced) but offer a twilight rate that starts at 2pm for $105(We booked our tee times in advance right at 2pm) the pace of play was great and you have incredible views of the mountains and plenty of wildlife(birds & iguanas of every size). The pools and ocean swimming are great just keep in mind the beach is brown sand and not white. If you are looking for lots of nightlife this is not the place for you, the only real nightlife is the small Casino(And I mean Small!) which is very poorly run. Overall the service at the resort was fairly good, a little inconsistent at times but not too bad, but the service in the Casino is terrible, the dealers and cashiers are not friendly and there are many slot machines not working properly and they don't know how to run a craps table(many payouts screwed up) and the cocktail waitresses in the casino are horrible they disappear for long stretches and one forgot to bring my drink twice and then finally brought me the wrong drink, you will end up going to the lobby bar for drinks, and it doesn't make sense because the casino is so small. We were looking for a scenic resort with good food to relax and play golf for a week. This resort fit the bill pretty well. If you don't play golf, and are looking for a wider range of activities I would recommend one of the many resorts in San Juan, but if you are looking for great views, good food, relaxing by the pool with a Pina Colada, and a few rounds of golf the Westin Rio Mar is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! But keep in mind...”
Reviews.Author: lifelongNYER
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a beautiful hotel with friendly, courteous & extremely helpful staff. Upon arrival, check in went slow & we did get offered a below average room... however, after asking for an upgrade, we received one of the BEST rooms possible at no additional charge! The beach was private & beautiful however there is brown sand not white so those of you who feel it's dirty - it's not! It did get a little littered by the end of our 8-day stay but NOTHING to complain about. The pools were perfect - with the exception of no swim-up bar & although the tiki bar was great & VERY relaxing the hours were too limited. The food/restaurants at the hotel were well-above average - except that they were not always open so if you are looking to JUST be at the hotel the ENTIRE time you may want to take that into consideration. We rented an Avis car at the hotel (good price & cheap parking) and explored the island which we HIGHLY recommend doing! Don't expect 4-5 star areas or restaurants as you would find in the U.S. Mainland - but if you give it a chance you WILL find 4-5 star quality in both food & places to visit - ESPECIALLY with the people of P.R.!! The hotel is isolated so, for example, to get to San Juan is at least 40 minutes with a bit of traffic. We explored El Yunque which is a MUST! (GREAT tour through the Westin with Harry the tour guide!!). The East Wind Catamarran trip to Culebra is also HIGHLY recommended out of Fajardo. Luquillo beach is great but NOT in the public area of the beach!!! You must go INTO the area of Luquillo where seafood like King's & Sandy's are AMAZING & that area has the beautiful beaches. The kiosks off route 3 for "Fast Puerto Rican Food" seems scary but if you can get past what you are used to you will be in for a REAL TREAT!!! The Pina Colada's at La Roca Taina (#53 -#58?) out of the kiosks is awesome esp. for $3!!! And Hacienda Caribali for sunsets in Rio Grande overlooking El Yunque & Rio Mar was breathtaking! The food incredible - the service outstanding & again! THe Pina Coladas ROCKED!! Also - if you can muster up the energy - Old San Juan is truly magical... We ate at a local hideaway called El Jibarito (recommended in Frommer's) and it was some of the best Puerto Rican food we had on the island... For 2 meals & 4 Medalla's (Puerto Rican beer) the bill was under $35 with tip. The main drawback to staying at the Westin Rio Mar is the lack of nightlife. If you don't mind driving a bit - the El Conquistador is good for some nightlife & Isla Verde is about 30 minutes away & GREAT for nightlife. For golf the Westin seems wonderful (we don't golf) & again, if isolation is a factor for your trip it's a TERRIFIC place to be! We were able to get both - relaxation & adventure & we can't WAIT to go back to Puerto Rico! Also for those people who we've read reviews of that complain about things like the humidity & bugs & sporadic rainstorms... It's a CARIBBEAN ISLAND! IT'S TROPICAL! DON'T GO IF YOU EXPECT TO FIND THIS OASIS OF PERFECT WEATHER! IT'S NOT POSSIBLE! And to us the weather was pretty perfect! Also, please keep in mind - Puerto Rico's MAIN language is SPANISH! 90% of the people speak english well but it helps to know a little spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel - Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tuje
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great the staff were helpfull and friendly. Our room was in very good condition and we had maid service twice a day. The food in the restaurants was above average and we did not have a bad meat our favorite was the Grill Room. The tour of the rain forest was also very nice. The only draw back was that the week we were there it was President week and a lot of kids. The pool service could improve always a towel shortage. All in all it was a very nice getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Needavaca
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to PR every year for 4 years. This was our first time at the Westin. It was not bad but it was not the 4 stars. We stayed at the Wyndham El Conquistador which is also a 4 star and it was so much nicer. The rooms at the Westin were musty. We paid extra for an Ocean view and the first room they gave us was not that. The second room you could see the ocean from the corner of the balcony. We rented a car and ate in Fajaro in a place called the Brass Cactus. It was good and less expensive. The pool and beach were crowded because it was a popular week. The front desk staff was nice to us but they were extremely rude to the people next to us. The bell staff was amazing. The airlines lost my luggage and they called them every few hours to check on it for me. They kept me updated and delivered my bag to my room when it arrived from the airport. We would not return to the Westin. There are just too many nicer places. The second half of our trip we stayed in Isle Verde at a Courtyard by Marriott and liked it better even though it was only 3 stars. I think from reading the reviews that it really matters when you travel. If it is a peak time then you may not want to stay here because it is crowded and they use all the rooms even the musty smelling ones. Also they are probably a lot more attentive on the off times.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio Mar for four nights the last week in January 2004. We loved it. The facilities at this hotel are exceptional. Our room was spacious and had a balcony with a view of EL Junque rainforest (the hotels grounds are located ten minutes from the park's entrance). Our accomodations were spacious, bright and clean. The grounds of the hotel (over 500 acres and 1 mile of beach) were splendidly landscaped and maintained. The two pools were large and little used. The beach was clean and raked every morning. Lounge chairs were readily available as were hammocks. On the grounds are two 18 hole golf courses, a jogging path, clubhouse, condos, tiki bars, a small casino and a spa. The resort has 7 restaurants including a gourmet Italian restaurant, an oriental restaurant and Marbella where you can order off the menu or partake in an upscale buffet in the evening. On balance we thought that the Westin Rio Mar was a very nice resort and would stay there agian. Other reviewers of the Rio Mar have complained about the food, the service, and the indifference of the employees. The food is expensive. What do you expect? This is not a cheap resort. You are paying for the view and the ambience and both are spectacular. I was extremely impressed with the attitude of the employees. Waiters, bartenders, blackjack dealers, cleaning staff, all greeted us warmly and attended to our needs promptly. Food quality at the Marbella was good but not exceptional. We did not eat at Palio or the oriental restaurant so I can't comment on their food. Some people have complained about the remoteness of the resort and those complaints are accurate. Just keep in mind that because the resort is 30 miles outside of San Juan, the beach is cleaner and less crowded and you don't have to deal with the congestion and pollution of the city. Easy sidetrips from this resort that were fun included El Junque rainforest, Luquillo Beach (food kiosks on the beach were exceptional), the city of Ponce (2 hr. to the south) and bar hopping in Penones. Also, just outside the grounds of the Westin Rio Mar there are several inexpensive restaurants serving good food.

Reviews.Title: “A few bright lights but overall much worse than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were some good things, and some really poor things about this place during my stay. The location next to the beach is nice. You can walk from your room pretty much right onto the beach. And the view as you do so is breathtaking. If you go, though, ASK ABOUT OCEAN VIEW ROOMS when you reserve your room. When we got there, we asked and none were available. The higher floors are better--pedestrians can see right into the lower floor rooms if the curtains are open. The hotel was very clean and attractive, although the ventilation in the room hallways was sometimes really bad, to where the air would be warm, humid, and smell bad. Service ranged from rarely good to almost uniformly HORRIBLE. We frequently waited long times either to get our orders taken or to get the check. Twice, I waited for a check for over 20 minutes after the plates were cleared, and I eventually had to find managers to get them. The waitstaff often refuse to make eye contact and gave me the impression that they felt like I was somehow "beneath" them. A few times we had genuinely nice people serve us or help us with our bags, and the concierge and front desk were always nice, but I cannot overstate this enough: be prepared for awful service more often than not. We were there a week and it was not just once or twice. The casino was also the same story--several times I waited over 20-30 minutes to get someone to come service the slot machine I played so it would pay out. Unless you get up and find someone, they will not come, despite the cameras in the ceiling. If you want free drinks, better sit at the table games. My wife and I sat at the slots for 2-3 hours on two separate nights and never saw a waitress, either. We were very surprised to find a brochure in the room that said that ALL casino patrons are entitled to free drinks after the experience of those two nights. We brought this up to the front desk and they comped us a breakfast buffet, which was nice. The food is sometimes pretty good; the Italian restaurant Palio was really good. But you are so isolated in the resort that if you do not have a rental car, you have to eat all your meals there. And believe me, they OVERCHARGE because they know you have no other options. A breakfast buffet is $18.50 per person. A dinner buffet (for average food--a "chicken parmesan" is boiled chicken breast, no breading, tomato sauce and a few shreds of parmesan cheese) is $30.00 per person. A virgin strawberry daquiri (essentially strawberries and ice) at the beach bar is $6.00. Another warning: the hotel bill will include gratuities that you are not told about. I had a $2.00 housekeeping gratuity per day tacked on, and this was after I had left some tips on the pillow because I didn't know about the "gratuity." I had the bellhop bring up our bags and tipped them when they did so. Lo and behold, I ended up with a separate $12.00 Bell Service Gratuity on my bill for that day that no one had ever told me about. Overall, I enjoyed the beach. But if there had been another resort nearby, I would definitely try it the next time rather than go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took the kids (ages 3 and 1) on a five night stay to the Westin. We all had a good time. The kids loved the beach, pools, water slide and game room. My husband and I enjoyed the courteous and helpful staff, casino, tennis facility and babysitting services. Also, the setting was lovely. The hotel and the beach are attractive and well maintained. We did not have trouble with bugs. Although we would agree with other reviewers that the food was somewhat disappointing, at least there was some variety in the restaurants and the breakfast buffet was terrific. Plus, the pina coladas were the best I ever had!

Reviews.Title: “I Really Liked This Place”
Reviews.Author: Coquiluvxo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights after our wedding. We have been all over Puerto Rico and usually stay in Isla Verde (Intercontinental). We booked a mountain view room and were upgraded upon arrival to beach front. Excellent room, very clean and spacious. The staff were very professional, grounds beautiful and beach awesome! Food was good but expensive. I would recommend having a car (fee per day) to drive to El Yunque and Farjardo for sightseeing, or to have some good local cuisine! This was a nice change of pace for us and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, amazing staff- an AMAZING vaction”
Reviews.Author: chine_1
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from one of the most enjoyable vacations of my life. As a Christmas present, my parents invited me along on their trip to this resort. They had purchased the trip through Apple Vacatons for the dates of Dec 11th thru the 16th. They also spent the extra money to make it an "all inclusive" stay- meaning we ate and drank for free, and received discounts at the spa and golf courses. After reading most of the unhappy reviews on here, I was quite shocked. I don't understand how anyone could say anything bad. Upon arrival, they upgraded me to an oceanview room on the same floor my parents were on (the 7th floor- top floor and the best views). Every employee would go out of their way for us. The maid came twice a day. The bartenders would remember us and our drinks. The waitresses and waiters were more attentive than I could have hoped. I realize that if we didn't have all-inclusive, the priced would be more than I would expect, but it is a resort- you have to expect things to be more pricy than home. I do suggest that you get that package if possible, its easier just to sign your name, than have to carry cash around. The beach is amazing, as well as the pool. I was waiting to be attacked by bugs after reading everyone's reviews. I had no problem, even though I forgot my bug spray. I found an empty chair everyday at the pool and beach. I can't rave about this place enough, except if you are single, this isn't really a place to consider staying. I'm 25 and didn't really see anyone my age (who wasn't there on a romantic getaway with their boyfriend/girlfriend). I do plan on going back with a friend or two next December. I just need to start saving now.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews after I had booked my trip- they all correct:1. Food- lousy and expensive2. room- decent3. beach- excellent sea but I was bitten by bugs everyday on the beach. The sand is brown not white4. staff- generally goodOverall- I would not go back. We spent $25 per person for horrendous food. Choose a better place to stay there

HotelInfo.Name: Rio Mar Beach Resort & Spa, a Wyndham Grand Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 6000 Rio Mar Boulevard, Rio Grande 00745, Puerto Rico
